wisdom.quote: Holding anger is a poison. It eats you from the inside. We think that hating is a weapon that attacks the person who harmed us. But hatred is a curved blade. And the harm we do, we do to ourselves.
wisdom.author: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

wisdom.quote: Life has to end, love doesn't.
wisdom.author: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

wisdom.quote: Sometimes when you sacrifice something precious, you're not really losing it. You're just passing it on to someone else.
wisdom.author: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

wisdom.quote: Strangers are just family you have yet to come to know.
wisdom.author: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

wisdom.quote: But all endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time.
wisdom.author: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet In Heaven, pg. 1 line 3-4

wisdom.quote: The shortest distance between two points is under construction.
wisdom.author: Noelie Altito

wisdom.quote: To play it safe is not to play.
wisdom.author: Robert Altman

wisdom.quote: What's a cult? It just means not enough people to make a minority.
wisdom.author: Robert Altman, The Observer (1981)

wisdom.quote: Everyone needs a strong sense of self. It is our base of operations for everything that we do in life.
wisdom.author: Julia T. Alvarez

wisdom.quote: I don't really trust a sane person.
wisdom.author: Lyle Alzado

wisdom.quote: For the skeptic there remains only one consolation: if there should be such a thing as superhuman law it is administered with subhuman inefficiency.
wisdom.author: Eric Ambler

wisdom.quote: Familiarity breed contempt.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Fox and the Lion

wisdom.quote: Thinking to get at once all the gold the goose could give, he killed it and opened it only to find - nothing.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Goose with the Golden Eggs

wisdom.quote: Slow and steady wins the race.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Hare and the Tortoise

wisdom.quote: It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Jay and the Peacock

wisdom.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Lion and the Mouse

wisdom.quote: While I see many hoof marks going in, I see none coming out. It is easier to get into the enemy's toils than out again.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Lion, the Fox, and the Beasts

wisdom.quote: I will have nought to do with a man who can blow hot and cold with the same breath.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Man and the Satyr

wisdom.quote: Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Milkmaid and Her Pail

wisdom.quote: A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Town Mouse and the Country Mouse

wisdom.quote: Appearances often are deceiving.
wisdom.author: Aesop, The Wolf in Sheep's Clothing

wisdom.quote: It was no wonder that people were so horrible when they started life as children.
wisdom.author: Kingsley Amis, One Fat Englishman (1963)

wisdom.quote: The descent to Hades is the same from every place.
wisdom.author: Anaxagoras, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
wisdom.author: Joe Ancis

wisdom.quote: Anything looked at closely becomes wonderful.
wisdom.author: A. R. Ammons

wisdom.quote: In nature there are few sharp lines.
wisdom.author: A. R. Ammons

wisdom.quote: Is it not careless to become too local when there are four hundred billion stars in our galaxy alone?
wisdom.author: A. R. Ammons, Glare

wisdom.quote: Joy is found not in finishing an activity but in doing it.
wisdom.author: Greg Anderson

wisdom.quote: During the Second World War, the Germans took four years to build the Atlantic Wall. On four beaches it held up the Allies for about an hour; at Omaha it held up the U.S. for less than one day. The Atlantic Wall must therefore be regarded as one of the greatest blunders in military history.
wisdom.author: Stephen Ambrose, D-Day, page 577

wisdom.quote: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
wisdom.author: Stephen Ambrose, in Fast Company

wisdom.quote: I guess we'd be living in a boring, perfect world if everybody wished everybody else well.
wisdom.author: Jennifer Aniston, O Magazine, February 2004

wisdom.quote: True love brings up everything - you're allowing a mirror to be held up to you daily.
wisdom.author: Jennifer Aniston, O Magazine, February 2004

wisdom.quote: Adventure is just bad planning.
wisdom.author: Roald Amundsen

wisdom.quote: As the poet said, 'Only God can make a tree' -- probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: His lack of education is more than compensated for by his keenly developed moral bankruptcy.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: How can I believe in God when just last week I got my tongue caught in the roller of an electric typewriter?
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I am at two with nature.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I can't listen to that much Wagner. I start getting the urge to conquer Poland.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work... I want to achieve it through not dying.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I tended to place my wife under a pedestal.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I took a speed reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I was thrown out of college for cheating on the metaphysics exam; I looked into the soul of the boy sitting next to me.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: I'm astounded by people who want to 'know' the universe when it's hard enough to find your way around Chinatown.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: If it turns out that there is a God, I don't think that he's evil. But the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: If only God would give me some clear sign! Like making a large deposit in my name in a Swiss bank.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Interestingly, according to modern astronomers, space is finite. This is a very comforting thought-- particularly for people who can never remember where they have left things.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to travel faster than the speed of light, and certainly not desirable, as one's hat keeps blowing off.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Being born in a duck yard does not matter, if only you are hatched from a swan's egg.

wisdom.quote: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.

wisdom.quote: Every man's life is a fairy-tale written by God's fingers.

wisdom.quote: I feel like a tiny bird with a big song!

wisdom.quote: The loss of one's dignified bearing is often sudden.

wisdom.quote: I can't take a well-tanned person seriously.

wisdom.quote: There are three terrible ages of childhood - 1 to 10, 10 to 20, and 20 to 30.

wisdom.quote: Life is just a mirror, and what you see out there, you must first see inside of you.

wisdom.quote: This liberty will look easy by and by when nobody dies to get it.

wisdom.quote: Nature has been for me, for as long as I remember, a source of solace, inspiration, adventure, and delight; a home, a teacher, a companion.

wisdom.quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.

wisdom.quote: Most of the time I don't have much fun. The rest of the time I don't have any fun at all.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: My education was dismal. I went to a series of schools for mentally disturbed teachers.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Not only is there no God, but try getting a plumber on weekends.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: On the plus side, death is one of the few things that can be done just as easily lying down.

wisdom.quote: Organized crime in America takes in over forty billion dollars a year and spends very little on office supplies.

wisdom.quote: Students achieving Oneness will move on to Twoness.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: The government is unresponsive to the needs of the little man. Under 5'7", it is impossible to get your congressman on the phone.

wisdom.quote: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Thought: Why does man kill? He kills for food. And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: To you I'm an atheist; to God, I'm the Loyal Opposition.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: What if everything is an illusion and nothing exists? In that case, I definitely overpaid for my carpet.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: When I was kidnapped, my parents snapped into action. They rented out my room.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: Why are our days numbered and not, say, lettered?
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.quote: You can live to be a hundred if you give up all the things that make you want to live to be a hundred.

wisdom.quote: What if nothing exists and we're all in somebody's dream? Or what's worse, what if only that fat guy in the third row exists?

wisdom.quote: More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly.

wisdom.quote: Death doesn't really worry me that much, I'm not frightened about it... I just don't want to be there when it happens.

wisdom.quote: A celebrity is a person who works hard all his life to become well known, then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.quote: A conference is a gathering of important people who singly can do nothing, but together can decide that nothing can be done.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.quote: California is a fine place to live--if you happen to be an orange.

wisdom.quote: Committee--a group of men who individually can do nothing but as a group decide that nothing can be done.

wisdom.quote: Hanging is too good for a man who makes puns; he should be drawn and quoted.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.quote: Hollywood is a place where people from Iowa mistake each other for stars.

wisdom.quote: I can't understand why a person will take a year to write a novel when he can easily buy one for a few dollars.

wisdom.quote: Imitation is the sincerest form of television.

wisdom.quote: What's on your mind, if you will allow the overstatement?

wisdom.quote: You can take all the sincerity in Hollywood, place it in the navel of a firefly and still have room enough for three caraway seeds and a producer's heart.

wisdom.quote: [Television is] the triumph of machine over people.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen

wisdom.quote: I have just returned from Boston. It is the only sane thing to do if you find yourself up there.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen, in a letter to Groucho Marx, 1953

wisdom.quote: Television is a new medium. It's called a medium because nothing is well-done.
wisdom.author: Fred Allen, on the radio program The Big Show, Dec. 17, 1950

wisdom.quote: ...happiness gives us the energy which is the basis of health.

wisdom.quote: All appears to change when we change.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: An error is the more dangerous the more truth it contains.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Charm is the quality in others that makes us more satisfied with ourselves.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: For purposes of action nothing is more useful than narrowness of thought combined with energy of will.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Great men are true men, the men in whom nature has succeeded. They are not extraordinary - they are in the true order. It is the other species of men who are not what they ought to be.

wisdom.quote: Hope is only the love of life.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Learn to limit yourself, to content yourself with some definite thing, and some definite work; dare to be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not and to believe in your own individuality.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Liberty, equality - bad principles! The only true principle for humanity is justice; and justice to the feeble is protection and kindness.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more characteristic of a man than the mann in which he behaves toward fools.

wisdom.quote: The man who insists on seeing with perfect clearness before he decides, never decides.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: The test of every religious, political, or educational system is the man that it forms.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Truth is the secret of eloquence and of virtue, the basis of moral authority; it is the highest summit of art and life.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: Work while you have the light. You are responsible for the talent that has been entrusted to you.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: You desire to know the art of living, my friend? It is contained in one phrase: make use of suffering.
wisdom.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

wisdom.quote: I don't really think about anything too much. I live in the present. I move on. I don't think about what happened yesterday. If I think too much, it kind of freaks me out.

wisdom.quote: I'm a mother with two small children, so I don't take as much crap as I used to.

wisdom.quote: My ideal relaxation is working on upholstry. I spend hours in junk shops buying furniture. I do all the upholstery work myself, and it's like therapy.
wisdom.author: Pamela Anderson

wisdom.quote: When love is gone, there's always justice. And when justice is gone, there's always force. And when force is gone, there's always Mom. Hi, Mom!

wisdom.quote: And there was a beautiful view But nobody could see. Cause everybody on the island Was saying: Look at me! Look at me!
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Language Is A Virus

wisdom.quote: Paradise is exactly like where you are right now... only much, much better.
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Language Is A Virus

wisdom.quote: And Sharkey says: Deep in the heart of darkest America. Home of the brave. He says: Listen to my heart beat.
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Sharkey's Night

wisdom.quote: You know, I can see two tiny pictures of myself And there's one in each of your eyes. And they're doin' everything I do. Every time I light a cigarette, they light up theirs. I take a drink and I look in and they're drinkin' too. It's drivin' me crazy. It's drivin' me nuts.
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Sharkey's Night

wisdom.quote: They say that Heaven is like TV... a perfect little world, that doesn't really need you.
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Strange Angels

wisdom.quote: Well I was out in my four door With the top down. And I looked up and there they were: Millions of tiny teardrops Just sort of hanging there And I didn't know whether to laugh or cry And I said to myself: What next big sky?
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson, Strange Angels

wisdom.quote: Our lives improve only when we take chances - and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.
wisdom.author: Walter Anderson

wisdom.quote: Seeing wildlife is like seeing celebrities, only better.

wisdom.quote: If everything seems under control, you're just not going fast enough.

wisdom.quote: If everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough
wisdom.author: Mario Andretti

wisdom.quote: If you wait, all that happens is that you get older.

wisdom.quote: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which, when you looked at it in the right way, did not become still more complicated.
wisdom.author: Poul Anderson

wisdom.quote: When you do a good job, you'll feel like people are bothering you. If you have a product that's interesting enough, then people will come to you.

wisdom.quote: What I spent, is gone; what I kept, I lost; but what I gave away will be mine forever.

wisdom.quote: Love is, above all else, the gift of oneself.

wisdom.quote: Most people would rather be certain they're miserable than risk being happy.

wisdom.quote: Observe your enemies for they first find out your faults.

wisdom.quote: Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.
wisdom.author: Antisthenes

wisdom.quote: Gardens and flowers have a way of bringing people together, drawing them from their homes.

wisdom.quote: Cautious, careful people, always casting about to preserve their reputations and social standing, never can bring about a reform.

wisdom.quote: It was we, the people; not we, the white male citizens; nor yet we, the male citizens; but we, the whole people, who formed the Union.... Men, their rights and nothing more; women, their rights and nothing less.

wisdom.quote: Resolved, that the women of this nation in 1876, have greater cause for discontent, rebellion and revolution than the men of 1776.

wisdom.quote: The older I get, the greater power I seem to have to help the world; I am like a snowball - the further I am rolled, the more I gain.

wisdom.quote: Poverty is the schoolmaster of character.

wisdom.quote: I don't mind what language an opera is sung in so long as it is a language I don't understand.

wisdom.quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.

wisdom.quote: Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills.
wisdom.author: Minna Thomas Antrim

wisdom.quote: Man forgives woman anything save the wit to outwit him.

wisdom.quote: Three failures denote uncommon strength. A weakling has not enough grit to fail thrice.
wisdom.author: Minna Thomas Antrim

wisdom.quote: When you kill one enemy, you then must plan for the one hundred enemies you have now created. No enemy ever stands alone. He comes with a mother and father, brothers and sisters. He has a wife and children, friends and neighbors. When you kill this enemy, you must be ready to face the angry revenge that comes from the grief of this loss for all the people who knew and loved this man. The only way to stop this endless chain of enemy killing enemy is to forgive it. And in doing so, teach each one that life is the most important, precious and valuable thing.
wisdom.author: Anwarshah Anwary, Freedom-A Journey Through Afghanistan-The Anwarshah Anwary Story

wisdom.quote: The drug that heals our sorrows forgetfulness.

wisdom.quote: A closed mind is a good thing to lose.

wisdom.quote: A closed mouth gathers no feet.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: A conscience is what hurts when all your other parts feel so good.

wisdom.quote: A friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.

wisdom.quote: A good exercise for the heart is to bend down and help another up.

wisdom.quote: A groundless rumor often covers a lot of ground.

wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude. Don't complain.

wisdom.quote: The needs of society determine its ethics.

wisdom.quote: We allow our ignorance to prevail upon us and make us think we can survive alone, alone in patches, alone in groups, alone in races, even alone in genders.

wisdom.quote: I know why the caged bird sings.

wisdom.quote: Discretion is the better part of valor.

wisdom.quote: Don't let yourself forget what it's like to be sixteen.

wisdom.quote: Efficiency is intelligent laziness.

wisdom.quote: God helps those who help themselves.

wisdom.quote: Going to church doesn't make you a Christian any more than standing in a garage makes you a car.

wisdom.quote: Good friends are hard to find, harder to leave, and impossible to forget.

wisdom.quote: If for a tranquil mind you seek, These things observe with care: Of whom you speak, to whom you speak, And how, and when and where.

wisdom.quote: It is light grief that can take counsel.

wisdom.quote: Liberals are very broadminded: they are always willing to give careful consideration to both sides of the same side.

wisdom.quote: May no portent of evil be attached to the words I say.

wisdom.quote: There are no thanks for a kindness, which has been delayed.

wisdom.quote: To harken to evil conversation is the road to wickedness.. (Pravis Assuescere Sermonibus Est Via Ad Rem Ipsam)

wisdom.quote: Unity in things necessary, liberty in things doubtful, charity in everything.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: Whatever you undertake, act with prudence, and consider the consequences.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: When you point your finger at someone, three fingers are pointing back at you.

wisdom.quote: Write a wise saying and your name will live forever.

wisdom.quote: You add insult to injury. (Injuriae Addis Contumeliam)
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: He deserves Paradise who makes his companions laugh.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, (wrongly attributed to the Koran)

wisdom.quote: A little nonsense now and then, is relished by the wisest men.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, Also used in "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory"

wisdom.quote: Our land is more valuable than your money. As long as the sun shines and the waters flow, this land will be here to give life to men and animals; therefore, we cannot sell this land. It was put here for us by the Great Spirit and we cannot sell it because it does not belong to us.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, Blackfoot chief (c. 1880)

wisdom.quote: I am a Marxist--of the Groucho tendency.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, French slogan

wisdom.quote: God is not dead but alive and well and working on a much less ambitious project.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, Graffito

wisdom.quote: Alas my love you do me wrong, To cast me of discurteously; And I have loved you so long, Delighting in your company.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, Greensleeves

wisdom.quote: Any piece of clothing can be sexy with a quietly passionate woman inside it.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, O Magazine, The Shy Girl's Guide to Sex, February 2003

wisdom.quote: A low voter turnout is an indication of fewer people going to the polls.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, often attributed to Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: If we don't succeed, we run the risk of failure.
wisdom.author: Anonymous, often attributed to Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: If you are pained by external things, it is not they that disturb you, but your own judgment of them. And it is in your power to wipe out that judgment now.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: It is the act of a madman to pursue impossibilities.

wisdom.quote: Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look there.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: Remember this-that there is a proper dignity and proportion to be observed in the performance of every act of life.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts, therefore guard accordingly; and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue, and reasonable nature.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: Waste no more time talking about great souls and how they should be. Become one yourself!
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

wisdom.quote: By a tranquil mind I mean nothing else than a mind well ordered.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks, but only at what he does himself, to make it just and holy.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: In the morning, when you are sluggish about getting up, let this thought be present: 'I am rising to a man's work.'
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: Nothing happens to any thing which that thing is not made by nature to bear.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: Nothing happens to anybody which he is not fitted by nature to bear.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in a few words.

wisdom.quote: Familiarity breeds contempt, while rarity wins admiration.

wisdom.quote: He is the better equipped for life. As for swimming, who has the less to carry.

wisdom.quote: Let us be resolute in prosecuting our ends, and mild in our methods of so doing.

wisdom.quote: I was to learn later that in life that we tend to meet any new situation by reorganizing; and what a wonderful method it can be for creating the illusion of progress while producing confusion, inefficiency, and demoralization.

wisdom.quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
wisdom.author: Joan of Arc, Sworn testimony of the �nullification trial�  conducted twenty-five years after Joan�s death gives tons of information about her.   The original transcript for this �nullification trial� still exist

wisdom.quote: Give me where to stand, and I will move the earth.
wisdom.author: Archimedes, 300 B.C.

wisdom.quote: My favorite thing is to go where I've never been.
wisdom.author: Diane Arbus

wisdom.quote: A photograph is a secret about a secret. The more it tells you the less you know.
wisdom.author: Diane Arbus,  (1923-1971)

wisdom.quote: Where you find the laws most numerous, there you will find also the greatest injustice.

wisdom.quote: A specification that will not fit on one page of 8.5x11 inch paper cannot be understood.
wisdom.author: Mark Ardis

wisdom.quote: Nature made him, and then broke the mold.
wisdom.author: Ludovico Ariosto, Orlando Furioso

wisdom.quote: We think the cross to bear is not for those who are gay, but those who believe in crosses in the first place.
wisdom.author: Jon Armstrong, Blurbomat, 03-25-2006

wisdom.quote: Equality...is the result of human organization. We are not born equal.
wisdom.author: Hannah Arendt

wisdom.quote: The most radical revolutionary will become a conservative the day after the revolution.
wisdom.author: Hannah Arendt

wisdom.quote: Under conditions of tyranny it is far easier to act than to think.
wisdom.author: Hannah Arendt

wisdom.quote: Houston, Tranquility Base here. The eagle has landed.
wisdom.author: Neil Armstrong

wisdom.quote: That's one small step for [a] man, one giant leap for mankind.
wisdom.author: Neil Armstrong, Upon landing on the Moon, July 20, 1969

wisdom.quote: I hope you become comfortable with the use of logic without being deceived into concluding that logic will inevitably lead you to the correct conclusion.
wisdom.author: Neil Armstrong, USC 2005 graduation

wisdom.quote: We do not die because we have to die; we die because one day, and not so long ago, our consciousness was forced to deem it necessary.
wisdom.author: Antonin Artaud

wisdom.quote: Not the power to remember, but its very opposite, the power to forget, is a necessary condition for our existence.
wisdom.author: Sholem Asch

wisdom.quote: What we play is life.
wisdom.author: Louis Armstrong

wisdom.quote: The living need charity more than the dead.
wisdom.author: George Arnold, The Jolly Old Pedagogue (1866)

wisdom.quote: What's the use of worrying? It never was worthwhile.
wisdom.author: George Asaf

wisdom.quote: The freethinking of one age is the common sense of the next.
wisdom.author: Matthew Arnold, 'God and the Bible,' 1875

wisdom.quote: The true meaning of religion is thus not simply morality, but morality touched by emotion.
wisdom.author: Matthew Arnold, 'Literature and Dogma,' preface to 1883 edition, last words

wisdom.quote: Resolve to be thyself: and know, that he who finds himself, loses his misery.
wisdom.author: Matthew Arnold, 'Self-Dependence'

wisdom.quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
wisdom.author: Matthew Arnold, 'Sohrab and Rustum,' 1853

wisdom.quote: I think the Internet is uniquely suited to this free market idea: that everyone on the Internet that exchanges the traffic back and forth, big or small, we all need each other.
wisdom.author: Pete Ashdown, Utah Geek Dinner Speech, 08-22-06

wisdom.quote: Unique among the nations, America recognized the source of our character as being godly and eternal, not being civic and temporal. And because we have understood that our source is eternal, America has been different. We have no king but Jesus.
wisdom.author: John Ashcroft

wisdom.quote: The engineer is the key figure in the material progress of the world. It is his engineering that makes a reality of the potential value of science by translating scientific knowledge into tools, resources, energy and labor to bring them into the service of man ... To make contributions of this kind the engineer requires the imagination to visualize the needs of society and to appreciate what is possible as well as the technological and broad social age understanding to bring his vision to reality.
wisdom.author: Sir Eric Ashby

wisdom.quote: Success is a journey, not a destination. The doing is often more important than the outcome.
wisdom.author: Arthur Ashe

wisdom.quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
wisdom.author: Margaret Atwood, Cat's Eye, 1988

wisdom.quote: Or perhaps she's just softening me up: she's a Baptist, she'd like me to find Jesus, or vice versa, before it's too late. That kind of thing doesn't run in her family: her mother Reenie never went in much for God. There was mutual respect, and if you were in trouble, naturally you'd call on him, as with lawyers, but as with lawyers, it would have to be bad trouble. Otherwise it didn't pay to get too mixed up with him.
wisdom.author: Margaret Atwood, The Blind Assassin

wisdom.quote: Democracy means government by discussion, but it is only effective if you can stop people talking.
wisdom.author: Clement Attlee

wisdom.quote: It is forbidden to decry other sects; the true believer gives honour to whatever in them is worthy of honour.
wisdom.author: Asoka

wisdom.quote: Truth has beauty, power and necessity.
wisdom.author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

wisdom.quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes

wisdom.quote: High thoughts must have high language.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Frogs, 405 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Shall I crack any of those old jokes, master,At which the audience never fail to laugh?
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Frogs, 405 B.C.

wisdom.quote: You have all the characteristics of a popular politician: a horrible voice, bad breeding, and a vulgar manner.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Knights, 424 B.C.

wisdom.quote: A man's homeland is wherever he prospers.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Plutus, 388 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Under every stone lurks a politician.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Thesmophoriazusae, 410 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Wasps, 422 B.C.

wisdom.quote: This is what extremely grieves us, that a man who never foughtShould contrive our fees to pilfer, on who for his native landNever to this day had oar, or lance, or blister in his hand.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes, Wasps, 422 B.C.

wisdom.quote: If living conditions don't stop improving in this country, we're going to run out of humble beginnings for our great men.
wisdom.author: Russell P. Askue

wisdom.quote: What a pity, when Christopher Colombus discovered America, that he ever mentioned it.
wisdom.author: Margot Asquith

wisdom.quote: A flatterer is a friend who is your inferior, or pretends to be so.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: A friend is a second self.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsion, habit, reason, passion, and desire.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: All paid jobs absorb and degrade the mind.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: All virtue is summed up in dealing justly.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Dignity consists not in possessing honors, but in the consciousness that we deserve them.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Education is the best provision for the journey to old age.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: How many a dispute could have been deflated into a single paragraph if the disputants had dared to define their terms.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Humor is the only test of gravity, and gravity of humor; for a subject which will not bear raillery is suspicious, and a jest which will not bear serious examination is false wit.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: If some animals are good at hunting and others are suitable for hunting, then the Gods must clearly smile on hunting.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: It is in justice that the ordering of society is centered.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Law is mind without reason.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Man perfected by society is the best of all animals; he is the most terrible of all when he lives without law, and without justice.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting a particular way... you become just by performing just actions, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave actions.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: One swallow does not make a summer, neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The best political community is formed by citizens of the middle class.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: They should rule who are able to rule best.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: When several villages are united in a single complete community, large enough to nearly or quite self-sufficing, the state comes into existence, originating in the bare needs of life, and continuing in existence for the sake of a good life.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics, book 1, chapter 2

wisdom.quote: A likely impossibility is always preferable to an unconvincing possibility.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Rhetoric

wisdom.quote: A whole is that which has beginning, middle and end.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Rhetoric

wisdom.quote: Evil draws men together.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Rhetoric

wisdom.quote: It is simplicity that makes the uneducated more effective than the educated when addressing popular audiences.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Rhetoric

wisdom.quote: Youth would be an ideal state if it came a little later in life.
wisdom.author: Herbert Henry Asquith

wisdom.quote: Of all afflictions, the worst is self-contempt.
wisdom.author: Berthold Auerbach

wisdom.quote: Only he is free who cultivates his own thoughts, and strives without fear to do justice to them.
wisdom.author: Berthold Auerbach

wisdom.quote: One swallow does not make a summer.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: To be conscious that we are perceiving or thinking is to be conscious of our own existence.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: To enjoy the things we ought and to hate the things we ought has the greatest bearing on excellence of character.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: We make war that we may live in peace.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: We must as second best...take the least of the evils.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: With regard to excellence, it is not enough to know, but we must try to have and use it.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: Without friends no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: In the arena of human life the honours and rewards fall to those who show their good qualities.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nicomachean Ethics (4th c. BC)

wisdom.quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Parts of Animals

wisdom.quote: Time crumbles things; everything grows old under the power of Time and is forgotten through the lapse of Time.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Physics

wisdom.quote: A state is not a mere society, having a common place, established for the prevention of mutual crime and for the sake of exchange...Political society exists for the sake of noble actions, and not of mere companionship.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: Again, men in general desire the good, and not merely what their fathers had.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: Even when laws have been written down, they ought not always to remain unaltered.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: If liberty and equality, as is thought by some are chiefly to be found in democracy, they will be best attained when all persons alike share in the government to the utmost.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: It is the nature of desire not to be satisfied, and most men live only for the gratification of it.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: Law is order, and good law is good order.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: Nature does nothing uselessly.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Politics

wisdom.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The moral virtues, then, are produced in us neither by nature nor against nature. Nature, indeed, prepares in us the ground for their reception, but their complete formation is the product of habit.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The only stable state is the one in which all men are equal before the law.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: To give a satisfactory decision as to the truth it is necessary to be rather an arbitrator than a party to the dispute.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: To perceive is to suffer.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence then, is not an act, but a habit.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: Young people are in a condition like permanent intoxication, because youth is sweet and they are growing.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, 'Nicomachean Ethics'

wisdom.quote: It is not always the same thing to be a good man and a good citizen.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, 'Nicomachean Ethics,' 325 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Evil brings men together.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Eudemian Ethics

wisdom.quote: Wretched, ephemeral race, children of chance and tribulation, why do you force me to tell you the very thing which it would be most profitable for you not to hear? The very best thing is utterly beyond your reach: not to have been born, not to be, to be nothing. However, the second best thing for you is: to die soon.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Eudemos

wisdom.quote: Education is the best provision for old age.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Hope is a waking dream.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Liars when they speak the truth are not believed.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who overcomes his enemies.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, In Stobaeus, Florilegium

wisdom.quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Metaphysics

wisdom.quote: For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.
wisdom.author: Aristotle, Nichomachean Ethics

wisdom.quote: When someone tells you something defies description, you can be pretty sure he's going to have a go at it anyway.
wisdom.author: Clyde B. Aster

wisdom.quote: If all men are born free, how is it that all women are born slaves?
wisdom.author: Mary Astell

wisdom.quote: Forgive many things in others; nothing in yourself.
wisdom.author: Ausonius

wisdom.quote: He who does not know how to be silent will not know how to speak.
wisdom.author: Ausonius

wisdom.quote: If you are a terror to many, then beware of many.
wisdom.author: Ausonius

wisdom.quote: Things that we hear pass quicker from our minds than what we read.
wisdom.author: Ausonius

wisdom.quote: Truth is the mother of hatred.
wisdom.author: Ausonius

wisdom.quote: Peace at home is peace in the country. Peace in the country is peace in the world.
wisdom.author: Mustafa Kemal Ataturk

wisdom.quote: Science is the only true guide in life.
wisdom.author: Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, Founder of modern Turkey 22.09.1924

wisdom.quote: Freedom and independence form my character.
wisdom.author: Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, Founder of modern Turkey 24.04.1921

wisdom.quote: He can make me love something just by showing me the energy with which he loves it.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Dooce Plugs In, 07-12-06

wisdom.quote: That�s the miracle of babies, their ability to lay bare the tender, beating hearts of raging assholes.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Dooce, 03-23-06

wisdom.quote: That�s sort of a clich� about parents. We all believe that our children are the most beautiful children in the world. But the thing is, what no one really talks about is the fact that we all really believe it.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Dooce, 05-04-06

wisdom.quote: People often write me and ask how I keep my wood floors so clean when I live with a child and a dog, and my answer is that I use a technique called Suffering From a Mental Illness.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Dooce, 07-07-06

wisdom.quote: This is part of the essence of motherhood, watching your kid grow into her own person and not being able to do anything about it. Otherwise children would be nothing more than pets.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Dooce, 11-15-05

wisdom.quote: I have to live the content, then come back and write about it.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: I usually approach things with the idea that I will take something out of everything I do.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Keep writing. Keep doing it and doing it. Even in the moments when it's so hurtful to think about writing.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: People think they have the right to judge everything that I do.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: There are certain sacred things in my life that I would never talk about. Because they are clear in my head, I can walk freely around the opposite side. I keep them completely separate in my mind.
wisdom.author: Heather Armstrong, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: If you don't run your own life, somebody else will.
wisdom.author: John Atkinson

wisdom.quote: Silence is a text easy to misread.
wisdom.author: A. A. Attanasio, 'The Eagle and the Sword'

wisdom.quote: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't, you're right.
wisdom.author: Mary Kay Ash

wisdom.quote: People fail forward to success.
wisdom.author: Mary Kay Ash

wisdom.quote: In every age 'the good old days' were a myth. No one ever thought they were good at the time. For every age has consisted of crises that seemed intolerable to the people who lived through them.
wisdom.author: Brooks Atkinson, Once Around the Sun (1951)

wisdom.quote: The perfect bureaucrat everywhere is the man who manages to make no decisions and escape all responsibility.
wisdom.author: Brooks Atkinson, Once Around the Sun, 1951

wisdom.quote: You can't love anyone until you understand that you can't love everyone.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, October 20, 2003

wisdom.quote: And so faith is closing your eyes and following the breath of your soul down to the bottom of life, where existence and nonexistence have merged into irrelevance. All that matters is the little part you play in the vast drama.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, reallivepreacher.com weblog, September 4, 2003

wisdom.quote: The universe seems wondrous to me, with or without God. It has powerful lines and uncompromising ways. Patience and time sit like sages on the planets, strong and impersonal. There is a stark beauty to all of this.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, reallivepreacher.com weblog, September 4, 2003

wisdom.quote: Memory is a giggling sprite and will not be tamed. She takes flight the moment the present becomes the past.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, weblog, 04-29-04

wisdom.quote: If stock market experts were so expert, they would be buying stock, not selling advice.
wisdom.author: Norman Augustine

wisdom.quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
wisdom.author: Fred Astaire

wisdom.quote: Despise not any man, and do not spurn anything; for there is no man who has not his hour, nor is there anything that has not its place.
wisdom.author: Ben Azai, Mishna

wisdom.quote: Young men, hear an old man to whom old men hearkened when he was young.
wisdom.author: Caesar Augustus, from Plutarch, Apothegms

wisdom.quote: I found Rome a city of bricks and left it a city of marble.
wisdom.author: Caesar Augustus, from Suetonius, Augustus

wisdom.quote: To err is dysfunctional, to forgive co-dependent.
wisdom.author: Berton Averre

wisdom.quote: What's up, Doc?
wisdom.author: Tex Avery, Bugs Bunny's catch phrase

wisdom.quote: Grief is Newark. It's there. Can't avoid it. The idea is to hold your nose, hope the traffic's not too bad and get on to Manhattan as quickly as possible.
wisdom.author: Eli Attie, House M.D., Dying Changes Everything, 2008

wisdom.quote: We can aspire to anything, but we don't get it just 'cause we want it. I would rather spend my life close to the birds than waste it wishing I had wings.
wisdom.author: Eli Attie, House M.D., Dying Changes Everything, 2008

wisdom.quote: We al have family disfunction. It's why we're successful, to fill that hole.
wisdom.author: Eli Attie, House M.D., Parents, 11-14-2011

wisdom.quote: I do not fear computers. I fear the lack of them.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: I write for the same reason I breathe - because if I didn't, I would die.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: If knowledge can create problems, it is not through ignorance that we can solve them.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: It pays to be obvious, especially if you have a reputation for subtlety.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Never let your sense of morals get in the way of doing what's right.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Science can be introduced to children well or poorly. If poorly, children can be turned away from science; they can develop a lifelong antipathy; they will be in a far worse condition than if they had never been introduced to science at all.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not 'Eureka!' (I found it!) but 'That's funny ...'
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: You must keep sending work out; you must never let a manuscript do nothing but eat its head off in a drawer. You send that work out again and again, while you're working on another one. If you have talent, you will receive some measure of success - but only if you persist.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: One, a robot may not injure a human being, or through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm;Two, a robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law; Three, a robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov, Laws of Robotics from I. Robot, 1950

wisdom.quote: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov, Salvor Hardin in "Foundation"

wisdom.quote: They say that blood is thicker than water. Maybe that's why we battle our own with more energy and gusto than we would ever expend on strangers.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, Family Feud, 1993

wisdom.quote: We're not talking about historical accuracy, we're talking about art. I've set in motion a geometric inevitability. If I start chiseling there, chipping here, the whole form is compromised.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, Family Feud, 1993

wisdom.quote: Be open to your dreams, people. Embrace that distant shore. Because our mortal journey is over all too soon.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, It Happened in Juneau, 1992

wisdom.quote: Sometimes it's hard to avoid the happiness of others.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, Our Tribe, 1992

wisdom.quote: After you've been in a place for a while, everything starts to look... I won't say better, there's no need to go to extremes...but your everyday life does start to become...familiar.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, Russian Flu, 1990

wisdom.quote: Well, spring sprang. We've had our state of grace and our little gift of sanctioned madness, courtesy of Mother Nature. Thanks, Gaia. Much obliged. I guess it's time to get back to that daily routine of living we like to call normal.
wisdom.author: David Assael, Northern Exposure, Spring Break, 1991

wisdom.quote: No moral system can rest solely on authority.
wisdom.author: A. J. Ayer, Humanist Outlook

wisdom.quote: I do not want people to be agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen

wisdom.quote: To sit in the shade on a fine day, and look upon verdure is the most perfect refreshment.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen

wisdom.quote: Where so many hours have been spent in convincing myself that I am right, is there not some reason to fear I may be wrong?
wisdom.author: Jane Austen

wisdom.quote: One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Emma

wisdom.quote: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Emma

wisdom.quote: A large income is the best recipe for happiness I ever heard of.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: Everybody likes to go their own way--to choose their own time and manner of devotion.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: I cannot think well of a man who sports with any woman's feelings; and there may often be a great deal more suffered than a stander-by can judge of.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: I pay very little regard...to what any young person says on the subject of marriage. If they profess a disinclination for it, I only set it down that they have not yet seen the right person.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: If any one faculty of our nature may be called more wonderful than the rest, I do think it is memory. There seems something more speakingly incomprehensible in the powers, the failures, the inequalities of memory, than in any other of our intelligences. The memory is sometimes so retentive, so serviceable, so obedient; at others, so bewildered and so weak; and at others again, so tyrannic, so beyond control! We are, to be sure, a miracle every way; but our powers of recollecting and of forgetting do seem peculiarly past finding out.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: It will, I believe, be everywhere found, that as the clergy are, or are not what they ought to be, so are the rest of the nation.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: Nothing amuses me more than the easy manner with which everybody settles the abundance of those who have a great deal less than themselves.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: Oh! Do not attack me with your watch. A watch is always too fast or too slow. I cannot be dictated to by a watch.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: One cannot fix one's eyes on the commonest natural production without finding food for a rambling fancy.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: The enthusiasm of a woman's love is even beyond the biographer's.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: There will be little rubs and disappointments everywhere, and we are all apt to expect too much; but then, if one scheme of happiness fails, human nature turns to another; if the first calculation is wrong, we make a second better: we find comfort somewhere.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: We have all a better guide in ourselves, if we would attend to it, than any other person can be.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: Where any one body of educated men, of whatever denomination, are condemned indiscriminately, there must be a deficiency of information, or...of something else.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Mansfield Park

wisdom.quote: But when a young lady is to be a heroine, the perverseness of forty surrounding families cannot prevent her. Something must and will happen to throw a hero in her way.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Northanger Abbey

wisdom.quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Northanger Abbey

wisdom.quote: I married beneath me - all women do.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor

wisdom.quote: One reason I don't drink is that I want to know when I am having a good time.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor

wisdom.quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything - or nothing.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor

wisdom.quote: The only thing I like about rich people is their money.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor

wisdom.quote: The penalty for success is to be bored by the people who used to snub you.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor

wisdom.quote: I used to dread getting older because I thought I would not be able to do all the things I wanted to do, but now that I am older I find that I don't want to do them.
wisdom.author: Nancy Astor, interview, 1959

wisdom.quote: It is all very well, when the pen flows, but then there are the dark days when imagination deserts one, and it is an effort to put anything down on paper. That little you have achieved stares at you at the end of the day, and you know the next morning you will have to scrape it down and start again.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: It's not what you want in this life, it's what you get that you have to do with.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: Love has no place in a lawyer's office.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: The trouble with lies was that once started, the fiction had to be continued, and it was hard always to be remembering details that you had made up upon the spur of the moment.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: We have to have the money to do the work we want to do, as well as to keep a roof over our heads and food on the table. Fat commissions are good, but not always easy to come by, and each new painting takes its time. So we need to find every way possible to earn extra income from our work.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: A man's looks are measured by the depth of his pockets.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, Mr. Darcy's Daughters, 2003

wisdom.quote: Anyone may have diamonds: an heirloom is an ornament of quite a different kind.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, Mr. Darcy's Daughters, 2003

wisdom.quote: People make one happy, not houses? I do not think so. Houses are more to be trusted than people.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, Mr. Darcy's Daughters, 2003

wisdom.quote: One's life is not as fixed as one believes. Surprises may lie in store for you, the unexpected often tends to happen, sometimes bringing in its train the most delightful change in one's life or circumstances.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Darcy Connection, 2008

wisdom.quote: The first rule of life is to reveal nothing, to be exceptionally cautious in what you say, in whatever company you may find yourself. If you have a secret, you have only to whisper it to your dearest friend with the strictest injunction that it will go no further, and within half a day the story is all over town, and when you do make what would seem to be a perfectly sensible remark, you will find it reported in the most grotesque form, thus incurring no end of criticism to rebound upon you.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Darcy Connection, 2008

wisdom.quote: Anyone who goes through life trusting people without making sure they are worthy of trust is a fool. Yet there are people who may be trusted, men as well as women. There are are as many difference in their natures as there are flowers in these meadows.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: Easy enough to dismiss others' problems when you had none of your own.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: How close the sexes sometimes come to one another. It is as much a matter of behaviour and the spere in which they move that separates the masculine part of humanity from the feminine.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: It is a sadness of growing older that we lose our ardent appreciation of what is new and different and difficult.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: Mountains inspire awe in any human person who has a soul. They remind us of our frailty, our unimportance, of the briefness of our span upon this earth. They touch the heavens, and sail serenely at an altitude beyond even the imaginings of a mere mortal.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: One remembers horrors, I think, for the rest of one's life, but memories do not always remain so sharp, and with time, and new circumstance, do not affect us so powerfully.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: One's first love is always perfect until one meets one's second love.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: There was no escaping by means of any journey, however adventurous, one took one's problems and sorrows with one.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: You can't jump down the stairs in one leap, however much you might wish to, and you even more surely can't jump up it, but one step and then the next and there you are, at the top or the bottom and not a bit out of breath or discomposed.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Exploits & Adventures of Miss Alethea Darcy, 2005

wisdom.quote: Clergymen have much the same in their breeches as other men.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Second Mrs. Darcy, 2007

wisdom.quote: What is right for one couple is wrong for another. I would say that there are many more important factors to a happy marriage.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Second Mrs. Darcy, 2007

wisdom.quote: When men are scared of a woman, they always accuse her of being mannish.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Second Mrs. Darcy, 2007

wisdom.quote: You would not think that birds who have no brain at all could become so friendly. I swear some of them are more intelligent than many humans, but that says more about our fellow beings than it does about the birds.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The Second Mrs. Darcy, 2007

wisdom.quote: Charge less, but charge. Otherwise, you will not be taken seriously, and you do your fellow artists no favours if you undercut the market.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: Concern for someone else was a good remedy for taking the mind off one's own troubles.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Aston, The True Darcy Spirit, 2006

wisdom.quote: External signs of wealth and success are often cheap storefronts that hide internal mediocrity or even incompetence.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Gospel Living in a Superficial World, 05-30-06

wisdom.quote: No one forgives with more grace and love than a child.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 02-15-06

wisdom.quote: I write because I'm afraid to say some things out loud.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 03-13-05

wisdom.quote: Knowing that there is worse pain doesn't make present pain hurt any less.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 03-22-05

wisdom.quote: One of the joys we have in being human is in exercising our freedom to choose and to take each case as it comes to us. We are not robots who are forced into behaviors by their programming. We see things; we think about things; and we choose our course of action or beliefs appropriately. And as long as that remains true of us, we will live every day of our lives on one slippery slope or another. There is no reason to fear this.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 03-23-06

wisdom.quote: When someone is giving you their theology, their God words, you should listen hard and be very gentle. The time to deliver your God words is when you are asked.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 03-25-05

wisdom.quote: Dignity comes not from control, but from understanding who you are and taking your rightful place in the world.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 05-01-05

wisdom.quote: Your world is made of your memories, and your memories are given to you by your world. The whispering voice of happenstance is always in our ears. 'This is the world. This is the way things are. Look. Pay attention. Remember.'
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 05-25-06

wisdom.quote: Doubting God's existence is okay and perfectly acceptable within Christianity as long as the person doubting remains obedient and committed to the Christian path.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 06-10-04

wisdom.quote: When you really trust someone, you have to be okay with not understanding some things.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 07-08-04

wisdom.quote: If you want to write you must have faith in yourself. Faith enough to believe that if a thing is true about you, it is likely true about many people. And if you can have faith in your integrity and your motives, then you can write about yourself without fear.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 07-25-06

wisdom.quote: See things as they are and write about them. Don�t waste your creative energy trying to make things up. Even if you are writing fiction, write the things you see and know.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 07-25-06

wisdom.quote: Some things you do because you want to. Some things you do because of the needs of others in your family.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher weblog, 10-06-05

wisdom.quote: The human heart cannot love the whole world. And if you try to put the whole world into your heart, you will eventually lose touch with your own humanity.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher, 05-01-07

wisdom.quote: One thing is clear to me. You can't know everything you'd like to know. You can't do everything you'd like to do. You can't read everything you'd like to read. You must hold onto some things and let go of others. Learning to make that choice is one of the big lessons of this life.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, Real Live Preacher.com weblog, September 9, 2003

wisdom.quote: Good writing takes more than just time; it wants your best moments and the best of you.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com weblog, 10-09-04

wisdom.quote: It's not foresight or hindsight we need. We need sight, plain and simple. We need to see what is right in front of us.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, April 22, 2003

wisdom.quote: When life seems chaotic, you don't need people giving you easy answers or cheap promises. There might not be any answers to your problems. What you need is a safe place where you can bounce with people who have taken some bad hops of their own.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, August 12, 2003

wisdom.quote: I�m telling you, things are getting out of hand. Or maybe I�m discovering that things were never in my hands.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, August 2, 2003

wisdom.quote: There isn�t much better in this life than finding a way to spend a few hours in conversation with people you respect and love. You have to carve this time out of your life because you aren�t really living without it.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, August 27, 2003

wisdom.quote: The only comfort comes in thinking about how nice it was to know them, and how nice it was to brush against goodness for a season.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, August 5, 2003

wisdom.quote: Fidelity to commitment in the face of doubts and fears is a very spiritual thing.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, December 16, 2002

wisdom.quote: I believe love is primarily a choice and only sometimes a feeling. If you want to feel love, choose to love and be patient.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, December 16, 2002

wisdom.quote: My life is the story of a man who always wants to carry too much. My spiritual quest is the painful process of learning to let go of things not essential.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, December 16, 2002

wisdom.quote: God, I don�t have great faith, but I can be faithful. My belief in you may be seasonal, but my faithfulness will not. I will follow in the way of Christ. I will act as though my life and the lives of others matter. I will love. I have no greater gift to offer than my life. Take it.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, December 26, 2002

wisdom.quote: We think having faith means being convinced God exists in the same way we are convinced a chair exists. People who cannot be completely convinced of God�s existence think faith is impossible for them. Not so. People who doubt can have great faith because faith is something you do, not something you think. In fact, the greater your doubt the more heroic your faith.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, December 26, 2002

wisdom.quote: EVERY path may lead you to God, even the weird ones. Most of us are on a journey. We�re looking for something, though we�re not always sure what that is. The way is foggy much of the time. I suggest you slow down and follow some of the side roads that appear suddenly in the mist.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, February 13, 2003

wisdom.quote: I�m searching through all that has ever been hoped, in praise of what can never be known.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, February 13, 2004

wisdom.quote: This isn't good or bad. It's just the way of things. Nothing stays the same.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 03, 2004

wisdom.quote: I have been truthful all along the way. The truth is more interesting, and if you tell the truth you never have to cover your tracks.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 04, 2004

wisdom.quote: I think people want their illusions and writers are mostly illusion. When you read their words, you read a flattened, incomplete version of the writer.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 05, 2004

wisdom.quote: I don�t think anyone can DO anything that would make him worthy of love. Love is a gift and cannot be earned. It can only be given.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 20, 2003

wisdom.quote: Integrity combined with faithfulness is a powerful force and worthy of great respect.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 27, 2003

wisdom.quote: This is the challenge of writing. You have to be very emotionally engaged in what you�re doing, or it comes out flat. You can�t fake your way through this.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 29, 2004

wisdom.quote: When someone allows you to bear his burdens, you have found deep friendship.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, January 4, 2003

wisdom.quote: Forgiveness does not always lead to a healed relationship. Some people are not capable of love, and it might be wise to let them go along with your anger. Wish them well, and let them go their way.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, July 7, 2003

wisdom.quote: Forgiveness is the healing of wounds caused by another. You choose to let go of a past wrong and no longer be hurt by it. Forgiveness is a strong move to make, like turning your shoulders sideways to walk quickly on a crowded sidewalk. It's your move.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, July 7, 2003

wisdom.quote: It really doesn't matter if the person who hurt you deserves to be forgiven. Forgiveness is a gift you give yourself. You have things to do and you want to move on.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, July 7, 2003

wisdom.quote: You can pray for someone even if you don't think God exists.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, July 7, 2003

wisdom.quote: Love the ones you can. Touch the ones you can reach. Let the others go.
wisdom.author: Gordon Atkinson, RealLivePreacher.com Weblog, October 20, 2003

wisdom.quote: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: Evil is unspectacular and always human, And shares our bed and eats at our own table.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: False enchantment can last a lifetime.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society has to take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness; it is the one crime in which society has a direct interest.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: No opera plot can be sensible, for people do not sing when they are feeling sensible.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: One cannot review a bad book without showing off.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: We are here on Earth to do good to others. What the others are here for, I don't know.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden

wisdom.quote: A poet's hope: to be,like some valley cheese,local, but prized elsewhere.
wisdom.author: W. H. Auden, Collected Poems

wisdom.quote: To be claimed as a good, though in an improper style, is at least better than being rejected as no good at all.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: To flatter and follow others, without being flattered and followed in turn, is but a state of half enjoyment.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: We certainly do not forget you as soon as you forget us. It is, perhaps, our fate rather than our merit. We cannot help ourselves. We live at home, quiet, confined, and our feelings prey upon us. You are forced on exertion. You have always a profession, pursuits, business of some sort or other, to take you back into the world immediately, and continual occupation and change soon weaken impressions. All the privilege I claim for my own sex (it is not a very enviable one; you need not covet it), is that of loving longest, when existence or when hope is gone.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: We none of us expect to be in smooth water all our days.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: When any two young people take it into their heads to marry, they are pretty sure by perseverance to carry their point, be they ever so poor, or ever so imprudent, or ever so little likely to be necessary to each other's ultimate comfort.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance. If the dispositions of the parties are ever so well known to each other or ever so similar beforehand, it does not advance their felicity in the least. They always continue to grow sufficiently unlike afterwards to have their share of vexation; and it is better to know as little as possible of the defects of the person with whom you are to pass your life.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: How little of permanent happiness could belong to a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of anything than of a book! When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: I have no pretensions whatever to that kind of elegance which consists in tormenting a respectable man.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: Loss of virtue in a female is irretrievable; that one false step involves her in endless ruin; that her reputation is no less brittle than it is beautiful; and that she cannot be too much guarded in her behaviour towards the undeserving of the other sex.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: No one can be really esteemed accomplished who does not greatly surpass what is usually met with.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously.... Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, 1811

wisdom.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice, first line

wisdom.quote: The more I know of the world, the more am I convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Sense and Sensibility, 1811

wisdom.quote: In every power, of which taste is the foundation, excellence is pretty fairly divided between the sexes.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Northanger Abbey, 1818

wisdom.quote: A persuadable temper might sometimes be as much in favour of happiness as a very resolute character.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: An agreeable manner may set off handsome features, but can never alter plain ones.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Everybody has their taste in noises as well as in other matters; and sounds are quite innoxious, or most distressing, by their sort rather than their quantity.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Facts or opinions which are to pass through the hands of so many, to be misconceived by folly in one, and ignorance in another, can hardly have much truth left.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Family connexions were always worth preserving, good company always worth seeking.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818
