wisdom.quote: Good company requires only birth, education, and manners, and with regard to education is not very nice. Birth and good manners are essential; but a little learning is by no means a dangerous thing in good company; on the contrary, it will do very well.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Here and there, human nature may be great in times of trial; but generally speaking, it is its weakness and not its strength that appears in a sick chamber: it is selfishness and impatience rather than generosity and fortitude, that one hears of. There is so little real friendship in the world! and unfortunately, there are so many who forget to think seriously till it is almost too late.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: How could it be? She watched, observed, reflected, and finally determined that this was not a case of fortitude or of resignation only. A submissive spirit might be patient, a strong understanding would supply resolution, but here was something more; here was that elasticity of mind, that disposition to be comforted, that power of turning readily from evil to good, and of finding employment which carried her out of herself, which was from nature alone. It was the choicest gift of Heaven.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: I can safely say, that the happiest part of my life has been spent on board a ship.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: I hate to hear you talking so like a fine gentleman, and as if women were all fine ladies, instead of rational creatures.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: I would rather have young people settle on a small income at once, and have to struggle with a few difficulties together, than be involved in a long engagement.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: It was the misfortune of poetry to be seldom safely enjoyed by those who enjoyed it completely; and that the strong feelings which alone could estimate it truly were the very feelings which ought to taste it but sparingly.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Knowing their feelings as she did, it was a most attractive picture of happiness to her. She always watched them as long as she could, delighted to fancy she understood what they might be talking of, as they walked along in happy independence, or equally delighted to see the Admiral's hearty shake of the hand when he encountered an old friend, and observe their eagerness of conversation when occasionally forming into a little knot of the navy, Mrs Croft looking as intelligent and keen as any of the officers around her.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: My idea of good company is the company of clever, well-informed people, who have a great deal of conversation; that is what I call good company.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: One does not love a place the less for having suffered in it, unless it has been all suffering, nothing but suffering.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: One man's ways may be as good as another's, but we all like our own best.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: You're nobody 'til somebody kills you.
wisdom.author: Notorious B.I.G.

wisdom.quote: By the time I'd grown up, I naturally supposed that I'd be grown up.
wisdom.author: Eve Babitz

wisdom.quote: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
wisdom.author: Richard Bach

wisdom.quote: You teach best what you most need to learn.
wisdom.author: Richard Bach

wisdom.quote: A platitude is simply a truth repeated until people get tired of hearing it.
wisdom.author: Stanley Baldwin

wisdom.quote: I have always felt that the moment when first you wake up in the morning is the most wonderful of the twenty-four hours.
wisdom.author: Monica Baldwin

wisdom.quote: The price one pays for pursuing any profession or calling is an intimate knowledge of its ugly side.
wisdom.author: James Baldwin

wisdom.quote: Anyone who had ever struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor.
wisdom.author: James Baldwin , Fifth Avenue Uptown: A Letter from

wisdom.quote: Knowing what you can not do is more important than knowing what you can do. In fact, that's good taste.
wisdom.author: Lucille Ball

wisdom.quote: Love yourself and eveything else falls into line. You really do have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
wisdom.author: Lucille Ball

wisdom.quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
wisdom.author: Lucille Ball

wisdom.quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
wisdom.author: Lucille Ball

wisdom.quote: The best thing to give to your enemy is forgiveness; to an opponent, tolerance; to a friend, your heart; to your child, a good example; to a father, deference; to your mother, conduct that will make her proud of you; to yourself, respect; to all men, charity.
wisdom.author: Francis Maitland Balfour

wisdom.quote: Behind every great fortune there is a crime.
wisdom.author: Honore de Balzac

wisdom.quote: First love is a kind of vaccination which saves a man from catching the complaint a second time.
wisdom.author: Honore de Balzac

wisdom.quote: I am a galley slave to pen and ink.
wisdom.author: Honore de Balzac

wisdom.quote: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
wisdom.author: Honore de Balzac

wisdom.quote: Theories are always very thin and insubstantial, experience only is tangible.
wisdom.author: Hosea Ballou

wisdom.quote: Weary the path that does not challenge. Doubt is an incentive to truth and patient inquiry leadeth the way.
wisdom.author: Hosea Ballou

wisdom.quote: To look backward for a while is to refresh the eye, to restore it, and to render it the more fit for its prime function of looking forward.
wisdom.author: Margaret Fairless Barber

wisdom.quote: Faith is a cop-out. If the only way you can accept an assertion is by faith, then you are conceding that it can�t be taken on its own merits.
wisdom.author: Dan Barker, "Losing Faith in Faith", 1992

wisdom.quote: Inanimate objects are classified scientifically into three major categories - those that don't work, those that break down and those that get lost.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: Is fuel efficiency really what we need most desperately? I say that what we really need is a car that can be shot when it breaks down.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: Misery no longer loves company. Nowadays it insists on it.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: People seem to enjoy things more when they know a lot of other people have been left out of the pleasure.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: People who say you're just as old as you feel are all wrong, fortunately.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: The goal of all inanimate objects is to resist man and ultimately defeat him.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: The only thing I was fit for was to be a writer, and this notion rested solely on my suspicion that I would never be fit for real work, and that writing didn't require any.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: Usually, terrible things that are done with the excuse that progress requires them are not really progress at all, but just terrible things.
wisdom.author: Russell Baker

wisdom.quote: I hate mankind, for I think myself one of the best of them, and I know how bad I am.
wisdom.author: Joseph Baretti, quoted in Boswell's Life of Samuel Johnson

wisdom.quote: Take away the miseries and you take away some folks' reason for living.
wisdom.author: Toni Cade Bambara

wisdom.quote: No one has ever had an idea in a dress suit.
wisdom.author: Sir Frederick G. Banting

wisdom.quote: Every crowd has a silver lining.
wisdom.author: Phineas Taylor Barnum

wisdom.quote: Television is the first truly democratic culture - the first culture available to everybody and entirely governed by what the people want. The most terrifying thing is what people do want.
wisdom.author: Clive Barnes

wisdom.quote: I don't care what people think. people are stupid.
wisdom.author: Charles Barkley

wisdom.quote: I LIKE ads. It's not that we don't like ads, we just don't like ads when they are out of place.
wisdom.author: Bill Barnes, How to Blog for Money by Learning from Comics, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: One picture is worth a thousand words.
wisdom.author: Fred R. Barnard

wisdom.quote: It's not about the length of the posts. It's about the passion.
wisdom.author: Cam Barrett, Better Blogging Brainstorming, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: For the most part, fear is nothing but an illusion. When you share it with someone else, it tends to disappear.
wisdom.author: Marilyn C. Barrick

wisdom.quote: If a `religion' is defined to be a system of ideas that contains unprovable statements, then Godel taught us that mathematics is not only a religion, it is the only religion that can prove itself to be one.
wisdom.author: John D. Barrow, (1735-1811)

wisdom.quote: We would worry less about what others think of us if we realized how seldom they do.
wisdom.author: Ethel Barrett

wisdom.quote: Love is an exploding cigar we willingly smoke.
wisdom.author: Lynda Barry

wisdom.quote: Conscience is the perfect interpreter of life.
wisdom.author: Karl Barth

wisdom.quote: In necessary things, unity; in doubtful things, liberty; in all things, charity.
wisdom.author: Richard Baxter

wisdom.quote: Each painting has its own way of evolving...When the painting is finished, the subject reaveals itself.
wisdom.author: William Baziotes

wisdom.quote: It's easier to quote poets than to read them.
wisdom.author: Allison Barrows, Preteena, 09-30-06

wisdom.quote: Even the wisest counsel is useless when it is unheeded.
wisdom.author: Stephanie Barron, Jane and the Unpleasantness at Scargrave Manor, 1996

wisdom.quote: Friends, in my experience, are like ladies' fashions. They come and go with the seasons, and are rarely of such stout stuff as bears repeated wearing.
wisdom.author: Stephanie Barron, Jane and the Unpleasantness at Scargrave Manor, 1996

wisdom.quote: I never feel that I have comprehended an emotion, or fully lived even the smallest events, until I have reflected upon it in my journal; my pen is my truest confidant, holding in check the passions and disappointments that I dare not share even with my beloved.
wisdom.author: Stephanie Barron, Jane and the Unpleasantness at Scargrave Manor, 1996

wisdom.quote: I would rather spend an hour among the notorious than two minutes with the dull.
wisdom.author: Stephanie Barron, Jane and the Unpleasantness at Scargrave Manor, 1996

wisdom.quote: When a quiet man is moved to passion, it seems the very earth will shake.
wisdom.author: Stephanie Barron, Jane and the Unpleasantness at Scargrave Manor, 1996

wisdom.quote: Food is our common ground, a universal experience.
wisdom.author: James Beard

wisdom.quote: If all the world's a stage, I want to operate the trap door.
wisdom.author: Paul Beatty

wisdom.quote: If a thing isn't worth saying, you sing it.
wisdom.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

wisdom.quote: It is not necessary to understand things in order to argue about them.
wisdom.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

wisdom.quote: You've achieved success in your field when you don't know whether what you're doing is work or play.
wisdom.author: Warren Beatty

wisdom.quote: I ran the wrong kind of business, but I did it with integrity.
wisdom.author: Sydney Biddle Barrows, in Marian Christy, ''Mayflower Madam' Tells All,' Boston Globe, 1986

wisdom.quote: America is the country where you buy a lifetime supply of aspirin for one dollar and use it up in two weeks.
wisdom.author: John Barrymore

wisdom.quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
wisdom.author: John Barrymore

wisdom.quote: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
wisdom.author: John Barrymore

wisdom.quote: One of my chief regrets during my recent years in the theater is that I couldn't sit in the audience and watch me.
wisdom.author: John Barrymore

wisdom.quote: Die? I should say not, dear fellow. No Barrymore would allow such a conventional thing to happen to him.
wisdom.author: John Barrymore, last words

wisdom.quote: He that loveth a book will never want a faithful friend, a wholesome counsellor, a cheerful companion, an effectual comforter.
wisdom.author: Dr. Isaac Barrow, quoted in Fifty Years of Sheffield Church Life 1866-1916 by Rev. W. Odom

wisdom.quote: Every instance of heartbreak can teach us powerful lessons about creating the kind of love we really want.
wisdom.author: Martha Beck, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: The power to bring me out of solitude - or to push me back into it - had never belonged to another person. It was mine and only mine.
wisdom.author: Martha Beck, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: The really potent part of love is that it allows you to carry around beliefs about yourself that make you feel special, desirable, precious, innately good. Your lover couldn't have seen [these qualities] in you, even temporarily, if they weren't part of your essential being.
wisdom.author: Martha Beck, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: Any transition serious enough to alter your definition of self will require not just small adjustments in your way of living and thinking but a full-on metamorphosis.
wisdom.author: Martha Beck, O Magazine, Growing Wings, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Everyone is necessarily the hero of his own life story.
wisdom.author: John Barth

wisdom.quote: The significance of man is that he is insignificant and is aware of it.
wisdom.author: Carl Becker

wisdom.quote: The best way to live is by not knowing what will happen to you at the end of the day...
wisdom.author: Donald Barthelme

wisdom.quote: Here's a rule I recommend: Never practice two vices at once.
wisdom.author: Tallulah Bankhead

wisdom.quote: I'm as pure as the driven slush.
wisdom.author: Tallulah Bankhead

wisdom.quote: It's the good girls who keep diaries; the bad girls never have the time.
wisdom.author: Tallulah Bankhead

wisdom.quote: Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it.
wisdom.author: Tallulah Bankhead

wisdom.quote: They used to photograph Shirley Temple through gauze.  They should photograph me through linoleum.
wisdom.author: Tallulah Bankhead

wisdom.quote: The test and use of a man's education is that he finds pleasure in the exercise of his mind.
wisdom.author: Carl Barzun

wisdom.quote: No one else can speak the words on your lips Drench yourself in words unspoken Live your life with arms wide open Today is where your book begins The rest is still unwritten
wisdom.author: Natasha Bedingfield, Unwritten

wisdom.quote: Water is the most neglected nutrient in your diet but one of the most vital.
wisdom.author: Kelly Barton

wisdom.quote: Conceit is God's gift to little men.
wisdom.author: Bruce Barton

wisdom.quote: If you can give your son or daughter only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
wisdom.author: Bruce Barton

wisdom.quote: When you're through changing, you're through.
wisdom.author: Bruce Barton

wisdom.quote: A sympathetic Scot summed it all up very neatly in the remark, "You should make a point of trying every experience once, excepting incest and folk dancing."
wisdom.author: Sir Arnold Bax, Farewell my Youth (1943)

wisdom.quote: You don't get anything clean without getting something else dirty.
wisdom.author: Cecil Baxter

wisdom.quote: There is not less wit nor less invention in applying rightly a thought one finds in a book, than in being the first author of that thought.
wisdom.author: Pierre Bayle, Dictionairre Historique et Critique

wisdom.quote: A synonym is a word you use when you can't spell the word you first thought of.
wisdom.author: Burt Bacharach

wisdom.quote: I am convinced that the world is not a mere bog in which men and women trample themselves in the mire and die. Something magnificent is taking place here amid the cruelties and tragedies, and the supreme challenge to intelligence is that of making the noblest and best in our curious heritage prevail.
wisdom.author: Charles Austin Beard

wisdom.quote: You need only reflect that one of the best ways to get yourself a reputation as a dangerous citizen these days is to go about repeating the very phrases which our founding fathers used in the struggle for independence.
wisdom.author: Charles Austin Beard

wisdom.quote: Love thy neighbour as yourself, but choose your neighbourhood.
wisdom.author: Louise Beal

wisdom.quote: The past is finished. There is nothing to b gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know.
wisdom.author: Rebecca Beard

wisdom.quote: The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know.
wisdom.author: Rebecca Beard

wisdom.quote: Certainly, travel is more than the seeing of sights; it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.
wisdom.author: Miriam Beard

wisdom.quote: I hate the word housewife; I don't like the word home-maker either. I want to be called Domestic Goddess.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: I know how to do anything - I'm a mom.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: The thing women have got to learn is that nobody gives you power. You just take it.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: The world makes you into a bitch, no matter how quietly you go, so you may as well go kicking and screaming.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: Women complain about premenstrual syndrome, but I think of it as the only time of the month that I can be myself.
wisdom.author: Roseanne Barr

wisdom.quote: The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The secret of happiness in not in what one likes to do, but in what one has to do.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: There are few more impressive sights in the world than a Scotsman on the make.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: To die will be an awfully big adventure.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: We are all failures - at least the best of us are.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: We are all of us failures, at least, the best of us are.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: You must have been warned against letting the golden hours slip by; but some of them are golden only because we let them slip by.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: God gave us memory so that we might have roses in December.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: All confidence which is not absolute and entire, is dangerous. There are few occasions but where a man ought either to say all, or conceal all; for, how little so ever you have revealed of your secret to a friend, you have already said too much if you think it not safe to make him privy to all particulars.
wisdom.author: Francis Beaumont

wisdom.quote: Let us have a care not to disclose our hearts to those who shut up theirs against us.
wisdom.author: Francis Beaumont

wisdom.quote: Research is the process of going up alleys to see if they are blind.
wisdom.author: Marston Bates

wisdom.quote: At their core, women fear that men will kill them. At their core, men fear that women will laugh at them.
wisdom.author: Gavin de Becker, The Gift of Fear

wisdom.quote: Teaching is not a lost art, but regard for teaching is a lost tradition.
wisdom.author: Jacques Barzun

wisdom.quote: A great writer reveals the truth even when he or she does not wish to.
wisdom.author: Tom Bissell, Truth in Oxiana, 2004

wisdom.quote: This does not make the authors of those narratives liars; it makes them servants of fallible human memory and perception.
wisdom.author: Tom Bissell, Truth in Oxiana, 2004

wisdom.quote: Good sense about trivialities is better than nonsense about things that matter.
wisdom.author: Max Beerbohm

wisdom.quote: No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
wisdom.author: Max Beerbohm

wisdom.quote: Nobody ever died of laughter.
wisdom.author: Max Beerbohm

wisdom.quote: You cannot make a man by standing a sheep on its hind legs. But by standing a flock of sheep in that position you can make a crowd of men.
wisdom.author: Max Beerbohm

wisdom.quote: The greatest justice in life is that your vision and looks tend to go simultaneously.
wisdom.author: Kevin Bacon, People, 06-13-2011

wisdom.quote: When they discover the center of the universe, a lot of people will be disappointed to discover they are not it.
wisdom.author: Bernard Bailey

wisdom.quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with ten thousand people. The hardest is with one.
wisdom.author: Joan Baez

wisdom.quote: The only thing that's been a worse flop than the organization of non-violence has been the organization of violence.
wisdom.author: Joan Baez

wisdom.quote: Instead of getting hard ourselves and trying to compete, women should try and give their best qualities to men - bring them softness, teach them how to cry.
wisdom.author: Joan Baez, Sexism Seen but not Heard, Los Angeles Times, 1974

wisdom.quote: The freedom of all is essential to my freedom.
wisdom.author: Mikhail Bakunin

wisdom.quote: A divine falsehood is more powerful than any human truth.
wisdom.author: Mikhail Bakunin, God and the State

wisdom.quote: I reverse the phrase of Voltaire, and say that if God really existed, it would be necessary to abolish him.
wisdom.author: Mikhail Bakunin, God and the State

wisdom.quote: Change is the constant, the signal for rebirth, the egg of the phoenix.
wisdom.author: Christina Baldwin

wisdom.quote: How we remember, what we remember and why we remember form the most personal map of our individuality.
wisdom.author: Christina Baldwin

wisdom.quote: Journal writing is a voyage to the interior.
wisdom.author: Christina Baldwin

wisdom.quote: Ritual is the way you carry the presence of the sacred. Ritual is the spark that must not go out.
wisdom.author: Christina Baldwin

wisdom.quote: I always say shopping is cheaper than a psychiatrist.
wisdom.author: Tammy Faye Bakker

wisdom.quote: The possession of unlimited power will make a despot of almost any man. There is a possible Nero in the gentlest human creature that walks.
wisdom.author: Thomas Bailey, 'Leaves from a Notebook,' Ponkapog Papers, 1903

wisdom.quote: I have never thought of writing for reputation and honor. What I have in my heart must come out; that is the reason why I compose.
wisdom.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

wisdom.quote: Recommend to your children virtue; that alone can make them happy, not gold.
wisdom.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

wisdom.quote: The family is changing not disappearing. We have to broaden our understanding of it, look for the new metaphors.
wisdom.author: Mary Catherine Bateson

wisdom.quote: A kiss is a lovely trick, designed by nature, to stop words when speech becomes unnecessary.
wisdom.author: Ingrid Bergman

wisdom.quote: Approach each new problem not with a view of finding what you hope will be there, but to get the truth, the realities that must be grappled with. You may not like what you find. In that case you are entitled to try to change it. But do not deceive yourself as to what you do find to be the facts of the situation.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: During my eighty-seven years I have witnessed a whole succession of technological revolutions. But none of them have done away with the need for character in the individual or the ability to think.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: Every man has a right to his opinion, but no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: I will never be an old man. To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: Millions say the apple fell but Newton was the only one to ask why.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: Never answer a critic, unless he's right.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: Only as you do know yourself can your brain serve you as a sharp and efficient tool. Know your own failings, passions, and prejudices so you can separate them from what you see.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch

wisdom.quote: To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
wisdom.author: Bernard M. Baruch, 1940

wisdom.quote: A place for everything and everything in its place.
wisdom.author: Isabella Mary Beeton, The Book of Household Management, 1861

wisdom.quote: One must not lose desires. They are mighty stimulants to creativeness, to love, and to long life.
wisdom.author: Alexander A. Bogomoletz

wisdom.quote: If you'd like to be good at something, the first thing to out the window is the notion of perfection.
wisdom.author: Scott Berkun, Confessions of a Public Speaker, 2009

wisdom.quote: It seems that bad advice that's fun will always be better known than than good advice that's dull-no matter how useless that fun advice is.
wisdom.author: Scott Berkun, Confessions of a Public Speaker, 2009

wisdom.quote: My intent is simply to know my material so well that I'm very comfortable with it. Confidence, not perfection, is the goal.
wisdom.author: Scott Berkun, Confessions of a Public Speaker, 2009

wisdom.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
wisdom.author: Irving Berlin

wisdom.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success. Talent is only a starting point in this business. You've got to keep on working that talent. Someday I'll reach for it and it won't be there.
wisdom.author: Irving Berlin, 1958

wisdom.quote: There's no business like show business.
wisdom.author: Irving Berlin, Song title

wisdom.quote: Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Do not be afraid of defeat. you are never so near victory as when defeated in a good cause
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Fear secretes acids; but love and trust are sweet juices.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: It usually takes 100 years to make a law, and then, after it's done its work, it usually takes 100 years to be rid of it.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Never forget what a man says to you when he is angry.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Our days are a kaleidoscope. Every instant a change takes place in the contents. New harmonies, new contrasts, new combinations of every sort. Nothing ever happens twice alike. The most familiar people stand each moment in some new relation to each other, to their work, to surrounding objects. The most tranquil house, with the most serene inhabitants, living upon the utmost regularity of system, is yet exemplifying infinite diversities.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Repentance may begin instantly, but reformation often requires a sphere of years.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: The dog was created especially for children. He is the god of frolic.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: The meanest, most contemptible kind of praise is that which first speaks well of a man, and then qualifies it with a "but".
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: We sleep, but the loom of life never stops, and the pattern which was weaving when the sun went down is weaving when it comes up in the morning.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: You never know till you try to reach them how accessible men are; but you must approach each man by the right door.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher

wisdom.quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one comes from a strong will; and the other from a strong won't.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher, Seven Lectures to a Young Man, 1844

wisdom.quote: There are 350 varieties of shark, not counting loan and pool.
wisdom.author: L. M. Boyd

wisdom.quote: If winter is slumber and spring is birth, and summer is life, then autumn rounds out to be reflection. It's a time of year when the leaves are down and the harvest is in and the perennials are gone. Mother Earth just closed up the drapes on another year and it's time to reflect on what's come before.
wisdom.author: Mitchell Burgess, Northern Exposure, Thanksgiving, 1992

wisdom.quote: The mellow sweetness of pumpkin pie off a prison spoon is something you will never forget.
wisdom.author: Mitchell Burgess, Northern Exposure, Thanksgiving, 1992

wisdom.quote: Cranes carry this heavy mystical baggage. They're icons of fidelity and happiness. The Vietnamese believe cranes cart our souls up to heaven on our wings.
wisdom.author: Mitchell Burgess, Northern Exposure, The Bad Seed, 1992

wisdom.quote: Our avian brothers are back to roost on the first leg of their annual sojourn south. Why them and not us? Maybe it's because we humans are meant to be rooted in one spot.
wisdom.author: Mitchell Burgess, Northern Exposure, The Bad Seed, 1992

wisdom.quote: Never chase a lie. Let it alone, and it will run itself to death.
wisdom.author: Lyman Beecher

wisdom.quote: A happy marriage is the world's best bargain.
wisdom.author: O. A. Battista

wisdom.quote: A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive. Having been alive, it won't be so hard in the end to lie down and rest.
wisdom.author: Pearl Bailey

wisdom.quote: You never find yourself until you face the truth.
wisdom.author: Pearl Bailey

wisdom.quote: A safe but sometimes chilly way of recalling the past is to force open a crammed drawer. If you are searching for anything in particular you don't find it, but something falls out at the back that is often more interesting.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Always be a little kinder than necessary.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Ambition - it is the last infirmity of noble minds.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Everytime a child says 'I don't believe in fairies' there is a little fairy somewhere that falls down dead.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: For several days after my first book was published, I carried it about in my pocket and took surreptitious peeps at it to make sure the ink had not faded.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: His lordship may compel us to be equal upstairs, but there will never be equality in the servants hall.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: I know not, sir, whether Bacon wrote the works of Shakespeare, but if he did not it seems to me that he missed the opportunity of his life.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: I'm youth, I'm joy, I'm a little bird that has broken out of the egg.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: If you have love you don't need to have anything else. If you don't have it it doesn't matter much what else you do have.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Let no one who loves be unhappy, even love unreturned has its rainbow.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Never ascribe to an opponent motives meaner than your own.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Strength instead of being the lusty child of passions, grows by grappling with and subduing them.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: Temper is a weapon that we hold by the blade.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: That is ever the way. 'Tis all jealousy to the bride and good wishes to the corpse.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The best place a person can die, is where they die for others.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The life of every man is a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another; and his humblest hour is when he compares the volume as it is with what he vowed to make it.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The most useless are those who never change through the years.
wisdom.author: James M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The secret of happiness is to make others believe they are the cause of it.
wisdom.author: Al Batt, in National Enquirer

wisdom.quote: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Bernard

wisdom.quote: Really listening and suspending one's own judgment is necessary in order to understand other people on their own terms... This is a process that requires trust and builds trust.
wisdom.author: Mary Field Belenky, Women's Ways of Knowing: The Development of Self, Voice, and Mind, p. 187

wisdom.quote: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
wisdom.author: Alexander Graham Bell

wisdom.quote: Man is an animal which, alone among the animals, refuses to be satisfied by the fulfilment of animal desires.
wisdom.author: Alexander Graham Bell

wisdom.quote: A pretty woman is a welcome guest.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.quote: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.quote: For the sword outwears its sheath, And the soul wears out the breast, And the heart must pause for breath, And love itself have rest.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.quote: How sweet and soothing is this hour of calm! I thank thee, night! for thou has chased away these horrid bodements which, amidst the throng, I could not dissipate; and with the blessing of thy benign and quiet influence now will I to my couch, although to rest is almost wronging such a night as this.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.quote: [Poetry] is the lava of the imagination whose eruption prevents an earthquake.
wisdom.author: Lord Byron

wisdom.quote: Oh! too convincing - dangerously dear - In woman's eye the unanswerable tear!
wisdom.author: Lord Byron, The Corsair (1814)

wisdom.quote: Let a good man do good deeds with the same zeal that the evil man does bad ones.
wisdom.author: The Belzer Rabbi

wisdom.quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old; seek what they sought.
wisdom.author: Matsuo Basho

wisdom.quote: Each moment in time we have it all, even when we think we don't.
wisdom.author: Melody Beattie

wisdom.quote: I want to find a voracious, small-minded predator and name it after the IRS.
wisdom.author: Robert Bakker, paleontologist

wisdom.quote: Action on the move creates its own route; creates to a very great extent the conditions under which is it to be fullfilled, and thus baffles all calculation.
wisdom.author: Henri Bergson

wisdom.quote: Think like a man of action, act like a man of thought.
wisdom.author: Henri Bergson

wisdom.quote: I lived what most people call the good life. I was happy, but deep inside I always felt that, with the short amount of time we are given to live and love in this world, we spend too much time loving things instead of people.
wisdom.author: Antonia Brenner

wisdom.quote: Man can learn nothing unless he proceeds from the known to the unknown.
wisdom.author: Claude Bernard

wisdom.quote: Mediocre men often have the most acquired knowledge.
wisdom.author: Claude Bernard

wisdom.quote: We can learn nothing except by going from the known to the unknown.
wisdom.author: Claude Bernard

wisdom.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
wisdom.author: Milton Berle

wisdom.quote: Laughter is an instant vacation.
wisdom.author: Milton Berle

wisdom.quote: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.
wisdom.author: Milton Berle

wisdom.quote: We thought, because we had power, we had wisdom.
wisdom.author: Stephen Vincent Benet, Litany for Dictatorships, 1935

wisdom.quote: The first sign of corruption in a society that is still alive is that the end justifies the means.
wisdom.author: Georges Bernanos, "Why Freedom?" The Last Essays of Georges Bernanos, 1955

wisdom.quote: It was the boast of Augustus that he found Rome of brick and left it of marble. But how much nobler will be the sovereign's boast when he shall have it to say that he found law... a sealed book and left it a living letter; found it the patrimony of the rich and left it the inheritance of the poor; found it the two-edged sword of craft and oppression and left it the staff of honesty and the shield of innocence.
wisdom.author: Henry Brougham

wisdom.quote: Although golf was originally restricted to wealthy, overweight Protestants, today it's open to anybody who owns hideous clothing.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: I can win an argument on any topic, against any opponent. People know this, and steer clear of me at parties. Often, as a sign of their great respect, they don't even invite me.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: I think Superman should go on the Larry King show and announce that he would come back to life if people in all 50 states wanted him to.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: Skiing combines outdoor fun with knocking down trees with your face.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: Thus the metric system did not really catch on in the States, unless you count the increasing popularity of the nine-millimeter bullet.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: We Americans live in a nation where the medical-care system is second to none in the world, unless you count maybe 25 or 30 little scuzzball countries like Scotland that we could vaporize in seconds if we felt like it.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: What I look forward to is continued immaturity followed by death.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.quote: Another possible source of guidance for teenagers is television, but television's message has always been that the need for truth, wisdom and world peace pales by comparison with the need for a toothpaste that offers whiter teeth *and* fresher breath.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry, "Kids Today: They Don't Know Dum Diddly Do"

wisdom.quote: Electricity is actually made up of extremely tiny particles called electrons, that you cannot see with the naked eye unless you have been drinking.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry, "The Taming of the Screw"

wisdom.quote: The only really good place to buy lumber is at a store where the lumber has already been cut and attached together in the form of furniture, finished, and put inside boxes.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry, "The Taming of the Screw"

wisdom.quote: Hail to you gods, on that day of the great reckoning. Behold me, I have come to you, without sin, without guilt, without evil, without a witness against me, without one whom I have wronged. I am one pure of mouth, pure of hands.
wisdom.author: The Book of the Dead, The Address to the Gods, 1700-1000 B.C.

wisdom.quote: It's the same each time with progress. First they ignore you, then they say you're mad, then dangerous, then there's a pause and then you can't find anyone who disagrees with you.
wisdom.author: Tony Benn

wisdom.quote: True friends are those who really know you but love you anyway.
wisdom.author: Edna Buchanan

wisdom.quote: Life is too short for traffic.
wisdom.author: Dan Bellack

wisdom.quote: To find fulfillment...don't exist with life - embrace it.
wisdom.author: Jim Beggs

wisdom.quote: What we say is important for in most cases the mouth speaks what the heart is full of.
wisdom.author: Jim Beggs

wisdom.quote: When I came back to Dublin I was courtmartialed in my absence and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
wisdom.author: Brendan Behan

wisdom.quote: He was born an Englishman and remained one for years.
wisdom.author: Brendan Behan, Hostage (1958)

wisdom.quote: A musicologist is a man who can read music but can't hear it.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas Beecham

wisdom.quote: Brass bands are all very well in their place - outdoors and several miles away.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas Beecham

wisdom.quote: The fragrance always remains in the hand that gives the rose.
wisdom.author: Heda Bejar

wisdom.quote: Let us determine to die here, and we will conquer.
wisdom.author: Barnard Elliot Bee

wisdom.quote: Oh, what a dear ravishing thing is the beginning of an Amour!
wisdom.author: Aphra Behn

wisdom.quote: Variety is the soul of pleasure.
wisdom.author: Aphra Behn

wisdom.quote: A man of sixty has spent twenty years in bed and over three years in eating.
wisdom.author: Arnold Bennett

wisdom.quote: Beware of undertaking too much at the start. Be content with quite a little. Allow for accidents. Allow for human nature, especially your own.
wisdom.author: Arnold Bennett

wisdom.quote: Falsehood often lurks upon the tongue of him, who, by self-praise, seeks to enhance his value in the eyes of others.
wisdom.author: Arnold Bennett

wisdom.quote: Having once decided to achieve a certain task, achieve it at all costs of tedium and distaste. The gain in self-confidence of having accomplished a tiresome labor is immense.
wisdom.author: Arnold Bennett

wisdom.quote: The best cure for worry, depression, melancholy, brooding, is to go deliberately forth and try to lift with one's sympathy the gloom of somebody else.
wisdom.author: Arnold Bennett

wisdom.quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it whether it exists or not, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedy.
wisdom.author: Ernest Benn

wisdom.quote: Eagles may soar, but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines.
wisdom.author: John Benfield

wisdom.quote: It's a sign of mediocrity when you demonstrate gratitude with moderation.
wisdom.author: Roberto Benigni, in Newsweek

wisdom.quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
wisdom.author: Ruth Benedict

wisdom.quote: Life engenders life. Energy creates energy. It is by spending oneself that one becomes rich.
wisdom.author: Sarah Bernhardt

wisdom.quote: Inspiration is wonderful when it happens, but the writer must develop an approach for the rest of the time... The wait is simply too long.
wisdom.author: Leonard Bernstein

wisdom.quote: A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: Any healthy man can go without food for two days - but not without poetry.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: Every man who refuses to accept the conditions of life sells his soul.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: Genius is no more than childhood recaptured at will, childhood equipped now with man's physical means to express itself, and with the analytical mind that enables it to bring order into the sum of experience, involuntarily amassed.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: I consider it useless and tedious to represent what exists, because nothing that exists satisfies me. Nature is ugly, and I prefer the monsters of my fancy to what is positively trivial.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: It is by universal misunderstanding that all agree. For if, by ill luck, people understood each other, they would never agree.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: It is necessary to work, if not from inclination, at least from despair. Everything considered, work is less boring than amusing oneself.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: Poetry and progress are like two ambitious men who hate one another with an instinctive hatred, and when they meet upon the same road, one of them has to give place.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: The world only goes round by misunderstanding.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: We are weighed down, every moment, by the conception and the sensation of Time. And there are but two means of escaping and forgetting this nightmare: pleasure and work. Pleasure consumes us. Work strengthens us. Let us choose.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire

wisdom.quote: There exist only three beings worthy of respect: the priest, the soldier, the poet. To know, to kill, to create.
wisdom.author: Charles Baudelaire, Mon Coeur Mis a Nu, XXII

wisdom.quote: Each word seemed to me an unnecessary stain on silence of nothingness.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett

wisdom.quote: Ever tried? Ever failed? No Matter, try again, fail again, Fail better.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett

wisdom.quote: Every word is like an unnecessary stain on silence and nothingness.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett

wisdom.quote: I don�t like animals. It�s a strange thing, I don�t like men and I don�t like animals. As for God, he is beginning to disgust me.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, "Molloy", 1951

wisdom.quote: The fact is, it seems, that the most you can hope is to be a little less, in the end, the creature you were in the beginning, and the middle.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, "Molloy", 1951

wisdom.quote: Yes, I don�t know why, but I have never been disappointed, and I often was in the early days, without feeling at the same time, or a moment later, an undeniable relief.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, "The Expelled", 1946

wisdom.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, "Worstward Ho", 1983

wisdom.quote: Where I am, I don't know, I'll never know, in the silence you don't know, you must go on, I can't go on, I'll go on.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, The Unnamable (1959) page 418

wisdom.quote: Vladimir: That passed the time.Estragon: It would have passed in any case.Vladimir: Yes, but not so rapidly.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, Waiting for Godot (1955)

wisdom.quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
wisdom.author: Samuel Beckett, Waiting for Godot (1955)

wisdom.quote: Every composer knows the anguish and despair occasioned by forgetting ideas which one had no time to write down.
wisdom.author: Hector Berlioz

wisdom.quote: One of the greatest pains to human nature is the pain of a new idea.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The greatest mistake is trying to be m ore agreeable than you can be.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The greatest mistake is trying to be more agreeable than you can be.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The habit of common and continuous speech is a symptom of mental deficiency.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The reason why so few good books are written is that so few people who can write know anything.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: The whole history of civilization is strewn with creeds and institutions which were invaluable at first, and deadly afterwards.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot

wisdom.quote: It is good to be without vices, but it is not good to be without temptations.
wisdom.author: Walter Bagehot, "Biographical Studies", 1863

wisdom.quote: For me, words are a form of action, capable of influencing change.
wisdom.author: Ingrid Bengis

wisdom.quote: It is the letter not sent that is often the most valuable.
wisdom.author: Melanie Benjamin, Alice I Have Been, 2010

wisdom.quote: There is always so much talk about the sins of the fathers, but it is the sins of the mothers that are the most difficult to avoid repeating.
wisdom.author: Melanie Benjamin, Alice I Have Been, 2010

wisdom.quote: What very mysterious things days were. Sometimes they fly by, and other times they seem to last forever, yet they are all exactly twenty-four hours. There's quite a lot we don't know about them.
wisdom.author: Melanie Benjamin, Alice I Have Been, 2010

wisdom.quote: When you write things down, they sometimes take you places you hadn't planned.
wisdom.author: Melanie Benjamin, Alice I Have Been, 2010

wisdom.quote: Silence is the virtue of fools.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: The worst solitude is to be destitute of sincere friendship.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: There be three things which make a nation great and prosperous: a fertile soil, busy workshops, easy conveyance for men and goods from place to place.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land, when they can see nothing but sea.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, "Of Beauty"

wisdom.quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, "Of Death"

wisdom.quote: Houses are built to live in, not to look on; therefore, let use be preferred before uniformity, except where both may be had.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, Essays: Of Building, 1623

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is power. (Ipsa Scientia Potestas Est)
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, Meditationes Sacr�. De H�resibus. (1597)

wisdom.quote: In charity there is no excess.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, Of Goodness, and Goodness of Nature (1625)

wisdom.quote: Ask counsel of both times-of the ancient time what is best, and of the latter time what is fittest.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, Of Great Place, 1625

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is power.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, Religious Meditations, Of Heresies, 1597

wisdom.quote: Man seeketh in society comfort, use and protection.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon, The Advancement of Learning, 1605

wisdom.quote: A smile is the shortest distance between two people.
wisdom.author: Victor Borge

wisdom.quote: I only know two pieces; one is 'Clair de Lune' and the other one isn't.
wisdom.author: Victor Borge

wisdom.quote: Laughter is the closest distance between two people.
wisdom.author: Victor Borge

wisdom.quote: The difference between a violin and a viola is that a viola burns longer.
wisdom.author: Victor Borge

wisdom.quote: By far the best proof is experience.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Certainly virtue is like precious odors, most fragrant when they are incensed, or crushed: for prosperity doth best discover vice, but adversity doth best discover virtue.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Choose the life that is most useful, and habit will make it the most agreeable.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Death is a friend of ours; and he that is not ready to entertain him is not at home.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Discretion in speech is more than eloquence.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: He of whom many are afraid ought to fear many.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: I have taken all knowledge to be my province.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts he shall end in certainties.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: In taking revenge, a man is but even with his enemy; but in passing it over, he is superior.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: In this theater of man's life, it is reserved only for God and for angels to be lookers-on.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Natural abilities are like natural plants; they need pruning by study.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Nature is a labyrinth in which the very haste you move with will make you lose your way.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Praise from the common people is generally false, and rather follows the vain than the virtuous.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Read not to contradict and confute, nor to find talk and discourse, but to weigh and consider.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Read not to contradict and confute, not to believe and take for granted, not to find talk and discourse, but to weigh and consider.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Reading maketh a full man, conference a ready man, and writing an exact man.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more man's nature runs to the more ought law to weed it out.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Seek ye first the good things of the mind, and the rest will either be supplied or its loss will not be felt.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Self-control is not a problem in the future. It's only a problem NOW when the chocolates is next to us.
wisdom.author: Shlomo Bernartzi, TED Talk: Saving for tomorrow, tomorrow, November 2011

wisdom.quote: A great deal of intelligence can be invested in ignorance when the need for illusion is deep.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow

wisdom.quote: All a writer has to do to get a woman is to say he's a writer. It's an aphrodisiac.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow

wisdom.quote: Any artist should be grateful for a naive grace which puts him beyond the need to reason elaborately.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow

wisdom.quote: California is like an artificial limb the rest of the country doesn't really need. You can quote me on that.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow

wisdom.quote: There is only one way to defeat the enemy, and that is to write as well as one can. The best argument is an undeniably good book.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow

wisdom.quote: There was a disturbance in my heart, a voice that spoke there and said, I want, I want, I want! It happened every afternoon, and when I tried to suppress it it got even stronger.
wisdom.author: Saul Bellow, O Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: Beauty? Let me tell you something - being thought of as 'a beautiful woman' has spared me nothing in life. No heartache, no trouble. Love has been difficult. Beauty is essentially meaningless and it is always transitory.
wisdom.author: Halle Berry

wisdom.quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.
wisdom.author: John Berry, Flight of White Crows

wisdom.quote: In health the flesh is graced, the holy enters the world.
wisdom.author: Wendell Berry

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is essential to conquest; only according to our ignorance are we helpless. Thought creates character. Character can dominate conditions. Will creates circumstances and environment.
wisdom.author: Anne Besant

wisdom.quote: When you want to believe in something, you also have to believe in everything that's necessary for believing in it.
wisdom.author: Ugo Betti, Struggle Till Dawn

wisdom.quote: God's only excuse is that he does not exist.
wisdom.author: Marie Henri Beyle

wisdom.quote: One can acquire everything in solitude - except character.
wisdom.author: Marie Henri Beyle

wisdom.quote: Life isn't simple. But the beauty of it is, you can always start over. It'll get easier.
wisdom.author: Alacia Bessette, Simply from Scratch, 2010

wisdom.quote: Nobody cleared a path for themselves by giving up.
wisdom.author: Alacia Bessette, Simply from Scratch, 2010

wisdom.quote: A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well.
wisdom.author: Jeff Bezos

wisdom.quote: The object of government in peace and in war is not the glory of rulers or of races, but the happiness of the common man.
wisdom.author: Lord William Beveridge

wisdom.quote: For certain is death for the bornAnd certain is birth for the dead;Therefore over the inevitableThou shouldst not grieve.
wisdom.author: Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 2

wisdom.quote: On action alone be thy interest,Never on its fruits.Let not the fruits of action be thy motive,Nor be thy attachment to inaction.
wisdom.author: Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 2

wisdom.quote: Blessed are those who can give without remembering, and take without forgetting.
wisdom.author: Princess Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

wisdom.quote: Irony is the hygiene of the mind.
wisdom.author: Princess Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

wisdom.quote: You don't have to signal a social conscience by looking like a frump. Lace knickers won't hasten the holocaust, you can ban the bomb in a feather boa just as well as without, and a mild interest in the length of hemlines doesn't necessarily disqualify you from reading Das Kapital and agreeing with every word.
wisdom.author: Princess Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

wisdom.quote: Do not speak quickly; it is a sign of insanity.
wisdom.author: Bias

wisdom.quote: Make wisdom your provision for the journey from youth to old age, for it is a more certain support than all other possessions.
wisdom.author: Bias

wisdom.quote: The wise man carries his possessions within him.
wisdom.author: Bias

wisdom.quote: Nature is just enough; but men and women must comprehend and accept her suggestions.
wisdom.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

wisdom.quote: Virtue is its own punishment.
wisdom.author: Aneurin Bevan

wisdom.quote: We know what happens to people who stay in the middle of the road. They get run over.
wisdom.author: Aneurin Bevan

wisdom.quote: True gentleness is founded on a sense of what we owe to him who made us and to the common nature which we all share. It arises from reflection on our own failings and wants, and from just views of the condition and duty of man. It is native feeling heightened and improved by principle.
wisdom.author: Hugh Blair

wisdom.quote: Law is the embodiment of the moral sentiment of the people.
wisdom.author: William Blackstone

wisdom.quote: Silence is one of the great arts of conversation, as allowed by Cicero himself, who says, 'there is not only an art, but an eloquence in it.' A well bred woman may easily and effectually promote the most useful and elegant conversation without speaking a word. The modes of speech are scarcely more variable than the modes of silence.
wisdom.author: Tom Blair

wisdom.quote: Do no dishonour to the earth least you dishonour the spirit of man.
wisdom.author: Henry Beston

wisdom.quote: The leaves fall, the wind blows, and the farm country slowly changes from the summer cottons into its winter wools.
wisdom.author: Henry Beston, Northern Farm

wisdom.quote: Each handicap is like a hurdle in a steeplechase, and when you ride up to it, if you throw your heart over, the horse will go along, too.
wisdom.author: Lawrence Bixby

wisdom.quote: When a man comes to me for advice, I find out the kind of advice he wants, and I give it to him.
wisdom.author: John Billings(Henry Wheeler Shaw)

wisdom.quote: Though boys throw stones at frogs in sport, the frogs do not die in sport, but in earnest.
wisdom.author: Bion, from Plutarch, Water and Land Animals

wisdom.quote: The fact is, sometimes it's hard to walk in a single woman's shoes. That's why we need really special ones now and then to make the walk a little more fun.
wisdom.author: Jenny Bicks, Sex and the City, A Woman's Right To Shoes, 2003

wisdom.quote: A boy can learn a lot from a dog: obedience, loyalty, and the importance of turning around three times before lying down.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: An ardent supporter of the hometown team should go to a game prepared to take offense, no matter what happens.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: Anyone can do any amount of work provided it isn't the work he is supposed to be doing at the moment.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: As for me, except for an occasional heart attack, I feel as young as I ever did.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: Defining and analyzing humor is a pastime of humorless people.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: Drinking makes such fools of people, and people are such fools to begin with, that it's compounding a felony.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: I can't bring myself to say, 'Well, I guess I'll be toddling along.' It isn't that I can't toddle. It's just that I can't guess I'll toddle.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: It took me fifteen years to discover that I had no talent for writing, but I couldn't give it up because by that time I was too famous.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: The surest way to make a monkey of a man is to quote him.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley

wisdom.quote: There are two kinds of people in the world, those who believe there are two kinds of people in the world and those who don't.
wisdom.author: Robert Benchley, Benchley's Law of Distinction

wisdom.quote: No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: Those who control their passions do so because their passions are weak enough to be controlled.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: To see a world in a Grain of Sand, And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand, And eternity in an hour.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: When thou seest an eagle, thou seest a portion of genius; lift up thy head!
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: As I was walking among the fires of Hell,  delighted with the enjoyments of Genius;  which to Angels look like torment and insanity.  I collected some of their Proverbs.
wisdom.author: William Blake, "The Marriage of Heaven and Hell", 1790

wisdom.quote: Those who restrain desire, do so because theirs is weak enough to be restrained.
wisdom.author: William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell (c. 1790-1793)

wisdom.quote: Intimacy is being seen and known as the person you truly are.

wisdom.quote: The last time somebody said, 'I find I can write much better with a word processor.', I replied, 'They used to say the same thing about drugs.'

wisdom.quote: From each according to his abilities, to each according to his needs.
wisdom.author: Louis Blanc, The Organization of Work, 1840

wisdom.quote: A person who trusts no one can't be trusted.
wisdom.author: Jerome Blattner

wisdom.quote: We read frequently if unknowingly, in quest of a mind more original than our own.
wisdom.author: Harold Bloom

wisdom.quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
wisdom.author: Harold Bloom, O Magazine, April 2003

wisdom.quote: I have often thought morality may perhaps consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
wisdom.author: Leon Blum

wisdom.quote: Engineers participate in the activities which make the resources of nature available in a form beneficial to man and provide systems which will perform optimally and economically.
wisdom.author: L. M. K. Boelter, 1957

wisdom.quote: I have the heart of a child. I keep it in a jar on my shelf.
wisdom.author: Robert Bloch

wisdom.quote: All that counts in life is intention.
wisdom.author: Andrea Bocelli, in TV Guide

wisdom.quote: That you may retain your self-respect, it is better to displease the people by doing what you know is right, than to temporarily please them by doing what you know is wrong.
wisdom.author: William J. H. Boetcker

wisdom.quote: You cannot strengthen the weak by weakening the strong.You cannot help small men by tearing down big men.You cannot help the poor by destroying the rich.You cannot lift the wage earner by pulling down the wage payer.You cannot keep out of trouble by spending more than your income.You cannot further the brotherhood of man by inciting class hatreds.You cannot establish security on borrowed money.You cannot build character and courage by taking away a man's initiative and independence.You cannot help men permanently by doing for them what they could and should do for themselves.
wisdom.author: William J. H. Boetcker, 1916 (often attributed to Lincoln)

wisdom.quote: When a dog bites a man, that is not news, because it happens so often. But if a man bites a dog, that is news.
wisdom.author: John B. Bogart

wisdom.quote: No man can ever be secure until he has been forsaken by Fortune.
wisdom.author: Boethius, 522, The Happiness Hypothesis: Finding Modern Truth in Ancient Wisdom, 2005

wisdom.quote: I cannot believe that the inscrutable universe turns on an axis of suffering; surely the strange beauty of the world must somewhere rest on pure joy!

wisdom.quote: A friend never defends a husband who gets his wife an electric skillet for her birthday.

wisdom.quote: A friend will tell you she saw your old boyfriend-and he's a priest.

wisdom.quote: Anybody who watches three games of football in a row should be declared brain dead.
wisdom.author: Erma Bombeck

wisdom.quote: Before you try to keep up with the Joneses, be sure they're not trying to keep up with you.

wisdom.quote: Whatever we conceive well we express clearly, and words flow with ease.

wisdom.quote: I think people don't place a high enough value on how much they are nurtured by doing whatever it is that totally absorbs them.

wisdom.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.

wisdom.quote: Never express yourself more clearly than you are able to think.
wisdom.author: Niels Bohr

wisdom.quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.

wisdom.quote: Your theory is crazy, but it's not crazy enough to be true.
wisdom.author: Niels Bohr, to a young physicist

wisdom.quote: A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses; it is an idea that possesses the mind.

wisdom.quote: If you do a good job for others,  you heal yourself at the same time, because a dose of joy is a spiritual cure.

wisdom.quote: The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children.

wisdom.quote: She did not talk to people as if they were strange hard shells she had to crack open to get inside. She talked as if she were already in the shell. In their very shell.

wisdom.quote: Do you realize if it weren't for Edison we'd be watching TV by candlelight?

wisdom.quote: It is only possible to live happily ever after on a day to day basis.

wisdom.quote: It is only possible to live happily ever after on a day-to-day basis.
wisdom.author: Margaret Bonnano

wisdom.quote: There was never anything by the wit of man so well devised, or so sure established, which in continuance of time hath not been corrupted.

wisdom.quote: In the midst of life we are in death. Earth to earth, ashes to ashes, dust to dust.

wisdom.quote: We have left undone those things which we ought to have done; and we have done those things which we ought not to have done.

wisdom.quote: In Ethiopia during the famine, I saw stuff there that reorganized how I saw the world. I didn't quite know what to do about it. At a certain point, I felt God is not looking for alms. God is looking for action.

wisdom.quote: There's the country of America, which you have to defend, but there's also the idea of America. America is more than just a country, it's an idea. An idea that's supposed to be contagious.

wisdom.quote: To resist the frigidity of old age one must combine the body, the mind and the heart - and to keep them in parallel vigor one must exercise, study and love.

wisdom.quote: The way to final freedom is within thy self.

wisdom.quote: I'm just a person trapped inside a woman's body.

wisdom.quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident. That's where we come in; we're computer professionals. We cause accidents.

wisdom.quote: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.

wisdom.quote: The marvel of all history is the patience with which men and women submit to burdens unnecessarily laid upon them by their governments.

wisdom.quote: A sign of celebrity is that his name is often worth more than his services.

wisdom.quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.

wisdom.quote: You've got to make a conscious choice every day to shed the old - whatever 'the old' means for you.

wisdom.quote: If thee marries for money, thee surely will earn it.

wisdom.quote: There can be no real individual freedom in the presence of economic insecurity.

wisdom.quote: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.

wisdom.quote: I'm seventeen and I'm crazy. My uncle says the two always go together. When people ask your age, he said, always say seventeen and insane.

wisdom.quote: We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?

wisdom.quote: If there is one thing worse than being an ugly duckling in a house of swans, it's having the swans pretend there's no difference.

wisdom.quote: If I take refuge in ambiguity, I can assure you that it's quite conscious.

wisdom.quote: An Army of lions commanded by a deer will never be an army of lions.

wisdom.quote: Americans are benevolently ignorant about Canada, while Canadians are malevolently well informed about the United States.

wisdom.quote: I have learned to use the word 'impossible' with the greatest caution.

wisdom.quote: We can lick gravity, but sometimes the paperwork is overwhelming.

wisdom.quote: America has believed that in differentiation, not in uniformity, lies the path of progress. It acted on this belief; it has advanced human happiness, and it has prospered.

wisdom.quote: Behind every argument is someone's ignorance.

wisdom.quote: I think all of our human Experience shows that no one with absolute power can be trusted to give it up even in part

wisdom.quote: Nearly all legislation involves a weighing of public needs as against private desires; and likewise a weighing of relative social values.

wisdom.quote: Our government is the potent, the omnipresent teacher. For good or ill, it teaches the whole people by its example.

wisdom.quote: The intermediate stage between socialism and capitalism is alcoholism.

wisdom.quote: I show you doubt, to prove that faith exists.

wisdom.quote: Ignorance is not innocence but sin.

wisdom.quote: What's the earth With all its art, verse, music, worth - Compared with love, found, gained, and kept?

wisdom.quote: Why comes temptation, but for man to meet and master and crouch beneath his foot, and so be pedestaled in triumph?

wisdom.quote: Other things may change us, but we start and end with family.

wisdom.quote: Because things are the way they are, things will not stay the way they are.

wisdom.quote: Why be a man when you can be a success?

wisdom.quote: Do not fear death so much, but rather the inadequate life.

wisdom.quote: For the villainy of the world is great, and a man has to run his legs off to keep them from being stolen out fom underneath him.
wisdom.author: Bertolt Brecht, The Threepenny Opera (1928), Act I Scene 3

wisdom.quote: Holding onto anger is like grasping onto a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else. You are the one who gets burned.

wisdom.quote: If you knew what I know about the power of giving, you would not let a single meal pass without sharing it in some way.

wisdom.quote: The thought manifests as the word; The word manifests as the deed; The deed develops into habit; And habit hardens into character; So watch the thought and its ways with care, And let it spring from love Born out of concern for all beings� As the shadow follows the body, As we think, so we become.

wisdom.quote: Hatred does not cease in this world by hating, but by not hating; this is an eternal truth.

wisdom.quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than he loves himself.

wisdom.quote: About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
wisdom.author: Josh Billings

wisdom.quote: Don't take the bull by the horns, take him by the tail; then you can let go when you want to.
wisdom.author: Josh Billings

wisdom.quote: I dont care how much a man talks, if he only says it in a few words.
wisdom.author: Josh Billings

wisdom.quote: It is much easier to repent of sins that we have committed than to repent of those we intend to commit.

wisdom.quote: Ive never known a person to live to one hundred and be remarkable for anything else.
wisdom.author: Josh Billings

wisdom.quote: Laughing is the sensation of feeling good all over and showing it principally in one spot.

wisdom.quote: Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over, and showing it principally in one place.

wisdom.quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.

wisdom.quote: The best way to convince a fool that he is wrong is to let him have his own way.

wisdom.quote: The time to pray is not when we are in a tight spot but just as soon as we get out of it.

wisdom.quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.

wisdom.quote: As scarce as truth is, the supply has always been in excess of the demand.

wisdom.quote: Computer games don't affect kids, I mean if Pac Man affected us as kids, we'd all be running around in darkened rooms, munching pills and listening to repetitive music.

wisdom.quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a new star.

wisdom.quote: Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.

wisdom.quote: Then give to the world the best you have. And the best will come back to you.

wisdom.quote: Genuine beginnings begin within us, even when they are brought to our attention by external opportunities.

wisdom.quote: If Pac-Man had affected us as kids, we'd all be running around in dark rooms, munching pills and listening to repetitive electronic music.
wisdom.author: Marcus Bridgstocke

wisdom.quote: Gaia spins on, silently contemplating what it means to be born into a sarcastic universe.

wisdom.quote: It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.

wisdom.quote: Envy can be a positive motivator. Let it inspire you to work harder for what you want.

wisdom.quote: The one function TV news performs very well is that when there is no news we give it to you with the same emphasis as if there were.

wisdom.quote: Always try to do something for the other fellow and you will be agreeably surprised how things come your way - how many pleasing things are done for you.

wisdom.quote: Undoubtedly, we become what we envisage.

wisdom.quote: The crux... is that the vast majority of the mass of the universe seems to be missing.

wisdom.quote: Good taste is the enemy of comedy.

wisdom.quote: Humor is just another defense against the universe.
wisdom.author: Mel Brooks

wisdom.quote: If God wanted us to fly, He would have given us tickets.

wisdom.quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you walk into an open sewer and die.

wisdom.quote: That's it baby, when you got it, flaunt it.

wisdom.quote: Character may be manifested in the great moments, but it is made in the small ones.

wisdom.quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men. Do not pray for tasks equal to your powers. Pray for powers equal to your tasks. Then the doing of your work shall be no miracle, but you shall be the miracle.

wisdom.quote: We shall never understand the natural environment until we see it as a living organism. Land can be healthy or sick, fertile or barren, rich or poor, lovingly nurtured or bled white. Our present attitudes and laws governing the ownership and use of land represent an abuse of the concept of private property.... Today you can murder land for private profit. You can leave the corpse for all to see and nobody calls the cops.
wisdom.author: Paul Brooks, The Pursuit of Wilderness (1971)

wisdom.quote: Tomatoes and oregano make it Italian; wine and tarragon make it French. Sour cream makes it Russian; lemon and cinnamon make it Greek. Soy sauce makes it Chinese; garlic makes it good.
wisdom.author: Alice May Brock

wisdom.quote: Anger repressed can poison a relationship as surely as the cruelest words.
wisdom.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

wisdom.quote: Listening, not imitation, may be the sincerest form of flattery.
wisdom.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

wisdom.quote: Marriage is not just spiritual communion, it is also remembering to take out the trash.
wisdom.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

wisdom.quote: No matter how love-sick a woman is, she shouldn't take the first pill that comes along.
wisdom.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

wisdom.quote: No matter how much pressure you feel at work, if you could find ways to relax for at least five minutes every hour, you'd be more productive.
wisdom.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

wisdom.quote: I'm not a vegetarian because I love animals. I'm a vegetarian because I hate plants.
wisdom.author: A. Whitney Brown

wisdom.quote: That is the saving grace of humor, if you fail no one is laughing at you.
wisdom.author: A. Whitney Brown

wisdom.quote: Engineering is not merely knowing and being knowledgeable, like a walking encyclopedia; engineering is not merely analysis; engineering is not merely the possession of the capacity to get elegant solutions to non-existent engineering problems; engineering is practicing the art of the organized forcing of technological change... Engineers operate at the interface between science and society...
wisdom.author: Dean Gordon Brown

wisdom.quote: Appeasers believe that if you keep on throwing steaks to a tire, the tiger will become a vegetarian.
wisdom.author: Heywood Broun

wisdom.quote: Nobody talks so constantly about God as those who insist that there is no God.
wisdom.author: Heywood Broun

wisdom.quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
wisdom.author: Heywood Broun

wisdom.quote: A technical objection is the first refuge of a scoundrel.
wisdom.author: Heywood Broun, ''Jam-Tomorrow' Progressives,' New Republic, December 15, 1937

wisdom.quote: Posterity is as likely to be wrong as anyone else.
wisdom.author: Heywood Broun, Sitting on the World, 1924
