wisdom.quote: I'm thirty years old, but I read at the thirty-four-year-old level.
wisdom.author: Dana Carvey

wisdom.quote: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough. Not only have I found that when I talk to the little flower or to the little peanut they will give up their secrets, but I have found that when I silently commune with people they give up their secrets also - if you love them enough.
wisdom.author: George Washington Carver

wisdom.quote: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving, and tolerant of the weak and the strong -- because someday you will have been all of these.
wisdom.author: George Washington Carver

wisdom.quote: Ninety-nine percent of all failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
wisdom.author: George Washington Carver

wisdom.quote: One of the things that has helped me as much as any other, is not how long I am going to live, but how much I can do while living.
wisdom.author: George Washington Carver

wisdom.quote: When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.
wisdom.author: George Washington Carver

wisdom.quote: I am an old man, but in many senses a very young man. And this is what I want you to be, young, young all your life.
wisdom.author: Pablo Casals, O Magazine, October 2003

wisdom.quote: Whom did it benefit. (Cui Bono Fuerit)
wisdom.author: Longinus Cassius

wisdom.quote: The best time to plant an oak tree was twenty-five years ago. The second best time is today.
wisdom.author: James Carville

wisdom.quote: Self-importance is our greatest enemy. Think about it - what weakens us is feeling offended by the deeds and misdeeds of our fellowmen. Our self-importance requires that we spend most of our lives offended by someone.
wisdom.author: Carlos Castaneda

wisdom.quote: all of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon - instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: Any fool can criticize, condemn, and complain - and most fools do.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: I've found that worry and irritation vanish into thin air the moment I open my mind to the many blessings I possess.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: If you can't sleep, then get up and do something instead of lying there and worrying. It's the worry that gets you, not the loss of sleep.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: It is the way we react to circumstances that determines our feelings.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: Many people think that if they were only in some other place, or had some other job, they would be happy. Well, that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes furthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: When dealing with people, let us remember we are not dealing with creatures of logic. We are dealing with creatures of emotion, creatures bustling with prejudices and motivated by pride and vanity.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get other people interested in you.
wisdom.author: Dale Carnegie

wisdom.quote: The problem with political jokes is they get elected.
wisdom.author: Henry Cate VII

wisdom.quote: If you want to make people weep, you must weep yourself. If you want to make people laugh, your face must remain serious.
wisdom.author: Giovanni Jacopo Casanova

wisdom.quote: A revolution is a struggle between the past and the future.
wisdom.author: Fidel Castro

wisdom.quote: If there ever was in the history of humanity an enemy who was truly universal, an enemy whose acts and moves trouble the entire world, threaten the entire world, attack the entire world in any way or another, that real and really universal enemy is precisely Yankee imperialism.
wisdom.author: Fidel Castro

wisdom.quote: I believe that all of us ought to retire relatively young.
wisdom.author: Fidel Castro, Playboy Interview - January 1967

wisdom.quote: The pleasure of the sportsman in the chase is measured by the intelligence of the game and its capacity to elude pursuit and in the labor involved in the capture.
wisdom.author: John Dean Caton

wisdom.quote: As long as people will accept crap, it will be financially profitable to dispense it.
wisdom.author: Dick Cavett

wisdom.quote: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.
wisdom.author: Dick Cavett

wisdom.quote: It's a rare person who wants to hear what he doesn't want to hear.
wisdom.author: Dick Cavett

wisdom.quote: There�s so much comedy on television. Does that cause comedy in the streets?
wisdom.author: Dick Cavett

wisdom.quote: One can pass on responsibility, but not the discretion that goes with it.
wisdom.author: Benvenuto Cellini

wisdom.quote: You must pray that the way be long, full of adventures and experiences.
wisdom.author: Constantine Peter Cavafy

wisdom.quote: We ought not to judge of men's merits by their qualifications, but by the use they make of them.
wisdom.author: Richard Cecil

wisdom.quote: I don't even butter my bread. I consider that cooking.
wisdom.author: Katherine Cebrian

wisdom.quote: You are not superior just because you see the world in an odious light.
wisdom.author: Vicomte de Chateaubriand

wisdom.quote: One does not learn how to die by killing others.
wisdom.author: Vicomte de Chateaubriand, Memoirs (1826-1841)

wisdom.quote: Thought is the fountain of speech.
wisdom.author: Chrysippus

wisdom.quote: As a matter of principle, I never attend the first annual anything.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Honesty may be the best policy, but it's important to remember that apparently, by elimination, dishonesty is the second-best policy.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: I think it's the duty of the comedian to find out where the line is drawn and cross it deliberately.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State. My idea is that these two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: I'm not concerned about all hell breaking loose, but that a PART of hell will break loose... it'll be much harder to detect.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say that the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: If lawyers are disbarred and clergymen defrocked, doesn't it follow that electricians can be delighted, musicians denoted?
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: It's never just a game when you're winning.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Some national parks have long waiting lists for camping reservations. When you have to wait a year to sleep next to a tree, something is wrong.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: The very existence of flamethrowers proves that some time, somewhere, someone said to themselves, "You know, I want to set those people over there on fire, but I'm just not close enough to get the job done."
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: There's no present. There's only the immediate future and the recent past.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Think of how stupid the average person is, and realize half of them are stupider than that.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Weather forecast for tonight: dark. Continued dark overnight, with widely scattered light by morning.
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: Well, if crime fighters fight crime and fire fighters fight fire, what do freedom fighters fight? They never mention that part to us, do they?
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: When someone asks you, A penny for your thoughts, and you put your two cents in, what happens to the other penny?
wisdom.author: George Carlin

wisdom.quote: I don't have hobbies; hobbies cost money. Interests are quite free.
wisdom.author: George Carlin, George Carlin: You Are All Diseased

wisdom.quote: The most important thing she'd learned over the years was that there was no way to be a perfect mother and a million ways to be a good one.
wisdom.author: Jill Churchill, O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: A two-pound turkey and a fifty-pound cranberry - that's Thanksgiving dinner at Three-Mile Island.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: Democracy means that anyone can grow up to be president, and anyone who doesn't grow up can be vice president.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: For three days after death hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: I was so naive as a kid I used to sneak behind the barn and do nothing.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: If it weren't for Philo T. Farnsworth, inventor of television, we'd still be eating frozen radio dinners.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: If life was fair, Elvis would be alive and all the impersonators would be dead.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: Nancy Reagan fell down and broke her hair.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: The Hollywood tradition I like best is called "sucking up to the stars."
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson

wisdom.quote: Blow in it's ear.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson,  on the best way to thaw a frozen turkey

wisdom.quote: I knew a man who gave up smoking, drinking, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson, people magazine special issue

wisdom.quote: Who could follow Carson? Well, believe me, somebody can - and will.
wisdom.author: Johnny Carson, Playboy Interview - December 1967

wisdom.quote: No one can build his security upon the nobleness of another person.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather

wisdom.quote: Only solitary men know the full joys of frienship. Others have their family; but to a solitary and an exile, his friends are everything.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather

wisdom.quote: The dead might as well try to speak to the living as the old to the young.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather

wisdom.quote: The history of every country begins in the heart of a man or a woman.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather

wisdom.quote: Trees were so rare in that country, and they had to make such a hard fight to grow, that we used to feel anxious about them, and visit them as if they were persons. It must have been the scarcity of detail in that tawny landscape that made detail so precious.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather, My Antonia

wisdom.quote: Winter lies too long in country towns; hangs on until it is stale and shabby, old and sullen.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather, My Antonia

wisdom.quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather, O Pioneers! (1913)

wisdom.quote: She used to drag her mattress besider her low window and lie awake for a long while, vibrating with excitement, as a machine vibrates from speed. Life rushed in upon her through that window - or so it seemed. In reality, of course, life rushes from within, not from without. There is no work of art so big or so beautiful that is was not once all contained in some youthful body, like this one which lay on the floor in the moonlight, pulsing with ardor and anticipation.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather, The Song of the Lark

wisdom.quote: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
wisdom.author: Willa Cather, The Song of the Lark, 1915

wisdom.quote: After I'm dead I'd rather have people ask why I have no monument than why I have one.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Anger so clouds the mind, that it cannot perceive the truth.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: From lightest words sometimes the direst quarrel springs.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Grasp the subject, the words will follow.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: I think the first virtue is to restrain the tongue; he approaches nearest to gods who knows how to be silent, even though he is in the right.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Lighter is the wound foreseen.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Patience is the greatest of all virtues.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Tis sometimes the height of wisdom to feign stupidity.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: We cannot control the evil tongues of others; but a good life enables us to disregard them.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder

wisdom.quote: Wise men profit more from fools than fools from wise men; for the wise men shun the mistakes of fools, but fools do not imitate the successes of the wise.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: An orator is a good man who is skilled in speaking.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder, from Seneca the Elder, Controversiae

wisdom.quote: Even though work stops, expenses run on.
wisdom.author: Cato the Elder, On Agriculture

wisdom.quote: Great people and great athletes realize early in their lives their destiny, and accept it. Even if they do not consciously realize the how, the where, the what.
wisdom.author: Percy Cerutty

wisdom.quote: There is no legal obligation to perform impossibilities.
wisdom.author: Publius Celsus

wisdom.quote: In a country as big as the United States, you can find fifty examples of anything.
wisdom.author: Jeffery F. Chamberlain

wisdom.quote: Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
wisdom.author: William Ellery Channing

wisdom.quote: Many things catches your eyes, appreciate them. But few things catches your heart, pursue them.
wisdom.author: Viju Chakavarthy

wisdom.quote: An economist is a surgeon with an excellent scalpel and a rough-edged lancet, who operates beautifully on the dead and tortures the living.
wisdom.author: Nicholas Chamfort

wisdom.quote: His passions make man live, his wisdom merely makes him last.
wisdom.author: Nicholas Chamfort

wisdom.quote: In great affairs men show themselves as they wish to be seen; in small things they show themselves as they are.
wisdom.author: Nicholas Chamfort

wisdom.quote: People are governed by the head; a kind heart is of little value in chess.
wisdom.author: Nicholas Chamfort

wisdom.quote: To read a book for the first time is to make the acquaintance of a new friend; to read it a second time is to meet an old one.
wisdom.author: Selwyn Champion

wisdom.quote: A proverb is a short sentence based on long experience.
wisdom.author: Miguel De Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Among the attributes of God, although they are all equal, mercy shines with even more brilliancy than justice.
wisdom.author: Miguel De Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Anyone who does not know how to make the most of his luck has no right to complain if it passes by him.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Be brief, for no discourse can please when too long.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Everyone is as God has made him, and oftentimes a great deal worse.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Short sentences drawn from long experiences.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: The bow cannot always stand bent, nor can human frailty subsist without some lawful recreation.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: Truth indeed rather alleviates than hurts, and will always bear up against falsehood, as oil does above water.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes

wisdom.quote: The most difficult character in comedy is that of a fool, and he must be no simpleton who plays the part.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes, Don Quixote, 1605

wisdom.quote: I say that good painters imitated nature; but that bad ones vomited it.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes, Exemplary Novels (1613)

wisdom.quote: Facts are the enemy of truth.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes, Man of La Mancha

wisdom.quote: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
wisdom.author: Coco Chanel

wisdom.quote: Youth is something very new: twenty years ago no one mentioned it.
wisdom.author: Coco Chanel

wisdom.quote: A quotation, like a pun, should come unsought, and then be welcomed only for some propriety of felicity justifying the intrusion.
wisdom.author: Robert Chapman

wisdom.quote: There are plenty of people to whom the crucial problems of their lives never get presented in terms that they can understand.
wisdom.author: Robert Chapman

wisdom.quote: At least half the mystery novels published violate the law that the solution, once revealed, must seem to be inevitable.
wisdom.author: Raymond Chandler

wisdom.quote: Chess is as elaborate a waste of human intelligence as you can find outside an advertising agency.
wisdom.author: Raymond Chandler

wisdom.quote: A true man never frets about his place in the world, but just slides into it by the gravitation of his nature, and swings there as easily as a star.
wisdom.author: Edward Chapin

wisdom.quote: Do not judge men by mere appearances; for the light laughter that bubbles on the lip often mantles over the depths of sadness, and the serious look may be the sober veil that covers a divine peace and joy.
wisdom.author: Edward Chapin

wisdom.quote: Never does the human soul appear so strong and noble as when it foregoes revenge and dares to forgive an injury.
wisdom.author: Edward Chapin

wisdom.quote: The brightest crowns that are worn in heaven have been tried, and smelted, and polished, and glorified through the furnace of tribulation.
wisdom.author: Edward Chapin

wisdom.quote: To me there is something thrilling and exalting in the thought that we are drifting forward into a splendid mystery-into something that no mortal eye hath yet seen, and no intelligence has yet declared.
wisdom.author: Edward Chapin

wisdom.quote: Be neither too remote nor too familiar.
wisdom.author: Prince Charles, of Wales

wisdom.quote: Avoid the crowd. Do your own thinking independently. Be the chess player, not the chess piece.
wisdom.author: Ralph Charell

wisdom.quote: The more passions and desires one has, the more ways one has of being happy.
wisdom.author: Charlotte-Catherine

wisdom.quote: There are only two kinds of scholars; those who love ideas and those who hate them.
wisdom.author: Emile Chartier

wisdom.quote: He who receives a benefit should never forget it; he who bestow should never remember it.
wisdom.author: Pierre Charron

wisdom.quote: The advice of friends must be received with a judicious reserve; we must not give ourselves up to it and follow it blindly, whether right or wrong.
wisdom.author: Pierre Charron

wisdom.quote: Fashion can be bought. Style one must possess.
wisdom.author: Edna Woolman Chase

wisdom.quote: Fashion is general. Style is individual.
wisdom.author: Edna Woolman Chase

wisdom.quote: The rich man may never get into heaven, but the pauper is already serving his term in hell.
wisdom.author: Alexander Chase, Perspectives, 1966

wisdom.quote: Make a virtue of necessity.
wisdom.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

wisdom.quote: There's never a new fashion but it's old.
wisdom.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

wisdom.quote: He was as fresh as is the month of May.
wisdom.author: Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales, 1390

wisdom.quote: Years ago my mother said to me, 'In this world, Elwood, you must be oh so smart or oh so pleasant.' For years I was smart. I recommend pleasant.
wisdom.author: Mary Chase, Elwood P. Dowd (Jimmy Stewart) in "Harvey", 1950

wisdom.quote: I've wrestled with reality for 35 years, Doctor, and I'm happy to state I finally won out over it.
wisdom.author: Mary Chase, Jimmy Stewart in "Harvey", 1950

wisdom.quote: My life may not be scintillating. But living it is more interesting than watching yours.
wisdom.author: Kevin Cheng, OK/Cancel, 05-11-07

wisdom.quote: Old age is not so bad when you consider the alternatives.
wisdom.author: Maurice Chevalier

wisdom.quote: Treat all men alike. Give them all the same laws. Give them all an even chance to live and grow.
wisdom.author: Chief Joseph

wisdom.quote: Hear me, my chiefs! I am tired. My heart is sick and sad. From where the sun now stands, I will fight no more forever.
wisdom.author: Chief Joseph, on his surrender to Gen. Howard, October 5, 1877

wisdom.quote: I learned long ago never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty, and besides, the pig likes it.
wisdom.author: Cyrus Ching

wisdom.quote: Heirlooms we don't have in our family. But stories we've got.
wisdom.author: Rose Cherin

wisdom.quote: Men cling passionately to old traditions and display intense reluctance to modify customary modes of behavior, as innovators at all times have found to their cost. The dead-weight of conservatism, largely a lazy and cowardly distaste for the strenuous and painful activity of real thinking, has undoubtedly retarded human progress...
wisdom.author: V. Gordon Childe, Man Makes Himself, p. 31

wisdom.quote: It isn't that they can't see the solution. It is that they can't see the problem.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Scandal of Father Brown (1935)

wisdom.quote: He may be mad, but there's method in his madness. There nearly always is method in madness. It's what drives men mad, being methodical.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, The Fad of the Fisherman (1922)

wisdom.quote: Compromise used to mean that half a loaf was better than no bread. Among modern statesmen it really seems to mean that half a loaf is better than a whole loaf.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, What's Wrong with the World, chapter 3, 1910

wisdom.quote: But a somewhat more liberal and sympathetic examination of mankind will convince us that the cross is even older than the gibbet, that voluntary suffering was before and independent of compulsory; and in short that in most important matters a man has always been free to ruin himself if he chose.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, What's Wrong With the World; p. 118

wisdom.quote: Actors search for rejection. If they don't get it they reject themselves.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin

wisdom.quote: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin

wisdom.quote: I don't believe that the public knows what it wants; this is the conclusion that I have drawn from my career.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin

wisdom.quote: In the end, everything is a gag.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin

wisdom.quote: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world - not even our troubles.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin

wisdom.quote: All I need to make a comedy is a park, a policeman and a pretty girl.
wisdom.author: Charlie Chaplin, in My Autobiography (1964)

wisdom.quote: Design is directed toward human beings. To design is to solve human problems by identifying them and executing the best solution.
wisdom.author: Ivan Chermayeff

wisdom.quote: Be more prompt to go to a friend in adversity than in prosperity.
wisdom.author: Chilo

wisdom.quote: Prefer loss to the wealth of dishonest gain; the former vexes you for a time; the latter will bring you lasting remorse.
wisdom.author: Chilo

wisdom.quote: I'm worried that the universe will soon need replacing. It's not holding a charge.
wisdom.author: Edward Chilton

wisdom.quote: And when it rains on your parade, look up rather than down. Without the rain, there would be no rainbow.
wisdom.author: Jerry Chin

wisdom.quote: You can only cure retail but you can prevent wholesale.
wisdom.author: Brock Chisholm

wisdom.quote: Genius hath electric power which earth can never tame.
wisdom.author: Lydia M. Child

wisdom.quote: You find yourself refreshed by the presence of cheerful people. Why not make an honest effort to confer that pleasure on others? Half the battle is gained if you never allow yourself to say anything gloomy.
wisdom.author: Lydia M. Child

wisdom.quote: Over the river and through the wood, To grandfather's house we go; The horse knows the way To carry the sleigh, Through the white and drifted snow.
wisdom.author: Lydia M. Child, Flowers for Children--Thanksgiving Day

wisdom.quote: A gift - be it a present, a kind word or a job done with care and love - explains itself!... and if receivin' it embarrasses you, it's because your 'thanks box' is warped.
wisdom.author: Alice Childress

wisdom.quote: What helps luck is a habit of watching for opportunities, of having a patient, but restless mind, of sacrificing one's ease or vanity, of uniting a love of detail to foresight, and of passing through hard times bravely and cheerfully.
wisdom.author: Charles Victor Cherbuliez

wisdom.quote: If a lot of cures are suggested for a disease, it means tat the disease is incurable.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: If you cry "Forward!" you must without fail make plain in what direction to go. Don't you see that if, without doing so, you call out the word to both a monk and revolutionary, they will go in directions precisely opposite?
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: Man is what he believes.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the feelings that we experience when we are in love represent a normal state. Being in love shows a person who he should be.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: Try to reason about love, and you will lose your reason.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: We shall find peace. We shall hear the angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov, 1897

wisdom.quote: Fitness - If it came in a bottle, everybody would have a great body.
wisdom.author: Cher

wisdom.quote: If grass can grow through cement, love can find you at every time in your life.
wisdom.author: Cher

wisdom.quote: Be wiser than other people if you can, but do not tell them so.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Be wiser than other people, if you can, but do not tell them so.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Choose your pleasures for yourself, and do not let them be imposed upon you.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: He makes people pleased with him by making them first pleased with themselves.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: If you will please people, you must please them in your own way.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness; no laziness; no procrastination; never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is a comfortable and necessary retreat and shelter for us in advanced age, and if we do not plant it while young, it will give us no shade when we grow old.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Never seem more learned than the people you are with. Wear your learning like a pocket watch and keep it hidden. Do not pull it out to count the hours, but give the time when you are asked.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: The knowledge of the world is only to be acquired in the world, and not in the closet.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Whatever you do, do it to the purpose; do it thoroughly, not superficially. Go to the bottom of things. Any thing half done, or half known, is in my mind, neither done nor known at all. Nay, worse, for it often misleads.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: [Common sense] is the best sense I know of.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield

wisdom.quote: Wit is so shining a quality that everybody admires it; most people aim at it, all people fear it, and few love it unless in themselves.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield, letter to his godson, December 18, 1765

wisdom.quote: The knowledge of the world is only to be acquired in the world, and not in a closet.
wisdom.author: Lord Chesterfield, Letters to His Son, 1746, published 1774

wisdom.quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: Real development is not leaving things behind, as on a road, but drawing life from them, as on a root.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because they are generally the same people.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The most astonishing thing about miracles is that they happen.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The people who are the most bigoted are the people who have no convictions at all.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The prophet and the quack are alike admired for a generation, and admired for the wrong reasons.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The thing I hate about an argument is that it always interrupts a discussion.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and the tired man who wants a book to read.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: There nearly always is a method in madness. It's what drives men mad, being methodical.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: To have a right to do a thing is not at all the same as to be right in doing it.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: You can only find truth with logic if you have already found truth without it.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: There are no wise few. Every aristocracy that has ever existed has behaved, in all essential points, exactly like a small mob.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, "Heretics", 1905

wisdom.quote: All slang is a metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Defendant (1901)

wisdom.quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Defendant (1901)

wisdom.quote: The rich are the scum of the earth in every country.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Flying Inn (1914)

wisdom.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Generally Speaking, Chapter 20, 1929

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing on earth as an uninteresting subject; the only thing that can exist is an uninterested person.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Heretics (1905)

wisdom.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on all men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, On Holland, Generally Speaking, 1928

wisdom.quote: The poet only asks to get his head into the heavens. It is the logician who seeks to get the heavens into his head. And it is his head that splits.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Orthodoxy

wisdom.quote: Tradition means giving votes to the most obscure of all classes, our ancestors. It is the democracy of the dead. Tradition refuses to submit to the small and arrogant oligarchy of those who merely happen to be walking about.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton, Orthodoxy

wisdom.quote: "My country, right or wrong," is a thing that no patriot would think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying, "My mother, drunk or sober."

wisdom.quote: Beware of no man more than yourself; we carry our worst enemies within us.

wisdom.quote: By a curious confusion, many modern critics have passed from the proposition that a masterpiece may be unpopular to the other proposition that unless it is unpopular it cannot be a masterpiece.

wisdom.quote: Democracy means government by the uneducated, while aristocracy means government by the badly educated.

wisdom.quote: Don't ever take a fence down until you know the reason it was put up.

wisdom.quote: Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: Every man is important is he loses his life; and every man is funny if he loses his hat and has to run after it.

wisdom.quote: Fallacies do not cease to be fallacies because they become fashions.

wisdom.quote: Happiness is a mystery like religion, and should never be rationalized.

wisdom.quote: I believe in getting into hot water; it keeps you clean.

wisdom.quote: I owe my success to having listened respectfully to the very best advice, and then going away and doing the exact opposite.

wisdom.quote: I say that a man must be certain of his morality for the simple reason that he has to suffer for it.

wisdom.quote: If there were no God, there would be no Atheists.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: It is not bigotry to be certain we are right; but it is bigotry to be unable to imagine how we might possibly have gone wrong.

wisdom.quote: Man seems to be capable of great virtues but not of small virtues; capable of defying his torturer but not of keeping his temper.

wisdom.quote: Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist.
wisdom.author: G. K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: The name of peace is sweet, and the thing itself is beneficial, but there is a great difference between peace and servitude. Peace is freedom in tranquillity, servitude is the worst of all evils, to be resisted not only by war, but even by death.

wisdom.quote: The strictest law often causes the most serious wrong.

wisdom.quote: The welfare of the people is the ultimate law. (Salus Populi Suprema Est Lex)

wisdom.quote: The wise are instructed by reason; ordinary minds by experience; the stupid, by necessity; and brutes by instinct.

wisdom.quote: There is no duty more obligatory than the repayment of kindness.

wisdom.quote: To be content with what one has is the greatest and truest of riches.

wisdom.quote: To each his own. (Suum Cuique)

wisdom.quote: We are obliged to respect, defend and maintain the common bonds of union and fellowship that exist among all members of the human race.

wisdom.quote: We do not destroy religion by destroying superstition.

wisdom.quote: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.

wisdom.quote: What we call pleasure, and rightly so is the absence of all pain.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: When you wish to instruct, be brief; that men's minds take in quickly what you say, learn its lesson, and retain it faithfully. Every word that is unnecessary only pours over the side of a brimming mind.

wisdom.quote: Where is there dignity unless there is honesty?
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.

wisdom.quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.

wisdom.quote: While there's life, there's hope.

wisdom.quote: A friend is, as it were, a second self.

wisdom.quote: The shifts of Fortune test the reliability of friends.

wisdom.quote: There is nothing so absurd but some philosopher has said it.

wisdom.quote: I don't measure America by its achievement but by its potential.

wisdom.quote: People drain me, even the closest of friends, and I find loneliness to be the best state in the union to live in.

wisdom.quote: All over the place, from the popular culture to the propaganda system, there is constant pressure to make people feel that they are helpless, that the only role they can have is to ratify decisions and to consume.

wisdom.quote: As soon as questions of will or decision or reason or choice of action arise, human science is at a loss.
wisdom.author: Noam Chomsky, in a television interview

wisdom.quote: It's also helpful to realize that this very body that we have, that's sitting right here right now... with its aches and it pleasures... is exactly what we need to be fully human, fully awake, fully alive.

wisdom.quote: I�m not going to die because I failed as someone else. I�m going to succeed as myself.

wisdom.quote: When people think the world of you, be careful with them.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cho, Margaret Cho Blog, 09-26-05

wisdom.quote: Just because you are blind, and unable to see my beauty doesn't mean it does not exist.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cho, Margaret Cho's weblog, 03-23-06

wisdom.quote: It�s like your batteries get low, and you need to charge them on someone else�s story.

wisdom.quote: Success is meaningless if you can't sleep at night because of harsh things said, petty secrets sharpened against hard and stony regret, just waiting to be plunged into the soft underbelly of a 'friendship.'

wisdom.quote: Privacy and security are those things you give up when you show the world what makes you extraordinary.

wisdom.quote: The incognito of lower class employment is an effective cloak for any dagger one might wish to hide.

wisdom.quote: I am so beautiful, sometimes people weep when they see me. And it has nothing to do with what I look like really, it is just that I gave myself the power to say that I am beautiful, and if I could do that, maybe there is hope for them too. And the great divide between the beautiful and the ugly will cease to be. Because we are all what we choose.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cho, Margaret Cho\'s weblog, 03-23-06

wisdom.quote: I have learned to love that which is meant to harm me, so that I can stand in the way of those who are less strong. I can take the bullets for those who aren't able to.

wisdom.quote: Love is the big booming beat which covers up the noise of hate.

wisdom.quote: Politics has less to do with where you live than where your heart is.

wisdom.quote: Thankfully, beauty is easier to remove than apply, and a swipe of demaquillage in the right direction and you are you once again.

wisdom.quote: Ugly. Is irrelevant. It is an immeasurable insult to a woman, and then supposedly the worst crime you can commit as a woman. But ugly, as beautiful, is an illusion.

wisdom.quote: Maybe I wanted to hear it so badly that my ears betrayed my mind in order to secure my heart.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cho, weblog,  03-03-04

wisdom.quote: If we have the opportunity to be generous with our hearts, ourselves, we have no idea of the depth and breadth of love's reach.

wisdom.quote: Sometimes when we are generous in small, barely detectable ways it can change someone else's life forever.

wisdom.quote: Try to love someone who you want to hate, because they are just like you, somewhere inside, in a way you may never expect, in a way that resounds so deeply within you that you cannot believe it.

wisdom.quote: Try to put your happiness before anyone else's, because you may never have done so in your entire life, if you really think about it, if you are really honest with yourself.

wisdom.quote: Some people are that - more than a parent, more than a role model, more than anything less than a religion.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cho, weblog,  05-04-04

wisdom.quote: I love drugs, but I hate hangovers, and the hatred of the hangover wins by a landslide every time.

wisdom.quote: A joke's a very serious thing.

wisdom.quote: Great use they have, when in the hands Of one like me, who understands, Who understands the time and place, The person, manner, and the grace, Which fools neglect; so that we find, If all the requisites are join'd, From whence a perfect joke must spring, A joke's a very serious thing.
wisdom.author: Charles Churchill, "The Ghost", 1762, Book IV, lines 1379-1387

wisdom.quote: When you're a mayor and you have a problem you blame the provincial government. If you are provincial government and you have a problem you blame the federal government. We don't blame the Queen any more, so once in a while we might blame the Americans.

wisdom.quote: It is necessary to try to surpass oneself always; this occupation ought to last as long as life.

wisdom.quote: We owe something to extravagance, for thrift and adventure seldom go hand in hand.

wisdom.quote: Maybe coming clean is the ultimate selfish act. A way to absolve yourself by hurting someone who doesn't deserve to be hurt.

wisdom.quote: You can't surprise a man with a dog.

wisdom.quote: I have enjoyed greatly the second blooming... suddenly you find - at the age of 50, say - that a whole new life has opened before you.

wisdom.quote: I like life. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.

wisdom.quote: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.

wisdom.quote: One is left with the horrible feeling now that war settles nothing; that to win a war is as disastrous as to lose one.

wisdom.quote: The people's good is the highest law.

wisdom.quote: Never, never, never believe any war will be smooth and easy, or that anyone who embarks on the strange voyage can measure the tides and hurricanes he will encounter. The statesman who yields to war fever must realize that once the signal is given, he is no longer the master of policy but the slave of unforeseeable and uncontrollable events.

wisdom.quote: Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm.

wisdom.quote: Where there is a great deal of free speech there is always a certain amount of foolish speech.

wisdom.quote: Don't talk to me about naval tradition. It's nothing but rum, sodomy and the lash.

wisdom.quote: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak, Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen."

wisdom.quote: We shall not fail or falter; we shall not weaken or tire...Give us the tools and we will finish the job.

wisdom.quote: The British nation is unique in this respect. They are the only people who like to be told how bad things are, who like to be told the worst.

wisdom.quote: I would say to the House, as I said to those who have joined this Government: 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears, and sweat."

wisdom.quote: Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed, it has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.

wisdom.quote: Laws are silent in times of war.

wisdom.quote: Never go to excess, but let moderation be your guide.

wisdom.quote: Our thoughts are free.

wisdom.quote: Reason should direct and appetite obey.

wisdom.quote: Strain every nerve to gain your point.

wisdom.quote: It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, My Early Life, 1930

wisdom.quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, on the eve of his 75th birthday

wisdom.quote: I am reminded of the professor who, in his declining hours, was asked by his devoted pupils for his final counsel. He replied, 'Verify your quotations.'
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, quoted in Rudolf Flesch, ed., "The New Book of Unusual Quotations" (NY: Harper & Row, 1966), p. 311

wisdom.quote: We must beware of trying to build a society in which nobody counts for anything except a politician or an official, a society where enterprise gains no reward and thrift no privileges.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Radio broadcast, London, March 21, 1943

wisdom.quote: I cannot forecast to you the action of Russia. It is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma: but perhaps there is a key. That key is Russian national interest.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Radio speech, 1939

wisdom.quote: Here is the answer which I will give to President Roosevelt... We shall not fail or falter; we shall not weaken or tire. Neither the sudden shock of battle nor the long-drawn trials of vigilance and exertion will wear us down. Give us the tools and we will finish the job.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Radio speech, 1941

wisdom.quote: It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations. Bartlett's Familiar Quotations is an admirable work, and I studied it intently. The quotations when engraved upon the memory give you good thoughts. They also make you anxious to read the authors and look for more.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Roving Commission: My Early Life, 1930, Chapter 9

wisdom.quote: One day President Roosevelt told me that he was asking publicly for suggestions about what the war should be called. I said at once 'The Unnecessary War'.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Second World War (1948)

wisdom.quote: The empires of the future are the empires of the mind.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Speech at Harvard University, September 6, 1943

wisdom.quote: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use being anything else.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, speech at the Lord Mayor's banquet, London, November 9, 1954

wisdom.quote: From Stettin in the Baltic to Trieste in the Adriatic an iron curtain has descended across the Continent.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Speech in March 1946

wisdom.quote: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Speech in November 1942

wisdom.quote: We shall show mercy, but we shall not ask for it.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, speech in the House of Commons, July 14, 1940

wisdom.quote: A love of tradition has never weakened a nation, indeed it has strengthened nations in their hour of peril; but the new view must come, the world must roll forward.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, speech in the House of Commons, November 29, 1944

wisdom.quote: Never give in--never, never, never, never, in nothing great or small, large or petty, never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense. Never yield to force; never yield to the apparently overwhelming might of the enemy.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Speech, 1941, Harrow School

wisdom.quote: Want of foresight, unwillingness to act when action would be simple and effective, lack of clear thinking, confusion of counsel until the emergency comes, until self-preservation strikes its jarring gong-these are the features which constitute the endless repetition of history.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, Speech, House of Commons, May 2, 1935

wisdom.quote: A happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: A life of peace, purity, and refinement leads to a calm and untroubled old age.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: A mind without instruction can no more bear fruit than can a field, however fertile, without cultivation.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Advice is judged by results, not by intentions.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: All action is of the mind and the mirror of the mind is the face, its index the eyes.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Art is born of the observation and investigation of nature.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: As the old proverb says "Like readily consorts with like."
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Be sure that it is not you that is mortal, but only your body. For that man whom your outward form reveals is not yourself; the spirit is the true self, not that physical figure which and be pointed out by your finger.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: By force of arms. (Vi Et Armis)
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Everyone has the obligation to ponder well his own specific traits of character. He must also regulate them adequately and not wonder whether someone else's traits might suit him better. The more definitely his own a man's character is, the better it fits him.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Force overcome by force. (Vi Victa Vis)
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: Freedom is a possession of inestimable value.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: He only employs his passion who can make no use of his reason.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: He removes the greatest ornament of friendship, who takes away from it respect.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: I will go further, and assert that nature without culture can often do more to deserve praise than culture without nature.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: If you aspire to the highest place, it is no disgrace to stop at the second, or even the third, place.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: In men of the highest character and noblest genius there is to be found an insatiable desire for honour, command, power, and glory.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: In so far as the mind is stronger than the body, so are the ills contracted by the mind more severe than those contracted by the body.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: It is a great thing to know our vices.
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: It is a true saying that "One falsehood leads easily to another".
wisdom.author: Cicero

wisdom.quote: CNN is one of the participants in the war. I have a fantasy where Ted Turner is elected president but refuses because he doesn't want to give up power.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: It has yet to be proven that intelligence has any survival value.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: It may be that our role on this planet is not to worship God-but to create him.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: Politicians should read science fiction, not westerns and detective stories.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: The best measure of a man's honesty isn't his income tax return. It's the zero adjust on his bathroom scale.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: The difference between machines and human beings is that human beings can be reproduced by unskilled labor.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: The only way of finding the limits of the possible is by going beyond them into the impossible.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: There is hopeful symbolism in the fact that flags do not wave in a vacuum.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, "Technology and the Future" (Clarke's second law)

wisdom.quote: At the present rate of progress, it is almost impossible to imagine any technical feat that cannot be achieved - if it can be achieved at all - within the next few hundred years.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, 1983

wisdom.quote: I'm sure we would not have had men on the Moon if it had not been for Wells and Verne and the people who write about this and made people think about it. I'm rather proud of the fact that I know several astronauts who became astronauts through reading my books.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, Address to US Congress, 1975

wisdom.quote: When a distinguished but elderly scientist states that something is possible, he is almost certainly right. When he states that something is impossible, he is very probably wrong.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, Clarke's first law

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is the only instrument of production that is not subject to diminishing returns.
wisdom.author: John Clarke, Economist

wisdom.quote: Who is more busy than he who hath least to do?
wisdom.author: John Clarke, Paroemiologia Anglo-Latina, 1639

wisdom.quote: A politician thinks of the next election; a statesman of the next generation.
wisdom.author: James Clarke

wisdom.quote: He who desires is always poor.
wisdom.author: Claudianus

wisdom.quote: Pride sullies the noblest character.
wisdom.author: Claudianus

wisdom.quote: Virtue is indeed its own reward.
wisdom.author: Claudianus

wisdom.quote: I find it rather easy to portray a businessman. Being bland, rather cruel and incompetent comes naturally to me.
wisdom.author: John Cleese

wisdom.quote: If you want creative workers, give them enough time to play.
wisdom.author: John Cleese

wisdom.quote: Things don't fall apart. Things hold. Lines connect in thin ways that last and last and lives become generations made out of pictures and words just kept.
wisdom.author: Lucille Clifton

wisdom.quote: What we�re saying today is that you're either part of the solution or you�re part of the problem.
wisdom.author: Eldridge Cleaver, Speech in San Francisco, 1968

wisdom.quote: Sensible and responsible women do not want to vote. The relative positions to be assumed by man and woman in the working out of our civilization were assigned long ago by a higher intelligence than ours.
wisdom.author: Grover Cleveland, 1905

wisdom.quote: I have tried so hard to do the right.
wisdom.author: Grover Cleveland, last words, 1908.

wisdom.quote: To dismiss front-end design as mere �icing� is to jeopardize the success of any site.
wisdom.author: Curt Cloninger, 2001

wisdom.quote: Learn to bear bravely changes of fortune.
wisdom.author: Cleobulus

wisdom.quote: Safeguard the health both of body and soul.
wisdom.author: Cleobulus

wisdom.quote: A friend told me that each morning when we get up we have to decide whether we are going to save or savor the world. I don't think that is the decision. It's not an either-or, save or savor. We have to do both, save and savor the world.
wisdom.author: Kate Clinton

wisdom.quote: If I wanted to go crazy I would do it in Washington because it would not be noticed.
wisdom.author: Irwin S. Cobb

wisdom.quote: America is the only nation in history which miraculously has gone directly from barbarism to degeneration without the usual interval of civilization.
wisdom.author: Georges Clemenceau

wisdom.quote: There is no passion like that of a functionary for his function.
wisdom.author: Georges Clemenceau

wisdom.quote: War is a series of catastrophes that results in a victory.
wisdom.author: Georges Clemenceau

wisdom.quote: War is much too serious a matter to be entrusted to the military.
wisdom.author: Georges Clemenceau

wisdom.quote: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves he is not a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.
wisdom.author: Georges Clemenceau, Conversation with Jean Martet, January 1 1929

wisdom.quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not.
wisdom.author: Kurt Cobain

wisdom.quote: Wanting to be someone you're not is a waste of the person you are.
wisdom.author: Kurt Cobain

wisdom.quote: It is better to burn out than fade away.
wisdom.author: Kurt Cobain, His suicide note

wisdom.quote: Bad mind, bad heart. (Mals Mens, Malus Animus)
wisdom.author: Anacharsis Cloots

wisdom.quote: What is man's chief enemy? Each man is his own.
wisdom.author: Anacharsis Cloots

wisdom.quote: I'm not going to quit. Why should I quit? This country is worth fighting for.
wisdom.author: Hillary Rodham Clinton, Ellen DeGeneres interview, 04-07-08

wisdom.quote: All legislation, all government, all society is founded upon the principle of mutual concession, politeness, comity, courtesy; upon these everything is based...Let him who elevates himself above humanity, above its weaknesses, its infirmities, its wants, its necessities, say, if he pleases, I will never compromise; but let no one who is not above the frailties of our common nature disdain compromises.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: An oppressed people are authorized whenever they can to rise and break their fetters.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: I had rather be right than be President.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: In a scheme of policy which is devised for a nation, we should not limit our views to its operation during a single year, or even for a short term of years. We should look at its operation for a considerable time, and in war as well as in peace.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: In all the affairs of life, social as well as political, courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest to the grateful and appreciating heart.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.
wisdom.author: Henry Clay

wisdom.quote: I have found adventure in flying, in world travel, in business, and even close at hand... Adventure is a state of mind - and spirit.
wisdom.author: Jacqueline Cochran

wisdom.quote: A committee can make a decision that is dumber than any of its members.
wisdom.author: David Coblitz

wisdom.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
wisdom.author: Bill Clinton

wisdom.quote: When I took office, only high energy physicists had ever heard of what is called the Worldwide Web.... Now even my cat has its own page.
wisdom.author: Bill Clinton, announcement of Next Generation Internet initiative, 1996

wisdom.quote: The world knows of Rosa Parks because of a single, simple act of dignity and courage that struck a lethal blow to the foundations of legal bigotry.
wisdom.author: Bill Clinton, at Rosa Park's funeral, CNN.com, 11-02-05

wisdom.quote: [George Bush] has raised taxes on the people driving pickup trucks and lowered taxes on the people riding in limousines. We can do better.
wisdom.author: Bill Clinton, Democratic National Convention, July 16, 1992

wisdom.quote: No wonder Americans hate politics when, year in and year out, they hear politicians make promises that won't come true because they don't even mean them - campaign fantasies that win elections but don't get nations moving again.
wisdom.author: Bill Clinton, Detroit Economic Club, August 21, 1992

wisdom.quote: Some days you're a bug, some days you're a windshield.
wisdom.author: Price Cobb

wisdom.quote: Never believe anything until it has been officially denied.
wisdom.author: Claud Cockburn

wisdom.quote: The trouble with normal is it always gets worse.
wisdom.author: Bruce Cockburn

wisdom.quote: Underlying the whole scheme of civilization is the confidence men have in each other, confidence in their integrity, confidence in their honesty, confidence in their future.
wisdom.author: Bourke Cockran

wisdom.quote: Be you in what line of life you may, it will be amongst your misfortunes if you have not time properly to attend to pecuniary [monetary] matters. Want of attention to these matters has impeded the progress of science and of genius itself.
wisdom.author: William Cobbett

wisdom.quote: To be poor and dependent is very nearly an impossibility.
wisdom.author: William Cobbett, Advice to Young Men, 1829

wisdom.quote: Art is science made clear.
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau

wisdom.quote: The worst tragedy for a poet is to be admired through being misunderstood.
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau

wisdom.quote: We must believe in luck. For how else can we explain the success of those we don't like?
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau

wisdom.quote: The instinct of nearly all societies is to lock up anybody who is truly free. First, society begins by trying to beat you up. If this fails, they try to poison you. If this fails too, they finish by loading honors on your head.
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau, Journey to Freedom (1969)

wisdom.quote: The actual tragedies of life bear no relation to one's preconceived ideas. In the event, one is always bewildered by their simplicity, their grandeur of design, and by that element of the bizzare which seems inherent in them.
wisdom.author: Jean Cocteau, Les Enfants Terribles

wisdom.quote: Generally the theories we believe we call facts, and the facts we disbelieve we call theories.
wisdom.author: Felix Cohen

wisdom.quote: Generally the theories we believe we call facts, and the we disbelieve we call theories.
wisdom.author: Felix Cohen

wisdom.quote: A committee is a cul-de-sac down which ideas are lured and then quietly strangled.
wisdom.author: Sir Barnett Cocks

wisdom.quote: Go after a man's weakness, and never, ever, threaten unless you're going to follow through, because if you don't, the next time you won't be taken seriously.
wisdom.author: Roy M. Cohn

wisdom.quote: Enjoy your own life without comparing it with that of another.
wisdom.author: Marquis de Condorcet

wisdom.quote: Nothing can so alienate a voter from the political system as backing a winning candidate.
wisdom.author: Mark B. Cohen

wisdom.quote: It is not a bad idea to get in the habit of writing down one's thoughts. It saves one having to bother anyone else with them.
wisdom.author: Isabel Colegate

wisdom.quote: I never saw an ugly thing in my life: for let the form of an object be what it may - light, shade, and perspective will always make it beautiful.
wisdom.author: John Constable

wisdom.quote: Luck is what you have left over after you give 100 percent.
wisdom.author: Langston Coleman

wisdom.quote: She is not fair to outward view As many maidens be; Her loveliness I never knew Until she smiled on me; Oh! then I saw her eye was bright, A well of love, a spring of light.
wisdom.author: Hartley Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Every contrivance of man, every tool, every instrument, every utensil, every article designed for use, of each and every kind, evolved from a very simple beginning.
wisdom.author: Robert Collier

wisdom.quote: Praise the bridge that carried you over.
wisdom.author: George Colman, The Younger

wisdom.quote: If you can't make a mistake, you can't make anything.
wisdom.author: Marva Collins

wisdom.quote: Trust yourself. Think for yourself. Act for yourself. Speak for yourself. Be yourself. Imitation is suicide.
wisdom.author: Marva Collins

wisdom.quote: There are two types of people--those who come into a room and say, 'Well, here I am!' and those who come in and say, 'Ah, there you are.'
wisdom.author: Frederick L Collins

wisdom.quote: The male is a domestic animal which, if treated with firmness, can be trained to do most things.
wisdom.author: Jilly Cooper

wisdom.quote: People will accept your ideas much more readily if you tell them Benjamin Franklin said it first.
wisdom.author: David H. Comins

wisdom.quote: In prosperity our friends know us; in adversity we know our friends.
wisdom.author: John Churton Collins

wisdom.quote: The secret to success in life is known only to those who have not succeeded.
wisdom.author: John Churton Collins

wisdom.quote: There is an art of which every man should be a master the art of reflection. If you are not a thinking man, to what purpose are you a man at all?
wisdom.author: William Hart Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Nothing ever goes away.
wisdom.author: Barry Commoner

wisdom.quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
wisdom.author: James Bryant Conant

wisdom.quote: If our democracy is to flourish, it must have criticism; if our government is to function it must have dissent.
wisdom.author: Henry Commager

wisdom.quote: You gotta dream? You gotta protect it. People can't do somethin' themselves, they wanna tell you you can't do it. If you want somethin', go get it, period.
wisdom.author: Steven Conrad, Pursuit of Happyness, 2006

wisdom.quote: I believe that the government that governs best is a government that governs least, and by these standards we have set up a fabulous government in Iraq.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, Speech to White House Correspondent's Dinner, April 30, 2006

wisdom.quote: When the president decides something on Monday, he still believes it on Wednesday -- no matter what happened Tuesday.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, Speech to White House Correspondent's Dinner, April 30, 2006

wisdom.quote: We know that polls are just a collection of statistics that reflect what people are thinking in 'reality.' And reality has a well known liberal bias.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, Speech to White House Correspondents' Dinner, April 30, 2006

wisdom.quote: Equations are the devil's sentences.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report

wisdom.quote: There's an old saying about those who forget history. I don't remember it, but it's good.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report, March 10, 2008

wisdom.quote: I don't want someone shoving his views down my throat, unless they're covered in a crunchy candy shell.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert, The Colbert Report, May 2, 2006

wisdom.quote: Ethics are so annoying. I avoid them on principle.
wisdom.author: Darby Conley, Get Fuzzy Comic, 08-15-07

wisdom.quote: It's hard to take over the world when you sleep 20 hours a day.
wisdom.author: Darby Conley, Get Fuzzy, 06-07-04

wisdom.quote: Sometimes it's good to contrast what you like with something else. It makes you appreciate it even more.
wisdom.author: Darby Conley, Get Fuzzy, 2001

wisdom.quote: I've always found paranoia to be a perfectly defensible position.
wisdom.author: Pat Conroy

wisdom.quote: Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers, that the mind can never break off from the journey.
wisdom.author: Pat Conroy, The Prince of Tides

wisdom.quote: Every improvement in communication makes the bore more terrible.
wisdom.author: Frank Moore Colby

wisdom.quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
wisdom.author: Rick Cook, The Wizardry Compiled

wisdom.quote: You don't need fancy highbrow traditions or money to really learn. You just need people with the desire to better themselves.
wisdom.author: Adam Cooper and Bill Collage, Accepted, 2006

wisdom.quote: Always be nice to those younger than you, because they are the ones who will be writing about you.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly

wisdom.quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly

wisdom.quote: Our memories are card indexes consulted, and then put back in disorder by authorities whom we do not control.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly

wisdom.quote: There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbors will say.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly

wisdom.quote: Everything is a dangerous drug except reality, which is unendurable.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly, "The Unquiet Grave", 1945

wisdom.quote: All charming people have something to conceal, usually their total dependence on the appreciation of others.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly, Enemies of Promise (1938)

wisdom.quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice; journalism what will be read once.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly, Enemies of Promise (1938)

wisdom.quote: Those whom the Gods would destroy, they first call promising.
wisdom.author: Cyril Connolly, Enemies of Promise (1938)

wisdom.quote: God gives to every man virtue, temper, and understanding.
wisdom.author: William Cooper

wisdom.quote: Never trust a man who speaks well of everybody.
wisdom.author: John Collins

wisdom.quote: To get something done, a committee should consist of no more than three men, two of whom are absent.
wisdom.author: Robert Copeland

wisdom.quote: I don't know how to have casual conversation. You think you're talking about one thing, and either you are and it's incredibly boring, or you're not because it's subtext and you need a decoder ring.
wisdom.author: Sara B. Cooper, House M.D., Love Hurts, 2004

wisdom.quote: You can't be angry with God and not believe in him at the same time.
wisdom.author: Sara B. Cooper, House, Damned If You Do, 2004

wisdom.quote: Last night I dreamed I ate a ten-pound marshmallow, and when I woke up the pillow was gone.
wisdom.author: Tommy Cooper

wisdom.quote: The scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The superior man cannot be known in little matters, but he may be entrusted with great concerns. The small man may not be entrusted with great concerns, but he may be known in little matters.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The superior man...does not set his mind either for anything, or against anything; what is right he will follow.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: There are three things which the superior man guards against. In youth...lust. When he is strong...quarrelsomeness. When he is old...covetousness.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Things that are done, it is needless to speak about...things that are past, it is needless to blame.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: To be able to practice five things everywhere under heaven constitutes perfect virtue...[They are] gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: To go beyond is as wrong as to fall short.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Virtue is more to man than either water or fire. I have seen men die from treading on water and fire, but I have never seen a man die from treading the course of virtue.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself. What the mean man seeks is in others.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: When a man's knowledge is sufficient to attain, and his virtue is not sufficient to enable him to hold, whatever he may have gained, he will lose again.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: When we see men of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: With coarse rice to eat, with water to drink, and my bended arm for a pillow - I have still joy in the midst of these things. Riches and honors acquired by unrighteousness are to me as a floating cloud.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Without an acquaintance with the rules of propriety, it is impossible for the character to be established.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: [The superior man] acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his actions.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Democracy consists of choosing your dictators, after they've told you what you think it is you want to hear.
wisdom.author: Alan Corenk

wisdom.quote: Television is more interesting than people. If it were not, we would have people standing in the corners of our rooms.
wisdom.author: Alan Corenk

wisdom.quote: To try to be better is to be better.
wisdom.author: Charlotte Cushman, quoted in O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: A poet ought not to pick nature's pocket. Let him borrow, and so borrow as to repay by the very act of borrowing. Examine nature accurately, but write from recollection, and trust more to the imagination than the memory.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Advice is like snow; the softer it falls, the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into, the mind.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Experience informs us that the first defense of weak minds is to recriminate.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: I have seen gross intolerance shown in support of tolerance.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: If you would stand well with a great mind, leave him with a favorable impression of yourself; if with a little mind, leave him with a favorable impression of himself.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Oh sleep! It is a gentle thing,  Beloved from pole to pole.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Only the wise possess ideas; the greater part of mankind are possessed by them.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing as a worthless book though there are some far worse than worthless; no book that is not worth preserving, if its existence may be tolerated; as there may be some men whom it may be proper to hang, but none should be suffered to starve.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: What is an epigram? A dwarfish whole, its body brevity, and wit its soul.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Works of imagination should be written in very plain language; the more purely imaginative they are the more necessary it is to be plain.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Water, water, every where, Nor any drop to drink.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge, The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, 1797

wisdom.quote: To get the best out of a man go to what is best in him.
wisdom.author: Daniel Considine

wisdom.quote: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time.
wisdom.author: Mason Cooley, O Magazine, April 2004

wisdom.quote: A happy childhood is poor preparation for human contacts.
wisdom.author: Colette

wisdom.quote: Hope costs nothing.
wisdom.author: Colette

wisdom.quote: There are days when solitude, for someone my age, is a heady wine that intoxicates you with freedom, others when it is a bitter tonic, and still others when it is a poison that makes you beat your head against the wall.
wisdom.author: Colette, 'Freedom,' 1908

wisdom.quote: Total absence of humor renders life impossible.
wisdom.author: Colette, Chance Acquaintances, 1952

wisdom.quote: The true traveler is he who goes on foot, and even then, he sits down a lot of the time.
wisdom.author: Colette, Paris From My Window, 1944

wisdom.quote: We only do well the things we like doing.
wisdom.author: Colette, Prisons and Paradise, 1932

wisdom.quote: I love my past. I love my present. I'm not ashamed of what I've had, and I'm not sad because I have it no longer.
wisdom.author: Colette, The Last of Cheri, 1926

wisdom.quote: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanisms of friendship.
wisdom.author: Colette, The Pure and the Impure, 1932

wisdom.quote: It doesn't matter if people are interested. It's about you taking your stuff and shouting out into the void.
wisdom.author: Jadelr and Cristina Cordova, Chasing Windmills, 07-11-2006

wisdom.quote: I think everyone should have a Beatles phase in their life. I think it's part of growing up in the Western world.
wisdom.author: Jadelr and Cristina Cordova, Chasing Windmills, 07-24-06

wisdom.quote: If you trust Google more than your doctor then maybe it's time to switch doctors.
wisdom.author: Jadelr and Cristina Cordova, Chasing Windmills, 08-21-06

wisdom.quote: You don�t have to specialize - do everything that you love and then, at some time, the future will come together for you in some form.
wisdom.author: Francis Ford Coppola

wisdom.quote: Inspiration may be a form of superconsciousness, or perhaps of subconsciousness - I wouldn't know. But I am sure it is the antithesis of self- consciousness.
wisdom.author: Aaron Copland

wisdom.quote: The whole problem can be stated quite simply by asking, 'Is there a meaning to music?' My answer would be, 'Yes.' And 'Can you state in so many words what the meaning is?' My answer to that would be, 'No.'
wisdom.author: Aaron Copland

wisdom.quote: To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable.
wisdom.author: Aaron Copland

wisdom.quote: Deliberate with caution, but act with decision; and yield with graciousness, or oppose with firmness.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: Examinations are formidable even to the best prepared, for the greatest fool may ask more than the wisest man can answer.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: If you would be known, and not know, vegetate in a village; If you would know, and not be known, live in a city.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: It is always safe to learn, even from our enemies; seldom safe to venture to instruct, even our friends.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: Men are born with two eyes, but only one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: The greatest friend of Truth is time, her greatest enemy is Prejudice, and her constant companion Humility.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: There are two modes of establishing our reputation: to be praised by honest men, and to be abused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the former, because it will invariably be accompanied by the latter.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: Times of general calamity and confusion create great minds. The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunderbolt is elicited from the darkest storms.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: To know a man, observe how he wins his object, rather than how he loses it; for when we fail our pride supports us; when we succeed, it betrays us.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: True friendship is like sound health, the value is seldom appreciated until it is lost.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: We hate some persons because we do not know them; and we will not know them because we hate them.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: We may lay in a stock of pleasures, as we would lay in a stock of wine; but if we defer tasting them too long, we shall find that both are soured by age.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton

wisdom.quote: When you have nothing to say, say nothing.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton
