wisdom.quote: Many books require no thought from those who read them, and for a very simple reason; they made no such demand upon those who wrote them.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton, Lacon, 1820

wisdom.quote: Riches may enable us to confer favours, but to confer them with propriety and grace requires a something that riches cannot give.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton, Lacon, 1825

wisdom.quote: To know the pains of power, we must go to those who have it; to know its pleasures, we must go to those who are seeking it.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton, Lacon, 1825

wisdom.quote: Imitation is the sincerest of flattery.
wisdom.author: Charles Caleb Colton, Lacon, volume I, no. 183

wisdom.quote: Human beings are the only creatures that allow their children to come back home.
wisdom.author: Bill Cosby

wisdom.quote: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
wisdom.author: Bill Cosby

wisdom.quote: The very first law in advertising is to avoid the concrete promise and cultivate the delightfully vague.
wisdom.author: Bill Cosby

wisdom.quote: Don't wear your heart on your sleeve when your remarks are off the cuff.
wisdom.author: Elvis Costello, from "Riot Act"

wisdom.quote: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
wisdom.author: Elvis Costello, Interview in Musician magazine, October 1983

wisdom.quote: All men have an equal right to the free development of their faculties; they have an equal right to the impartial protection of the state; but it is not true, it is against all the laws of reason and equity, it is against the eternal nature of things, that the indolent man and the laborious man, the spendthrift and the economist, the imprudent and the wise, should obtain and enjoy an equal amount of goods.
wisdom.author: Victor Cousin

wisdom.quote: True philosophy invents nothing; it merely establishes and describes what is.
wisdom.author: Victor Cousin

wisdom.quote: Every day, in every way, I am getting better and better.
wisdom.author: Emile Coue

wisdom.quote: The arts must be considered an essential element of education... They are tools for living life reflectively, joyfully and with the ability to shape the future.
wisdom.author: Shirley Trusty Corey

wisdom.quote: If we don't change direction soon, we'll end up where we're going.
wisdom.author: Professor Irwin Corey

wisdom.quote: Marriage is like a bank account. You put it in, you take it out, you lose interest.
wisdom.author: Professor Irwin Corey

wisdom.quote: He who allows himself to be insulted, deserves to be.
wisdom.author: Pierre Corneille

wisdom.quote: When there is no peril in the fight there is no glory in the triumph.
wisdom.author: Pierre Corneille

wisdom.quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
wisdom.author: Pierre Corneille, 'The Cid,' 1636

wisdom.quote: When we conquer without danger our triumph is without glory.
wisdom.author: Pierre Corneille, Le Cid (1637)

wisdom.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you do not trust enough.
wisdom.author: Frank Crane

wisdom.quote: in the service of Caesar, everything is legitimate.
wisdom.author: Pierre Corrielle, la Mort de Pompee

wisdom.quote: Drive-in banks were established so most of the cars today could see their real owners.
wisdom.author: E. Joseph Cossman

wisdom.quote: Middle age is when your broad mind and narrow waist begin to change places.
wisdom.author: E. Joseph Cossman

wisdom.quote: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
wisdom.author: William Congreve

wisdom.quote: Defer not till tomorrow to be wise, tomorrow's sun to thee may never rise.
wisdom.author: William Congreve

wisdom.quote: He that first cries out stop thief, is often he that has stolen the treasure.
wisdom.author: William Congreve, Love for Love (1695)

wisdom.quote: I came upstairs into the world; for I was born in a cellar.
wisdom.author: William Congreve, Love for Love (1695)

wisdom.quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
wisdom.author: William Congreve, The Mourning Bride, 1697, act III scene 8

wisdom.quote: Music has charms to soothe the savage breast  To soften rocks, or bend a knotted oak.
wisdom.author: William Congreve, The Mourning Bride, Act 1 Scene 1

wisdom.quote: They must often change who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
wisdom.author: Confucius, Analects

wisdom.quote: By nature, men are nearly alike; by practice, they get to be wide apart.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: He who exercises government by means of his virtue may be compared to the north polar star, which keeps its place and all the stars turn towards it.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: He with whom neither slander that gradually soaks into the mind, nor statements that startle like a wound in the flesh, are successful may be called intelligent indeed.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: I am not one who was born in the possession of knowledge; I am one who is fond of antiquity, and earnest in seeking it there.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: I have not seen a person who loved virtue, or one who hated what was not virtuous. He who loved virtue would esteem nothing above it.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: If a man takes no thought about what is distant, he will find sorrow near at hand.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: If a man withdraws his mind from the love of beauty, and applies it as sincerely to the love of the virtuous; if, in serving his parents, he can exert his utmost strength; if, in serving his prince, he can devote his life; if in his intercourse with his friends, his words are sincere - although men say that he has not learned, I will certainly say that he has.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Is virtue a thing remote? I wish to be virtuous, and lo! Virtue is at hand.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The cautious seldom err.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The determined scholar and the man of virtue will not seek to live at the expense of injuring their virtue. They will even sacrifice their lives to preserve their virtue complete.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The firm, the enduring, the simple, and the modest are near to virtue.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The man of virtue makes the difficulty to be overcome his first business, and success only a subsequent consideration.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: The man who in view of gain thinks of righteousness; who in the view of danger is prepared to give up his life; and who does not forget an old agreement however far back it extends - such a man may be reckoned a complete man.
wisdom.author: Confucius, The Confucian Analects

wisdom.quote: All a man can betray is his conscience.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: All ambitions are lawful except those that climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: Being a woman is a terribly difficult task since it consists principally in dealing with men.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: Facing it, always facing it, that's the way to get through. Face it.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: For the great mass of mankind, the only saving grace needed is a steady fidelity to what is nearest to hand and heart for the short moment of each human effort.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: Having had to encounter single-handed during his period of eclipse many physical dangers, he was well aware of the most dangerous element common to them all: of the crushing, paralysing sense of human littleness, which is what really defeats a human struggling with natural forces, alone, far from the eyes of his fellows.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: I can't tell if a straw ever saved a drowning man, but I know that a mere glance is enough to make despair pause. For in truth we who are creatures of impulse are creatures of despair.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: I take it that what all men are really after is some form or perhaps only some formula of peace.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: They wanted facts. Facts! They demanded facts from him, as if facts could explain anything.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: What makes mankind tragic is not that they are the victims of nature, it is that they are conscious of it.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad

wisdom.quote: Strength is just an accident arising from the weakness of others.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Heart of Darkness

wisdom.quote: We live as we dream - alone.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Heart of Darkness

wisdom.quote: It's extraordinary how we go through life with eyes half shut, with dull ears, with dormant thoughts. Perhaps it's just as well; and it may be that it is this very dullness that makes life to the incalculable majority so supportable and so welcome.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Lord Jim

wisdom.quote: Who could tell what forms, what visions, what faces, what forgiveness he could see in the glow of the west!
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Lord Jim

wisdom.quote: There is no credulity so eager and blind as the credulity of covetness, which, in its universal extent, measures the moral misery and the intellectual destitution of mankind.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Nostromo

wisdom.quote: But the truth was that he died from solitude, the enemy known but to few on this Earth, and whom only the simplest of us are fit to withstand. The brilliant Costaguanaro of the boulevards had died from solitude and want of faith in himself and others.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Nostromo (on the death of Decoud)

wisdom.quote: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
wisdom.author: Joseph Conrad, Under Western Eyes, 1911

wisdom.quote: Laughter is inner jogging.
wisdom.author: Norman Cousins

wisdom.quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
wisdom.author: Norman Cousins

wisdom.quote: The generation of random numbers is too important to be left to chance.
wisdom.author: Robert R. Coveyou, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

wisdom.quote: I like long walks, especially when they are taken by people who annoy me.
wisdom.author: Noel Coward

wisdom.quote: The higher the buildings, the lower the morals.
wisdom.author: Noel Coward

wisdom.quote: Make as many friends as you can, but don't build your life on them alone. It's an unstable foundation.
wisdom.author: Sean Covey

wisdom.quote: Keeping your clothes well pressed will keep you from looking hard pressed.
wisdom.author: Coleman Cox

wisdom.quote: If there comes a little thaw, Still the air is chill and raw, Here and there a patch of snow,Dirtier than the ground below, Dribbles down a marshy flood; Ankle-deep you stick in mud In the meadows while you sing, "This is Spring."
wisdom.author: Christopher Pearce Cranch, A Spring Growl

wisdom.quote: Don't do a project where you don't think you'll learn something on the way.
wisdom.author: Jim Coudal, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: It's better to be a company than to work for a company.
wisdom.author: Jim Coudal, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: The meek shall inherit the earth? Well... I don't think so. If by meek you mean friendly and introverted, okay maybe, but if by meek you mean unwilling to take a chance, then never. If I was a betting man and I had to wager on who I thought would inherit the earth, my money would be on the curious.
wisdom.author: Jim Coudal, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is neccessary.
wisdom.author: Margaret Cousins

wisdom.quote: Glory built on selfish principles is shame and guilt.
wisdom.author: William Cowper

wisdom.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
wisdom.author: William Cowper

wisdom.quote: O Winter! ruler of the inverted year, . . . I crown thee king of intimate delights, Fireside enjoyments, home-born happiness, And all the comforts that the lowly roof Of undisturb'd Retirement, and the hours Of long uninterrupted evening, know.
wisdom.author: William Cowper, Task (bk. IV, l. 120)

wisdom.quote: Nobody has things just as he would like them. The thing to do is to make a success with what material I have. It is a sheer waste of time and soulpower to imagine what I would do if things were different. They are not different.
wisdom.author: Dr. Frank Crane

wisdom.quote: Deceivers are the most dangerous members of society. They trifle with the best affections of our nature, and violate the most sacred obligations.
wisdom.author: George Crabbe

wisdom.quote: Here�s my theory about meetings and life; the three things you can�t fake are erections, competence and creativity. That�s why meetings become toxic they put uncreative people in a situation in which they have to be something they can never be. And the more effort they put into concealing their inabilities, the more toxic the meeting becomes. One of the most common creativity-faking tactics is when someone puts their hands in prayer position and conceals their mouth while they nod at you and say, 'Mmmmmm. Interesting.' If pressed, they�ll add, 'I�ll have to get back to you on that.' Then they don�t say anything else.
wisdom.author: Douglas Coupland

wisdom.quote: Don't expect to build up the weak by pulling down the strong.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: In a republic the first rule for the guidance of the citizen is obedience of the law.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: Never go out to meet trouble. If you will just sit still, nine cases out of ten someone will intercept it before it reaches you.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor is the reward for what he gave.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: Nothing in the world can take the place of Persistence.  Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent.  Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb.  Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts.  Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan 'Press On' has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: The things I never say never get me into trouble.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: There is no right to strike against the public safety by anybody, anywhere, any time.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge, in a telegram, 1919

wisdom.quote: The chief business of the American people is business.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge, Speech in Washington, Jan. 17, 1925

wisdom.quote: Prosperity is only an instrument to be used, not a deity to be worshipped.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge, speech, June 11, 1928

wisdom.quote: We immediately become more effective when we decide to change ourselves rather than asking things to change for us.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey

wisdom.quote: One of the most important ways to manifest integrity is to be loyal to those who are not present. In doing so, we build the trust of those who are present.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey, 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

wisdom.quote: Seek first to understand, and then to be understood.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey, 7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens

wisdom.quote: If there is no gardener there is no garden.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey, First things First

wisdom.quote: The way we see the problem is the problem.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

wisdom.quote: Leadership is communicating to people their worth and potential so clearly that they come to see it in themselves.
wisdom.author: Stephen Covey, the 8th habit

wisdom.quote: Somewhere deep down we know that in the final analysis, we do decide things and that even our decisions to let someone else decide are really our decisions, however pusillanimous.
wisdom.author: Harvey Cox, On Not Leaving It to the Snake

wisdom.quote: Somewhere deep down we know that in the final analysis we do decide things and that even our decisions to let someone else decide are really our decisions, however pusillanimous.
wisdom.author: Harvey Cox, On Not Leaving It to the Snake, 1967

wisdom.quote: Historically, the claim of consensus has been the first refuge of scoundrels; it is a way to avoid debate by claiming that the matter is already settled.
wisdom.author: Michael Crichton, Caltech Michelin Lecture, January 17, 2003

wisdom.quote: The belief that there are other life forms in the universe is a matter of faith. There is not a single shred of evidence for any other life forms, and in forty years of searching, none has been discovered. There is absolutely no evidentiary reason to maintain this belief.
wisdom.author: Michael Crichton, Caltech Michelin Lecture, January 17, 2003

wisdom.quote: Whenever you hear the consensus of scientists agrees on something or other, reach for your wallet, because you're being had.
wisdom.author: Michael Crichton, Caltech Michelin Lecture, January 17, 2003

wisdom.quote: I am certain there is too much certainty in the world.
wisdom.author: Michael Crichton, State of Fear

wisdom.quote: A prose writer gets tired of writing prose, and wants to be a poet. So he begins every line with a capital letter, and keeps on writing prose.
wisdom.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

wisdom.quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection, the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
wisdom.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

wisdom.quote: The trouble with facts is that there are so many of them.
wisdom.author: Samuel McChord Crothers, The Gentle Reader

wisdom.quote: The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.
wisdom.author: Amanda Cross

wisdom.quote: It's not having what you want It's wanting what you've got.
wisdom.author: Sheryl Crow, Soak Up The Sun

wisdom.quote: If the automobile had followed the same development cycle as the computer, a Rolls-Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year, killing everyone inside.
wisdom.author: Robert X. Cringely, InfoWorld magazine

wisdom.quote: I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
wisdom.author: Roy Croft

wisdom.quote: Women need a reason to have sex. Men just need a place.
wisdom.author: Billy Crystal

wisdom.quote: I beseech you, in the bowels of Christ, think it possible you may be mistaken.
wisdom.author: Oliver Cromwell

wisdom.quote: "Do what thou wilt" shall be the whole of the law.
wisdom.author: Aleister Crowley

wisdom.quote: I slept with faith and found a corpse in my arms on awakening; I drank and danced all night with doubt and found her a virgin in the morning.
wisdom.author: Aleister Crowley

wisdom.quote: The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from within, not without. Inevitably anyone with an independent mind must become "one who resists or opposes authority or established conventions": a rebel. If enough people come to agree with, and follow, the Rebel, we now have a Devil. Until, of course, still more people agree. And then, finally, we have --- Greatness.
wisdom.author: Aleister Crowley

wisdom.quote: To read a newspaper is to refrain from reading something worthwhile.  The first discipline of education must therefore be to refuse resolutely to feed the mind with canned chatter.
wisdom.author: Aleister Crowley

wisdom.quote: When you go into court you are putting your fate into the hands of twelve people who weren't smart enough to get out of jury duty.
wisdom.author: Norm Crosby

wisdom.quote: Art forms of the past were really considered elitist. Bach did not compose for the masses, neither did Beethoven. It was always for patrons, aristocrats, and royalty. Now we have a sort of democratic version of that, which is to say that the audience is so splintered in its interests.
wisdom.author: David Cronenberg, Rocketboom, 07-19-06

wisdom.quote: The idea of a mass audience was really an invention of the Industrial Revolution.
wisdom.author: David Cronenberg, Rocketboom, 07-19-06

wisdom.quote: The strongest possible piece of advice I would give any young woman is: Don't screw around, and don't smoke.
wisdom.author: Edwina Currie, in Observer, 1988

wisdom.quote: It is better to wear out than to rust out.
wisdom.author: Bishop Richard Cumberland

wisdom.quote: A good book has no ending.
wisdom.author: R. D. Cumming

wisdom.quote: There are two kinds of men who never amount to much: those who cannot do what they are told and those who can do nothing else.
wisdom.author: Cyrus H. Curtis

wisdom.quote: Yes, God and the politicians willing, the United States can declare peace upon the world, and win it.
wisdom.author: Ely Culbertson, Must We Fight Russia, chapter 5, 1946

wisdom.quote: Flowers are words even a baby can understand.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: Health consists of having the same diseases as one's neighbors.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: If at first you don't succeed, failure may be your style.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: My mother protected me from the world and my father threatened me with it.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: Never keep up with the Joneses. Drag them down to your level.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: The very purpose of existence is to reconcile the glowing opinion we have of ourselves with the appalling things that other people think about us.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: To know all is not to forgive all. It is to despise everybody.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: Treat all disasters as if they were trivialities but never treat a triviality as if it were a disaster.
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: When I told the people of Northern Ireland that I was an atheist, a woman in the audience stood up and said, "Yes, but is it the God of the Catholics or the God of the Protestants in whom you don't believe?"
wisdom.author: Quentin Crisp

wisdom.quote: I think wholeness comes from living your life consciously during the day and then exploring your inner life or unconscious at night.
wisdom.author: Margery Cuyler

wisdom.quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
wisdom.author: Will Cuppy

wisdom.quote: Women are the only oppressed group in our society that lives in intimate association with their opressors.
wisdom.author: Evelyn Cunningham

wisdom.quote: When the bold branches Bid farewell to rainbow leaves - Welcome wool sweaters.
wisdom.author: B. Cybrill

wisdom.quote: A joyful life is an individual creation that cannot be copied from a recipe.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: A person who forgoes the use of his symbolic skills is never really free.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: A self that is only differentiated - not integrated - may attain great individual accomplishments, but risks being mired in self-centered egotism. By the same token, a person who self is based exclusively on integration will be well connected and secure, but lack autonomous individuality. Only when a person invests equal amounts of psychic energy in these two processes and avoids both selfishness and conformity is the self likely to relect complexity.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: As long as we respond predictably to what feels good and what feels bad, it is easy for others to exploit our preferences for their own ends.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: Entropy is the normal state of consciousness - a condition that is neither useful nor enjoyable.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: It does not seem to be true that work necessarily needs to be unpleasant. It may always have to be hard, or at least harder than doing nothing at all. But there is ample evidence that work can be enjoyable, and that indeed, it is often the most enjoyable part of life.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: It is how people respond to stress that determines whether they will profit from misfortune or be miserable.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: People who learn to control inner experience will be able to determine the quality of their lives, which is as close as any of us can come to being happy.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: People without an internalized symbolic system can all too easily become captives of the media.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: Pleasure is an important component of the quality of life, but by itself it does not bring happiness. Pleasure helps to maintain order, but by itself cannot create a new order in consciousness.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: Repression is not the way to virtue. When people restrain themselves out of fear, their lives are by necessity diminished. Only through freely chosen discipline can life be enjoyed and still kept within the bounds of reason.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: The solution is to gradually become free of societal rewards and learn how to substitute for them rewards that are under one's own powers. This is not to say that we should abandon every goal endorsed by society; rather, it means that, in addition to or instead of the goals others use to bribe us with, we develop a set of our own.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: There are two main strategies we can adopt to improve the quality of life. The first is to try making external conditions match our goals. The second is to change how we experience external conditions to make them fit our goals better.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: Those who seek consolation in existing churches often pay for their peace of mind with a tacit agreement to ignore a great deal of what is known about the way the world works.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: We cannot deny the facts of nature, but we should certainly try to improve on them.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: Without the capacity to provide its own information, the mind drifts into randomness.
wisdom.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, 1990

wisdom.quote: (i do not know what it is about you that closes and opens; only something in me understands the voice of your eyes is deeper than all roses) nobody, not even the rain, has such small hands
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: Life's not a paragraph And death i think is no parenthesis
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: Listen; there's a hell of a good universe next door: let's go.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: To be nobody-but-yourself -- in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else -- means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.
wisdom.author: e e cummings

wisdom.quote: The only man, woman, or child who ever wrote a simple declarative sentence with seven grammatical errors is dead.
wisdom.author: e e cummings, on the death of Warren G. Harding, 1923

wisdom.quote: To destroy is always the first step in any creation.
wisdom.author: e e Cummings, Selected Letters, 1955

wisdom.quote: I am among those who think that science has great beauty. A scientist in his laboratory is not only a technician: he is also a child placed before natural phenomena which impress him like a fairy tale.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie

wisdom.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie

wisdom.quote: There are sadistic scientists who hurry to hunt down errors instead of establishing the truth.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie

wisdom.quote: You cannot hope to build a better world without improving the individuals. To that end each of us must work for his own improvement, and at the same time share a general responsibility for all humanity, our particular duty being to aid those to whom we think we can be most useful.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie

wisdom.quote: We must not forget that when radium was discovered no one knew that it would prove useful in hospitals. The work was one of pure science. And this is a proof that scientific work must not be considered from the point of view of the direct usefulness of it. It must be done for itself, for the beauty of science, and then there is always the chance that a scientific discovery may become like the radium a benefit for humanity.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie, Lecture at Vassar College, May 14, 1921

wisdom.quote: One never notices what has been done; one can only see what remains to be done.
wisdom.author: Marie Curie, letter to her brother, 1894

wisdom.quote: If newspapers are useful in overthrowing tyrants, it is only to establish a tyranny of their own.
wisdom.author: James Fenimore Cooper

wisdom.quote: The tendencies of democracies are, in all things, to mediocrity, since the tastes, knowledge and principles of the majority form the tribunal of the appeal.
wisdom.author: James Fenimore Cooper

wisdom.quote: How easy it is for generous sentiments, high courtesy, and chivalrous courage to lose their influence beneath the chilling blight of selfishness, and to exhibit to the world a man who was great in all the minor attributes of character, but who was found wanting when it became necessary to prove how much principle is superior to policy.
wisdom.author: James Fenimore Cooper, The Last of the Mohicans, 1826

wisdom.quote: Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Everything has its beauty but not everyone sees it.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: He who will not economize will have to agonize.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon and star.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Men's natures are alike, it is their habits that carry them far apart.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in getting up every time we do.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Study the past if you would define the future.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: The superior man, when resting in safety, does not forget that danger may come. When in a state of security he does not forget the possibility of ruin. When all is orderly, he does not forget that disorder may come. Thus his person is not endangered, and his States and all their clans are preserved.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: To be able under all circumstances to practice five things constitutes perfect virtue; these five things are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness and kindness.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: To see what is right, and not to do it, is want of courage or of principle.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: The more alternatives, the more difficult the choice.
wisdom.author: Abbe' D'Allanival

wisdom.quote: America is the greatest, freest and most decent society in existence. It is an oasis of goodness in a desert of cynicism and barbarism. This country, once an experiment unique in the world, is now the last best hope for the world.
wisdom.author: Dinesh D'Souza

wisdom.quote: And Charlie, don't forget about what happened to the man who suddenly got everything he ever wanted. He lived happily ever after.
wisdom.author: Roald Dahl, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

wisdom.quote: We have so much time and so little to do. Strike that, reverse it.
wisdom.author: Roald Dahl, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

wisdom.quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
wisdom.author: The Dalai Lama

wisdom.quote: Frugality without creativity is deprivation.
wisdom.author: Amy Dacyczyn

wisdom.quote: Ahhh. A man with a sharp wit. Someone ought to take it away from him before he cuts himself.
wisdom.author: Peter da Silva

wisdom.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
wisdom.author: Salvador Dali

wisdom.quote: There is only one difference between a madman and me. I am not mad.
wisdom.author: Salvador Dali

wisdom.quote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.
wisdom.author: Salvador Dali, from Dialogues with Marcel Duchamp, by Pierre Cabanne, 1987, pp. 13-14

wisdom.quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Inequality is the cause of all local movements.
wisdom.author: Leonardo Da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Nature is full of infinite causes that have never occurred in experience.
wisdom.author: Leonardo Da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Patience serves as a protection against wrongs as clothes do against cold. For if you put on more clothes as the cold increases, it will have no power to hurt you. So in like manner you must grow in patience when you meet with great wrongs, and they will then be powerless to vex your mind.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci

wisdom.quote: You do ill if you praise, but worse if you censure, what you do not understand.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Intellectual passion dries out sensuality.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci, The Notebooks

wisdom.quote: Iron rusts from disuse; stagnant water loses its purity and in cold weather becomes frozen; even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci, The Notebooks

wisdom.quote: Supreme happiness will be the greatest cause of misery, and the perfection of wisdom the occassion of folly.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci, The notebooks of Leonardo DaVinci by Macurdy

wisdom.quote: The law of liberty tends to abolish the reign of race over race, of faith over faith, of class over class. It is not the realization of a political ideal; it is the discharge of a moral obligation.
wisdom.author: John Dalberg

wisdom.quote: It is the creative potential itself in human beings that is the image of God.
wisdom.author: Mary Daly

wisdom.quote: Each person has an ideal, a hope, a dream which represents the soul. We must give to it the warmth of love, the light of understanding and the essence of encouragement.
wisdom.author: Colby Dorr Dam

wisdom.quote: Fight for your opinions, but do not believe that they contain the whole truth, or the only truth.
wisdom.author: Charles A. Dana

wisdom.quote: Get all the fools on your side and you can be elected to anything.
wisdom.author: Frank Dane

wisdom.quote: Do not condemn the judgement of another because it differs from your own. You may both be wrong.
wisdom.author: Dandemis

wisdom.quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.
wisdom.author: Charles Darwin

wisdom.quote: The highest possible stage in moral culture is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
wisdom.author: Charles Darwin

wisdom.quote: We must, however, acknowledge as it seems to me, that a man with all his noble qualities...still bears in his bodily frame the indelible stamp of his lowly origin.
wisdom.author: Charles Darwin

wisdom.quote: In science the credit goes to the man who convinces the world, not the man to whom the idea first occurs.
wisdom.author: Sir Francis Darwin, Eugenics Review, April 1914

wisdom.quote: Every day holds the possibility of a miracle.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth David

wisdom.quote: May I forget what ought to be forgotten; and recall, unfailing, all that ought to be recalled, each kindly thing, forgetting what might sting.
wisdom.author: Mary Caroline Davies

wisdom.quote: Applause, mingled with boos and hisses, is about all that the average voter is able or willing to contribute to public life.
wisdom.author: Elmer Davis

wisdom.quote: The first and great commandment is: Don't let them scare you.
wisdom.author: Elmer Davis

wisdom.quote: Nice guys finish last, but we get to sleep in.
wisdom.author: Evan Davis

wisdom.quote: Someday we'll look back on this moment and plow into a parked car.
wisdom.author: Evan Davis

wisdom.quote: As I see it, every day you do one of two things: build health or produce disease in yourself.
wisdom.author: Adelle Davis

wisdom.quote: Eat breakfast like a king, lunch like a prince, and dinner like a pauper.
wisdom.author: Adelle Davis

wisdom.quote: We are indeed much more than what we eat, but what we eat can nevertheless help us to be much more than what we are.
wisdom.author: Adelle Davis

wisdom.quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for the truth; and truth rewarded me.
wisdom.author: Simone de Beauvoir

wisdom.quote: It is in the knowledge of the genuine conditions of our lives that we must draw our strength to live and our reasons for living.
wisdom.author: Simone de Beauvoir

wisdom.quote: One is not born a genius, one becomes a genius.
wisdom.author: Simone de Beauvoir

wisdom.quote: One is not born a woman, one becomes one.
wisdom.author: Simone de Beauvoir

wisdom.quote: That's what I consider true generosity. You give your all, and yet you always feel as if it costs you nothing.
wisdom.author: Simone de Beauvoir

wisdom.quote: Gifts allow us to demonstrate exactly how little we know about a person. And nothing pisses a person off more than being shoved into the wrong pigeonhole.
wisdom.author: Pam Davis, House M.D., It's A Wonderful Lie, 2008

wisdom.quote: Lies are like children: they're hard work, but it's worth it because the future depends on them.
wisdom.author: Pam Davis, House M.D., It's A Wonderful Lie, 2008

wisdom.quote: The notion of picking one time of year to be decent to other people is obscene because it's actually validating the notion of being miserable wretches the rest of the year.
wisdom.author: Pam Davis, House M.D., It's A Wonderful Lie, 2008

wisdom.quote: [Sleep is] the golden chain that ties health and our bodies together.
wisdom.author: Thomas Dekker

wisdom.quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
wisdom.author: Edward De Bono

wisdom.quote: I have long since come to believe that people never mean half of what they say, and that it is best to disregard their talk and judge only their actions.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Day, The Long Loneliness, 1952

wisdom.quote: Never be haughty to the humble; never be humble to the haughty.
wisdom.author: Jefferson Davis

wisdom.quote: My future starts when I wake up every morning... Every day I find something creative to do with my life.
wisdom.author: Miles Davis

wisdom.quote: If you want to make peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
wisdom.author: Moshe Dayan

wisdom.quote: A girl phoned me the other day and said "Come on over, there's nobody home." I went over. Nobody was home.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: I told my psychiatrist that everyone hates me. He said I was being ridiculous - everyone hasn't met me yet.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: I went to a fight the other night, and a hockey game broke out.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: Life is just a bowl of pits.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: My wife and I were happy for twenty years. Then we met.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: My wife is always trying to get rid of me. The other day she told me to put the garbage out. I said to her I already did. She told me to go and keep an eye on it.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: My wife's jealousy is getting ridiculous. The other day she looked at my calendar and wanted to know who May was.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: When I was a kid my parents moved a lot, but I always found them.
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: When I was born the doctor took one look at my face, turned me over and said, Look ... twins!
wisdom.author: Rodney Dangerfield

wisdom.quote: I've never known any trouble that an hour's reading didn't assuage.
wisdom.author: Charles De Secondat

wisdom.quote: When great changes occur in history, when great principles are involved, as a rule the majority are wrong.
wisdom.author: Eugene V. Debs

wisdom.quote: Ignorance of certain subjects is a great part of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Hugo De Groot

wisdom.quote: At twenty a man is full of fight and hope. He wants to reform the world. When he is seventy he still wants to reform the world, but he knows he can't.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: Chase after truth like hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat-tails.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: Even if you do learn to speak correct English, whom are you going to speak it to?
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: History repeats itself. That's one of the things wrong with history.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: I am a friend of the working man, and I would rather be his friend, than be one.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: I am an agnostic; I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: Just think of the tragedy of teaching children not to doubt.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: Physical deformity, calls forth our charity. But the infinite misfortune of moral deformity calls forth nothing but hatred and vengeance.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents, and the second half by our children.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President. Now I'm beginning to believe it.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.quote: You can only protect your liberties in this world by protecting the other man's freedom. You can only be free if I am free.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow, Address to the jury, trial of Communists, Chicago, Illinois, 1920

wisdom.quote: I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with a lot of pleasure.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow, Medley

wisdom.quote: A child is the root of the heart.
wisdom.author: Maria de Jesus

wisdom.quote: Living is a form of not being sure, not knowing what next or how�We guess. We may be wrong, but we take leap after leap in the dark.
wisdom.author: Agnes de Mille

wisdom.quote: No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made. Destiny is made known silently.
wisdom.author: Agnes de Mille

wisdom.quote: Put up with it and you will get more of it.
wisdom.author: Lynne Deal

wisdom.quote: How you treat others is a direct reflection of how you feel about yourself.
wisdom.author: Amber Deckers, Ella Mental and the Good Sense Guide

wisdom.quote: Never let the fear of failure be an excuse for not trying. Society tells us that to fail is the most terrible thing in the world, but I know it isn't. Failure is part of what makes us human.
wisdom.author: Amber Deckers, Ella Mental and the Good Sense Guide

wisdom.quote: Never regret something that once made you smile.
wisdom.author: Amber Deckers, Ella Mental and the Good Sense Guide

wisdom.quote: Love is not enough. It must be the foundation, the cornerstone - but not the complete structure. It is much too pliable, too yielding.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis

wisdom.quote: This became a credo of mine...attempt the impossible in order to improve your work.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis

wisdom.quote: I am doomed to an eternity of compulsive work. No set goal achieved satisfies. Success only breeds a new goal. The golden apple devoured has seeds. It is endless.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: I do not regret one professional enemy I have made. Any actor who doesn't dare to make an enemy should get out of the business.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: I was thought to be 'stuck up.' I wasn't. I was just sure of myself. This is and always has been an unforgivable quality to the unsure.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: It has been my experience that one cannot, in any shape or form, depend on human relations for lasting reward. It is only work that truly satisfies.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: My passions were all gathered together like fingers that made a fist. Drive is considered aggression today; I knew it then as purpose.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: There are new words now that excuse everybody. Give me the good old days of heroes and villains. the people you can bravo or hiss. There was a truth to them that all the slick credulity of today cannot touch.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: To fulfill a dream, to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor, to be given the chance to create, is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy. As everyone else, I love to dunk my crust in it. But alone, it is not a diet designed to keep body and soul together.
wisdom.author: Bette Davis, The Lonely Life, 1962

wisdom.quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it.
wisdom.author: Doris Day

wisdom.quote: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within - strength, courage, dignity.
wisdom.author: Ruby Dee

wisdom.quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
wisdom.author: Edgar Degas

wisdom.quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
wisdom.author: Eugene Delacroix

wisdom.quote: I live in company with a body, a silent companion, exacting and eternal.
wisdom.author: Eugene Delacroix

wisdom.quote: What makes men of genius, or rather, what they make, is not new ideas, it is that idea - possessing them - that what has been said has still not been said enough.
wisdom.author: Eugene Delacroix

wisdom.quote: One must desire something to be alive.
wisdom.author: Margaret Deland, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: That is not what Geek means to me. We are more than the hobbies that we do or the things that we like. To me, Geek means an outsider, a rebel, a dreamer, a creator, a fighter. It's a person who dares to love something that isn't conventional.
wisdom.author: Felicia Day, Geek and Sundry, State of the Sundry, 03-25-13

wisdom.quote: Now I understand what exhaustion is. It�s not just a code word for heroin addiction. People don�t teach you how to handle the workload that comes from a little bit of success, and it�s something I�d never had to handle, because I�d been rejected for so long.
wisdom.author: Felicia Day, The Washington Post, 04-03-12

wisdom.quote: Modesty is the citadel of beauty.
wisdom.author: Demades

wisdom.quote: Fate chooses your relations, you choose your friends.
wisdom.author: Jacques Delille

wisdom.quote: Golf and sex are about the only things you can enjoy without being good at.
wisdom.author: Jimmy Demaret

wisdom.quote: We seem to believe it is possible to ward off death by following rules of good grooming.
wisdom.author: Don Delillo

wisdom.quote: The cure for writer's cramp is writer's block.
wisdom.author: Inigo DeLeon

wisdom.quote: Idleness is not doing nothing. Idleness is being free to do anything.
wisdom.author: Floyd Dell

wisdom.quote: There is no human reason why a child should not admire and emulate his teacher's ability to do sums, rather than the village bum's ability to whittle sticks and smoke cigarettes. The reason why the child does not is plain enough - the bum has put himself on an equality with him and the teacher has not.
wisdom.author: Floyd Dell

wisdom.quote: Beware the flatterer: he feeds you with an empty spoon.
wisdom.author: Cosino DeGregrio

wisdom.quote: Learning is not compulsory... neither is survival.
wisdom.author: W. Edwards Deming

wisdom.quote: The beauty of a statue is in its outward form; of a man in his conduct.
wisdom.author: Demophilus

wisdom.quote: There is no nonsense so gross that society will not, at some time, make a doctrine of it and defend it with every weapon of communal stupidity.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: Every man is wise when attacked by a mad dog; fewer when pursued by a mad woman; only the wisest survive when attacked by a mad notion.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: Few people can see genius in someone who has offended them.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: Many a promising career has been wrecked by marrying the wrong sort of woman. The right sort of woman can distinguish between Creative Lassitude and plain shiftlessness.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: Never harbor grudges; they sour your stomach and do no harm to anyone else.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: The love of truth lies at the root of much humor.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: The people of the United States, perhaps more than any other nation in history, love to abase themselves and proclaim their unworthiness, and seem to find refreshment in doing so... That is a dark frivolity, but still frivolity.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies

wisdom.quote: The world is full of people whose notion of a satisfactory future is, in fact, a return to the idealised past.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies, "A Voice from the Attic", 1960

wisdom.quote: He was a genius - that is to say, a man who does superlatively and without obvious effort something that most people cannot do by the uttermost exertion of their abilities.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies, "Fifth Business"

wisdom.quote: To be a book-collector is to combine the worst characteristics of a dope fiend with those of a miser.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies, "The Table Talk of Samuel Marchbanks"

wisdom.quote: A happy childhood has spoiled many a promising life.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies, "What's Bred in the Bone"

wisdom.quote: I object to being told that I am saving daylight when my reason tells me that I am doing nothing of the kind... At the back of the Daylight Saving scheme, I detect the bony, blue-fingered hand of Puritanism, eager to push people into bed earlier, and get them up earlier, to make them healthy, wealthy, and wise in spite of themselves.
wisdom.author: Robertson Davies, The Diary of Samuel Marchbanks, 1947

wisdom.quote: Creativity is a drug I cannot live without.
wisdom.author: Cecil B. DeMille

wisdom.quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who see his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
wisdom.author: Cecil B. DeMille

wisdom.quote: The key to non-anxious sermon-writing is that it�s not about me. It�s about the congregation. I honor the fact that the listeners bring more to the sermon than I do. I remind myself of the hundreds of times someone says, 'I loved how you said�' and then tell me things that they heard that were nowhere in my text and that I never said. But they heard what they needed to hear.
wisdom.author: Reverend Sean Parker Dennison, Ministrare, 04-07-2006

wisdom.quote: The ability to see beauty is the beginning of our moral sensibility. What we believe is beautiful we will not wantonly destroy.
wisdom.author: Reverend Sean Parker Dennison, Ministrare, 2-10-05

wisdom.quote: Nature is not cruel, pitiless, indifferent. This is one of the hardest lessons for humans to learn. We cannot admit that things might be neither good nor evil, neither cruel nor kind, but simply callous -- indifferent to all suffering, lacking all purpose.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins

wisdom.quote: The theory of evolution by cumulative natural selection is the only theory we know of that is in principle capable of explaining the existence of organized complexity.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins

wisdom.quote: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakeable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins, "The Root of All Evil", Channel 4 UK, 2006

wisdom.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that societies have ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins, "The Root of All Evil", UK Channel 4, 2006

wisdom.quote: They are in you and me; they created us, body and mind; and their preservation is the ultimate rationale for our existence. They have come a long way, those replicators. Now they go by the name of genes, and we are their survival machines.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins, The Selfish Gene

wisdom.quote: Let us understand Darwinism so we can walk in the opposite direction when it comes to setting up society.
wisdom.author: Richard Dawkins, The Washington Post Magazine

wisdom.quote: To pretend, I actually do the thing: I have therefore only pretended to pretend.
wisdom.author: Jacques Derrida

wisdom.quote: But psychoanalysis has taught that the dead�a dead parent, for example�can be more alive for us, more powerful, more scary, than the living. It is the question of ghosts.
wisdom.author: Jacques Derrida, Quoted in New York Times, January 23, 1994

wisdom.quote: I believe that professional wrestling is clean and everything else in the world is fixed.
wisdom.author: Frank Deford

wisdom.quote: When you are obliged to make a statement that you know will cause displeasure, you must say it with every appearance of sincerity; this is the only way to make it palatable.
wisdom.author: Paul De Gondi

wisdom.quote: Dreaming permits each and every one of us to be quietly and safely insane every night of our lives.
wisdom.author: William Dement, in Newsweek, 1959

wisdom.quote: Confession is good for the soul only in the sense that a tweed coat is good for dandruff - it is a palliative rather than a remedy.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: Everybody hates me because I'm so universally liked.
wisdom.author: Peter de Vries

wisdom.quote: I love being a writer. What I can't stand is the paperwork.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: Life is a zoo in a jungle.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: My father hated radio and could not wait for television to be invented so he could hate that too.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: Nostalgia isn't what it used to be.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: The murals in restaurants are on par with the food in museums.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: There are times when parenthood seems nothing but feeding the mouth that bites you.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: We all learn by experience but some of us have to go to summer school.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: When I can no longer bear to think of the victims of broken homes, I begin to think of the victims of intact ones.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries

wisdom.quote: It is the final proof of God's omnipotence that he need not exist in order to save us.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries, "The Mackerel Plaza," 1958

wisdom.quote: I wanted to be bored to death, as good a way to go as any.
wisdom.author: Peter De Vries, Comfort me with Apples (1956)

wisdom.quote: The tree of life is self pruning.
wisdom.author: Joel Determan, Darwin Awards

wisdom.quote: I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
wisdom.author: Charles De Gaulle

wisdom.quote: Since a politician never believes what he says, he is quite surprised to be taken at his word.
wisdom.author: Charles De Gaulle

wisdom.quote: The graveyards are full of indispensable men.
wisdom.author: Charles de Gaulle

wisdom.quote: We may go to the moon, but that's not very far. The greatest distance we have to cover still lies within us.
wisdom.author: Charles de Gaulle

wisdom.quote: How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?
wisdom.author: Charles De Gaulle, in "Les Mots du General", 1962

wisdom.quote: Deliberation is the function of the many; action is the function of one.
wisdom.author: Charles de Gaulle, War Memoirs, 1960

wisdom.quote: All speech is vain and empty unless it be accompanied by action.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: Beware lest in your anxiety to avoid war you obtain a master.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: He who confers a favor should at once forget it, if he is not to show a sordid ungenerous spirit. To remind a man of a kindness conferred and to talk of it, is little different from reproach.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: The easiest thing of all is to deceive one's self; for what a man wishes he generally believes to be true.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: The fact speak for themselves.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: The man who has received a benefit ought always to remember it, but he who has granted it ought to forget the fact at once.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes

wisdom.quote: Every advantage in the past is judged in the light of the final issue.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes, First Olynthiac

wisdom.quote: There is a great deal of wishful thinking in such cases; it is the easiest thing of all to deceive one�s self.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes, Olynthiac

wisdom.quote: Nothing is easier than self-deceit. For what each man wishes, that he also believes to be true.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes, Third Olynthiac

wisdom.quote: You cannot have a proud and chivalrous spirit if your conduct is mean and paltry; for whatever a man's actions are, such must be his spirit.
wisdom.author: Demosthenes, Third Olynthiac

wisdom.quote: Cogito ergo sum. (I think; therefore I am.)
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: In order to improve the mind, we ought less to learn, than to contemplate.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: The reading of all good books is indeed like a conversation with the noblest men of past centuries who were the authors of them, nay a carefully studied conversation, in which they reveal to us none but the best of their thoughts.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind. The main thing is to use it well.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes, 'Le Discours de la Methode,' 1637

wisdom.quote: One cannot conceive anything so strange and so implausible that it has not already been said by one philosopher or another.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes, 'Le Discours de la Methode,' 1637

wisdom.quote: The first precept was never to accept a thing as true until I knew it as such without a single doubt.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes, 'Le Discours de la Methode,' 1637

wisdom.quote: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes, 'Le Discours de la Methode,' 1637

wisdom.quote: It is only prudent never to place complete confidence in that by which we have even once been deceived.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes, 'Meditations'

wisdom.quote: Don't give advice. It will come back and bite you in the [butt]. Don't take anyone's advice. So, my advice to you is to be true to yourself and everything will be fine.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: Follow your passion. Stay true to yourself. Never follow someone else's path unless you're in the woods and you're lost and you see a path. By all means, you should follow that.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: I didn't go to college at all, any college, and I'm not saying you wasted your time or money, but look at me, I'm a huge celebrity.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: Life is like one big Mardi Gras. But instead of showing your boobs, show people your brain, and if they like what they'll, you'll have more beads than you know what to do with.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: Some of the most devastating things that happen to you will teach you the most.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: When I was younger I thought success was something different. I thought, " When I grow up, I want to be famous. I want to be a star. I want to be in movies. When I grow up I want to see the world, drive nice cars. I want to have groupies." But my idea of success is different today. For me, the most important thing in your life is to live your life with integrity and not to give into peer pressure, to try to be something that you're not. To live your life as an honest and compassionate person. To contribute in some way.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Tulane Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: You have to have funny faces and words, you can't just have words. It is a powerful thing, and I think that's why it's hard for people to imagine that women can do that, be that powerful.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, US Magazine, January 1995

wisdom.quote: For me, it's that I contributed, ... That I'm on this planet doing some good and making people happy. That's to me the most important thing, that my hour of television is positive and upbeat and an antidote for all the negative stuff going on in life.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: I don't understand the sizes anymore. There's a size zero, which I didn't even know that they had. It must stand for: 'Ohhh my God, you're thin.'
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: I gotta work out. I keep saying it all the time. I keep saying I gotta start working out. It's been about two months since I've worked out. And I just don't have the time. Which uh..is odd. Because I have the time to go out to dinner. And uh..and watch tv. And get a bone density test. And uh.. try to figure out what my phone number spells in words.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: I was coming home from kindergarten--well they told me it was kindergarten. I found out later I had been working in a factory for ten years. It's good for a kid to know how to make gloves.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: I was in yoga the other day. I was in full lotus position. My chakras were all aligned. My mind is cleared of all clatter and I'm looking out of my third eye and everything that I'm supposed to be doing. It's amazing what comes up, when you sit in that silence. 'Mama keeps whites bright like the sunlight, Mama's got the magic of Clorox 2.'
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the hell she is.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: Procrastination isn't the problem, it's the solution. So procrastinate now, don't put it off.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: Sometimes you can't see yourself clearly until you see yourself through the eyes of others.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: Stuffed deer heads on walls are bad enough, but it's worse when they are wearing dark glasses and have streamers in their antlers because then you know they were enjoying themselves at a party when they were shot.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: The only thing that scares me more than space aliens is the idea that there aren't any space aliens. We can't be the best that creation has to offer. I pray we're not all there is. If so, we're in big trouble.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres

wisdom.quote: In the beginning there was nothing. God said, 'Let there be light!' And there was light. There was still nothing, but you could see it a whole lot better.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: They say you just stand over there, he'll say thank you and you walk back off and that's what I thought was gonna happen, but in my head, I had for five or six years known that he was gonna call me over.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Commenting on being called over to sit with Johnny Carson back in 1986

wisdom.quote: I don't need a baby growing inside me for nine months. For one thing, there's morning sickness. If I'm going to feel nauseous and achy when I wake up, I want to achieve that state the old fashioned way: getting good and drunk the night before.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, My Point and I Do Have One

wisdom.quote: I'm a godmother, that's a great thing to be, a godmother. She calls me god for short, that's cute, I taught her that.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, My Point and I Do Have One

wisdom.quote: Sometimes when I am driving I get so angry at inconsiderate drivers that I want to scream at them. But then I remember how insignificant that is, and I thank God that I have a car and my health and gas. That was phrased wrong - normally you wouldn't say, thank God I have gas.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, My Point and I Do Have One

wisdom.quote: The good psychic would pick up the phone before it rang. Of course it is possible there was noone on the other line. Once she said "God Bless you" I said, "I didn't sneeze" She looked deep into my eyes and said, "You will, eventually." And damn it if she wasn't right. Two days later I sneezed.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, My Point and I Do Have One

wisdom.quote: Really, he called me that? Ellen DeGenerate? I've been getting that since fourth grade. I guess I'm happy I could give him work.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, Newsweek, 04-97, regarding Jerry Falwell's comments

wisdom.quote: The way I see it... If you need both of your hands for whatever it is you're doing, then your brain should probably be in on it too.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, On Cell phones and driving

wisdom.quote: I have the worst memory ever so no matter who comes up to me - they're just, like, 'I can't believe you don't remember me!" I'm like, 'Oh Dad I'm sorry!'
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, on Oprah Winfrey 1995

wisdom.quote: What you look like on the outside is not what makes you cool at all. I mean, I had a mullet and wore parachute pants for a long, long time, and I'm doin' okay.
wisdom.author: Ellen DeGeneres, The Ellen Show, 05-17-13

wisdom.quote: Do not trust all men, but trust men of worth; the former course is silly, the latter a mark of prudence.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: I would rather discover one scientific fact than become King of Persia.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: To gain that which is worth having, it may be necessary to lose everything else.
wisdom.author: Burnadette Devlin, The Price of My Soul, 1969

wisdom.quote: God loved the birds and invented trees. Man loved the birds and invented cages.
wisdom.author: Jacques Deval, Afin de vivre bel et bien

wisdom.quote: If one speaks or acts with a cruel mind, misery follows, as the cart follows the horse... If one speaks or acts with a pure mind, happiness follows, as a shadow follows its source.
wisdom.author: the Dhammapada

wisdom.quote: Travel only with thy equals or thy betters; if there are none, travel alone.
wisdom.author: The Dhammapada

wisdom.quote: A writer is a writer not because she writes well and easily, because she has amazing talent, because everything she does is golden. In my view, a writer is a writer because even when there is no hope, even when nothing you do shows any sign of promise, you keep writing anyway.
wisdom.author: Junot Diaz, O Magazine, November 2009

wisdom.quote: Don't need to say please to no man for a happy tune.
wisdom.author: Neil Diamond, Cracklin' Rose

wisdom.quote: Pride is the chief cause in the decline in the number of husbands and wives.
wisdom.author: Neil Diamond, Husbands and Wives

wisdom.quote: 'I am,' I said To no one there, And no one heard at all.
wisdom.author: Neil Diamond, I Am... I Said

wisdom.quote: I thought love was more or less a giving thing. Seems the more I gave, the less I got.
wisdom.author: Neil Diamond, I'm A Believer

wisdom.quote: Some are born who never need them, Others still who never read them, signs.
wisdom.author: Neil Diamond, Signs

wisdom.quote: Everybody lies, but it doesn't matter because nobody listens.
wisdom.author: Nick Diamos

wisdom.quote: I don't like composers who think. It gets in the way of their plagiarism.
wisdom.author: Howard Dietz

wisdom.quote: Luck, bad if not good, will always be with us. But it has a way of favoring the intelligent and showing its back to the stupid.
wisdom.author: John Dewey

wisdom.quote: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.
wisdom.author: John Dewey

wisdom.quote: There is no discipline in the world so severe as the discipline of experience subjected to the tests of intelligent development and direction.
wisdom.author: John Dewey

wisdom.quote: We can have facts without thinking but we cannot have thinking without facts.
wisdom.author: John Dewey

wisdom.quote: Always be nice to your children because they are the ones who will choose your rest home.
wisdom.author: Phyllis Diller

wisdom.quote: If it weren't for baseball, many kids wouldn't know what a millionaire looked like.
wisdom.author: Phyllis Diller

wisdom.quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
wisdom.author: Phyllis Diller

wisdom.quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
wisdom.author: E. W. Dijkstra

wisdom.quote: It is practically impossible to teach good programming style to students that have had prior exposure to BASIC; as potential programmers they are mentally mutilated beyond hope of regeneration.
wisdom.author: E. W. Dijkstra

wisdom.quote: The question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than the question of whether a submarine can swim.
wisdom.author: E. W. Dijkstra

wisdom.quote: The use of COBOL cripples the mind; its teaching should, therefore, be reguarded as a criminal offense.
wisdom.author: E. W. Dijkstra

wisdom.quote: The fathers of the field had been pretty confusing: John von Neumann speculated about computers and the human brain in analogies sufficiently wild to be worthy of a medieval thinker, and Alan Turing thought about criteria to settle the question of whether machines can think, a question of which we now know that it is about as relevant as the question of whether submarines can swim.
wisdom.author: E. W. Dijkstra, at the ACN South Central Regional Conference, Austin, Texas, 16 to 18 November 1984

wisdom.quote: Touch the earth, love the earth, honour the earth, her plains, her valleys, her hills, and her seas; rest your spirit in her solitary places.
wisdom.author: Ernest Dimnet

wisdom.quote: This life gets bitterly cold. Sometimes you just need to cling to the person that you can claw your way out of the dark with.
wisdom.author: Chris Dingess, Being Human, Wouldn't It Be Nice (If We Were Human), 2011

wisdom.quote: In science one tries to tell people, in such a way as to be understood by everyone, something that no one ever knew before. But in poetry, it's the exact opposite.
wisdom.author: Paul Dirac

wisdom.quote: A billion here, a billion there, pretty soon it adds up to real money.
wisdom.author: Senator Everett Dirksen

wisdom.quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to flexible at all times.
wisdom.author: Everett Mckinley Dirkson

wisdom.quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I've ever known.
wisdom.author: Walt Disney

wisdom.quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
wisdom.author: Walt Disney

wisdom.quote: I dream, I test my dreams against my beliefs, I dare to take risks, and I execute my vision to make those dreams come true.
wisdom.author: Walt Disney, The Disney Way

wisdom.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
wisdom.author: Philip K. Dick, "How to Build a Universe That Doesn't Fall Apart Two Days Later", 1978

wisdom.quote: The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use the words.
wisdom.author: Philip K. Dick, How To Build A Universe That Doesn't Fall Apart Two Days Later (1978)

wisdom.quote: So we and our elaborately evolving computers may meet each other halfway. Someday a human being, named perhaps Fred White, may shoot a robot named Pete Something-or-other, which has come out of a General Electric factory, and to his surprise see it weep and bleed. And the dying robot may shoot back and, to its surprise, see a wisp of gray smoke arise from the electric pump that it supposed was Mr. White's beating heart. It would be rather a great moment of truth for both of them.
wisdom.author: Philip K. Dick, The Shifting Realities of Phillip K. Dick

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the appropriate response to reality is to go insane.
wisdom.author: Philip K. Dick, Valis

wisdom.quote: Don't try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night.
wisdom.author: Philip K. Dick, What The Dead Men Say, 1964

wisdom.quote: I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking, what I'm looking at, what I see and what it means. What I want and what I fear.
wisdom.author: Joan Didion

wisdom.quote: Death be not proud, though some have called theeMighty and dreadfull, for thou art not so,For, those, whom thou thinkst, thou dost overthrow, die not, poor death, nor yet canst thou kill me.

wisdom.quote: No man is an Island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the Continent, a part of the main; if a clod be washed away by the sea, Europe is the less, as well as if a promontory were, as well as if a manor of thy friends or of thine own were; any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; It tolls for thee.

It will be almost as convenient to search for some bit of truth concealed in nature as it will be to find it hidden away in an immense multitude of bound volumes.

wisdom.quote: Almost everybody today believes that nothing in economic history has ever moved as fast as, or had a greater impact than, the Information Revolution. But the Industrial Revolution moved at least as fast in the same time span, and had probably an equal impact if not a greater one.

wisdom.quote: Business has only two basic functions-marketing and innovation.
