wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: In all recorded history there has not been one economist who has had to worry about where the next meal would come from.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Long-range planning does not deal with future decisions, but with the future of present decisions.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Management by objectives works if you first think through your objectives. Ninety percent of the time you haven't.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Quality in a product or service is not what the supplier puts in. It is what the customer gets out and is willing to pay for. A product is not quality because it is hard to make and costs a lot of money, as manufacturers typically believe. This is incompetence. Customers pay only for what is of use to them and gives them value. Nothing else constitutes quality.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: The computer is a moron.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: We know nothing about motivation. All we can of is write books about it.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: We now accept the fact that learning is a lifelong process of keeping abreast of change. And the most pressing task is to teach people how to learn.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: When a subject becomes totally obsolete we make it a required course.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Whenever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker

wisdom.quote: Innovation is the specific instrument of entrepreneurship... the act that endows resources with a new capacity to create wealth.
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker, Innovation and Entrepreneurship, 1985

wisdom.quote: "Management" means, in the last analysis, the substitution of thought for brawn and muscle, of knowledge for folklore and superstition, and of cooperation for force. . .
wisdom.author: Peter Drucker, People and Performance

wisdom.quote: Engineers are all basically high-functioning autistics who have no idea how normal people do stuff.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Eastern Standard Tribe, 2004

wisdom.quote: Abnormal is so common, it's practically normal.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Little Brother, 2008

wisdom.quote: Never underestimate the determination of a kid who is time rich and cash poor.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Little Brother, 2008

wisdom.quote: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Little Brother, 2008

wisdom.quote: All secrets are deep. All secrets become dark. That's in the nature of secrets.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Someone Comes To Town, Someone Leaves Town, 2005

wisdom.quote: It's not necessarily about what career you pick. It's about how you do what you do.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Someone Comes To Town, Someone Leaves Town, 2005

wisdom.quote: No one should do a job he can do in his sleep.
wisdom.author: Cory Doctorow, Someone Comes To Town, Someone Leaves Town, 2005

wisdom.quote: A husband is always a sensible man; he never thinks of marrying.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas

wisdom.quote: All generalizations are dangerous, even this one.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas

wisdom.quote: Business?  It's quite simple.  It's other people's money.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas

wisdom.quote: Rogues are preferable to imbeciles because they sometimes take a rest.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas

wisdom.quote: Until the day when God shall deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is summed up in these two words,--'Wait and hope'.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristo

wisdom.quote: An appeal is when you ask one court to show its contempt for another court.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: Don't jump on a man unless he's down.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: Most vegetarians look so much like the food they eat that they can be classified as cannibals.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: The past always looks better than it was. It's only pleasant because it isn't here.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: The past always looks better than it was; it's only pleasant because it isn't here.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: The Puritans gave thanks for being preserved from the Indians, and we give thanks for being preserved from the Puritans.
wisdom.author: Finley Peter Dunne

wisdom.quote: Our sins are more easily remembered than our good deeds.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: The pride of youth is in strength and beauty, the pride of old age is in discretion.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: Tis hard to fight with anger, but the prudent man keeps it under control.
wisdom.author: Democritus

wisdom.quote: Word is a shadow of a deed.
wisdom.author: Democritus, Fragment 145

wisdom.quote: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: A hundred years ago, the electric telegraph made possible - indeed, inevitable - the United States of America. The communications satellite will make equally inevitable a United Nations of Earth; let us hope that the transition period will not be equally bloody.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, First on the Moon, 1970

wisdom.quote: It may be that the old astrologers had the truth exactly reversed, when they believed that the stars controlled the destinies of men. The time may come when men control the destinies of stars.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, First on the Moon, 1970

wisdom.quote: The inspirational value of the space program is probably of far greater importance to education than any input of dollars... A whole generation is growing up which has been attracted to the hard disciplines of science and engineering by the romance of space.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, First on the Moon, 1970

wisdom.quote: If we have learned one thing from the history of invention and discovery, it is that, in the long run - and often in the short one - the most daring prophecies seem laughably conservative.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke, The Exploration of Space, 1951

wisdom.quote: She felt that she could so much more depend upon the sincerity of those who sometimes looked or said a careless or a hasty thing, than of those whose presence of mind never varied, whose tongue never slipped.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: The only time I ever really suffered in body or mind, the only time that I ever fancied myself unwell, or had any ideas of danger, was the winter that I passed by myself. As long as we could be together, nothing ever ailed me, and I never met with the smallest inconvenience.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: The stream is as good as at first; the little rubbish it collects in the turnings is easily moved away.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen, Persuasion, 1818

wisdom.quote: Think not disdainfully of death, but look on it with favor; for even death is one of the things that Nature wills.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: Whatever is in any way beautiful hath its source of beauty in itself, and is complete in itself; praise forms no part of it. So it is none the worse nor the better for being praised.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: You will find rest from vain fancies if you perform every act in life as though it were your last.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus, Meditations

wisdom.quote: What music is more enchanting than the voices of young people, when you can't hear what they say?
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

wisdom.quote: Baloney is the lie laid on so thick you hate it. Blarney is flattery laid on so thin you love it.
wisdom.author: Fulton J. Sheen

wisdom.quote: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare, And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.
wisdom.author: Ali ibn-Abi-Talib

wisdom.quote: Some people die at 25 and aren't buried until 75.
wisdom.author: Ben Franklin

wisdom.quote: There is no nature which is inferior to art, the arts imitate the nature of things.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

wisdom.quote: Consider that everything is opinion, and opinion is in thy power.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

wisdom.quote: Receive without conceit, release without struggle.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

wisdom.quote: Never judge a book by its movie.
wisdom.author: J. W. Eagan

wisdom.quote: When he was young, I told Dale Jr. that hunting and racing are a lot alike. Holding that steering wheel and holding that rifle both mean you better be responsible.
wisdom.author: Dale Earnhardt

wisdom.quote: Say little, and love much; give all; judge no man; aspire to all that is pure and good.
wisdom.author: White Eagle

wisdom.quote: Flying may not be all plain sailing, but the fun of it is worth the price.
wisdom.author: Amelia Earhart

wisdom.quote: Courage is the price that Life exacts for granting peace.
wisdom.author: Amelia Earhart, Courage, 1927

wisdom.quote: There's only one way to have a happy marriage and as soon as I learn what it is I'll get married again.
wisdom.author: Clint Eastwood

wisdom.quote: The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
wisdom.author: Isabelle Eberhardt

wisdom.quote: Be not slow to visit the sick.
wisdom.author: Ecclesiastes

wisdom.quote: Give not over thy soul to sorrow; and afflict not thyself in thy own counsel. Gladness of heart is the life of man and the joyfulness of man is length of days.
wisdom.author: Ecclesiastes

wisdom.quote: The moment a man stops dreaming is the moment he petrifies inside...
wisdom.author: Roger Ebert, Movie Reveiw of "American Beauty"

wisdom.quote: I know death is coming, and I do not fear it. I was perfectly content before I was born, and I think of death as the same state. I am grateful for the gifts of intelligence, love, wonder and laughter. You can't say it wasn't interesting.
wisdom.author: Roger Ebert, People Magazine, 09-19-11

wisdom.quote: What's sad about not eating is the experience, whether at a family reunion or at midnight by yourself in a greasy spoon under the L tracks. The loss of dining, not the loss of food.
wisdom.author: Roger Ebert, People Magazine, 09-19-11

wisdom.quote: Yes, I was fat, but I dealt with it by simply never thinking about it. It is useful, when you are fat, to have a lot of other things to think about.
wisdom.author: Roger Ebert, People Magazine, 09-19-11

wisdom.quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your whole life is "thank you," that would suffice.
wisdom.author: Meister Eckhart

wisdom.quote: In silence man can most readily preserve his integrity.
wisdom.author: Meister Eckhart

wisdom.quote: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
wisdom.author: Meister Eckhart

wisdom.quote: History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.
wisdom.author: Abba Eban

wisdom.quote: Tragedy is the difference between what is and what could have been.
wisdom.author: Abba Eban

wisdom.quote: I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
wisdom.author: Umberto Eco

wisdom.quote: I felt like poisoning a monk.
wisdom.author: Umberto Eco, on why he wrote the novel "The Name of the Rose."

wisdom.quote: The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else.
wisdom.author: Umberto Eco, Travels in Hyperreality (Harcourt)

wisdom.quote: Have regard for your name, since it will remain for you longer than a great store of gold.
wisdom.author: Ecclesiasticus, Aprocrypha (Ec. 41:12)

wisdom.quote: You talk to God, you're religious. God talks to you, you're psychotic.
wisdom.author: Doris Egan, House M.D., House vs. God, 2006

wisdom.quote: Rational arguments don't usually work on religious people. Otherwise, there wouldn't be religious people.
wisdom.author: Doris Egan, House M.D., The Right Stuff, 2007

wisdom.quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing but a lot of ignorance is just as bad.
wisdom.author: Bob Edwards

wisdom.quote: Now I know what a statesman is; he's a dead politician. We need more statesmen.
wisdom.author: Bob Edwards

wisdom.quote: When Solomon said there was a time and a place for everything he had not encountered the problem of parking his automobile.
wisdom.author: Bob Edwards

wisdom.quote: If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves.
wisdom.author: Maria Edgeworth, O Magazine, April 2004

wisdom.quote: Walking is also an ambulation of mind.
wisdom.author: Gretel Ehrlich

wisdom.quote: All pleasures contain an element of sadness.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Eibeschutz

wisdom.quote: If we were brought to trial for the crimes we have committed against ourselves, few would escape the gallows.
wisdom.author: Paul Eldridge

wisdom.quote: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
wisdom.author: Paul Eldridge

wisdom.quote: Man is ready to die for an idea, provided that idea is not quite clear to him.
wisdom.author: Paul Eldridge

wisdom.quote: Is there a rehab center for Coke drinkers? I drink six to eight cans a day.
wisdom.author: Carmen Electra

wisdom.quote: You know criticism when you get into this business. You accept the bad with the good, the tabloids and the positive side of it.
wisdom.author: Carmen Electra

wisdom.quote: Don't think you are going to conceal thoughts by concealing evidence that they ever existed.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, speech at Dartmouth College, June 14, 1953

wisdom.quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, speech to the Republican National Committee, January 31, 1958

wisdom.quote: We succeed only as we identify in life, or in war, or in anything else, a single overriding objective, and make all other considerations bend to that one objective.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, speech, April 2, 1957

wisdom.quote: We have a right to speak our minds, not an obligation to do so.
wisdom.author: Uffe Ellemann-Jensen, The Economist, January 5, 2006

wisdom.quote: It is by no means self-evident that human beings are most real when most violently excited; violent physical passions do not in themselves differentiate men from each other, but rather tend to reduce them to the same state.
wisdom.author: Thomas Elliot

wisdom.quote: Not only is the universe stranger than we imagine, it is stranger than we can imagine.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

wisdom.quote: We are bits of stellar matter that got cold by accident, bits of a star gone wrong.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

wisdom.quote: Science is one thing, wisdom is another. Science is an edged tool, with which men play like children, and cut their own fingers.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, Attributed in Robert L. Weber "More Random Walks in Science", 1982

wisdom.quote: Something unknown is doing we don't know what.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, comment on the Uncertainty Principle in quantum physics, 1927

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to trap modern physics into predicting anything with perfect determinism because it deals with probabilities from the outset.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, In J. R. Newman (ed.) The World of Mathematics, New York: Simon and Schuster, 1956

wisdom.quote: We have found a strange footprint on the shores of the unknown. We have devised profound theories, one after another, to account for its origins. At last, we have succeeded in reconstructing the creature that made the footprint. And lo! It is our own.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, Space, Time, and Gravitation, 1920

wisdom.quote: I ask you to look both ways. For the road to a knowledge of the stars leads through the atom; and important knowledge of the atom has been reached through the stars.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, Stars and Atoms (1928), Lecture 1

wisdom.quote: We used to think that if we knew one, we knew two, because one and one are two. We are finding that we must learn a great deal more about 'and'.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, The Harvest of a Quiet Eye (A. L. Mackay), 1977

wisdom.quote: Proof is the idol before whom the pure mathematician tortures himself.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, The Nature of the Physical World

wisdom.quote: For the truth of the conclusions of physical science, observation is the supreme Court of Appeal. It does not follow that every item which we confidently accept as physical knowledge has actually been certified by the Court; our confidence is that it would be certified by the Court if it were submitted. But it does follow that every item of physical knowledge is of a form which might be submitted to the Court. It must be such that we can specify (although it may be impracticable to carry out) an observational procedure which would decide whether it is true or not. Clearly a statement cannot be tested by observation unless it is an assertion about the results of observation. Every item of physical knowledge must therefore be an assertion of what has been or would be the result of carrying out a specified observational procedure.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, The Philosophy of Physical Science

wisdom.quote: The mathematics is not there till we put it there.
wisdom.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, The Philosophy of Physical Science

wisdom.quote: Journalism is just a gun. It's only got one bullet in it, but if you aim right, that's all you need. Aim it right and you can blow a kneecap off the world.
wisdom.author: Warren Ellis, Transmetropolitan: Back On The Street

wisdom.quote: The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity.
wisdom.author: Harlan Ellison

wisdom.quote: There is no reciprocity. Men love women, women love children, children love hamsters.
wisdom.author: Alice Thomas Ellis

wisdom.quote: Those who live on vanity must, not unreasonably, expect to die of mortification.
wisdom.author: Alice Thomas Ellis

wisdom.quote: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You don't blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the President. You realize that you control your own destiny.
wisdom.author: Albert Ellis

wisdom.quote: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own.You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.
wisdom.author: Albert Ellis

wisdom.quote: Challenge is a dragon with a gift in its mouth�Tame the dragon and the gift is yours.
wisdom.author: Noela Evans

wisdom.quote: The crowd gives the leader new strength.
wisdom.author: Evenius

wisdom.quote: The undertaking of a new action brings new strength.
wisdom.author: Evenius

wisdom.quote: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whisky.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: I never did anything worth doing by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison

wisdom.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison, Encyclopaedia Britannica

wisdom.quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison, Harper's Monthly, 1932

wisdom.quote: Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration.
wisdom.author: Thomas A. Edison, Harper's Monthly, 1932

wisdom.quote: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
wisdom.author: Marian Evans

wisdom.quote: He who can suppress a moment's anger may prevent a day of sorrow.
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: If you would thoroughly know anything, teach it to others.
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: Quiet and sincere sympathy is often the most welcome and efficient consolation to the afflicted. Said a wise man to one in deep sorrow, "I did not come to comfort you; God only can do that; but I did come to say how deeply and tenderly I feel for you in your affliction".
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: The great end of education is to discipline rather than to furnish the mind; to train it to the use of its own powers, rather than fill it with the accumulation of others.
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: The secret of a good memory is attention, and attention to a subject depends upon our interest in it. We rarely forget that which has made a deep impression on our minds.
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: Where duty is plain, delay is both foolish and hazardous; where it is not, delay may provide both wisdom and safety.
wisdom.author: Tryon Edwards

wisdom.quote: I could never think well of a man's intellectual or moral character, if he was habitually unfaithful to his appointments.
wisdom.author: Nathaniel Emmons

wisdom.quote: Just definitions either prevent or put an end to a dispute.
wisdom.author: Nathaniel Emmons

wisdom.quote: The idle mind knows not what it wants.
wisdom.author: Ennius

wisdom.quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Engels

wisdom.quote: The state is nothing but an instrument of oppression of one class by another--no less so in a democratic republic than in a monarchy.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Engels, preface to Kark Marx, The Civil War in France, 1891

wisdom.quote: Some people make headlines while others make history.
wisdom.author: Philip Elmer-DeWitt, in Time Magazine

wisdom.quote: If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.
wisdom.author: Mary Englebreit

wisdom.quote: Dive into the sea of thought, and find there pearls beyond price.
wisdom.author: Moses Ibn Ezra, Shirat Yisrael

wisdom.quote: I'm struck by the insidious, computer-driven tendency to take things out of the domain of muscular activity and put them into the domain of mental activity. The transfer is not paying off. Sure, muscles are unreliable, but they represent several million years of accumulated finesse.
wisdom.author: Brian Eno, Wired 1/99, p. 176

wisdom.quote: Nature abhors a vacuum, but not as much as cats do.
wisdom.author: Lee Entrekin

wisdom.quote: Judgement, not passion should prevail.
wisdom.author: Epicharmus

wisdom.quote: Having a baby's sweet face so close to your own, for so long a time as it takes to nurse 'em, is a great tonic for a sad soul.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: I felt despair. Though it seems to me now there's two kinds of it: the sort that causes a person to surrender and then the sort I had which made me take risks and make plans.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: I have found that it don't really matter if you're brought up fine or rough, but that it helps to have someone to spill your sorrows to.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: I have never cared much for fish - it floats in the belly as much as in the pond.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: I have seen a peaceful expression turn to anger as fast as a whip cracks, and so the look on the face might mean less than what it seems to be.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: I take care of my things. After all, those of us as has few things to begin with must take care, lest we have fewer.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: If you're servant enough, you can shrink into the shadows, even in the bright morning sun and even if you're large enough to often block it.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: Losing a baby is not a thing that you could ever get used to.
wisdom.author: Erica Eisdorfer, The Wet Nurse's Tale, 2009

wisdom.quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
wisdom.author: Duke Ellington

wisdom.quote: Gray skies are just clouds passing over.
wisdom.author: Duke Ellington

wisdom.quote: I merely took the energy it takes to pout and wrote some blues.
wisdom.author: Duke Ellington

wisdom.quote: He talked with more claret than clarity.
wisdom.author: Susan Ertz

wisdom.quote: Millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
wisdom.author: Susan Ertz, Anger in the Sky

wisdom.quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; but remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
wisdom.author: Epicurus

wisdom.quote: Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed.
wisdom.author: Epicurus

wisdom.quote: The man least dependent upon the morrow goes to meet the morrow most cheerfully.
wisdom.author: Epicurus, 300 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Death is nothing to us, since when we are, death has not come, and when death has come, we are not.
wisdom.author: Epicurus, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Pleasure is the beginning and the end of living happily.
wisdom.author: Epicurus, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing. One cannot help but be in awe when he contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality. It is enough if one tries merely to comprehend a little of this mystery every day. Never lose a holy curiosity.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: To punish me for my contempt for authority, fate made me an authority myself.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Too many of us look upon Americans as dollar chasers. This is a cruel libel, even if it is reiterated thoughtlessly by the Americans themselves.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Truth is what stands the test of experience.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: We should take care not to make the intellect our god; it has, of course, powerful muscles, but no personality.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Yes, we have to divide up our time like that, between our politics and our equations. But to me our equations are far more important, for politics are only a matter of present concern. A mathematical equation stands forever.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, "Geometry and Experience", January 27, 1921

wisdom.quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, "Science, Philosophy and Religion: a Symposium", 1941

wisdom.quote: Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, 'Out of My Later Years,' 1950

wisdom.quote: It is the duty of every citizen according to his best capacities to give validity to his convictions in political affairs.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, 'Treasury for the Free World,' 1946

wisdom.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not one bit simpler.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: If pregnancy were a book, they would cut the last two chapters.
wisdom.author: Nora Ephron

wisdom.quote: Insane people are always sure that they are fine. It is only the sane people who are willing to admit that they are crazy.
wisdom.author: Nora Ephron

wisdom.quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus

wisdom.quote: The pleasures which we most rarely experience give us the greatest delight.
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus

wisdom.quote: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus

wisdom.quote: War is delightful to those who have had no experience of it.
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus

wisdom.quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.  [In regione caecorum rex est luscus.]
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus, Adagia (III, IV, 96)

wisdom.quote: They were so strong in their beliefs that there came a time when it hardly mattered what exactly those beliefs were; they all fused into a single stubbornness.
wisdom.author: Louise Erdrich

wisdom.quote: In youth we learn; in age we understand.
wisdom.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

wisdom.quote: Those whom we support hold us up in life.
wisdom.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

wisdom.quote: We are so vain that we even care for the opinion of those we don't care for.
wisdom.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

wisdom.quote: Fear not those who argue but those who dodge.
wisdom.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach, Aphorisms, 1905

wisdom.quote: Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Ethical axioms are found and tested not very differently from the axioms of science. Truth is what stands the test of experience.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life are based on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love. How on earth can you explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love? Put your hand on a stove for a minute and it seems like an hour. Sit with that special girl for an hour and it seems like a minute. That's relativity.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: I never think of the future - it comes soon enough.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: If I had only known, I would have been a locksmith.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: If you are out to describe the truth, leave elegance to the tailor.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Perfection of means and confusion of ends seems to characterize our age.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth. The trite subjects of human efforts, possessions, outward success, luxury have always seemed to me contemptible.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: A sense of humor is part of the art of leadership, of getting along with people, of getting things done.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Americans, indeed all free men, remember that inn the final choice, a soldier's pack is not so heavy a burden as a prisoner's chains.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Before all else, we seek, upon our common labor as a nation, the blessings of Almighty God.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Don't join the book burners. Don't think you're going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed. Don't be afraid to go in your library and read every book...
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: I can think of nothing more boring for the American people than to have to sit in their living rooms for a whole half hour looking at my face on their television screens.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: I like to believe that people in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than our governments. Indeed, I think that people want peace so much that one of these days governments had better get out of the way and let them have it.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: I would rather try to persuade a man to go along, because once I have persuaded him he will stick. If I scare him, he will stay just as long as he is scared, and then he is gone.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: May we, in our dealings with all the peoples of the earth, ever speak the truth and serve justice.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: The middle of the road is all of the usable surface. The extremes, right and left, are in the .
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that the faith, love of freedom, intelligence and energy of her citizens cannot cure.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Things are more like they are now than they ever were before.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Though force can protect in emergency, only justice, fairness, consideration and co-operation can finally lead men to the dawn of eternal peace.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: When you appeal to force, there's one thing you must never do - lose.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: When you are in any contest you should work as if there were - to the very last minute - a chance to lose it.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

wisdom.quote: Politics ought to be the part-time profession of every citizen who would protect the rights and privileges of free people and who would preserve what is good and fruitful in our national heritage.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, Address recorded for the Republican Lincoln Day dinners, January 28, 1964

wisdom.quote: Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the cloud of threatening war, it is humanity hanging from a cross of iron.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, From a speech before the American Society of Newspaper Editors, April 16, 1953

wisdom.quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, Inaugural Address, January 20, 1953

wisdom.quote: Farming looks mighty easy when your plow is a pencil, and you're a thousand miles from the corn field.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, September 11, 1956

wisdom.quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Erhard

wisdom.quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: The hardest thing in the world to understand is the income tax.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: The significant problems we have cannot be solved at the same level of thinking with which we created them.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the Gods.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: You cannot simultaneously prevent and prepare for war.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: At any rate, I am convinced that He [God] does not play dice.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, In a letter to Max Born, 1926

wisdom.quote: If A is success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, Observer, Jan. 15, 1950

wisdom.quote: If someone can enjoy marching to music in rank and file, I can feel only contempt for him; he has received his large brain by mistake, a spinal cord would have been enough.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, Out of My Later Years, 1936

wisdom.quote: Science can only ascertain what is, but not what should be, and outside of its domain value judgements of all kinds remain necessary.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, Out of My Later Years, 1936

wisdom.quote: Great spirits have always found violent opposition from mediocrities.  The latter cannot understand it when a man does not thoughtlessly submit to hereditary prejudices, but honestly and courageously uses his intelligence and fulfills the duty to express the results of his thought in clear form.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, quoted in New York Times, March 19, 1940

wisdom.quote: The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophe.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, Telegram, 24 May 1946

wisdom.quote: When you look at yourself from a universal standpoint, something inside always reminds or informs you that there are bigger and better things to worry about.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, The World as I See It.

wisdom.quote: Although I have been prevented by outward circumstances from observing a strictly vegetarian diet, I have long been an adherent to the cause in principle. Besides agreeing with the aims of vegetarianism for aesthetic and moral reasons, it is my view that a vegetarian manner of living by its purely physical effect on the human temperament would most beneficially influence the lot of mankind.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, Translation of letter to Hermann Huth, December 27, 1930

wisdom.quote: You see, wire telegraph is a kind of a very, very long cat. You pull his tail in New York and his head is meowing in Los Angeles. Do you understand this? And radio operates exactly the same way: you send signals here, they receive them there. The only difference is that there is no cat.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein, when asked to describe radio

wisdom.quote: He who wonders discovers that this in itself is wonder.
wisdom.author: M. C. Escher

wisdom.quote: My work is a game, a very serious game.
wisdom.author: M. C. Escher

wisdom.quote: What I give form to in daylight is only one per cent of what I have seen in darkness.
wisdom.author: M. C. Escher, Quoted in Comic Sections, D. MacHale (Dublin 1993)

wisdom.quote: By keenly confronting the enigmas that surround us, and by considering and analysing the observations that I have made, I ended up in the domain of mathematics, Although I am absolutely without training in the exact sciences, I often seem to have more in common with mathematicians than with my fellow artists.
wisdom.author: M. C. Escher, Quoted in To Infinity and Beyond, E Maor (Princeton 1991)

wisdom.quote: Slow but sure moves the might of the gods.
wisdom.author: Euripides, The Bacchae, circa 407 B.C.

wisdom.quote: But this is slavery, not to speak one's thought.
wisdom.author: Euripides, The Phoenician Women, 409 BC

wisdom.quote: If youth only knew: if age only could.
wisdom.author: Henri Estienne

wisdom.quote: Humankind cannot stand very much reality.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Humor is also a way of saying something serious.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: I take as metaphysical poetry that in which what is ordinarily apprehensible only by thought is brought within the grasp of feeling, or that in which what is ordinarily only felt is transformed into thought without ceasing to be feeling.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Some editors are failed writers, but so are most writers.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Success is relative. It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: The last temptation is the greatest treason: to do the right deed for the wrong reason.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot, "Tradition and the Individual Talent", II (The Sacred Wood, 1922)

wisdom.quote: We shall not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot, Little Gidding

wisdom.quote: Between the desire And the spasm Between the potency And the existence Between the essence And the descent Falls the Shadow
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot, The Hollow Men

wisdom.quote: Between the idea And the reality Between the motion And the act Falls the Shadow
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot, The Hollow Men

wisdom.quote: This is the way the world ends This is the way the world ends This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot, The Hollow Men

wisdom.quote: Be courteous, be obliging, but don't give yourself over to be melted down for the benefit of the tallow trade.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: Blessed is the man who, having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: I think I should have no other mortal wants, if I could always have plenty of music. It seems to infuse strength into my limbs and ideas into my brain. Life seems to go on without effort, when I am filled with music.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: I'm proof against that word failure. I've seen behind it. The only failure a man ought to fear is failure of cleaving to the purpose he sees to be best.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: Ignorance gives one a large range of probabilities.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: It's never too late to be who you might have been.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: Our deeds travel with us from afar, and what we have been makes us what we are.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: The beginning of compunction is the beginning of a new life.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: The golden moments in the stream of life rush past us and we see nothing but sand; the angels come to visit us, and we only know them when they are gone.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: The important work of moving the world forward does not wait to be done by perfect men.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: The reward of one duty is the power to fulfill another.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: The strongest principle of growth lies in human choice.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: There's folks 'ud stand on their heads and then say the fault was i' their boots.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: We are all apt to believe what the world believes about us.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: What greater thing is there for two human souls than to feel that they are joined for life?
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: What greater thing is there for two human souls than to feel that they are joined... to strengthen each other... to be one with each other in silent unspeakable memories.
wisdom.author: George Eliot

wisdom.quote: Miss Brooke had that kind of beauty which seems to be thrown into relief by poor dress.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, "Middlemarch", Book I, ch.1

wisdom.quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, 'Mr. Gilfil's Love Story,' Scenes of Clerical Life, 1857

wisdom.quote: In the modern world the intelligence of public opinion is the one indispensable condition for social progress.
wisdom.author: Charles W. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counsellors, and the most patient of teachers.
wisdom.author: Charles W. Eliot, The Happy Life, 1896

wisdom.quote: Education is a better safeguard of liberty than a standing army.
wisdom.author: Edward Everett

wisdom.quote: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things
wisdom.author: Edward Everett

wisdom.quote: The scornful nostril and the high head gather not the odors that lie on the track of truth.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Felix Holt, the Radical, 1866

wisdom.quote: Some people did what their neighbors did so that if any lunatics were at large, one might know and avoid them.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Middlemarch

wisdom.quote: What we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Middlemarch

wisdom.quote: Our deeds are like children that are born to us; they live and act apart from our own will. Nay, children may be strangled, but deeds never: they have an indestructible life both in and out of our consciousness.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Romola, 1863

wisdom.quote: Every man who is not a monster, mathematician or a mad philosopher, is the slave of some woman or other.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Scenes of Clerical Life - Amos Barton

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, Silas Marner (1861)

wisdom.quote: There is no feeling, except the extremes of fear and grief, that does not find relief in music.
wisdom.author: George Eliot, The Mill on the Floss, 1860

wisdom.quote: A friend is one before whom I may think aloud.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is braver five minutes longer.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A man of genius is privileged only as far as he is genius. His dullness is as insupportable as any other dullness.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All our progress is an unfolding, like a vegetable bud. You have first an instinct, then an opinion, then a knowledge as the plant has root, bud, and fruit. Trust the instinct to the end, though you can render no reason.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: As we grow old�the beauty steals inward.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Be not the slave of your own past. Plunge into the sublime seas, dive deep and swim far, so you shall come back with self-respect, with new power, with an advanced experience that shall explain and overlook the old.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beware when the great God lets loose a thinker on this planet.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Character is higher than intellect... A great soul will be strong to live, as well as to think.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Children are all foreigners.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Colleges hate geniuses, just as convents hate saints.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Conversation is an art in which a man has all mankind for his competitors, for it is that which all are practising every day while they live.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Democracy becomes a government of bullies tempered by editors.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Don't waste yourself in rejection, nor bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every great and commanding moment in the annals of the world is the triumph of some enthusiasm.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every hero becomes a bore at last.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every man is hero and an oracle to somebody, and to that person, whatever he says has an enhanced value.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every revolution was thought first in one man's mind.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don't turn up at all.
wisdom.author: Sam Ewing

wisdom.quote: It's not the hours you put in your work that counts, it's the work you put in the hours.
wisdom.author: Sam Ewing

wisdom.quote: Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Give all to love; obey thy heart.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Good manners are made up of petty sacrifices.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He has not learned the lesson of life who does not every day surmount a fear.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I awoke this morning with devout thanksgiving for my friends, the old and the new.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I pack my trunk, embrace my friends, embark on the sea, and at last wake up in Naples, and there beside me is the Stern Fact, the Sad Self, unrelenting, identical, that I fled from.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If I have lost confidence in myself, I have the universe against me.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Insist on yourself; never imitate... Every great man is unique.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let not a man guard his dignity, but let his dignity guard him.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody. Do not make life hard to any.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Money, which represents the prose of life, and which is hardly spoken of in parlors without an apology, is, in its effects and laws, as beautiful as roses.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If you can react the same way to winning and losing, that is a big accomplishment. That quality is important because it stays with you the rest of your life.
wisdom.author: Chris Evert

wisdom.quote: Music is the only language in which you cannot say a mean or sarcastic thing.
wisdom.author: John Erskine

wisdom.quote: Think twice before you speak, and then you may be able to say something more insulting than if you spoke right out at once.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Zoo: An excellent place to study the habits of human beings.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: The advancement of the arts from year to year taxes our credulity, and seems to presage the arrival of that period when human improvement must end.
wisdom.author: Henry L. Ellsworth, U.S. commissioner of patents, Annual Report, 1843

wisdom.quote: My mother used to say that there are no strangers, only friends you haven't met yet. She's now in a maximum security twilight home in Australia.
wisdom.author: Dame Edna Everage

wisdom.quote: Never be afraid to laugh at yourself, after all, you could be missing out on the joke of the century.
wisdom.author: Dame Edna Everage, In a television interview with Joan Rivers

wisdom.quote: Anger at lies lasts forever. Anger at truth can't last.
wisdom.author: Greg Evans, Luann (comic), September 27, 2003

wisdom.quote: It is only the great men who are truly obscene. If they had not dared to be obscene, they could never have dared to be great.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis

wisdom.quote: The place where optimism most flourishes is the lunatic asylum.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis

wisdom.quote: Thinking in its lower grades, is comparable to paper money, and in its higher forms it is a kind of poetry.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis

wisdom.quote: What we call 'Progress' is the exchange of one nuisance for another nuisance.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis

wisdom.quote: The sun, the moon and the stars would have disappeared long ago, had they happened to be within reach of predatory human hands.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis, "The Dance of Life", 1923

wisdom.quote: The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis, Impressions and Comments (1914)

wisdom.quote: The more rapidly a civilization progresses, the sooner it dies for another to rise in its place.
wisdom.author: Havelock Ellis, The Dance of Life

wisdom.quote: Death can sneak up on you like a silent kitten, surprising you with it's touch and you have a right to act surprised. Other times death stomps in the front door, unwanted and unannounced, and makes it's noisy way to your seat on the sofa.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Bible Versus, 11-27-08

wisdom.quote: I am not dying, not anymore than any of us are at any moment. We run, hopefully as fast as we can, and then everyone must stop. We can only choose how we handle the race.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog comments, 06-11-04

wisdom.quote: Just because you love someone doesn't mean you have to be involved with them. Love is not a bandage to cover wounds.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  February 16, 2004

wisdom.quote: I have you and even if we never meet or ever see each other, we have left our thumbprints in the thick, moist clay of each other's lives.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  May 6, 2003

wisdom.quote: Miracles: You do not have to look for them. They are there, 24-7, beaming like radio waves all around you. Put up the antenna, turn up the volume - snap... crackle... this just in, every person you talk to is a chance to change the world...
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  May 6, 2003

wisdom.quote: All people want is someone to listen.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  May 8, 2003

wisdom.quote: You can always tell you're in trouble when the good option involves a prosthetic leg.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  November 5, 2003

wisdom.quote: Personally I think birthdays and anniversaries are like menstrual cramps, a regular pain in the ass that's somehow connected to birth.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog,  September 30, 2003

wisdom.quote: It�s such a part of me, I assume Everyone can see it.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, 02-09-05

wisdom.quote: Share your M&Ms. There are bags and bags of them all over the place. If you give them one of yours, even one of the green ones, you will not be lacking. Honust Injun. Now apply this to Time, Concern, Touch, Interest and Being Vulnerable.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, 02-14-03

wisdom.quote: Listen. Do not have an opinion while you listen because frankly, your opinion doesn't hold much water outside of Your Universe. Just listen. Listen until their brain has been twisted like a dripping towel and what they have to say is all over the floor.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, 02-14-2003

wisdom.quote: If there's one thing I know it's God does love a good joke.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, 05-01-04

wisdom.quote: When a miracle happens, even if not to you, its nature is to naturally expand. You can almost feel the warmth on your face.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, 06-02-04

wisdom.quote: You thought I was writing The Truth? Honey, I don't even know what The Truth means.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only weblog, September 29, 2005

wisdom.quote: You can call it the 'Perfect Moment' when the universe aligns and the music in your head actually matches the music outside and all is well.
wisdom.author: Hugh Elliott, Standing Room Only, 04-18-2006

wisdom.quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Address on The Method of Nature, 1841

wisdom.quote: To be great is to be misunderstood.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, An Essay on Self-Reliance

wisdom.quote: The key to every man is his thought.... He can only be reformed by showing him a new idea which commands his own.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Circles, Essays: First Series, 1903

wisdom.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly, and they will show themselves great.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Essays, First Series: Prudence, 1841

wisdom.quote: Whatever limits us, we call Fate.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Fate, The Conduct of Life, 1860

wisdom.quote: Immortality. I notice that as soon as writers broach this question they begin to quote. I hate quotation. Tell me what you know.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Journal (May 1849)

wisdom.quote: When a whole nation is roaring Patriotism at the top of its voice, I am fain to explore the cleanness of its hands and purity of its heart.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Journals, 1824

wisdom.quote: The best effect of fine persons is felt after we have left their presence.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Journals, 1839

wisdom.quote: Next to the originator of a good sentence is the first quoter of it.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Letters and Social Aims (Quotation and Originality)

wisdom.quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Letters and Social Aims: Progress of Culture, 1876

wisdom.quote: In the highest civilization, the book is still the highest delight. He who has once known its satisfactions is provided with a resource against calamity.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Letters and Social Aims: Quotation and Originality, 1876

wisdom.quote: Wit makes its own welcome, and levels all distinctions. No dignity, no learning, no force of character, can make any stand against good wit.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Letters and Social Aims: The Comic, 1876

wisdom.quote: The bitterest tragic element in life to be derived from an intellectual source is the belief in a brute Fate or Destiny.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Natural History of Intellect (1893)

wisdom.quote: Men are conservatives when they are least vigorous, or when they are most luxurious. They are conservatives after dinner.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, New England Reformers, 1844

wisdom.quote: These times of ours are series and full of calamity, but all times are essentially alike. As soon as there is life there is danger.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Public and Private Education, November 27, 1864

wisdom.quote: In every work of genius we see our own rejected thoughts.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Self Reliance

wisdom.quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Self-Reliance

wisdom.quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds, adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Self-Reliance

wisdom.quote: As soon as there is life there is danger.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Society and Solitude (1870)

wisdom.quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our chief want in life is somebody who shall make us do what we can.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our knowledge is the amassed thought and experience of innumerable minds.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of their character.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier, not that the task itself has become easier, but that our ability to perform it has improved.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The adventitious beauty of poetry may be felt in the greater delight with a verse given in a happy quotation than in the poem.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The ancestor of every action is a thought.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The essence of all jokes, of all comedy, seems to be an honest or well intended halfness; a non performance of that which is pretended to be performed, at the same time that one is giving loud pledges of performance. The balking of the intellect, is comedy and it announces itself in the pleasant spasms we call laughter.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The foolish man wonders at the unusual, but the wise man at the usual.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The key to every man is his thought. Sturdy and defying though he look, he has a helm which he obeys, which is the idea after which all his facts are classified. He can only be reformed by showing him a new idea which commands his own.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The life of man is the true romance, which when it is valiantly conduced, will yield the imagination a higher joy than any fiction.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The louder he talked of his honor, the faster we counted our spoons.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The measure of a master is his success in bringing all men around to his opinion twenty years later.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The only gift is a portion of thyself.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The peril of every fine faculty is the delight of playing with it for pride. Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character, and the greater it grows, the more is the mischief. Talent is mistaken for genius, a dogma or system for truth, ambition for greatest, ingenuity for poetry, sensuality for art.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is no den in the wide world to hide a rogue. Commit a crime and the earth is made of glass. Commit a crime, and it seems as if a coat of snow fell on the ground, such as reveals in the woods the track of every partridge, and fox, and squirrel.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is properly no history, only biography.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This time, like all times, is a very good one, if we but know what to do with it.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Those who cannot tell what they desire or expect, still sigh and struggle with indefinite thoughts and vast wishes.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Trust your instinct to the end, though you can render no reason.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We all boil at different degrees.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We do what we must, and call it by the best names.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What you do speaks so loud that I cannot hear what you say.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When you strike at a king, you must kill him.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whoever is open, loyal, true; of humane and affable demeanour; honourable himself, and in his judgement of others; faithful to his word as to law, and faithful alike to God and man....such a man is a true gentleman.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whoso would be a man must be a nonconformist.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Work and acquire, and thou hast chained the wheel of Chance.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The two parties which divide the state, the party of Conservatism and that of Innovation, are very old, and have disputed the possession of the world ever since it was made.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Conservative, Boston, Massachusetts, December 9, 1841

wisdom.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, "American Civilization", The Atlantic Monthly, 1862

wisdom.quote: In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts; they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Self Reliance"

wisdom.quote: Speak what you think today in hard words and tomorrow speak what tomorrow thinks in hard words again, though it contradict every thing you said today.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Self-Reliance", 1841

wisdom.quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, 'Art,' 1841

wisdom.quote: Sometimes a scream is better than a thesis.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, 'Journals,' 1836

wisdom.quote: Bear in mind that you should conduct yourself in life as at a feast.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: Control thy passions, lest they take vengeance on thee.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: If you do not wish to be prone to anger, do not feed the habit; give it nothing which may tend to its increase.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: If you would cure anger, do not feed it. Say to yourself: 'I used to be angry every day; then every other day; now only every third or fourth day.' When you reach thirty days offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the gods.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: Know, first, who you are; and then adorn yourself accordingly.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: Preach not to others what they should eat, but eat as becomes you, and be silent.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: The good or ill of a man lies within his own will.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: Only the educated are free.
wisdom.author: Epictetus, Discourses

wisdom.quote: What is the first business of one who practices philosophy? To get rid of self-conceit. For it is impossible for anyone to begin to learn that which he thinks he already knows.
wisdom.author: Epictetus, Discourses

wisdom.quote: When you close your doors, and make darkness within, remember never to say that you are alone, for you are not alone; nay, God is within, and your genius is within. And what need have they of light to see what you are doing?
wisdom.author: Epictetus, Discourses

wisdom.quote: A husband is like a fire, he goes out when unattended.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy and Jill a rich widow.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: America believes in education: the average professor earns more money in a year than a professional athlete earns in a whole week.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Anger is the feeling that makes your mouth work faster than your mind.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Character is what you have left when you've lost everything you can lose.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Conscience is what makes a boy tell his mother before his sister does.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Hope is tomorrow's veneer over today's disappointment.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Housework is what a woman does that nobody notices unless she hasn't done it.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Most new books are forgotten within a year, especially by those who borrow them.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Public speaking is the art of diluting a two-minute idea with a two-hour vocabulary.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: The girl with a future avoids a man with a past.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: The mint makes it first, it is up to you to make it last.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: Walking isn't a lost art: one must, by some means, get to the garage.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: You can't do anything about the length of your life, but you can do something about its width and depth.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar

wisdom.quote: It takes hundreds of nuts to hold a car together, but it takes only one of them to scatter it all over the highway.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Many a man who falls in love with a dimple make the mistake of marrying the whole girl.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Play: Work that you enjoy doing for nothing.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Statistician: A man who believes figures don't lie, but admits that under analysis some of them won't stand up either.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Statistics: The only science that enables different experts using the same figures to draw different conclusions.
wisdom.author: Evan Esar, Esar's Comic Dictionary

wisdom.quote: Circumstances rule men and not men rule circumstances.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Do not consider painful what is good for you.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Short is the joy that guilty pleasure brings.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: The best and safest thing is to keep a balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: The wisest men follow their own direction.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Waste not fresh tears over old griefs.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Your very silence shows you agree.
wisdom.author: Euripides

wisdom.quote: Slight not what's near, while aiming at what's far.
wisdom.author: Euripides, 'Rhesus'

wisdom.quote: I have found power in the mysteries of thought.
wisdom.author: Euripides, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: A bad beginning makes a bad ending.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Aegeus

wisdom.quote: The company of just and righteous men is better than wealth and a rich estate.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Aegeus

wisdom.quote: Time will explain it all. He is a talker, and needs no questioning before he speaks.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Aeolus

wisdom.quote: A second wifeis hateful to the children of the first;a viper is not more hateful.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: A sweet thing, for whatever time,to revisit in dreams the dear dad we have lost.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Dishonor will not trouble me, once I am dead.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: I have found power in the mysteries of thought,exaltation in the changing of the Muses;I have been versed in the reasonings of men;but Fate is stronger than anything I have known.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Light be the earth upon you, lightly rest.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Never say that marriage has more of joy than pain.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Time cancels young pain.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: You were a stranger to sorrow: therefore Fate has cursed you.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Alcestis, 438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Man's best possession is a sympathetic wife.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Antigone

wisdom.quote: I care for riches, to make giftsTo friends, or lead a sick man back to healthWith ease and plenty. Else small aid is wealthFor daily gladness; once a man be doneWith hunger, rich and poor are all as one.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Electra, 413 B.C.

wisdom.quote: In case of dissension, never dare to judge till you've heard the other side.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Heraclidae, circa 428 B.C.

wisdom.quote: In this world second thoughts, it seems, are best.
