wisdom.author: Euripides, Hippolytus, 428 B.C.

wisdom.quote: My tongue swore, but my mind was still unpledged.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Hippolytus, 428 B.C.

wisdom.quote: There is one thing alonethat stands the brunt of life throughout its course:a quiet conscience.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Hippolytus, 428 B.C.

wisdom.quote: A coward turns away, but a brave man's choice is danger.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Iphigenia in Tauris, circa 412 B.C.

wisdom.quote: The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Iphigenia in Tauris, circa 412 B.C.

wisdom.quote: I know indeed what evil I intend to do,but stronger than all my afterthoughts is my fury,fury that brings upon mortals the greatest evils.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Medea, 431 B.C.

wisdom.quote: There is no benefit in the gifts of a bad man.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Medea, 431 B.C.

wisdom.quote: What greater grief than the loss of one's native land.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Medea, 431 B.C.

wisdom.quote: When love is in excess it brings a man no honor nor worthiness.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Medea, 431 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Every man is like the company he is wont to keep.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Phoenix

wisdom.quote: Death comes to all But great achievements raise a monument Which shall endure until the sun grows old.
wisdom.author: George Fabricius, 'In Praise of Georgius Agricola'

wisdom.quote: Cheese - milk's leap toward immortality.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.quote: For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.quote: One's first book, kiss, home run, is always the best.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.quote: When you travel, remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.
wisdom.author: Clifton Fadiman

wisdom.quote: No amount of artificial reinforcement can offset the natural inequalities of human individuals.
wisdom.author: Henry P. Fairchild

wisdom.quote: We were happily married for eight months. Unfortunately, we were married for four and a half years.
wisdom.author: Nick Faldo

wisdom.quote: When it is not necessary to make a decision, it is necessary not to make a decision.
wisdom.author: Lord Falkland

wisdom.quote: Gravity. It keeps you rooted to the ground. In space, there's not any gravity. You just kind of leave your feet and go floating around. Is that what being in love is like?
wisdom.author: Josh Brand and John Falsey, Northern Exposure, The Pilot, 1990

wisdom.quote: I listen to feminists and all these radical gals - most of them are failures. They've blown it. Some of them have been married, but they married some Casper Milquetoast who asked permission to go to the bathroom. These women just need a man in the house. That's all they need. Most of the feminists need a man to tell them what time of day it is and to lead them home. And they blew it and they're mad at all men. Feminists hate men. They're sexist. They hate men - that's their problem.
wisdom.author: Jerry Falwell

wisdom.quote: The argument that making contraceptives available to young people would prevent teen pregnancies is ridiculous. That's like offering a cookbook as a cure to people who are trying to lose weight.
wisdom.author: Jerry Falwell

wisdom.quote: Fervor is the weapon of choice for the impotent.
wisdom.author: Frantz Fanon

wisdom.quote: To err is human, but to really foul things up requires a computer.
wisdom.author: Farmers' Almanac, 1978

wisdom.quote: God gave women intuition and femininity. Used properly, the combination easily jumbles the brain of any man I've ever met.
wisdom.author: Farrah Fawcett

wisdom.quote: If you go in for argument, take care of your temper. Your logic, if you have any, will take care of itself.
wisdom.author: Joseph Farrell

wisdom.quote: The secret of all power is - save your force. If you want high pressure you must choke off waste.
wisdom.author: Joseph Farrell

wisdom.quote: A curious part of the human psyche is that the moment that a person presumed to be in danger is discovered to be safe, everyone's anxiety turns into anger.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: I think the mark of a great ruler, is not his ability to make war but to achieve peace.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: If you ask too many questions, you will find no answers, only more questions.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: It is generally true that, the more preparations one has for an event, the more inconveniently fast the event will occur.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: It is much easier to break the rules when one s surrounded by strangers. One does not know any of them, so one cannot really care for their opinion.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: Once you have listened to the gossip for some time, you will soon feel as if you know everyone, even if you have never met them.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: The perversity of the human spirit is such that when a young lady longs for one specific partner, every other partner counts for nothing.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: To demand perfection is a sure way to be disappointed in everybody, for you will be bound to think ill of others.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: When a person is uncertain in love, there is nothing easier than for him to put one and one together and to make three out of them.
wisdom.author: Monica Fairview, Darcy Cousins, 2010

wisdom.quote: Be warned against all 'good' advice because 'good' advice is necessarily 'safe' advice, and though it will undoubtedly follow a sane pattern, it will very likely lead one into total sterility--one of the crushing problems of our time.
wisdom.author: Jules Feiffer

wisdom.quote: Maturity is only a short break in adolescence.
wisdom.author: Jules Feiffer

wisdom.quote: All of us failed to match our dreams of perfection. So I rate us on the basis of our splendid failure to do the impossible.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner

wisdom.quote: Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner

wisdom.quote: The artist doesn't have time to listen to the critics.  The ones who want to be writers read the reviews,  the ones who want to write don't have the time to read reviews.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner

wisdom.quote: The past is not dead. In fact, it's not even past.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner

wisdom.quote: The aim of every artist is to arrest motion, which is life, by artificial means and hold it fixed so that a hundred years later, when a stranger looks at it, it moves again since it is life.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner, Interview, 1958

wisdom.quote: In forming a bridge between body and mind, dreams may be used as a springboard from which man can leap to new realms of experience lying outside his normal state of consciousness.
wisdom.author: Ann Faraday

wisdom.quote: The difference between insanity and genius is success.
wisdom.author: Bruce Feirstein, Tomorrow Never Dies

wisdom.quote: Toughness doesn't have to come in a pinstriped suit.
wisdom.author: Senator Dianne Feinstein

wisdom.quote: Winning may not be everything, but losing has little to recommend it.
wisdom.author: Senator Dianne Feinstein

wisdom.quote: A myth is a religion in which no one any longer believes.
wisdom.author: James Feibleman

wisdom.quote: A different language is a different vision of life.
wisdom.author: Federico Fellini

wisdom.quote: I don't believe in total freedom for the artist. Left on his own, free to do anything he likes, the artist ends up doing nothing at all. If there's one thing that's dangerous for an artist, it's precisely this question of total freedom, waiting for inspiration and all the rest of it.
wisdom.author: Federico Fellini

wisdom.quote: Never feel self-pity, the most destructive emotion there is. How awful to be caught up in the terrible squirrel cage of self.
wisdom.author: Millicent Fenwick

wisdom.quote: It is no good to try to stop knowledge from going forward. Ignorance is never better than knowledge.
wisdom.author: Enrico Fermi

wisdom.quote: Perhaps too much of everything is as bad as too little.
wisdom.author: Edna Ferber

wisdom.quote: Fear is a question: What are you afraid of, and why? Just as the seed of health is in illness, because illness contains information, your fears are a treasure house of self-knowledge if you explore them.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Ferguson

wisdom.quote: Over the years your bodies become walking autobiographies, telling friends and strangers alike of the minor and major stresses of your lives.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Ferguson

wisdom.quote: Of all the self-fulfilling prophecies in our culture, the assumption that aging means decline and poor health is probably the deadliest.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Ferguson, The Aquarian Conspiracy, 1980

wisdom.quote: MTV is the lava lamp of the 1980's.
wisdom.author: Doug Ferrari

wisdom.quote: Eliminate something superfluous from your life. Break a habit. Do something that makes you feel insecure.
wisdom.author: Piero Ferrucci

wisdom.quote: Hunting has opened the earth to me and let me sense the rhythms and hierarchies of nature.
wisdom.author: Charles Fergus

wisdom.quote: The land comes alive through its wild creatures.
wisdom.author: Charles Fergus

wisdom.quote: I began to have an idea of my life, not as the slow shaping of achievement to fit my preconceived purposes, but as the gradual discovery and growth of a purpose which I did not know.
wisdom.author: Joanna Field

wisdom.quote: Half of the modern drugs could well be thrown out of the window, except that the birds might eat them.
wisdom.author: Dr. Martin Henry Fischer

wisdom.quote: Man is what he eats.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Feuerbach

wisdom.quote: It isn't where you came from; it's where you're going that counts.
wisdom.author: Ella Fitzgerald

wisdom.quote: The whole dream of democracy is to raise the proletarian to the level of stupidity attained by the bourgeois.
wisdom.author: Gustave Flaubert

wisdom.quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
wisdom.author: Gustave Flaubert

wisdom.quote: My problem lies in reconciling my gross habits with my net income.
wisdom.author: Errol Flynn

wisdom.quote: Nobody is ever met at the airport when beginning a new adventure. It's just not done.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Warnock Fernea, A View of the Nile, 1970

wisdom.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged that as soon as one part of your life starts looking up, another falls to pieces.
wisdom.author: Helen Fielding, Bridget Jones Diary

wisdom.quote: A cheerful mind is a vigorous mind.
wisdom.author: Jean De la Fontaine

wisdom.quote: Better to rely on one powerful king than on many little princes.
wisdom.author: Jean de La Fontaine

wisdom.quote: By the work one knows the workmen.
wisdom.author: Jean De La Fontaine

wisdom.quote: In everything one must consider the end.
wisdom.author: Jean De la Fontaine

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so dangerous as an ignorant friend; A wise enemy is worth more.
wisdom.author: Jean De la Fontaine

wisdom.quote: I've been on a diet for two weeks and all I've lost is two weeks.
wisdom.author: Totie Fields

wisdom.quote: A hotel isn't like a home, but it's better than being a house guest.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: Beware of the man who won't be bothered with details.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: Early morning cheerfulness can be extremely obnoxious.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: One of the indictments of civilizations is that happiness and intelligence are so rarely found in the same person.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: Setting a good example for children takes all the fun out of middle age.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: The petty economies of the rich are just as amazing as the silly extravagances of the poor.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages is preserved into perpetuity by a nation's proverbs, fables, folk sayings and quotations.
wisdom.author: William Feather

wisdom.quote: We all need to have a creative outlet - a window, a space - so we don't lose track of ourselves.
wisdom.author: Norman Fischer

wisdom.quote: A mother is not a person to lean on but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
wisdom.author: Dorothy C. Fisher, quoted in O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: Leave well - even 'pretty well' - alone: that is what I learn as I get old.
wisdom.author: Edward Fitzgerald

wisdom.quote: Instant gratification takes too long.
wisdom.author: Carrie Fisher

wisdom.quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die.
wisdom.author: Carrie Fisher

wisdom.quote: You can't find any true closeness in Hollywood, because everybody does the fake closeness so well.
wisdom.author: Carrie Fisher

wisdom.quote: Sharing food with another human being is an intimate act that should not be indulged in lightly.
wisdom.author: M. F. K. Fisher

wisdom.quote: War is a beastly business, it is true, but one proof we are human is our ability to learn, even from it, how better to exist.
wisdom.author: M. F. K. Fisher

wisdom.quote: Deeds, not words shall speak me.
wisdom.author: John Fletcher

wisdom.quote: Man is his own star and the soul that can render an honest and perfect man commands all light, all influence, all fate.
wisdom.author: John Fletcher, 1647

wisdom.quote: Death hath so many doors to let out life.
wisdom.author: John Fletcher, The Custom of the Country (1647)

wisdom.quote: The best way to divulge a secret is to tell someone not to say anything about it.
wisdom.author: Charles Fleischer, TED Talk: All things are Moleeds, February 2005

wisdom.quote: The only reason some people get lost in thought is because it's unfamiliar territory.
wisdom.author: Paul Fix

wisdom.quote: It is the loose ends with which men hang themselves.
wisdom.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

wisdom.quote: She was conscious that the things she did were the things she had always wanted to do.
wisdom.author: Zelda Fitzgerald, 1922

wisdom.quote: [S]he refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn�t boring.
wisdom.author: Zelda Fitzgerald, 1922

wisdom.quote: I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them.
wisdom.author: Ian Fleming

wisdom.quote: If we cannot live so as to be happy, let us least live so as to deserve it.
wisdom.author: Immanuel Hermann Fichte

wisdom.quote: It's the gloomy things that need our help, if everything in the garden is sunny, why meddle?
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 1, 2010

wisdom.quote: War makes early risers of us all.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 1, 2010

wisdom.quote: I don't want my own son to die, but this is a war and we must be in it together. High and low. Rich and poor. There can be no special cases because every man at the front is a special case to someone.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 7, 2010

wisdom.quote: Any bride who doesn't suck up to their husband's mother is a fool.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 8, 2010

wisdom.quote: I never know which is worse: the sorrow when you hit the bird or the shame when you miss it.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 9, 2010

wisdom.quote: Lawyers are always confident before the verdict. It's only after that they share their doubts.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 9, 2010

wisdom.quote: Life is a game in which the player must appear ridiculous.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 9, 2010

wisdom.quote: You never know people, do you? You can work with 'em for twenty years; you don't know 'em at all.
wisdom.author: Julian Fellowes, Downton Abbey, Season 2, Episode 9, 2010

wisdom.quote: All wars are civil wars, because all men are brothers.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: Children are very nice observers, and will often perceive your slightest defects. In general, those who govern children, forgive nothing in them, but everything in themselves.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: Discouragement is simply the despair of wounded self-love.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: If the riches of the Indies, or the crowns of all the kingdom of Europe, were laid at my feet in exchange for my love of reading, I would spurn them all.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: If we were faultless we should not be so much annoyed by the defects of those with whom we associate.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become toward the defects of others.
wisdom.author: Francois de Fenelon

wisdom.quote: One of the hardest tasks of leadership is understanding that you are not what you are, but what you're perceived to be by others.
wisdom.author: Edward L. Flom

wisdom.quote: A lost battle is a battle one thinks one has lost.
wisdom.author: Ferdinand Foch

wisdom.quote: None but a coward dares to boast that he has never known fear.
wisdom.author: Ferdinand Foch

wisdom.quote: Competition is a painful thing, but it produces great results.
wisdom.author: Jerry Flint, in Forbes

wisdom.quote: I feel good about taking things to Goodwill and actually, I do like shopping at Goodwill. It's so cheap that it feels like a library where I am just checking things out for awhile until I decide to take them back.
wisdom.author: April Foiles

wisdom.quote: Life is like getting dropped off in the middle of the woods, and then year by year, gradually walking home.
wisdom.author: April Foiles

wisdom.quote: Nations have recently been led to borrow billions for war; no nation has ever borrowed largely for education. Probably, no nation is rich enough to pay for both war and civilization. We must make our choice; we cannot have both.
wisdom.author: Abraham Flexner, Universities, part 3, 1930

wisdom.quote: Love is the reason for it all.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Fields

wisdom.quote: When a man plays a woman in a dress, you're halfway there. It's inherently funny. When a woman plays a man, for whatever reason, it's not that instant kind of funny.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, ABC-TV World News Now

wisdom.quote: Do your thing and don't care if they like it.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: I have a suspicion that the definition of "crazy" in show business is a woman who keeps talking even after no one wants to f*** [sleep with her] anymore.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: I'll be ready for it to happen and that way it won't happen. It's a burden, being able to control situations with my hyper-vigilance, but it's my lot in life.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: In most cases being a good boss means hiring talented people and then getting out of their way. In other cases, to get the best work out of people you may have to pretend you are not their boss and let them treat someone else like the boss, and then that whispers to you behind a fake wall and you tell them what to tell the first person. Contrary to what I believed as a little girl, being the boss almost never involves marching around, waving your arms, and chanting, " I am the boss! I am the boss!"
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: In my experience, the hardest thing about having someone "come out" to you is the "pretending to be surprised" part.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: It's not vanity, because if you look weird, it will distract from what your trying to do. If you look as good as you can, people will be able to pay attention to what your actually saying.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: THERE ARE NO MISTAKES, only opportunities.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: To me YES, AND means don't be afraid to contribute. Always make sure you're adding something to the discussion. Your initiations are worthwhile.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: Whatever the problem, be part of the solution. Don't just sit around raising questions and pointing out obstacles. We've all worked with that person. That person is a drag.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: When faced with sexism or ageism or lookism or even really aggressive Buddhism, ask yourself the following question:"Is this person in between me and what do I want to do?" If the answer is no, ignore it and move on. Your energy is better used doing your work and outpacing people that way. Then, when you're in charge, don't hire the people who were jerky to you.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: When people say, "You really, really must" do something, it means you don't really have to. no one ever says, "You really, really must deliver the baby during labor." When it's true, it doesn't need to be said.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: You have to let people see what you wrote. It will never be perfect, but perfect is overrated. Perfect is boring.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Bossypants, 2011

wisdom.quote: If everyone had a dad like mine, no one would have sex tapes.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, David Letterman Interview, 2011

wisdom.quote: If you ever start to feel too good about yourself, they have this thing called the Internet, and you can find a lot of people there who don't like you.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Golden Globes Acceptance Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: If you are capable people are happy to play with you.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Interview from Second City, 2008

wisdom.quote: You can be a little bit darker and rougher on the stage, partly because when you're in the theater, people have come to see you, and so they kind of know what they're in for. In television, you are sort of sneaking into people's homes. So, I think you can be a little bit darker on stage.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Interview from Second City, 2008

wisdom.quote: It's harder to make something good when you can't curse all the time.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Max 60 Seconds, 2008

wisdom.quote: Confidence is 10% hard work and 90% delusion.
wisdom.author: Tina Fey, Vogue Interview, 2010

wisdom.quote: Women and men have to fight together to change society - and both will benefit... Partnership, not dependence, is the real romance in marriage.
wisdom.author: Muriel Fox

wisdom.quote: We must get beyond textbooks, go out into the bypaths... and tell the world the glories of our journey.
wisdom.author: John Hope Franklin

wisdom.quote: Music is the wine that fills the cup of silence.
wisdom.author: Robert Fripp

wisdom.quote: Whenever I hear, 'It can't be done,' I know I'm close to success.
wisdom.author: Michael Flatley, (Lord of the Dance) quoted by Eric Celeste

wisdom.quote: Let's assume that each person has an equal opportunity, not to become equal, but to become different. To realize whatever unique potential of body, mind and spirit he or she possesses.
wisdom.author: John Fischer

wisdom.quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for Nature cannot be fooled.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: I believe that a scientist looking at nonscientific problems is just as dumb as the next guy.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: Philosophers say a great deal about what is absolutely necessary for science, and it is always, so far as one can see, rather naive, and probably wrong.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: Physicists like to think that all you have to do is say, these are the conditions, now what happens next?
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: There are 10^11 stars in the galaxy. That used to be a huge number. But it's only a hundred billion. It's less than the national deficit! We used to call them astronomical numbers. Now we should call them economical numbers.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: You can know the name of a bird in all the languages of the world, but when you're finished, you'll know absolutely nothing whatever about the bird... So let's look at the bird and see what it's doing -- that's what counts. I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman

wisdom.quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself - and you are the easiest person to fool.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman, Caltech commencement address, 1974

wisdom.quote: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Armando Garcia J, December 11, 1985

wisdom.quote: There is no harm in doubt and skepticism, for it is through these that new discoveries are made.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Armando Garcia J, December 11, 1985

wisdom.quote: No problem is too small or too trivial if we can really do something about it.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Koichi Mano

wisdom.quote: The worthwhile problems are the ones you can really solve or help solve, the ones you can really contribute something to.
wisdom.author: Richard Feynman, Letter to Koichi Mano, February 3, 1966

wisdom.quote: A newspaper consists of just the same number of words, whether there be any news in it or not.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: A truly elegant taste is generally accompanied with excellency of heart.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: He that can heroically endure adversity will bear prosperity with equal greatness of the soul; for the mind that cannot be dejected by the former is not likely to be transported without the latter.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: Make money your god and it will plague you like the devil.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: Now, in reality, the world have paid too great a compliment to critics, and have imagined them to be men of much greater profundity than they really are.
wisdom.author: Henry Fielding

wisdom.quote: A thing worth having is a thing worth cheating for.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: I always keep a supply of stimulant handy in case I see a snake--which I also keep handy.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: I never vote for anyone; I always vote against.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: I've never struck a woman in my life, not even my own mother.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: Some weasel took the cork out of my lunch.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields

wisdom.quote: Last week, I went to Philadelphia, but it was closed.
wisdom.author: W. C. Fields, in Richard J. Anobile - "Godfrey Daniels"

wisdom.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is the expectation of too great a happiness.
wisdom.author: Fontenelle

wisdom.quote: A true philosopher is like an elephant; he never puts the second foot down until the first one is solidly in place.
wisdom.author: Fontenelle

wisdom.quote: If I have learnt anything, it is that life forms no logical patterns. It is haphazard and full of beauties which I try to catch as they fly by, for who knows whether any of them will ever return?
wisdom.author: Margot Fonteyn

wisdom.quote: He is not only dull himself, but the cause of dullness in others.
wisdom.author: Samuel Foote

wisdom.quote: At 18 our convictions are hills from which we look; At 45 they are caves in which we hide.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

wisdom.quote: In a real dark night of the soul it is always three o'clock in the morning, day after day.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, "The Crack-Up" (1936)

wisdom.quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, "The Crack-Up" (1936)

wisdom.quote: Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, Tender is the Night

wisdom.quote: Action is character.
wisdom.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Last Tycoon, 1941

wisdom.quote: Nothing shocks me. I'm a scientist.
wisdom.author: Harrison Ford, as Indiana Jones

wisdom.quote: We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
wisdom.author: Harrison Ford, quoted by Garry Jenkins in 'Harrison Ford: Imperfect Hero'

wisdom.quote: If the government is big enough to give you everything you want, it is big enough to take away everything you have.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford

wisdom.quote: Things are more like they are now than they have ever been.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford

wisdom.quote: In a political sense, there is one problem that currently underlies all of the others. That problem is making Government sufficiently responsive to the people. If we dont make government responsive to the people, we dont make it believable. And we must make government believable if we are to have a functioning democracy.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford, Address at Jacksonville University, December 16, 1971

wisdom.quote: I believe that truth is the glue that holds government together, not only our government but civilization itself.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford, Inaugural Address, 9 August 1974

wisdom.quote: Our constitution works. Our great republic is a government of laws, not of men.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford, on becoming President, Aug. 9, 1974

wisdom.quote: I believe that truth is the glue that holds government together , not only our government but civilization itself. That bond, though strained, is unbroken at home and abroad.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford, Remarks on taking the oath of office, August 9, 1974`

wisdom.quote: The American wage earner and the American housewife are a lot better economists than most economists care to admit. They know that a government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have.
wisdom.author: Gerald R. Ford, Remarks to a Joint Session of Congress, August 12, 1974

wisdom.quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: By the time we've made it, we've had it.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: If you don't know what to do with many of the papers piled on your desk, stick a dozen colleagues' initials on 'em, and pass them along. When in doubt, route.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: It's so much easier to suggest solutions when you don't know too much about the problem.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: Keeping score of old scores and scars, getting even and one-upping, always make you less than you are.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: Men who never get carried away should be.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: There is never enough time, unless you're serving it.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes

wisdom.quote: Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
wisdom.author: Malcolm Forbes, in Forbes Magazine

wisdom.quote: What's right about America is that although we have a mess of problems, we have great capacity - intellect and resources - to do some thing about them.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford II

wisdom.quote: Never try to tell everything you know. It may take too short a time.
wisdom.author: Norman Ford

wisdom.quote: We're not lost. We're locationally challenged.
wisdom.author: John M. Ford

wisdom.quote: History is a voice forever sounding across the centuries the laws of right and wrong. Opinions alter, manners change, creeds rise and fall, but the moral law is written on the tablets of eternity.
wisdom.author: James A. Forude

wisdom.quote: Always hold your head up, but be careful to keep your nose at a friendly level.
wisdom.author: Max L. Forman

wisdom.quote: When I'm not doing something that comes deeply from me, I get bored. When I get bored I get distracted and when I get distracted, I become depressed. It's a natural resistance, and it insures your integrity.
wisdom.author: Maria Irene Fornes

wisdom.quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.quote: Don't simply retire from something; have something to retire to.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things done.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.quote: Hold a picture of yourself long and steadily enough in your mind's eye, and you will be drawn toward it.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.quote: The world is moving so fast these days that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.quote: Freedom is just Chaos, with better lighting.
wisdom.author: Alan Dean Foster, "To the Vanishing Point"

wisdom.quote: No one who cannot rejoice in the discovery of his own mistakes deserves to be called a scholar.
wisdom.author: Donald Foster

wisdom.quote: There's an evolutionary imperative why we give a crap about our family and friends. And there's an evolutionary imperative why we don't give a crap about anybody else. If we loved all people indiscriminately, we couldn't function.
wisdom.author: David Foster, House M.D., TB or Not TB, 2005

wisdom.quote: We are who people think we are.
wisdom.author: David Foster, House M.D., TB or Not TB, 2005

wisdom.quote: Normal is not something to aspire to, it's something to get away from.
wisdom.author: Jodie Foster

wisdom.quote: Men are not against you; they are merely for themselves.
wisdom.author: Gene Fowler

wisdom.quote: Life is consciousness.
wisdom.author: Emmet Fox

wisdom.quote: There is no difficulty that enough love will not conquer; no disease that enough love will not heal; no door that enough love will not open.
wisdom.author: Emmet Fox

wisdom.quote: As the archaeology of our thought easily shows, man is an invention of recent date. And one perhaps nearing its end.
wisdom.author: Michel Foucault

wisdom.quote: To become acquainted with kindness one must be prepared to learn new things and feel new feelings. Kindness is more than a philosophy of the mind. It is a philosophy of the spirit.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Furey

wisdom.quote: A gift, with a kind countenance, is a double present.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Anger is one of the sinners of the soul.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Be a friend to thyself, and others will be so too.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Be not extravagantly high in expression of thy commendations of men thou likest, it may make the hearer's stomach rise.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Enquire not what boils in another's pot.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: He that will not sail until all dangers are over, will never put to sea.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: If it were not for hope, the heart would break.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: If thou are a master, be sometimes blind; if a servant, sometimes deaf.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: If we are bound to forgive an enemy, we are not bound to trust him.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: If you are too fortunate, you will not know yourself. If you are too unfortunate, nobody will know you.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Judge of thine improvement, not by what thou speakest or writest, but by the firmness of thy mind, and the government of thy passions and affections.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Learning makes a man fit company for himself.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Many would be cowards if they had courage enough.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Purchase not friends by gifts; when thou ceasest to give, such will cease to love.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Some have been thought brave because they were afraid to run away.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: The great end of life is not knowledge, but action.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Trust thyself only, and another shall not betray thee.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: Know most of the rooms of thy native country before thou goest over the threshold thereof.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller, 'The Holy State and the Profane State,' 1642

wisdom.quote: But the body is deeper than the soul and its secrets inscrutable.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster

wisdom.quote: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster

wisdom.quote: Have you ever noticed that there are people who do things which are most indelicate, and yet at the same time - beautiful?
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster, "A Room with a View"

wisdom.quote: Pathos, piety, courage, � they exist, but are identical, and so is filth. Everything exists, nothing has value.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster, A Passage to India, 1924

wisdom.quote: I would rather be a coward than brave because people hurt you when you are brave.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster, as a small child

wisdom.quote: Life is indeed dangerous, but not in the way morality would have us believe. It is indeed unmanageable, but the essence of it is not a battle. It is unmanageable because it is a romance, and its essence is romantic beauty.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster, Howards End

wisdom.quote: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.
wisdom.author: E. M. Forster, Two Cheers for Democracy, 1951

wisdom.quote: Obscurity is a good thing. You can fail in obscurity. It removes the fear of failure.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Projections are bullshit. They're just guesses. Wait until the real thing happens and then when it happens, then you can make the decision. Make decisions when you have a lot of information to make the decision. Not when you have to guess about what the decision is going to be or use data that doesn't exist yet.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: The closer you are to your money, the better off you'll be.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: There's nothing wrong with staying small. You can do big things with a small team.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: You don't need a lot of the stuff you think you need.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: You don't need to outdo the competition. It's expensive and defensive. Underdo your competition. We need more simplicity and clarity.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: You want more constraints on you. You want to embrace constraints. Don't try to use resources to get them out of the way.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: You don�t need to win every medal to be successful.
wisdom.author: Jason Fried, Signal Vs. Noise, 08-22-06

wisdom.quote: All Fords are exactly alike, but no two men are just alike. Every new life is a new thing under the sun; there has never been anything just like it before, never will be again. A young man ought to get that idea about himself; he should look for the single spark of individuality that makes him different from other folks, and develop that for all he is worth. Society and schools may try to iron it out of him; their tendency is to put it all in the same mold, but I say don't let that spark be lost; it is your only real claim to importance.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: An idealist is a person who helps other people to be prosperous.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: History is more or less bunk.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: I am looking for a lot of men who have an infinite capacity to not know what can't be done.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. the only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: People can have the Model T in any colour--so long as it's black.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: The question, "Who ought to be boss?" is like asking "Who ought to be the tenor in the quartet?" Obviously, the man who can sing tenor.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wages possible.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford

wisdom.quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: History is more or less bunk. It's tradition. We don't want tradition. We want to live in the present and the only history that is worth a tinker's dam is the history we made today.
wisdom.author: Henry Ford, Interview in Chicago Tribune, May 25th, 1916

wisdom.quote: Quotation ... A writer expresses himself in words that have been used before because they give his meaning better than he can give it himself, or because they are beautiful or witty, or because he expects them to touch a cord of association in his reader, or because he wishes to show that he is learned and well read. Quotations due to the last motive are invariably ill-advised; the discerning reader detects it and is contemptuous; the undiscerning is perhaps impressed, but even then is at the same time repelled, pretentious quotations being the surest road to tedium.
wisdom.author: Henry W. Fowler, A Dictionary of Modern English Usage (1926)

wisdom.quote: If you ever start feeling like you have the goofiest, craziest, most dysfunctional family in the world, all you have to do is go to a state fair. Because five minutes at the fair, you'll be going, 'you know, we're alright. We are dang near royalty.'
wisdom.author: Jeff Foxworthy

wisdom.quote: My whole career can be summed up with 'Ignorance is bliss.' When you do not know better, you do not really worry about failing.
wisdom.author: Jeff Foxworthy

wisdom.quote: The problem with the designated driver program, it's not a desirable job, but if you ever get sucked into doing it, have fun with it. At the end of the night, drop them off at the wrong house.
wisdom.author: Jeff Foxworthy

wisdom.quote: There's a whole segment of the population with a mentality that bases good times on where they can go and what they can buy.
wisdom.author: Jeff Foxworthy

wisdom.quote: Pleasure and love are the pinions of great deeds.
wisdom.author: Charles Fox

wisdom.quote: Health nuts are going to feel stupid someday, lying in hospitals dying of nothing.
wisdom.author: Redd Foxx

wisdom.quote: I think there's a god and I know it's not me.
wisdom.author: Michael J. Fox, Good Housekeeping,  June 2011

wisdom.quote: If Spirituality is that you're humble in the face of forces greater than you and you believe those forces are more inclined toward being good than being bad, then I'm a spiritual person.
wisdom.author: Michael J. Fox, Good Housekeeping,  June 2011

wisdom.quote: There's a rule in acting called, "Don't play the result." If you have a character who's going to end up in a certain place, don't play that until you get there. Play each scene and each beat as it comes. And that's what you do in life: You don't play the result.
wisdom.author: Michael J. Fox, Good Housekeeping,  June 2011

wisdom.quote: One's dignity may be assaulted, vandalized and cruelly mocked, but cannot be taken away unless it is surrendered.
wisdom.author: Michael J. Fox, in "Saving Milly" by Morton Kondrake

wisdom.quote: I am careful not to confuse excellence with perfection. Excellence, I can reach for; perfection is God's business.
wisdom.author: Michael J. Fox, quoted by Lorne A. Adrain in 'The Most Important Thing I Know'

wisdom.quote: A quotation in a speech, article or book is like a rifle in the hands of an infantryman. It speaks with authority.
wisdom.author: Brendan Francis

wisdom.quote: If you greatly desire something, have the guts to stake everything on obtaining it.
wisdom.author: Brendan Francis

wisdom.quote: If you have a talent, use it in every which way possible. Don't hoard it. Don't dole it out like a miser. Spend it lavishly like a millionaire intent on going broke.
wisdom.author: Brendan Francis

wisdom.quote: People who ask our advice almost never take it. Yet we should never refuse to give it, upon request, for it often helps us to see our own way more clearly.
wisdom.author: Brendan Francis

wisdom.quote: A bully is not reasonable - he is persuaded only by threats.
wisdom.author: Marie De France, 12th Century

wisdom.quote: The worst thing about Europe is that you can't go out in the middle of the night and get a Slurpee.
wisdom.author: Tellis Frank

wisdom.quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
wisdom.author: Anne Frank, Diary of a Young Girl, 1952

wisdom.quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
wisdom.author: Anne Frank, Diary of a Young Girl, 1952

wisdom.quote: The biases the media has are much bigger than conservative or liberal. They're about getting ratings, about making money, about doing stories that are easy to cover.
wisdom.author: Al Franken, "Lies and the Lying Liars who Tell Them", 2003

wisdom.quote: Mistakes are a part of being human. Appreciate your mistakes for what they are: precious life lessons that can only be learned the hard way. Unless it's a fatal mistake, which, at least, others can learn from.
wisdom.author: Al Franken, "Oh, the Things I Know", 2002

wisdom.quote: When you encounter seemingly good advice that contradicts other seemingly good advice, ignore them both.
wisdom.author: Al Franken, "Oh, the Things I Know", 2002

wisdom.quote: It's easier to put on slippers than to carpet the whole world.
wisdom.author: Al Franken, 'Stuart Saves His Family'

wisdom.quote: I�m good enough, I�m smart enough, and dog-gone it, people like me.
wisdom.author: Al Franken, Stuart Smalley in Saturday Night Live, catchphrase

wisdom.quote: Diplomacy without arms is like music without instruments.
wisdom.author: Frederick the Great

wisdom.quote: If my soldiers were to begin to think, not one would remain in the ranks.
wisdom.author: Frederick The Great

wisdom.quote: Affirmations are like prescriptions for certain aspects of yourself you want to change.
wisdom.author: Jerry Frankhauser

wisdom.quote: Fragile as reason is and limited as law is as the institutionalised medium of reason, that's all we have between us and the tyranny of mere will and the cruelty of unbridled, undisciplined feelings.
wisdom.author: Felix Frankfurter

wisdom.quote: Our generation is realistic, for we have come to know man as he really is. After all, man is that being who invented the gas chambers of Auschwitz; however, he is also that being who entered those gas chambers upright, with the Lord's Prayer or the Shema Yisrael on his lips.
wisdom.author: Viktor Frankl, "Logotherapy in a Nutshell" Man's Search for Meaning (1959, 1962, 1985)

wisdom.quote: Don't aim at success - the more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it. For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue... as the unintended side-effect of one's personal dedication to a course greater than oneself.
wisdom.author: Viktor Frankl, Man's Search For Meaning

wisdom.quote: I grasped the meaning of the greatest secret that human poetry and human thought and belief have to impart: The salvation of man is through love and in love.
wisdom.author: Viktor Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

wisdom.quote: To say something nice about yourself, this is the hardest thing in the world for people to do. They'd rather take their clothes off.
wisdom.author: Nancy Friday

wisdom.quote: Life is full of obstacle illusions.
wisdom.author: Grant Frazier

wisdom.quote: Never knock on Death's door: ring the bell and run away! Death really hates that!
wisdom.author: Matt Frewer, as Dr. Mike Stratford in "Doctor, Doctor"

wisdom.quote: A person is never happy except at the price of some ignorance.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: An education isn't how much you have committed to memory, or even how much you know. It's being able to differentiate between what you do know and what you don't.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: If fifty million people say a foolish thing, it is still a foolish thing.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: It is better to understand little than to misunderstand a lot.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: So long as society is founded on injustice, the function of the laws will be to defend injustice. And the more unjust they are the more respectable they will seem.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: The average man, who does not know what to do with his life, wants another one which will last forever.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: To accomplish great things we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: To be willing to die for an idea is to set a rather high price on conjecture.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: To know is nothing at all; to imagine is everything.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: When a thing has been said and well, have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.quote: Man is so made that he can only find relaxation from one kind of labor by taking up another.
wisdom.author: Anatole France, The Crime of Sylvestre Bonnard

wisdom.quote: People who have no weaknesses are terrible; there is no way of taking advantage of them.
wisdom.author: Anatole France, The Crime of Sylvestre Bonnard

wisdom.quote: The whole art of teaching is only the art of awakening the natural curiosity of young minds for the purpose of satisfying it afterwards.
wisdom.author: Anatole France, The Crime of Sylvestre Bonnard

wisdom.quote: The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.
wisdom.author: Anatole France, The Red Lily, 1894, chapter 7

wisdom.quote: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence but it comes from within.  It is there all the time.
wisdom.author: Anna Freud

wisdom.quote: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence, but it comes from within. It is there all the time.
wisdom.author: Anna Freud

wisdom.quote: If you really want to do something, you do it. You don't save it for a sound bite.
wisdom.author: Liz Friedman, House M.D., Hunting, 2005

wisdom.quote: A conclusion is the place where you got tired of thinking.
wisdom.author: Harold Fricklestein

wisdom.quote: The direct use of force is such a poor solution to any problem, it is generally employed only by small children and large nations.
wisdom.author: David Friedman

wisdom.quote: Never give a party if you will be the most interesting person there.
wisdom.author: Mickey Friedman

wisdom.quote: Genius without education is like silver in the mine.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Glass, china, and reputation are easily cracked, and never well mended.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: God heals, and the doctor takes the fees.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Having been poor is no shame, but being ashamed of it, is.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He is ill clothed that is bare of virtue.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that blows the coals in quarrels that he has nothing to do with, has no right to complain if the sparks fly in his face.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that falls in love with himself will have no rivals.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: He that would live in peace and at ease, must not speak all he knows nor judge all he sees.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made. What's a sun-dial in the shade?
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: How many observe Christ's birthday! How few, his precepts! O! 'tis easier to keep Holidays than Commandments.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: I am in the prime of senility.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If a man empties his purse into his head no one can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If you know how to spend less than you get, you have the philosopher's stone.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If you would be wealthy, think of saving as well as getting.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If you would know the value of money, go try to borrow some; for he that goes a-borrowing goes a-sorrowing.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead and rotten, either write something worth reading or do things worth the writing.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: A countryman between two lawyers is like a fish between two cats.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: A good conscience is a continual Christmas.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: A slip of the foot you may soon recover, but a slip of the tongue you may never get over.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: All human situations have their inconveniences. We feel those of the present but neither see nor feel those of the future; and hence we often make troublesome changes without amendment, and frequently for the worse.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: All would live long, but none would be old.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Anger is never without Reason, but seldom with a good One.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: At 20 years of age the will reigns, at 30 the wit, at 40 the judgment.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: At twenty years of age the will reigns; at thirty the wit; at forty the judgement.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Be civil to all; sociable to many; familiar with few; friend to one; enemy to none.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Beware of the young doctor and the old barber.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: By my rambling digressions I perceive myself to be growing old.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Content makes poor men rich; discontentment makes rich men poor.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Drive thy business or it will drive thee.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Educate your children to self-control, to the habit of holding passion and prejudice and evil tendencies subject to an upright and reasoning will, and you have done much to abolish misery from their future and crimes from society.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Employ thy time well, if thou meanest to get leisure.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: An unhurried sense of time is in itself a form of wealth.
wisdom.author: Bonnie Friedman, in New York Times

wisdom.quote: A society that puts equality... ahead of freedom will end up with neither.
wisdom.author: Milton Friedman

wisdom.quote: Governments never learn. Only people learn.
wisdom.author: Milton Friedman

wisdom.quote: Hell hath no fury like a bureaucrat scorned.
wisdom.author: Milton Friedman

wisdom.quote: In a bureaucratic system, useless work drives out useful work.
wisdom.author: Milton Friedman

wisdom.quote: The scientific name for an animal that doesn't either run from or fight its enemies is lunch.
wisdom.author: Michael Friedman

wisdom.quote: He's turned his life around. He used to be depressed and miserable. Now he's miserable and depressed.
wisdom.author: David Frost

wisdom.quote: Television enables you to be entertained in your home by people you wouldn't have in your home.
wisdom.author: David Frost

wisdom.quote: [The television is] an invention that permits you to be entertained in your living room by people you wouldn't have in your home.
wisdom.author: David Frost

wisdom.quote: If you limit your choices only to what seems possible or reasonable, you disconnect yourself from what you truly want, and all that is left is a compromise.
wisdom.author: Robert Fritz

wisdom.quote: But in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Letter to Jean Baptiste Le Roy (1789)

wisdom.quote: Take it from Richard, poor and lame, what's begun in anger ends in shame.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanac

wisdom.quote: Fish and visitors smell in three days.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanack, 1736

wisdom.quote: To lengthen thy life, lessen thy meals.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanack, 1737

wisdom.quote: Wish not so much to live long as to live well.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanack, 1738

wisdom.quote: Creditors have better memories than debtors.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard�s Almanac (1758)

wisdom.quote: Technology is a way of organizing the universe so that man doesn't have to experience it.
wisdom.author: Max Frisch

wisdom.quote: Time does not change us. It just unfolds us.
wisdom.author: Max Frisch

wisdom.quote: If you wouldst live long, live well, for folly and wickedness shorten life.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If your head is wax, don't walk in the sun.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Love your enemies; for they shall tell you all your faults.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Old boys have their playthings as well as young ones; the difference is only in the price.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Rebellion to tyrants is obedience to God.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Remember not only to say the right thing in the right place, but far more difficult still, to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Search others for their virtues, thyself for thy vices.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Sloth makes all things difficult, but industry, all things easy. He that rises late must trot all day, and shall scarce overtake his business at night, while laziness travels so slowly that poverty soon overtakes him.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: So convenient a thing it is to be a reasonable creature, since it enables one to find or make a reason for everything one has a mind to do.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: There is no kind of dishonesty into which otherwise good people more easily and frequently fall than that of defrauding the government.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Well done is better than well said.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Were it offered to my choice, I should have no objection to a repetition of the same life from its beginning, only asking the advantages authors have in a second edition to correct some faults in the first.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Who is wise? He that learns from every One. Who is powerful? He that governs his Passions. Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: You may delay, but time will not.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that's the stuff life is made of.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, 'Poor Richard's Almanack,' June 1746

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the history of the errors of mankind, all things considered, is more valuable and interesting than that of their discoveries. Truth is uniform and narrow; it constantly exists, and does not seem to require so much an active energy, as a passive aptitude of the soul in order to encounter it. But error is endlessly diversified; it has no reality, but is the pure and simple creation of the mind that invents it. In this field the soul has room enough to expand herself, to display all her boundless faculties, and all her beautiful and interesting extravagancies and absurdities.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, from his report to the King of France on Animal Magnetism, 1784

wisdom.quote: America is a mistake, a giant mistake.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: Everywhere I go I find a poet has been there before me.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: Innately, children seem to have little true realistic anxiety. They will run along the brink of water, climb on the window sill, play with sharp objects and with fire, in short, do everything that is bound to damage them and to worry those in charge of them, that is wholly the result of education; for they cannot be allowed to make the instructive experiences themselves.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: Men are more moral than they think and far more immoral than they can imagine.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: The goal of all life is death.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud

wisdom.quote: Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Anatomy is destiny.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud, Collected Writings, 1924

wisdom.quote: We are certainly getting ahead; if I am Moses, then you are Joshua and will take possession of the promised land of psychiatry, which I shall only be able to glimpse from afar.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud, Letter to Carl Jung, January 17, 1909

wisdom.quote: The more the fruits of knowledge become accessible to men, the more widespread is the decline of religious belief.
wisdom.author: Sigmund Freud, The Future of an Illusion (1927)

wisdom.quote: A girl should not expect special privileges because of her sex but neither should she adjust to prejudice and discrimination.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: A woman has got to be able to say, and not feel guilty, 'Who am I, and what do I want out of life?' She mustn't feel selfish and neurotic if she wants goals of her own, outside of husband and children.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: Aging is not 'lost youth' but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: I never set out to write a book to change women's lives, to change history. It's like, 'Who, me?' Yes, me. I did it. And I'm not that different from other women. ... Maybe my power and glory was that I could speak my truth as a woman and it was the truth of every woman.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: If divorce has increased by one thousand percent, don't blame the women's movement. Blame the obsolete sex roles on which our marriages were based.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: Instead of fulfilling the promise of infinite orgasmic bliss, sex in the America of the feminine mystique is becoming a strangely joyless national compulsion, if not a contemptuous mockery.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: It is better for a woman to compete impersonally in society, as men do, than to compete for dominance in her own home with her husband, compete with her neighbors for empty status, and so smother her son that he cannot compete at all.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: It is easier to live through someone else than to become complete yourself.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: Men are not the enemy, but the fellow victims. The real enemy is women's denigration of themselves.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: Strange new problems are being reported in the growing generations of children whose mothers were always there, driving them around, helping them with their homework - an inability to endure pain or discipline or pursue any self-sustained goal of any sort, a devastating boredom with life.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: The problem lay buried, unspoken for many years in the minds of American women. It was a strange stirring, a sense of dissatisfaction, a yearning that women suffered in the middle of the twentieth century in the United States. Each suburban housewife struggled with it alone. As she made the beds, shopped for groceries, matched slipcover material, ate peanut butter sandwiches with her children, chauffeured Cub Scouts and Brownies, lay beside her husband at night, she was afraid to ask even of herself the silent question: 'Is this all?'
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: The problem that has no name - which is simply the fact that American women are kept from growing to their full human capacities - is taking a far greater toll on the physical and mental health of our country than any known disease.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: There needs to be bolder thinking, ... on how to measure the quality of life of men and women in the work force. Currently, success is measured by material advancements. We need to readjust the definition of success to account for time outside of work and satisfaction of life, not just the dollars-and-cents bottom line.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: When she stopped conforming to the conventional picture of femininity she finally began to enjoy being a woman.
wisdom.author: Betty Friedan

wisdom.quote: Love is union with somebody, or something, outside oneself, under the condition of retaining the separateness and integrity of one's own self.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm

wisdom.quote: Man's main task in life is to give birth to himself, to become what he potentially is.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm

wisdom.quote: Man's main task is to give birth to himself.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm

wisdom.quote: The history of man is a graveyard of great cultures that came to catastrophic ends because of their incapacity for planned, rational, voluntary reaction to challenge.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm

wisdom.quote: The most beautiful as well as the most ugly inclinations of man are not part of a fixed biologically given human nature, but result from the social process which creates man.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm

wisdom.quote: That man can destroy life is just as miraculous a feat as that he can create it, for life is the miracle, the inexplicable. In the act of destruction, man sets himself above life; he transcends himself as a creature. Thus, the ultimate choice for a man, inasmuch as he is driven to transcend himself, is to create or to destroy, to love or to hate.
wisdom.author: Erich Fromm, The Sane Society

wisdom.quote: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: I'm against a homogenized society, because I want the cream to rise.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The best things and the best people rise out of their separateness; I'm against a homogenized society because I want the cream to rise.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The best way out is always through.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The middle of the road is where the white line is-and that's the worst place to drive.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: The world is full of willing people, some willing to work, the rest willing to let them.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: You can be a rank insider as well as a rank outsider.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.quote: I never dared to be radical when young For fear it would make me conservative when old.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, 'Ten Mills,' A Further Range, 1936

wisdom.quote: A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: I never dared to be radical when young,  For fear it would make me conservative when old.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, Precaution, 1936

wisdom.quote: The woods are lovely, dark, and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening

wisdom.quote: Whose woods these are I think I know. His house is in the village though; He will not see me stopping here To watch his woods fill up with snow.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening

wisdom.quote: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, The Black Cottage

wisdom.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I-- I took the one less traveled by,  And that has made all the difference.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost, The Road Not Taken

wisdom.quote: Experience teaches slowly and at the cost of mistakes.
wisdom.author: James A. Froude

wisdom.quote: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.
wisdom.author: James A. Froude

wisdom.quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one.
wisdom.author: James A. Froude

wisdom.quote: How to Raise your I.Q. by Eating Gifted Children
wisdom.author: Lewis B. Frumkes, Book Title (1983)

wisdom.quote: I have seen the future and it doesn't work.
wisdom.author: Robert Fulford

wisdom.quote: The more things change, the more they remain... insane.
wisdom.author: Michael Fry and T. Lewis, Over the Hedge, 05-09-04

wisdom.quote: In a democracy dissent is an act of faith. Like medicine, the test of its value is not in its taste, but in its effects.
wisdom.author: J. William Fulbright

wisdom.quote: We must dare to think about "unthinkable things" because when things become "unthinkable" thinking stops and action becomes mindless.
wisdom.author: J. William Fulbright

wisdom.quote: It is not our affluence, or our plumbing, or our clogged freeways that grip the imagination of others. Rather, it is the values upon which our system is built. These values imply our adherence not only to liberty and individual freedom, but also to international peace, law and order, and constructive social purpose. When we depart from these value, we do so at our peril.
wisdom.author: J. William Fulbright, Remarks in the Senate, June 29, 1961

wisdom.quote: The citizen who criticizes his country is paying it an implied tribute.
wisdom.author: J. William Fulbright, Speech to the American Newspaper Publishers Assn. April 28, 1966

wisdom.quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles at it.
wisdom.author: Margaret Fuller

wisdom.quote: Male and female represent the two sides of the great radical dualism. But in fact they are perpetually passing into one another. Fluid hardens to solid, solid rushes to fluid. There is no wholly masculine man, no purely feminine woman.
wisdom.author: Margaret Fuller, Woman in the Nineteenth Century, 1845

wisdom.quote: The grass is not, in fact, always greener on the other side of the fence. Fences have nothing to do with it. The grass is greenest where it is watered. When crossing over fences, carry water with you and tend the grass wherever you may be.
wisdom.author: Robert Fulghum, It Was on Fire When I Lay Down on It

wisdom.quote: I find nothing more depressing than optimism.
wisdom.author: Paul Fussell

wisdom.quote: Life is a risk.
wisdom.author: Diane Von Furstenberg

wisdom.quote: He that is busy is tempted by but one devil; he that is idle, by a legion.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Beware of telling an improbable truth.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: All things are difficult before they are easy.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Bacchus hath drowned more men than Neptune.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Education begins a gentleman, conversation completes him.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Get the facts, or the facts will get you. And when you get them, get them right, or they will get you wrong.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: He that plants trees loves others beside himself.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Let not thy will roar, when thy power can but whisper.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Money is the sinew of love as well as war.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: With foxes we must play the fox.
wisdom.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller, Gnomologia, 1732

wisdom.quote: Children are born true scientists. They spontaneously experiment and experience and reexperience again. They select, combine, and test, seeking to find order in their experiences - "which is the mostest? which is the leastest?" They smell, taste, bite, and touch-test for hardness, softness, springiness, roughness, smoothness, coldness, warmness: they heft, shake, punch, squeeze, push, crush, rub, and try to pull things apart.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: Dare to be naive.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: Everything you've learned in school as "obvious" becomes less and less obvious as you begin to study the universe. For example, there are no solids in the universe. There's not even a suggestion of a solid. There are no absolute continuums. There are no surfaces. There are no straight lines.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: God is a verb.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: Sometimes I think we're alone. Sometimes I think we're not. In either case, the thought is staggering.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: When I'm working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I think only how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.quote: Nature is trying very hard to make us succeed, but nature does not depend on us. We are not the only experiment.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller, Interview, April 30, 1978

wisdom.quote: Either war is obsolete or men are.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller, New Yorker, Jan. 8, 1966

wisdom.quote: Now there is one outstandingly important fact regarding Spaceship Earth, and that is that no instruction book came with it.
wisdom.author: R. Buckminster Fuller, Operating Manual for Spaceship Earth, 1963

wisdom.quote: Of course, our failures are a consequence of many factors, but possibly one of the most important is the fact that society operates on the theory that specialization is the key to success, not realizing that specialization precludes comprehensive thinking.
