wisdom.author: Bell Hooks

wisdom.quote: Life-transforming ideas have always come to me through books.
wisdom.author: Bell Hooks, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
wisdom.author: Victoria Holt

wisdom.quote: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: People seldom become famous for what they say until after they are famous for what they've done.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: Saying what we think gives us a wider conversational range than saying what we know.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: There's always somebody who is paid too much, and taxed too little - and it's always somebody else.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: Those who agree with us may not be right, but we admire their astuteness.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: We may not imagine how our lives could be more frustrating and complex--but Congress can.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is what's left after we've run out of personal opinions.
wisdom.author: Cullen Hightower

wisdom.quote: You cannot fly like an eagle with the wings of a wren.
wisdom.author: William Henry Hudson, Afoot in England, 1909

wisdom.quote: Strong lives are motivated by dynamic purposes.
wisdom.author: Kenneth Hildebrand

wisdom.quote: If you haven't forgiven yourself something, how can you forgive others?
wisdom.author: Dolores Huerta

wisdom.quote: At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities.
wisdom.author: Jean Houston

wisdom.quote: We all have the extraordinary coded within us, waiting to be released.
wisdom.author: Jean Houston

wisdom.quote: With the gift of listening comes the gift of healing.
wisdom.author: Catherine de Hueck

wisdom.quote: A person is always startled when he hears himself seriously called an old man for the first time.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Civilization is the process of reducing the infinite to the finite.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: It is the province of knowledge to speak and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Man is born a predestined idealist, for he is born to act. To act is to affirm the worth of an end, and to persist in affirming the worth of an end is to make an ideal.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Rough work, iconoclasm, but the only way to get at truth.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Science is good furniture for one's upper chamber, if there is common sense below.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Speak clearly, if you speak at all; carve every word before you let it fall.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Take a music bath once or twice a week for a few seasons, and you will find that it is to the soul what the water bath is to the body.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where you stand, as in what direction you are moving.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: To be 70 years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be 40 years old.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: To obtain a man's opinion of you, make him mad.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Truth is tough. It will not break, like a bubble, at a touch; nay, you may kick it about all day like a football, and it will be round and full at evening.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.quote: Life is a fatal complaint, and an eminently contagious one.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, "The Poet at the Breakfast-Table", 1872

wisdom.quote: A thought is often original, though you have uttered it a hundred times.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, The Autocrat of the Breakfast-Table, 1858

wisdom.quote: Don't flatter yourself that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. The nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become. Except in cases of necessity, which are rare, leave your friend to learn unpleasant things from his enemies; they are ready enough to tell them.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, The Autocrat of the Breakfast-Table, 1858

wisdom.quote: Knowledge and timber shouldn't be much used till they are seasoned.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, The Autocrat of the Breakfast-Table, 1858

wisdom.quote: I find the great in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving: To reach the port of heaven, we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it,-but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, The Autocrat of the Breakfast-Table, 1891

wisdom.quote: Any ideas, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill

wisdom.quote: Before success in any man's life he is sure to meet with much temporary defeat and, perhaps, some failure. When defeat overtakes a man, the easiest and most logical thing to do is to quit. That is exactly what the majority of men do.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill

wisdom.quote: Create a definite plan for carrying out your desire and begin at once, whether you are ready or not, to put this plan into action.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill

wisdom.quote: If your imagination leads you to understand how quickly people grant your requests when those requests appeal to their self-interest, you can have practically anything you go after.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill

wisdom.quote: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill

wisdom.quote: No one is ready for a thing until he believes he can acquire it.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Hill, Think and Grow Rich

wisdom.quote: Cease to ask what the morrow will bring forth. And set down as gain each day that Fortune grants.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Force without wisdom falls of its own weight.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: In adversity remember to keep an even mind.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: It is not the rich man you should properly call happy, but him who knows how to use with wisdom the blessings of the gods, to endure hard poverty, and who fears dishonor worse than death, and is not afraid to die for cherished friends or fatherland.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Many brave men lived before Agamemnon; but all are overwhelmed in eternal night, unwept, unknown, because they lack a sacred poet.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Pale Death with impartial tread beats at the poor man's cottage door and at the palaces of kings.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Seize the day, put no trust in the morrow![Carpe diem, quam minimum credula postero.]
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Whoever cultivates the golden mean avoids both the poverty of a hovel and the envy of a palace.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: With you I should love to live, with you be ready to die.
wisdom.author: Horace, Odes

wisdom.quote: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.
wisdom.author: Horace, Satires

wisdom.quote: There is measure in all things.
wisdom.author: Horace, Satires

wisdom.quote: We rarely find anyone who can say he has lived a happy life, and who, content with his life, can retire from the world like a satisfied guest.
wisdom.author: Horace, Satires

wisdom.quote: Lots of folks confuse bad management with destiny.
wisdom.author: Frank McKinney Hubbard

wisdom.quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: I don't generally feel anything until noon; then it's time for my nap.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: I don't know if the presidential candidates are running for the White House or Animal House.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: If you watch a game, it's fun. If you play at it, it's recreation.  If you work at it, it's golf.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: No one party can fool all of the people all of the time; that's why we have two parties.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: People who throw kisses are hopelessly lazy.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.quote: A moment's insight is sometimes worth a lifetime's experience.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: A word is not a crystal, transparent and unchanging, it is the skin of a living thought and may vary greatly in colour and content according to the circumstances and time in which it is used.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: Lawyers spend a great deal of their time shoveling smoke.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: Our test of truth is a reference to either a present or imagined future majority in favour of our view.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: The character of every act depends upon the circumstances in which it is done.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: The mind of a bigot is like the pupil of the eye. The more light you shine on it, the more it will contract.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: To have doubted one's own first principles is the mark of a civilized man.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: To live is to function. That is all there is in living.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: We are all tattooed in our cradles with the beliefs of our tribe; the record may seem superficial, but it is indelible. You cannot educate a man wholly out of superstitious fears which were implanted in his imagination, no matter how utterly his reason may reject them.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: We should be eternally vigilant against attempts to check the expression of opinions that we loathe.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

wisdom.quote: I think that, as life is action and passion, it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of his time at peril of being judged not to have lived
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr., Speech, May 30, 1884

wisdom.quote: Faults are soon copied.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: He who postpones the hour of living rightly is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: He will always be a slave who does not know how to live upon a little.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: I will not add another word.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: If you wish me to weep, you must mourn first yourself.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: Mix a little foolishness with your prudence: It's good to be silly at the right moment.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: Of writing well the source and fountainhead is wise thinking.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: The appearance of right oft leads us wrong.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: There is a measure in everything. There are fixed limits beyond which and short of which right cannot find a resting place.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: With silence favor me. (Favete Linguis)
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: He who has begun has half done. Dare to be wise; begin!
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: He wins every hand who mingles profit with pleasure.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: It is when I struggle to be brief that I become obscure.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: Make money, money by fair means if you can, if not, but any means money.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: Once a word has been allowed to escape, it cannot be recalled.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: The covetous man is ever in want.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: The years as they pass plunder us of one thing after another.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: Think to yourself that every day is your last; the hour to which you do not look forward will come as a welcome surprise.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: To flee vice is the beginning of virtue, and to have got rid of folly is the beginning of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Horace, Epistles

wisdom.quote: The fates have given mankind a patient soul.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: The glorious gifts of the gods are not to be cast aside.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: The outcome of the war is in our hands; the outcome of words is in the council.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: The single best augury is to fight for one's country.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: There is a fullness of all things, even of sleep and love.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: There is a strength in the union even of very sorry men.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Thus have the gods spun the thread for wretched mortals: that they live in grief while they themselves are without cares; for two jars stand on the floor of Zeus of the gifts which he gives, one of evils and another of blessings.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Whoever obeys the gods, to him they particularly listen.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: You will certainly not be able to take the lead in all things yourself, for to one man a god has given deeds of war, and to another the dance, to another lyre and song, and in another wide-sounding Zeus puts a good mind.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Young men's minds are always changeable, but when an old man is concerned in a matter, he looks both before and after.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Zeus does not bring all men's plans to fulfillment.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: A small rock holds back a great wave.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: A young man is embarrassed to question an older one.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: All men have need of the gods.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: All strangers and beggars are from Zeus, and a gift, though small, is precious.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Among all men on the earth bards have a share of honor and reverence, because the muse has taught them songs and loves the race of bards.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: By their own follies they perished, the fools.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Dreams surely are difficult, confusing, and not everything in them is brought to pass for mankind. For fleeting dreams have two gates: one is fashioned of horn and one of ivory. Those which pass through the one of sawn ivory are deceptive, bringing tidings which come to nought, but those which issue from the one of polished horn bring true results when a mortal sees them.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Even his griefs are a joy long after to one that remembers all that he wrought and endured.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Evil deeds do not prosper; the slow man catches up with the swift.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Do thou restrain the haughty spirit in thy breast, for better far is gentle courtesy.
wisdom.author: Homer

wisdom.quote: I detest that man who hides one thing in the depths of his heart, and speaks for another.
wisdom.author: Homer

wisdom.quote: It is equally offensive to speed a guest who would like to stay and to detain one who is anxious to leave.
wisdom.author: Homer

wisdom.quote: A companion's words of persuasion are effective.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: A councilor ought not to sleep the whole night through, a man to whom the populace is entrusted, and who has many responsibilities.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: A generation of men is like a generation of leaves; the wind scatters some leaves upon the ground, while others the burgeoning wood brings forth - and the season of spring comes on. So of men one generation springs forth and another ceases.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: A multitude of rulers is not a good thing. Let there be one ruler, one king.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Even when someone battles hard, there is an equal portion for one who lingers behind, and in the same honor are held both the coward and the brave man; the idle man and he who has done much meet death alike.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Hateful to me as the gates of Hades is that man who hides one thing in his heart and speaks another.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: He knew the things that were and the things that would be and the things that had been before.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: He lives not long who battles with the immortals, nor do his children prattle about his knees when he has come back from battle and the dread fray.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: I too shall lie in the dust when I am dead, but now let me win noble renown.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: If you are very valiant, it is a god, I think, who gave you this gift.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair. But when dogs shame the gray head and gray chin and nakedness of an old man killed, it is the most piteous thing that happens among wretched mortals.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: It is not possible to fight beyond your strength, even if you strive.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: It is not unseemly for a man to die fighting in defense of his country.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: It was built against the will of the immortal gods, and so it did not last for long.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Miserable mortals who, like leaves, at one moment flame with life, eating the produce of the land, and at another moment weakly perish.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Of men who have a sense of honor, more come through alive than are slain, but from those who flee comes neither glory nor any help.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Once harm has been done, even a fool understands it.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Iliad

wisdom.quote: Boldness in itself is genius.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Dreams, goals, ambitions - these are the stuff man uses for fuel.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard

wisdom.quote: The wrong thing to do about any given circumstance or situation is to do nothing.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard

wisdom.quote: You want to raise your child in such a way that you don%uFFFDt have to control him, so that he will be in full possession of himself at all times. Upon that depends his good behavior, his health, his sanity.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, Book: Child Dianetics

wisdom.quote: The only time anyone has ever gotten into serious trouble was when he decided he could do nothing about something.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, Book: Dianetics 55

wisdom.quote: Never regret yesterday. Life is in you today, and you make your tomorrow.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, Book: The Creation of Human Ability

wisdom.quote: There is no national problem in the world today, which cannot be resolved by reason alone.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, Dianetics:  The Modern Science of Mental Health

wisdom.quote: A culture is only as great as its dreams, and its dreams are dreamed by artists.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, Science of Survival

wisdom.quote: It takes truth to live with a swiftly changing world. Nothing less than truth can survive. You cannot survive with anything less than truth.
wisdom.author: L. Ron Hubbard, The Ability Congress - Washington D.C 1957

wisdom.quote: I should rather labor as another's serf, in the home of a man without fortune, one whose livelihood was meager, than rule over all the departed dead.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: It is equally wrong to speed a guest who does not want to go, and to keep one back who is eager. You ought to make welcome the present guest, and send forth the one who wishes to go.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: It is tedious to tell again tales already plainly told.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Look now how mortals are blaming the gods, for they say that evils come from us, but in fact they themselves have woes beyond their share because of their own follies.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: May the gods grant you all things which your heart desires, and may they give you a husband and a home and gracious concord, for there is nothing greater and better than this -when a husband and wife keep a household in oneness of mind, a great woe to their enemies and joy to their friends, and win high renown.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Nothing feebler than a man does the earth raise up, of all the things which breathe and move on the earth, for he believes that he will never suffer evil in the future, as long as the gods give him success and he flourishes in his strength; but when the blessed gods bring sorrows too to pass, even these he bears, against his will, with steadfast spirit, for the thoughts of earthly men are like the day which the father of gods and men brings upon them.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: So it is that the gods do not give all men gifts of grace - neither good looks nor intelligence nor eloquence.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: The gods, likening themselves to all kinds of strangers, go in various disguises from city to city, observing the wrongdoing and the righteousness of men.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: The minds of the everlasting gods are not changed suddenly.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: The wine urges me on, the bewitching wine, which sets even a wise man to singing and to laughing gently and rouses him up to dance and brings forth words which were better unspoken.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: There is a time for many words, and there is also a time for sleep.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: There is nothing more dread and more shameless than a woman who plans such deeds in her heart as the foul deed which she plotted when she contrived her husband's murder.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: We are quick to flare up, we races of men on the earth.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: Wide-sounding Zeus takes away half a man's worth on the day when slavery comes upon him.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: You ought not to practice childish ways, since you are no longer that age.
wisdom.author: Homer, The Odyssey

wisdom.quote: A good listener is usually thinking about something else.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Boys will be boys, and so will a lot of middle-aged men.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Classical music is the kind we keep thinking will turn into a tune.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Don't knock the weather. If it didn't change once in a while, nine out of ten people couldn't start a conversation.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Everything comes to him who waits but a loaned book.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Honesty pays, but it doesn't seem to pay enough to suit some people.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: It is pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness; poverty and wealth have both failed.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: No one can feel as helpless as the owner of a sick goldfish.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Nothing is as irritating as the fellow who chats pleasantly while he's overcharging you.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Now and then an innocent man is sent to the legislature.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: So far I haven't heard of anybody who wants to stop living on account of the cost.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: The only way to entertain some folks is to listen to them.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: The safest way to double your money is to fold it over and put it in your pocket.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: There is plenty of peace in any home where the family doesn't make the mistake of trying to get together.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: There's no secret about success. Did you ever know a successful man who didn't tell you about it?
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.quote: When we lose the right to be different, we lose the privilege to be free.
wisdom.author: Charles Evans Hughes, Address at Faneuil Hall, Boston, Massachusetts, June 17, 1925

wisdom.quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls this adventure Science.
wisdom.author: Edward Powell Hubble, The Nature of Science, 1954

wisdom.quote: Be a fountain, not a drain.
wisdom.author: Rex Hudler, quoted in 'Sports Illustrated'

wisdom.quote: For visions come not to polluted eyes.
wisdom.author: Mary Howitt

wisdom.quote: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family. Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
wisdom.author: Jane Howard, "Families"

wisdom.quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually afraid you will make one.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: The recipe for perpetual ignorance is: be satisfied with your opinions and content with your knowledge.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: To avoid criticism do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Perfection is a road, not a destination. Every time I live, I get an education.
wisdom.author: Burk Hudson

wisdom.quote: We clearly realize that freedom's inner kingdom cannot be touched by exterior attacks.
wisdom.author: Vernon Howard

wisdom.quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
wisdom.author: Vernon Howard

wisdom.quote: You must dare to disassociate yourself from those who would delay your journey... Leave, depart, if not physically, then mentally. Go your own way, quietly, undramatically, and venture toward trueness at last.
wisdom.author: Vernon Howard

wisdom.quote: When I see the elaborate study and ingenuity displayed by women in the pursuit of trifles, I feel no doubt of their capacity for the most herculean undertakings.
wisdom.author: Julia Ward Howe

wisdom.quote: Respect a man, he will do the more.
wisdom.author: James Howell

wisdom.quote: It's the possibility that when you're dead you might still go on hurting that bothers me.
wisdom.author: Keri Hulme, The Bone People, 1983

wisdom.quote: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.
wisdom.author: H. L. Hunt

wisdom.quote: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or unhappiness depends more on the way we meet the events of life than on the nature of those events themselves.
wisdom.author: Alexander Humboldt

wisdom.quote: First it is necessary to stand on your own two feet. But the minute a man finds himself in that position, the next thing he should do is reach out his arms.
wisdom.author: Kristin Hunter, O Magazine, November 2003

wisdom.quote: Designing your product for monetization first, and people second will probably leave you with neither.
wisdom.author: Tara Hunt, HorsePigCow, 07-12-06

wisdom.quote: An undefined problem has an infinite number of solutions.
wisdom.author: Robert A. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: A failure is a man who has blundered, but is not able to cash in on the experience.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: A person may be very secretive and yet have no secrets.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: An ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Don't take life too seriously. You'll never get out of it alive.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Editor: a person employed by a newspaper, whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff, and to see that the chaff is printed.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Enthusiasm is the great hill-climber.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists of not exceeding the limit.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Folks who never do any more than they are paid for, never get paid more than they do.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Folks who never do more than their paid for, never get paid for any more than they do.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Get happiness out of your work or you may never know what happiness is.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort, a little more patience would have achieved success?
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: If men could only know each other, they would neither idolize nor hate.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Life is just one damned thing after another.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Logic is an instrument used for bolstering a prejudice.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Never explain--your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: No man needs a vacation so much as the man who has just had one.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: Art may make a suit of clothes: but nature must produce a man.
wisdom.author: David Hume

wisdom.quote: Beauty in things exist in the mind which contemplates them.
wisdom.author: David Hume

wisdom.quote: Beauty is no quality in things themselves: it exists merely in the mind which contemplates them.
wisdom.author: David Hume

wisdom.quote: Custom is the great guide of human life.
wisdom.author: David Hume

wisdom.quote: Whenever evil befalls us, we ought to ask ourselves, after the first suffering, how we can turn it into good. So shall we take occasion, from one bitter root, to raise perhaps many flowers.
wisdom.author: Leigh Hunt

wisdom.quote: Get pleasure out of life...as much as you can. Nobody ever died from pleasure.
wisdom.author: Sol Hurok

wisdom.quote: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or unhappiness depends far more on the way we meet the events of life, than on the nature of those events themselves.
wisdom.author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

wisdom.quote: There are no trifles in the human story, no trifling leaves on the tree.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: To die is nothing; but it is terrible not to live.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Where the telescope ends the microscope begins, and who can say which has the wider vision?
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Work is the law of life, and to reject it as boredom is to submit to it as torment.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Work, which makes a man free, and thought, which makes him worthy of freedom.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Life's greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables, 1862

wisdom.quote: There is nothing like dream to create the future. Utopia to-day, flesh and blood tomorrow.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables, 1862

wisdom.quote: Love is like a tree, it grows of its own accord, it puts down deep roots into our whole being.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Notre-Dame de Paris

wisdom.quote: Do you know what friendship is... it is to be brother and sister; two souls which touch without mingling, two fingers on one hand.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, The Hunchback of Notre Dame, Chapter 13

wisdom.quote: All formal dogmatic religions are fallacious and must never be accepted by self-respecting persons as final.
wisdom.author: Hypatia of Alexandria

wisdom.quote: Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.
wisdom.author: Hypatia of Alexandria

wisdom.quote: That action is best which procures the greatest happiness.
wisdom.author: Francis Hutcheson

wisdom.quote: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is a visible labor and there is an invisible labor.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is visible labour and there is invisible labour.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: A study can be made against invasion by an army; no stand can be made against invasion by an idea.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Emergencies have always been necessary to progress. It was darkness which produced the lamp. It was fog that produced the compass. It was hunger that drove us to exploration. And it took a depression to teach us the real value of a job.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: He who every morning plans the transaction of the day and follows out that plan, carries a thread that will guide him through the maze of the most busy life. But where no plan is laid, where the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incidence, chaos will soon reign.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: I don't mind what Congress does, as long as they don't do it in the streets and frighten the horses.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: If a writer wrote merely for his time, I would have to break my pen and throw it away.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Popularity? It is glory's small change.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: What a grand thing, to be loved! What a grander thing still, to love!
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Winter is on my head, but eternal spring is in my heart.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, 'Histoire d'un crime,' 1852

wisdom.quote: If suffer we must, let's suffer on the heights.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, 'Les Malheureux'

wisdom.quote: To be a saint is the exception; to be upright is the rule. Err, falter, sin, but be upright. To commit the least possible sin is the law for man. Sin is a gravitation.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, 'Les Miserables'

wisdom.quote: There is always more misery among the lower classes than there is humanity in the higher.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, 'Les Miserables,' 1862

wisdom.quote: He who abandons the field is beaten.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Nothing discernable to the eye of the spirit is more brilliant or obscure than man; nothing is more formidible, complex, mysterious, and infinite. There is a prospect greater than the sea, and it is the sky; there is a prospect greater than the sky, and it is the human soul.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: The quantity of civilization is measured by the quality of imagination.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

wisdom.quote: Vegetarianism is harmless enough, though it is apt to fill a man with wind and self-righteousness.
wisdom.author: Sir Robert Hutchinson

wisdom.quote: Education is a kind of continuing dialogue, and a dialogue assumes, in the nature of the case, different points of view.
wisdom.author: Robert Hutchins

wisdom.quote: Americans detest all lies except lies spoken in public or printed lies.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: Express a mean opinion of yourself occasionally; it will show your friends that you know how to tell the truth.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: If you don't learn to laugh at trouble, you won't have anything to laugh at when you're old.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: Many people would be more truthful were it not for their uncontrollable desire to talk.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: Men have as exaggerated an idea of their rights as women have of their wrongs.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: Most people have seen worse things in private than they pretend to be shocked at in public.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: No man would listen to you talk if he didn't know it was his turn next.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is any thing you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe

wisdom.quote: Abuse a man unjustly, and you will make friends for him.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe, 'Country Town Sayings,' 1911

wisdom.quote: A poem is no place for an idea.
wisdom.author: Edgar Watson Howe, Country Town Sayings, 1911

wisdom.quote: The charity that hastens to proclaim its good deeds, ceases to be charity, and is only pride and ostentation.
wisdom.author: William Hutton

wisdom.quote: In real life, unlike in Shakespeare, the sweetness of the rose depends upon the name it bears. Things are not only what they are. They are, in very important respects, what they seem to be.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: It was once said that the moral test of Government is how that Government treats those who are in the dawn of life, the children; those who are in the twilight of life, the elderly; and those who are in the shadows of life, the sick, the needy and the handicapped.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: There are not enough jails, not enough policemen, not even enough courts too enforce a law not supported by the people.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: You cannot go around and keep score. If you keep score on the good things and the bad things, you'll find out that you're a very miserable person. God gave man the ability to forget, which is one of the greatest attributes you have. Because if you remember everything that's happened to you, you generally remember that which is the most unfortunate.
wisdom.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

wisdom.quote: I am as vulnerable and fragile as it is possible to be. I am shredded to the core. I am at the point where I am stripped bare.
wisdom.author: Rachel Hunter

wisdom.quote: You can't really expect a 22-year-old girl to react the same way as a man 24 years older than her.
wisdom.author: Rachel Hunter, on ex-husband Rod Stewart

wisdom.quote: An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: At least two-thirds of our miseries spring from human stupidity, human malice and those great motivators and justifiers of malice and stupidity: idealism, dogmatism and proselytizing zeal on behalf of religous or political ideas.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: Experience is not what happens to a man. It is what a man does with what happens to him.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: Experience teaches only the teachable.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: If you look up 'Intelligence' in the new volumes of the Encyclopeadia Britannica, you'll find it classified under the following three heads: Intelligence, Human; Intelligence, Animal; Intelligence, Military. My stepfather's a perfect specimen of Intelligence, Military.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: Maybe this world is another planet's hell.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: That all men are equal is a proposition which, at ordinary times, no sane individual has ever given his assent.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: The author of the Iliad is either Homer or, if not Homer, somebody else of the same name.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley

wisdom.quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley, "Music at Night", 1931

wisdom.quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley, "Proper Studies", 1927

wisdom.quote: Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley, "Texts and Pretexts", 1932

wisdom.quote: Death � It�s the only thing we haven�t succeeded in completely vulgarizing.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley, Eyeless in Gaza (1936)

wisdom.quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.
wisdom.author: Aldous Huxley, Vedanta for the Western World, 1945

wisdom.quote: Agnosticism simply means that a man shall not say he knows or believes that for which he has no grounds for professing to believe.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: God give me strength to face a fact though it slay me.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: I have no faith, very little hope, and as much charity as I can afford.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: If a little knowledge is dangerous, where is the man who has so much as to be out of danger.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Irrationally held truths may be more harmful than reasoned errors.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: It is an error to imagine that evolution signifies a constant tendency to increased perfection. That process undoubtedly involves a constant remodelling of the organism in adaptation to new conditions; but it depends on the nature of those conditions whether the directions of the modifications effected shall be upward or downward.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Make up your mind to act decidedly and take the consequences. No good is ever done in this world by hesitation.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Only one absolute certainty is possible to man, namely that at any given moment the feeling which he has exists.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the most valuable result of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it ought to be done, whether you like it or not; it is the first lesson that ought to be learned; and however early a man's training begins, it is probably the last lesson that he learns thoroughly.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Science ... warns me to be careful how I adopt a view which jumps with my preconceptions, and to require stronger evidence for such belief than for one to which I was previously hostile. My business is to teach my aspirations to conform themselves to fact, not to try and make facts harmonize with my aspirations.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Science is nothing but trained and organized common sense, differing from the latter only as a veteran may differ from a raw recruit: and its methods differ from those of common sense only as far as the guardsman's cut and thrust differ from the manner in which a savage wields his club.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion... or you shall learn nothing.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: The deepest sin against the human mind is to believe things without evidence.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: The great tragedy of Science - the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: The strongest man in the world is the man who stands alone.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: There is no greater mistake than the hasty conclusion that opinions are worthless because they are badly argued.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Thoughtfulness for others, generosity, modesty, and self-respect are the qualities which make a real gentleman or lady.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley

wisdom.quote: A man's worst difficulties begin when he is able to do as he likes.
wisdom.author: Thomas H. Huxley, Address on university education, Baltimore, Maryland, September 12, 1876

wisdom.quote: There's nothing like a gleam of humor to reassure you that a fellow human being is ticking inside a strange face.
wisdom.author: Eva Hoffman

wisdom.quote: An envious heart makes a treacherous ear.
wisdom.author: Zora Neale Hurston, "Their Eyes Were Watching God"

wisdom.quote: Mama exhorted her children at every opportunity to 'jump at de sun.' We might not land on the sun, but at least we would get off the ground.
wisdom.author: Zora Neale Hurston, Dust Tracks on a Road, 1942

wisdom.quote: Management is nothing more than motivating other people.
wisdom.author: Lee Iacocca

wisdom.quote: People want economy and they will pay any price to get it.
wisdom.author: Lee Iacocca

wisdom.quote: The speed of the boss is the speed of the team.
wisdom.author: Lee Iacocca

wisdom.quote: The trick is to make sure you don't die waiting for prosperity to come.
wisdom.author: Lee Iacocca

wisdom.quote: There ain't no free lunches in this country. And don't go spending your whole life commiserating that you got raw deals. You've got to say, 'I think that if I keep working at this and want it bad enough I can have it.'
wisdom.author: Lee Iacocca

wisdom.quote: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare,And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.
wisdom.author: Ali ibn-Abi-Talib, A Hundred Sayings

wisdom.quote: The great secret of power is never to will to do more than you can accomplish.
wisdom.author: Henrik Ibsen

wisdom.quote: Castles in the air - they are so easy to take refuge in. And so easy to build, too.
wisdom.author: Henrik Ibsen, "The Master builder", 1892, act 3

wisdom.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands alone.
wisdom.author: Henrik Ibsen, An Enemy of the People, 1882

wisdom.quote: Passion makes the world go round. Love just makes it a safer place.
wisdom.author: Ice T, The Ice Opinion

wisdom.quote: A superstition is a premature explanation that overstays its time.
wisdom.author: George Iles

wisdom.quote: We despair of changing the habits of men, still we would alter institutions, the habits of millions of men.
wisdom.author: George Iles

wisdom.quote: Whoever ceases to be a student has never been a student.
wisdom.author: George Iles

wisdom.quote: Confusion is always the most honest response.
wisdom.author: Marty Indik

wisdom.quote: Too many people think only of their own profit. But business opportunity seldom knocks on the door of self-centered people. No customer ever goes to a store merely to please the storekeeper.
wisdom.author: Kazuo Inamori

wisdom.quote: A nation is a society united by a delusion about its ancestry and by common hatred of its neighbors.
wisdom.author: Dean William R. Inge

wisdom.quote: It had only been my repeated experience that when you said to life calmly and firmly... 'I trust you; do what you must,' life had an uncanny way of responding to your need.
wisdom.author: Olga Ilyin

wisdom.quote: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.
wisdom.author: Eugene Ionesco

wisdom.quote: You can only predict things after they've happened.
wisdom.author: Eugene Ionesco

wisdom.quote: Explanation separates us from astonishment, which is the only gateway to the incomprehensible.
wisdom.author: Eugene Ionesco,  Decouvertes (1969)

wisdom.quote: The way you define yourself as a writer is that you write every time you have a free minute. If you didn't behave that way you would never do anything.
wisdom.author: John Irving

wisdom.quote: Law is order in liberty, and without order liberty is social chaos.
wisdom.author: Archbishop Ireland

wisdom.quote: Comedy is nothing more than tragedy deferred.
wisdom.author: Pico Iyer, Time

wisdom.quote: I grew up in Europe, where the history comes from.
wisdom.author: Eddie Izzard

wisdom.quote: The National Rifle Association says, 'Guns don't kill people. People do'. But I think the gun helps.
wisdom.author: Eddie Izzard

wisdom.quote: If you're choking in a restaurant you can just say the magic words, 'Heimlich maneuver,' and all will be well. Trouble is, it's difficult to say 'Heimlich maneuver' when you're choking to death.
wisdom.author: Eddie Izzard, Dress To Kill

wisdom.quote: A nation is a society united by delusions about its ancestry and by common hatred of its neighbors.
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge

wisdom.quote: Events in the past may be roughly divided into those which probably never happened and those which do not matter.
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge

wisdom.quote: The wise man is he who knows the relative value of things.
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge

wisdom.quote: There is no law of progress. Our future is in our own hands, to make or to mar. It will be an uphill fight to the end, and would we have it otherwise? Let no one suppose that evolution will ever exempt us from struggles. 'You forget,' said the Devil, with a chuckle, 'that I have been evolving too.'
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge

wisdom.quote: Worry is interest paid on trouble before is falls due.
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge

wisdom.quote: It takes in reality only one to make a quarrel. It is useless for the sheep to pass resolutions in favour of vegetarianism while the wolf remains of a different opinion.
wisdom.author: William Ralph Inge, Outspoken Essays (1919)

wisdom.quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
wisdom.author: Robert Ingersoll

wisdom.quote: Any doctrine that will not bear investigation is not a fit tenant for the mind of an honest man.
wisdom.author: Robert Ingersoll

wisdom.quote: Courage without conscience is a wild beast.
wisdom.author: Robert Ingersoll

wisdom.quote: Give to every other human being every right that you claim for yourself.
wisdom.author: Robert Ingersoll

wisdom.quote: There are in nature neither rewards nor punishments, there are consequences.

wisdom.quote: There is no slavery but ignorance.

wisdom.quote: A father may turn his back on his child, � . but a mother's love endures through all.

wisdom.quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: A tart temper never mellows with age, and a sharp tongue is the only edged tool that grows keener with constant use.

wisdom.quote: A tart temper never mellows with age; and a sharp tongue is the only edged tool that grows keener with constant use.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: One reassuring thing about modern art is that things can't be as bad as they are painted.

wisdom.quote: What a child doesn't receive he can seldom later give.

wisdom.quote: But be, as you have been, my happiness...

wisdom.quote: I think that one possible definition of our modern culture is that it is one in which nine-tenths of our intellectuals can't read any poetry.

wisdom.quote: One of the most obvious facts about grownups to a child is that they have forgotten what it is like to be a child.

wisdom.quote: For what I have received, may the Lord make me truly thankful. And more truly for what I have not received.

wisdom.quote: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply, to enjoy simply, to think freely, to risk life, to be needed.

wisdom.quote: There are two ways to pass a hurdle: leaping over or plowing through... There needs to be a monster truck option.

wisdom.quote: Spontaneous kindness is to hipsters as high beams are to deer.

wisdom.quote: The quickest way to a man's heart really is through his stomach, because then you don't have to chop through that pesky rib cage.

wisdom.quote: 'Light fuse and get away' may work for a Roman candle, but not so much for the wrath of a woman scorned.

wisdom.quote: What's the point of havin' a rapier wit if I can't use it to stab people?

wisdom.quote: Bachelor's degrees make pretty good placemats if you get 'em laminated.
wisdom.author: Jeph Jacques, Questionable Content, 01-04-07

wisdom.quote: That's what college is for - getting as many bad decisions as possible out of the way before you're forced into the real world. I keep a checklist of 'em on the wall in my room.

wisdom.quote: A good relationship is like fireworks: loud, explosive, and liable to maim you if you hold on too long.
wisdom.author: Jeph Jacques, Questionable Content, 11-14-08

wisdom.quote: You ought to expect better of people. It encourages you to be a better person yourself.
wisdom.author: Jeph Jacques, Questionable Content, 12-19-2011

wisdom.quote: Your whole life people tell you to do what you love. But if you gotta do something else to pay the bills, you don't automatically have to be miserable.

wisdom.quote: If only corporal punishment cured low self-esteem.
wisdom.author: Jeph Jacques, Questionable Content, She's A Bit of A Pout, author's note, 08-31-11

wisdom.quote: It is the caring and sharing that count�love is not prevented by the things and the time that you haven�t shared.
wisdom.author: Claudia Jewett Jarrett, Adopting the Older Child, 1978

wisdom.quote: One of the common causes of serious difficulty takes the form of parental self-discovery. The newly adopted child brings out submerged feelings or behavior in his parents that make them dislike themselves. This can be such a severe blow to their self- esteem that they must eradicate the cause of their distress. Sometimes the only way that parents are able to do that is by returning the child.
wisdom.author: Claudia Jewett Jarrett, Adopting the Older Child, 1978

wisdom.quote: The best way to learn to be an honest, responsible adult is to live with adults who act honestly and responsibly.
wisdom.author: Claudia Jewett Jarrett, Adopting the Older Child, 1978

wisdom.quote: The first step in blogging is not writing them but reading them.
wisdom.author: Jeff Jarvis, BuzzMachine, 07-10-2006

wisdom.quote: Cats and monkeys; monkeys and cats; all human life is there.

wisdom.quote: Do not mind anything that anyone tells you about anyone else. Judge everyone and everything for yourself.

wisdom.quote: I've always been interested in people, but I've never liked them.

wisdom.quote: It is, I think, an indisputable fact that Americans are, as Americans, the most self- conscious people in the world, and the most addicted to the belief that the other nations are in a conspiracy to under-value them.

wisdom.quote: It takes a great deal of history to produce a little literature.
wisdom.author: Henry James

wisdom.quote: She had an unequalled gift... of squeezing big mistakes into small opportunities.
wisdom.author: Henry James

wisdom.quote: She was a woman who, between courses, could be graceful with her elbows on the table.
wisdom.author: Henry James

wisdom.quote: Summer afternoon - Summer afternoon... the two most beautiful words in the English language.
wisdom.author: Henry James

wisdom.quote: Summer afternoon-summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
wisdom.author: Henry James

wisdom.quote: The only obligation to which in advance we may hold a novel, without incurring the accusation of being arbitrary, is that it be interesting.

wisdom.quote: Live all you can - it's a mistake not to. It doesn't so much matter what you do in particular, so long as you have your life. If you haven't had that, what have you had?

wisdom.quote: There are women who are for all your 'times of life.' They're the most wonderful sort.
wisdom.author: Henry James, "The Ambassadors", Book Fifth, Chapter 3

wisdom.quote: Thanks to his constant habit of shaking the bottle in which life handed him the wine of experience, he presently found the taste of the lees rising as usual into his draught.
wisdom.author: Henry James, "The Ambassadors", Book Fourth, Chapter 2

wisdom.quote: Be generous, be delicate, and always pursue the prize.
wisdom.author: Henry James, from his essay about the rules of writing

wisdom.quote: Civilization is the art of living in towns of such size the everyone does not know everyone else.

wisdom.quote: The heads of strong old age are beautiful beyond all grace of youth.

wisdom.quote: We don't get offered crises, they arrive.

wisdom.quote: I have a problem about being nearly sixty: I keep waking up in the morning and thinking I'm thirty-one.

wisdom.quote: Gratitude is born in hearts that take time to count up past mercies.

wisdom.quote: We have been taught to believe that negative equals realistic and positive equals unrealistic.

wisdom.quote: Feel the fear and do it anyway.

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so firmly believed as that which is least known.

wisdom.quote: Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest of violence.

wisdom.quote: There is nothing respecting which a man may be so long unconscious as of the extent and strength of his prejudices.

wisdom.quote: A good name, like good will, is got by many actions and lost by one.

wisdom.quote: Maps encourage boldness. They're like cryptic love letters. They make anything seem possible.

wisdom.quote: The human brain starts working the moment you are born and never stops until you stand up to speak in public.

wisdom.quote: The idea of legally establishing inalienable, inherent and sacred rights of the individual is not of political but religious origin.
wisdom.author: George Jellinek

wisdom.quote: Photographers do this for a living, every single day -- they point their lenses toward every single corner of our world and somehow make the mundane mesmerizing through their artistic eye. It's all a matter of being aware of your surroundings and realizing that there are some really amazing and interesting things to look at, even if it may just be something so simple as a wall being covered up by paint.
wisdom.author: Ward Jenkins, Ward-O-Matic, 03-14-2005

wisdom.quote: I know just how frustrating it can be when you're tired and exhausted, but you still want to draw something.
wisdom.author: Ward Jenkins, Ward-O-Matic, 03-23-2006

wisdom.quote: The sweet and the sour: this is what makes great art.
wisdom.author: Ward Jenkins, Ward-O-Matic, 03-23-2006

wisdom.quote: Idleness, like kisses, to be sweet must be stolen.
wisdom.author: Jerome K. Jerome

wisdom.quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth--unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
wisdom.author: Jerome K. Jerome

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to enjoy idling thoroughly unless one has plenty of work to do.
wisdom.author: Jerome K. Jerome

wisdom.quote: I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
wisdom.author: Jerome K. Jerome, "Three Men in a Boat", 1889

wisdom.quote: Drink to me only with thine eyes, And I will pledge with mine; Or leave a kiss but in the cup, And I'll not look for wine.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Johnson

wisdom.quote: It is not growing like a tree in bulk doth make man better be; Or standing long an oak, three hundred year, To fall a log at last, dry, bald, and sere, A lily of a day is fairer in May Although it fall and die that night, It was the plant of flower and light, In small proportions we just beauties see; And in short measures, life may perfect be.

wisdom.quote: It's okay if you mess up. You should give yourself a break.

wisdom.quote: I'd rather laugh with the sinners than cry with the saints, sinners are much more fun.

wisdom.quote: If they give you ruled paper, write the other way.

wisdom.quote: Nothing changes more constantly than the past; for the past that influences our lives does not consist of what actually happened, but of what men believe happened.

wisdom.quote: Everything you do in life, every choice you make, has a consequence. When you do things without thinkin', then you ain't makin' the choice. The choice is makin' you.

wisdom.quote: Treat a person as he is, and he will remain as he is. Treat him as he could be, and will become as he should be.

wisdom.quote: If we keep treating our most important values as meaningless relics, that's exactly what they'll become.

wisdom.quote: Architecture is the art of how to waste space.

wisdom.quote: Whenever I hear the word culture, I reach for my revolver.

wisdom.quote: Money is the opposite of the weather. Nobody talks about it, but everybody does something about it.

wisdom.quote: Always and never are two words you should always remember never to use.

wisdom.quote: I don't believe in guilt, I believe in living on impulse as long as you never intentionally hurt another person, and don't judge people in your life. I think you should live completely free.

wisdom.quote: If I think more about death than some other people, it is probably because I love life more than they do.

wisdom.quote: Therapy? I don't need that. The roles that I choose are my therapy.

wisdom.quote: Ours is the age that is proud of machines that think and suspicious of men who try to.

wisdom.quote: I am not afraid of the pen, or the scaffold, or the sword. I will tell the truth wherever I please.

wisdom.quote: If I make a record I love, then somebody will like it. Maybe not everybody, but that won't matter.

wisdom.quote: One of the greatest disservices you can do to a man is to lend him money that he can't pay back.
wisdom.author: Jesse H. Jones, The New York Times Magazine, July 2, 1939

wisdom.quote: I've always thought that a big laugh is a really loud noise from the soul saying, "Ain't that the truth."

wisdom.quote: The word 'meaningful' when used today is nearly always meaningless.
wisdom.author: Paul Johnson

wisdom.quote: Don't compromise yourself.  You are all you've got.
wisdom.author: Janis Joplin

wisdom.quote: A picture says more than a thousands words, but which words are these?
wisdom.author: Taeke de Jong, Ways to Study and Research

wisdom.quote: Be not ashamed of thy virtues; honor's a good brooch to wear in a man's hat at all times.
wisdom.author: Ben Jonson

wisdom.quote: He knows not his own strength that hath not met adversity.

wisdom.quote: Language most shews a man: Speak, that I may see thee.

wisdom.quote: Talking and eloquence are not the same: to speak, and to speak well, are two things.
wisdom.author: Ben Jonson

wisdom.quote: I can accept failure, but I can't accept not trying.

wisdom.quote: I have failed many times, and that's why I am a success.

wisdom.quote: Be life long or short, its completeness depends on what it was lived for.
wisdom.author: David Starr Jordan

wisdom.quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
wisdom.author: David Starr Jordan

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
wisdom.author: David Starr Jordan, The Philosophy of Despair

wisdom.quote: Genius begins great works; labor alone finishes them.
wisdom.author: Joseph Joubert

wisdom.quote: It is an aspect of happiness to suppose we all deserve it.
wisdom.author: Joseph Joubert

wisdom.quote: Everyone ought to worship God according to his own inclinations, and not to be constrained by force.
wisdom.author: Flavius Josephus, Life

wisdom.quote: A society of sheep must in time beget a government of wolves.
wisdom.author: Bertrand de Jouvenal

wisdom.quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.

wisdom.quote: It is better to look ahead and prepare than to look back and regret.

wisdom.quote: I can't understand it. I can't even understand the people who can understand it.
wisdom.author: Queen Juliana, of the Netherlands

wisdom.quote: He said not 'Thou shalt not be tempested, thou shalt not be travailed, thou shalt not be dis-eased'; but he said, 'Thou shalt not be overcome.'
wisdom.author: Julian of Norwich, Revelations of Divine Love

wisdom.quote: Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jones

wisdom.quote: It's odd that you can get so anesthetized by your own pain or your own problem that you don't quite fully share the hell of someone close to you.
wisdom.author: Lady Bird Johnson

wisdom.quote: The way you overcome shyness is to become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
wisdom.author: Lady Bird Johnson

wisdom.quote: A harbor, even if it is a little harbor, is a good thing... It takes something from the world, and has something to give in return.
wisdom.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

wisdom.quote: 'Taint't worthwhile to wear a day all out before it comes.
wisdom.author: Sarah Orne Jewett, The Country of the Pointed Firs, 1896

wisdom.quote: What we truly and earnestly aspire to be, that in some sense, we are. The mere aspiration, by changing the frame of the mind, for the moment realizes itself.
wisdom.author: Anna Jameson

wisdom.quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are really rearranging their prejudices.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: As a rule we disbelieve all the facts and theories for which we have no use.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: Human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The great use of a life is to spend for something that outlasts it.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes of mind.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The most immutable barrier in nature is between one man's thoughts and another's.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The stream of thought flows on; but most of its segments fall into the bottomless abyss of oblivion. Of some, no memory survives the instant of their passage. Of others, it is confined to a few moments, hours or days. Others, again, leave vestiges which are indestructible, and by means of which they may be recalled as long as life endures.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: There is no more miserable human being than one in whom nothing is habitual but indecision.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: There is only one thing a philosopher can be relied upon to do, and that is to contradict other philosophers.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: These, then are my last words to you: be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: Whenever two people meet, there are really six people present. There is each man as he sees himself, each man as the other person sees him, and each man as he really is.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: The great thing, then, in all education, is to make our nervous system our ally instead of our enemy.
wisdom.author: William James, The Principles of Psychology

wisdom.quote: Advertisements... contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter to Nathaniel Macon, January 12, 1819

wisdom.quote: I read no newspaper now but Ritchie's, and in that chiefly the advertisements, for they contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter to Nathaniel Macon, January 12, 1819

wisdom.quote: A strict observance of the written laws is doubtless one of the high virtues of a good citizen, but it is not the highest. The laws of necessity, of self preservation, of saving our country when in danger, are of higher obligation.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter, 1810

wisdom.quote: It behoves every man who values liberty of conscience for himself, to resist invasions of it in the case of others; or their case may, by change of circumstances, become his own.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letters to Benjamin Rush, April 21, 1803

wisdom.quote: Some men look at constitutions with sanctimonious reverence, and deem them like the ark of the covenant, too sacred to be touched.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Resolutions, 1803

wisdom.quote: I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, to Archibald Stuart, 1791

wisdom.quote: A republican government is slow to move, yet once in motion it's momentum becomes irresistible.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Determine never to be idle...It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Do not bite at the bait of pleasure till you know there is no hook beneath it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Enlighten the people, generally, and tyranny and oppressions of body and mind will vanish like spirits at the dawn of day.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Every citizen should be a soldier. This was the case with the Greeks and Romans, and must be that of every free state.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I cannot live without books.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I do not take a single newspaper, nor read one a month, and I feel myself infinitely the happier for it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I have never believed there was one code of morality for a public and another for a private man.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I know no safe depository of the ultimate powers of the society but the people themselves; and if we think them not enlightened enough to exercise their control with a wholesome discretion, the remedy is not to take it from them, but to inform their discretion by education.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I'm a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation which give happiness.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Laws and institutions must go hand in hand with the general progress of the human mind.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Never fear the want of business. A man who qualifies himself well for his calling, never fails of employment.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Never spend your money before you have it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Never trouble another for what you can do for yourself.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: No instance exists of a person's writing two languages perfectly. That will always appear to be his native language which was most familiar to him in his youth.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Say nothing of my religion. It is known to God and myself alone. Its evidence before the world is to be sought in my life: if it has been honest and dutiful to society the religion which has regulated it cannot be a bad one.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Shake off all the fears of servile prejudices, under which weak minds are servilely crouched. Fix reason firmly in her seat, and call on her tribunal for every fact, every opinion. Question with boldness even the existence of a God; because, if there be one, he must more approve of the homage of reason than that of blindfolded fear.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: The spirit of resistance to government is so valuable on certain occasions, that I wish it always to be kept alive.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: The will of the people is the only legitimate foundation of any government, and to protect its free expression should be our first object.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: Walking is the best possible exercise. Habituate yourself to walk very far.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: We in America do not have government by the majority. We have government by the majority who participate.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: When the government fears the people, there is liberty. When the people fear the government, there is tyranny.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies. If the American people ever allow private banks to control the issue of their currency, first by inflation, then by deflation, the banks and corporations that will grow up around [the banks] will deprive the people of all property until their children wake-up homeless on the continent their fathers conquered. The issuing power should be taken from the banks and restored to the people, to whom it properly belongs.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, (Attributed)

wisdom.quote: Every difference of opinion is not a difference of principle.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, First Inaugural Adress, 1801

wisdom.quote: I would rather be exposed to the inconveniencies attending too much liberty than those attending too small a degree of it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter to Archibald Stuart, December 23, 1791

wisdom.quote: That peace, safety, and concord may be the portion of our native land, and be long enjoyed by our fellow-citizens, is the most ardent wish of my heart, and if I can be instrumental in procuring or preserving them, I shall think I have not lived in vain.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to Benjamin Waring and others, March 23, 1801

wisdom.quote: I have the consolation of having added nothing to my private fortune during my public service, and of retiring with hands clean as they are empty.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to Count Diodati, 1807

wisdom.quote: Delay is preferable to error.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, Letter to George Washington, May 16, 1792

wisdom.quote: No government ought to be without censors & where the press is free, no one ever will.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to George Washington, September 9, 1792

wisdom.quote: Health is worth more than learning.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to his cousin John Garland Jefferson, June 11, 1790

wisdom.quote: If our house be on fire, without inquiring whether it was fired from within or without, we must try to extinguish it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to James Lewis, Jr., May 9, 1798

wisdom.quote: An honest man can feel no pleasure in the exercise of power over his fellow citizens.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson, letter to John Melish, January 13, 1813

wisdom.quote: A lot of companies have chosen to downsize, and maybe that was the right thing for them. We chose a different path. Our belief was that if we kept putting great products in front of customers, they would continue to open their wallets.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: Almost everything--all external expectations, all pride, all fear of embarrassment or failure--these things just fall away in the face of death, leaving only what is truly important. Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: Here's to the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers, the round pegs in the square holes... the ones who see things differently -- they're not fond of rules... You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them, but the only thing you can't do is ignore them because they change things... they push the human race forward, and while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius, because the ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world, are the ones who do.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: I think we're having fun. I think our customers really like our products. And we're always trying to do better.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: In most people's vocabularies, design means veneer. It's interior decorating. It's the fabric of the curtains of the sofa. But to me, nothing could be further from the meaning of design.
