wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, Francis Carpenter, Six Months at the White House, 1867

wisdom.quote: People who like this sort of thing will find this the sort of thing they like.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, in a book review

wisdom.quote: Quarrel not at all. No man resolved to make the most of himself can spare time for personal contention.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, in a letter to J. M. Cutts, October 26, 1863

wisdom.quote: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, letter to Secretary of War Edwin Stanton, July 18, 1864

wisdom.quote: Nature does not proceed by leaps.
wisdom.author: Linnaeus

wisdom.quote: Never be a cynic, even a gentle one. Never help out a sneer, even at the devil.
wisdom.author: Vachel Lindsay

wisdom.quote: Man is free in his imagination, but bound by his reason.
wisdom.author: Israel Lipkin

wisdom.quote: Actions have consequences...first rule of life. And the second rule is this - you are the only one responsible for your own actions.
wisdom.author: Holly Lisle, Fire In The Mist, 1992

wisdom.quote: I would rather be right and die than be wrong and kill.
wisdom.author: Holly Lisle, Fire In The Mist, 1992

wisdom.quote: If you don't accept responsibility for your own actions, then you are forever chained to a position of defense.
wisdom.author: Holly Lisle, Fire In The Mist, 1992

wisdom.quote: The only place you will be accepted is the place you make for yourself.
wisdom.author: Holly Lisle, Fire In The Mist, 1992

wisdom.quote: You must learn to face the fact, always, that you choose to do what you do, and that everything you do affects not only you but others.
wisdom.author: Holly Lisle, Fire In The Mist, 1992

wisdom.quote: Men can know more than their ancestors did if they start with a knowledge of what their ancestors had already learned....That is why a society can be progressive only if it conserves its traditions.
wisdom.author: Walter Lippmann

wisdom.quote: The justification of majority rule in politics is not to be found in its ethical superiority.
wisdom.author: Walter Lippmann

wisdom.quote: When men are brought face to face with their opponents, forced to listen and learn and mend their ideas, they cease to be children and savages and begin to live like civilized men. Then only is freedom a reality, when men may voice their opinions because they must examine their opinions.
wisdom.author: Walter Lippmann

wisdom.quote: Where all think alike, no one thinks very much.
wisdom.author: Walter Lippmann

wisdom.quote: Time sneaks up on you like a windshield on a bug.
wisdom.author: John Lithgow

wisdom.quote: The four stages of man are infancy, childhood, adolescence and obsolescence.
wisdom.author: Art Linkletter, "A Child's Garden of Misinformation", 1965

wisdom.quote: I looked always outside of myself to see what I could make the world give me instead of looking within myself to see what was there.
wisdom.author: Belle Livingstone

wisdom.quote: Nonsense and noise will oft prevail, when honour and affection fail.
wisdom.author: William Lloyd

wisdom.quote: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, speech in Washington D.C., 1865

wisdom.quote: We know nothing of what will happen in the future, but in the analogy of experience.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, Speech on the sub-Treasury, December 26, 1839

wisdom.quote: But, in a larger sense, we can not dedicate -- we can not consecrate -- we can not hallow -- this ground. The brave men, living and dead, who struggled here, have consecrated it, far above our poor power to add or detract. The world will little note, nor long remember what we say here, but it can never forget what they did here.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, The Gettysburg Address, November 19, 1863

wisdom.quote: It is for us the living, rather, to be dedicated here to the unfinished work which they who fought here have thus far so nobly advanced.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, The Gettysburg Address, November 19, 1863

wisdom.quote: Now we are engaged in a great civil war, testing whether that nation, or any nation so conceived and so dedicated, can long endure. We are met on a great battle-field of that war. We have come to dedicate a portion of that field, as a final resting place for those who here gave their lives that that nation might live. It is altogether fitting and proper that we should do this.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln, The Gettysburg Address, November 19, 1863

wisdom.quote: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is in having lots to do and not doing it.
wisdom.author: Mary Wilson Little

wisdom.quote: Between two products equal in price, function and quality, the better looking will out sell the other.
wisdom.author: Raymond Loewy

wisdom.quote: I am happy being able to play roles with people my age because once you do something really mature there is no turning back.
wisdom.author: Lindsay Lohan

wisdom.quote: I write a lot of lyrics and I'm involved in the producing process, because it's like, if I'm singing it, I want it to be something that I can relate to.
wisdom.author: Lindsay Lohan

wisdom.quote: Part of being sane, is being a little bit crazy.
wisdom.author: Janet Long

wisdom.quote: The world's as ugly as sin, and almost as delightful
wisdom.author: Frederick Locker-Lampson

wisdom.quote: Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them.
wisdom.author: Arnold Lobel

wisdom.quote: I have a simple philosophy. Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. And scratch where it itches.
wisdom.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

wisdom.quote: If you can't say anything good about someone, sit right here by me.
wisdom.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

wisdom.quote: The secret of eternal youth is arrested development.
wisdom.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

wisdom.quote: Creativity can solve almost any problem. The creative act, the defeat of habit by originality, overcomes everything.
wisdom.author: George Lois

wisdom.quote: Our feelings are our most genuine paths to knowledge.
wisdom.author: Audre Lorde

wisdom.quote: Revolution is not a onetime event.
wisdom.author: Audre Lorde

wisdom.quote: A sound mind in a sound body is a short but full description of a happy state in this world.
wisdom.author: John Locke

wisdom.quote: Good and evil, reward and punishment, are the only motives to a rational creature: these are the spur and reins whereby all mankind are set on work, and guided.
wisdom.author: John Locke

wisdom.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
wisdom.author: John Locke

wisdom.quote: There cannot be greater rudeness than to interrupt another in the current of his discourse.
wisdom.author: John Locke

wisdom.quote: The prospect of a long day at the beach makes me panic. There is no harder work I can think of than taking myself off to somewhere pleasant, where I am forced to stay for hours and 'have fun'.
wisdom.author: Phillip Lopate

wisdom.quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
wisdom.author: Vince Lombardi

wisdom.quote: If winning isn't everything, why do they keep score?
wisdom.author: Vince Lombardi

wisdom.quote: If you aren't fired with enthusiasm, you will be fired with enthusiasm.
wisdom.author: Vince Lombardi

wisdom.quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
wisdom.author: Vince Lombardi

wisdom.quote: The average person thinks he isn't.
wisdom.author: Father Larry Lorenzoni

wisdom.quote: No culture has yet solved the dilemma each has faced with the growth of a conscious mind: how to live a moral and compassionate existence when one is fully aware of the blood, the horror inherent in all life, when one finds darkness not only in one's own culture but within oneself... There are simply no answers to some of the great pressing questions. You continue to live them out, making your life a worthy expression of a leaning into the light.
wisdom.author: Barry Lopez, Arctic Dreams

wisdom.quote: Greater is our terror of the unknown.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: I approach these questions unwillingly, as they are sore subjects, but no cure can be effected without touching upon and handling them.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: In difficult and desperate cases, the boldest counsels are the safest.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: Many difficulties which nature throws in our way, may be smoothed away by the exercise of intelligence.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: Men are only clever at shifting blame from their own shoulders to those of others.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: Men are slower to recognize blessings than misfortunes.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: The populace is like the sea motionless in itself, but stirred by every wind, even the lightest breeze.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: There is always more spirit in attack than in defence.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius

wisdom.quote: Better late than never.
wisdom.author: Titus Livius, History

wisdom.quote: A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.
wisdom.author: Jack London

wisdom.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
wisdom.author: Jack London

wisdom.quote: I would rather be ashes than dust! I would rather that my spark should burn out in a brilliant blaze than it should be stifled by dry-rot. I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet. The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
wisdom.author: Jack London, Jack London's Tales of Adventure

wisdom.quote: There is an ecstasy that marks the summit of life, and beyond which life cannot rise. And such is the paradox of living, this ecstasy comes when one is most alive, and it comes as a complete forgetfulness that one is alive.
wisdom.author: Jack London, The Call of the Wild

wisdom.quote: Man always gets less than he demands from life.
wisdom.author: Jack London, The People of the Abyss

wisdom.quote: A torn jacket is soon mended; but hard words bruise the heart of a child.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Age is opportunity no less Than youth itself, though in another dress, And as the evening twilight fades away The sky is filled with stars, invisible by day.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Give what you have. To someone, it may be better than you dare to think.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: He that respects himself is safe from others. He wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: If we could read the secret history of our enemies, we should find in each man's life sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: It is curious to note the old sea-margins of human thought. Each subsiding century reveals some new mystery; we build where monsters used to hide themselves.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Joy, temperance, and repose,Slam the door on the doctor's nose.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Learn to labour and to wait.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Let us, then be up and doing, With a heart for any fate; Still achieving, still pursuing, Learn to labour and to wait.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Look not mournfully into the past. It comes not back again. Wisely improve the present. It is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future, without fear.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate, you are sure to wake up somebody.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: Talk not of wasted affection, affection never was wasted, If it enrich not the heart of another, its waters returning Back to their springs, like the rain shall fill them full of refreshment; That which the fountain sends forth returns again to the fountain.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained by sudden flight, but they while their companions slept, were toiling upward in the night.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

wisdom.quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, 'Morituri Salutamus,' 1875

wisdom.quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Driftwood; Table Talk, 1857

wisdom.quote: To say the least, a town life makes one more tolerant and liberal in one's judgement of others.
wisdom.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Hyperion, 1839

wisdom.quote: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. That is why some people with mediocre talent, but with great inner drive, go much further than people with vastly superior talent.
wisdom.author: Sophia Loren

wisdom.quote: Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life.
wisdom.author: Sophia Loren

wisdom.quote: Nothing makes a woman more beautiful than the belief that she is beautiful.
wisdom.author: Sophia Loren

wisdom.quote: It is a good morning exercise for a research scientist to discard a pet hypothesis every day before breakfast. It keeps him young.
wisdom.author: Konrad Lorenz

wisdom.quote: If you must keep a journal for puposes of sanity, adopt an illegible hand.
wisdom.author: R. Bryan Love, Esquire magazine, January 2005, page 86.

wisdom.quote: I define comfort as self-acceptance. When we finally learn that self-care begins and ends with ourselves, we no longer demand sustenance and happiness from others.
wisdom.author: Jennifer Louden

wisdom.quote: The question should be, is it worth trying to do, not can it be done.
wisdom.author: Allard Lowenstein, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: Almost nobody dances sober, unless they happen to be insane.
wisdom.author: H. P. Lovecraft

wisdom.quote: The most merciful thing in the world, I think, is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents.
wisdom.author: H. P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu", first line

wisdom.quote: Our duty is to believe that for which we have sufficient evidence, and to suspend our judgement when we have not.
wisdom.author: John Lubbock

wisdom.quote: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
wisdom.author: John Lubbock

wisdom.quote: There is nothing so good for the inside of a man as the outside of a horse.
wisdom.author: John Lubbock, The Use of Life, 1894

wisdom.quote: Archaeology is the search for fact... not truth. If it's truth you're looking for, Dr. Tyree's philosophy class is right down the hall.
wisdom.author: George Lucas, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, 1989

wisdom.quote: Look at this. It's worthless - ten dollars from a vendor in the street. But I take it, I bury it in the sand for a thousand years, it becomes priceless.
wisdom.author: George Lucas, Raiders of the Lost Ark, 1981

wisdom.quote: So this is how liberty dies. With thunderous applause.
wisdom.author: George Lucas, Senator Amidala in Star Wars: Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)

wisdom.quote: Train yourself to let go of the things you fear to lose.
wisdom.author: George Lucas, Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith

wisdom.quote: Either do, or do not, there is no try
wisdom.author: George Lucas, The Empire Strikes Back

wisdom.quote: I have noticed that the people who are late are often so much jollier than the people who have to wait for them.
wisdom.author: E. V. Lucas

wisdom.quote: A crime which is the crime of many none avenge.
wisdom.author: Lucan

wisdom.quote: A show of daring oft conceals great fear.
wisdom.author: Lucan

wisdom.quote: Deep-seated are the wounds dealt in civil brawls.
wisdom.author: Lucan

wisdom.quote: Pleasure is a by-product of doing something that is worth doing. Therefore, do not seek pleasure as such. Pleasure comes of seeking something else, and comes by the way.
wisdom.author: A. Lawrence Lowell

wisdom.quote: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
wisdom.author: Amy Lowell

wisdom.quote: Every journalist has a novel in him, which is an excellent place for it.
wisdom.author: Russel Lynes

wisdom.quote: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life.
wisdom.author: Joan Lunden, in Healthy Living Magazine

wisdom.quote: Not much longer shall we have time for reading lessons of the past. An inexorable present calls us to the defense of a great future.
wisdom.author: Henry Luce

wisdom.quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
wisdom.author: Robert Lynd, The Blue Lion and Other Essays

wisdom.quote: The trouble with America is that there are far too many wide-open spaces surrounded by teeth.
wisdom.author: Charles Luckman

wisdom.quote: Nothing can be created from nothing.
wisdom.author: Lucretius, De Rerum Natura

wisdom.quote: Such evil deeds could religion prompt.
wisdom.author: Lucretius, De Rerum Natura

wisdom.quote: What is food to one, is to others bitter poison.
wisdom.author: Lucretius, De Rerum Natura

wisdom.quote: Fasting and natural diet, though essentially unknown [in today's U.S.] as a therapy, should be the first treatment when someone discovers that she or he has a medical problem. It should not be applied only to the most advanced cases, as is present practice. Whether the patient has a cardiac condition, hypertension, autoimmune disease, fibroids, or asthma, he or she must be informed that fasting and natural, plant-based diets are a viable alternative to conventional therapy, and an effective one. The time may come when not offering this substantially more effective nutritional approach will be considered malpractice.
wisdom.author: Joel Fuhrman, M.D., Fasting And Eating For Health

wisdom.quote: Level with your child by being honest. Nobody spots a phony quicker than a child.
wisdom.author: Mary MacCracken

wisdom.quote: When you are not practicing, remember, someone somewhere is practicing, and when you meet him he will win.
wisdom.author: Ed Macauley

wisdom.quote: It is possible to be below flattery as well as above it.
wisdom.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

wisdom.quote: We must judge of a form of government by its general tendency, not by happy accidents.
wisdom.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay, Speech on Parliamentary reform, March 2, 1831

wisdom.quote: Work is not always required. There is such a thing as sacred idleness.
wisdom.author: George MacDonald

wisdom.quote: At the worst, a house unkept cannot be so distressing as a life unlived.
wisdom.author: Dame Rose Macaulay

wisdom.quote: It is a common delusion that you make things better by talking about them.
wisdom.author: Dame Rose Macaulay

wisdom.quote: It was a book to kill time for those who like it better dead.
wisdom.author: Dame Rose Macaulay

wisdom.quote: He felt about books as doctors feel about medicines, or managers about plays - cynical, but hopeful.
wisdom.author: Dame Rose Macaulay, Crewe Train, 1926

wisdom.quote: The highest proof of virtue is to possess boundless power without abusing it.
wisdom.author: Lord Macaulay, review of Lucy Aikin, 'Life and Writings of Addison,' 1943

wisdom.quote: Men, it has been well said, think in herds; it will be seen that they go mad in herds, while they only recover their senses slowly, and one by one.
wisdom.author: Charles Mackay

wisdom.quote: The only reason we die, is because we accept death as an inevitability.
wisdom.author: Seth MacFarlane, The Family Guy

wisdom.quote: The two symbols of the Republican Party: an elephant, and a big fat white guy who is threatened by change.
wisdom.author: Seth MacFarlane, The Family Guy

wisdom.quote: It is those we live with and love and should know who elude us.
wisdom.author: Norman Maclean

wisdom.quote: Eventually, all things merge into one, and a river runs through it. The river was cut by the world's great flood and runs over rocks from the basement of time. On some of the rocks are timeless raindrops. Under the rocks are the words, and some of the words are theirs. I am haunted by waters.
wisdom.author: Norman Maclean, A River Runs Through It

wisdom.quote: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power.
wisdom.author: Shirley MacLaine

wisdom.quote: It is right to be contented with what we have, never with what we are.
wisdom.author: Sir James MacKintosh

wisdom.quote: History is too serious to be left to historians.
wisdom.author: Ian Macleod, in The Observer (July 16, 1961)

wisdom.quote: To see the earth as it truly is, small and blue and beautiful in that eternal silence where it floats, is to see ourselves as riders on the earth together, brothers on that bright loveliness in the eternal cold.
wisdom.author: Archibald MacLeish

wisdom.quote: Do not rely completely on any other human being, however dear.  We meet all life's greatest tests alone.
wisdom.author: Agnes Macphail

wisdom.quote: Good laws have their origins in bad morals.
wisdom.author: Ambrosius Macrobius

wisdom.quote: Freedom, then, lies only in our innate human capacity to choose between different sorts of bondage, bondage to desire or self esteem, or bondage to the light that lightens all our lives.
wisdom.author: Sri Madhava

wisdom.quote: I have never found, in a long experience of politics, that criticism is ever inhibited by ignorance.
wisdom.author: Harold Macmillan, Wall Street Journal, Aug. 13, 1963

wisdom.quote: The world will change for the better when people decide they are sick and tired of being sick and tired of the way the world is, and decide to change themselves.
wisdom.author: Sidney Madwed

wisdom.quote: Words can be like baseball bats when used maliciously.
wisdom.author: Sidney Madwed

wisdom.quote: We are alone, absolutely alone on this chance planet: and, amid all the forms of life that surround us, not one, excepting the dog, has made an alliance with us.
wisdom.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

wisdom.quote: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
wisdom.author: Maurice Maeterlinck, Wisdom and Destiny, 1898

wisdom.quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.
wisdom.author: Madonna

wisdom.quote: Poor is the man whose pleasures depend on the permission of another.
wisdom.author: Madonna

wisdom.quote: That consciousness is everything and that all things begin with a thought. That we are responsible for our own fate, we reap what we sow, we get what we give, we pull in what we put out. I know these things for sure.
wisdom.author: Madonna, O Magazine, January 2004

wisdom.quote: To be brave is to love someone unconditionally, without expecting anything in return. To just give. That takes courage, because we don't want to fall on our faces or leave ourselves open to hurt.
wisdom.author: Madonna, O Magazine, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Our heroes are those... who... act above and beyond the call of duty and in so doing give definition to patriotism and elevate all of us.... America is the land of the free because we are the home of the brave.
wisdom.author: David Mahoney

wisdom.quote: In the right light, at the right time, everything is extraordinary.
wisdom.author: Wendy Magruder

wisdom.quote: Computers can figure out all kinds of problems, except the things in the world that just don't add up.
wisdom.author: James Magary

wisdom.quote: 'Tis an ill wind that blows no minds.
wisdom.author: Malaclypse the Younger

wisdom.quote: It is one of man's curious idiosyncrasies to create difficulties for the pleasure of resolving them.
wisdom.author: Joseph de Maistre

wisdom.quote: Age is�wisdom, if one has lived one's life properly.
wisdom.author: Miriam Makeba, O Magazine, October 2003

wisdom.quote: To no one will we sell, to no one will we refuse or delay right or justice.
wisdom.author: Magna Carta

wisdom.quote: It is just the little touches after the average man would quit that make the master's fame.
wisdom.author: Orison Swett Marden

wisdom.quote: Unless you are prepared yourself to profit by your chance, the opportunity will only make you ridiculous. A great occasion is valuable to you in proportion as you have educated yourself to make use of it.
wisdom.author: Orison Swett Marden

wisdom.quote: We lift ourselves by our thought, we climb upon our vision of ourselves. If you want to enlarge your life, you must first enlarge your thought of it and of yourself. Hold the ideal of yourself as you long to be, always, everywhere - your ideal of what you long to attain - the ideal of health, efficiency, success.
wisdom.author: Orison Swett Marden

wisdom.quote: You cannot measure a man by his failures. You must know what use he makes of them. What did they mean to him. What did he get out of them.
wisdom.author: Orison Swett Marden

wisdom.quote: An opinion should be the result of thought, not a substitute for it.
wisdom.author: Jef Mallett, Frazz, 04-04-07

wisdom.quote: Writing well means never having to say, 'I guess you had to be there.'
wisdom.author: Jef Mallett, Frazz, 07-29-07

wisdom.quote: If time flies when you're having fun, it hits the afterburners when you don't think you're having enough.
wisdom.author: Jef Mallett, Frazz, 08-01-05

wisdom.quote: Mach-S, the speed at which stress can't keep up, is simply forward motion. But it has to be self- propelled. Note that people in cars are still stressed.
wisdom.author: Jef Mallett, Frazz, 08-26-05

wisdom.quote: Be careful -- with quotations, you can damn anything.
wisdom.author: Andre Malraux

wisdom.quote: The first duty of a leader is to make himself be loved without courting love. To be loved without 'playing up' to anyone - even to himself.
wisdom.author: Andre Malraux

wisdom.quote: The greatest mystery is not that we have been flung at random between the profusion of matter and of the stars, but that within this prison we can draw from ourselves images powerful enough to deny our nothingness.
wisdom.author: Andre Malraux

wisdom.quote: The most important thing in life is to see to it that you are never beaten.
wisdom.author: Andre Malraux

wisdom.quote: Do what you love, love what you do, leave the world a better place and don't pick your nose.
wisdom.author: Jeff Mallett, Frazz, 08-03-04

wisdom.quote: A college degree is not a sign that one is a finished product but an indication a person is prepared for life.
wisdom.author: Reverend Edward A. Malloy, Monk's Reflections

wisdom.quote: He who blinded by ambition, raises himself to a position whence he cannot mount higher, must thereafter fall with the greatest loss.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

wisdom.quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

wisdom.quote: War cannot be avoided; it can only be postponed to the other's advantage.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

wisdom.quote: Whoever desires to found a state and give it laws, must start with assuming that all men are bad and ever ready to display their vicious nature, whenever they may find occasion for it.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, Discourse upon the First Ten Books of Livy

wisdom.quote: God creates men, but they choose each other.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, quoted in O Magazine, November 2003

wisdom.quote: A prince should therefore have no other aim or thought, nor take up any other thing for his study but war and it organization and discipline, for that is the only art that is necessary to one who commands.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: He who has not first laid his foundations may be able with great ability to lay them afterwards, but they will be laid with trouble to the architect and danger to the building.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: Men judge generally more by the eye than by the hand, for everyone can see and few can feel. Every one sees what you appear to be, few really know what you are.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: Since love and fear can hardly exist together, if we must choose between them, it is far safer to be feared than loved.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: There are three classes of intellects: one which comprehends by itself; another which appreciates what others comprehend; and a third which neither comprehends by itself nor by the showing of others; the first is the most excellent, the second is good, and the third is useless.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: There is no other way of guarding oneself against flattery than by letting men understand that they will not offend you by speaking the truth; but when everyone can tell you the truth, you lose their respect.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: When neither their property nor their honor is touched, the marjority of men live content.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli, The Prince

wisdom.quote: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
wisdom.author: Dudley Field Malone

wisdom.quote: I shall curse you with book and bell and candle.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas Malory, Le Morte d'Arthur

wisdom.quote: Now hast thou but one bare hour to live, And then thou must be damned perpetually. Stand still, you ever-moving spheres of heaven, That time may cease, and midnight never come.
wisdom.author: Christopher Marlowe, Doctor Faustus scene 13

wisdom.quote: I count religion but a childish toy, And hold there is no sin but ignorance. Birds of the air will tell of murders past. I am asham'd to hear such fooleries!
wisdom.author: Christopher Marlowe, Jew of Malta, Prologue

wisdom.quote: To do anything truly worth doing, I must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger, but jump in with gusto and scramble through as well as I can.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Treasure the love you have received above all. It will survive long after your gold and good health have vanished.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster. Your life will never be the same again.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino, The Greatest Miracle in the World

wisdom.quote: The country only has charms for those not obliged to stay there.
wisdom.author: Edouard Manet

wisdom.quote: Give us clear vision that we may know where to stand and what to stand for, because unless we stand for something, we shall fall for anything.
wisdom.author: Peter Marshall, Senate chaplain, prayer offered at the opening of the session, April 18, 1947

wisdom.quote: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.
wisdom.author: Nelson Mandela

wisdom.quote: I am not a saint, unless you think of a saint as a sinner who keeps on trying.
wisdom.author: Nelson Mandela

wisdom.quote: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.
wisdom.author: Nelson Mandela, 'A Long Walk to Freedom'

wisdom.quote: Enough organization, enough lists and we think we can control the uncontrollable.
wisdom.author: John Mankiewicz, House, The Socratic Method, 2004

wisdom.quote: Good ideas alter the power balance in relationships, that is why good ideas are always initially resisted. Good ideas come with a heavy burden. Which is why so few people have them. So few people can handle it.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 1 Ignore Everybody, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: There's no correlation between creativity and equipment ownership. None. Zilch. Nada. Actually, as the artist gets more into his thing, and as he gets more successful, his number of tools tends to go down. He knows what works for him. Expending mental energy on stuff wastes time.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 10, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: All existing business models are wrong. Find a new one.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 11, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Question how much freedom your path affords you. Be utterly ruthless about it. It's your freedom that will get you to where you want to go.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 11, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The pain of making the necessary sacrifices always hurts more than you think it's going to. I know. It sucks. That being said, doing something seriously creative is one of the most amazing experiences one can have, in this or any other lifetime. If you can pull it off, it's worth it. Even if you don't end up pulling it off, you'll learn many incredible, magical, valuable things. It's NOT doing it when you know you full well you HAD the opportunity- that hurts FAR more than any failure.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 12. If you accept the pain, it cannot hurt you., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Never compare your inside with somebody else's outside.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 13, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The first rule of business, is never sell something you love. Otherwise, you may as well be selling your children.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 13, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The bars of West Hollywood and New York are awash with people throwing their lives away in the desperate hope of finding a shortcut, any shortcut. And a lot of them aren't even young anymore; their B-plans having been washed away by Vodka & Tonics years ago. Meanwhile their competition is at home, working their asses off.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 14. Dying young is overrated., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Art suffers the moment other people start paying for it. The more you need the money, the more people will tell you what to do. The less control you will have. The more bullshit you will have to swallow. The less joy it will bring. Know this and plan accordingly.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 15, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: When I see somebody 'suffering for their art', it%uFFFDs usually a case of them not knowing where that red line is, not knowing where the sovereignty lies.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 15, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The old ways are dead. And you need people around you who concur. That means hanging out more with the creative people, the freaks, the real visionaries, than you're already doing. Thinking more about what their needs are, and responding accordingly. Avoid the dullards; avoid the folk who play it safe. They can't help you any more. Their stability model no longer offers that much stability. They are extinct, they are extinction.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 16. The world is changing. , 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Part of understanding the creative urge is understanding that it's primal. Wanting to change the world is not a noble calling, it's a primal calling.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 17. Merit can be bought. Passion can't.  , 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The only people who can change the world are people who want to. And not everybody does.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 17. Merit can be bought. Passion can't.  , 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Your idea doesn't have to be big. It just has to be yours alone. The more the idea is yours alone, the more freedom you have to do something really amazing. The more amazing, the more people will click with your idea. The more people click with your idea, the more it will change the world.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 2, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Diluting your product to make it more 'commercial' will just make people like it less.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 21. Selling out is harder than it looks., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Everybody is too busy with their own lives to give a damn about your book, painting, screenplay etc, especially if you haven't sold it yet. And the ones that aren't, you don't want in your life anyway.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 22. Nobody cares. Do it for yourself., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: It's about what YOU are going to do with the short time you have left on this earth.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 23, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: If you have something to say, then say it. If not, enjoy the silence while it lasts. The noise will return soon enough. In the meantime, you%uFFFDre better off going out into the big, wide world, having some adventures and refilling your well. Trying to create when you don%uFFFDt feel like it is like making conversation for the sake of making conversation.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 24, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Neither should you fret too much about 'writer%uFFFDs block'. If you%uFFFDre looking at a blank piece of paper and nothing comes to you, then go do something else. Writer%uFFFDs block is just a symptom of feeling like you have nothing to say, combined with the rather weird idea that you SHOULD feel the need to say something.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 24, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: You have to find a way of working that makes it dead easy to take full advantage of your inspired moments. They never hit at a convenient time, nor do they last long.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 24, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Even pleasure itself is a toil.
wisdom.author: Manilius

wisdom.quote: When we are born we die, our end is but the pendant of our beginning.
wisdom.author: Manilius

wisdom.quote: If I knew I was going to live this long, I'd have taken better care of myself.
wisdom.author: Mickey Mantle, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Part of being a Master is learning how to sing in nobody else's voice but your own.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 25. You have to find your own schtick., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Put your whole self into it, and you will find your true voice. Hold back and you won't. It's that simple.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 25. You have to find your own schtick., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: You can�t love a crowd the same way you can love a person. And a crowd can�t love you the way a single person can love you. Intimacy doesn�t scale. Not really. Intimacy is a one-on-one phenomenon.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 26. Write from the heart., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The best way to get approval is not to need it.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 27, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: People who are 'ready' give off a different vibe than people who aren't. Animals can smell fear; maybe that's it. The minute you become ready is the the minute you stop dreaming. Suddenly it's no longer about 'becoming'. Suddenly it's about 'doing'.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 28. Power is never given. Power is taken., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Anyone can be an idealist. Anyone can be a cynic. The hard part lies somewhere in the middle i.e. being human.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 29, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: People are fond of spouting out the old clich%uFFFD about how Van Gogh never sold a painting in his lifetime. Somehow his example serves to justify to us, decades later, that there is somehow merit in utter failure. Perhaps, but the man did commit suicide.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 29, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The fact is, the old clich%uFFFDs work for us in abstract terms, but they never work out in real life quite the same way. Life is messy; clich%uFFFDs are clean and tidy.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 29, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Stamina is utterly important. And stamina is only possible if it's managed well. People think all they need to do is endure one crazy, intense, job-free creative burst and their dreams will come true. They are wrong, they are stupidly wrong.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 3. Put the hours in., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: If you have the creative urge, it isn't going to go away. But sometimes it takes a while before you accept the fact.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 30, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Part of being creative is learning how to protect your freedom. That includes freedom from avarice.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 31 Remain Frugal, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The less you can live on, the more chance your idea will succeed. This is true even after you�ve 'made it'.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 31. Remain Frugal., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Publishers are just middlemen. That's all. If artists could remember that more often, they'd save themselves a lot of aggrevation.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 4, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Nobody can tell you if what you're doing is good, meaningful or worthwhile. The more compelling the path, the more lonely it is.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 5, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: If you try to make something just to fit your uninformed view of some hypothetical market, you will fail. If you make something special and powerful and honest and true, you will succeed.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 6, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: The creative person basically has two kinds of jobs: One is the sexy, creative kind. Second is the kind that pays the bills. Sometimes the task in hand covers both bases, but not often. This tense duality will always play center stage. It will never be transcended.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 7. Keep your day job., 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: If you're creative, if you can think independently, if you can articulate passion, if you can override the fear of being wrong, then your company needs you now more than it ever did. And now your company can no longer afford to pretend that isn't the case.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 8, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: Admit that your own private Mount Everest exists. That is half the battle.
wisdom.author: Hugh Macleod, How To Be Creative: 9, 08-22-04

wisdom.quote: He who praises you for what you lack wishes to take from you what you have.
wisdom.author: Don Juan Manuel

wisdom.quote: God has always been hard on the poor.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Marat

wisdom.quote: A throw of the dice will never abolish chance.
wisdom.author: Stephane Mallarme

wisdom.quote: Talk of nothing but business, and dispatch that business quickly.
wisdom.author: Aldus Manutius, Placard on the door of the Aldine Press

wisdom.quote: Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
wisdom.author: Jacques Maritain, Reflections on America, 1958

wisdom.quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree - they bear no fruit.
wisdom.author: Francis Marion

wisdom.quote: We find no real satisfaction or happiness in life without obstacles to conquer and goals to achieve.
wisdom.author: Maxwell Maltz, Communication Bulletin for Managers & Supervisors, June 2004

wisdom.quote: The beauty of daylight-saving time is that it just makes everyone feel sunnier.
wisdom.author: Edward Markey, quoted in Associated Press, July 22, 2005

wisdom.quote: I believe there are more instances of the abridgement of the freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments of those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations.
wisdom.author: James Madison

wisdom.quote: If men were angels, no government would be necessary.
wisdom.author: James Madison

wisdom.quote: The essence of government is power; and power, lodged as it must be in human hands, will ever be liable to abuse.
wisdom.author: James Madison, Speech in the Virginia constitutional convention, Richmond, Virginia, December 2, 1829

wisdom.quote: Since the general civilization of mankind, I believe there are more instances of the abridgment of the freedom of the people, by gradual and silent encroachments of those in power, than by violent and sudden usurpations.
wisdom.author: James Madison, Speech in the Virginia Convention, June 6, 1788

wisdom.quote: If men were angels, no government would be necessary. If angels were to govern men, neither external nor internal controls on government would be necessary. In framing a government which is to be administered by men over men, the great difficulty lies in this: you must first enable the government to control the governed; and in the next place oblige it to control itself.
wisdom.author: James Madison, The Federalist Papers, 1788

wisdom.quote: The measure of a country's greatness is its ability to retain compassion in times of crisis.
wisdom.author: Thurgood Marshall

wisdom.quote: Mustard's no good without roast beef.
wisdom.author: Chico Marx

wisdom.quote: It's always helpful to learn from your mistakes because then your mistakes seem worthwhile.
wisdom.author: Garry Marshall, 'Wake Me When It's Funny'

wisdom.quote: Man has to suffer. When he has no real afflictions, he invents some.
wisdom.author: Jose Marti

wisdom.quote: If it weren't for my lawyer, I'd still be in prison. It went a lot faster with two people digging.
wisdom.author: Joe Martin, Mister Boffo

wisdom.quote: The most overlooked advantage to owning a computer is that if they foul up there's no law against wacking them around a little.
wisdom.author: Joe Martin, Porterfield

wisdom.quote: If you drink, don't drive. Don't even putt.
wisdom.author: Dean Martin

wisdom.quote: Every moment of one's existence one is growing into more or retreating into less.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer

wisdom.quote: One thing I've learned in all these years is not to make love when you really don't feel it; there's probably nothing worse you can do to yourself than that.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer

wisdom.quote: Part of the ability to keep writing over the years comes down to living with the expectation of disappointment. It's the exact opposite of capitalism. In capitalism you want your business to succeed, and to the degree it does your energy increases, and you go out and buy an even bigger business. In writing it's almost the exact opposite. You just want to keep the store going. You're not going to do as well this year as last year probably, but nonetheless let's keep the store going. What ruins most writers of talent is that they don't get enough experience, so their novels tend to develop a certain paranoid perfection.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer

wisdom.quote: Sentimentality is the emotional promiscuity of those who have no sentiment.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer

wisdom.quote: The function of socialism is to raise suffering to a higher level.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer

wisdom.quote: Once a newspaper touches a story, the facts are lost forever, even to the protagonists.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer, "Esquire", June 1960

wisdom.quote: Any war that requires the suspension of reason as a necessity for support is a bad war.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer, Armies Of The Night

wisdom.quote: There is no greater importance in all the world like knowing you are right and that the wave of the world is wrong, yet the wave crashes upon you.
wisdom.author: Norman Mailer, Armies Of The Night

wisdom.quote: We live in an age when pizza gets to your home before the police.
wisdom.author: Jeff Marder

wisdom.quote: My computer beat me at chess... so I beat it at kickboxing.
wisdom.author: Demetri Martin

wisdom.quote: I bought a cactus. A week later it died. And I got depressed, because I thought, Damn. I am less nurturing than a desert.

wisdom.quote: I go to the gym religiously. About twice a year around the holidays.
wisdom.author: Demetri Martin, On James Corden, Sept. 7, 2018

wisdom.quote: Nearly one-half of all Americans are torsos.
wisdom.author: Demetri Martin, On James Corden, Sept. 7, 2018

wisdom.quote: I like sports bars. Sports bars are great because they collect all of the people I don't want to hang out with, and put them in one room.
wisdom.author: Demetri Martin, The Overthinker, Netflix, 2018

wisdom.quote: He that would govern others, first should be the master of himself.
wisdom.author: Philip Massinger, The Bondman, 1624

wisdom.quote: It is far more impressive when others discover your good qualities without your help.
wisdom.author: Judith Martin, (Miss Manners)

wisdom.quote: Let us make a special effort to stop communicating with each other, so we can have some conversation.
wisdom.author: Judith Martin, (Miss Manners)

wisdom.quote: There are three social classes in America: upper middle class, middle class, and lower middle class.
wisdom.author: Judith Martin, (Miss Manners)

wisdom.quote: We are born charming, fresh and spontaneous and must be civilized before we are fit to participate in society.
wisdom.author: Judith Martin, (Miss Manners)

wisdom.quote: We must expect finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King, jr.

wisdom.quote: When evil men plot, good men must plan.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

wisdom.quote: The most dangerous criminal may be the man gifted with reason, but with no morals.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King, jr., The Purpose of Education, Maroon Tiger, January-February 1947

wisdom.quote: How, given the canine teeth and close-set eyes that declare the human animal to be a predator, had we come up with the notion that oat bran is more natural to eat than chicken?
wisdom.author: Valerie Martin, The Great Divorce

wisdom.quote: Judge thyself with the judgment of sincerity, and thou will judge others with the judgment of charity.
wisdom.author: John Mitchell Mason

wisdom.quote: Last words are for fools who haven't said enough.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx

wisdom.quote: Reason has always existed, but not always in a reasonable form.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx

wisdom.quote: The last capitalist we hang shall be the one who sold us the rope.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx

wisdom.quote: Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature, the heart of a heartless world, just as it is the spirit of a spiritless situation. It is the opium of the people.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx, Critique of Hegel's Philosophy of Right

wisdom.quote: The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx, Thesis 11

wisdom.quote: He who builds a better mousetrap these days runs into material shortages, patent-infringement suits, work stoppages, collusive bidding, discount discrimination--and taxes."
wisdom.author: H. E. Martz

wisdom.quote: I have seen flowers come in stony places And kind things done by men with ugly faces And the gold cup won by the worst horse at the races, So I trust too.
wisdom.author: John Masefield

wisdom.quote: In this life he laughs longest who laughs last.
wisdom.author: John Masefield, "Window in Bye Street", 1912

wisdom.quote: Women should be obscene and not heard.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: I don't have a photograph, but you can have my footprints. They're upstairs in my socks.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx, In the film A Day at the Races

wisdom.quote: The customer doesn't expect everything will go right all the time; the big test is what you do when things go wrong.
wisdom.author: Sir Colin Marshall

wisdom.quote: Generosity with strings is not generosity; It is a deal.
wisdom.author: Marya Mannes

wisdom.quote: Nobody objects to a woman being a good writer or sculptor or geneticist if at the same time she manages to be a good wife, a good mother, good-looking, good-tempered, well-dressed, well-groomed, and unaggressive.

wisdom.quote: The sign of an intelligent people is their ability to control emotions by the application of reason.
wisdom.author: Marya Mannes

wisdom.quote: Desire, ask, believe, receive.
wisdom.author: Stella Terrill Mann

wisdom.quote: Every time we say, "Let there be!" in any form, something happens.
wisdom.author: Stella Terrill Mann

wisdom.quote: Whatever God's dream about man may be, it seems certain it cannot come true unless man cooperates.
wisdom.author: Stella Terrill Mann

wisdom.quote: Character is what God and the angels know of us; reputation is what men and women think of us.

wisdom.quote: Do not think of knocking out another person's brains because he differs in opinion from you. It would be as rational to knock yourself on the head because you differ from yourself ten years ago.

wisdom.quote: Resolve to edge in a little reading every day, if it is but a single sentence. If you gain fifteen minutes a day, it will make itself felt at the end of the year.
wisdom.author: Horace Mann

wisdom.quote: To pity distress is but human; to relieve it is Godlike.
wisdom.author: Horace Mann

wisdom.quote: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.
wisdom.author: Horace Mann, address at Antioch College, 1859

wisdom.quote: Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.

wisdom.quote: Politics is war without bloodshed while war is politics with bloodshed.
wisdom.author: Mao Tse-Tung

wisdom.quote: We shall support whatever the enemy opposes and oppose whatever the enemy supports.
wisdom.author: Mao Tse-Tung

wisdom.quote: Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love.
wisdom.author: Hamilton Wright Mabi

wisdom.quote: Be yourself is the worst advice you can give to some people.
wisdom.author: Tom Masson

wisdom.quote: Think of what would happen to us in America if there were no humorists; life would be one long Congressional Record.
wisdom.author: Tom Masson

wisdom.quote: Learning to love yourself is the greatest love of all.
wisdom.author: Michael Masser and Linda Creed

wisdom.quote: A man is too apt to forget that in this world he cannot have everything. A choice is all that is left him.
wisdom.author: H. Mathews

wisdom.quote: Readers are plentiful; thinkers are rare.
wisdom.author: Harriet Martineau

wisdom.quote: You better live your best and act your best and think your best today, for today is the sure preparation for tomorrow and all the other tomorrows that follow.
wisdom.author: Harriet Martineau

wisdom.quote: Eighty percent of married men cheat in America. The rest cheat in Europe.

wisdom.quote: I have enough money to last me the rest of my life, unless I buy something.

wisdom.quote: It's no longer a question of staying healthy. It's a question of finding a sickness you like.
wisdom.author: Jackie Mason

wisdom.quote: It is bad luck to be superstitious.
wisdom.author: Andrew W. Mathis

wisdom.quote: Derive happiness in oneself from a good day's work, from illuminating the fog that surrounds us.
wisdom.author: Henri Matisse

wisdom.quote: What I dream of is an art of balance.

wisdom.quote: Hollywood is a place where they'll pay you a thousand dollars for a kiss and fifty cents for your soul.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Monroe

wisdom.quote: I don't mind living in a man's world as long as i can be a woman in it.

wisdom.quote: I'm not interested in money. I just want to be wonderful.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Monroe

wisdom.quote: I've been on a calendar, but never on time.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Monroe

wisdom.quote: Conceal a flaw, and the world will imagine the worst.

wisdom.quote: It is feeling and force of imagination that make us eloquent.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis

wisdom.quote: The virtuous man is never a novice in worldly things.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis

wisdom.quote: Why do strong arms fatigue themselves with frivolous dumbbells? To dig a vineyard is worthier exercise for men.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis

wisdom.quote: A man who lives everywhere lives nowhere.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis, Epigrams

wisdom.quote: Tomorrow's life is too late. Live today.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis, Epigrams

wisdom.quote: Virtue extends our days: he live two lives who relives his past with pleasure.
wisdom.author: Marcus Valerius Martialis, Epigrams

wisdom.quote: Funny business, a woman's career: the things you drop on the way up the ladder so you can move faster. You forget you'll need them again when you get back to being a woman. It's one career all females have in common, whether we like it or not: being a woman. Sooner or later, we've got to work at it, no matter how many other careers we've had or wanted.
wisdom.author: Joseph L. Mankiewicz, in All About Eve

wisdom.quote: A man's dying is more the survivors' affair than his own.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: A writer is a person for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: A writer is somebody for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: All interest in disease and death is only another expression of interest in life.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: No man remains quite what he was when he recognizes himself.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: Speech is civilization itself... It is silence which isolates.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: War is a cowardly escape from the problems of peace.
wisdom.author: Thomas Mann

wisdom.quote: Because one of the properties of music is to entertain and to, I don't mean this lightly, distract us from the things that pull us down. Music should be not only a source for political ideas but also a source of hope.
wisdom.author: Dave Matthews

wisdom.quote: The future is no place to place your better days.
wisdom.author: Dave Matthews, "Cry Freedom"

wisdom.quote: Good music is good music, and everything else can go to hell.
wisdom.author: Dave Matthews, VH1 Special: Trey And Dave Go To Africa

wisdom.quote: If you live life, then you become what are.
wisdom.author: Dave Matthews, What You Are

wisdom.quote: By health I mean the power to live a full, adult, living, breathing life in close contact with... the earth and the wonders thereof - the sea - the sun.
wisdom.author: Katherine Mansfield

wisdom.quote: Could we change our attitude, we should not only see life differently, but life itself would come to be different. Life would undergo a change of appearance because we ourselves had undergone a change in attitude.
wisdom.author: Katherine Mansfield

wisdom.quote: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only for wallowing in.
wisdom.author: Katherine Mansfield

wisdom.quote: Risk! Risk anything! Care no more for the opinions of others, for those voices. Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
wisdom.author: Katherine Mansfield

wisdom.quote: Americans never quit.
wisdom.author: General Douglas Macarthur

wisdom.quote: In war there is no substitute for victory.
wisdom.author: General Douglas MacArthur

wisdom.quote: There is no security on this earth, there is only opportunity.
wisdom.author: General Douglas MacArthur

wisdom.quote: There is no security on this earth; there is only opportunity.
wisdom.author: General Douglas MacArthur

wisdom.quote: If man does find the solution for world peace it will be the most revolutionary reversal of his record we have ever known.
wisdom.author: George C. Marshall

wisdom.quote: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
wisdom.author: George C. Marshall

wisdom.quote: Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, None but ourselves can free our minds.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: Free speech carries with it some freedom to listen.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: Get up, stand up Stand up for your rights Get up, stand up Don't give up the fight.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: The good times of today are the sad thoughts of tomorrow.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: Don't worry about a thing, 'cause every little thing gonna be all right.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley, "Three Little Birds" - song  "Legend"- album

wisdom.quote: Don't gain the world and lose your soul, wisdom is better than silver or gold.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley, From "Zion Train" lyrics.

wisdom.quote: One kernel is felt in a hogshead; one drop of water helps to swell the ocean; a spark of fire helps to give light to the world. None are too small, too feeble, too poor to be of service. Think of this and act.
wisdom.author: Hannah More

wisdom.quote: I like a woman with a head on her shoulders. I hate necks.
wisdom.author: Steve Martin

wisdom.quote: There is no old age. There is, as there always was, just you.
wisdom.author: Carol Matthau, O Magazine, October 2003

wisdom.quote: If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
wisdom.author: Abraham Maslow

wisdom.quote: A hypocrite is a person who--but who isn't?
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: Fishing is a delusion entirely surrounded by liars in old clothes.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: Honesty is a good thing, but it is not profitable to its possessor unless it is kept under control.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: If you make people think they're thinking, they'll love you; But if you really make them think, they'll hate you.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: Pity the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: The chief obstacle to the progress of the human race is the human race.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: 'Whose?'
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.quote: Everybody has difficult years, but a lot of times the difficult years end up being the greatest years of your whole entire life, if you survive them.
wisdom.author: Brittany Murphy, Seventeen Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Cherish each hour of this day for it can never return.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Count your blessings. Once you realize how valuable you are and how much you have going for you, the smiles will return, the sun will break out, the music will play, and you will finally be able to move forward the life that God intended for you with grace, strength, courage, and confidence.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Do not listen to those who weep and complain, for their disease is contagious.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Each failure to sell will increase your chances for success at your next attempt.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: I am here for a purpose and that purpose is to grow into a mountain, not to shrink to a grain of sand. Henceforth will I apply ALL my efforts to become the highest mountain of all and I will strain my potential until it cries for mercy.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness for it shows me the stars.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: I will not allow yesterday's success to lull me into today's complacency, for this is the great foundation of failure.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: It is those who concentrate on but one thing at a time who advance in this world. The great man or woman is the one who never steps outside his or her specialty or foolishly dissipates his or her individuality.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Love doesn't sit there like a stone, it has to be made, like bread: remade all the time, made new.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Never again clutter your days or nights with so many menial and unimportant things that you have no time to accept a real challenge when it comes along. This applies to play as well as work. A day merely survived is no cause for celebration. You are not here to fritter away your precious hours when you have the ability to accomplish so much by making a slight change in your routine. No more busy work. No more hiding from success. Leave time, leave space, to grow. Now. Now! Not tomorrow!
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Sound character provides the power with which a person may ride the emergencies of life instead of being overwhelmed by them. Failure is... the highway to success.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: The victory of success is half won when one gains the habit of setting goals and achieving them. Even the most tedious chore will become endurable as you parade through each day convinced that every task, no matter how menial or boring, brings you closer to fulfilling your dreams.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: To be always intending to make a new and better life but never to find time to set about it is as to put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day to the next until you're dead.
wisdom.author: Og Mandino

wisdom.quote: I view my job as being someone who is supposed to piss people off. I don't want to be just one-of-the-guys. I don't want to be just a smiling face you see on television presenting some vapid kind of easily- digestible garbage. This is rock and roll. I want to be a rock and roll star! Rock and roll is about shaking things up, making people act and react. That's what I do.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: I'm tired of people calling me a devil worshipper. It's kind of pointless you know. Because if the Devil did exist, he'd be worshipping me, because I'm more successful than he is.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: Music critics get their records for free so their opinions usually don't matter.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: Society has traditionally always tried to find scapegoats for its problems. Well, here I am.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: There are people accusing me that I'm sick, that I'm a danger to morals, western civilization and basically everything under the sun. And they've got these wild stories about me, completely off the wall, completely untrue. They thought them up and it makes you wonder what goes on in their brain, but of course, they don't consider themselves sick. They think they're normal because they don't dress like I do.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: We live in a society of victimization, where people are much more comfortable being victimized than actually standing up for themselves.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson

wisdom.quote: Times have not become more violent. They have just become more televised.
wisdom.author: Marilyn Manson, I Don't Like The Media But The Media Likes Me - Columbine statement

wisdom.quote: I believe that all government is evil, and that trying to improve it is largely a waste of time.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: I never lecture, not because I am shy or a bad speaker, but simply because I detest the sort of people who go to lectures and don't want to meet them.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: In the United States, doing good has come to be, like patriotism, a favorite device of persons with something to sell.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Injustice is relatively easy to bear; what stings is justice.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is even harder for the average ape to believe that he has descended from man.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is hard to believe that a man is telling the truth when you know that you would lie if you were in his place.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to imagine Goethe or Beethoven being good at billiards or golf.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is inaccurate to say that I hate everything. I am strongly in favor of common sense, common honesty, and common decency. This makes me forever ineligible for public office.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is now quite lawful for a Catholic woman to avoid pregnancy by a resort to mathematics, though she is still forbidden to resort to physics or chemistry.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: It is the dull man who is always sure, and the sure man who is always dull.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Man is never honestly the fatalist, nor even the stoic. He fights his fate, often desperately. He is forever entering bold exceptions to the rulings of the bench of gods. This fighting, no doubt, makes for human progress, for it favors the strong and the brave. It also makes for beauty, for lesser men try to escape from a hopeless and intolerable world by creating a more lovely one of their own.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Men are the only animals that devote themselves, day in and day out, to making one another unhappy. It is an art like any other. Its virtuosi are called altruists.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Misogynist: A man who hates women as much as women hate one another.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: My guess is that well over 80 percent of the human race goes without having a single original thought.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Never let your inferiors do you a favor - it will be extremely costly.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the intelligence of the American public.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Opera in English is, in the main, just about as sensible as baseball in Italian.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Philosophy consists very largely of one philosopher arguing that all others are jackasses. He usually proves it, and I should add that he also usually proves that he is one himself.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Platitude: an idea (a) that is admitted to be true by everyone, and (b) that is not true.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: People do tell a writer things that they don't tell others. I don't know why, unless it is that having read one or two of his books they feel on peculiarly intimate terms with him; or it may be that they dramatize themselves and, seeing themselves as it were as characters in a novel, are ready to be as open with him as they imagine the characters of his invention are.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the most important use of money - It saves time. Life is so short, and there's so much to do, one can't afford to waste a minute; and just think how much you waste, for instance, in walking from place to place instead of going by bus and in going by bus instead of by taxi.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: The average American can get into the kingdom of heaven much more easily than he can get into the Boulevard St. Germain.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: The dead look so terribly dead when they're dead.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: The fact that a great many people believe something is no guarantee of its truth.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: There are few things so pleasant as a picnic eaten in perfect comfort.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: Unfortunately sometimes one can't do what one thinks is right without making someone else unhappy.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: We didn't think much in the air corps of a fellow who wangled a cushy job out of his C.O. by buttering him up. It was hard for me to believe that God thought much of a man who tried to wangle salvation by fulsome flattery. I should have thought the worship most pleasing to him was to do your best according to your lights.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: We who are of mature age seldom suspect how unmercifully and yet with what insight the very young judge us.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: When you're eighteen your emotions are violent, but they're not durable.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: You Europeans know nothing about America. Because we amass large fortunes you think we care for nothing but money. We are nothing for it; the moment we have it we spend it, sometimes well, sometimes ill, but we spend it. Money is nothing to us; it's merely the symbol of success. We are the greatest idealists in the world; I happen to think that we've set our ideal on the wrong objects; I happen to think that the greatest ideal man can set before himself is self-perfection.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: You learn more quickly under the guidance of experienced teachers. You waste a lot of time going down blind alleys if you have no one to lead you.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Age is not a particularly interesting subject. Anyone can get old. All you have to do is live long enough.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Either this man is dead or my watch has stopped.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: From the moment I picked up your book until I laid it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Go, and never darken my towels again.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: I could dance with you until the cows come home. On second   thought I'd rather dance with the cows until you come home.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: I've had a perfectly wonderful evening. But this wasn't it.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: It isn't necessary to have relatives in Kansas City in order to be unhappy.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Military intelligence is a contradiction in terms.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Military justice is to justice what military music is to music.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Money frees you from doing things you dislike. Since I dislike doing nearly everything, money is handy.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: My mother loved children -- she would have given anything if I had been one.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: There's one way to find out if a man is honest-ask him. If he says, "Yes," you know he is a crook.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Those are my principles, and if you don't like them... well, I have others.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Time flies like an arrow. Fruit flies like a banana.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.quote: Anyone who isn't confused really doesn't understand the situation.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you are wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: Most truths are so naked that people feel sorry for them and cover them up, at least a little bit.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: No one can terrorize a whole nation, unless we are all his accomplices.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: The obscure we see eventually. The completely obvious, it seems, takes longer.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: The speed of communications is wondrous to behold. It is also true that speed can multiply the distribution of information that we know to be untrue.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: We cannot defend freedom abroad by deserting it at home.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: We must not confuse dissent with disloyalty. When the loyal opposition dies, I think the soul of America dies with it.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: We will not walk in fear, one of another. We will not be driven into an age of unreason if we dig deep into our history and remember we are not descended from fearful men.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: When the politicians complain that TV turns the proceedings into a circus, it should be made clear that the circus was already there, and that TV has merely demonstrated that not all the performers are well trained.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow

wisdom.quote: No man can terrorize a whole nation unless we are all his accomplices.
