wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow, On Senator Joseph McCarthy, See It Now, March 7, 1954

wisdom.quote: Everyone is a prisoner of his own experiences. No one can eliminate prejudices - just recognize them.
wisdom.author: Edward R. Murrow, television broadcast, December 31, 1955

wisdom.quote: A successful marriage is an edifice that must be rebuilt every day.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois

wisdom.quote: Above all things, never be afraid. The enemy who forces you to retreat is himself afraid of you at that very moment.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois

wisdom.quote: If men could regard the events of their lives with more open minds they would frequently discover that they did not really desire the thing they failed to obtain.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois

wisdom.quote: In literature as in love, we are astonished at what is chosen by others.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois

wisdom.quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
wisdom.author: Andre Maurois, The Art of Living

wisdom.quote: A satirist is a man who discovers unpleasant things about himself and then says them about other people.
wisdom.author: Peter McArthur

wisdom.quote: Some people have so much respect for their superiors they have none left for themselves.
wisdom.author: Peter McArthur

wisdom.quote: A good home must be made, not bought.
wisdom.author: Joyce Maynard, "Domestic Affairs"

wisdom.quote: Sick I am of idle words, past all reconciling, Words that weary and perplex and pander and conceal, Wake the sounds that cannot lie, for all their sweet beguiling; The language one need fathom not, but only hear and feel.
wisdom.author: George Du Maurier

wisdom.quote: McCabe's Law: Nobody _has_ to do _anything_.
wisdom.author: Charles McCabe

wisdom.quote: Any clod can have the facts, but having opinions is an art.
wisdom.author: Charles McCabe, San Francisco Chronicle

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.
wisdom.author: William G. McAdoo

wisdom.quote: To be turned from one's course by men's opinions, by blame, and by misrepresentation shows a man unfit to hold an office.
wisdom.author: Quintus Fabius Maximus, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: The family is the country of the heart.
wisdom.author: Giuseppe Mazzini

wisdom.quote: Laugh at yourself first, before anyone else can.
wisdom.author: Elsa Maxwell, September 28, 1958

wisdom.quote: Why not be happy after a while? You get to a certain age where you prepare yourself for happiness. Sometimes you never remember to get happy.
wisdom.author: John Mayer, The Ellen DeGeneres Show, 05-14-12

wisdom.quote: The gallery in which the reporters sit has become the fourth estate of the realm.
wisdom.author: Lord McCauley

wisdom.quote: Real success is finding your lifework in the work that you love.
wisdom.author: David McCullough

wisdom.quote: Live your life as though there is great joy to be experienced... an abundance of goodness in each person you come in contact with, and the knowledge that you have enough inner wisdom to answer the mysteries that challenge you.
wisdom.author: Meladee McCarty

wisdom.quote: Irrigation of the land with seawater desalinated by fusion power is ancient. It's called 'rain'.
wisdom.author: Michael McClary

wisdom.quote: Work is not always required... there is such a thing as sacred idleness, the cultivation of which is now fearfully neglected.
wisdom.author: George McDonald

wisdom.quote: Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think it's important.
wisdom.author: Eugene McCarthy

wisdom.quote: It is dangerous for a national candidate to say things that people might remember.
wisdom.author: Eugene McCarthy

wisdom.quote: The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is inefficiency. An efficient bureaucracy is the greatest threat to liberty.
wisdom.author: Eugene McCarthy, Time magazine, Feb. 12, 1979

wisdom.quote: You can go a long way with bad legs and a good head.
wisdom.author: Gavin McDonald, Scottish Bicyclist, 04-15-2006

wisdom.quote: I know that you believe that you understood what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant.
wisdom.author: Robert McCloskey, State Department spokesman (attributed)

wisdom.quote: If ye break faith with us who die  We shall not sleep, though poppies grow  In Flanders fields.
wisdom.author: John McCrae, "In Flanders Fields"

wisdom.quote: If fate means you to lose, give him a good fight anyhow.
wisdom.author: William McFee

wisdom.quote: There is no greater joy nor greater reward than to make a fundamental difference in someone's life.
wisdom.author: Sister Mary Rose McGeady

wisdom.quote: Don't get me wrong: I love nuclear energy! It's just that I prefer fusion to fission. And it just so happens that there's an enormous fusion reactor safely banked a few million miles from us. It delivers more than we could ever use in just about 8 minutes. And it's wireless!
wisdom.author: William McDonough, Fortune Brainstorm Conference, 2006

wisdom.quote: A hobby a day keeps the doldrums away.
wisdom.author: Phyllis Mcginley

wisdom.quote: At the end of the day, whether or not those people are comfortable with how you're living your life doesn't matter. What matters is whether you're comfortable with it.
wisdom.author: Phillip C. McGraw, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: Love can be sordid only if you work at it.
wisdom.author: Brooke McEldowney, 9 Chickweed Lane, 05-10-2006

wisdom.quote: I suppose no matter what I'm drawing, there will always be some sort of question in my mind about it. A work of art (even cartoon art)is never really finished; it is abandoned.
wisdom.author: Brooke McEldowney, Pibgorn commentary, 03-31-05

wisdom.quote: I no longer prepare food or drink with more than one ingredient.
wisdom.author: Cyra McFadden

wisdom.quote: When I pass, speak freely of my shortcomings and my flaws. Learn from them, for I'll have no ego to injure.
wisdom.author: Aaron McGruder, Boondocks, 07-04-04

wisdom.quote: I wonder what it means when your grandson is more crotchety than you are.
wisdom.author: Aaron McGruder, The Boondocks

wisdom.quote: Late to bed and late to wake will keep you long on money and short on mistakes.
wisdom.author: Aaron McGruder, The Boondocks, 07-10-2001

wisdom.quote: Sin bravely...We will never have all the facts to make a perfect judgement, but with the aid of basic experience we must leap bravely into the future.
wisdom.author: Russell R. McIntyre

wisdom.quote: I think the world is run by 'C' students.
wisdom.author: Al McGuire

wisdom.quote: I've often thought the Bible should have a disclaimer in the front saying this is fiction.
wisdom.author: Ian McKellen, Interview on the Today Show, May 2006

wisdom.quote: Equal participants doing similar things will generate lots of new ideas.
wisdom.author: Tom McMakin, CEO, Great Harvest

wisdom.quote: I'm not sure I want popular opinion on my side -- I've noticed those with the most opinions often have the fewest facts.
wisdom.author: Bethania McKenstry

wisdom.quote: I see my body as an instrument, rather than an ornament.
wisdom.author: Alanis Morissette, Reader's Digest, March 2000

wisdom.quote: Be aware that a halo has to fall only a few inches to be a noose.
wisdom.author: Dan McKinnon

wisdom.quote: Accept the pain, cherish the joys, resolve the regrets; then can come the best of benedictions - 'If I had my life to live over, I'd do it all the same.'
wisdom.author: Joan McIntosh

wisdom.quote: Reality is something you rise above.
wisdom.author: Liza Minnelli

wisdom.quote: But O the truth, the truth. The many eyes That look on it! The diverse things they see.
wisdom.author: George Meredith

wisdom.quote: Music like religion, unconditionally brings in its train all the moral virtues to the heart it enters, even though that heart is not in the least worthy.
wisdom.author: Jean Baptiste Montegut

wisdom.quote: Nothing says, 'I have no idea what to get you,' quite like giant beige bath towels.
wisdom.author: Missbhavens, the miscellaneous mischievous misadventures of missbhavens, 05-05-07

wisdom.quote: It's very hard to take yourself too seriously when you look at the world from outer space.
wisdom.author: Thomas K. Mattingly II

wisdom.quote: I don't necessarily agree with everything I say.
wisdom.author: Marshall McLuhan

wisdom.quote: There is absolutely no inevitability as long as there is a willingness to contemplate what is happening.
wisdom.author: Marshall McLuhan

wisdom.quote: The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.
wisdom.author: Marshall McLuhan, "Gutenberg Galaxy", 1962

wisdom.quote: The medium is the message.
wisdom.author: Marshall McLuhan, "Understanding Media", 1964

wisdom.quote: Whatever crushes individuality is despotism, by whatever name it may be called.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty, 1859

wisdom.quote: But society has now fairly got the better of individuality; and the danger which threatens human nature is not the excess, but the deficiency, of personal impulses and preferences.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty,chapter 3, 1859

wisdom.quote: At a dinner party one should eat wisely but not too well, and talk well but not too wisely.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. And my advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: It is a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: It was such a lovely day I thought it a pity to get up.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: The common idea that success spoils people by making them vain, egotistic, and self-complacent is erroneous; on the contrary, it makes them, for the most part, humble, tolerant, and kind. Failure makes people cruel and bitter.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: There are three rules for writing the novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: Tradition is a guide and not a jailer.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: We do not write because we want to; we write because we have to.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: When you have loved as she has loved, you grow old beautifully.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham

wisdom.quote: Like all weak men he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, "Of Human Bondage", 1915

wisdom.quote: People ask for criticism, but they only want praise.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, "Of Human Bondage", 1915

wisdom.quote: Art is merely the refuge which the ingenious have invented, when they were supplied with food and women, to escape the tediousness of life.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: D'you call life a bad job? Never! We've had our ups and downs, we've had our struggles, we've always been poor, but it's been worth it, ay, worth it a hundred times I say when I look round at my children.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: Follow your inclinations with due regard to the policeman round the corner.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: He had heard people speak contemptuously of money: he wondered if they had ever tried to do without it.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: I daresay one profits more by the mistakes one makes off one's own bat than by doing the right thing on somebody's else advice.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: I do not confer praise or blame: I accept. I am the measure of all things. I am the centre of the world.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: I feel like a fugitive from the law of averages.
wisdom.author: William H. Mauldin

wisdom.quote: It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it; but the young know they are wretched for they are full of the truthless ideal which have been instilled into them, and each time they come in contact with the real, they are bruised and wounded.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: It is cruel to discover one's mediocrity only when it is too late.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: It is not wealth one asks for, but just enough to preserve one's dignity, to work unhampered, to be generous, frank and independent.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: It's asking a great deal that things should appeal to your reason as well as your sense of the aesthetic.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: Life wouldn't be worth living if I worried over the future as well as the present.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: Men seek but one thing in life - their pleasure.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: Money is like a sixth sense without which you cannot make a complete use of the other five.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: The important thing was to love rather than to be loved.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: The rain fell alike upon the just and upon the unjust, and for nothing was there a why and a wherefore.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: There was an immeasurable distance between the quick and the dead: they did not seem to belong to the same species; and it was strange to think that but a little while before they had spoken and moved and eaten and laughed.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: There's always one who loves and one who lets himself be loved.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: When I read a book I seem to read it with my eyes only, but now and then I come across a passage, perhaps only a phrase, which has a meaning for me, and it becomes part of me.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: When things are at their worst I find something always happens.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, 'Of Human Bondage', 1915

wisdom.quote: The most useful thing about a principle is that it can always be sacrificed to expediency.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Circle, 1921

wisdom.quote: A woman can forgive a man for the harm he does her...but she can never forgive him for the sacrifices he makes on her account.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Moon and Sixpence

wisdom.quote: I don't think of the past. The only thing that matters is the everlasting present.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Moon and Sixpence

wisdom.quote: Life isn't long enough for love and art.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Moon and Sixpence

wisdom.quote: Sometimes people carry to such perfection the mask they have assumed that in due course they actually become the person they seem.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Moon and Sixpence

wisdom.quote: As if a woman ever loved a man for his virtue.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: Charm and nothing but charm at last grows a little tiresome. It's a relief then to deal with a man who isn't quite so delightful but a little more sincere.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: If nobody spoke unless he had something to say, the human race would very soon lose the use of speech.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: One can be very much in love with a woman without wishing to spend the rest of one's life with her.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: One cannot find peace in work or in pleasure, in the world or in a convent, but only in one's soul.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: Remember that it is nothing to do your duty, that is demanded of you and is no more meritorious than to wash your hands when they are dirty; the only thing that counts is the love of duty; when love and duty are one, then grace is in you and you will enjoy a happiness which passes all understanding.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: Tao. Some of us look for the Way in opium and some in God, some of us in whiskey and some in love. It is all the same Way and it leads nowhither.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: There is only one way to win hearts and that is to make oneself like unto those of whom one would be loved.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: Women are often under the impression that men are much more madly in love with them than they really are.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Painted Veil, 1925

wisdom.quote: A God that can be understood is no God. Who can explain the Infinite in words?
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: A man ought to work. That's what he's here for. That's how he contributes to the welfare of the community.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: A mother only does her children harm if she makes them the only concern of her life.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: All important persons have about them someone in a subordinate position who has their ear. These dependents are very susceptible to slights, and, when they are not treated as they think they should be, will by well-directed shafts, constantly repeated, poison the minds of their patrons against those who have provoked their animosity. It is well to keep in with them.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: An author spends months writing a book, and maybe puts his heart's blood into it, and then it lies about unread till the reader has nothing else in the world to do.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: I like manual labor. Whenever I've got waterlogged with study, I've taken a spell of it and found it spiritually invigorating.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: I never spend more than one hour in a gallery. That is as long as one's power of appreciation persists.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: I'm not only my spirit buy my body, and who can decide how much I, my individual self, am conditioned by the accident of my body? Would Byron have been Byron but for his club foot, or Dostoyevsky Dostoyevsky without his epilepsy?
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: It is very difficult to know people and I don't think one can ever really know any but one's own countrymen. For men and women are not only themselves; they are also the region in which they are born, the city apartment or the farm in which they learnt to walk, the games they played as children, the old wives' tales they overheard, the food they ate, the schools they attended, the sports they followed, the poets they read, and the God they believed in. It is all these things that have made them what they are, and these are the things that you can't come to know by hearsay, you can only know them if you have lived them.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: It's a toss-up when you decide to leave the beaten track. Many are called, but few are chosen.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: It's always difficult to make conversation with a drunk, and there's no denying it, the sober are at a disadvantage with him.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: Nothing in the world is permanent, and we're foolish when we ask anything to last, but surely we're still more foolish not to take delight in it while we have it. If change is of the essence of existence one would have thought it only sensible to make it the premise of our philosophy.
wisdom.author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Razor's Edge, 1943

wisdom.quote: Life ain't like books. Books got somebody writin' 'em and tryin' to entertain ya. Life is more like a set of Legos. Unless you take care of 'em, you lose a few pieces and you end up steppin' on 'em with bare feet. You gotta take care of your life.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: 35 Minutes Away From Home, 02-29-12

wisdom.quote: Our creations MUST be shared to be art, and the easiest way to share our art is to sell it.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: 35 Minutes from Home, 03-07-12

wisdom.quote: Better to look weak and be strong than to look strong and be weak.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: 35 Minutes from Home, 05-19-12

wisdom.quote: There's nothing like seeing a photo of yourself in happier days speeding toward your face in anger.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 01-07-09

wisdom.quote: There is nothing like the razor sharp tongue of a good friend to cut through the lies we tell ourselves.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 02-25-09

wisdom.quote: You don't get to pick your own nickname. They've gotta give you one. It's like we're all tryin' to make pets out of each other and we're not comfortable unless we get to name 'em.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 03-26-08

wisdom.quote: I've decided that the key to happiness is low expectations.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 06-04-08

wisdom.quote: Even the most dangerous look less threatening when they are dead.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 07-09-08

wisdom.quote: Sometimes ya gotta do stuff 'cause it's expected of ya, not 'cause of anything else.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 07-09-08

wisdom.quote: Ain't never seen a ski trip fix a marriage.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 07-11-2007

wisdom.quote: A man that don't believe in destiny don't need to know what his destiny is.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 08-20-08

wisdom.quote: The more I know about business, the more I'm convinced that it is conducted in homes and churches far more than in office buildings.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 09-17-08

wisdom.quote: Mighty hard to tell the people you love you're a failure.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Merriton: Twelve Hours from San Francisco, 11-28-07

wisdom.quote: You learn a lot about people when you play games with them.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Pick Me! 02-11-09

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the joys of our youth do not translate to joys in adulthood and it�s hard to release them.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, Starling Fitness, 07-23-08

wisdom.quote: We make our gadgets our own by the way that we use them, with or without the permission of the manufacturer.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Gadgets Page, 07-09-09

wisdom.quote: Enmeshed in the details of life, a diary rarely talks about the important things. It turns out that most of life happens off-screen.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Quotations Blog, 09-19-07

wisdom.quote: A fine dress on a homely maiden is never enough of a distraction. It can convey a sense of wealth and its accompanying attractions, but it can never truly compensate for a plain face.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: A scoundrel will forever be a scoundrel, no matter which coat he wears.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: An old friend is like a tender memory or a comfortable shoe. It takes years of caring to get to that point.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin

wisdom.quote: I'm glad I don't have to explain to a man from Mars why each day I set fire to dozens of little pieces of paper, and then put them in my mouth.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin

wisdom.quote: If I knew what I was so anxious about, I wouldn't be so anxious.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin

wisdom.quote: If you jot down every silly thought that pops into your mind, you will soon find out everything you most seriously believe.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin

wisdom.quote: No one really listens to anyone else, and if you try it for a while you'll see why.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin

wisdom.quote: It's innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn't.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin, The Neurotic's Notebook

wisdom.quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
wisdom.author: Mignon McLaughlin, The Second Neurotic's Notebook, 1966

wisdom.quote: Incompetents invariably make trouble for people other than themselves.
wisdom.author: Larry McMurtry, 'Lonesome Dove'

wisdom.quote: Brains, like hearts, go where they are appreciated.
wisdom.author: Robert S. McNamara, former U.S. Secretary of Defense

wisdom.quote: We try to grab pieces of our lives as they speed past us. Photographs freeze those pieces and help us remember how we were. We don't know these lost people but if you look around, you'll find someone just like them.
wisdom.author: Gene McSweeney, Grey Water Photography, 06-04-2006

wisdom.quote: I'd rather wake up in the middle of nowhere than in any city on earth.
wisdom.author: Steve McQueen

wisdom.quote: In reality, serendipity accounts for one percent of the blessings we receive in life, work and love. The other 99 percent is due to our efforts.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams

wisdom.quote: Acceptance is not a state of passivity or inaction. I am not saying you can't change the world, right wrongs, or replace evil with good. Acceptance is, in fact, the first step to successful action. If you don't fully accept a situation precisely the way it is, you will have difficulty changing it. Moreover, if you don't fully accept the situation, you will never really know if the situation should be changed.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Acceptance is such an important commodity, some have called it "the first law of personal growth."
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Guilt is anger directed at ourselves--at what we did or did not do.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: If our early lessons of acceptance were as successful as our early lessons of anger, how much happier we would all be.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Many people weigh the guilt they will feel against the pleasure of the forbidden action they want to take.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Mistakes, obviously, show us what needs improving. Without mistakes, how would we know what we had to work on?
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Pain (any pain--emotional, physical, mental) has a message. The information it has about our life can be remarkably specific, but it usually falls into one of two categories: "We would be more alive if we did more of this," and, "Life would be more lovely if we did less of that." Once we get the pain's message, and follow its advice, the pain goes away.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Resentment is anger directed at others--at what they did or did not do.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: Stubbornness is also determination. It's simply a matter of shifting from "won't power" to "will power."
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: The more severe the pain or illness, the more severe will be the necessary changes. These may involve breaking bad habits, or acquiring some new and better ones.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: The simple solution for disappointment depression: Get up and get moving. Physically move. Do. Act. Get going.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: To avoid situations in which you might make mistakes may be the biggest mistake of all.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: To use fear as the friend it is, we must retrain and reprogram ourselves...We must persistently and convincingly tell ourselves that the fear is here--with its gift of energy and heightened awareness--so we can do our best and learn the most in the new situation.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101

wisdom.quote: If you want peace, stop fighting. If you want peace of mind, stop fighting with your thoughts.
wisdom.author: Peter McWilliams, Life 101, 1991

wisdom.quote: Of one thing I am certain, the body is not the measure of healing - peace is the measure.
wisdom.author: George Melton

wisdom.quote: You couldn't even prove the White House staff sane beyond a reasonable doubt.
wisdom.author: Ed Meese, on the Hinckley verdict

wisdom.quote: Not even computers will replace committees, because committees buy computers.
wisdom.author: Edward Shepherd Mead

wisdom.quote: I must govern the clock, not be governed by it.
wisdom.author: Golda Meir

wisdom.quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart, don't know how to laugh either.
wisdom.author: Golda Meir

wisdom.quote: We can forgive you for killing our sons. But we will never forgive you for making us kill yours.
wisdom.author: Golda Meir, to Anwar Saddat just before the peace talks.

wisdom.quote: Anybody who has doubts about the ingenuity or the resourcefulness of a plumber never got a bill from one.
wisdom.author: George Meany

wisdom.quote: Gentlemen prefer bonds.
wisdom.author: Andrew Mellon

wisdom.quote: As I was walking up the stair  I met a man who wasn't there.  He wasn't there again today.  I wish, I wish he'd stay away.
wisdom.author: Hughes Mearns

wisdom.quote: The human mind treats a new idea the same way the body treats a strange protein; it rejects it.
wisdom.author: P. B. Medawar

wisdom.quote: Nobody ever did anything very foolish except from some strong principle.
wisdom.author: William Melbourne

wisdom.quote: Men must be decided on what they will not do, and then they are able to act with vigor in what they ought to do.
wisdom.author: Mencius, Works

wisdom.quote: Never has a man who has bent himself been able to make others straight.
wisdom.author: Mencius, Works

wisdom.quote: Sincerity is the way of Heaven.
wisdom.author: Mencius, Works

wisdom.quote: People are always asking me what my lyrics mean. Well I say what any decent poet would say if you dared ask him to analyse his work: if you see it, darling, then it's there.
wisdom.author: Freddie Mercury, In an interview

wisdom.quote: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead

wisdom.quote: I was brought up to believe that the only thing worth doing was to add to the sum of accurate information in the world.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead

wisdom.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead

wisdom.quote: Our first and most pressing problem is how to do away with warfare as a method of solving conflicts between national groups within a society who have different views about how the society is to run.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead

wisdom.quote: Women want mediocre men, and men are working hard to become as mediocre as possible.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead

wisdom.quote: No society that feeds its children on tales of successful violence can expect them not to believe that violence in the end is rewarded.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mead, Anthropologist (1901-1978)

wisdom.quote: The cure for the evils of democracy is more democracy!
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken, Notes on Democracy, 1926

wisdom.quote: After all, all he did was string together a lot of old, well-known quotations.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken, on Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: There is always a well-known solution to every human problem--neat, plausible, and wrong.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken, Prejudices: Second Series, 1920

wisdom.quote: The least of learning is done in the classrooms.
wisdom.author: Thomas Merton

wisdom.quote: The truth that many people never understand, until it is too late, is that the more you try to avoid suffering the more you suffer because smaller and more insignificant things begin to torture you in proportion to your fear of being hurt.
wisdom.author: Thomas Merton

wisdom.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
wisdom.author: Thomas Merton, 'No Man Is an Island'

wisdom.quote: Habits are like supervisors that you don't notice.
wisdom.author: Hannes Messemer

wisdom.quote: What's the point of worshipping a forgiving god if you're just gonna be good anyway?
wisdom.author: Matt Milby, Malfunction Junction, 07-17-06

wisdom.quote: Set up as an ideal the facing of reality as honestly and as cheerfully as possible.
wisdom.author: Dr. Karl Menninger

wisdom.quote: The adjuration to be "normal" seems shockingly repellent to me; I see neither hope nor comfort in sinking to that low level. I think it is ignorance that makes people think of abnormality only with horror and allows them to remain undismayed at the proximity of "normal" to average and mediocre. For surely anyone who achieves anything is, essentially, abnormal.
wisdom.author: Dr. Karl Menninger

wisdom.quote: Most conversations are simply monologues delivered in the presence of witnesses.
wisdom.author: Margaret Millar

wisdom.quote: Everybody likes a kidder, but nobody lends him money.
wisdom.author: Arthur Miller

wisdom.quote: Glamour, that trans-human aura or power to attract imitation, is a kind of vessel into which dreams are poured, and some vessels are simply worthier than others... A beautiful woman can turn heads but real glamour has a deeper pull... Glamour [is] the power to rearrange people's emotions, which, in effect, is the power to control one's environment.
wisdom.author: Arthur Miller

wisdom.quote: The jungle is dark but full of diamonds...
wisdom.author: Arthur Miller, Death of a Salesman

wisdom.quote: Cleave to no faith when faith brings blood.
wisdom.author: Arthur Miller, The Crucible, act II

wisdom.quote: The need of man to wholly realize himself is the only fixed star.
wisdom.author: Arthur Miller, Tragedy and the Common Man

wisdom.quote: We need anything politically important rationed out like Pez: small, sweet, and coming out of a funny, plastic head.
wisdom.author: Dennis Miller

wisdom.quote: Fear sometimes stops you from doing stupid things. But it can also stop you from doing creative or exciting or experimental things. It can cloud your judgment of others, and lead to all kinds of evil. The control and understanding of our personal fears is one of the most important undertakings in our life.
wisdom.author: Helen Mirren

wisdom.quote: Say not, when I have leisure I will study; you may not have leisure.
wisdom.author: The Mishnah

wisdom.quote: Beware the pull on your heartstrings -- it's often the pursestrings that are actually being reached for.
wisdom.author: Barbara Mikkelson, snopes.com, May 15, 2001

wisdom.quote: To be absolutely certain about something, one must know everything or nothing about it.
wisdom.author: Olin Miller

wisdom.quote: You probably wouldn't worry about what people think of you if you could know how seldom they do.
wisdom.author: Olin Miller

wisdom.quote: A man thinks that by mouthing hard words he understands hard things.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville

wisdom.quote: If you can get nothing better out of the world, get a good dinner out of it, at least.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville

wisdom.quote: Life's a voyage that's homeward bound.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville

wisdom.quote: Of all the preposterous assumptions of humanity over humanity, nothing exceeds most of the criticisms made on the habits of the poor by the well-housed, well-warmed, and well-fed.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville

wisdom.quote: When beholding the tranquil beauty and brilliancy of the ocean's skin, one forgets the tiger heart that pants beneath it; and would not willingly remember that this velvet paw but conceals a remorseless fang.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville, "Moby Dick"

wisdom.quote: To the last, I grapple with thee; from hell's heart I stab at thee; for hate's sake I spit my last breath at thee.
wisdom.author: Herman Melville, Moby Dick, 1851

wisdom.quote: The power of illustrative anecdotes often lies not in how well they present reality, but in how well they reflect the core beliefs of their audience.
wisdom.author: David P. Mikkelson, Snopes.com, 04-10-04

wisdom.quote: Authenticity matters little, though--our willingness to accept legends depends far more upon their expression of concepts we want to believe than upon their plausibility.
wisdom.author: David P. Mikkelson, snopes.com, February 25, 2000

wisdom.quote: Perhaps better we not obscure the idea that happiness and misery, kindness and greed, and good works and bad deeds are within the capacities of us all, not merely a select few.
wisdom.author: David P. Mikkelson, snopes.com, September 8, 2003

wisdom.quote: The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present. You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman

wisdom.quote: If you don't get what you want, you suffer; if you get what you don't want, you suffer; even when you get exactly what you want, you still suffer because you can't hold on to it forever. Your mind is your predicament. It wants to be free of change. Free of pain, free of the obligations of life and death. But change is a law, and no amount of pretending will alter that reality.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman, The Way of the Peaceful Warrior

wisdom.quote: Moderation? It's mediocrity, fear, and confusion in disguise. It's the devil's dilemma. It's neither doing nor not doing. It's the wobbling compromise that makes no one happy. Moderation is for the bland, the apologetic, for the fence-sitters of the world afraid to take a stand. It's for those afraid to laugh or cry, for those afraid to live or die. Moderation...is lukewarm tea, the devil's own brew.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman, The Way of the Peaceful Warrior

wisdom.quote: Money can't buy friends, but it can get you a better class of enemy.
wisdom.author: Spike Milligan

wisdom.quote: Are you going to come quietly, or do I have to use earplugs?
wisdom.author: Spike Milligan, from "The Goon Show"

wisdom.quote: Is love supposed to last throughout all time, or is it like trains changing at random stops. If I loved her, how could I leave her? If I felt that way then, how come I don't feel anything now?
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Altered Egos, 1993

wisdom.quote: Sexually,we are all competing for the same seat on the bus and the thing that holds it together is the tightly held conceit that we are all sexual gods. How can I believe in my own uniqueness when there's a cat out there exactly the same as me?
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Altered Egos, 1993

wisdom.quote: George Washington had a vision for this country. Was it three days of uninterrupted shopping?
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Bolt from the Blue, 1994

wisdom.quote: You think Nature is some Disney movie? Nature is a killer. Nature is a bitch. It's feeding time out there 24 hours a day, every step that you take is a gamble with death. If it isn't getting hit with lightning today, it's an earthquake tomorrow or some deer tick carrying Lime disease. Either way, you're ending up on the wrong end of the food chain.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Bolt from the Blue, 1994

wisdom.quote: I'm not judging people, I'm judging their actions. It's the same type of distinction that I try to apply to myself, to judge, but not be judgmental.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Crime and Punishment, 1992

wisdom.quote: The law is not so much carved in stone as it is written in water, flowing in and out with the tide.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Crime and Punishment, 1992

wisdom.quote: Rain usually makes me feel mellow. Curl up in the corner time, slow down, smell the furniture. Today it just makes me feel wet.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Dateline: Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: What is it about possessing things? Why do we feel the need to own what we love, and why do we become jerks when we do? We've all been there-- you want something, to possess it. By possessing something you lose it. You finally win the girl of your dreams, the first thing you do is change her. The little things she does with her hair, the way she wears her clothes or the way she chews her gum. Pretty soon what you like, what you changed, what you don't like, blends together like a watercolor in the rain.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Dateline: Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: The idea of an election is much more interesting to me than the election itself...The act of voting is in itself the defining moment.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Democracy in America, 1992

wisdom.quote: It's not your painting anymore. It stopped being your painting the moment that you finished it.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Fish Story, 1994

wisdom.quote: You're confusing product with process. Most people, when they criticize, whether they like it or hate it, they're talking about product. That's not art, that's the result of art. Art, to whatever degree we can get a handle on (I'm not sure that we really can) is a process. It begins in the heart and the mind with the eyes and hands.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Fish Story, 1994

wisdom.quote: Talking perceptions, people. Do we really see each other for what we really are, or do we just see what we want to see, the image distorted by our own personal lenses? I lost someone today and the funny thing is, I don't even know who she was.
wisdom.author: Jeff Melvoin, Northern Exposure, Lovers and Madmen, 1994

wisdom.quote: Not merely an absence of noise, Real Silence begins when a reasonable being withdraws from the noise in order to find peace and order in his inner sanctuary.
wisdom.author: Peter Minard

wisdom.quote: I conceive the essential task of religion to be "to develop the consciences, the ideals, and the aspirations of mankind".
wisdom.author: Robert Millikan

wisdom.quote: It's very strange when the life you never had flashes before your eyes.
wisdom.author: Terri Minsky, Sex and the City, The Baby Shower, 1998

wisdom.quote: Desperate is not a sexual preference.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Postive, 01-08-09

wisdom.quote: People age even when you're not looking.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Postive, 07-30-08

wisdom.quote: Say what you will about the Ten Commandments, you must always come back to the pleasant fact that there are only ten of them.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The capacity of human beings to bore one another seems to be vastly greater than that of any other animal.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The chief value of money lies in the fact that one lives in a world in which it is overestimated.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The demagogue is one who preaches doctrines he knows to be untrue to men he knows to be idiots.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The government consists of a gang of men exactly like you and me. They have, taking one with another, no special talent for the business of government; they have only a talent for getting and holding office.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The men the American people admire most extravagantly are the most daring liars; the men they detest most violently are those who try to tell them the truth.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The men the American public admire most extravagantly are the most daring liars; the men they detest most violently are those who try to tell them the truth.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The most common of all follies is to believe passionately in the palpably not true. It is the chief occupation of mankind.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The penalty for laughing in a courtroom is six months in jail; if it were not for this penalty, the jury would never hear the evidence.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The trouble with fighting for human freedom is that one spends most of one's time defending scoundrels. For it is against scoundrels that oppressive laws are first aimed, and oppression must be stopped at the beginning if it is to be stopped at all.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The world always makes the assumption that the exposure of an error is identical with the discovery of truth--that the error and truth are simply opposite. They are nothing of the sort. What the world turns to, when it is cured of one error, is usually simply another error, and maybe one worse than the first one.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: To die for an idea; it is unquestionably noble. But how much nobler it would be if men died for ideas that were true!
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Under democracy one party always devotes its chief energies to trying to prove that the other party is unfit to rule - and both commonly succeed, and are right.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Unquestionably, there is progress. The average American now pays out twice as much in taxes as he formerly got in wages.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that all human knowledge is moonshine.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: What the meaning of human life may be I don't know: I incline to suspect that it has none.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: The difference between a moral man and a man of honor is that the latter regrets a discreditable act, even when it has worked and he has not been caught.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken, 'Prejudices: Fourth Series,' 1924

wisdom.quote: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken, A Mencken Chrestomathy

wisdom.quote: Some tips for life: 1.Don't be afraid to follow your dreams, unless your dreams are stupid. 2.Be kind to people. 3.Don't get too excited when you read the Fountainhead 4.In times of recession, it is time for invention. 5.Things can kill you, so keep that in mind, you fearless know it alls.
wisdom.author: Eugene  Mirman, LHS Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: A man who thinks he has a higher purpose can do terrible things, even to those he professes to love.
wisdom.author: Denise Mina, Hellblazer: Empathy is the Enemy, 2006

wisdom.quote: I bet the human brain is a kludge.
wisdom.author: Marvin Minsky

wisdom.quote: Imagine what it would be like if TV actually were good. It would be the end of everything we know.
wisdom.author: Marvin Minsky

wisdom.quote: No computer has ever been designed that is ever aware of what it's doing; but most of the time, we aren't either.
wisdom.author: Marvin Minsky

wisdom.quote: You don't understand anything until you learn it more than one way.
wisdom.author: Marvin Minsky

wisdom.quote: In general we are least aware of what our minds do best.
wisdom.author: Marvin Minsky,  The Society of Mind

wisdom.quote: I know love and lust don't always keep the same company.
wisdom.author: Stephenie Meyer, Twilight, 2005

wisdom.quote: I like the night. Without the dark, we'd never see the stars.
wisdom.author: Stephenie Meyer, Twilight, 2005

wisdom.quote: I was thinking about how disjointedly time seemed to flow, passing in a blur at times, with single images standing out more clearly than others. And then, at other times, every second was significant, etched in my mind.
wisdom.author: Stephenie Meyer, Twilight, 2005

wisdom.quote: Just because we've been dealt a certain hand, it doesn't mean that we can't choose to rise above - to conquer the boundaries of a destiny that none of us wanted. To try to retain whatever essential humanity we can.
wisdom.author: Stephenie Meyer, Twilight, 2005

wisdom.quote: Twilight, again. Another ending. No matter how perfect the day is, it always has to end.
wisdom.author: Stephenie Meyer, Twilight, 2005

wisdom.quote: I never know how much of what I say is true.
wisdom.author: Bette Midler

wisdom.quote: The mass production of distraction is now as much a part of the American way of life as the mass production of automobiles.
wisdom.author: C. Wright Mills

wisdom.quote: Look at what your idea of success would be. The more that you take in external motivators, the more it reduces your ultimate satisfaction because it doesn't come from inside.
wisdom.author: Chris Messina, Cashing In or Selling Out, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Culture makes all men gentle.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.quote: He who labors diligently need never despair; for all things are accomplished by diligence and labor.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.quote: Let bravery be thy choice, but not bravado.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.quote: The character of a man is known from his conversations.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.quote: The sword the body wounds, sharp words the mind.
wisdom.author: Menander

wisdom.quote: Riches cover a multitude of woes.
wisdom.author: Menander, Lady of Andros

wisdom.quote: The man who runs may fight again.
wisdom.author: Menander, Monostikoi (Single Lines)

wisdom.quote: Whom the gods love dies young.
wisdom.author: Menander, The Double Deceiver

wisdom.quote: Deus ex machina [A god from the machine]
wisdom.author: Menander, The Woman Possessed with a Divinity

wisdom.quote: I call a fig a fig, a spade a spade.
wisdom.author: Menander, Unidentified fragment

wisdom.quote: It is not white hair that engenders wisdom.
wisdom.author: Menander, Unidentified fragment

wisdom.quote: Why should I buy expensive art when I can make my own.
wisdom.author: Piero Milani

wisdom.quote: A person may cause evil to others not only by his action but by his inaction, and in either case he is justly accountable to them for the injury.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: A person may cause evil to others not only by his actions but by his inaction, and in either case he is justly accountable to them for the injury.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: Ask yourself whether you are happy and you cease to be so.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: Conservatives are not necessarily stupid, but most stupid people are conservatives.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: If mankind minus one were of one opinion, then mankind is no more justified in silencing the one than the one - if he had the power - would be justified in silencing mankind.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: Indeed the dictum that truth always triumphs over persecution, is one of those pleasant falsehoods which men repeat after one another till they pass into common places, but which all experience refutes.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: No great improvements in the lot of mankind are possible until a great change takes place in the fundamental constitution of their modes of thought.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: One person with a belief is equal to a force of 99 who have only interests.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in the next.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: There are many truths by which the full meaning cannot be realized until personal experience has brought it home.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse. The person who has nothing for which he is willing to fight, nothing which is more important than his own personal safety, is a miserable creature and has no chance of being free unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: We can never be sure that the opinion we are endeavoring to stifle is a false opinion; and if we were sure, stifling it would be an evil still.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill

wisdom.quote: Next to selfishness the principal cause which makes life unsatisfactory is want of mental cultivation.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, Defence of Hedonism

wisdom.quote: Everyone who receives the protection of society owes a return for the benefit.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty

wisdom.quote: Over one's mind and over one's body the individual is sovereign.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty

wisdom.quote: The only purpose for which power can be rightfully exercised over any member of a civilized community, against his will, is to prevent harm to others. His own good, either physical or moral, is not sufficient warrant.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty

wisdom.quote: He who lets the world, or his own portion of it, choose his plan of life for him, has no need of any other faculty than the ape-like one of imitation. He who chooses his plan for himself, employs all his faculties. He must use observation to see, reasoning and judgment to foresee, activity to gather materials for decision, discrimination to decide, and when he has decided, firmness and self-control to hold to his deliberate decision.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty, 1859

wisdom.quote: No one can be a great thinker who does not recognize that as a thinker it is his first duty to follow his intellect to whatever conclusions it may lead. Truth gains more even by the errors of one who, with due study, and preparation, thinks for himself, than by the true opinions of those who only hold them because they do not suffer themselves to think.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty, 1859

wisdom.quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it. Each is the proper guardian of his own health, whether bodily, or mental or spiritual. Mankind are greater gainers by suffering each other to live as seems good to themselves, than by compelling each to live as seems good to the rest.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty, 1859

wisdom.quote: The only freedom which deserves the name, is that of pursuing our own good in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.
wisdom.author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty, 1859

wisdom.quote: Cats regard people as warmblooded furniture.
wisdom.author: Jacquelyn Mitchard, The Deep End of the Ocean

wisdom.quote: You have to recognize when the right place and the right time fuse and take advantage of that opportunity. There are plenty of opportunities out there. You can't sit back and wait.
wisdom.author: Ellen Metcalf

wisdom.quote: Until you've lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was.
wisdom.author: Margaret Mitchell

wisdom.quote: Most people ignore most poetry  because  most poetry ignores most people.
wisdom.author: Adrian Mitchell

wisdom.quote: Help others get ahead. You will always stand taller with someone else on your shoulders.
wisdom.author: Bob Moawad

wisdom.quote: I had an epiphany a few years ago where I was out at a celebrity party and it suddenly dawned on me that I had yet to meet a celebrity who is as smart and interesting as any of my friends.
wisdom.author: Moby, quoted on CNN.com, March 2005

wisdom.quote: I learned in the last few years that it's really unhappy and really unsustainable to try and base your well being on something as arbitrary as record sale and critical acclaim and the interests of the public. All of those things are so fickle. So my approach now to music is I want to make records that I love, and I hope that other people love them, then that's OK.
wisdom.author: Moby, quoted on CNN.com, March 2005

wisdom.quote: It just seem like musicians want to sell a few records and put out a perfume line, and I think it's so sad that there are so many musicians who don't want to change the world... Music has been so much more.
wisdom.author: Moby, quoted on CNN.com, March 2005

wisdom.quote: A celebrity is one who is known to many persons he is glad he doesn't know.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: A cynic is a man who, when he smells flowers, looks around for a coffin.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: A home is not a mere transient shelter: its essence lies in the personalities of the people who live in it.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: A judge is a law student who marks his own examination papers.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: A poet more than thirty years old is simply an overgrown child.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: All men are frauds. The only difference between them is that some admit it. I myself deny it.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: All successful newspapers are ceaselessly querulous and bellicose. They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it; if the job is forced on them, they tackle it by denouncing someone or something else.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: All [zoos] actually offer to the public in return for the taxes spent upon them is a form of idle and witless amusement, compared to which a visit to a penitentiary, or even to a State legislature in session, is informing, stimulating and ennobling.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: An idealist is one who, on noticing that a rose smells better than a cabbage, concludes that it will also make better soup.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Any man who afflicts the human race with ideas must be prepare to see them misunderstood.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Any man who afflicts the human race with ideas must be prepared to see them misunderstood.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Conscience is a mother-in-law whose visit never ends.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Criticism is prejudice made plausible.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Democracy is the theory that the common people know what they want and deserve to get it good and hard.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Every decent man is ashamed of the government he lives under.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Every normal man must be tempted at times to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin to slit throats.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Faith may be defined briefly as an illogical belief in the occurrence of the improbable.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: For centuries, theologians have been explaining the unknowable in terms of the-not-worth-knowing.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: For it is mutual trust, even more than mutual interest that holds human associations together. Our friends seldom profit us but they make us feel safe... Marriage is a scheme to accomplish exactly that same end.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: Giving every man a vote has no more made men wise and free than Christianity has made them good.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: I love humanity, but I hate people.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

wisdom.quote: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it is one damn thing over and over.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

wisdom.quote: Soar, eat ether, see what has never been seen; depart, be lost, but climb.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

wisdom.quote: My candle burns at both endsIt will not last the night;But ah, my foes, and oh, my friends -It gives a lovely light.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay, "A Few Figs from Thistles", 1920

wisdom.quote: Please give me some good advice in your next letter. I promise not to follow it.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay, Letters

wisdom.quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling into at night. I miss you like hell.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay, Letters

wisdom.quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
wisdom.author: Jeanne Moreau

wisdom.quote: I don't think success is harmful, as so many people say. Rather, I believe it indispensable to talent, if for nothing else than to increase the talent.
wisdom.author: Jeanne Moreau

wisdom.quote: A great marriage is not when the 'perfect couple' comes together. It is when an imperfect couple learns to enjoy their differences.
wisdom.author: Dave Meurer, "Daze of Our Wives"

wisdom.quote: We never stop investigating. We are never satisfied that we know enough to get by. Every question we answer leads on to another question. This has become the greatest survival trick of our species.
wisdom.author: Desmond Morris

wisdom.quote: Our heroes are people and people are flawed. Don't let that taint the thing you love.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Midnight Macabre, 09-27-07

wisdom.quote: We all have a few failures under our belt. It's what makes us ready for the successes.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Midnight Macabre, 10-18-05

wisdom.quote: Things aren't magically better if that's what you're hoping for. It's not that simple.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 02-11-05

wisdom.quote: In the end, we decide if we're remembered for what happened to us or for what we did with it.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 06-29-06

wisdom.quote: Typos are very important to all written form. It gives the reader something to look for so they aren't distracted by the total lack of content in your writing.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 07-03-05

wisdom.quote: It's a lot like nature. You only have as many animals as the ecosystem can support and you only have as many friends as you can tolerate the bitching of.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 08-16-05

wisdom.quote: In the end, you'll know which people really love you. They're the ones who see you for who you are and, no matter what, always find a way to be at your side.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 08-23-05

wisdom.quote: Sometimes people do things that hurt and it's not because they mean to. They just do. It doesn't necessarily have anything to do with you, but you end up hurt because of it.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 08-23-05

wisdom.quote: It hurts to find out that what you wanted doesn't match what you dreamed it would be.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 09-07-04

wisdom.quote: The only thing that lasts longer than a friend's love is the stupidity that keeps us from knowing any better.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 09-07-06

wisdom.quote: The shortest verse in the Bible is 'Jesus wept.' The only thing wrong with it is the past tense.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 10-10-06

wisdom.quote: That's the thing with suicide pacts. Sometimes they only really work if they catch you by surprise.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 10-11-05

wisdom.quote: Never confuse the faith with the supposedly faithful.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 10-19-06

wisdom.quote: The only time anyone's admitted they were a Christian before was when they were busy telling me why they're better than me.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 10-19-06

wisdom.quote: The key is to commit crimes so confusing that police feel too stupid to even write a crime report about them.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 10-30-03

wisdom.quote: Slow and steady wins the race, then wastes no time grinding salt-caked glass in your open wounds.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 11-06-05

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the measure of friendship isn't your ability to not harm but your capacity to forgive the things done to you and ask forgiveness for your own mistakes.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 11-07-05

wisdom.quote: There are people I know who won't hurt me. I call them corpses.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 12-06-05

wisdom.quote: Could you imagine how horrible things would be if we always told others how we felt? Life would be intolerably bearable.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 12-09-05

wisdom.quote: Why do we have to wait for special moments to say nice things or tell people we care about them?
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive Comic, 12-09-05

wisdom.quote: Honesty is probably the sexiest thing a man can give to a woman.
wisdom.author: Debra Messing

wisdom.quote: All growth is a leap in the dark, a spontaneous unpremeditated act without the benefit of experience.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: Develop interest in life as you see it; in people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: Every moment is a golden one for him who has the vision to recognize it as such.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: Life is constantly providing us with new funds, new resources, even when we are reduced to immobility. In life's ledger there is no such thing as frozen assets.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: Living apart and at peace with myself, I came to realize more vividly the meaning of the doctrine of acceptance. To refrain from giving advice, to refrain from meddling in the affairs of others, to refrain, even though the motives be the highest, from tampering with another's way of life - so simple, yet so difficult for an active spirit. Hands off!
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: One's destination is never a place but rather a new way of looking at things.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: What does it matter how one comes by the truth so long as one pounces upon it and lives by it?
wisdom.author: Henry Miller

wisdom.quote: To live without killing is a thought which could electrify the world, if men were only capable of staying awake long enough to let the idea soak in.
wisdom.author: Henry Miller, The Henry Miller Reader (1959), "Reunion in Brooklyn"

wisdom.quote: "How long does getting thin take?" Pooh asked anxiously.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne

wisdom.quote: For one person who dreams of making fifty thousand pounds, a hundred people dream of being left fifty thousand pounds.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne

wisdom.quote: If one is to be called a liar, one may as well make an effort to deserve the name.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne

wisdom.quote: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne

wisdom.quote: The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne

wisdom.quote: I am a Bear of Very Little Brain, and long words bother me.
wisdom.author: A. A. Milne, Winnie-the-Pooh

wisdom.quote: Give me the liberty to know, to utter, and to argue freely according to conscience, above all liberties.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: He that studieth revenge keepeth his own wounds green, which otherwise would heal and do well.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: He who kills a man kills a reasonable creature, but he who destroys a good book kills reason itself.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: He who reigns within himself and rules his passions, desires, and fears is more than a king.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: No man who know aught can be so stupid to deny that all men naturally were born free.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: None can love freedom heartily, but good men; the rest love not freedom, but license.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: Where there is much desire to learn, there of necessity will be much arguing, much writing, many opinions; for opinions in good men is but knowledge in the making.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: Who overcomes by force hath overcome but half his foe.
wisdom.author: John Milton

wisdom.quote: Sometimes old things need to go away. That way, we have room for the new things that come into our lives.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive webcomic, 09-17-05

wisdom.quote: The only way to be truly misogynistic is to be a woman.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive webcomic, 11-11-04

wisdom.quote: You can't show love to someone at the expense of someone else who loves you.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 01-19-10

wisdom.quote: You make me understand how wonderful it is for little lizards when they find that one special rock that's perfect for sunning themselves on. You make me lizard-happy.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 02-23-10

wisdom.quote: It's not a matter of whether or not someone's watching over you. It's just a question of their intentions.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 03-24-07

wisdom.quote: Success only hurts the first time.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 04-01-2006

wisdom.quote: Lies are like children. If you don't nurture them, they'll never be useful later.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 07-26-2012

wisdom.quote: A birthday wish granted 23 years late is still a birthday wish granted.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 08-02-11

wisdom.quote: Ah, sweet alcohol. Like a true friend, you replace the anger with better, louder anger.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 08-23-11

wisdom.quote: Death likes it when you play hard to get.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 09-20-12

wisdom.quote: Being prepared for loss is never the same as being ready for it.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 10-20-09

wisdom.quote: I barely trust established sources of information. I have a hard time finding [Wikipedia], an encyclopedia that anyone can alter, to be a safe way to learn about anything except how many idiots think their opinions are a suitable substitute for facts.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 10-31-2006

wisdom.quote: Friendship is being there when someone's feeling low and not being afraid to kick them.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 11-04-10

wisdom.quote: Think of life as a giant, fat cat you're in charge of. Sometimes you can control it, but other times, it's going to do what it wants and you have to roll with it. And sometimes you can do everything - everything you're s'posed to do- and it'll still shred all the things you hold dear... The only thing you can really do with life is rub its belly and prepare for the worst.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 11-07-2011

wisdom.quote: I guess that's how death works. It doesn't matter if we're ready or not. It just happens.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 11-29-2006

wisdom.quote: Forgiveness is one of the many horrible side effects of loving someone.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, 12-29-05

wisdom.quote: Nothing like a lot of exercise to make you realize you'd rather be lazy and dead sooner.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, Casting Call, 10-21-13

wisdom.quote: That's the thing about marriage. It's a shell game we play with ourselves. We're the suckers and we have to lose, but we play anyway because we lie to ourselves that we can win.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, Family's A Gamble Part 5, 07-25-13

wisdom.quote: Slap a mask on a drunk and you're going to have trouble. It's like having a live reenactment of anonymous forum comments.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, Masquerade, 09-09-13

wisdom.quote: I've accepted that I'm not going to die of natural causes, [but] getting killed 'cuz you're naturally a dick seems like natural causes to me.
wisdom.author: Randy K. Milholland, Something Positive, Natural Causes, 06-07-13

wisdom.quote: Doubts are more cruel than the worst of truths.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.quote: Rest assured that there is nothing which wounds the heart of a noble man more deeply than the thought his honour is assailed.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.quote: There's no praise to beat the sort you can put in your pocket.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.quote: To find yourself jilted is a blow to your pride. Do your best to forget it and if you don't succeed, at least pretend to.
wisdom.author: Moliere

wisdom.quote: One dies only once, and then for such a long time!
wisdom.author: Moli�re, Le D�pit Amoureux (1656)

wisdom.quote: Appearances are not the full cloth of a woman, but they are the most readily seen.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: As difficult as it is to have company within one's house, the absence of company is more so. The quiet echoing of solitary footsteps within the halls is suddenly amplified without the voices of excited guests. The clinking of plates and silver has narrowed to individual forks and spoons instead of the enchanting din of dining. The natural creaks and squeaks of the home are louder and more surprising.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Attention to our duties provides far greater rewards than beauty and wit. Self-control is what differentiates us from the beasts. Without it, we are merely animals.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: However difficult it is to be the homely friend of a reputed beauty, there are certain benefits. Most days, the humiliation of being the second choice is outweighed by the overflow of disappointed gentlemen.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: In business, you must remain unattached to the outcome. It matters not who is chosen first and who is chosen second. The only thing that matters is the final verdict.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Joy is not a commodity to be hoarded and protected. It is like a muscle. It must be used daily to keep strong and vigorous. For all my hardships, I have been able to remain quite joyful, for my muscles are strong.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Our hearts can deceive us. Our hearts cannot reason. They cannot judge a man's character. All they can do is see a man and think, 'There is a fine specimen. He is handsome and attentive. He will father healthy children.' It is only our mind that we can trust. Our mind can catch him in lies. Our mind can fathom his honesty and honor.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Papa said that I should never be jealous of another's marriage. Whatever joys I imagine them having are just my imaginings. The reality is far more complicated and vast.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Spoken words evaporated into the air just as easily as burned letters, but the sound of them seemed immortal. It was as if a word spoken could not be destroyed.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: The home of a clergyman is constantly judged by its parishioners. If it is too large and richly decorated, it is the subject of jealousy. If it is too small and humble, it is the subject of scorn. If it is too clean and orderly, it is considered a museum where charity is untouched and kept in a box. If it is slovenly, it is the subject of disgust.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: There is not a person in the world who is given the advantage of travel who does not return changed.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: Whether you are healthy or ill, your thoughts can drive you. If you are feeling ill, it may be your mind that has made you so.
wisdom.author: Laura Moncur, The Secret Heart of Charlotte Lucas, 2014

wisdom.quote: A fellow who is always declaring he's no fool usually has his suspicions.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: A good listener is not only popular everywhere, but after a while he gets to know something.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: Always be nice to people on the way up; because you'll meet the same people on the way down.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: God help those who do not help themselves.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: I respect faith, but doubt is what gets you an education.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: Life's a tough proposition, and the first hundred years are the hardest.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: Those who welcome death have only tried it from the ears up.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner
