wisdom.quote: To my embarrassment I was born in bed with a lady.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.quote: First weigh the considerations, then take the risks.
wisdom.author: Helmuth von Moltke

wisdom.quote: The position of the artist is humble. He is essentially a channel.
wisdom.author: Piet Mondrian

wisdom.quote: When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: whoever saw old age that did not applaud the past and condemn the present?
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Even on the highest throne in the world, we are still sitting on our ass.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne, 'De l'experience,' 1580-88

wisdom.quote: I will follow the right side even to the fire, but excluding the fire if I can.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne, 'De l'utile et de l'honnete,' 1580-88

wisdom.quote: Oppression can only survive through silence.
wisdom.author: Carmen de Monteflores

wisdom.quote: It is a tragedy that we live in a world where physical courage is so common, and moral courage is so rare.
wisdom.author: Claude Monet

wisdom.quote: Don't tell people to act their age. It's like telling a baby to move out, and if they're older you're telling them to "die in a hole."
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: I don't understand why people think everything has to have meaning. While painting the Mona Lisa did Leonardo Da Vinci intend for it to have greater meaning than a work of art that he made?
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: I have found that everything wants to kill you. For some things, like fast food, or riding a bike, it just takes longer.
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: If at first you don't succeed try, try again. If you fail even after these attempts, perhaps your just stupid.
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself, but raptors are pretty dang scary.
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: The phrase "action speaks louder than words," is most easily proven by a swift kick to the genitals.
wisdom.author: Devin J. Monroe

wisdom.quote: A man of understanding has lost nothing, if he has himself.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Don't discuss yourself, for you are bound to lose; if you belittle yourself, you are believed; if you praise yourself, you are disbelieved.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Each man calls barbarism what is not his own practice for indeed it seems we have no other test of truth and reason that the example and pattern of the opinions and customs of the country we live in.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Even on the most exalted throne in the world we are only sitting on our own bottom.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Fashion is the science of appearances, and it inspires one with the desire to seem rather than to be.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: He who establishes his argument by noise and command, shows that his reason is weak.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: He who is not very strong in memory should not meddle with lying.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: I prefer the company of peasants because they have not been educated sufficiently to reason incorrectly.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: I see men ordinarily more eager to discover a reason for things than to find out whether the things are so.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: No man is exempt from saying silly things; the mischief is to say them deliberately.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Not being able to govern events, I govern myself.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Nothing fixes a thing so intensely in the memory as the wish to forget it.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: So it is with minds. Unless you keep them busy with some definite subject that will bridle and control them, they throw themselves in disorder hither and yon in the vague field of imagination... And there is no mad or idle fancy that they do not bring forth in the agitation.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: The art of dining well is no slight art, the pleasure not a slight pleasure.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: The most profound joy has more of gravity than of gaiety in it.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: The strongest, most generous, and proudest of all virtues is true courage.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: There is nothing useless in nature; not even uselessness itself.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: Avoid destructive thinking. Improper negative thoughts sink people. A ship can sail around the world many, many times, but just let enough water get into the ship and it will sink. Just so with the human mind. Let enough negative thoughts or improper thoughts get into the human mind and the person sinks just like a ship.
wisdom.author: Alfred A. Montapert

wisdom.quote: I give myself, sometimes, admirable advice, but I am incapable of taking it.
wisdom.author: Mary Montagu

wisdom.quote: Science has proof without any certainty. Creationists have certainty without any proof.
wisdom.author: Ashley Montague

wisdom.quote: To be amused by what you read--that is the great spring of happy quotations.
wisdom.author: C. E. Montague, "A Writer's Notes on His Trade"

wisdom.quote: Whenever you looked forward to anything pleasant you were sure to be more or less disappointed . . . perhaps that is true. But there is a good side to it too. The bad things don't always come up to your expectations either . . . they nearly always turn out ever so much better than you think.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Worrying helps you some�it seems as if you were doing something when you're worrying.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Anyone who has gumption knows what it is, and anyone who hasn't can never know what it is. So there is no need of defining it.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of the Island, 1915

wisdom.quote: Proverbs are all very fine when there's nothing to worry you, but when you're in real trouble, they're not a bit of help.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, The Story Girl

wisdom.quote: I despise the pleasure of pleasing people that I despise.
wisdom.author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu

wisdom.quote: You can be pleased with nothing when you are not pleased with yourself.
wisdom.author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu

wisdom.quote: It has all been very interesting.
wisdom.author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu, last words, 1762

wisdom.quote: Existence is random. Has no pattern save what we imagine after staring at it for too long. No meaning save what we choose to impose.
wisdom.author: Alan Moore, Watchmen, 1986

wisdom.quote: Part of being a hero is knowing when you don't need to be one anymore.
wisdom.author: Alan Moore, Watchmen, 1986

wisdom.quote: There's no such thing as quitting. Just sometimes there's a longer pause between relapses.
wisdom.author: Alan Moore, Watchmen, 1986

wisdom.quote: I simply cannot understand the passion that some people have for making themselves thoroughly uncomfortable and then boasting about it afterwards.
wisdom.author: Patricia Moyes

wisdom.quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
wisdom.author: George Moore

wisdom.quote: When any man is more stupidly vain and outrageously egotistic than his fellows, he will hide his hideousness in humanitarianism.
wisdom.author: George Moore

wisdom.quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
wisdom.author: Doris Mortman

wisdom.quote: One never knows what each day is going to bring. The important thing is to be open and ready for it.
wisdom.author: Henry Moore

wisdom.quote: Deeds, not stones, are the true monuments of the great.
wisdom.author: John L. Motley

wisdom.quote: Having a dream is what keeps you alive. Overcoming the challenges make life worth living.
wisdom.author: Mary Tyler Moore

wisdom.quote: Pain nourishes courage. You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.
wisdom.author: Mary Tyler Moore

wisdom.quote: Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.
wisdom.author: Mary Tyler Moore

wisdom.quote: I'm an experienced woman; I've been around... well, alright, I might not've been around, but I've been... nearby.
wisdom.author: Mary Tyler Moore, Mary Richards (Mary Tyler Moore Show)

wisdom.quote: Sometimes you have to get to know someone really well to realize you're really strangers.
wisdom.author: Mary Tyler Moore, Mary Richards, "The Mary Tyler Moore Show"

wisdom.quote: An author is a fool who, not content with boring those he lives with, insists on boring future generations.
wisdom.author: Charles de Montesquieu

wisdom.quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, but the ability to deal with them.
wisdom.author: Charles de Montesquieu

wisdom.quote: In the state of nature...all men are born equal, but they cannot continue in this equality. Society makes them lose it, and they recover it only by the protection of the law.
wisdom.author: Charles de Montesquieu

wisdom.quote: The love of democracy is that of equality.
wisdom.author: Charles de Montesquieu

wisdom.quote: In the state of nature, indeed, all men are born equal, but they cannot continue in this equality. Society makes them lose it, and they recover it only by the protection of the laws.
wisdom.author: Charles de Montesquieu, The Spirit of Laws, 1748

wisdom.quote: Arithmetic is being able to count up to twenty without taking off your shoes.
wisdom.author: Mickey Mouse

wisdom.quote: I enjoy being a highly overpaid actor.
wisdom.author: Roger Moore

wisdom.quote: If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of itself.
wisdom.author: D. L. Moody

wisdom.quote: Howard Hughes was able to afford the luxury of madness, like a man who not only thinks he is Napoleon but hires an army to prove it.
wisdom.author: Ted Morgan

wisdom.quote: Do not fight verbosity with words: speech is given to all, intelligence to few.
wisdom.author: Moralia

wisdom.quote: Nay, tempt me not to love again: There was a time when love was sweet; Dear Nea! had I known thee then, Our souls had not been slow to meet! But oh! this weary heart hath run So many a time the rounds of pain, Not even for thee, thou lovely one! Would I endure such pangs again.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More

wisdom.quote: Why dost thou gaze upon the sky? O that I were yon spangled sphere! Then every star should be an eye, To wander o'er thy beauties here.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More

wisdom.quote: This hath not offended the king.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More, As he drew his beard aside upon placing his head on the block, From Bacon

wisdom.quote: They wonder much to hear that gold, which in itself is so useless a thing, should be everywhere so much esteemed, that even men for whom it was made, and by whom it has its value, should yet be thought of less value than it is.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More, Utopia

wisdom.quote: A little wanton money, which burned out the bottom of his purse.
wisdom.author: Sir Thomas More, Works

wisdom.quote: The only way most people recognize their limits is by trespassing on them.
wisdom.author: Tom Morris

wisdom.quote: It's all knowing what to start with. If you start in the right place and follow all the steps, you will get to the right end.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Moon, The Speed of Dark, 2003

wisdom.quote: No matter what I do, no matter how predictable I try to make my life, it will not be any more predictable than the rest of the world. Which is chaotic.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Moon, The Speed of Dark, 2003

wisdom.quote: One thing nobody can do better than you is be you.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Moon, The Speed of Dark, 2003

wisdom.quote: People are people, messy and mutable, combining differently with one another from day to day - even hour to hour.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Moon, The Speed of Dark, 2003

wisdom.quote: A child that has a quick temper, just blaze up and cool down, ain't never likely to be sly or deceitful.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: ALL things great are wound up with all things little.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: An old house with its windows gone always makes me think of something dead with its eyes picked out.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: But the worst of imagining things is that the time comes when you have to stop and that hurts.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Cakes have such a terrible habit of turning out bad just when you especially want them to be good.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Doesn't matter what a person's name is as long as he behaves himself.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Don't believe in imagining things different from what they really are. When the Lord puts us in certain circumstances He doesn't mean for us to imagine them away.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Folks that has brought up children know that there's no hard and fast method in the world that'll suit every child. But them as never have think it's all as plain and easy as Rule of Three�just set your three terms down so fashion, and the sum'll work out correct.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I don't like green Christmases. They're not green�they're just nasty faded browns and grays.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I don't want to talk as much. It's nicer to think dear, pretty thoughts and keep them in one's heart, like treasures. I don't like to have them laughed at or wondered over.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I love pretty things; and I hate to look in the glass and see something that isn't pretty. It makes me feel so sorrowful�just as I feel when I look at any ugly thing. I pity it because it isn't beautiful.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I shall give life here my best, and I believe it will give its best to me in return.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I think it would be worse to expect nothing than to be disappointed.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I'd rather look ridiculous when everybody else does than plain and sensible all by myself.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: I'm always sorry when pleasant things end. Something still pleasanter may come after, but you can never be sure.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: If I really wanted to pray I'll tell you what I'd do. I'd go out into a great big field all alone or into the deep, deep, woods, and I'd look up into the sky�up�up�up�into that lovely blue sky that looks as if there was no end to its blueness. And then I'd just FEEL a prayer.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: If the path set before her feet was to be narrow she knew that flowers of quiet happiness would bloom along it. The joy of sincere work and worthy aspiration and congenial friendship were to be hers; nothing could rob her of her birthright of fancy or her ideal world of dreams.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Isn't it good just to be alive on a day like this? I pity the people who aren't born yet for missing it.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: It is ever so much easier to be good if your clothes are fashionable.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: It makes you feel very virtuous when you forgive people, doesn't it?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Any party which takes credit for the rain must not be surprised if its opponents blame it for the draught.
wisdom.author: Dwight W. Morrow

wisdom.quote: When you are not physically starving, you have the luxury to realize psychic and emotional starvation.
wisdom.author: Cherrie Moraga

wisdom.quote: Moments of kindness and reconciliation are worth having, even if the parting has to come sooner or later.
wisdom.author: Alice Munro

wisdom.quote: Any party which takes credit for the rain must not be surprised if its opponents blame it for the drought.
wisdom.author: Dwight D. Morrow

wisdom.quote: Leaders make things possible. Exceptional leaders make them inevitable.
wisdom.author: Lance Morrow

wisdom.quote: Anyone who works is a fool. I don't work - I merely inflict myself upon the public.
wisdom.author: Robert Morley

wisdom.quote: Let us make one point, that we meet each other with a smile, when it is difficult to smile. Smile at each other, make time for each other in your family.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa, in her Nobel lecture

wisdom.quote: The best car safety device is a rear-view mirror with a cop in it.
wisdom.author: Dudley Moore

wisdom.quote: A man always has two reasons for what he does-a good one and the real one.
wisdom.author: J. Pierpont Morgan

wisdom.quote: It's all very well to read about sorrows and imagine yourself living through them heroically, but it's not so nice when you really come to have them, is it?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: It's delightful to have ambitions. I'm so glad I have such a lot. And there never seems to be any end to them�that's the best of it. Just as soon as you attain to one ambition you see another one glittering higher up still. It does make life so interesting.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: It's so easy to be wicked without knowing it, isn't it?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Looking forward to things is half the pleasure of them. You mayn't get the things themselves; but nothing can prevent you from having the fun of looking forward to them.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: One can dream so much better in a room where there are pretty things.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: One can't stay sad very long in such an interesting world, can one?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: People laugh at me because I use big words. But if you have big ideas you have to use big words to express them, haven't you?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Reading stories is bad enough but writing them is worse.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: She makes me love her and I like people who make me love them. It saves me so much trouble in making myself love them.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: That is one consolation when you are poor�there are so many more things you can imagine about.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: That's the worst of growing up, and I'm beginning to realize it. The things you wanted so much when you were a child don't seem half so wonderful to you when you get them.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: There is no use in loving things if you have to be torn from them, is there? And it's so hard to keep from loving things, isn't it?
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: There must be a limit to the mistakes one person can make, and when I get to the end of them, then I'll be through with them. That's a very comforting thought.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: There's such a difference between saying a thing yourself and hearing other people say it. You may know a thing is so, but you can't help hoping other people don't quite think it is.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: We pay a price for everything we get or take in this world; and although ambitions are well worth having, they are not to be cheaply won, but exact their dues of work and self-denial, anxiety and discouragement.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: We resent the thought that anything can please us when someone we love is no longer here to share the pleasure with us, and we almost feel as if we were unfaithful to our sorrow when we find our interest in life returning to us.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: When I make up my mind to do a thing it stays made up.
wisdom.author: L. M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables, 1908

wisdom.quote: Even good opinions are worth very little unless we hold them in the broad, intelligent, and spacious way.
wisdom.author: John Viscount Morley

wisdom.quote: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.
wisdom.author: John Viscount Morley

wisdom.quote: It is not enough to do good; one must do it the right way.
wisdom.author: John Viscount Morley, of Blackburn

wisdom.quote: The difference between visionaries and dreamers is that visionaries make the dreams come true.
wisdom.author: Walter R. Mueller

wisdom.quote: Don't accept rides from strange men, and remember that all men are strange.
wisdom.author: Robin Morgan

wisdom.quote: Women are not inherently passive or peaceful. We're not inherently anything but human.
wisdom.author: Robin Morgan

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to walk rapidly and be unhappy.
wisdom.author: Dr. Howard Murphy

wisdom.quote: . . . .When I am, as it were, completely myself, entirely alone, and of good cheer - say traveling in a carriage, or walking after a good meal, or during the night when I cannot sleep - it is on such occasions that my ideas flow best, and most abundantly. Whence and how they come, I know not, nor can I force them...
wisdom.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

wisdom.quote: I pay no attention whatever to anybody's praise or blame. I simply follow my own feelings.
wisdom.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

wisdom.quote: Nevertheless the passions, whether violent or not, should never be so expressed as to reach the point of causing disgust; and music, even in situations of the greatest horror, should never be painful to the ear but should flatter and charm it, and thereby always remain music.
wisdom.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

wisdom.quote: If you're afraid to let someone else see your weakness, take heart: Nobody's perfect. Besides, your attempts to hide your flaws don't work as well as you think they do.
wisdom.author: Julie Morgenstern, O Magazine, April 2004

wisdom.quote: How we treasure (and admire) the people who acknowledge us!
wisdom.author: Julie Morgenstern, O Magazine, Belatedly Yours, January 2004

wisdom.quote: By learning to discover and value our ordinariness, we nurture a friendliness toward ourselves and the world that is the essence of a healthy soul.
wisdom.author: Thomas Moore

wisdom.quote: The ordinary acts we practice every day at home are of more importance to the soul than their simplicity might suggest.
wisdom.author: Thomas Moore

wisdom.quote: To the soul, there is hardly anything more healing than friendship.
wisdom.author: Thomas Moore

wisdom.quote: She is a friend of my mind... The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order.
wisdom.author: Toni Morrison

wisdom.quote: Love is or it ain't. Thin love ain't love at all.
wisdom.author: Toni Morrison, Beloved

wisdom.quote: Confidence is the sexiest thing a woman can have. It's much sexier than any body part.
wisdom.author: Aimee Mullins, Oprah Magazine, May 2004

wisdom.quote: Interestingly, from an identity standpoint, what does it mean to have a disability? Pamela Anderson has more prosthetic in her body than I do and nobody calls her disabled.
wisdom.author: Aimee Mullins, Ted Conference, How My Legs Give Me Super-Powers, February 2009

wisdom.quote: God gives us relatives; thank God we can choose our friends.
wisdom.author: Ethel Mumford

wisdom.quote: Knowledge is power, if you know it about the right person.
wisdom.author: Ethel Mumford

wisdom.quote: Death is only going to happen to you once; I don't want to miss it.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: Hatred is a very underestimated emotion.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: I think of myself as an intelligent, sensitive human being with the soul of a clown which always forces me to blow it at the most important moments.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: Violence isn't always evil. What's evil is the infatuation with violence.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: Some of the worst mistakes of my life have been haircuts.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison, No One Here Gets Out Alive

wisdom.quote: Canada is the essence of not being. Not English, not American, it is the mathematic of not being. And a subtle flavour - we're more like celery as a flavour.
wisdom.author: Mike Myers

wisdom.quote: I still believe that at any time the no-talent police will come and arrest me.
wisdom.author: Mike Myers

wisdom.quote: My theory is that all of Scottish cuisine is based on a dare.
wisdom.author: Mike Myers

wisdom.quote: Silly is you in a natural state, and serious is something you have to do until you can get silly again.
wisdom.author: Mike Myers

wisdom.quote: And I loved the whole idea behind the story, which is that you're beautiful, so don't let other people tell you that you're not just because you don't look like the people in magazines. Or because you're not that weird ideal body image that's out there right now.
wisdom.author: Mike Myers, Talking about Shrek

wisdom.quote: We go where our vision is.
wisdom.author: Joseph Murphy

wisdom.quote: Curiosity is the key to creativity.
wisdom.author: Akio Morita, Made in Japan (1986)

wisdom.quote: The reason there are so few female politicians is that it is too much trouble to put makeup on two faces.
wisdom.author: Maureen Murphy

wisdom.quote: People vote their resentment, not their appreciation. The average man does not vote for anything, but against something.
wisdom.author: William Bennet Munro

wisdom.quote: Did you ever walk into a room and forget why you walked in? I think that's how dogs spend their lives.
wisdom.author: Sue Murphy

wisdom.quote: First you're an unknown, then you write one book and you move up to obscurity.
wisdom.author: Martin Myers

wisdom.quote: Human beings are seventy percent water, and with some the rest is collagen.
wisdom.author: Martin Mull

wisdom.quote: The town where I grew up has a zip code of E-I-E-I-O.
wisdom.author: Martin Mull

wisdom.quote: The trouble with jogging is that the ice falls out of your glass.
wisdom.author: Martin Mull

wisdom.quote: Laws not enforced cease to be laws, and rights not defended may wither away.
wisdom.author: Thomas Moriarty

wisdom.quote: But I am a dreamer So you sent me away. Sometimes we dreamers Just get in the way.
wisdom.author: Shawn Mullins, Anchored In You

wisdom.quote: Humor is our way of defending ourselves from life's absurdities by thinking absurdly about them.
wisdom.author: Lewis Mumford

wisdom.quote: Modern Man is the victim of the very instruments he values most. Every gain in power, every mastery of natural forces, every scientific addition to knowledge, has proved potentially dangerous, because it has not been accompanied by equal gains in self-understanding and self-discipline.
wisdom.author: Lewis Mumford

wisdom.quote: Our national flower is the concrete cloverleaf.
wisdom.author: Lewis Mumford

wisdom.quote: Traditionalists are pessimists about the future and optimists about the past.
wisdom.author: Lewis Mumford

wisdom.quote: A kleptomaniac is a person who helps himself because he can't help himself.
wisdom.author: Henry Morgan

wisdom.quote: The best way to teach your kids about taxes is by eating 30% of their ice cream.
wisdom.author: Bill Murray

wisdom.quote: I don't have to take this abuse from you -- I've got hundreds of people waiting to abuse me.
wisdom.author: Bill Murray, "Ghostbusters"

wisdom.quote: God doesn't require us to succeed; he only requires that you try.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: I have found the paradox that if I love until it hurts, then there is no hurt, but only more love.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: I know God will not give me anything I can't handle. I just wish that He didn't trust me so much.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: If you find serenity and happiness, some people may be jealous. Be happy anyway.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: It is easy to love the people far away. It is not always easy to love those close to us. It is easier to give a cup of rice to relieve hunger than to relieve the loneliness and pain of someone unloved in our home. Bring love into your home for this is where our love for each other must start.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: It's not how much we give, but how much love we put into giving.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Joy is prayer - Joy is strength - Joy is love - Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: The good you do today, people will often forget tomorrow; Do good anyway.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness and the feeling of being unloved.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: There are many in the world dying for a piece of bread, but there are many more dying for a little love.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: We can do no great things; only small things with great love.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: What we do is less than a drop in the ocean. But if it were missing, the ocean would lack something.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Whether one is Hindu or a Muslim or a Christian, how you live your life is proof that you are or not fully His. We cannot condemn or judge or pass words that will hurt people. We don't know in what way God is appearing to that soul and what God is drawing that soul to; therefor, who are we to condemn anybody?
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa

wisdom.quote: Please choose the way of peace. ... In the short term there may be winners and losers in this war that we all dread. But that never can, nor never will justify the suffering, pain and loss of life your weapons will cause.
wisdom.author: Mother Teresa, -- Letter to U.S. President George Bush and Iraqi President Saddam Hussein, January 1991.

wisdom.quote: Discipline must come through liberty. . . . We do not consider an individual disciplined only when he has been rendered as artificially silent as a mute and as immovable as a paralytic. He is an individual annihilated, not disciplined.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: I keep pointing at the child; they keep staring at my finger.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: The child's true constructive energy, a dynamic power, has remained unnoticed for thousands of years. Just as men have trodden the earth, and later tilled its surface, without thought for the immense wealth hidden in its depths, so the men of our day make progress after progress in civilized life, without noticing the treasures that lie hidden in the psychic world of infancy.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: The task of the educator lies in seeing that the child does not confound good with immobility and evil with activity.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: The teacher must derive not only the capacity, but the desire, to observe natural phenomena. The teacher must understand and feel her position of observer: the activity must lie in the phenomenon.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: We teachers can only help the work going on, as servants wait upon a master.
wisdom.author: Maria Montessori

wisdom.quote: I know that our bodies were made to thrive only in pure air, and the scenes in which pure air is found. There is not a "fragment" in all nature, for every relative fragment of one thing is a full harmonious unit in itself.
wisdom.author: John Muir, A Thousand Mile Walk to the Gulf, 1916

wisdom.quote: Come to the woods, for here is rest. There is no repose like that of the green deep woods. Here grow the wallflower and the violet. The squirrel will come and sit upon your knee, the logcock will wake you in the morning. Sleep in forgetfulness of all ill. Of all the upness accessible to mortals, there is no upness comparable to the mountains.
wisdom.author: John Muir, Atlantic Monthly, January 1869

wisdom.quote: No synonym for God is so perfect as Beauty. Whether as seen carving the lines of the mountains with glaciers, or gathering matter into stars, or planning the movements of water, or gardening - still all is Beauty!
wisdom.author: John Muir, Atlantic Monthly, January 1869

wisdom.quote: We all flow from one fountain Soul. All are expressions of one Love. God does not appear, and flow out, only from narrow chinks and round bored wells here and there in favored races and places, but He flows in grand undivided currents, shoreless and boundless over creeds and forms and all kinds of civilizations and peoples and beasts, saturating all and fountainizing all.
wisdom.author: John Muir, Bad�'s Life and Letters of John Muir: June 9, 1872 letter to Miss Catharine Merrill, from New Sentinel Hotel, Yosemite Valley

wisdom.quote: In God's wildness lies the hope of the world - the great fresh unblighted, unredeemed wilderness. The galling harness of civilization drops off, and wounds heal ere we are aware.
wisdom.author: John Muir, John of the Mountains, 1938

wisdom.quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
wisdom.author: John Muir, John of the Mountains, 1938

wisdom.quote: Fresh beauty opens one's eyes wherever it is really seen, but the very abundance and completeness of the common beauty that besets our steps prevents its being absorbed and appreciated. It is a good thing, therefore, to make short excursions now and then to the bottom of the sea among dulse and coral, or up among the clouds on mountain-tops, or in balloons, or even to creep like worms into dark holes and caverns underground, not only to learn something of what is going on in those out-of-the-way places, but to see better what the sun sees on our return to common everyday beauty.
wisdom.author: John Muir, My First Summer in the Sierra, 1911

wisdom.quote: The wrongs done to trees, wrongs of every sort, are done in the darkness of ignorance and unbelief, for when the light comes, the heart of the people is always right.
wisdom.author: John Muir, My First Summer in the Sierra, 1911

wisdom.quote: When we try to pick out anything by itself, we find it hitched to everything else in the Universe.
wisdom.author: John Muir, My First Summer in the Sierra, 1911

wisdom.quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop away from you like the leaves of Autumn.
wisdom.author: John Muir, Our National Parks, 1901

wisdom.quote: Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean. None of Nature's landscapes are ugly so long as they are wild.
wisdom.author: John Muir, Our National Parks, 1901

wisdom.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul alike.
wisdom.author: John Muir, The Yosemite, 1912

wisdom.quote: When we contemplate the whole globe as one great dewdrop, striped and dotted with continents and islands, flying through space with other stars all singing and shining together as one, the whole universe appears as an infinite storm of beauty.
wisdom.author: John Muir, Travels in Alaska by John Muir, 1915, chapter 1

wisdom.quote: Cherish all your happy moments: they make a fine cushion for old age.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: Life is a foreign language; all men mispronounce it.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: My theology, briefly, is that the universe was dictated but not signed.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: No one appreciates the very special genius of your conversations as a dog does.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: Read, every day, something no one else is reading. Think, every day, something no one else is thinking. Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do. It is bad for the mind to be always part of unanimity.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: Hold a book in your hand and you're a pilgrim at the gates of a new city.
wisdom.author: Anne Michaels, Fugitive Pieces

wisdom.quote: Photography, fortunately, to me has not only been a profession but also a contact between people - to understand human nature and record, if possible, the best in each individual.
wisdom.author: Nickolas Muray

wisdom.quote: Love is the difficult realization that something other than oneself is real.
wisdom.author: Iris Murdoch

wisdom.quote: We can only learn to love by loving.
wisdom.author: Iris Murdoch, O Magazine, February 2004

wisdom.quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley

wisdom.quote: There is only one success... to be able to spend your life in your own way, and not to give others absurd maddening claims upon it.
wisdom.author: Christopher Morley, Where the Blue Begins,1922

wisdom.quote: My loathings are simple: stupidity, oppression, crime, cruelty, soft music.
wisdom.author: Vladimir Nabokov

wisdom.quote: Our existence is but a brief crack of light between two eternities of darkness.
wisdom.author: Vladimir Nabokov

wisdom.quote: Nothing fails like success.
wisdom.author: Gerald Nachman

wisdom.quote: The only place where democracy comes before work is in the dictionary.
wisdom.author: Ralph Nader, 2000 NAACP Address

wisdom.quote: The administration is not sympathetic to corporations, it is indentured to corporations.
wisdom.author: Ralph Nader, News conference, October 3, 1972, speaking about the Nixon Administration

wisdom.quote: Creative work is play. It is free speculation using materials of one's chosen form.
wisdom.author: Stephen Nachmanovitch

wisdom.quote: The most potent muse of all is our own inner child.
wisdom.author: Stephen Nachmanovitch

wisdom.quote: The noun of self becomes a verb. This flashpoint of creation in the present moment is where work and play merge.
wisdom.author: Stephen Nachmanovitch

wisdom.quote: When a rose dies, a thorn is left behind.
wisdom.author: Publius Ovidius Naso, Selections from Ars Amatoria Remedia Amoris

wisdom.quote: We're a sentimental people. We like a few kind words better than millions of dollars given in a humiliating way.
wisdom.author: Gamal Abdel Nasser, on refusing Western economic assistance, 'Realites,' January 20, 1969

wisdom.quote: The moment of victory is much too short to live for that and nothing else.
wisdom.author: Martina Navratilova

wisdom.quote: In war, there are no unwounded soldiers.
wisdom.author: Jose Narosky

wisdom.quote: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go... And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
wisdom.author: Gloria Naylor

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the clearest mirrors come from those who are outside looking in.
wisdom.author: Jennifer Neal, nakedjen, 06-26-09

wisdom.quote: Who knew that dog saliva can mend a broken heart?
wisdom.author: Jennifer Neal, nakedjen, 07-22-08

wisdom.quote: Disappearing can be quite the coping mechanism for those of us who fear abandonment the very most of all. If we disappear, you have to find us. You're the one who worries. We know where we are, but you can't leave me. I'm in charge and doing the leaving. Not the other way around.
wisdom.author: Jennifer Neal, nakedjen, Disappearing Act, 03-06-12

wisdom.quote: A door is what a dog is perpetually on the wrong side of.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: A family is a unit composed not only of children but of men, women, an occasional animal, and the common cold.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: I think that I shall never see  a billboard lovely as a tree.  Perhaps, unless the billboards fall,  I'll never see a tree at all.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: Middle age is when you've met so many people that every new person you meet reminds you of someone else.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: Parents were invented to make children happy by giving them something to ignore.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: People who have what they want are fond of telling people who haven't what they want that they really don't want it.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: People who work sitting down get paid more than people who work standing up.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: Progress might have been all right once, but it has gone on too long.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash

wisdom.quote: CandyIs dandyBut liquorIs quicker.
wisdom.author: Ogden Nash, "Reflections on Ice-Breaking"

wisdom.quote: Fall not in love, therefore; it will stick to your face.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.quote: Let not the sands of time get in your lunch.
wisdom.author: National Lampoon, "Deteriorata"

wisdom.quote: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man; it is what he wants and must have to be good for anything. Hardship and opposition are the native soil of manhood and self-reliance.
wisdom.author: John Neal

wisdom.quote: Bad officials are elected by good citizens who do not vote.
wisdom.author: George Jean Nathan

wisdom.quote: I drink to make other people seem more interesting.
wisdom.author: George Jean Nathan

wisdom.quote: Patriotism is often an arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles.
wisdom.author: George Jean Nathan

wisdom.quote: Good food ends with good talk.
wisdom.author: Geoffrey Neighor, Northern Exposure, Duets, 1993

wisdom.quote: Who would've thought such a slight tilt in our earthly axis could make such a big difference in our lives? The big wheel keeps on turning and here we are again, looking in the sweet face of darkness.
wisdom.author: Geoffrey Neighor, Northern Exposure, Midnight Sun, 1992

wisdom.quote: A master can tell you what he thinks of you. A teacher, though awakens your own expectations.
wisdom.author: Patricia Neal

wisdom.quote: A strong positive mental attitude will create more miracles than any wonder drug.
wisdom.author: Patricia Neal

wisdom.quote: Desperate affairs require desperate remedies.
wisdom.author: Horatio Nelson

wisdom.quote: Of those who say nothing, few are silent.
wisdom.author: Thomas Neill

wisdom.quote: It is wonderful how quickly you get used to things, even the most astonishing.
wisdom.author: Edith Nesbitt

wisdom.quote: Do not fall prey to the false belief that mastery and domination are synonymous with manliness.
wisdom.author: Kent Nerburn

wisdom.quote: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing at the right place but to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Nevill

wisdom.quote: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing in the right place but to leave the unsaid the wrong thing thing at the tempting moment.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Nevill

wisdom.quote: Es tan corto el amor, y tan largo el olvido.  (Love is so short, and forgetting is so long.)
wisdom.author: Pablo Neruda

wisdom.quote: Fortune does not change men, it unmasks them.
wisdom.author: Suzanne Necker

wisdom.quote: Crime does not pay ... as well as politics.
wisdom.author: Alfred E. Newman

wisdom.quote: Nobody believes the official spokesman... but everybody trusts an unidentified source.
wisdom.author: Ron Nesen

wisdom.quote: I have made my world and it is a much better world than I ever saw outside.
wisdom.author: Louise Nevelson

wisdom.quote: I never feel age...If you have creative work, you don't have age or time.
wisdom.author: Louise Nevelson, 1980

wisdom.quote: Crooks are early adopters.
wisdom.author: Craig Newmark, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: I look at what the phone company does and do the opposite.
wisdom.author: Craig Newmark, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: People everywhere have the same needs and values. They need a place to live and a job. Beyond that, they may need to sell stuff or get a mate.
wisdom.author: Craig Newmark, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Sometimes a slow gradual approach does more good than a large gesture.
wisdom.author: Craig Newmark, Keynote Speech, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: I keep the subject of my inquiry constantly before me, and wait till the first dawning opens gradually, by little and little, into a full and clear light.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton

wisdom.quote: If I have ever made any valuable discoveries, it has been owing more to patient attention, than to any other talent.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton

wisdom.quote: Tact is the knack of making a point without making an enemy.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton

wisdom.quote: I do not know what I may appear to the world; but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton, From Brewster, Memoirs of Newton (1855)

wisdom.quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton, Letter to Robert Hooke, February 5, 1675

wisdom.quote: Fear not that thy life shall come to an end, but rather fear that it shall never have a beginning.
wisdom.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

wisdom.quote: Let us take things as we find them: let us not attempt to distort them into what they are not. We cannot make facts. All our wishing cannot change them. We must use them.
wisdom.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

wisdom.quote: People forget how fast you did a job - but they remember how well you did it.
wisdom.author: Howard Newton

wisdom.quote: If you must love your neighbor as yourself, it is at least as fair to love yourself as your neighbor.
wisdom.author: Sebastien-Roch Nicolas

wisdom.quote: Facts are facts and will not disappear on account of your likes.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you is determinism; the way you play it is free will.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: Peace is not a relationship of nations. It is a condition of mind brought about by a serenity of soul. Peace is not merely the absence of war. It is also a state of mind. Lasting peace can come only to peaceful people.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: The only alternative to coexistence is codestruction.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: The policy of being too cautious is the greatest risk of all.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.quote: Achievement is largely the product of steadily raising one's levels of aspiration and expectation.
wisdom.author: Jack Nicklaus, 'My Story'

wisdom.quote: I tell ya, if you want to disperse a crowd, start spittin' on 'em.
wisdom.author: Kent Nichols and Douglas Sarine, Ask A Ninja, 06-08-07

wisdom.quote: If you have to have your weapon, at least run it through the grandma test. Take the weapon and hit your grandma with it. If she dies or writes you out of the will, don't bring it!
wisdom.author: Kent Nichols and Douglas Sarine, Ask A Ninja, 08-29-06

wisdom.quote: Here's a tip to avoid death by celebrity: First off, get a life. They can't touch you if you're out doing something interesting.
wisdom.author: Kent Nichols and Douglas Sarine, Ask a Ninja, Question 55, 10-03-07

wisdom.quote: Sometimes creativity is a compulsion, not an ambition.
wisdom.author: Ed Norton, Entertainment Weekly

wisdom.quote: All I can say about life is, Oh God, enjoy it!
wisdom.author: Bob Newhart

wisdom.quote: Laughter gives us distance. It allows us to step back from an event, deal with it and then move on.
wisdom.author: Bob Newhart

wisdom.quote: Feeling grateful to or appreciative of someone or something in your life actually attracts more of the things that you appreciate and value into your life.
wisdom.author: Christiane Northrup, M.D.

wisdom.quote: Do not run from the truth. There be nought so hard to live with as a lie.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: I have made plenty of enemies in my lifetime, but none has ever done me as much injury as I do myself.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: I have not yet met with a sorrow that could not be borne, nor with one who's passing did not leave me stronger.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: I shall not pretend that I do not prefer to have people adore me rather than revile me, but I have always found that it was far easier for me to suffer the disapprobation of others than to amend my behaviour in order to find favour with them.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: It does not always follow that good men are good fathers.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: Passion is seldom the end of any story, for it cannot long endure if it is not soon supplemented with true affection and mutual respect.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: Sometimes it is the quiet observer who sees the most.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: The best defence against misguided arrogance is a keen sense of humour.
wisdom.author: Kathryn L. Nelson, Pemberley Manor, 2006

wisdom.quote: The best Web sites are better than reality.
wisdom.author: Jakob Nielsen, Usability consultant

wisdom.quote: First they came for the Communists but I was not a Communist so I did not speak out. Then they came for the Socialists and the Trade Unionists but I was not one of them, so I did not speak out. Then they came for the Jews but I was not Jewish so I did not speak out. And when they came for me, there was no one left to speak out for me.
wisdom.author: Martin Niemoeller

wisdom.quote: Doing nothing is very hard to do ... you never know when you're finished.
wisdom.author: Leslie Nielsen

wisdom.quote: 'Who are you and how did you get in here?' 'I'm a locksmith. And, I'm a locksmith.'
wisdom.author: Leslie Nielsen,  as Lieutenant Frank Drebin, "Police Squad"

wisdom.quote: Man's capacity for justice makes democracy possible, but man's inclination to injustice makes democracy necessary.
wisdom.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

wisdom.quote: The tendency to claim God as an ally for our partisan values and ends is... the source of all religious fanaticism.
wisdom.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

wisdom.quote: The whole art of politics consists in directing rationally the irrationalities of men.
wisdom.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

wisdom.quote: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed, and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
wisdom.author: Reinhold Niebuhr, in a sermon in 1943

wisdom.quote: There is... nothing greater than touching the shore after crossing some great body of water knowing that I've done it with my own two arms and legs.
wisdom.author: Diana Nyad

wisdom.quote: In the absences of a decent time machine, fiction remains the most sturdy vehicle for visiting other eras.
wisdom.author: Tom Nolan, in The Wall Street Journal

wisdom.quote: Cynicism is not realistic and tough. It's unrealistic and kind of cowardly because it means you don't have to try.
wisdom.author: Peggy Noonan, in Good Housekeeping

wisdom.quote: Civilization is built on a number of ultimate principles...respect for human life, the punishment of crimes against property and persons, the equality of all good citizens before the law...or, in a word justice.
wisdom.author: Max Nordau

wisdom.quote: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
wisdom.author: Joseph F. Newton

wisdom.quote: You ask me why I do not write something....I think one's feelings waste themselves in words, they ought all to be distilled into actions and into actions which bring results.
wisdom.author: Florence Nightingale, in Cecil Woodham-Smith, Florence Nightingale, 1951

wisdom.quote: There is but one temple in the universe and that is the body of man.
wisdom.author: Novalis

wisdom.quote: Humor is everywhere, in that there's irony in just about anything a human does.
wisdom.author: Bill Nye, Interview with Wired.com, April 2005

wisdom.quote: The more you find out about the world, the more opportunities there are to laugh at it.
wisdom.author: Bill Nye, Interview with Wired.com, April 2005

wisdom.quote: Reading this book is like waiting for the first shoe to drop.
wisdom.author: Ralph Novak

wisdom.quote: It's choice - not chance - that determines your destiny.
wisdom.author: Jean Nidetch

wisdom.quote: Wagner's music is better than it sounds.
wisdom.author: Edgar Wilson Nye, quoted in Mark Twain's Autobiography, 1924

wisdom.quote: But the life that no longer trust another human being and no longer forms ties to the political community is not a human life any longer.
wisdom.author: Martha Nussbaum, O Magazine, November 2003

wisdom.quote: Beauty and brains, pleasure and usability � they should go hand in hand.
wisdom.author: Donald Norman, 2003

wisdom.quote: I think the primary function of radio is that people want company.
wisdom.author: Elise Nordling, The Future of Radio, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Make your own recovery the first priority in your life.
wisdom.author: Robin Norwood

wisdom.quote: A joke was not a single-use item but something you brought out again and again until it fell apart in your hand like a cheap umbrella.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: Envy was just the tax you paid on success.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: Friends were like clothes: fine while they lasted but eventually they wore thin or you grew out of them.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: He wanted to live life in such a way that if a photograph were taken at random it would be a cool photograph. Things should look right. Fun; there should be a lot of fun and no more sadness than absolutely necessary.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: I think you actually get a kick out of being disappointed and under-achieving, because it's easier, isn't it? Failure and unhappiness is easier because you can make a joke out of it.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: If I could give you just one gift ever for the rest of your life it would be this. Confidence. It would be the gift of confidence. Either that or a scented candle.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: If you have to keep something secret it's because you shouldn't be doing it in the first place!
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: If you're at school and you're not that bright or good-looking or popular or whatever, and one day you say something and someone laughs, well, you sort of grab onto it, don't you? you think, well I run funny and I've got this stupid big face and big thighs and no-one fancies me, but at least I can make people laugh. And It's such a nice feeling, making someone laugh, that maybe you get a bit reliant on it. Like, if you're not funny then you're not... anything.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: Maybe that's just what happens; you start out wanting to change the world through language, and end up thinking it's enough to tell a few jokes.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: She was discovering once again that reading and writing were not the same-you couldn't just soak it up then squeeze it out again.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: Sometimes, when it's going badly, she wonders if what she believes to be a love of the written word is really just a fetish for stationary. The true writer, the born writer, will scribble words on scraps of litter, the back of a bus ticket, on the wall of a cell.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: The trick of it, she told herself, is to be courageous and bold and make a difference. Not change the world exactly, just the bit around you. Go out there with your double-first, your passion and your new Smith Corona electric typewriter and work hard at ... something. Change lives through art maybe. Write beautifully. Cherish your friends, stay true to your principles, live passionately and fully well. Experience new things. Love and be loved if at all possible. Eat sensibly. Stuff like that.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: There's something unnatural about a woman finding babies or, more specifically, conversation about babies, boring. They'll think she's bitter, jealous, lonely. But she's also bored of everybody telling her how lucky she is, what with all that sleep and all that freedom and spare time, the ability to go on dates or head off to Paris at a moments notice. It sounds like they're consoling her, and she resents this and feels patronized by it.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: These days grief seems like walking on a frozen river; most of the time he feels safe enough, but there is always that danger he will plunge through.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: To have had fame, even very minor fame, and to have lost it, got older and maybe put on a little weight is a kind of living death.
wisdom.author: David Nicholls, One Day, 2010

wisdom.quote: God gave us the gift of life. It is the most precious gift ever. To be unarmed is to be helpless to protect that gift; that is outright irresponsible.
wisdom.author: Ted Nugent

wisdom.quote: Before you begin a thing, remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. If you could see them clearly, naturally you could do a great deal to get rid of them but you can't. You can only see one thing clearly and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Norris

wisdom.quote: Intimacy is what makes a marriage, not a ceremony, not a piece of paper from the state.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Norris

wisdom.quote: Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Norris, Hands Full of Living, 1931

wisdom.quote: Disconnecting from change does not recapture the past. It loses the future.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Norris, O Magazine, January 2004

wisdom.quote: If we are lucky, we can give in and rest without feeling guilty. We can stop doing and concentrate on being.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Norris, O Magazine, July 2003

wisdom.quote: We are always in our own company.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 166

wisdom.quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 191

wisdom.quote: For believe me: the secret for harvesting from existence the greatest fruitfulness and greatest enjoyment is - to live dangerously.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 283

wisdom.quote: I would not know what the spirit of a philosopher might wish more to be than a good dancer.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 381

wisdom.quote: A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 41

wisdom.quote: Out of life's school of war: What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Twilight of the Idols (1899)

wisdom.quote: For men are not equal: thus speaks justice.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

wisdom.quote: I am a law only for my kind, I am no law for all.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

wisdom.quote: It is nobler to declare oneself wrong than to insist on being right - especially when one is right.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

wisdom.quote: Not by wrath does one kill, but by laughter.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

wisdom.quote: What does not kill me, makes me stronger.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Twilight of the Idols, 1888

wisdom.quote: Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man's?
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Twilight of the Idols, Maxims and Arrows

wisdom.quote: Plato is boring.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Twilight of the Idols, What I owe to the Ancients

wisdom.quote: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: At times one remains faithful to a cause only because its opponents do not cease to be insipid.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Battle not with monsters, lest ye become a monster, and if you gaze into the abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Be careful when you fight the monsters, lest you become one.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Great men's errors are to be venerated as more fruitful than little men's truths.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: In heaven all the interesting people are missing.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: In truth, there was only one Christian, and he died on the cross.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Man is the cruelest animal.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Many people wait throughout their whole lives for the chance to be good in their own fashion.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: No price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: One must have a good memory to be able to keep the promises one makes.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Talking much about oneself can also be a means to conceal oneself.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: The irrationality of a thing is no argument against its existence, rather a condition of it.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: The overman...Who has organized the chaos of his passions, given style to his character, and become creative. Aware of life's terrors, he affirms life without resentment.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: The visionary lies to himself, the liar only to others.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: To forget one's purpose is the commonest form of stupidity.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Sure there are dishonest men in local government. But there are dishonest men in national government too.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon

wisdom.quote: This land of ours cannot be a good place for any of us to live in unless we make it a good place for all of us to live in.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing as a nonpolitical speech by a politician.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon, Address to Radio-Television Executives Society, New York City, September 14, 1955

wisdom.quote: I made my mistakes, but in all my years of public life, I have never profited from public service. I've earned every cent. And in all of my years in public life I have never obstructed justice. And I think, too, that I can say that in my years of public life that I welcome this kind of examination because people have got to know whether or not their President is a crook. Well, I'm not a crook. I've earned everything I've got.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon, In a press conference, November 11, 1973

wisdom.quote: Always remember others may hate you but those who hate you don't win unless you hate them. And then you destroy yourself.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon, in his White House farewell

wisdom.quote: He has been called a mediocre man; but this is unwarranted flattery. He was a politician of monumental littleness.
wisdom.author: Richard M. Nixon, Writing of John Tyler, Thomas Hart Benton, chapter 11, 1897

wisdom.quote: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin

wisdom.quote: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me na�ve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
wisdom.author: Ana�s Nin

wisdom.quote: There are only two kinds of freedom in the world; the freedom of the rich and powerful, and the freedom of the artist and the monk who renounces possessions.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin

wisdom.quote: We are like sculptors, constantly carving out of others the image we long for, need, love or desire, often against reality, against their benefit, and always, in the end, a disappointment, because it does not fit them.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin

wisdom.quote: We don't see things as they are, we see things as we are.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin

wisdom.quote: When you make a world tolerable for yourself, you make a world tolerable for others.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin

wisdom.quote: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin, "Winter of Artifice"

wisdom.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin, The Diary of Anais Nin, volume 3, 1939-1944

wisdom.quote: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic.
wisdom.author: Anais Nin, The Diary of Anais Nin, volume 4, 1944-1947

wisdom.quote: To predict the behavior of ordinary people in advance, you only have to assume that they will always try to escape a disagreeable situation with the smallest possible expenditure of intelligence.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: What else is love but understanding and rejoicing in the fact that another person lives, acts, and experiences otherwise than we do�?
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: When one has much to put into them, a day has a hundred pockets.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: When you stare into the abyss the abyss stares back at you.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: You need chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, "On Reading and Writing"

wisdom.quote: But thus do I counsel you, my friends: distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful!
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Also Sprach Zarathustra, Chapter 29

wisdom.quote: Digressions, objections, delight in mockery, carefree mistrust are signs of health; everything unconditional belongs in pathology.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Beyond Good and Evil

wisdom.quote: Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Beyond Good and Evil

wisdom.quote: He who fights with monsters might take care lest he thereby become a monster. And if you gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Beyond Good and Evil, Aphorism 146

wisdom.quote: What is done out of love always takes place beyond good and evil.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Beyond Good and Evil, Aphorism 153

wisdom.quote: Only sick music makes money today.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Der Fall Wagner, Section 5

wisdom.quote: In Christianity neither morality nor religion come into contact with reality at any point.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Antichrist, section 16

wisdom.quote: What is good? All that heightens the feeling of power in man, the will to power, power itself. What is bad? All that is born of weakness. What is happiness? The feeling that power is growing, that resistance is overcome.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Antichrist, section 2

wisdom.quote: Christianity is called the religion of pity.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Antichrist, Section 7

wisdom.quote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Dawn, Sec. 297

wisdom.quote: God is dead.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 108

wisdom.quote: Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you�re kind, amazing things will happen.
wisdom.author: Conan O'Brien, Final Tonight Show Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: Please do not be cynical. I hate cynicism. For the record, it�s my least favorite quality. It doesn�t lead anywhere.
wisdom.author: Conan O'Brien, Final Tonight Show Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.
wisdom.author: Sean O'Casey

wisdom.quote: Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.
wisdom.author: Sean O'Casey

wisdom.quote: No man is so old as to believe he cannot live one more year.
wisdom.author: Sean O'Casey

wisdom.quote: Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher.
wisdom.author: Flannery O'Connor

wisdom.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
wisdom.author: Flannery O'Connor

wisdom.quote: There is only one admirable form of the imagination: the imagination that is so intense that it creates a new reality, that it makes things happen.
wisdom.author: Sean O'Faolain

wisdom.quote: Maybe the greatest challenge now is to find a way to keep independence while also committing ourselves to the ties that bind people, families, and ultimately societies together.
wisdom.author: Jane O'Reilly

wisdom.quote: Love cannot survive if you just give it scraps of yourself, scraps of your time, scraps of your thoughts.
wisdom.author: Mary O'Hara

wisdom.quote: Those that think it permissible to tell white lies soon grow color blind.
wisdom.author: Austin O'Malley

wisdom.quote: I think the promise of fame and what it holds to you as a child and dreaming of it is not what it is. What it is, I'm not complaining about, but it's just different than the reality you dreamed.
wisdom.author: Rosie O'Donnell, Today Show interview, 04-08-08

wisdom.quote: It's going to come true like you knew it, but it's not going to feel like you think.
wisdom.author: Rosie O'Donnell, Today Show interview, 04-08-08

wisdom.quote: Practice, the master of all things.
wisdom.author: Augustus Octavius

wisdom.quote: If you explore beneath shyness or party chit-chat, you can sometimes turn a dull exchange into an intriguing one. I've found this to be particularly true in the case of professors or intellectuals, who are full of fascinating information, but need encouragement before they'll divulge it.
wisdom.author: Joyce Carol Oates

wisdom.quote: Never increase, beyond what is necessary, the number of entities required to explain anything.
wisdom.author: William Ockham

wisdom.quote: Those who flee temptation generally leave a forwarding address.
wisdom.author: Lane Olinghouse

wisdom.quote: There is no reason for any individual to have a computer in his home.
wisdom.author: Ken Olsen, President, Digital Equipment, 1977

wisdom.quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet.
wisdom.author: James Oppenheim

wisdom.quote: The older I get, the more I feel  almost beautiful...
wisdom.author: Sharon Olds, Oprah Magazine, May 2004

wisdom.quote: Any man whose errors take ten years to correct is quite a man.
wisdom.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer, speaking of Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: I don't think there is a proper way to celebrate something which makes you happy.
wisdom.author: Matthew Oliphant, Usability Works, 04-01-2006

wisdom.quote: There is no silver bullet and frankly you probably don�t need one. It is far more important to be able to find the right kind of gun, be able to load the gun � and perhaps most importantly, be able to figure out where the werewolf is.
wisdom.author: Matthew Oliphant, Useability Works, 03-22-2006

wisdom.quote: And isn't that, at it's core, what the princess fantasy is about for all of us? "Princess" is how we tell little girls that they are special, precious. "Princess" is the wish that we could protect them from pain, that they would never know sorrow, that they will live happily ever after ensconces in lace and innocence.
wisdom.author: Peggy Orenstein, Cinderella Ate My Daughter: Dispatches from the Front Lines of the New Girlie-Girl Culture, 2011

wisdom.quote: It's not that pink is intrinsically bad, but it is such a tiny slice of the rainbow, and, though it may celebrate girlhood in one way, it also repeatedly and firmly fuses girl's identity to appearance.
wisdom.author: Peggy Orenstein, Cinderella Ate My Daughter: Dispatches from the Front Lines of the New Girlie-Girl Culture, 2011

wisdom.quote: I never have found the perfect quote. At best I have been able to find a string of quotations which merely circle the ineffable idea I seek to express.
wisdom.author: Caldwell O'Keefe

wisdom.quote: It's better to do nothing with your money than something you don't understand.
wisdom.author: Suze Orman, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: A hat should be taken off when you greet a lady and left off for the rest of your life. Nothing looks more stupid than a hat.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: A little government and a little luck are necessary in life, but only a fool trusts either of them.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Drugs have taught an entire generation of Americans the metric system.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Fish is the only food that is considered spoiled once it smells like what it is.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Humans are the only animals that have children on purpose with the exception of guppies, who like to eat theirs.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Never fight an inanimate object.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: Skiing consists of wearing $3,000 worth of clothes and equipment and driving 200 miles in the snow in order to stand around at a bar and drink.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: The mystery of government is not how Washington works but how to make it stop.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: The U.S. Constitution is less than a quarter the length of the owner's manual for a 1998 Toyota Camry, and yet it has managed to keep 300 million of the world's most unruly, passionate and energetic people safe, prosperous and free.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: The weirder you are going to behave, the more normal you should look. It works in reverse, too. When I see a kid with three or four rings in his nose, I know there is absolutely nothing extraordinary about that person.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke
