wisdom.quote: Very little is known of the Canadian country since it is rarely visited by anyone but the Queen and illiterate sport fishermen.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: When buying and selling are controlled by legislation, the first things to be bought and sold are legislators.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: With Epcot Center the Disney corporation has accomplished something I didn't think possible in today's world. They have created a land of make-believe that's worse than regular life.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke

wisdom.quote: There's a whiff of the lynch mob or the lemming migration about any overlarge concentration of like-thinking individuals, no matter how virtuous their cause.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke,  Parliament of Whores (1991)

wisdom.quote: The purpose of a funeral service is to comfort the living. It is important at a funeral to display excessive grief. This will show others how kind-hearted and loving you are and their improved opinion of you will be very comforting.
wisdom.author: P. J. O'Rourke, Modern Manners, 1983

wisdom.quote: I'd the upbringing a nun would envy and that's the truth. Until I was fifteen I was more familiar with Africa than my own body.
wisdom.author: Joe Orton, Entertaining Mr Sloane (1964)

wisdom.quote: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.
wisdom.author: Arthur O'Shaughnessy, "Ode" (quoted in the film Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory)

wisdom.quote: We trained hard, but it seemed that every time we were beginning to form up into teams we would be reorganized. Presumably the plans for our employment were being changed. I was to learn later in life that, perhaps because we are so good at organizing, we tend as a nation to meet any new situation by reorganizing; and a wonderful method it can be for creating the illusion of progress while producing confusion, inefficiency, and demoralization.
wisdom.author: Charlton Ogburn, "Merrill's Marauders", Harpers Magazine, January 1957

wisdom.quote: When the judgement's weak, The prejudice is strong.
wisdom.author: Kane O'Hara

wisdom.quote: Taxation without representation is tyranny.
wisdom.author: James Otis

wisdom.quote: The man who has nothing to boast of but his illustrious ancestry is like the potato - the best part under ground.
wisdom.author: Thomas Overbury

wisdom.quote: For death begins with life's first breath, and life begins at touch of death.
wisdom.author: John Oxenham

wisdom.quote: I'm not afraid of facts, I welcome facts but a congeries of facts is not equivalent to an idea. This is the essential fallacy of the so-called "scientific" mind. People who mistake facts for ideas are incomplete thinkers; they are gossips.
wisdom.author: Cynthia Ozick

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so awesomely unfamiliar as the familiar that discloses itself at the end of a journey.
wisdom.author: Cynthia Ozick

wisdom.quote: To imagine the unimaginable is the highest use of the imagination.
wisdom.author: Cynthia Ozick

wisdom.quote: To want to be what one can be is purpose in life.
wisdom.author: Cynthia Ozick, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: A good advertisement is one which sells the product without drawing attention to itself.
wisdom.author: David M. Ogilvy

wisdom.quote: In the modern world of business, it is useless to be a creative original thinker unless you can also sell what you create. Management cannot be expected to recognize a good idea unless it is presented to them by a good salesman.
wisdom.author: David M. Ogilvy

wisdom.quote: Never write an advertisement which you wouldn't want your family to read. You wouldn't tell lies to your own wife. Don't tell them to mine.
wisdom.author: David M. Ogilvy

wisdom.quote: Political advertising ought to be stopped. It's the only really dishonest kind of advertising that's left.
wisdom.author: David M. Ogilvy

wisdom.quote: The best ideas come as jokes. Make your thinking as funny as possible.
wisdom.author: David M. Ogilvy

wisdom.quote: The important thing is to know when to laugh, or since laughing is somewhat undignified to smile. But the smile must be of the right kind must have understanding in it, and friendliness, and a good deal of patience.
wisdom.author: Roderic Owen

wisdom.quote: The old lie; Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori. (Sweet and fitting it is to die for the fatherland)
wisdom.author: Wilfred Owen, Poem:  Dulce et Decorum est.

wisdom.quote: I am just going outside and may be some time.
wisdom.author: Captain Lawrence Oates, last words

wisdom.quote: I said to myself, I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me - shapes and ideas so near to me - so natural to my way of being and thinking that it hasn't occurred to me to put them down. I decided to start anew, to strip away what I had been taught.
wisdom.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

wisdom.quote: Nobody sees a flower - really - it is so small it takes time - we haven't time - and to see takes time, like to have a friend takes time.
wisdom.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

wisdom.quote: I take my children everywhere, but they always find their way back home.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Most people would like to be delivered from temptation but would like it to keep in touch.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Never raise your hand to your children; it leaves your midsection unprotected.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Quit worrying about your health. It'll go away.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Sometimes I get the feeling the whole world is against me, but deep down I know that's not true. Some smaller countries are neutral.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: There's so much pollution in the air now that if it weren't for our lungs there'd be no place to put it all.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: These detective series on TV always end at precisely the right moment-after the criminal is arrested and before the court turns him loose.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: To err is human--and to blame it on a computer is even more so.
wisdom.author: Robert Orben

wisdom.quote: Abraham Lincoln and Millard Fillmore had the same title. They were both presidents of the United States, but their tenure in office and their legacy could not be more different.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: Acts of sacrifice and decency without regard to what's in it for you create ripple effects. Ones that lift up families and communities, that spread opportunity and boost our economy.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: Find somebody to be successful for. Raise their hopes. Think of their needs.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: I know starting careers in troubled times is a challenge, but it is also a privilege. Because it's moments like these that force us to try harder, dig deeper and to discover gifts we never knew we had. To find the greatness that lies within each of us. So don't ever shy away from that endeavor. Don't stop adding to your body of work. I can promise that you will be the better for that continued effort as will be this nation that we all love.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: I've come to embrace the notion that I haven't done enough in my life. I've come to confirm that one's title, even a title like president of the United States, says very little about how well one's life has been led. No matter how much you've done or how successful you've been, there's always more to do, always more to learn, and always more to achieve.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: In recent years, we've become enamored with our own past success. Lulled into complacency by the glitter of our own achievements. We've become accustomed to the title of Military Superpower, forgetting the qualities that got us there. We've become accustomed to our economic dominance in the world, forgetting that it wasn't reckless deals and get rich quick schemes that got us where we are, but hard work and smart ideas, quality products and wise investments.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: In this new, hyper competitive age, none of us, none of us can afford to be complacent.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: That is the American story. People, just like you, following their passions, determined to meet the times on their own terms. They weren't doing it for the money. Their titles weren't fancy. But they changed the course of history and so can you.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: That's what building a body of work is all about. It's about the daily labor, the many individual acts, the choices large and small that add up over time, over a lifetime to a lasting legacy. It's about not being satisfied with the latest achievement, the latest gold star, because the one thing I know about a body of work is that it's never finished. It's cumulative. It deepens and expands with each day you give your best. You may have setbacks and you may have failures, but you're not done. You haven't even started.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: The elevation of appearance over substance, of celebrity over character, of short term gains over lasting achievement displays a poverty of ambition. It distracts you from what's truly important.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: The leaders we revere and the businesses that last are generally not the result of a narrow pursuit of popularity or personal advancement, but of devotion to some bigger purpose. That's the hallmark of real success. The other trapping of success might be the by product of this larger mission, but it can't be the central thing.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: We too often let the material things serve as indicators that we're doing well, even though something inside us tells us that were not doing our best. That we are avoiding that which is hard, but also necessary. That we are shrinking from rather than vising to the challenges of the age.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: You can't rest on your laurels. Your own body of work is yet to come.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Arizona State Commencement Speech, 2009

wisdom.quote: I will never forget who this victory truly belongs to. It belongs to you. It belongs to you. I was never the likeliest candidate for this office. We didn't start with much money or many endorsements. Our campaign was not hatched in the halls of Washington. It began in the backyards of Des Moines and the living rooms of Concord and the front porches of Charleston. It was built by working men and women who dug into what little savings they had to give $5 and $10 and $20 to the cause.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Election Night Speech in Chicago, 11-04-08

wisdom.quote: If there is anyone out there who still doubts that America is a place where all things are possible, who still wonders if the dream of our founders is alive in our time, who still questions the power of our democracy, tonight is your answer.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Election Night Speech in Chicago, 11-04-08

wisdom.quote: There's new energy to harness, new jobs to be created, new schools to build, and threats to meet, alliances to repair. The road ahead will be long. Our climb will be steep. We may not get there in one year or even in one term. But, America, I have never been more hopeful than I am tonight that we will get there. I promise you, we as a people will get there. There will be setbacks and false starts. There are many who won't agree with every decision or policy I make as president. And we know the government can't solve every problem. But I will always be honest with you about the challenges we face. I will listen to you, especially when we disagree. And, above all, I will ask you to join in the work of remaking this nation, the only way it's been done in America for 221 years � block by block, brick by brick, calloused hand by calloused hand.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Election Night Speech in Chicago, 11-04-08

wisdom.quote: It was a creed written into the founding documents that declared the destiny of a nation. Yes we can. It was whispered by slaves and abolitionists as they blazed a trail towards freedom through the darkest of nights. Yes we can. It was sung by immigrants as they struck out from distant shores and pioneers who pushed westward against an unforgiving wilderness. Yes we can.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, New Hampshire Democratic Primary Speech, 01-08-08

wisdom.quote: We have been told we cannot do this by a chorus of cynics. They will only grow louder and more dissonant in the weeks to come. We've been asked to pause for a reality check; we've been warned against offering the people of this nation false hope. But in the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, New Hampshire Democratic Primary Speech, 01-08-08

wisdom.quote: America, we are better than these last eight years. We are a better country than this.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Nomination Acceptance Speech, 08-28-08

wisdom.quote: We are here because we love this country too much to let the next four years look like the last eight.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Nomination Acceptance Speech, 08-28-08

wisdom.quote: We cannot meet 21st Century challenges with a 20th Century bureaucracy.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, Nomination Acceptance Speech, 08-28-08

wisdom.quote: Before we get too depressed about the state of our politics, let's remember our history. The great debates of the past, all stirred great passions. They all made somebody angry, and at least once led to a terrible war. What is amazing, is that despite all the conflict, our experiment in democracy has worked better than any form of government on earth.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: If we choose only to expose ourselves to opinions and viewpoints that are in line to our own, we become more polarized, more set in our own ways. It will only reinforce and deepen the political divides in our country. But if we choose to actively seek out information that challenges our assumptions and beliefs, perhaps we can begin to understand where the people who disagree with us are coming from.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: It may make your blood boil and your mind may not be changed, but the practice of listening to opposing views is essential for effective citizenship. It is essential for our democracy.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: Politics has never been for the thin-skinned or the faint of heart, and if you enter the arena , you should expect to get roughed up. Moreover, Democracy in a nation of more than 300 million people is inherently difficult.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: We can't expect to solve problems if all we do is tear each other down. You can disagree with a certain policy without demonizing the person who espouses it.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: What we should be asking is not whether we need a big government or small government, but how we can create a smarter and better government.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: When our government is spoken of as some menacing, threatening, foreign entity, it ignores the fact that in our democracy, government is us.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: You can question somebody's views and their judgment without questioning their motives or patriotism.
wisdom.author: Barack Obama, University of Michigan Commencement, 2010

wisdom.quote: Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: In a time of universal deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: On the whole human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: To see what is in front of one's nose needs a constant struggle.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "1984", first sentence

wisdom.quote: All animals are equal but some animals are more equal than others.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Animal Farm"

wisdom.quote: A scrupulous writer, in every sentence that he writes, will ask himself at least four questions, thus: 1. What am I trying to say? 2. What words will express it? 3. What image or idiom will make it clearer? 4. Is this image fresh enough to have an effect?
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Politics and the English Language", 1946

wisdom.quote: In certain kinds of writing, particularly in art criticism and literary criticism, it is normal to come across long passages which are almost completely lacking in meaning.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Politics and the English Language", 1946

wisdom.quote: Political language -- and with variations this is true of all political parties, from Conservatives to Anarchists -- is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Politics and the English Language", 1946

wisdom.quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns as it were instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish spurting out ink.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, "Politics and the English Language", 1946

wisdom.quote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: If both the past and the external world exist only in the mind, and if the mind itself is controllable � what then?
wisdom.author: George Orwell, 1984

wisdom.quote: War is a way of shattering to pieces, or pouring into the stratosphere, or sinking in the depths of the sea, materials which might otherwise be used to make the masses too comfortable, and hence, in the long run, too intelligent.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, 1984

wisdom.quote: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
wisdom.author: George Orwell, Polemic, May 1946, "Second Thoughts on James Burnham"

wisdom.quote: Look wise, say nothing, and grunt. Speech was given to conceal thought.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler

wisdom.quote: Shut out all of your past except that which will help you weather your tomorrows.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler

wisdom.quote: That man can interrogate as well as observe nature was a lesson slowly learned in his evolution.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler

wisdom.quote: The greater the ignorance the greater the dogmatism.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler

wisdom.quote: To study the phenomenon of disease without books is to sail an uncharted sea, while to study books without patients is not to go to sea at all.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler

wisdom.quote: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler, Aphorisms from his Bedside Teachings (1961) p. 105

wisdom.quote: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler, In H. Cushing, Life of Sir William Osler (1925)

wisdom.quote: Live neither in the past nor in the future, but let each day's work absorb your entire energies, and satisfy your widest ambition.
wisdom.author: Sir William Osler, to his students

wisdom.quote: All things may corrupt when minds are prone to evil.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: By faithful study of the nobler arts, our nature's softened, and more gentle grows.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Dignity and love do not blend well, nor do they continue long together.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: If you would marry suitably, marry your equal.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Love will enter cloaked in friendship's name.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Overlook our deeds, since you know that crime was absent from our inclination.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: Tears at times have all the weight of speech.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: The cause is hidden. The effect is visible to all.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: We two are to ourselves a crowd.
wisdom.author: Ovid

wisdom.quote: So I can't live either without you or with you.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Amores

wisdom.quote: When I was from Cupid's passions free, my Muse was mute and wrote no elegy.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Amores

wisdom.quote: Nothing is stronger than habit.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Ars Amatoria

wisdom.quote: Age is mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
wisdom.author: Satchel Paige

wisdom.quote: Don't look back:  Something may be gaining on you.
wisdom.author: Satchel Paige

wisdom.quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
wisdom.author: Satchel Paige

wisdom.quote: Sometimes I sits and thinks, and sometimes I just sits.
wisdom.author: Satchel Paige

wisdom.quote: Concentration comes out of a combination of confidence and hunger.
wisdom.author: Arnold Palmer

wisdom.quote: The secret of concentration is the secret of self-discovery. You reach inside yourself to discover your personal resources, and what it takes to match them to the challenge.
wisdom.author: Arnold Palmer

wisdom.quote: Never grow a wishbone, daughter, where your backbone ought to be.
wisdom.author: Clementine Paddleford

wisdom.quote: We have no eternal allies, and we have no perpetual enemies. Our interests are eternal and perpetual, and those interests it is our duty to follow.
wisdom.author: Henry John Temple Palmerston, Remarks in the House of Commons, March 1, 1848

wisdom.quote: If you look good and dress well, you don't need a purpose in life.
wisdom.author: Robert Pante

wisdom.quote: It happens fast for some people and slow for some, accidents or gravity, but we all end up mutilated.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: It's not living alone if you keep a rifle under the bed.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Nothing of me is original. I am the combined effort of everybody I've ever known.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: On game shows, some people will take the trip to France, but most people will take the washer dryer pair.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: People are all over the world telling their one dramatic story and how their life has turned into getting over this one event. Now their lives are more about the past than their future.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: The best way is not to fight it, just go. Don't be trying all the time to fix things. What you run from only stays with you longer. When you fight something, you only make it stronger.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: The idea that I can't share my problems with other people makes me not give a shit about their problems.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: The most boring thing in the entire world is nudity. The second most boring thing is honesty.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: The only reason why we ask other people how their weekend was is so we can tell them about our own weekend.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: When nobody will look at you, you can stare a hole in them. Picking out all the little details you'd never stare long enough to get if she'd ever just return your gaze, this, this is your revenge.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: When you don't share your problems, you resent hearing the problems of other people.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: When you understand that what you're telling is just a story. It isn't happening anymore. When you realize the story you're telling is just words, when you can just crumble it up and throw your past in the trashcan, then we'll figure out who you're going to be.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Who you are moment to moment is just a story.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Why is it you feel like a dope if you laugh alone, but that's usually how you end up crying?
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: You can't base your life on the past or the present. You have to tell me about your future.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Your birth is a mistake you'll spend your whole life trying to correct.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Your parents, they give you your life, but then they try to give you their life.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Better fare hard with good men than feast it with bad.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: He that would make his own liberty secure, must guard even his enemy from oppression; for if he violates this duty, he establishes a precedent that will reach to himself.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: Society is produced by our wants and government by our wickedness.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: Such is the irresistible nature of truth that all it asks, and all it wants, is the liberty of appearing.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: To argue with a person who has renounced the use of reason is like administering medicine to the dead.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: What we obtain too cheap, we esteem too lightly.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: When we are planning for posterity, we ought to remember that virtue is not hereditary.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: A thing moderately good is not so good as it ought to be. Moderation in temper is always a virtue, but moderation in principle is always a vice.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine, "The Rights of Man", 1792

wisdom.quote: When my country, into which I had just set my foot, was set on fire about my ears, it was time to stir. It was time for every man to stir.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine, Common Sense

wisdom.quote: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. �Tis the business of little minds to shrink; but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine, The Crisis, no. 1

wisdom.quote: We fight not to enslave, but to set a country free, and to make room upon the earth for honest men to live in.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine, The Crisis, no. 4, September 11, 1777

wisdom.quote: Much talking is the cause of danger. Silence is the means of avoiding misfortune. The talkative parrot is shut up in a cage. Other birds, without speech, fly freely about.
wisdom.author: Saskya Pandita

wisdom.quote: People don't want their lives fixed. Nobody wants their problems solved. Their dramas. Their distractions. Their stories resolved. Their messes cleaned up. Because what would they have left? Just the big scary unknown.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk

wisdom.quote: Which is worse: Hell or nothing?
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk

wisdom.quote: Someone bent on suicide won't have much sense of humor left.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, "Survivor"

wisdom.quote: Masochism is a valuable job skill.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Choke

wisdom.quote: A minute of perfection was worth the effort. A moment was the most you could ever expect from perfection.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: Being tired isn't the same as being rich, but most times it's close enough.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: If you could be God's worst enemy or nothing, which would you choose?
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: This is why I loved the support groups so much. If people thought you were dying, they gave you their full attention. If this might be the last time they saw you, they really saw you. People listened instead of just waiting for their turn to speak. And when they spoke, they weren't telling you a story. When the two of you talked, you were building something, and afterward you were both different than before.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: We just had a near-life experience!
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: We're the middle children of history, man. No purpose or place. We have no Great War. No Great Depression. Our Great War's a spiritual war... our Great Depression is our lives.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

wisdom.quote: No fear. No distractions. The ability to let that which does not matter truly slide.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club, 1996

wisdom.quote: On a long enough timeline. The survival rate for everyone drops to zero.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club, 1996

wisdom.quote: The things you own end up owning you.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club, 1996

wisdom.quote: With a gun stuck in your mouth and the barrel of the gun between your teeth, you can only talk in vowels.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club, 1996

wisdom.quote: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters

wisdom.quote: All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Don't do what you want. Do what you don't want. Do what you're trained not to want. Do the things that scare you the most.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Game shows are designed to make us feel better about the random, useless facts that are all we have left of our education.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Hysteria is only possible with an audience.
wisdom.author: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters, 1999

wisdom.quote: Those who can laugh without cause have either found the true meaning of happiness or have gone stark raving mad.
wisdom.author: Norm Papernick

wisdom.quote: If we could not forget, we would never be free from grief.
wisdom.author: Bahya Ibn Paquda

wisdom.quote: Always work hard on something uncomfortably exciting.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: I think it is often easier to make progress on mega-ambitious dreams. Since no one else is crazy enough to do it, you have little competition. In fact, there are so few people this crazy that I feel like I know them all by first name.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: The moments that we have with friends and family, the chances that we have to make a big difference in the world or even to make a small difference to the ones we love, all those wonderful chances that life gives us, life also takes away. It can happen fast and a whole lot sooner than you think.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: You know what it's like to wake up in the middle of the night with a vivid dream? And you know that if you don't have a pencil and pad by the bed, it will be completely gone by the next morning. Sometimes it's important to wake up and stop dreaming. When a really great dream shows up, grab it.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: You never lose a dream. It just incubates as a hobby.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: You're probably on the right track if you feel like a sidewalk worm during a rainstorm.
wisdom.author: Larry Page, University of Michigan Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: A large part of virtue consists in good habits.
wisdom.author: William Paley

wisdom.quote: A friend is one of the nicest things you can have and one of the best things you can be.
wisdom.author: Douglas Pagels

wisdom.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
wisdom.author: Douglas Pagels

wisdom.quote: Each new day is a blank page in the diary of your life. The secret of success is in turning that diary into the best story you possibly can.
wisdom.author: Douglas Pagels, A Wonderful Resolution For The New Year!

wisdom.quote: The intelligent man is one who has successfully fulfilled many accomplishments, and is yet willing to learn more.
wisdom.author: Ed Parker

wisdom.quote: Be kind - Remember every one you meet is fighting a battle - everybody's lonesome.
wisdom.author: Marion Parker

wisdom.quote: Magnificent promises are always to be suspected.
wisdom.author: Theodore Parker

wisdom.quote: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading; but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
wisdom.author: Theodore Parker

wisdom.quote: All great discoveries are made by men whose feelings run ahead of their thinking.
wisdom.author: C. H. Parkhurst

wisdom.quote: The guy who takes a chance, who walks the line between the known and unknown, who is unafraid of failure, will succeed.
wisdom.author: Gordon Parks

wisdom.quote: Thoughts give birth to a creative force that is neither elemental nor sidereal. Thoughts create a new heaven, a new firmament, a new source of energy, from which new arts flow. When a man undertakes to create something, he establishes a new heaven, as it were and from it the work that he desires to create flows into him. For such is the immensity of man that he is greater than heaven and earth.
wisdom.author: Philipus Aureolus Paracelsus

wisdom.quote: What we have to do is to be forever curiously testing new opinions and courting new impressions.
wisdom.author: Walter Pater, 1873

wisdom.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
wisdom.author: Louis Pasteur

wisdom.quote: There are no such things as applied sciences, only applications of science.
wisdom.author: Louis Pasteur

wisdom.quote: In the field of observation, chance favors only the prepared mind.
wisdom.author: Louis Pasteur, lecture 1854

wisdom.quote: Thus, in a real sense, I am constantly writing autobiography, but I have to turn it into fiction in order to give it credibility.
wisdom.author: Katherine Paterson, The Spying Heart, 1989

wisdom.quote: May I never miss a sunset or a rainbow because I am looking down.
wisdom.author: Sara June Parker

wisdom.quote: If someone offers you a gift, and you decline to accept it, the other person still owns that gift. The same is true of insults and verbal attacks.
wisdom.author: Steve Pavlina, How to Win an Argument, 08-31-05

wisdom.quote: His intelligence seized on a subject, his genius embraced it, his eloquence illuminated it.
wisdom.author: Paterculus

wisdom.quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
wisdom.author: John Patrick

wisdom.quote: Never miss a chance to keep your mouth shut.
wisdom.author: Robert Newton Peck, 'A Day No Pigs Would Die'

wisdom.quote: To give up the task of reforming society is to give up one's responsibility as a free man.
wisdom.author: Alan Paton

wisdom.quote: When a deep injury is done to us, we never recover until we forgive.
wisdom.author: Alan Paton

wisdom.quote: Fear is a journey, a terrible journey, but sorrow is at least an arriving.
wisdom.author: Alan Paton, Cry the Beloved Country

wisdom.quote: An executive is a person who always decides; sometimes he decides correctly, but he always decides.
wisdom.author: John H. Patterson

wisdom.quote: The best way to have a good idea is to have lots of ideas.
wisdom.author: Linus Pauling

wisdom.quote: Science is the search for truth - it is not a game in which one tries to beat his opponent, to do harm to others. We need to have the spirit of science in international affairs, to make the conduct of international affairs the effort to find t he right solution, the just solution of international problems, not the effort by each nation to get the better of other nations, to do harm to them when it is possible.
wisdom.author: Linus Pauling, No More War!

wisdom.quote: Assuming either the Left Wing or the Right Wing gained control of the country, it would probably fly around in circles.
wisdom.author: Pat Paulsen

wisdom.quote: A good plan, violently executed now, is better than a perfect plan next week.
wisdom.author: George S. Patton

wisdom.quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
wisdom.author: George S. Patton

wisdom.quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
wisdom.author: George S. Patton

wisdom.quote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
wisdom.author: George S. Patton

wisdom.quote: Don't be a fool and die for your country. Let the other sonofabitch die for his.
wisdom.author: George S. Patton, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.
wisdom.author: Joseph Chilton Pearce

wisdom.quote: We must accept that this creative pulse within us is God's creative pulse itself.
wisdom.author: Joseph Chilton Pearce

wisdom.quote: This isn't right. This isn't even wrong.
wisdom.author: Wolfgang Pauli, on a paper submitted by a physicist colleague

wisdom.quote: I am not in this world to live up to other people's expectations, nor do I feel that the world must live up to mine.
wisdom.author: Fritz Perls

wisdom.quote: Every luxury must be paid for, and everything is a luxury, starting with being in the world.
wisdom.author: Cesare Pavese

wisdom.quote: The only joy in the world is to begin.
wisdom.author: Cesare Pavese

wisdom.quote: We are all capable of evil thoughts, but only very rarely of evil deeds: we can all do good deeds, but very few of us can think good thoughts.
wisdom.author: Cesare Pavese

wisdom.quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
wisdom.author: Cesare Pavese

wisdom.quote: To become aware of the possibility of the search is to be onto something.
wisdom.author: Walker Percy

wisdom.quote: He conquers who endures.
wisdom.author: Persius

wisdom.quote: Millions of words are written annually purporting to tell how to beat the races, whereas the best possible advice on the subject is found in the three monosyllables: 'Do not try.'
wisdom.author: Dan Parker

wisdom.quote: I never failed to convince an audience that the best thing they could do was to go away.
wisdom.author: Thomas Love Peacock

wisdom.quote: I phoned my dad to tell him I had stopped smoking. He called me a quitter.
wisdom.author: Steven Pearl

wisdom.quote: Perfect as the wing of a bird may be, it will never enable the bird to fly if unsupported by the air. Facts are the air of science. Without them a man of science can never rise.
wisdom.author: Ivan Pavlov

wisdom.quote: That's the irony of women in charge, they don't like other women in charge.
wisdom.author: Michael R. Perry, House M.D., Deception, 2005

wisdom.quote: Politics is the skilled use of blunt objects.
wisdom.author: Lester B. Pearson

wisdom.quote: I think people that have a brother or sister don't realize how lucky they are. Sure, they fight a lot, but to know that there's always somebody there, somebody that's family.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Cat Orgy, 1999

wisdom.quote: Love isn't a decision. It's a feeling. If we could decide who we loved, it would be much simpler, but much less magical.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Chef Aid, 1998

wisdom.quote: I think that parents only get so offended by television because they rely on it as a babysitter and the sole educator of their kids.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Death, 1997

wisdom.quote: You know, I think that if parents would spend less time worrying about what their kids watch on TV and more time worrying about what's going on in their kids' lives, this world would be a much better place.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Death, 1997

wisdom.quote: Family isn't about whose blood you have. It's about who you care about.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Ike's Wee Wee, 1998

wisdom.quote: The best way to try to motivate somebody is by being direct with them. To be honest with them. Lies are never the right way to get your message across.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, My Future Self n' Me, 2002

wisdom.quote: The truth is, marijuana probably isn't going to make you kill people. Most likely isn't going to fund terrorists, but pot makes you feel fine with being bored and it's when you're bored that you should be learning a new skill or some new science or being creative. If you smoke pot you may grow up to find out that you're not good at anything.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, My Future Self n' Me, 2002

wisdom.quote: I've learned that all a person has in life is family and friends. If you lose those, you have nothing, so friends are to be treasured more than anything else in the world.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Prehistoric Ice Man, 1999

wisdom.quote: Living is having ups and downs and sharing them with friends.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Prehistoric Ice Man, 1999

wisdom.quote: Sometimes what's right isn't as important as what's profitable.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Prehistoric Ice Man, 1999

wisdom.quote: I just realized that there's going to be a lot of painful times in life, so I better learn to deal with it the right way.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Raisins, 2003

wisdom.quote: I love life...Yeah, I'm sad, but at the same time, I'm really happy that something could make me feel that sad. It's like...It makes me feel alive, you know. It makes me feel human. The only way I could feel this sad now is if I felt something really good before. So I have to take the bad with the good. So I guess what I'm feeling is like a beautiful sadness.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Raisins, 2003

wisdom.quote: Saying goodbye doesn't mean anything. It's the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it.
wisdom.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park, Tweek Vs. Craig, 1999

wisdom.quote: Fortunately for themselves and the world, nearly all men are cowards and dare not act on what they believe. Nearly all our disasters come of a few fools having the courage of their convictions.
wisdom.author: Coventry Patmore

wisdom.quote: It is within the families themselves where peace can begin.
wisdom.author: Susan Partnow

wisdom.quote: Mid pleasures and palaces though we may roam,  Be it ever so humble, there's no place like home.
wisdom.author: John Howard Payne

wisdom.quote: The strength of the United States is not the gold at Fort Knox or the weapons of mass destruction that we have, but the sum total of the education and the character of our people.
wisdom.author: Claiborne Pell

wisdom.quote: In every generation there has to be some fool who will speak the truth as he sees it.
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak

wisdom.quote: Man is born to live, not to prepare for life.
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak

wisdom.quote: What is laid down, ordered, factual is never enough to embrace the whole truth: life always spills over the rim of every cup.
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak

wisdom.quote: The great majority of us are required to live a life of constant, systematic duplicity. Your health is bound to be affected if, day after day, you say the opposite of what you feel, if you grovel before what you dislike and rejoice at what bring you nothing but misfortune. Our nervous system isn't just a fiction, it's part of our physical body, and our soul exists in space and is inside us, like teeth in our mouth. It can't be forever violated with impunity.
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak, Doctor Zhivago

wisdom.quote: Gregariousness is always the refuge of mediocrities, whether they swear by Soloviev or Kant or Marx. Only individuals seek the truth, and they shun those whose sole concern is not the truth.
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak, Dr. Zhivago

wisdom.quote: Oh, how one wishes sometimes to escape from the meaningless dullness of human eloquence, from all those sublime phrases, to take refuge in nature, apparently so inarticulate, or in the wordlessness of long grinding labor, of sound sleep, of true music, or of a human understanding, rendered speechless by emotion!
wisdom.author: Boris Pasternak, Dr. Zhivago

wisdom.quote: Remember! Things in life will not always run smoothly. Sometimes we will be rising toward the heights - then all will seem to reverse itself and start downward. The great fact to remember is that the trend of civilization itself is forever upward, that a line drawn through the middle of the peaks and the valleys of the centuries always has an upward trend.
wisdom.author: Endicott Peabody

wisdom.quote: Beyond happiness or unhappiness, though it is both things, love is intensity; it does not give us eternity but life, that second in which the doors of time and space open just a crack: here is there and now is always.
wisdom.author: Octavio Paz

wisdom.quote: Love is an attempt at penetrating another being, but it can only succeed if the surrender is mutual.
wisdom.author: Octavio Paz,  The Labyrinth of Solitude (1950)

wisdom.quote: If a problem has no solution, it may not be a problem, but a fact - not to be solved, but to be coped with over time.
wisdom.author: Shimon Peres

wisdom.quote: Freedom is a clear conscience.
wisdom.author: Periander

wisdom.quote: Real love is a permanently self-enlarging experience.
wisdom.author: M. Scott Peck, O Magazine, February 2004

wisdom.quote: The peculiar striations that define someone's personality are too numerous to know, no matter how close the observer. A person we think we know can suddenly become someone else when previously hidden strands of his character are called to the fore by circumstance.
wisdom.author: Elliot Perlman, Seven Types of Ambiguity

wisdom.quote: To follow, without halt, one aim: There's the secret of success.
wisdom.author: Anna Pavlova

wisdom.quote: There is no stigma attached to recognizing a bad decision in time to install a better one.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Everyone rises to their level of incompetence.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter, "The Peter Principle"

wisdom.quote: Oh, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to believe.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter, misquoting Sir Walter Scott

wisdom.quote: Competence, like truth, beauty and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter, The Peter Principle (1969), chapter 1

wisdom.quote: Bureaucrats write memoranda both because they appear to be busy when they are writing and because the memos, once written, immediately become proof that they were busy.
wisdom.author: Charles Peters

wisdom.quote: Each person must live their life as a model for others.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: Have you ever been hurt and the place tries to heal a bit, and you just pull the scar off of it over and over again.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: I do the very best I can to look upon life with optimism and hope and looking forward to a better day, but I don't think there is anything such as complete happiness. It pains me that there is still a lot of Klan activity and racism. I think when you say you're happy, you have everything that you need and everything that you want, and nothing more to wish for. I haven't reached that stage yet.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: I knew someone had to take the first step and I made up my mind not to move.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: It was not pre-arranged. It just happened that the driver made and demand and I just didn't feel like obeying his demand . . . I was quite tired after spending a full day working.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: My only concern was to get home after a hard day's work.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: Our mistreatment was just not right, and I was tired of it.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: Whatever my individual desires were to be free, I was not alone. There were many others who felt the same way.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks

wisdom.quote: The only tired I was, was tired of giving in.
wisdom.author: Rosa Parks, (on refusing to give up her seat on the bus)

wisdom.quote: Leaders don't create followers, they create more leaders.
wisdom.author: Tom Peters

wisdom.quote: Underpromise; overdeliver.
wisdom.author: Tom Peters, in The Chicago Tribune

wisdom.quote: Time has a wonderful way of showing us what really matters.
wisdom.author: Margaret Peters

wisdom.quote: Trees, though they are cut and lopped, grow up again quickly, but if men are destroyed, it is not easy to get them again.
wisdom.author: Pericles, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: Wait for that wisest of all counselors, Time.
wisdom.author: Pericles, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: The secret of greatness is simple: do better work than any other man in your field - and keep on doing it.
wisdom.author: Wilfred A. Peterson

wisdom.quote: Misquotations are the only quotations that are never misquoted.
wisdom.author: Hesketh Pearson

wisdom.quote: Misquotation is, in fact, the pride and privilege of the learned. A widely- read man never quotes accurately, for the rather obvious reason that he has read too widely.
wisdom.author: Hesketh Pearson, Common Misquotations (1934), Introduction

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more pleasing and engaging than the sense of having conferred benefits. Not even the gratification of receiving them.
wisdom.author: Ellis Peters

wisdom.quote: Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together.
wisdom.author: Petrarch, De Remedies

wisdom.quote: The computing field is always in need of new cliches.
wisdom.author: Alan Perlis

wisdom.quote: Autumn is the bite of the harvest apple.
wisdom.author: Christina Petrowsky

wisdom.quote: Clarity of mind means clarity of passion, too; this is why a great and clear mind loves ardently and sees distinctly what it loves.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Contradiction is not a sign of falsity, nor the lack of contradiction a sign of truth.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Few men speak humbly of humility, chastely of chastity, skeptically of skepticism.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still in a room.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: If all men knew what each said of the other, there would not be four friends in the world.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Man is equally incapable of seeing the nothingness from which he emerges and the infinity in which he is engulfed.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from a religious conviction.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: One must know oneself, if this does not serve to discover truth, it at least serves as a rule of life and there is nothing better.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Our notion of symmetry is derived from the human face. Hence, we demand symmetry horizontally and in breath only, not vertically nor in depth.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: People are usually more convinced by reasons they discovered themselves than by those found by others.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: Since we cannot know all that there is to be known about anything, we ought to know a little about everything.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: The eternal silence of these infinite spaces fills me with dread.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows nothing of.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: We are generally the better persuaded by the reasons we discover ourselves than by those given to us by others.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: We know truth, not only by reason, but also by the heart.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal

wisdom.quote: I have made this [letter] longer, because I have not had the time to make it shorter.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal, "Lettres provinciales", letter 16, 1657

wisdom.quote: Man is to himself the most wonderful object in nature; for he cannot conceive what the body is, still less what the mind is, and least of all how a body should be united to a mind. This is the consummation of his difficulties, and yet it is his very being.
wisdom.author: Blaise Pascal, Pensees(II,72)

wisdom.quote: If you don't know what to do, call the media and at least give the appearance of doing something.
wisdom.author: David Peterson

wisdom.quote: Advice is very easy to give, and even easier not to follow, so I don't fool with it.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: Call home at least once a week. It's a proven fact that we call home less the older we get. And that's wrong. It should be the other way around. As we get older, our parents get older.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: I have never thought of writing as hard work, but I have worked hard to find a voice.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: It's not the things we do in life that we regret on our death bed, it is the things we do not.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: Read at least one book a month. This is self-serving, obviously. It's a proven fact that people who read buy more books than people who don't read. In truth, I wish you'd read ten books a month, or at least buy that many.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: The most difficult part of writing a book is not devising a plot which will captivate the reader. It's not developing characters the reader will have strong feelings for or against. It is not finding a setting which will take the reader to a place he or she as never been. It is not the research, whether in fiction or non-fiction. The most difficult task facing a writer is to find the voice in which to tell the story.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: The size of your audience doesn't matter. What's important is that your audience is listening.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: We don't beat the Grim Reaper by living longer, we beat the Reaper by living well and living fully, for the Reaper will come for all of us. The question is what do we do between the time we are born and the time he shows up. It's too late to do all the things that you're gonna kinda get around to.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: You will need to find your passion. Don't give up on finding it because then all you're doing is waiting for the Reaper.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: You will not find your passion in things and you will not find your passion in money. The more things and the more money you have, the more you will look around and use that as the metric and there will be someone with more.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: Your pasion must come from the things that fuel you from the inside. Honors and awards are nice things, but only to the extent that they regard the real respect from your peers.
wisdom.author: Randy Pausch, Carnegie Mellon Commencement Speech, 2008

wisdom.quote: You've got to be original, because if you're like someone else, what do they need you for?
wisdom.author: Bernadette Peters, Inside the Actors Studio

wisdom.quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye.
wisdom.author: Miss Piggy

wisdom.quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
wisdom.author: Miss Piggy

wisdom.quote: Nihilism is best done by professionals.
wisdom.author: Iggy Pop

wisdom.quote: When I first started racing, my father said, "Win the race as slow as you can."
wisdom.author: Richard Petty

wisdom.quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes and I am left the same. The more things change the more I am the same. I am what I started with, and when it is all over I will be all that is left of me.
wisdom.author: Hugh Prather

wisdom.quote: True humor is fun - it does not put down, kid, or mock. It makes people feel wonderful, not separate, different, and cut off. True humor has beneath it the understanding that we are all in this together.
wisdom.author: Hugh Prather

wisdom.quote: Unless I accept my faults, I will most certainly doubt my virtues.
wisdom.author: Hugh Prather

wisdom.quote: Wear the old coat and buy the new book.
wisdom.author: Austin Phelps

wisdom.quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education; nothing but the first step to something better.
wisdom.author: Wendell Phillips

wisdom.quote: You can always get truth from an American statesman after he has turned seventy or given up hope of the Presidency.
wisdom.author: Wendell Phillips

wisdom.quote: What power has law where only money rules.
wisdom.author: Gaius Petronius

wisdom.quote: One good turn deserves another.
wisdom.author: Gaius Petronius, (Petronius Arbiter), Satyricon

wisdom.quote: Perfectionism is simply putting a limit on your future. When you have an idea of perfect in your mind, you open the door to constantly comparing what you have now with what you want. That type of self criticism is significantly deterring.
wisdom.author: John Eliot, Ph.D., Reverse Psychology for Success

wisdom.quote: The idea of perfect closes your mind to new standards. When you drive hard toward one ideal, you miss opportunities and paths, not to mention hurting your confidence. Believe in your potential and then go out and explore it; don't limit it.
wisdom.author: John Eliot, Ph.D., Reverse Psychology for Success

wisdom.quote: A little bad taste is like a nice dash of paprika.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: I don't care what is written about me so long as it isn't true.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: I might repeat to myself slowly and soothingly, a list of quotations beautiful from minds profound - if I can remember any of the damn things.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: I've never been a millionaire but I just know I'd be darling at it.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: If all the girls who attended the Yale prom were laid end to end, I wouldn't be a bit surprised.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: If wild my breast and sore my pride, I bask in dreams of suicide, If cool my heart and high my head I think "How lucky are the dead.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: Take care of the luxuries and the necessities will take care of themselves.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: The best way to keep children home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant--and let the air out of the tires.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, 'But the One on the Right,' in New Yorker, 1929

wisdom.quote: They sicken of the calm, who knew the storm.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, 'Fair Weather,' Sunset Gun, 1928

wisdom.quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: I'm never going to be famous. My name will never be writ large on the roster of Those Who Do Things. I don't do any thing. Not one single thing. I used to bite my nails, but I don't even do that any more.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, Here Lies (1939), "The Little Hours"

wisdom.quote: Oh, life is a glorious cycle of song, A medley of extemporanea; And love is a thing that can never go wrong; And I am Marie of Romania.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, Not So Deep as a Well (1937), "Comment"

wisdom.quote: Men seldom make passes At girls who wear glasses.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, Not So Deep as a Well (1937), "News Item"

wisdom.quote: She runs the gamut of emotions from A to B.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker, speaking of Katharine Hepburn

wisdom.quote: The man who makes no mistakes does not usually make anything.
wisdom.author: E. J. Phelps

wisdom.quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself as succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture...Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Think enthusiastically about everything; but especially about your job. If you do, you'll put a touch of glory in your life. If you love your job with enthusiasm, you'll shake it to pieces. You'll love it into greatness.
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Throw your heart over the fence and the rest will follow.
wisdom.author: Norman Vincent Peale

wisdom.quote: Whenever it is in any way possible, every boy and girl should choose as his life work some occupation which he should like to do anyhow, even if he did not need the money.
wisdom.author: William Lyon Phelps

wisdom.quote: All the world's a cage.
wisdom.author: Jeanne Phillips

wisdom.quote: Boredom, after all, is a form of criticism.
wisdom.author: William Phillips

wisdom.quote: I write down everything I want to remember. That way, instead of spending a lot of time trying to remember what it is I wrote down, I spend the time looking for the paper I wrote it down on.
wisdom.author: Beryl Pfizer

wisdom.quote: You know that children are growing up when they start asking questions that have answers.
wisdom.author: John J. Plomp

wisdom.quote: Give no decision till both sides thou'st heard.
wisdom.author: Phocylides

wisdom.quote: In archaeology you uncover the unknown. In diplomacy you cover the known.
wisdom.author: Thomas Pickering

wisdom.quote: A good End cannot sanctifie evil Means; nor must we ever do Evil, that Good may come of it.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Believe nothing against another but on good authority; and never report what may hurt another, unless it be a greater hurt to some other to conceal it.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: If a civil word or two will render a man happy, he must be a wretch indeed who will not give them to him. Such a disposition is like lighting another man's candle by one's own, which loses none of its brilliancy by what the other gains.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: If men will not be governed by God, they will be ruled by tyrants.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Let the people think they govern, and they will be governed.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Men are generally more careful of the breed of their horses and dogs than of their children.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Never marry but for love; but see that thou lovest what is lovely.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Speak properly, and in as few words as you can, but always plainly; for the end of speech is not ostentation, but to be understood.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: True silence is the rest of the mind; it is to the spirit what sleep is to the body, nourishment and refreshment.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Truth often suffers more by the heat of its defenders, than from the arguments of its opposers.
wisdom.author: William Penn

wisdom.quote: Against logic there is no armor like ignorance.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: America is a country that doesn't know where it is going but is determined to set a speed record getting there.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: An intelligence test sometimes shows a man how smart he would have been not to have taken it.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Bureaucracy defends the status quo long past the time when the quo has lost its status.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Democracy is a process by which the people are free to choose the man who will get the blame.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Education is a method whereby one acquires a higher grade of prejudices.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Equal opportunity means everyone will have a fair chance at being incompetent.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Every man serves a useful purpose: A miser, for example, makes a wonderful ancestor.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Humility is the embarrassment you feel when you tell people how wonderful you are.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: If a cluttered desk is the sign of a cluttered mind, what is the significance of a clean desk?
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: In spite of the cost of living, it's still popular.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: It is wise to remember that you are one of those who can be fooled some of the time.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Psychiatry enables us to correct our faults by confessing our parents' shortcomings.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Real, constructive mental power lies in the creative thought that shapes your destiny, and your hour-by-hour mental conduct produces power for change in your life. Develop a train of thought on which to ride. The nobility of your life as well as your happiness depends upon the direction in which that train of thought is going.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: Speak when you are angry--and you will make the best speech you'll ever regret.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: The incompetent with nothing to do can still make a mess of it.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: The man who says he is willing to meet you halfway is usually a poor judge of distance.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.quote: A contented mind is the best source for trouble.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: A word to the wise is enough.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: I am always afraid of your "something shall be done."
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: It well becomes a young man to be modest.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: Not every age is fit for childish sports.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more wretched than the mind of a man conscious of guilt.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: The evil that we know is best.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: Things we not hope for often come to pass than things we wish.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

wisdom.quote: Practice yourself what you preach.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Asinaria

wisdom.quote: There are occasions when it is undoubtedly better to incur loss than to make gain.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Captivi

wisdom.quote: Nothing is there more friendly to a man than a friend in need.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Epidicus

wisdom.quote: No guest is so welcome in a friend's house that he will not become a nuisance after three days.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Miles Gloriosus

wisdom.quote: No man is wise enough by himself.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Miles Gloriosus

wisdom.quote: Patience is the best remedy for every trouble.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Rudens

wisdom.quote: Not by age but by capacity is wisdom acquired.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Trinummus

wisdom.quote: What is yours is mine, and all mine is yours.
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Trinummus

wisdom.quote: Speak no evil of an absent friend. (Non male loquare absenti amico)
wisdom.author: Titus Maccius Plautus, Trinummus, IV, c. 190 BC

wisdom.quote: Aggression unchallenged is aggression unleashed.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: It is destruction to the weak man to attempt to imitate the powerful.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: Men in however high a station ought to fear the humble.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: The humble suffer when the mighty disagree.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: The mind ought sometimes to be diverted that it may return the better to thinking.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: There is danger in both belief and unbelief.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: To add insult to injury.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus, Fables

wisdom.quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: God is really only another artist, he made the elephant, giraffe and cat. He has no real style but keeps trying new ideas.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: Inspiration does exist, but it must find you working.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: It is your work in life that is the ultimate seduction.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape...
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: The connoisseur of painting gives only bad advice to the painter. For that reason I have given up trying to judge myself.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: There are painters who transform the sun to a yellow spot, but there are others who with the help of their art and their intelligence, transform a yellow spot into the sun.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: We all know that art is not the truth, art is a lie that makes us realize the truth.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: At my lemonade stand I used to give the first glass away free and charge five dollars for the second glass. The refill contained the antidote.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.quote: I like to play chess with old men in the park. But it's so hard to find 32 of them.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.quote: I was the kid next door's imaginary friend.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.quote: People come up to me and say, "Emo, do people really come up to you?"
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.quote: Some mornings it just doesn't seem worth it to gnaw through the leather straps.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips

wisdom.quote: I used to think that the brain was the most wonderful organ in my body. Then I realized who was telling me this.
wisdom.author: Emo Phillips, Neuropsychology: Clinical and Experimental Foundations

wisdom.quote: A suspicious mind always looks on the black side of things.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Admonish thy friends in secret, praise them openly.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: An angry man is again angry with himself when he returns to reason.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Count not him among your friends who will retail your privacies to the world.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Depend not on fortune, but on conduct.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: If you refuse where you have always granted you invite to theft.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: In a heated argument we are apt to lose sight of the truth.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: It is folly to punish your neighbor by fire when you live next door.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: It is more tolerable to be refused than deceived.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: It is no profit to have learned well, if you neglect to do well.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Learn to see in another's calamity the ills which you should avoid.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Look to be treated by others as you have treated others.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Never promise more than you can perform.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Ready tears are a sign of treachery, not of grief.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: Tis foolish to fear what you cannot avoid.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: To-day is the pupil of yesterday.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: We must give lengthy deliberation to what has to be decided once and for all.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: You should not live one way in private, another in public.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus

wisdom.quote: A fair exterior is a silent recommendation.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Better be ignorant of a matter than half know it.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Do not turn back when you are just at the goal.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Every day should be passed as if it were to be our last.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: For a good cause, wrongdoing is virtuous.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: He doubly benefits the needy who gives quickly.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: I have often regretted my speech, never my silence.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is a bad plan that admits of no modification.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is a consolation to the wretched to have companions in misery.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is a very hard undertaking to seek to please everybody.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is better to learn late than never.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is not every question that deserves an answer.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It is only the ignorant who despise education.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: It takes a long time to bring excellence to maturity.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Let a fool hold his tongue and he will pass for a sage.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Many receive advice, few profit by it.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Money alone sets all the world in motion.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: He who endeavors to serve, to benefit, and improve the world, is like a swimmer, who struggles against a rapid current, in a river lashed into angry waves by the winds. Often they roar over his head, often they beat him back and baffle him. Most men yield to the stress of the current...
