Only here and there the stout, strong heart and vigorous arms struggle on toward ultimate success.
wisdom.author: Albert Pike

wisdom.quote: As thou hast sown, so shalt thou reap.
wisdom.author: Pinarius

wisdom.quote: Sweet is war to those who know it not.
wisdom.author: Pindar

wisdom.quote: Seek not, my soul, the life of the immortals; but enjoy to the full the resources that are within thy reach.
wisdom.author: Pindar, 518-438 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Words have a longer life than deeds.
wisdom.author: Pindar, Nemean Odes

wisdom.quote: ...free time is an illusion. It's what you get when you die and the gods reward you for a life spent working from dawn until midnight.
wisdom.author: Tamora Pierce, Alanna The First Adventure

wisdom.quote: What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal.
wisdom.author: Albert Pine

wisdom.quote: A financier is a pawnbroker with imagination.
wisdom.author: Arthur Wing Pinero

wisdom.quote: I believe the future is only the past again, entered through another gate.
wisdom.author: Arthur Wing Pinero

wisdom.quote: [Long hair] is considered bohemian, which may be why I grew it, but I keep it long because I love the way it feels, part cloak, part fan, part mane, part security blanket.
wisdom.author: Marge Piercy

wisdom.quote: Write 100 things that you love about your partner. It�s another way of keeping yourself in check. It�s hard to do.
wisdom.author: Chris Pirillo, Bloggers In Love, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: How high must we build these walls Around the fields of paradise?
wisdom.author: Ricardo Pinto, The Chosen

wisdom.quote: Have I inadvertently said some evil thing?
wisdom.author: Phocion, from Plutarch, Apothegms

wisdom.quote: There is an evil tendency underlying all our technology - the tendency to do what is reasonable even when it isn't any good.
wisdom.author: Robert Pirsig, Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance

wisdom.quote: Eloquence is in the assembly, not merely in the speaker.
wisdom.author: William Pitt

wisdom.quote: Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants; it is the creed of slaves.
wisdom.author: William Pitt

wisdom.quote: Know the right moment.
wisdom.author: Pittacus, (The Seven Sages) from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Different and new is just the same old if you keep doing it over and over.
wisdom.author: Kyran Pittman, Good Housekeeping,  June 2011

wisdom.quote: When you build bridges you can keep crossing them.
wisdom.author: Rick Pitino, Lead to Success

wisdom.quote: How helpless we are, like netted birds, when we are caught by desire!
wisdom.author: Belva Plain

wisdom.quote: My definition of an expert in any field is a person who knows enough about what's really going on to be scared.
wisdom.author: P. J. Plauger, Computer Language, March 1983

wisdom.quote: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die, and a new generation grows up that is familiar with�it.
wisdom.author: Max Planck, Scientific Autobiography and Other Papers, 1950

wisdom.quote: I wanted change and excitement and to shoot off in all directions myself, like the colored arrows from a Fourth of July rocket.
wisdom.author: Sylvia Plath

wisdom.quote: There must be quite a few things a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them.
wisdom.author: Sylvia Plath, The Bell Jar, 1963

wisdom.quote: However often you may have done them a favour, if you once refuse they forget everything except your refusal.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Younger

wisdom.quote: An object in possession seldom retains the same charm that it had in pursuit.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Younger, Letters

wisdom.quote: His only fault is that he has no fault.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Younger, Letters

wisdom.quote: That indolent but agreeable condition of doing nothing.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Younger, Letters

wisdom.quote: There is nothing to write about, you say. Well then, write and let me know just this - that there is nothing to write about; or tell me in the good old style if you are well. That's right. I am quite well.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Younger, Letters

wisdom.quote: Knowledge, if it does not determine action, is dead to us.
wisdom.author: Plotinus

wisdom.quote: Science is facts; just as houses are made of stones, so is science made of facts; but a pile of stones is not a house and a collection of facts is not necessarily science.
wisdom.author: Henri Poincare

wisdom.quote: Thought is only a flash between two long nights, but this flash is everything.
wisdom.author: Henri Poincare

wisdom.quote: Creativity represents a miraculous coming together of the uninhibited energy of the child with its apparent opposite and enemy, the sense of order imposed on the disciplined adult intelligence.
wisdom.author: Norman Podhoretz

wisdom.quote: If the divine creator has taken pains to give us delicious and exquisite things to eat, the least we can do is prepare them well and serve them with ceremony.
wisdom.author: Fernand Point

wisdom.quote: The painting has a life of its own. I try to let it come through.
wisdom.author: Jackson Pollock

wisdom.quote: I don't believe in intuition. When you get sudden flashes of perception, it is just the brain working faster than usual. But you've been getting ready to know it for a long time, and when it comes, you feel you've known it always.
wisdom.author: Katherine Anne Porter

wisdom.quote: To err is human. (Errare Humanum Est)
wisdom.author: Melchior De Polignac

wisdom.quote: He who laughs, lasts!
wisdom.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

wisdom.quote: People who are always making allowances for themselves soon go bankrupt.
wisdom.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

wisdom.quote: To repeat what others have said, requires education; to challenge it, requires brains.
wisdom.author: Mary Pettibone Poole, A Glass Eye at a Keyhole, 1938

wisdom.quote: There is no monument dedicated to the memory of a committee.
wisdom.author: Lester J. Pourciau

wisdom.quote: If you're a misfit within a group of misfits, does that mean you're actually popular and normal?
wisdom.author: Laura Preble, The Queen Geek Social Club, 2006

wisdom.quote: There are worse things than looking stupid. Sleeping through life is one of them.
wisdom.author: Laura Preble, The Queen Geek Social Club, 2006

wisdom.quote: We will make them think it's their idea. That's how all great leaders fool people.
wisdom.author: Laura Preble, The Queen Geek Social Club, 2006

wisdom.quote: If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you. What we call failure is not the falling down but the staying down.
wisdom.author: Mary Pickford

wisdom.quote: It is the function of creative men to perceive the relations between thoughts, or things, or forms of expression that may seem utterly different, and to be able to combine them into some new forms-the power to connect the seemingly unconnected.
wisdom.author: William Plomer

wisdom.quote: If the human mind was simple enough to understand, we'd be too simple to understand it.
wisdom.author: Emerson Pugh

wisdom.quote: The end always passes judgement on what has gone before.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Sententiae (c. 43 BC)

wisdom.quote: A liberal is a person whose interests aren't at stake at the moment.
wisdom.author: Willis Player

wisdom.quote: About the only thing that comes to us without effort is old age.
wisdom.author: Gloria Pitzer, in Reader's Digest, 1979

wisdom.quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Desires are only the lack of something: and those who have the greatest desires are in a worse condition than those who have none, or very slight ones.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: If women are expected to do the same work as men, we must teach them the same things.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Ignorance, the root and the stem of every evil.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Laws are partly formed for the sake of good men, in order to instruct them how they may live on friendly terms with one another, and partly for the sake of those who refuse to be instructed, whose spirit cannot be subdued, or softened, or hindered from plunging into evil.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Man...is a tame or civilized animal; never the less, he requires proper instruction and a fortunate nature, and then of all animals he becomes the most divine and most civilized; but if he be insufficiently or ill- educated he is the most savage of earthly creatures.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Never discourage anyone... who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Never discourage anyone...who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: No human thing is of serious importance.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing as a lover's oath.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: They certainly give very strange names to diseases.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Thinking is the talking of the soul with itself.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Apology

wisdom.quote: You cannot conceive the many without the one.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Parmenides

wisdom.quote: Transported to a surreal landscape, a young girl kills the first woman she meets and then teams up with three complete strangers to kill again.
wisdom.author: Rick Polito, Marin Independent Journal's TV listing for "The Wizard of Oz"

wisdom.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Phaedo

wisdom.quote: Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Phaedo

wisdom.quote: The partisan, when he is engaged in a dispute, cares nothing about the rights of the question, but is anxious only to convince his hearers of his own assertions.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Phaedo

wisdom.quote: Friends have all things in common.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: The greatest penalty of evildoing - namely, to grow into the likeness of bad men.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Theatetus

wisdom.quote: You are young, my son, and, as the years go by, time will change and even reverse many of your present opinions. Refrain therefore awhile from setting yourself up as a judge of the highest matters.
wisdom.author: Plato, Dialogues, Theatetus

wisdom.quote: Any one who has common sense will remember that the bewilderments of the eyes are of two kinds, and arise from two causes, either from coming out of the light or from going into the light, which is true of the mind's eye, quite as much as of the bodily eye; and he who remembers this when he sees any one whose vision is perplexed and weak, will not be too ready to laugh; he will first ask whether that soul of man has come out of the brighter light, and is unable to see because unaccustomed to the dark, or having turned from darkness to the day is dazzled by excess of light.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Everything that deceives may be said to enchant.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: He who is of calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age, but to him who is of an opposite disposition youth and age are equally a burden.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Mankind censure injustice fearing that they may be the victims of it, and not because they shrink from committing it.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Necessity, who is the mother of invention.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future life.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: The people have always some champion whom they set over them and nurse into greatness...This and no other is the root from which a tyrant springs; when he first appears he is a protector.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: The soul of man is immortal and imperishable.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: There are three arts which are concerned with all things: one which uses, another which makes, and a third which imitates them.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Wealth is the parent of luxury and indolence, and poverty of meanness and viciousness, and both of discontent.
wisdom.author: Plato, The Republic

wisdom.quote: Do not speak of your happiness to one less fortunate than yourself.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: No beast is more savage than man when possessed with power answerable to his rage.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: Rest is the sweet sauce of labor.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: So very difficult a matter is it to trace and find out the truth of anything by history.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: The whole life of man is but a point of time; let us enjoy it.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: To find a fault is easy; to do better may be difficult.
wisdom.author: Plutarch

wisdom.quote: It is certainly desirable to be well descended, but the glory belongs to our ancestors.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, 'Morals,' 100 A.D.

wisdom.quote: Perseverance is more prevailing than violence; and many things which cannot be overcome when they are together, yield themselves up when taken little by little.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: An old doting fool, with one foot already in the grave.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, Morals

wisdom.quote: For to err in opinion, though it be not the part of wise men, is at least human.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, Morals

wisdom.quote: The very spring and root of honesty and virtue lie in good education.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, Morals

wisdom.quote: When the candles are out all women are fair.
wisdom.author: Plutarch, Morals

wisdom.quote: From the end spring new beginnings.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder

wisdom.quote: In these matters the only certainty is that nothing is certain.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder

wisdom.quote: No mortal man, moreover is wise at all moments.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder

wisdom.quote: True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written; in writing what deserves to be read; and in so living as to make the world happier for our living in it.
wisdom.author: Pliny The Elder

wisdom.quote: In comparing various authors with one another, I have discovered that some of the gravest and latest writers have transcribed, word for word, from former works, without making acknowledgment.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder, Natural History

wisdom.quote: Indeed, what is there that does not appear marvelous when it comes to our knowledge for the first time? How many things, too, are looked upon as quite impossible until they have been actually effected?
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder, Natural History

wisdom.quote: The best plan is to profit by the folly of others.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder, Natural History

wisdom.quote: There is always something new out of Africa.
wisdom.author: Pliny the Elder, Natural History

wisdom.quote: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: I have no faith in human perfectability. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: Sleep, those little slices of death; Oh how I loathe them.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: The nose of a mob is its imagination. By this, at any time, it can be quietly led.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: To be thoroughly conversant with a man's heart, is to take our final lesson in the iron-clasped volume of despair.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, "Eleonora"

wisdom.quote: Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, Berenice

wisdom.quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, Dream Within a Dream

wisdom.quote: Depend upon it, after all, Thomas, Literature is the most noble of professions. In fact, it is about the only one fit for a man. For my own part, there is no seducing me from the path.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, From a letter to Frederick W. Thomas (February 14, 1849).

wisdom.quote: Scorching my seared heart with a pain, not hell shall make me fear again.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, Tamerlane, Part II

wisdom.quote: Yet I am not more sure that my soul lives, than I am that perverseness is one of the primitive impulses of the human heartone of the indivisible primary faculties, or sentiments, which give direction to the character of Man.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, The Black Cat, 1843

wisdom.quote: It may well be doubted whether human ingenuity can construct an enigma... which human ingenuity may not, by proper application, resolve.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, The Gold Bug

wisdom.quote: There are certain themes of which the interest is all-absorbing, but which are too entirely horrible for the purposes of legitimate fiction.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe, The Premature Burial

wisdom.quote: There is no witness so dreadful, no accuser so terrible as the conscience that dwells in the heart of every man.
wisdom.author: Polybius, History

wisdom.quote: Those who know how to win are much more numerous than those who know how to make proper use of their victories.
wisdom.author: Polybius, History

wisdom.quote: Love God and trust your feelings. Be loyal to them. Don't betray them.
wisdom.author: Robert C. Pollock

wisdom.quote: Even with the best of maps and instruments, we can never fully chart our journeys.
wisdom.author: Gail Pool

wisdom.quote: The trouble in corporate America is that too many people with too much power live in a box (their home), then travel the same road every day to another box (their office).

wisdom.quote: It's funny how dogs and cats know the inside of folks better than other folks do, isn't it?
wisdom.author: Eleanor H. Porter, Pollyanna, 1912

wisdom.quote: Do you know, my son, with what little understanding the world is ruled?

wisdom.quote: Human nature constitutes a part of the evidence in every case.
wisdom.author: Elisha Potter

wisdom.quote: Remember that what you believe will depend very much on what you are.
wisdom.author: Noah Porter

wisdom.quote: If there is a sacred moment in the ethical pursuit of game, it is the moment you release the arrow or touch off the fatal shot.
wisdom.author: Jim Posewitz

wisdom.quote: Human beings are perhaps never more frightening than when they are convinced beyond doubt that they are right.
wisdom.author: Laurens Van der Post, The Lost World of the Kalahari (1958)

wisdom.quote: Great literature is simply charged with meaning to the utmost possible degree.
wisdom.author: Ezra Pound

wisdom.quote: Properly, we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.
wisdom.author: Ezra Pound

wisdom.quote: Literature is news that stays news.
wisdom.author: Ezra Pound, ABC of Reading (1934) chapter 8

wisdom.quote: All the sounds of this valley run together into one great echo, a song that is sung by all the spirits of this valley. Only a hunter hears it.
wisdom.author: Chaim Potok

wisdom.quote: Law is experience developed by reason and applied continually to further experience.
wisdom.author: Roscoe Pound

wisdom.quote: The law must be stable, but it must not stand still.
wisdom.author: Roscoe Pound

wisdom.quote: A man's respect for law and order exists in precise relationship to the size of his paycheck.
wisdom.author: Adam Clayton Powell Jr., "Keep the Faith, Baby!", 1967

wisdom.quote: Unless man is committed to the belief that all mankind are his brothers, then he labors in vain and hypocritically in the vineyards of equality.
wisdom.author: Adam Clayton Powell Jr., 'Black Power: A Form of Godly Power,' 1967

wisdom.quote: I don't have a bank account, because I don't know my mother's maiden name.
wisdom.author: Paula Poundstone

wisdom.quote: The wages of sin are death, but by the time taxes are taken out, it's just sort of a tired feeling.
wisdom.author: Paula Poundstone

wisdom.quote: A man should never be ashamed to own he has been wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Amusement is the happiness of those who cannot think.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: An honest man is the noblest work of God.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: And all who told it added something new, And all who heard it made enlargements too.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Be thou the first true merit to befriend, his praise is lost who stays till all commend.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Fools admire, but men of sense approve.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: He who tells a lie is not sensible of how great a task he undertakes; for he must be forced to invent twenty more to maintain that one.

wisdom.quote: Man: the glory, jest, and riddle of the world.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Our passions are like convulsion fits, which, though they make us stronger for a time, leave us the weaker ever after.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Some people will never learn anything because they understand everything too soon.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: The greatest advantage I know of being thought a wit by the world is that it gives me the greater freedom of playing the fool.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: How happy is the blameless vestal's lot! The world forgetting, by the world forgot. Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind! Each pray'r accepted, and each wish resign'd;
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, "Eloisa to Abelard"

wisdom.quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing; drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring: there shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, An essay on Criticism

wisdom.quote: To err is human, to forgive divine.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, An Essay on Criticism

wisdom.quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried, Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, An Essay on Criticism, 1711

wisdom.quote: Ten censure wrong, for one that writes amiss.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, Essay on Criticism

wisdom.quote: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope, Letter to Gay, October 6, 1727

wisdom.quote: Let us consider the reason of the case. For nothing is law that is not reason.
wisdom.author: Sir John Powell

wisdom.quote: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
wisdom.author: Colin Powell

wisdom.quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
wisdom.author: Colin Powell

wisdom.quote: The day soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you have stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help them or concluded that you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
wisdom.author: Colin Powell

wisdom.quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
wisdom.author: Colin Powell

wisdom.quote: What some call health, if purchased by perpetual anxiety about diet, isn't much better than tedious disease.
wisdom.author: George Dennison Prentice

wisdom.quote: The bone-chilling scream split the warm summer night in two, the first half being before the scream when it was fairly balmy and calm and pleasant for those who hadn't heard the scream at all, but not calm or balmy or even very nice for those who did hear the scream, discounting the little period of time during the actual scream itself when your ears might have been hearing it but your brain wasn't reacting yet to let you know.
wisdom.author: Patricia E. Presutti, 1986 winner of the Bulwer-Lytton Fiction Contest

wisdom.quote: I am here and you will know that I am the best and will hear me.
wisdom.author: Leontyne Price, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: I don't know anything about music. In my line you don't have to.
wisdom.author: Elvis Presley

wisdom.quote: Like its politicians and its wars, society has the teenagers it deserves.
wisdom.author: J. B. Priestley

wisdom.quote: The world is round and the place which may seem like the end may also be only the beginning.
wisdom.author: Ivy Baker Priest, in Parade, 1958

wisdom.quote: The future is uncertain... but this uncertainty is at the very heart of human creativity.
wisdom.author: Ilya Prigogine

wisdom.quote: Be to her virtues very kind. Be to her faults a little blind.
wisdom.author: Matthew Prior

wisdom.quote: They always talk who never think.
wisdom.author: Matthew Prior

wisdom.quote: The ends must justify the means.
wisdom.author: Matthew Prior, "Hans Carvel" (1701)

wisdom.quote: Fear is that little darkroom where negatives are developed.
wisdom.author: Michael Pritchard

wisdom.quote: No matter how rich you become, how famous or powerful, when you die the size of your funeral will still pretty much depend on the weather.
wisdom.author: Michael Pritchard

wisdom.quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing.
wisdom.author: Michael Pritchard

wisdom.quote: To give anything less than your best is to sacrifice the gift.
wisdom.author: Steve Prefontaine

wisdom.quote: Correct me if I'm wrong, but hasn't the fine line between sanity and madness gotten finer?
wisdom.author: George Price

wisdom.quote: Could we have entered into the mind of Sir Isaac Newton, and have traced all the steps by which he produced his great works, we might see nothing very extraordinary in the process.
wisdom.author: Joseph Priestley

wisdom.quote: In completing one discovery we never fail to get an imperfect knowledge of others of which we could have no idea before, so that we cannot solve one doubt without creating several new ones.
wisdom.author: Joseph Priestley

wisdom.quote: The more elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
wisdom.author: Joseph Priestley

wisdom.quote: What I have known with respect to myself, has tended much to lessen both my admiration, and my contempt, of others.
wisdom.author: Joseph Priestley

wisdom.quote: Will is nothing more than a particular case of the general doctrine of association of ideas, and therefore a perfectly mechanical thing.
wisdom.author: Joseph Priestley

wisdom.quote: Man is the measure of all things.
wisdom.author: Protagoras, Fragment 1

wisdom.quote: There are two sides to every question.
wisdom.author: Protagoras, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: [The pamphlet] was very patriotic. That is, it talked about killing foreigners.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Monstrous Regiment

wisdom.quote: Of course, it is very important to be sober when you take an exam. Many worthwhile careers in the street- cleansing, fruit-picking and subway-guitar-playing industries have been founded on a lack of understanding of this simple fact.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Moving Pictures

wisdom.quote: If you put butter and salt on it, it tastes like salty butter.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Moving Pictures (regarding popcorn)

wisdom.quote: Revolutions always come around again. That's why they're called revolutions.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Night Watch

wisdom.quote: Seeing, contrary to popular wisdom, isn't believing. It's where belief stops, because it isn't needed any more.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Pyramids

wisdom.quote: What our ancestors would really be thinking, if they were alive today, is: "Why is it so dark in here?"
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Pyramids

wisdom.quote: Bishops move diagonally. That's why they often turn up where the kings don't expect them to be.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: Gods don't like people not doing much work. People who aren't busy all the time might start to think.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: He says gods like to see an atheist around. Gives them something to aim at.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: No. Men should die for lies. But the truth is too precious to die for.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: When the least they could do to you was everything, then the most they could do to you suddenly held no terror.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: Words are the litmus paper of the minds. If you find yourself in the power of someone who will use the word "commence" in cold blood, go somewhere else very quickly. But if they say "Enter", don't stop to pack.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Small Gods

wisdom.quote: Famous I don't know about. It's hard to be famous and alive. I just want to play music every day and hear someone say, 'Thanks, that was great, here's some money, same time tomorrow, okay?'
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Soul Music, page 151

wisdom.quote: "I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?" Death thought about it. "Cats," he said eventually. "Cats are nice."
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Sourcery

wisdom.quote: Tourist, Rincewind decided, meant "idiot".
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, The Colour of Magic

wisdom.quote: A marriage is always made up of two people who are prepared to swear that only the other one snores.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, The Fifth Elephant

wisdom.quote: Geography is just physics slowed down, with a couple of trees stuck in it.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, The Last Continent

wisdom.quote: There are, it has been said, two types of people in the world. There are those who, when presented with a glass that is exactly half full, say: this glass is half full. And then there are those who say: this glass is half empty. The world belongs, however, to those who can look at the glass and say: What's up with this glass? Excuse me? Excuse me? This is my glass? I don't think so. My glass was full! And it was a bigger glass!
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, The Truth

wisdom.quote: The duke had a mind that ticked like a clock and, like a clock, it regularly went cuckoo.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Wyrd Sisters

wisdom.quote: Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: Sometimes glass glitters more than diamonds because it has more to prove.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: That seems to point up a significant difference between Europeans and Americans. A European says: "I can't understand this, what's wrong with me?" An American says: "I can't understand this, what's wrong with him?"
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of his own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players, to being involved in an obscure and complex version of poker in a pitch dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who smiles all the time.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, "Good Omens"

wisdom.quote: The truth may be out there, but the lies are inside your head.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, "Hogfather", footnote

wisdom.quote: Gravity is a habit that is hard to shake off.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, "Small Gods" (1992)

wisdom.quote: In the begining there was nothing, and it exploded.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, (on the big bang theory)

wisdom.quote: Give a man a fire and he's warm for the day. But set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Discworld

wisdom.quote: For animals, the entire universe has been neatly divided into things to (a) mate with, (b) eat, (c) run away from, and (d) rocks.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Equal Rites

wisdom.quote: The consensus seemed to be that if really large numbers of men were sent to storm the mountain, then enough might survive the rocks to take the citadel. This is essentially the basis of all military thinking.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Eric

wisdom.quote: Stupid men are often capable of things the clever would not dare to contemplate...
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Feet of Clay

wisdom.quote: A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Guards! Guards!

wisdom.quote: An education was a bit like a communicable sexual disease. It made you unsuitable for a lot of jobs and then you had the urge to pass it on.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Hogfather

wisdom.quote: Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Hogfather

wisdom.quote: It could not be happening because this sort of thing did not happen. Any contradictory evidence could be safely ignored.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Jingo

wisdom.quote: It was so much easier to blame it on Them. It was bleakly depressing to think that They were Us. If it was Them, then nothing was anyone's fault. If it was us, what did that make Me? After all, I'm one of Us. I must be. I've certainly never thought of myself as one of Them. No one ever thinks of themselves as one of Them. We're always one of Us. It's Them that do the bad things.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Jingo

wisdom.quote: Sham Harga had run a succesful eatery for many years by always smiling, never extending credit, and realizing that most of his customers wanted meals properly balanced between the four food groups: sugar, starch, grease, and burnt crunchy bits.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett, Men at Arms

wisdom.quote: Afflicted by love's madness all are blind.
wisdom.author: Sextus Propertius

wisdom.quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
wisdom.author: Sextus Propertius, Elegies

wisdom.quote: Let each man pass his days in that wherein his skill is greatest.
wisdom.author: Sextus Propertius, Elegies

wisdom.quote: Let no one be willing to speak ill of the absent.
wisdom.author: Sextus Propertius, Elegies

wisdom.quote: The Americans have need of the telephone, but we do not. We have plenty of messenger boys.
wisdom.author: Sir William Preece, chief engineer of the British Post  Office, 1876

wisdom.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy: They are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: Only through art can we get outside of ourselves and know another's view of the universe.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: The one thing more difficult than following a regimen is not imposing it on others.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: The only paradise is paradise lost.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: We feel in one world, we think and name in another. Between the two we can set up a system of references, but we cannot fill in the gap.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: Desire makes everything blossom; possession makes everything wither and fade.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust, Les Plaisirs et les Jours (1896)

wisdom.quote: Another such victory over the Romans, and we are undone.
wisdom.author: Pyrrhus, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: Marriage is really tough because you have to deal with feelings... and lawyers.
wisdom.author: Richard Pryor

wisdom.quote: I never met anybody who said when they were a kid, "I wanna grow up and be a critic."
wisdom.author: Richard Pryor, Guardian Unlimited (UK) August 9, 2004

wisdom.quote: Cowardice asks: Is it safe? Expediency asks: Is it politic? But Conscience asks: Is it right?
wisdom.author: William Punshon

wisdom.quote: Never get angry. Never make a threat. Reason with people.
wisdom.author: Mario Puzo, 'The Godfather'

wisdom.quote: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: No one knows what he can do till he tries.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: No one should be judge in his own case.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Nothing can be done at once hastily and prudently.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Pardon one offense, and you encourage the commission of many.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Speech is a mirror of the soul: as a man speaks, so is he.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: The fear of death is more to be dreaded than death itself.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: The judge is condemned when the criminal is absolved.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: The loss which is unknown is no loss at all.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: There are some remedies worse than the disease.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: To do two things at once is to do neither.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: Treat your friend as if he might become an enemy.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: We desire nothing so much as what we ought not to have.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: What is left when honor is lost?
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: You should go to a pear tree for pears, not to an elm.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Maxims

wisdom.quote: A gift in season is a double favor to the needy.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Moral Sayings, 100 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Hares can gambol over the body of a dead lion.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Moral Sayings, 100 B.C.

wisdom.quote: As men, we are all equal in the presence of death.
wisdom.author: Publilius Syrus, Moral Sayings, First Century B.C.

wisdom.quote: You can't turn back the clock. But you can wind it up again.
wisdom.author: Bonnie Prudden

wisdom.quote: Above all things, reverence yourself.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: Choose rather to be strong of soul than strong of body.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: Do not talk a little on many subjects, but much on a few.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: In anger we should refrain both from speech and action.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: It is better wither to be silent, or to say things of more value than silence. Sooner throw a pearl at hazard than an idle or useless word; and do not say a little in many words, but a great deal in a few.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: It is only necessary to make war with five things; with the maladies of the body, the ignorances of the mind, with the passions of the body, with the seditions of the city and the discords of families.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: Rest satisfied with doing well, and leave others to talk of you as they please.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras

wisdom.quote: Reason is immortal, all else mortal.
wisdom.author: Pythagoras, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: All my possessions for a moment of time.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth I

wisdom.quote: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth I, in Francis Bacon, Apophthegms, 1625

wisdom.quote: Take hope from the heart of man, and you make him a beast of prey.
wisdom.author: Quida

wisdom.quote: Don't ask of your friends what you yourself can do.
wisdom.author: Quintus Ennius

wisdom.quote: Quite frankly, teachers are the only profession that teach our children.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 9/18/90

wisdom.quote: We're going to have the best-educated American people in the world.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 9/21/88

wisdom.quote: We are ready for any unforeseen event that may or may not occur.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 9/22/90

wisdom.quote: For NASA, space is still a high priority.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 9/5/90

wisdom.quote: Public speaking is very easy.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, to reporters in 10/88

wisdom.quote: I stand by all the misstatements that I've made.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, to Sam Donaldson, 8/17/89

wisdom.quote: The future is much like the present, only longer.
wisdom.author: Dan Quisenberry

wisdom.quote: I am not part of the problem. I am a Republican.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: I have made good judgements in the Past. I have made good judgements in the Future.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: People that are really very weird can get into sensitive positions and have a tremendous impact on history.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: Republicans understand the importance of bondage between a mother and child.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that Dan Quayle may or may not make.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: The future will be better tomorrow.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: We don't want to go back to tomorrow, we want to go forward.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: We have a firm commitment to NATO, we are a *part* of NATO. We have a firm commitment to Europe. We are a *part* of Europe.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: We're all capable of mistakes, but I do not care to enlighten you on the mistakes we may or may not have made.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: Welcome to President Bush, Mrs. Bush, and my fellow astronauts.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: What a waste it is to lose one's mind. Or not to have a mind is being very wasteful. How true that is.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: When I have been asked during these last weeks who caused the riots and the killing in L.A., my answer has been direct and simple: Who is to blame for the riots? The rioters are to blame. Who is to blame for the killings? The killers are to blame.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: [It's] time for the human race to enter the solar system.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle

wisdom.quote: Verbosity leads to unclear, inarticulate things.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 11/30/88

wisdom.quote: One word sums up probably the responsibility of any vice president, and that one word is 'to be prepared'.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 12/6/89

wisdom.quote: Illegitimacy is something we should talk about in terms of not having it.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 5/20/92 (reported in Esquire, 8/92)

wisdom.quote: I believe we are on an irreversible trend toward more freedom and democracy - but that could change.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 5/22/89

wisdom.quote: Mars is essentially in the same orbit... Mars is somewhat the same distance from the Sun, which is very important. We have seen pictures where there are canals, we believe, and water. If there is water, that means there is oxygen. If oxygen, that means we can breathe.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 8/11/89

wisdom.quote: Murphy Brown is doing better than I am. At least she knows she still has a job next year.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 8/18/92

wisdom.quote: The Holocaust was an obscene period in our nation's history. I mean in this century's history. But we all lived in this century. I didn't live in this century.
wisdom.author: Dan Quayle, 9/15/88

wisdom.quote: A finished person is a boring person.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: A man who builds his own pedestal had better use strong cement.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: But never fear, gentlemen; castration was really not the point of feminism, and we women are too busy eviscerating one another to take you on.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: I came to the realization that there were certain public issues that were most usefully dealt with within some sort of framework of at least my private beliefs, if not my private life.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: I can't think of anything to write about except families. They are a metaphor for every other part of society.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: I think that anyone who comes upon a Nautilus machine suddenly will agree with me that its prototype was clearly invented at some time in history when torture was considered a reasonable alternative to diplomacy.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think interior decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: I would be the most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: If your success is not on your own terms, if it looks good to the world but does not feel good in your heart, it is not success at all.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: The truth about your own life is not always easy to accept, and sometimes hasn't even occurred to you.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: There's a certain kind of conversation you have from time to time at parties in New York about a new book. The word "banal" sometimes rears its by-now banal head; you say "underedited," I say "derivative." The conversation goes around and around various literary criticisms, and by the time it moves on one thing is clear: No one read the book; we just read the reviews.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: Voices that loud are always meant to bully. Do not be bullied. Acts of bravery don't always take place on battlefields. They can take place in your heart, when you have the courage to honor your character, your intellect, your inclinations, and, yes your soul by listening to its clean, clear voice of direction instead of following the muddied messages of a timid world.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: When an actress takes off her clothes onscreen but a nursing mother is told to leave, what message do we send about the roles of women? In some ways we're as committed to the old madonna-whore dichotomy as ever. And the madonna stays home, feeding the baby behind the blinds, a vestige of those days when for a lady to venture out was a flagrant act of public exposure.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen

wisdom.quote: All of us want to do well. But if we do not do good, too, then doing well will never be enough.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: Don't ever confuse the two, your life and your work. That's what I have to say. The second is only a part of the first.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: I show up. I listen. I try to laugh.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: It's so much easier to write a resume than to craft a spirit.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: Think of life as a terminal illness, because, if you do, you will live it with joy and passion, as it ought to be lived.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: When you leave college, there are thousands of people out there with the same degree you have; when you get a job, there will be thousands of people doing what you want to do for a living. But you are the only person alive who has sole custody of your life.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: When you have a number of disagreeable duties to perform, always do the most disagreeable first.
wisdom.author: Josiah Quincy

wisdom.quote: You cannot be really first-rate at your work if your work is all you are.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, A Short Guide to a Happy Life, 2000

wisdom.quote: If God is watching us, as some believers suggest, as though we were a television show and God had a lot of free time, the deity would surely be bemused by how dumbed-down devotion has sometimes become in this so-called modern era. How might an omnipotent being with the long view of history respond to those who visit the traveling exhibit of a grilled-cheese sandwich, sold on eBay, that is said to bear the image of the Virgin Mary? It certainly argues against intelligent design, or at least intelligent design in humans.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, Newsweek, 01-02-06

wisdom.quote: O ye of little faith, who believe that somehow the birth of Christ is dependent upon acknowledgment in a circular from OfficeMax!
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, Newsweek, 01-02-06

wisdom.quote: Or what about the statue in California currently said to be crying bloody tears? Why worry about the alleged weeping of a plaster effigy when so many actual human beings have reason to cry?
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, Newsweek, 01-02-06

wisdom.quote: The world is full of women blindsided by the unceasing demands of motherhood, still flabbergasted by how a job can be terrific and torturous.
wisdom.author: Anna Quindlen, O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: It is much easier to try one's hand at many things than to concentrate one's powers on one thing.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: Nature herself has never attempted to effect great changes rapidly.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: Nothing can be pleasing which is not also becoming.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: That laughter costs too much which is purchased by the sacrifice of decency.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: Though ambition itself be a vice, yet it is often times the cause of virtues.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: When defeat is inevitable, it is wisest to yield.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: When we cannot hope to win, it is an advantage to yield.
wisdom.author: Quintilian

wisdom.quote: A liar should have a good memory.
wisdom.author: Quintilian, De Institutione Oratoria

wisdom.quote: Those who wish to appear wise among fools, among the wise seem foolish.
wisdom.author: Quintilian, De Institutione Oratoria

wisdom.quote: Be very circumspect in the choice of thy company. In the society of thine equals thou shalt enjoy more pleasure; in the society of thy superiors thou shalt find more profit. To be the best in the company is the way to grow worse.
wisdom.author: Francis Quarles

wisdom.quote: If thou desire the love of God and man, be humble, for the proud heart, as it loves none but itself, is beloved of none but itself. Humility enforces where neither virtue, nor strength, nor reason can prevail.
wisdom.author: Francis Quarles

wisdom.quote: If thou desire to purchase honor with thy wealth, consider first how that wealth became thine; if thy labor got it, let thy wisdom keep it; if oppression found it, let repentance restore it; if thy parent left it, let thy virtues deserve it; so shall thy honor be safer, better and cheaper.
wisdom.author: Francis Quarles

wisdom.quote: Read not books alone, but men, and amongst them chiefly thyself. If thou find anything questionable there, use the commentary of a severe friend rather than the gloss of a sweet lipped flatterer; there is more profit in a distasteful truth than in deceitful sweetness.
wisdom.author: Francis Quarles

wisdom.quote: To be loved, be lovable.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Ars Amatoria

wisdom.quote: The result justifies the deed. (Exitus acta probat)
wisdom.author: Ovid, Heorides (c. 10 BC)

wisdom.quote: Time the devourer of all things.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Metamorphoses

wisdom.quote: We can learn even from our enemies.
wisdom.author: Ovid, Metamorphoses

wisdom.quote: Morality is herd instinct in the individual.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 116

wisdom.quote: The Christian resolution to find the world ugly and bad has made the world ugly and bad.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, section 130

wisdom.quote: Men are like steel. When they lose their temper, they lose their worth.
wisdom.author: Chuck Norris

wisdom.quote: Vigorous let us be in attaining our ends, and mild in our method of attainment.
wisdom.author: Lord Newborough, Motto

wisdom.quote: If men saw that a term was set to their troubles, they would find strength in some way to withstand the hocus-pocus and intimidations of the prophets.
wisdom.author: Lucretius, On the Nature of the Universe

wisdom.quote: Music is a discipline, and a mistress of order and good manners, she makes the people milder and gentler, more moral and more reasonable.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther

wisdom.quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther

wisdom.quote: If at first you don't succeed, find out if the loser gets anything.
wisdom.author: Bill Lyon

wisdom.quote: Solitude: sweet absence of faces.
wisdom.author: Milan Kundera, Imortality

wisdom.quote: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.
wisdom.author: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

wisdom.quote: Tomas did not realize at the time that metaphors are dangerous. Metaphors are not to be trifled with. A single metaphor can give birth to love.
wisdom.author: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

wisdom.quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.
wisdom.author: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

wisdom.quote: We cannot change anything unless we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses.
wisdom.author: Carl Jung

wisdom.quote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light in the darkness of mere being.
wisdom.author: Carl Jung, "Memories, Dreams, Reflections", 1962

wisdom.quote: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
wisdom.author: Carl Jung, "Modern Man in Search of a Soul"

wisdom.quote: Where love rules, there is no will to power, and where power predominates, love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.
wisdom.author: Carl Jung, "On the Psychology of the Unconciousness", 1917

wisdom.quote: A woman's whole life is a history of the affections.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: Great minds have purposes, others have wishes.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: There is a healthful hardiness about real dignity that never dreads contact and communion with others, however humble.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power.
wisdom.author: Washington Irving

wisdom.quote: Living in a vacuum sucks.
wisdom.author: Adrienne E. Gusoff

wisdom.quote: Not only is life a bitch, it has puppies.
wisdom.author: Adrienne E. Gusoff

wisdom.quote: The world is round; it has no point.
wisdom.author: Adrienne E. Gusoff

wisdom.quote: Things could always be worse; for instance, you could be ugly and work in the Post Office.
wisdom.author: Adrienne E. Gusoff

wisdom.quote: Television has raised writing to a new low.
wisdom.author: Samuel Goldwyn

wisdom.quote: When someone does something good, applaud! You will make two people happy.
wisdom.author: Samuel Goldwyn

wisdom.quote: You've got to take the bitter with the sour.
wisdom.author: Samuel Goldwyn

wisdom.quote: A verbal contract isn't worth the paper it's written on.
wisdom.author: Samuel Goldwyn, Goldwyn's Law of Contracts

wisdom.quote: The gods visit the sins of the fathers upon the children.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Phrixus

wisdom.quote: Whoso neglects learning in his youth,Loses the past and is dead for the future.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Phrixus

wisdom.quote: Slight not what's near through aiming at what's far.
wisdom.author: Euripides, Rhesus, circa 435 B.C.

wisdom.quote: When one can hear people moving, one does not so much mind, about one's fears.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: When the mind has once begun to yield to the weakness of superstition, trifles impress it with the force of conviction.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
wisdom.author: Francois Rabelais

wisdom.quote: So much is a man worth as he esteems himself.
wisdom.author: Francois Rabelais, 1532

wisdom.quote: My mom is the most famous thing about my video blog. Everyone likes moms. People enjoy watching people's family.
wisdom.author: Schlomo Rabinowitz, How To Add Video To Your Blog, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: We cannot destroy kindred: Our chains stretch a little sometimes, but they never break.
wisdom.author: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal

wisdom.quote: I always wanted a happy ending... Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious ambiguity.
wisdom.author: Gilda Radner

wisdom.quote: I base my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.
wisdom.author: Gilda Radner

wisdom.quote: While we have the gift of life, it seems to me that only tragedy is to allow part of us to die - whether it is our spirit, our creativity, or our glorious uniqueness.
wisdom.author: Gilda Radner

wisdom.quote: May your walls know joy; May every room hold laughter and every window open to great possibility.
wisdom.author: Maryanne Radmacher-Hershey, 1995

wisdom.quote: Facing a mirror you see merely your own countenance; facing your child you finally understand how everyone else has seen you.
wisdom.author: Daniel Raeburn, The New Yorker, 05-01-2006

wisdom.quote: There is no wisdom without love.
wisdom.author: N. Sri Ram

wisdom.quote: Remember, that if thou marry for beauty, thou bindest thyself all thy life for that which perchance will neither last nor please thee one year; and when thou hast it, it will be to thee of no price at all; for the desire dieth when it is attained, and the affection perisheth when it is satisfied.
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Raleigh

wisdom.quote: God can be realized through all paths. All religions are true. The important thing is to reach the roof. You can reach it by stone stairs or by wooden stairs or by bamboo steps or by a rope. You can also climb up by a bamboo pole.
wisdom.author: Ramakrishna

wisdom.quote: Life is not so important as the duties of life.
wisdom.author: John Randolph

wisdom.quote: The principle of liberty and equality, if coupled with mere selfishness, will make men only devils, each trying to be independent that he may fight only for his own interest. And here is the need of religion and its power, to bring in the principle of benevolence and love to men.
wisdom.author: John Randolph

wisdom.quote: Time is at once the most valuable and the most perishable of all our possessions.
wisdom.author: John Randolph

wisdom.quote: Design can be art. Design can be aesthetics. Design is so simple, that's why it is so complicated.
wisdom.author: Paul Rand, 1997

wisdom.quote: Simplicity is not the goal. It is the by-product of a good idea and modest expectations.
wisdom.author: Paul Rand, 1997

wisdom.quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.
wisdom.author: Jeannette Rankin

wisdom.quote: Most people believe that if you go in and try to micromanage a forest, it is possible to destroy the very thing that makes it a unique and special place. That's just as true of the Net.
wisdom.author: Glen Raphael

wisdom.quote: Hit the ball over the fence and you can take your time going around the bases.
wisdom.author: John W. Raper

wisdom.quote: A well-informed mind is the best security against the contagion of folly and of vice. The vacant mind is ever on the watch for relief, and ready to plunge into error, to escape from the languor of idleness.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: And since, in our passage through this world, painful circumstances occur more frequently than pleasing ones, and since our sense of evil is, I fear, more acute than our sense of good, we become the victims of our feelings, unless we can in some degree command them.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Employment is the surest antidote to sorrow.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Happiness arises in a state of peace, not of tumult.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: I never trust people's assertions, I always judge of them by their actions.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: I tasted too what was called the sweet of revenge - but it was transient, it expired even with the object, that provoked it.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: If the weak hand, that has recorded this tale, has, by its scenes, beguiled the mourner of one hour of sorrow, or, by its moral, taught him to sustain it - the effort, however humble, has not been vain, nor is the writer unrewarded.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: It is dismal coming home, when there is nobody to welcome one!
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: One act of beneficence, one act of real usefulness, is worth all the abstract sentiment in the world. Sentiment is a disgrace, instead of an ornament, unless it lead us to good actions.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Poverty cannot deprive us of many consolations. It cannot rob us of the affection we have for each other, or degrade us in our own opinion, of in that of any person, whose opinion we ought to value.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Such is the inconsistency of real love, that it is always awake to suspicion, however unreasonable; always requiring new assurances from the object of its interest.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: The passions are the seeds of vices as well as of virtues, from which either may spring, accordingly as they are nurtured. Unhappy they who have never been taught the art to govern them!
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: The refreshing pleasure from the first view of nature, after the pain of illness, and the confinement of a sick-chamber, is above the conceptions, as well as the descriptions, of those in health.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: The world ridicules a passion which it seldom feels; its scenes, and its interests, distract the mind, deprave the taste, corrupt the heart, and love cannot exist in a heart that has lost the meek dignity of innocence.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: There is some comfort in dying surrounded by one's children.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: There is some magic in wealth, which can thus make persons pay their court to it, when it does not even benefit themselves. How strange it is, that a fool or knave, with riches, should be treated with more respect by the world, than a good man, or a wise man in poverty!
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Though the vicious can sometimes pour affliction upon the good, their power is transient and their punishment certain; and that innocence, though oppressed by injustice, shall, supported by patience, finally triumph over misfortune!
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: Virtue and taste are nearly the same, for virtue is little more than active taste, and the most delicate affections of each combine in real love.
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: What are riches - grandeur - health itself, to the luxury of a pure conscience, the health of the soul; - and what the sufferings of poverty, disappointment, despair - to the anguish of an afflicted one!
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: What has a man's face to do with his character? Can a man of good character help having a disagreeable face?
wisdom.author: Ann Radcliffe, The Mysteries of Udolpho, 1764

wisdom.quote: I hate life, I hate death and everything in between just doesn't interest me.
wisdom.author: Chris Rapier

wisdom.quote: A tough lesson in life that one has to learn is that not everybody wishes you well.
wisdom.author: Dan Rather

wisdom.quote: Americans will put up with anything provided it doesn't block traffic.
wisdom.author: Dan Rather

wisdom.quote: An intellectual snob is someone who can listen to the William Tell Overture and not think of The Lone Ranger.
wisdom.author: Dan Rather

wisdom.quote: Your best shot at happiness, self-worth and personal satisfaction - the things that constitute real success - is not in earning as much as you can but in performing as well as you can something that you consider worthwhile.
wisdom.author: William Raspberry

wisdom.quote: And remember, no matter where you go, there you are.
wisdom.author: Earl Mac Rauch, from "Buckaroo Bansai"

wisdom.quote: Remember, no matter where you go, there you are.
wisdom.author: Earl Mac Rauch, from "Buckaroo Bansai"

wisdom.quote: Sorrow was like the wind. It came in gusts.
wisdom.author: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

wisdom.quote: Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand � and melting like a snowflake. Let us use it before it is too late.
wisdom.author: Marie Beyon Ray

wisdom.quote: We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand... and melting like a snowflake. Let us use it before it is too late.
wisdom.author: Marie Beyon Ray

wisdom.quote: Sometimes people are on the outside looking in because they don�t have any money. But sometimes people are on the outside looking in because they don�t have any class.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant blog, 09-12-06

wisdom.quote: Dating's like going on a job interview. You don't know if you'll get the job, but if you do, you get to see the interviewee naked.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 04-18-06

wisdom.quote: Angels dancing on the head of a pin dissolve into nothingness at the bedside of a dying child.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 06-21-05

wisdom.quote: Cocooned inside our private dramas we often don�t realize life is rolling by us like it should.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 08-29-06

wisdom.quote: The inability to secure a reservation drives yuppies absolutely crazy.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 09-07-05

wisdom.quote: We want God to come and save us. But he won�t. God doesn�t stop levees from failing, he doesn�t stay the force of tsunamis, and he doesn�t stop planes from smashing into buildings. Deus Ex Machina is overrated.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 09-09-05

wisdom.quote: But seduction isn�t making someone do what they don�t want to do. Seduction is enticing someone into doing what they secretly want to do already.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 11-29-05

wisdom.quote: Character is forged in the smallest of struggles. Then, when the big challenges come, we�re ready.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant weblog, 12-30-05

wisdom.quote: I once read cooking is something you do for your family. But when you�re alone you sometimes have to treat yourself like family. And now that my apartment�s redolent with the smell of food it feels more like a home than a box where I hang my hat.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant, 01-10-10

wisdom.quote: My mom grew up in Spanish Harlem and the Bronx and gave me an invaluable piece of advice for dealing with people in New York - if someone's bugging you just act crazy. I've modified her approach somewhat. Public displays of religiosity work just as well as feigning psychosis.
wisdom.author: Waiter Rant, Waiter Rant, 01-14-10

wisdom.quote: I hope that while so many people are out smelling the flowers, someone is taking the time to plant some.
wisdom.author: Herbert Rappaport

wisdom.quote: I believe that people would be alive today if there were a death penalty.
wisdom.author: Nancy Reagan

wisdom.quote: Facts have a cruel way of substituting themselves for fancies. There is nothing more remorseless, just as there is nothing more helpful, than truth.
wisdom.author: William C. Redfield, Address at Case School, Cleveland, Ohio, May 27, 1915

wisdom.quote: A man who doesn't trust himself can never truly trust anyone else.
wisdom.author: Cardinal de Retz, Memoires

wisdom.quote: Imagine if every Thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining.
wisdom.author: Jef Raskin, interviewed in Doctor Dobb's Journal

wisdom.quote: Either you decide to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out in the ocean.
wisdom.author: Christopher Reeve

wisdom.quote: I think a hero is an ordinary individual who finds strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
wisdom.author: Christopher Reeve

wisdom.quote: So many of our dreams at first seem impossible, then they seem improbable, and then, when we summon the will, they soon become inevitable.
wisdom.author: Christopher Reeve, From speech at Democratic National Convention, August 1996

wisdom.quote: We live in a time when the words impossible and unsolvable are no longer part of the scientific community's vocabulary. Each day we move closer to trials that will not just minimize the symptoms of disease and injury but eliminate them.
wisdom.author: Christopher Reeve, Testimony to US House of Representative, 1999

wisdom.quote: Good men must be affectionate men.
wisdom.author: Samuel Richardson

wisdom.quote: Never forget that you're a member of your own community. Don't do something that you wouldn't like to see done.
wisdom.author: Keith Richman, Building Buzz for Your Web Project, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Acting is not being emotional, but being able to express emotion.
wisdom.author: Kate Reid

wisdom.quote: A lot of people like snow. I find it to be an unnecessary freezing of water.
wisdom.author: Carl Reiner

wisdom.quote: Let him who desires peace prepare for war.
wisdom.author: Flavius Vegetius Renatus, De Rei Militari

wisdom.quote: The simplest schoolboy is now familiar with truths for which Archimedes would have sacrificed his life.
wisdom.author: Ernest Renan, Recollections of My Youth, 1883

wisdom.quote: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous patience.
wisdom.author: Hyman Rickover

wisdom.quote: It is bitter to lose a friend to evil, before one loses him to death.
wisdom.author: Mary Renault, The Praise Singer, 1978

wisdom.quote: He who comes first, eats first. [Familiar as: First come first served.]
wisdom.author: Eike von Repkow, Sachsenspiegel

wisdom.quote: Look at all the sentences which seem true and question them.
wisdom.author: David Reisman

wisdom.quote: A man can sleep around, no questions asked, but if a woman makes nineteen or twenty mistakes she's a tramp.
wisdom.author: Joan Rivers

wisdom.quote: The first time I see a jogger smiling, I'll consider it.
wisdom.author: Joan Rivers

wisdom.quote: Guilt is a rope that wears thin.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand

wisdom.quote: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand

wisdom.quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: to fight for your happiness.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand

wisdom.quote: Thanksgiving is a typically American holiday...The lavish meal is a symbol of the fact that abundant consumption is the result and reward of production.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand

wisdom.quote: The upper classes are... a nation's past; the middle class is its future.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand

wisdom.quote: I need no warrant for being, and no word of sanction upon my being. I am the warrant and the sanction.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Anthem, 1946

wisdom.quote: I swear by my life and my love of it that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

wisdom.quote: Pride is the recognition of the fact that you are your own highest value and, like all of man�s values, it has to be earned.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

wisdom.quote: Rationality is the recognition of the fact that nothing can alter the truth and nothing can take precedence over that act of perceiving it.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

wisdom.quote: That which you call your soul or spirit is your consciousness, and that which you call 'free will' is your mind's freedom to think or not, the only will you have, your only freedom, the choice that controls all the choices you make and determines your life and your character.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

wisdom.quote: Until and unless you discover that money is the root of all good, you ask for your own destruction. When money ceases to become the means by which men deal with one another, then men become the tools of other men. Blood, whips and guns--or dollars. Take your choice--there is no other.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

wisdom.quote: It is not advisable, James, to venture unsolicited opinions. You should spare yourself the embarrassing discovery of their exact value to your listener.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged, 1957

wisdom.quote: The evil of the world is made possible by nothing but the sanction you give it.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged, 1957

wisdom.quote: The spread of evil is the symptom of a vacuum. whenever evil wins, it is only by default: by the moral failure of those who evade the fact that there can be no compromise on basic principles.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, Capitalism: The Unknown Ideal, 1966

wisdom.quote: The Argument from Intimidation is a confession of intellectual impotence.
wisdom.author: Ayn Rand, The Virtue of Selfishness, 1964

wisdom.quote: Clearly, a civilization that feels guilty for everything it is and does will lack the energy and conviction to defend itself.
wisdom.author: Jean Francois Revel

wisdom.quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice; In practice, there is.
wisdom.author: Chuck Reid

wisdom.quote: Having a holiday weekend without a family member felt like putting on a sweater that had an extra arm.
wisdom.author: Pamela Ribon, Why Girls Are Weird, 2003

wisdom.quote: It's sad when our daddies die. Makes us one less person inside.
wisdom.author: Pamela Ribon, Why Girls Are Weird, 2003

wisdom.quote: When something that honest is said it usually needs a few minutes of silence to dissipate.
wisdom.author: Pamela Ribon, Why Girls Are Weird, 2003

wisdom.quote: When you live in Texas, every single time you see snow it�s magical.
wisdom.author: Pamela Ribon, Why Girls Are Weird, 2003

wisdom.quote: It is in his pleasure that a man really lives; it is from his leisure that he constructs the true fabric of self.
wisdom.author: Agnes Repplier

wisdom.quote: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves, and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
wisdom.author: Agnes Repplier

wisdom.quote: There are few nudities so objectionable as the naked truth.
wisdom.author: Agnes Repplier

wisdom.quote: We cannot really love anybody with whom we never laugh.
wisdom.author: Agnes Repplier, Americans and Others, 1912

wisdom.quote: For when the One Great Scorer comes To write against your name, He marks-not that you won or lost- But how you played the game.
wisdom.author: Grantland Rice, "Alumunus Football," Only the Brave and Other Poems, p. 144 (1941)

wisdom.quote: The true aim of everyone who aspires to be a teacher should be, not to impart his own opinions, but to kindle minds.
wisdom.author: Frederick William Robertson

wisdom.quote: This world is given as the prize for the men in earnest; and that which is true of this world, is truer still of the world to come.
wisdom.author: Frederick William Robertson

wisdom.quote: My one aim was to do a thing well and to excel if possible.
wisdom.author: Josephine demott Robinson, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: If you want change, you have to make it. If we want progress we have to drive it.
wisdom.author: Susan Rice, Stanford University  Commencement, 2010
