wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell, Unpopular Essays (1950), "Outline of Intellectual Rubbish"

wisdom.quote: Man is a credulous animal, and must believe something; in the absence of good grounds for belief, he will be satisfied with bad ones.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell, Unpopular Essays (1950), "Outline of Intellectual Rubbish"

wisdom.quote: No one gossips about other people's secret virtues.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Our great democracies still tend to think that a stupid man is more likely to be honest than a clever man.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Passive acceptance of the teacher's wisdom is easy to most boys and girls. It involves no effort of independent thought, and seems rational because the teacher knows more than his pupils; it is moreover the way to win the favour of the teacher unless he is a very exceptional man. Yet the habit of passive acceptance is a disastrous one in later life. It causes man to seek and to accept a leader, and to accept as a leader whoever is established in that position.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Patriotism is the willingness to kill and be killed for trivial reasons.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Patriots always talk of dying for their country but never of killing for their country.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Science may set limits to knowledge, but should not set limits to imagination.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: So far as I can remember, there is not one word in the Gospels in praise of intelligence.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The good life, as I conceive it, is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy - I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The greatest challenge to any thinker is stating the problem in a way that will allow a solution.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The main things which seem to me important on their own account, and not merely as means to other things, are knowledge, art, instinctive happiness, and relations of friendship or affection.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The most savage controversies are those about matters as to which there is no good evidence either way.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The people who are regarded as moral luminaries are those who forego ordinary pleasures themselves and find compensation in interfering with the pleasures of others.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The place of the father in the modern suburban family is a very small one, particularly if he plays golf.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The true spirit of delight, the exaltation, the sense of being more than Man, which is the touchstone of the highest excellence, is to be found in mathematics as surely as in poetry.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The universe may have a purpose, but nothing we know suggests that, if so, this purpose has any similarity to ours.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so good for an ignorant man as silence; and if he was sensible of this he would not be ignorant.
wisdom.author: Saadi

wisdom.quote: O wise man, wash your hands of that friend who associates with your enemies.
wisdom.author: Saadi

wisdom.quote: Reveal not every secret you have to a friend, for how can you tell but that friend may hereafter become an enemy. And bring not all mischief you are able to upon an enemy, for he may one day become your friend.
wisdom.author: Saadi

wisdom.quote: Roam abroad in the world, and take thy fill of its enjoyments before the day shall come when thou must quit it for good.
wisdom.author: Saadi

wisdom.quote: Whatever is produced in haste goes hastily to waste.
wisdom.author: Saadi

wisdom.quote: Every little girl knows about love. It is only her capacity to suffer because of it that increases.
wisdom.author: Francoise Sagan

wisdom.quote: It is healthier to see the good points of others than to analyze our own bad ones.
wisdom.author: Francoise Sagan

wisdom.quote: I was brought up to believe that how I saw myself was more important than how others saw me.
wisdom.author: Anwar el-Sadat

wisdom.quote: Is sloppiness in speech caused by ignorance or apathy? I don't know and I don't care.
wisdom.author: William Safire

wisdom.quote: Do not measure your loss by itself; if you do, it will seem intolerable; but if you will take all human affairs into account you will find that some comfort is to be derived from them.
wisdom.author: Saint Basil

wisdom.quote: When you are at Rome live in the Roman style; when you are elsewhere live as they live elsewhere.
wisdom.author: Saint Ambrose, Taylor

wisdom.quote: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: All of the books in the world contain no more information than is broadcast as video in a single large American city in a single year. Not all bits have equal value.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: I maintain there is much more wonder in science than in pseudoscience. And in addition, to whatever measure this term has any meaning, science has the additional virtue, and it is not an inconsiderable one, of being true.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: If we long to believe that the stars rise and set for us, that we are the reason there is a Universe, does science do us a disservice in deflating our conceits?
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: If you want to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first create the universe.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: In every country, we should be teaching our children the scientific method and the reasons for a Bill of Rights. With it comes a certain decency, humility and community spirit. In the demon-haunted world that we inhabit by virtue of being human, this may be all that stands between us and the enveloping darkness.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: It is of interest to note that while some dolphins are reported to have learned English -- up to fifty words used in correct context -- no human being has been reported to have learned dolphinese.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep insights can be winnowed from deep nonsense.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: When you make the finding yourself - even if you're the last person on Earth to see the light - you'll never forget it.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan, "Contact"

wisdom.quote: In science it often happens that scientists say, 'You know that's a really good argument; my position is mistaken,' and then they would actually change their minds and you never hear that old view from them again. They really do it. It doesn't happen as often as it should, because scientists are human and change is sometimes painful. But it happens every day. I cannot recall the last time someting like that happened in politics or religion.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan, 1987 CSICOP Keynote Address

wisdom.quote: Where we have strong emotions, we're liable to fool ourselves.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan, Cosmos (Blues for a Red Planet)

wisdom.quote: You will find something more in woods than in books. Trees and stones will teach you that which you can never learn from masters.
wisdom.author: Saint Bernard, Epistle

wisdom.quote: There are more tears shed over answered prayers than over unanswered prayers.
wisdom.author: Saint Theresa of Jesus

wisdom.quote: No one can harm the man who does himself no wrong.
wisdom.author: Saint John Chrysostom, Letter to Olympia

wisdom.quote: I am a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.
wisdom.author: J. D. Salinger

wisdom.quote: It's really too bad a lot of crumby stuff is a lot of fun sometimes.
wisdom.author: J. D. Salinger, Catcher In the Rye

wisdom.quote: If you really want to hear about it, the first thing you'll probably want to know is where I was born, and what my lousy childhood was like, and how my parents were occupied and all before they had me, and all that David Copperfield kind of crap, but I don't feel like going into it, if you want to know the truth.
wisdom.author: J. D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye, opening line

wisdom.quote: Conscience and reputation are two things. Conscience is due to yourself, reputation to your neighbour.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: Hear the other side. (Audi Partem Alteram)
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: The argument is at an end.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: You (God) have not only commanded continence, that is, from what things we are to restrain our love, but also justice, that is, on what we are to bestow our love.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine

wisdom.quote: I was in love with loving.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine, Confessions

wisdom.quote: Unless you believe, you will not understand.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine, De Libero Arbitrio

wisdom.quote: Total abstinence is easier than perfect moderation.
wisdom.author: Saint Augustine, On the Good of Marriage, c. 401 AD

wisdom.quote: When in doubt, do without.
wisdom.author: Hofni Samuel

wisdom.quote: Simplicity is the peak of civilization.
wisdom.author: Jessie Sampter

wisdom.quote: The more freedom we enjoy, the greater the responsibility we bear, toward others as well as ourselves.
wisdom.author: Oscar Arias Sanchez

wisdom.quote: A human being must have occupation if he or she is not to become a nuisance to the world.
wisdom.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

wisdom.quote: The worst sin - perhaps the only sin - passion can commit, is to be joyless.
wisdom.author: Dorothy L. Sayers, Gaudy Night

wisdom.quote: A facility for quotation covers the absence of original thought.
wisdom.author: Dorothy L. Sayers, Lord Peter Wimsey in "Gaudy Night"

wisdom.quote: Books...are like lobster shells, we surround ourselves with 'em, then we grow out of 'em and leave 'em behind, as evidence of our earlier stages of development.
wisdom.author: Dorothy L. Sayers, The Unpleasantness at the Bellona Club, 1928

wisdom.quote: Everyone should carefully observe which way his heart draws him, and then choose that way with all his strength.
wisdom.author: Hasidic Saying

wisdom.quote: The man who has confidence in himself gains the confidence of others.
wisdom.author: Hasidic Saying

wisdom.quote: All marriages are mixed marriages.
wisdom.author: Chantal Saperstein

wisdom.quote: Peace has never come from dropping bombs. Real peace comes from enlightenment and educating people to behave more in a divine manner.
wisdom.author: Carlos Santana, Associated Press interview, September 1, 2004

wisdom.quote: I think it's about time we voted for senators with breasts. After all, we've been voting for boobs long enough.
wisdom.author: Claire Sargent, on women candidates, The World Almanac and Book of Facts, 1993

wisdom.quote: Make sure you have finished speaking before your audience has finished listening.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Sarnoff

wisdom.quote: If you had to define stress, it would not be far off if you said it was the process of living. The process of living is the process of having stress imposed on you and reacting to it.
wisdom.author: Stanley J. Sarnoff, Man Under Stress, 1963

wisdom.quote: Sure, winning isn't everything. It's the only thing.
wisdom.author: Henry Sanders, in Sports Illustrated, Dec. 26, 1955

wisdom.quote: A house that does not have one worn, comfy chair in it is soulless.
wisdom.author: May Sarton

wisdom.quote: There is only one real deprivation, I decided this morning, and that is not to be able to give one's gifts to those one loves most.
wisdom.author: May Sarton

wisdom.quote: We are able to laugh when we achieve detachment, if only for a moment.
wisdom.author: May Sarton

wisdom.quote: The minute one utters a certainty, the opposite comes to mind.
wisdom.author: May Sarton, Mrs. Stevens Hears the Mermaids Singing, 1965

wisdom.quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
wisdom.author: John Singer Sargent, quoted in Bentley and Esar, Treasury of Humorous Quotations (1951)

wisdom.quote: Addresses are given to us to conceal our whereabouts.
wisdom.author: Saki

wisdom.quote: He is one of those people who would be enormously improved by death.
wisdom.author: Saki

wisdom.quote: He's simply got the instinct for being unhappy highly developed.
wisdom.author: Saki

wisdom.quote: The young have aspirations that never come to pass, the old have reminiscences of what never happened.
wisdom.author: Saki

wisdom.quote: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
wisdom.author: Saki, "The Square Egg", 1924

wisdom.quote: Man is only miserable so far as he thinks himself so.
wisdom.author: Jacopo Sannazaro

wisdom.quote: The idea of selling out is not so much a dollar amount, but are you sacrificing the service to the customers. You have to ask yourself, 'Are you betraying your users?'
wisdom.author: Jesse Sanchez, Cashing In or Selling Out, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: The only place where success comes before work is a dictionary.
wisdom.author: Vidal Sassoon

wisdom.quote: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure.
wisdom.author: William Saroyan

wisdom.quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
wisdom.author: William Saroyan

wisdom.quote: Have patience with all things, but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections but instantly set about remedying them - every day begin the task anew.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: If we say a little it is easy to add, but having said too much it is hard to withdraw and never can it be done so quickly as to hinder the harm of our success.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more like a wise man than a fool who holds his tongue.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: Nothing is so strong as gentleness. Nothing so gentle as real strength.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: There is nothing as strong as tenderness, And nothing as tender as true strength.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: When you encounter difficulties and contradictions, do not try to break them, but bend them with gentleness and time.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis de Sales

wisdom.quote: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis of Assisi

wisdom.quote: It is no use walking anywhere to preach unless our walking is our preaching.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis Of Assisi

wisdom.quote: Where there is hatred, let me sow love. Where there is injury, pardon. Where there is doubt, faith.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis of Assisi

wisdom.quote: Lord, make me an instrument of Your peace! Where there is hatred let me sow love; Where there is injury, pardon; Where there is doubt, faith; Where there is despair, hope; Where there is darkness, light; Where there is sadness, joy.
wisdom.author: Saint Francis of Assisi, "Prayer of St Francis" (attributed)

wisdom.quote: It is worse still to be ignorant of your ignorance.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome

wisdom.quote: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome

wisdom.quote: A fat paunch never breeds fine thoughts.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: An unstable pilot steers a leaking ship, and the blind is leading the blind straight to the pit. The ruler is like the ruled.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: Do not let your deeds belie your words, lest when you speak in church someone may say to himself, 'Why do you not practice what you preach?'
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: No athlete is crowned but in the sweat of his brow.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: The fact is that my native land is a prey to barbarism, that in it men's only God is their belly, that they live only for the present, and that the richer a man is the holier he is held to be.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: The scars of others should teach us caution.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: When the stomach is full, it is easy to talk of fasting.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter

wisdom.quote: The line, often adopted by strong men in controversy, of justifying the means by the end.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, Letter 48

wisdom.quote: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
wisdom.author: Saint Jerome, On the Epistle to the Ephesians

wisdom.quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
wisdom.author: Rabbinical Saying

wisdom.quote: Hiring has been a gradual process. We only hire someone when we really need them. It takes a while to get people up to speed. Our rule of thumb is to only hire when absolutely necessary.
wisdom.author: Cabel Sasser, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Make software that you want to use and that you would want to use often. As long as you are making something that you want to use, then your heart will be in it.
wisdom.author: Cabel Sasser, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

wisdom.quote: Anyone who truly loves God travels securely.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

wisdom.quote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

wisdom.quote: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

wisdom.quote: I do not fear Satan half so much as I fear those who fear him.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

wisdom.quote: To reach something good it is very useful to have gone astray, and thus acquire experience.
wisdom.author: Saint Teresa Of Avila

wisdom.quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: He who would travel happily must travel light.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: Language is the source of misunderstandings.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: One man may hit the mark, another blunder; but heed not these distinctions. Only from the alliance of the one, working with and through the other, are great things born.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step. It is always the same step, but you have to take it.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: You become responsible forever, for what you have tamed.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

wisdom.quote: If someone wants a sheep, then that means that he exists.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery, "The Little Prince"

wisdom.quote: Grown-ups never understand anything for themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery, "The Little Prince", 1943

wisdom.quote: If I were to command a general to turn into a seagull, and if the general did not obey, that would not be the general's fault. It would be mine
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup�ry, The Little Prince

wisdom.quote: It is only with one's heart that one can see clearly. What is essential is invisible to the eye.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup�ry, The Little Prince

wisdom.quote: That is the hardest thing of all. It is much harder to judge yourself than to judge others. If you succeed in judging yourself, it's because you're truly a wise man.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup�ry, The Little Prince

wisdom.quote: You risk tears if you let yourself be tamed.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup�ry, The Little Prince

wisdom.quote: Beware the man of one book.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

wisdom.quote: He who is dying of hunger must be fed rather than taught.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

wisdom.quote: Not everything that is more difficult is more meritorious.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

wisdom.quote: Perfection of moral virtue does not wholly take away the passions, but regulates them.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

wisdom.quote: ...the goodness of the will depends on the intention of the end.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologica

wisdom.quote: Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do.
wisdom.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas, Two Precepts of Charity

wisdom.quote: There is�nothing to suggest that mothering cannot be shared by several people.
wisdom.author: H. R. Schaffer, O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: In your clothes avoid too much gaudiness; do not value yourself upon an embroidered gown; and remember that a reasonable word, or an obliging look, will gain you more respect than all your fine trappings.
wisdom.author: Sir George Savile, 'Advice to a Daughter,' 1688

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the laughter in mothering is the recognition of the ironies and absurdities. Sometime, though, it's just pure, unthinking delight.
wisdom.author: Barbara Schapiro, O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
wisdom.author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

wisdom.quote: The reward for doing right is mostly an internal phenomenon: self-respect, dignity, integrity, and self- esteem.
wisdom.author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

wisdom.quote: Peace is when time doesn't matter as it passes by.
wisdom.author: Maria Schell

wisdom.quote: Life is like an ever-shifting kaleidoscope - a slight change, and all patterns alter.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg

wisdom.quote: Any ordinary favor we do for someone or any compassionate reaching out may seem to be going nowhere at first, but may be planting a seed we can't see right now. Sometimes we need to just do the best we can and then trust in an unfolding we can't design or ordain.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: By prizing heartfulness above faultlessness, we may reap more from our effort because we're more likely to be changed by it.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Each decision we make, each action we take, is born out of an intention.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: If we fall, we don't need self-recrimination or blame or anger - we need a reawakening of our intention and a willingness to recommit, to be whole-hearted once again.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Often we can achieve an even better result when we stumble yet are willing to start over, when we don't give up after a mistake, when something doesn't come easily but we throw ourselves into trying, when we're not afraid to appear less than perfectly polished.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: We learn and grow and are transformed not so much by what we do but by why and how we do it.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg, O Magazine, The Power of Intention, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Self-reliance is the only road to true freedom, and being one's own person is its ultimate reward.
wisdom.author: Patricia Sampson

wisdom.quote: The notes I handle no better than many pianists. But the pauses between the notes--ah, that is where the art resides!
wisdom.author: Arthur Schnabel, in Chicago Daily News, June 11 1958

wisdom.quote: When I am asked, "What do you think of our audience?" I answer, "I know two kinds of audiences only--one coughing, and one not coughing."
wisdom.author: Arthur Schnabel, My Life and Music (1961)

wisdom.quote: Good-bye. I am leaving because I am bored.
wisdom.author: George Saunders, last words

wisdom.quote: The traveller must, of course, always be cautious of the overly broad generalisation. But I am an American, and a paucity of data does not stop me from making sweeping, vague, conceptual statements and, if necessary, following these statements up with troops.
wisdom.author: George Saunders, The Guardian (UK) July 22, 2006

wisdom.quote: A baby is God's opinion that the world should go on.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg

wisdom.quote: I see America, not in the setting sun of a black night of despair ahead of us, I see America in the crimson light of a rising sun fresh from the burning, creative hand of God. I see great days ahead, great days possible to men and women of will and vision.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg

wisdom.quote: I won't take my religion from any man who never works except with his mouth.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg

wisdom.quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg

wisdom.quote: The fog comes on little cat feet. It sits looking over harbor and city on silent haunches and then moves on.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg, Chicago Poems (1916) "Fog"

wisdom.quote: I tell you the past is a bucket of ashes.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg, Cornhuskers (1918) "Prairie"

wisdom.quote: I'm an idealist. I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg, Incidentals (1907)

wisdom.quote: Slang is a language that rolls up its sleeves, spits on its hands and goes to work.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg, New York Times Feb. 13, 1959

wisdom.quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
wisdom.author: Carl Sandburg, The People, Yes (1936)

wisdom.quote: Happy or unhappy, families are all mysterious.
wisdom.author: Gloria Steinem

wisdom.quote: I've yet to be on a campus where most women weren't worrying about some aspect of combining marriage, children, and a career. I've yet to find one where many men were worrying about the same thing.
wisdom.author: Gloria Steinem

wisdom.quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
wisdom.author: Gloria Steinem, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Each individual woman's body demands to be accepted on its own terms.
wisdom.author: Gloria Steinem, O Magazine, May 2004

wisdom.quote: Evil is obvious only in retrospect.
wisdom.author: Gloria Steinem, Outrageous Acts and Everyday Rebellions, 1983

wisdom.quote: You never really hear the truth from your subordinates until after 10 in the evening.
wisdom.author: Jurgen Schrempp, Former CEO of DaimlerChrysler

wisdom.quote: The chief lesson I have learned in a long life is that the only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him; and the surest way to make him untrustworthy is to distrust him and show your distrust.
wisdom.author: Henry L. Stimson

wisdom.quote: A man is morally free when, in full possession of his living humanity, he judges the world, and judges other men, with uncompromising sincerity.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: A man's feet should be planted in his country, but his eyes should survey the world.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Advertising is the modern substitute for argument; its function is to make the worse appear the better.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: America is a young country with an old mentality.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Before he sets out, the traveler must possess fixed interests and facilities to be served by travel.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Before you contradict an old man, my fair friend, you should endeavor to understand him.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Character is the basis of happiness and happiness the sanction of character.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: If one is the master of one thing and understands one thing well, one has at the same time insight into and understanding of many things.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Life is not a spectacle or a feast: it is a predicament.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: People are usually more firmly convinced that their opinions are precious that that they are true.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Repetition is the only form of permanence that nature can achieve.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Sanity is a madness put to good use.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Science is nothing but developed perception, interpreted intent, common sense rounded out and minutely articulated.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Skepticism, like chastity, should not be relinquished too readily.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: The body is an instrument, the mind its function, the witness and reward of its operation.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: The truth is cruel, but it can be loved and it makes free those who love it.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: The wisest mind has something yet to learn.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Those who speak most of progress measure it by quantity and not by quality.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: To be interested in the changing seasons is a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: A diplomat... is a person who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you actually look forward to the trip.
wisdom.author: Caskie Stinnett, Out of the Red (1960)

wisdom.quote: A lot of people approach risk as if it's the enemy when it's really fortune's accomplice.
wisdom.author: Sting

wisdom.quote: Why not go out on a limb? Isn't that where the fruit is?
wisdom.author: Frank Scully

wisdom.quote: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
wisdom.author: Erich Segal

wisdom.quote: Love means not ever having to say you're sorry.
wisdom.author: Erich Segal, Love Story (1970)

wisdom.quote: Every decision has a cost. Do I have to make this decision at all or can I move on to the next thing? What we decided to leave out is almost as important as what we put in.
wisdom.author: Joshua Schachter, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: We did a variant of the intern thing. We hired people as consultants for a specific thing and then if they were good, offered them a job.
wisdom.author: Joshua Schachter, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: A bookstore is one of the only pieces of evidence we have that people are still thinking.
wisdom.author: Jerry Seinfeld

wisdom.quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
wisdom.author: Jerry Seinfeld

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing as "fun for the whole family."
wisdom.author: Jerry Seinfeld

wisdom.quote: Where lipstick is concerned, the important thing is not color, but to accept God's final word on where your lips end.
wisdom.author: Jerry Seinfeld

wisdom.quote: We begin to see that the completion of an important project has every right to be dignified by a natural grieving process. Something that required the best of you has ended. You will miss it.
wisdom.author: Anne Wilson Schaef

wisdom.quote: Ignorance of the law excuses no man: Not that all men know the law, but because 'tis an excuse every man will plead, and no man can tell how to refute him.
wisdom.author: John Selden

wisdom.quote: I haven't the slightest idea how to change people, but I still keep a long list of prospective candidates just in case I should ever figure it out.
wisdom.author: David Sedaris

wisdom.quote: At first, writing for The New Yorker was very scary to me. I couldn't imagine anything that I would write in that typeface.
wisdom.author: David Sedaris, interview in Louisville Courier-Journal, June 5, 2005

wisdom.quote: Writing gives you the illusion of control, and then you realize it's just an illusion, that people are going to bring their own stuff into it.
wisdom.author: David Sedaris, interview in Louisville Courier-Journal, June 5, 2005

wisdom.quote: Keep cool and you command everybody.
wisdom.author: Louis de Saint-Just

wisdom.quote: World only has two things: Things you can eat and things you can no eat.
wisdom.author: Hironobu Sakaguchi, Final Fantasy IX

wisdom.quote: Isn't everyone a part of everyone else?
wisdom.author: Budd Schulberg, O Magazine, November 2003

wisdom.quote: You don't understand. I could have had class.  I could have been a contender.
wisdom.author: Budd Schulberg, On the Waterfront (film, 1954)

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more despicable than a professional talker who uses his words as a quack uses his remedies.
wisdom.author: Francois de Salignac

wisdom.quote: For several years more I maintained public relations with the Almighty. But privately, I ceased to associate with him.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: In love, one and one are one.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: Man is condemned to be free.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: Once freedom lights is beacon in a man's heart, the gods are powerless against him.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: To believe is to know you believe, and to know you believe is not to believe.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: We do not know what we want and yet we are responsible for what we are - that is the fact.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

wisdom.quote: Every man is condemned to freedom.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Being and Nothingness (1943)

wisdom.quote: Existence precedes and rules essence.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Being and Nothingness (1943)

wisdom.quote: Hell is other people.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Closed Doors (1944)

wisdom.quote: Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Nausea (1938) "Vendredi"

wisdom.quote: One always dies too soon--or too late. And yet one's whole life is complete at that moment, with a line drawn neatly under it, ready for the summing up. You are--your life, and nothing else.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, No Exit

wisdom.quote: When the rich wage war it's the poor who die.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, The Devil and the Good Lord (1951) act 1

wisdom.quote: A writer must refuse to allow himself to be transformed into an institution.
wisdom.author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Upon refusing the Nobel Prize, Oct. 22, 1964

wisdom.quote: I grow more intense as I age.
wisdom.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell, O Magazine, October 2003

wisdom.quote: You need only claim the event of your life to make yourself yours. When you truly possess all you have been and done, which may take some time, you are fierce with reality.
wisdom.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell, Oprah Magazine, May 2004

wisdom.quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius -- and a lot of courage -- to move in the opposite direction.
wisdom.author: E. F. Schumacher

wisdom.quote: He that climbs the tall tree has won right to the fruit.
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Scott

wisdom.quote: O! many a shaft, at random sent, Finds mark the archer little meant; And many a word, at random spoken, May soothe or wound a heart that's broken!
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Scott

wisdom.quote: To all, to each, a fair good night, And pleasing dreams, and slumbers light.
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Scott

wisdom.quote: And come he slow, or come he fast, It is but death who comes at last.
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Scott, Marmion (1808)

wisdom.quote: Oh what a tangled web we weave, When first we practise to deceive!
wisdom.author: Sir Walter Scott, Marmion, Canto vi. Stanza 17.

wisdom.quote: It is through creating, not possessing, that life is revealed.
wisdom.author: Vida D. Scudder

wisdom.quote: First Rule of Collaboration: If you can�t link to it, it didn�t happen.
wisdom.author: Joseph Scott, Joseph Scott Blog, 01-18-10

wisdom.quote: General principles should not be based on exceptional cases.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: Honor does not have to be defended.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: How do you define God? Like this. A God I could understand, at least potentially, was infinitely more interesting and relevant than one that defied comprehension.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: Not wanting to die was another universal constant, it seemed.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: The right things to do are those that keep our violence in abeyance; the wrong things are those that bring it to the fore.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: You can't choose the ways in which you'll be tested.
wisdom.author: Robert J. Sawyer, "Calculating God", 2000

wisdom.quote: Criminal: A person with predatory instincts who has not sufficient capital to form a corporation.
wisdom.author: Howard Scott

wisdom.quote: My feeling is that there is nothing in life but refraining from hurting others, and comforting those who are sad.
wisdom.author: Olive Schreiner

wisdom.quote: We bear the world and we make it... There was never a great man who had not a great mother - it is hardly an exaggeration.
wisdom.author: Olive Schreiner

wisdom.quote: You can't help someone get up a hill without getting closer to the top yourself.
wisdom.author: H. Norman Schwarzkopf

wisdom.quote: It's amazing how pervasive food is. Every second commercial is for food. Every second TV episode takes place around a meal. In the city, you can't go ten feet without seeing or smelling a restaurant. There are 20 foot high hamburgers up on billboards. I am acutely aware of food, and its omnipresence is astounding.
wisdom.author: Adam Scott, The Monkey Chow Diaries, June 2006

wisdom.quote: We play the hands of cards life gives us. And the worst hands can make us the best players.
wisdom.author: Doc Searls, Doc Searls Weblog, 12-02-06

wisdom.quote: The world loves to be deceived.
wisdom.author: Franck Sebastian

wisdom.quote: The human brain is a most unusual instrument of elegant and as yet unknown capacity.
wisdom.author: Stuart Seaton

wisdom.quote: We inhereit from our ancestors gifts so often taken for granted... Each of us contains within... this inheritance of soul. We are links between the ages, containing past and present expectations, sacred memories and future promise.
wisdom.author: Edward Sellner

wisdom.quote: Education is when you read the fine print. Experience is what you get if you don't.
wisdom.author: Pete Seeger

wisdom.quote: For four-fifths of our history, our planet was populated by pond scum.
wisdom.author: J. W. Schopf

wisdom.quote: If winter comes, can spring be far behind?
wisdom.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

wisdom.quote: Poetry is the record of the best and happiest moments of the happiest and best minds.
wisdom.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

wisdom.quote: There is a harmony In autumn, and a lustre in its sky, Which through the summer is not heard or seen, As if it could not be, as if it had not been!
wisdom.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

wisdom.quote: War is the statesman's game, the priest's delight, the lawyer's jest, the hired assassin's trade.
wisdom.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

wisdom.quote: A raise is like a martini: it elevates the spirit, but only temporarily.
wisdom.author: Dan Seligman, in 'Forbes Magazine'

wisdom.quote: What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?
wisdom.author: Dr. Robert Schuller

wisdom.quote: For every person who wants to teach there are approximately thirty people who don't want to learn--much.
wisdom.author: W. C. Sellar and R. J. Yeatman, And Now All This (1932) introduction

wisdom.quote: Do not read beauty magazines.  They only make you feel ugly.
wisdom.author: Mary Schmich

wisdom.quote: Promote yourself, but do not demote another.
wisdom.author: Israel Salanter

wisdom.quote: If you would not step into the harlot's house, do not go by the harlot's door.
wisdom.author: Thomas Secker

wisdom.quote: If you believe the doctors, nothing is wholesome; if you believe the theologians, nothing is innocent; if you believe the military, nothing is safe.
wisdom.author: Lord Salisbury

wisdom.quote: I am never afraid of what I know.
wisdom.author: Anna Sewell

wisdom.quote: We call them dumb animals, and so they are, for they cannot tell us how they feel, but they do not suffer less because they have no words.
wisdom.author: Anna Sewell, Black Beauty, 1877

wisdom.quote: If you're here for four more years or four more weeks, you're here right now. I think when you're somewhere, you ought to be there. It's not about how long you stay in a place, it's about what you do while you're there, and when you go, is that place any better for your having been there?
wisdom.author: Karen Hall and Jerry Stahl, Northern Exposure, Soapy Sanderson, 1990

wisdom.quote: A chess genius is a human being who focuses vast, little-understood mental gifts and labors on an ultimately trivial human enterprise.
wisdom.author: George Steiner

wisdom.quote: Some people think football is a matter of life and death. I don't like that attitude. I can assure them it is much more serious than that.
wisdom.author: Bill Shankly, In Sunday Times (UK) Oct. 4 1981

wisdom.quote: The best way to escape from a problem is to solve it.
wisdom.author: Alan Saporta

wisdom.quote: It is difficult to produce a television documentary that is both incisive and probing when every twelve minutes one is interrupted by twelve dancing rabbits singing about toilet paper.
wisdom.author: Rod Serling

wisdom.quote: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.
wisdom.author: Diana Spencer

wisdom.quote: Finance is the art of passing money from hand to hand until it finally disappears.
wisdom.author: Robert W. Sarnoff

wisdom.quote: Working in the garden...gives me a profound feeling of inner peace.
wisdom.author: Ruth Stout

wisdom.quote: A man should not leave this earth with unfinished business. He should live each day as if it was a pre-flight check. He should ask each morning, am I prepared to lift-off?
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, All is Vanity, 1991

wisdom.quote: If you were in a burning house and there was a cat and a Rembrandt, what would you save? The cat...you would save the cat, because the cat is alive. The art is dead. It's just paint on a canvas, ink on a page. To live for art is to deny life. It's just to destroy life.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: Men are confused. They're conflicted. They want a woman who's their intellectual equal, but they're afraid of women like that. They want a woman they can dominate, but then they hate her for being weak. It's an ambivalence that goes back to a man's relationship with his mother. Source of his life, center of his universe, object of both his fear and his love.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: One person can have a profound effect on another. And two people...well, two people can work miracles. They can change a whole town. They can change the world.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: There is nothing sadder in this world than the waste of human potential. The purpose of evolution is to raise us out of the mud, not have us grovelling in it.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: We hold in our hands, the most precious gift of all: Freedom. The freedom to express our art. Our love. The freedom to be who we want to be. We are not going to give that freedom away and no one shall take it from us!
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: You bluffed me! I don't like it when people bluff me. It makes me question my perception of reality.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Cicely, 1992

wisdom.quote: I am going to concentrate on what's important in life. I'm going to strive everyday to be a kind and generous and loving person. I'm going to keep death right here, so that anytime I even think about getting angry at you or anybody else, I'll see death and I'll remember.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Do The Right Thing, 1992

wisdom.quote: People are simply incapable of prolonged, sustained goodness.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Do The Right Thing, 1992

wisdom.quote: By mid-November I always like to have an extra 15 pounds on me.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, First Snow, 1993

wisdom.quote: Death is the enemy. I spent 10 years of my life singlemindedly studying, practicing, fighting hand to hand in close quarters to defeat the enemy, to send him back bloodied and humble and I am not going to roll over and surrender.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, First Snow, 1993

wisdom.quote: There's a lot to be said for self-delusionment when it comes to matters of the heart.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, First Snow, 1993

wisdom.quote: Well, you're either lovers or you're wanting to be lovers or you're trying not to be lovers so you can be friends, but any way you look at it, sex is always looming in the picture like a shadow, like an undertow.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Get Real, 1991

wisdom.quote: It's no accident that the church and the graveyard stand side by side. The city of the dead sleeps encircled by the city of the living.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Lost and Found, 1992

wisdom.quote: Time for the weather report. It's cold out folks. Bonecrushing cold. The kind of cold which will wrench the spirit out of a young man, or forge it into steel.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Lost and Found, 1992

wisdom.quote: It's just human. We all have the jungle inside of us. We all have wants and needs and desires, strange as they may seem. If you stop to think about it, we're all pretty creative, cooking up all these fantasies. it's like a kind of poetry.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Mister Sandman, 1994

wisdom.quote: But then there's a moment like tonight, a profound and transcendent experience, the feeling as if a door has opened, and it's all because of that instrument, that incredible, magical instrument.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Mite Makes Right, 1994

wisdom.quote: There were always people like the pope. They serve a certain function, of course. They subsidize us. But, they don't create anything and they must never be allowed to stop the artist from creating.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Mite Makes Right, 1994

wisdom.quote: A person has three choices in life. You can swim against the tide and get exhausted, or you can tread water and let the tide sweep you away, or you can swim with the tide, and let it take you where it wants you to go.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Northern Lights, 1993

wisdom.quote: I guess what I'm trying to say is, I don't think you can measure life in terms of years. I think longevity doesn't necessarily have anything to do with happiness. I mean happiness comes from facing challenges and going out on a limb and taking risks. If you're not willing to take a risk for something you really care about, you might as well be dead.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Northern Lights, 1993

wisdom.quote: To knock a thing down, especially if it is cocked at an arrogant angle, is a deep delight of the blood.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: What others think of us would be of little moment did it not, when known, so deeply tinge what we think of ourselves.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Why shouldn't things be largely absurd, futile, and transitory? They are so, and we are so, and they and we go very well together.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.quote: Our character...is an omen of our destiny, and the more integrity we have and keep, the simpler and nobler that destiny is likely to be.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, "The German Mind: A Philosophical Diagnosis"

wisdom.quote: The young man who has not wept is a savage, and the old man who will not laugh is a fool.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Dialogues in Limbo (1925) ch. 3

wisdom.quote: Happiness is the only sanction of life; where happiness fails, existence remains a mad and lamentable experiment.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 1, ch. 10

wisdom.quote: Fanaticism consists in redoubling your effort when you have forgotten your aim.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 1, Introduction

wisdom.quote: An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 4, ch. 3

wisdom.quote: Music is essentially useless, as life is.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 4, ch. 4

wisdom.quote: Music is essentially useless, as life is: but both have an ideal extension which lends utility to its conditions.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 4, ch. 4

wisdom.quote: Nothing is really so poor and melancholy as art that is interested in itself and not in its subject.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Life of Reason (1905) vol. 4, ch. 8

wisdom.quote: The truth is cruel, but it can be loved, and it makes free those who have loved it.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Little Essays (1920) "Ideal Immortality"

wisdom.quote: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Soliloquies in England, 1922, "War Shrines"

wisdom.quote: Progress, far from consisting in change, depends on retentiveness. When change is absolute there remains no being to improve and no direction is set for possible improvement: and when experience is not retained, as among savages, infancy is perpetual. Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it. In the first stage of life the mind is frivolous and easily distracted, it misses progress by failing in consecutiveness and persistence. This is the condition of children and barbarians, in which instinct has learned nothing from experience.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, The Life of Reason, Volume 1, 1905

wisdom.quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, The Life of Reason, Volume 1, 1905

wisdom.quote: For an idea ever to be fashionable is ominous, since it must afterwards be always old-fashioned.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Winds of Doctrine (1913) ch. 2

wisdom.quote: Intolerance itself is a form of egoism, and to condemn egoism intolerantly is to share it.
wisdom.author: George Santayana, Winds of Doctrine (1913) ch. 4

wisdom.quote: I didn't mind getting old when I was young. It's the being old now that's getting to me.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: If the universe is bigger and stranger than I can imagine, it's best to meet it with an empty bladder.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: My marriage had its ups and downs like anyone's, but when it came down to it, I knew it was solid. I miss that sort of security, and that sort of connection with someone.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: Part of what makes us human is what we mean to other people, and what people mean to us.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: When you lose someone you love, you die too, and you wait around for your body to catch up.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: When you're a teenager and you're in love, it's obvious to everyone but you and the person you're in love with.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: You do what you have to do to give people closure; it makes them feel better and it doesn't cost you much to do it. I'd rather apologize for something I didn't really care about and leave someone on Earth wishing me well.
wisdom.author: John Scalzi, Old Man's War, 2005

wisdom.quote: He who boasts of his ancestry is praising the deeds of another.
wisdom.author: Seneca, 'Hercules Furens,' 100 A.D.

wisdom.quote: Every man prefers belief to the exercise of judgement.
wisdom.author: Seneca, 4 BC-65 AD

wisdom.quote: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: It is better, of cours, to know useless things than to know nothing.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: It is quality rather than quantity that matters.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: Live among men as if God beheld you; speak to God as if men were listening.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: Men do not care how nobly they live, but only how long, although it is within the reach of every man to live nobly, but within no man's power to live long.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: The best ideas are common property.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: You can tell the character of every man when you see how he receives praise.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Epistles

wisdom.quote: The spirit in which a thing is given determines that in which the debt is acknowledged; it's the intention, not the face-value of the gift, that's weighed.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Letters to Lucilius, 100 A.D.

wisdom.quote: Nothing is as certain as that the vices of leisure are gotten rid of by being busy.
wisdom.author: Seneca, Moral Letters to Lucilius, 64 A.D.

wisdom.quote: Yes is how you get your first job, and your next job, and your spouse, and even your kids. Even if it's a bit edgy, a bit out of your comfort zone, saying yes means that you will do something new, meet someone new and make a difference.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt

wisdom.quote: If you forgo your plan, you also have to forgo fear.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: In a networked world, trust is the most important currency.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: In a world where everything is remembered and everything is kept forever, you need to live for the future and things you really care about.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: None of us is as smart as all of us.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: Success is really about being ready for the good opportunities that come before you. It's not to have a detailed plan of everything that you're going to do. You can't plan innovation or inspiration, but you can be ready for it, and when you see it, you can jump on it.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: We have an opportunity for everyone in the world to have access to all the world's information. This has never before been possible. Why is ubiquitous information so profound? It's a tremendous equalizer. Information is power.
wisdom.author: Eric Schmidt, University of Pennsylvania Commencement Address, 2009

wisdom.quote: Real meaningful endeavours, the biggies in human existence, often require the sacrifice of others.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Northern Lights, 1993

wisdom.quote: Trees like to have kids climb on them, but trees are much bigger than we are, and much more forgiving.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Old Tree, 1993

wisdom.quote: Marriage. It's like a cultural hand-rail. It links folks to the past and guides them to the future.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Our Wedding, 1992

wisdom.quote: What are man and woman if not members of two very different and warring tribes? Yet decade after decade, century after century, they attempt in marriage to reconcile and forge a union. Why? I don't know. Biological imperative? Divine law? Or just a desire to connect to that mysterious other? In any case, it's always struck me as a hopeful thing.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Our Wedding, 1992

wisdom.quote: There can be no spirituality, no sanctity, no truth without the female sex.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Revelations, 1993

wisdom.quote: I always admired atheists. I think it takes a lot of faith.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Seoul Mates, 1991

wisdom.quote: I used to think of all the billions of people in the world, and of all those people, how was I going to meet the right ones? The right ones to be my friends, the right one to be my husband. Now I just believe you meet the people you're supposed to meet.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, The Quest, 1995

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the mind, for reasons we don't necessarily understand, just decides to go to the store for a quart of milk.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Three Doctors, 1993

wisdom.quote: Let's not kid ourselves. Whatever we diagnose, most patients, if they don't die, get well by themselves. Our job is mainly to try to make them feel better; do no harm.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Wake Up Call, 1992

wisdom.quote: Listen, can you hear it? Spring's sweet cantata. The strains of grass pushing through the snow. The song of buds swelling on the vine. The tender timpani of a baby robin's heart. Spring.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Wake Up Call, 1992

wisdom.quote: As a scientist, I am not sure anymore that life can be reduced to a class struggle, to dialectical materialism, or any set of formulas. Life is spontaneous and it is unpredictable, it is magical. I think that we have struggled so hard with the tangible that we have forgotten the intangible.
wisdom.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider, Northern Exposure, Zarya, 1994

wisdom.quote: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It's already tomorrow in Australia.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz

wisdom.quote: I know the answer! The answer lies within the heart of all mankind! The answer is twelve? I think I'm in the wrong building.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz

wisdom.quote: My life has no purpose, no direction, no aim, no meaning, and yet I'm happy. I can't figure it out. What am I doing right?
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz

wisdom.quote: No problem is so formidable that you can't walk away from it.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz

wisdom.quote: There's a difference between a philosophy and a bumper sticker.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz

wisdom.quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz, (Snoopy)

wisdom.quote: That's the secret to life... replace one worry with another....
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz, Charlie Brown

wisdom.quote: I have a new philosophy. I'm only going to dread one day at a time.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz, Charlie Brown in "Peanuts"

wisdom.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz, Charlie Brown in "Peanuts"

wisdom.quote: Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, "Where have I gone wrong?" Then a voice says to me, "This is going to take more than one night."
wisdom.author: Charles M. Schulz, Charlie Brown in "Peanuts"

wisdom.quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Compassion is the basis of all morality.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Every person takes the limits of their own field of vision for the limits of the world.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: If there is anything in the world that can really be called a man's property, it is surely that which is the result of his mental activity.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: If we were not all so interested in ourselves, life would be so uninteresting that none of us would be able to endure it.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: If we weren't all so interested in ourselves, life would be so uninteresting we couldn't endure it.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Noise is the most impertinent of all forms of interruption. It is not only an interruption, but is also a disruption of thought.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: The amount of noise which anyone can bear undisturbed stands in inverse proportion to his mental capacity.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: The memory should be specially taxed in youth, since it is then that it is strongest and most tenacious. But in choosing the things that should be committed to memory the utmost care and forethought must be exercised; as lessons well learnt in youth are never forgotten.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: We forfeit three-fourths of ourselves in order to be like other people.
wisdom.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

wisdom.quote: Before you act consider; when you have considered, tis fully time to act.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: Few men desire liberty: The majority are satisfied with a just master.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: Small communities grow great through harmony, great ones fall to pieces through discord.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: The higher your station, the less your liberty.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: The soul is the captain and ruler of the life of morals.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: They envy the distinction I have won; let them therefore, envy my toils, my honesty, and the methods by which I gained it.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: To someone seeking power, the poorest man is the most useful.
wisdom.author: Sallust

wisdom.quote: A good man would prefer to be defeated than to defeat injustice by evil means.
wisdom.author: Sallust, 'Jugurthine War,' 41 B.C.

wisdom.quote: Ambition drove many men to become false; to have one thought locked in the breast, another ready on the tongue.
wisdom.author: Sallust, The War with Catiline

wisdom.quote: The renown which riches or beauty confer is fleeting and frail; mental excellence is a splendid and lasting possession.
wisdom.author: Sallust, The War with Catiline

wisdom.quote: To like and dislike the same things, that is indeed true friendship.
wisdom.author: Sallust, The War with Catiline

wisdom.quote: I believe that if it were left to artists to choose their own labels, most would choose none.
wisdom.author: Ben Shahn

wisdom.quote: Fear is the tax that conscience pays to guilt.
wisdom.author: George Sewell

wisdom.quote: Oh, darling, let your body in, let it tie you in, in comfort.
wisdom.author: Anne Sexton

wisdom.quote: Don't laugh at a youth for his affectations; he is only trying on one face after another to find his own.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

wisdom.quote: I cannot forgive my friends for dying; I do not find these vanishing acts of theirs at all amusing.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Age and Death"

wisdom.quote: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people, and greatly assists in the circulation of their blood.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Age and Death"

wisdom.quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Art and Letters"

wisdom.quote: It is the wretchedness of being rich that you have to live with rich people.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "In the World"

wisdom.quote: To suppose, as we all suppose, that we could be rich and not behave as the rich behave, is like supposing that we could drink all day and keep absolutely sober.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "In the World"

wisdom.quote: How many of our daydreams would darken into nightmares if there seemed any danger of their coming true!
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Life and Human Nature"

wisdom.quote: There are few sorrows, however poignant, in which a good income is of no avail.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Life and Human Nature"

wisdom.quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first, to get what you want; and, after that, to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Life and Human Nature"

wisdom.quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Myself"

wisdom.quote: All Reformers, however strict their social conscience, live in houses just as big as they can pay for.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Other People"

wisdom.quote: Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Other People"

wisdom.quote: When they come downstairs from their Ivory Towers, Idealists are very apt to walk straight into the gutter.
wisdom.author: Logan Pearsall Smith, Afterthoughts (1931) "Other People"

wisdom.quote: Censorship reflects a society's lack of confidence in itself.
wisdom.author: Potter Stewart

wisdom.quote: I have such poor vision I can date anybody.
wisdom.author: Garry Shandling

wisdom.quote: I'm too shy to express my sexual needs except over the phone to people I don't know.
wisdom.author: Garry Shandling

wisdom.quote: Against stupidity the gods themselves contend in vain.
wisdom.author: Friedrich von Schiller

wisdom.quote: It does not prove a thing to be right because the majority say it is so.
wisdom.author: Friedrich von Schiller

wisdom.quote: Keep true to the dreams of thy youth.
wisdom.author: Friedrich von Schiller

wisdom.quote: Goodbye cruel world.
wisdom.author: Gloria Shayne, Title of song (1961)

wisdom.quote: Creativity is...seeing something that doesn't exist already. You need to find out how you can bring it into being and that way be a playmate with God.
wisdom.author: Michele Shea

wisdom.quote: A wretched soul, bruised with adversity, We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;  But were we burdened with like weight of pain, As much or more we should ourselves complain.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Action is eloquence.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: And since you know you cannot see yourself, so well as by reflection, I, your glass, will modestly discover to yourself, that of yourself which you yet know not of.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: And thus I clothe my naked villainy With old odd ends, stol'n forth of holy writ; And seem a saint, when most I play the devil.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Assume a virtue, if you have it not.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Be great in act, as you have been in thought.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Blow, blow, thou winter wind Thou art not so unkind, As man's ingratitude.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Conversation should be pleasant without scurrility, witty without affectation, free without indecency, learned without conceitedness, novel without falsehood.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: For they are yet ear-kissing arguments.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Free from gross passion or of mirth or anger constant in spirit, not swerving with the blood, garnish'd and deck'd in modest compliment, not working with the eye without the ear, and but in purged judgement trusting neither? Such and so finely bolted didst thou seem.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Glory is like a circle in the water, Which never ceaseth to enlarge itself, Till by broad spreading it disperses to naught.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: God bless thee; and put meekness in thy mind, love, charity, obedience, and true duty!
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: He who has injured thee was either stronger or weaker than thee. If weaker, spare him; if stronger, spare thyself.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: His life was gentle; and the elements So mixed in him, that Nature might stand up, And say to all the world, THIS WAS A MAN!
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: How poor are they who have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: How use doth breed a habit in a man.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: I am not bound to please thee with my answers.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: I did never know so full a voice issue from so empty a heart: but the saying is true 'The empty vessel makes the greatest sound'.

wisdom.quote: My method is to take the utmost trouble to find the right thing to say, and then to say it with the utmost levity.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Answers to Nine Questions"

wisdom.quote: You see things; and you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say, "Why not?"
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Back to Methuselah" (1921), part 1, act 1

wisdom.quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is not to get your heart's desire. The other is to get it.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Man and Superman" (1903), act 4

wisdom.quote: A lifetime of happiness! No man alive could bear it: it would be hell on earth.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Man and Superman" (1903), act I

wisdom.quote: The more things a man is ashamed of, the more respectable he is.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Man and Superman" (1903), act I

wisdom.quote: You'll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Misalliance"

wisdom.quote: People are always blaming their circumstances for what they are. I don't believe in circumstances. The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want, and, if they can't find them, make them.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Mrs. Warren's Profession" (1893) act II

wisdom.quote: There are no secrets better kept than the secrets that everybody guesses.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Mrs. Warren's Profession" (1893), act III

wisdom.quote: Women upset everything. When you let them into your life, you find that the woman is driving at one thing and you're driving at another.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Pygmalion" (1913)

wisdom.quote: One man that has a mind and knows it can always beat ten men who haven't and don't.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "The Apple Cart" (1930), act I

wisdom.quote: The worst sin toward our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them: that's the essence of inhumanity.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "The Devil's Disciple" (1901), act II

wisdom.quote: We don't bother much about dress and manners in England, because as a nation we don't dress well and we've no manners.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, "You Never Can Tell" (1898), act I

wisdom.quote: "Do you know what a pessimist is?" "A man who thinks everybody is as nasty as himself, and hates them for it."
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, An Unsocial Socialist (1887) ch. 5

wisdom.quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, Annajanska (1919)

wisdom.quote: Silence is the most perfect expression of scorn.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, Back to Methuselah (1921) pt. 5

wisdom.quote: Without art the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, Back to Methuselah, 1921

wisdom.quote: He who has never hoped can never despair.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw, Caesar and Cleopatra (1901) act 4

wisdom.quote: A day's work is a day's work, neither more nor less, and the man who does it needs a day's sustenance, a night's repose and due leisure, whether he be painter or ploughman.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: A fashion is nothing but an induced epidemic.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: A lifetime of happiness! No man alive could bear it; it would be hell on earth.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Americans adore me and will go on adoring me until I say something nice about them.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: An American has no sense of privacy. He does not know what it means.There is no such thing in the country.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Democracy is a device that ensures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: England and America are two countries separated by a common language.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Everything happens to everybody sooner or later if there is time enough.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Few people think more than two or three times a year; I have made an international reputation for myself by thinking once or twice a week.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Gambling promises the poor what property performs for the rich--something for nothing.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Hegel was right when he said that we learn from history that man can never learn anything from history.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: I can forgive Alfred Nobel for having invented dynamite, but only a fiend in human form could have invented the Nobel Prize.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: If all economists were laid end to end, they would not reach a conclusion.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: If history repeats itself, and the unexpected always happens, how incapable must Man be of learning from experience.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: If the lesser mind could measure the greater as a footrule can measure a pyramid, there would be finality in universal suffrage. As it is, the political problem remains unsolved.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.quote: The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think.
wisdom.author: Edwin Schlossberg

wisdom.quote: True interactivity is not about clicking on icons or downloading files, it's about encouraging communication.
wisdom.author: Edwin Schlossberg, 2002

wisdom.quote: Like I always say, there's no 'I' in "team". There is a 'me', though, if you jumble it up.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., DNR, 2004

wisdom.quote: Doing what you love means dealing with things you don't.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Last Temptation, 2011

wisdom.quote: Only two things you ignore: things that aren't important and things you wish weren't important, and wishing never works.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Not Cancer, 2008

wisdom.quote: You're supposed to trust friends. You have no reason to be his friend? That is part of the pleasure of friendship: trusting without absolute evidence and then being rewarded for that trust.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Not Cancer, 2008
