wisdom.quote: Beauty often seduces us on the road to truth.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Occam's Razor, 2004

wisdom.quote: If we were to care about every person suffering on this planet, life would shut down.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., One Day, One Room, 2007

wisdom.quote: People choose the paths that grant them the greatest rewards for the least amount of effort.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Pilot, 2004

wisdom.quote: It's a basic truth of the human condition that everybody lies. The only variable is about what. The weird thing about telling someone they're dying is it tends to focus their priorities. You find out what matters to them. What they're willing to die for. What they're willing to lie for.
wisdom.author: David Shore, House M.D., Three Stories, 2004

wisdom.quote: Be on the alert to recognize your prime at whatever time of your life it may occur.
wisdom.author: Muriel Spark

wisdom.quote: In giving advice, seek to help, not please, your friend.
wisdom.author: Solon

wisdom.quote: Men keep agreements when it is to the advantage of neither to break them.
wisdom.author: Solon

wisdom.quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
wisdom.author: Solon

wisdom.quote: Reprove thy friend privately; commend him publicly.
wisdom.author: Solon

wisdom.quote: There are people whom one loves immediately and forever. Even to know they are alive in the world with one is quite enough.
wisdom.author: Nancy Spain

wisdom.quote: I still have a lot to learn - about the business, about music, and about myself. Its exciting.
wisdom.author: Britney Spears

wisdom.quote: I would like to be called an inspiration to people, not a role model--because I make mistakes like everybody else. When I'm offstage, I'm just like everybody else.
wisdom.author: Britney Spears

wisdom.quote: Onstage I'm the happiest person in the world.
wisdom.author: Britney Spears

wisdom.quote: With love, you should go ahead and take the risk of getting hurt... because love is an amazing feeling.
wisdom.author: Britney Spears

wisdom.quote: My prerogative right now is to just chill and let all the other overexposed blondes on the cover of Us Weekly (magazine) be your entertainment.
wisdom.author: Britney Spears, on her web site, October 2004

wisdom.quote: Do definite good; first of all to yourself, then to definite persons.
wisdom.author: John Lancaster Spalding

wisdom.quote: Leave each one his touch of folly; it helps to lighten life's burden which, if he could see himself as he is, might be too heavy to carry.
wisdom.author: John Lancaster Spalding

wisdom.quote: The highest courage is to dare to appear to be what one is.
wisdom.author: John Lancaster Spalding

wisdom.quote: A vision without action is called a daydream; but then again, action without a vision is called a nightmare.
wisdom.author: Jim Sorensen

wisdom.quote: Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness.
wisdom.author: George Sand

wisdom.quote: It is a mistake to regard age as a downhill grade toward dissolution. The reverse is true. As one grows older, one climbs with surprising strides.
wisdom.author: George Sand

wisdom.quote: I believe in an open mind, but not so open that your brains fall out.
wisdom.author: Arthur Hays Sulzberger

wisdom.quote: Trouble is part of your life, and if you don't share it, you don't give the person who loves you a chance to love you enough.
wisdom.author: Dinah Shore

wisdom.quote: On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog.
wisdom.author: Peter Steiner, cartoon in The New Yorker, July 5, 1993

wisdom.quote: The great thing about democracy is that it gives every voter a chance to do something stupid.
wisdom.author: Art Spander

wisdom.quote: I would rather have a mind opened by wonder than one closed by belief.
wisdom.author: Gerry Spence, 'How to Argue and Win Every Time'

wisdom.quote: To freely bloom - that is my definition of success.
wisdom.author: Gerry Spence, How to Argue and Win Every Time

wisdom.quote: Any great truth can -- and eventually will -- be expressed as a cliche -- a cliche is a sure and certain way to dilute an idea. For instance, my grandmother used to say, 'The black cat is always the last one off the fence.' I have no idea what she meant, but at one time, it was undoubtedly true.
wisdom.author: Solomon Short

wisdom.quote: I'm all in favor of keeping dangerous weapons out of the hands of fools. Let's start with typewriters.
wisdom.author: Solomon Short

wisdom.quote: The only winner in the War of 1812 was Tchaikovsky.
wisdom.author: Solomon Short

wisdom.quote: This is the best kind of voyeurism, hearing joy from your neighbors.
wisdom.author: Chuck Sigars, The World According to Chuck weblog, October 14, 2003

wisdom.quote: [T]here's no bad day that can't be overcome by listening to a barbershop quartet; this is just truth, plain and simple.
wisdom.author: Chuck Sigars, The World According to Chuck weblog, September 30, 2003

wisdom.quote: Calendars are for careful people, not passionate ones.
wisdom.author: Chuck Sigars, The World According to Chuck weblog, September 8, 2003

wisdom.quote: I like coincidences. They make me wonder about destiny, and whether free will is an illusion or just a matter of perspective. They let me speculate on the idea of some master plan that, from time to time, we're allowed to see out of the corner of our eye.
wisdom.author: Chuck Sigars, The World According to Chuck weblog, September 8, 2003

wisdom.quote: Pay no attention to what the critics say... Remember, a statue has never been set up in honor of a critic!
wisdom.author: Jean Sibelius, quoted in Bengt de Torne "Sibelius: A Close-Up" 1937

wisdom.quote: The game of life is the game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later, with astounding accuracy.
wisdom.author: Florence Shinn

wisdom.quote: Ridicule is the first and last argument of fools.
wisdom.author: Charles Simmons

wisdom.quote: The pursuit of happiness is a most ridiculous phrase; if you pursue happiness you'll never find it.
wisdom.author: C. P. Snow

wisdom.quote: When you think of the long and gloomy history of man, you will find more hideous crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion.
wisdom.author: C. P. Snow

wisdom.quote: There are many fine ideals which are not realisable, and yet we do not refrain from teaching them.
wisdom.author: Peretz Smolenskin

wisdom.quote: Education has for its object the formation of character.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer

wisdom.quote: Opinion is ultimately determined by the feelings, and not by the intellect.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer

wisdom.quote: Science is organized knowledge.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer

wisdom.quote: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer

wisdom.quote: The ultimate result of shielding men from the effects of folly is to fill the world with fools.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer

wisdom.quote: No one can be perfectly free till all are free; no one can be perfectly moral till all are moral; no one can be perfectly happy till all are happy.
wisdom.author: Herbert Spencer,  Social Statics, part 4, chapter 30 1851

wisdom.quote: In many cases, the more you try to compete, the less competitive you actually are.
wisdom.author: Kathy Sierra, Creating Passionate Users, 07-22-06

wisdom.quote: We are all human, and caring about the way something looks and feels does not mean we're superficial--it means we're human. We don't need to exploit sex to recognize that a certain amount of sexiness is both pleasurable and natural.
wisdom.author: Kathy Sierra, Creating Passionate Users, 08-22-06

wisdom.quote: Be careful that victories do not carry the seed of future defeats.
wisdom.author: Ralph W. Sockman

wisdom.quote: Good habits, which bring our lower passions and appetites under automatic control, leave our natures free to explore the larger experiences of life.
wisdom.author: Ralph W. Sockman

wisdom.quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
wisdom.author: Ralph W. Sockman

wisdom.quote: Engineering is the professional art of applying science to the optimum conversion of natural resources to the benefit of man.
wisdom.author: Ralph J. Smith

wisdom.quote: All is but lip-wisdom which wants experience.
wisdom.author: Sir Philip Sidney

wisdom.quote: No sword bites so fiercly as an evil tongue.
wisdom.author: Sir Philip Sidney

wisdom.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
wisdom.author: Sir Philip Sidney

wisdom.quote: Why is it drug addicts and computer afficionados are both called users?
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll

wisdom.quote: A box of crayons and a big sheet of paper provides a more expressive medium for kids than computerized paint programs.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Anyone can post messages to the net. Practically everyone does. The resulting cacophony drowns out serious discussion.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: As the networks evolve, so do my opinions toward them, and my divergent feelings bring out conflicting points of view. In advance, I apologize to those who expect a consistent position from me.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Call me a troglodyte; I'd rather peruse those photos alongside my sweetheart, catch the newspaper on the way to work, and page thorough a real book.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Computers force us into creating with our minds and prevent us from making things with our hands. They dull the skills we use in everyday life.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Electronic communication is an instantaneous and illusory contact that creates a sense of intimacy without the emotional investment that leads to close friendships.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Here are my strong reservations about the wave of computer networks. They isolate us from one another and cheapen the meaning of actual experience. They work against literacy and creativity. They undercut our schools and libraries.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: I sense an insatiable demand for connectivity. Maybe all these people have discovered important uses for the Internet. Perhaps some of them feel hungry for a community that our real neighborhoods don't deliver. At least a few must wonder what the big deal is.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: I spend almost as much time figuring out what's wrong with my computer as I do actually using it.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: It's a great medium for trivia and hobbies, but not the place for reasoned, reflective judgment. Suprisingly often, discussions degenerate into acrimony, insults and flames.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: No computer network with pretty graphics can ever replace the salespeople that make our society work.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: The Internet has no such organization - files are made available at random locations. To search through this chaos, we need smart tools, programs that find resources for us.
wisdom.author: Clifford Stoll, Silicon Snake Oil, 1995

wisdom.quote: Pray as if everything depended upon God and work as if everything depended upon man.
wisdom.author: Francis Cardinal Spellman

wisdom.quote: Genuine goodness is threatening to those at the opposite end of the moral spectrum.
wisdom.author: Charles Spencer

wisdom.quote: Let us hope that we are all preceded in this world by a love story.
wisdom.author: Don Snyder, Of Time and Memory

wisdom.quote: Power tempts even the best of men to take liberties with the truth.
wisdom.author: Joseph Sobran

wisdom.quote: The attempt to silence a man is the greatest honor you can bestow on him. It means that you recognize his superiority to yourself.
wisdom.author: Joseph Sobran

wisdom.quote: A state of war only serves as an excuse for domestic tyranny.
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

wisdom.quote: Do not pursue what is illusory - property and position: all that is gained at the expense of your nerves decade after decade and can be confiscated in one fell night. Live with a steady superiority over life - don't be afraid of misfortune, and do not yearn after happiness; it is after all, all the same: the bitter doesn't last forever, and the sweet never fills the cup to overflowing.
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

wisdom.quote: If one is forever cautious, can one remain a human being?
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

wisdom.quote: Our envy of others devours us most of all.
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

wisdom.quote: Own only what you can carry with you; know language, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

wisdom.quote: Can a man who's warm understand one who's freezing?
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn, One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich

wisdom.quote: Pride grows in the human heart like lard on a pig.
wisdom.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn, The Gulag Archipelago

wisdom.quote: A short saying oft contains much wisdom.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: Ignorant men don't know what good they hold in their hands until they've flung it away.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: Much speech is one thing, well-timed speech is another.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: That word is love.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: What you cannot enforce, do not command.
wisdom.author: Sophocles

wisdom.quote: No man loves life like him that's growing old.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Acrisius

wisdom.quote: To him who is in fear everything rustles.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Acrisius

wisdom.quote: It is not righteousness to outrageA brave man dead, not even though you hate him.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Ajax

wisdom.quote: Men of ill judgment oft ignore the goodThat lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Ajax

wisdom.quote: Of all human ills, greatest is fortune's wayward tyranny.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Ajax

wisdom.quote: For God hates utterlyThe bray of bragging tongues.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Grief teaches the steadiest minds to waver.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: How dreadful it is when the right judge judges wrong!
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: I have nothing but contempt for the kind of governor who is afraid, for whatever reason, to follow the course that he knows is best for the State; and as for the man who sets private friendship above the public welfare - I have no use for him either.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Money: There's nothing in the world so demoralizing as money.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Nobody likes the man who brings bad news.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Numberless are the world's wonders, but noneMore wonderful than man.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Reason is God's crowning gift to man.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Show me the man who keeps his house in hand,He's fit for public authority.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: I row after health like a waterman...
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: I wonder what fool it was that first invented kissing.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: It is impossible that anything so natural, so necessary, and so universal as death, should ever have been designed by Providence as an evil to mankind.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: It is useless to attempt to reason a man out of a thing he was never reasoned into.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: May you live all the days of your life.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: One of the best rules in conversation is, never to say a thing which any of the company can reasonably wish had been left unsaid.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: When a true genius appears in this world you may know him by this sign, that the dines are all in confederacy against him.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: Ambition often puts men upon doing the meanest offices; so climbing is performed in the same posture with creeping.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift, Miscellanies, 1711

wisdom.quote: When a true genius appears in this world, you may know him by this sign, that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift, Thoughts on Various Subjects

wisdom.quote: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift, Thoughts on Various Subjects, 1711

wisdom.quote: What is most beautiful in virile men is something feminine; what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
wisdom.author: Susan Sontag, Against Interpretation, 1966

wisdom.quote: Theories that diseases are caused by mental states and can be cured by will power, are always an index of how much is not understood about the physical terrain of a disease.
wisdom.author: Susan Sontag, Illness as Metaphor, 1978

wisdom.quote: The camera makes everyone a tourist in other people's reality, and eventually in one's own.
wisdom.author: Susan Sontag, New York Review of Books 18 Apr. 1974

wisdom.quote: If my hands are fully occupied in holding on to something, I can neither give nor receive.
wisdom.author: Dorothee Solle

wisdom.quote: A feeling of real need is always a good enough reason to pray.
wisdom.author: Hannah Whitall Smith

wisdom.quote: The true secret of giving advice is, after you have honestly given it, to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not, and never persist in trying to set people right.
wisdom.author: Hannah Whitall Smith, 1902

wisdom.quote: Let me advise thee not to talk of thyself as being old. There is something in Mind Cure, after all, and if thee continually talks of thyself as being old, thee may perhaps bring on some of the infirmities of age. At least I would not risk it if I were thee.
wisdom.author: Hannah Whitall Smith, 1907

wisdom.quote: By all means marry; if you get a good wife, you'll be happy. If you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Do not do to others what angers you if done to you by others.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Envy is the ulcer of the soul.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Get not your friends by bare compliments, but by giving them sensible tokens of your love.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Regard your good name as the richest jewel you can possibly be possessed of - for credit is like fire; when once you have kindled it you may easily preserve it, but if you once extinguish it, you will find it an arduous task to rekindle it again. The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Remember that there is nothing stable in human affairs; therefore avoid undue elation in prosperity, or undue depression in adversity.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Remember what is unbecoming to do is also unbecoming to speak of.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: The shortest and surest way to live with honour in the world, is to be in reality what we would appear to be; and if we observe, we shall find, that all human virtues increase and strengthen themselves by the practice of them.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions; but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Thou shouldst eat to live; not live to eat.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Having the fewest wants, I am nearest to the gods.
wisdom.author: Socrates, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: I know nothing except the fact of my ignorance.
wisdom.author: Socrates, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
wisdom.author: Socrates, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Bad men live that they may eat and drink, whereas good men eat and drink that they may live.
wisdom.author: Socrates, from Plutarch, How a Young Man Ought to Hear Poems

wisdom.quote: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.
wisdom.author: Socrates, from Plutarch, Of Banishment

wisdom.quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled [poets] to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
wisdom.author: Socrates, In "Apology," sct. 21, by Plato.

wisdom.quote: The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our ways - I to die, and you to live. Which is better God only knows.
wisdom.author: Socrates, in Plato, Dialogues, Apology

wisdom.quote: If you would be pungent, be brief; for it is with words as with sunbeams - the more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.
wisdom.author: Robert Southey

wisdom.quote: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
wisdom.author: Julia Sorel

wisdom.quote: The inner fire is the most important thing mankind possesses.
wisdom.author: Edith Sodergran

wisdom.quote: I love that sometimes we need to go to the opposite side of the world to realize assumptions that we didn't even know we had and realize that the opposite may also be true.
wisdom.author: Derek Sivers, TED Talk: Weird, or just different? Nov 2009

wisdom.quote: The ideal conditionWould be, I admit, that men should be right by instinct;But since we are all likely to go astray,The reasonable thing is to learn from those who can teach.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: There is no happiness where there is no wisdom;No wisdom but in submission to the gods.Big words are always punished,And proud men in old age learn to be wise.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Antigone

wisdom.quote: Truly, to tell lies is not honorable;but when the truth entails tremendous ruin,To speak dishonorably is pardonable.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Creusa

wisdom.quote: Death is not the worst thing; rather, when one who craves death cannot attain even that wish.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Electra

wisdom.quote: Death is not the worst; rather, in vainTo wish for death, and not to compass it.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Electra

wisdom.quote: The end excuses any evil.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Electra (c.409 BC)

wisdom.quote: It made our hair stand up in panic fear.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus at Colonus

wisdom.quote: One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus at Colonus

wisdom.quote: Stranger in a strange country.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus at Colonus

wisdom.quote: The good befriend themselves.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus at Colonus

wisdom.quote: How dreadful knowledge of the truth can beWhen there's no help in truth!
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus Rex

wisdom.quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus Rex

wisdom.quote: Time eases all things.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Oedipus Rex

wisdom.quote: A prudent mind can see room for misgiving, lest he who prospers would one day suffer reverse.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Trachiniae

wisdom.quote: Knowledge must come through action; you can have no test which is not fanciful, save by trial.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Trachiniae

wisdom.quote: Rash indeed is he who reckons on the morrow, or haply on days beyond it; for tomorrow is not, until today is past.
wisdom.author: Sophocles, Trachiniae

wisdom.quote: For me [video blogging] is like a scrapbook. You have all these video tapes sitting around and have no way to watch them. It's like an archive. It's so much easier than going through the video tapes.
wisdom.author: Mike B. Slone, How To Add Video To Your Blog, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: The more people have studied different methods of bringing up children the more they have come to the conclusion that what good mother and fathers instinctively feel like doing for their babies is the best after all.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Spock

wisdom.quote: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Spock

wisdom.quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting with the gift of speech.
wisdom.author: Simonides

wisdom.quote: Not even the gods fight against necessity.
wisdom.author: Simonides, from Plato, Dialogues, Protagoras

wisdom.quote: I don't like the sound of all those lists he's making - it's like taking too many notes at school; you feel you've achieved something when you haven't.
wisdom.author: Dodie Smith, I Capture the Castle, 1948

wisdom.quote: In Mexico we have a word for sushi: Bait.
wisdom.author: Jose Simon

wisdom.quote: Any event, once it has occurred, can be made to appear inevitable by a competent historian.
wisdom.author: Lee Simonson

wisdom.quote: In early childhood you may lay the foundation of poverty or riches, industry or idleness, good or evil, by the habits to which you train your children. Teach them right habits then, and their future life is safe.
wisdom.author: Lydia Sigourney

wisdom.quote: I say, thou mad March hare.
wisdom.author: John Skelton, Replication Against Certain Young Scholars

wisdom.quote: He who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
wisdom.author: Samuel Smiles

wisdom.quote: Blaze with the fire that is never extinguished.
wisdom.author: Luisa Sigea, O Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: Consistency is the quality of a stagnant mind.
wisdom.author: John Sloan

wisdom.quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker, that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own self-interest. We address ourselves, not to their humanity but to their self-love, and never talk to them of our own neccessities but of their advantages.
wisdom.author: Adam Smith

wisdom.quote: Wherever there is great property, there is great inequality... for one very rich man, there must be at least five hundred poor.
wisdom.author: Adam Smith

wisdom.quote: There is an applause superior to that of the multitudes: one's own.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Elton Smith

wisdom.quote: A few days ago I walked along the edge of the lake and was treated to the crunch and rustle of leaves with each step I made. The acoustics of this season are different and all sounds, no matter how hushed, are as crisp as autumn air.
wisdom.author: Eric Sloane

wisdom.quote: Look like a girl, act like a lady, think like a man and work like a dog.
wisdom.author: Caroline K. Simon

wisdom.quote: [Memory is] a man's real possession...In nothing else is he rich, in nothing else is he poor.
wisdom.author: Alexander Smith

wisdom.quote: I feel bad for people who don't drink because when they wake up in the morning and get out of bed...Thats the best they are gonna feel.
wisdom.author: Frank Sinatra

wisdom.quote: I feel sorry for people who do not drink. When they wake up in the morning it is as good as they are going to feel all day.
wisdom.author: Frank Sinatra, Quoted in The Sydney Morning Herald

wisdom.quote: Red meat is NOT bad for you. Now blue-green meat, THAT'S bad for you!
wisdom.author: Tommy Smothers

wisdom.quote: There are only two ways of telling the complete truth--anonymously and posthumously.
wisdom.author: Thomas Sowell

wisdom.quote: Politeness and consideration for others is like investing pennies and getting dollars back.
wisdom.author: Thomas Sowell, Creators Syndicate

wisdom.quote: Much of the social history of the Western world over the past three decades has involved replacing what worked with what sounded good.
wisdom.author: Thomas Sowell, Is Reality Optional?, 1993

wisdom.quote: Much of the social history of the Western world over the past three decades has involved replacing what worked with what sounded good. In area after area - crime, education, housing, race relations - the situation has gotten worse after the bright new theories were put into operation. The amazing thing is that this history of failure and disaster has neither discouraged the social engineers nor discredited them.
wisdom.author: Thomas Sowell, Is Reality Optional?, 1993

wisdom.quote: No woman is required to build the world by destroying herself.
wisdom.author: Rabbi Sofer

wisdom.quote: In this business you either sink or swim or you don't.
wisdom.author: David Smith

wisdom.quote: Eccentricity is not, as dull people would have us believe, a form of madness. It is often a kind of innocent pride, and the man of genius and the aristocrat are frequently regarded as eccentrics because genius and aristocrat are entirely unafraid of and uninfluenced by the opinions and vagaries of the crowd.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell

wisdom.quote: Good taste is the worst vice ever invented.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell

wisdom.quote: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell

wisdom.quote: My personal hobbies are reading, listening to music, and silence.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell

wisdom.quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell

wisdom.quote: My poems are hymns of praise to the glory of life.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, "Some notes on my poetry" Collected Poems, 1957

wisdom.quote: The aim of flattery is to soothe and encourage us by assuring us of the truth of an opinion we have already formed about ourselves.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, As quoted in The Last Years of a Rebel : A Memoir of Edith Sitwell by Elizabeth Salter, 1967

wisdom.quote: I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty... But I am too busy thinking about myself.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, As quoted in The Observer (30 April 1950)

wisdom.quote: I'm afraid I'm being an awful nuisance.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, Her last words, as quoted in The Last Years of a Rebel : A Memoir of Edith Sitwell by Elizabeth Salter, 1967

wisdom.quote: I am an unpopular electric eel in a pool of catfish.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, Life magazine, 01-04-63

wisdom.quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, Life magazine, 01-04-63

wisdom.quote: Vulgarity is, in reality, nothing but a modern, chic, pert descendant of the goddess Dullness.
wisdom.author: Edith Sitwell, Taken Care Of ,1965

wisdom.quote: I think that freshness and that innocence is something that is missing from a lot of female singers. I'm certainly not denying that I'm young, but I'm not fluff.
wisdom.author: Jessica Simpson

wisdom.quote: Twenty-three is old. It's almost 25, which is like almost mid-20s.
wisdom.author: Jessica Simpson

wisdom.quote: You've done a nice job decorating the White House.
wisdom.author: Jessica Simpson, Upon being introduced to Interior Secretary Gale Norton

wisdom.quote: Engineering is the science of economy, of conserving the energy, kinetic and potential, provided and stored up by nature for the use of man. It is the business of engineering to utilize this energy to the best advantage, so that there may be the least possible waste.
wisdom.author: William A. Smith, 1908

wisdom.quote: I really do believe I can accomplish a great deal with a big grin, I know some people find that disconcerting, but that doesn't matter.
wisdom.author: Beverly Sills

wisdom.quote: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
wisdom.author: Beverly Sills

wisdom.quote: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try.
wisdom.author: Beverly Sills

wisdom.quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
wisdom.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

wisdom.quote: We know what a person thinks not when he tells us what he thinks, but by his actions.
wisdom.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

wisdom.quote: What nature delivers to us is never stale. Because what nature creates has eternity in it.
wisdom.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

wisdom.quote: We have to believe in free will. We�ve got no choice.
wisdom.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer, The Times (1982)

wisdom.quote: The future, according to some scientists, will be exactly like the past, only far more expensive.
wisdom.author: John Sladek

wisdom.quote: Stoners are cute; junkies are sad.
wisdom.author: Kevin Smith, My Boring Ass Life, 03-29-06

wisdom.quote: More often than not, a hero�s most epic battle is the one you never see; it�s the battle that goes on within him or herself.
wisdom.author: Kevin Smith, My Boring Ass Life, 04-18-06

wisdom.quote: My Father taught me how to be a man � and not by instilling in me a sense of machismo or an agenda of dominance. He taught me that a real man doesn�t take, he gives; he doesn�t use force, he uses logic; doesn�t play the role of trouble-maker, but rather, trouble-shooter; and most importantly, a real man is defined by what�s in his heart, not his pants.
wisdom.author: Kevin Smith, My Boring Ass Life, 06-01-05

wisdom.quote: My Father taught me to weigh my words carefully, and speak up only when I had something insightful to add to the proceedings, or something really funny to say. He also taught me that if I couldn�t be that kind of guy in real life, that I could earn a healthy living pretending to be that guy in the movies � particularly when paired up with a long haired stoner.
wisdom.author: Kevin Smith, My Boring Ass Life, 06-01-05

wisdom.quote: Errors to be dangerous must have a great deal of truth mingled with them. It is only from this alliance that they can ever obtain an extensive circulation.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: Learn from the earliest days to insure your principles against the perils of ridicule; you can no more exercise your reason if you live in the constant dread of laughter, than you can enjoy your life if you are in the constant terror of death.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: Live always in the best company when you read.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: Never try to reason the prejudice out of a man. It was not reasoned into him, and cannot be reasoned out.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: There is one piece of advice, in a life of study, which I think no one will object to; and that is, every now and then to be completely idle - to do nothing at all.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: To do anything in this world worth doing, we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger, but jump in, and scramble through as well as we can.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: Whatever you are by nature, keep to it; never desert your line of talent. Be what nature intended you for and you will succeed.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: You must not think me necessarily foolish because I am facetious, nor will I consider you necessarily wise because you are grave.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith

wisdom.quote: He had occasional flashes of silence, that made his conversation perfectly delightful.
wisdom.author: Sydney Smith, referring to Macaulay

wisdom.quote: I do nothing but go about persuading you all, old and young alike, not to take thought for your persons or your properties, but and chiefly to care about the greatest improvement of the soul. I tell you that virtue is not given by money, but that from virtue comes money and every other good of man, public as well as private. This is my teaching, and if this is the doctrine which corrupts the youth, I am a mischievous person.
wisdom.author: Socrates, quoted by Plato, 'The Death of Socrates'

wisdom.quote: Does a poet create, originate, initiate the thing called a poem, or is his behavior merely the product of his genetic and environmental histories?
wisdom.author: B. F. Skinner

wisdom.quote: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.
wisdom.author: B. F. Skinner

wisdom.quote: Education is what survives when what has been learned has been forgotten.
wisdom.author: B. F. Skinner, New Scientist, May 21, 1964

wisdom.quote: The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our ways--I to die and you to live. Which is the better, only God knows.
wisdom.author: Socrates, Quoted in: Plato's Apology, sct. 42a. Last words of his speech to the court following the sentence of death imposed on him by the Athenians.

wisdom.quote: When you can't have what you want, it's time to start wanting what you have.
wisdom.author: Kathleen A. Sutton

wisdom.quote: Never say never, for if you live long enough, chances are you will not be able to abide by its restrictions. Never is a long, undependable time, and life is too full of rich possibilities to have restrictions placed upon it.
wisdom.author: Gloria Swanson

wisdom.quote: To love deeply in one direction makes us more loving in all others.
wisdom.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

wisdom.quote: We are rich only through what we give, and poor only through what we refuse.
wisdom.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

wisdom.quote: Providence has hidden a charm in difficult undertakings which is appreciated only by those who dare to grapple with them.
wisdom.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine, The Writings of Madame Swetchine, 1869

wisdom.quote: Conscience is God's presence in man.
wisdom.author: Emanuel Swedenborg

wisdom.quote: Sport is imposing order on what was chaos.
wisdom.author: Anthony Starr

wisdom.quote: What is the difference between unethical and ethical advertising? Unethical advertising uses falsehoods to deceive the public; ethical advertising uses truth to deceive the public.
wisdom.author: Vilhjalmur Stefansson, "Discovery", 1964

wisdom.quote: He has achieved success who has lived well, laughed often, and loved much.
wisdom.author: Bessie A. Stanley

wisdom.quote: Sow good services; sweet remembrances will grow them.
wisdom.author: Madame de Stael

wisdom.quote: From the beginning of our history the country has been afflicted with compromise. It is by compromise that human rights have been abandoned. I insist that this shall cease. The country needs repose after all its trials; it deserves repose. And repose can only be found in everlasting principles.
wisdom.author: Charles Sumner

wisdom.quote: All warfare is based on deception. There is no place where espionage is not used. Offer the enemy bait to lure him.
wisdom.author: Sun-Tzu

wisdom.quote: Appraise war in terms of the fundamental factors. The first of these factors is moral influence.
wisdom.author: Sun-Tzu

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more difficult than the art of maneuvering for advantageous positions.
wisdom.author: Sun-Tzu

wisdom.quote: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
wisdom.author: Sun-tzu, (attributed)

wisdom.quote: Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.
wisdom.author: Sun-tzu, The Art of War. Emptiness and Fullness

wisdom.quote: The best victory is when the opponent surrenders of its own accord before there are any actual hostilities...It is best to win without fighting.
wisdom.author: Sun-tzu, The Art of War. Planning a Siege

wisdom.quote: A military operation involves deception. Even though you are competent, appear to be incompetent. Though effective, appear to be ineffective.
wisdom.author: Sun-tzu, The Art of War. Strategic Assessments

wisdom.quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
wisdom.author: Sun-tzu, The Art of War. Strategic Assessments

wisdom.quote: To love is to receive a glimpse of heaven.
wisdom.author: Karen Sunde

wisdom.quote: Truth, like surgery, may hurt, but it cures.
wisdom.author: Han Suyin

wisdom.quote: The most important thing is to be whatever you are without shame.
wisdom.author: Rod Steiger

wisdom.quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities. In the expert's mind there are few.
wisdom.author: Shunryu Suzuki

wisdom.quote: When the water reaches the upper level, follow the rats.
wisdom.author: Claude Swanson

wisdom.quote: "Fearless" is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.
wisdom.author: Taylor Swift

wisdom.quote: Experience is what you get when you don't get what you want.
wisdom.author: Dan Stanford

wisdom.quote: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.
wisdom.author: Barry Switzer

wisdom.quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
wisdom.author: Herbert Bayard Swope

wisdom.quote: There is only one you... Don't you dare change just because you're outnumbered!
wisdom.author: Charles Swindoll

wisdom.quote: The history of the Victorian Age will never be written: we know too much about it. For ignorance is the first requisite of the historian - ignorance, which simplifies and clarifies, which selects and omits, with a placid perfection unattainable by the highest art.
wisdom.author: Lytton Strachey, Eminent Victorians (1918)

wisdom.quote: Discretion is not the better part of biography.
wisdom.author: Lytton Strachey, in Michael Holroyd Lytton, Strachey vol. 1 (1967)

wisdom.quote: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.
wisdom.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

wisdom.quote: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody has thought.
wisdom.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi, in Irving Good, The Scientist Speculates (1962)

wisdom.quote: Senescent judges show how patriotic they are by passing out hard sentences for tearing up a draft card or following one's conscience according to the principles established by our country at the Nuremburg trials.
wisdom.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi, The Crazy Ape

wisdom.quote: When I received the Nobel Prize, the only big lump sum of money I have ever seen, I had to do something with it. The easiest way to drop this hot potato was to invest it, to buy shares. I knew that World War II was coming and I was afraid that if I had shares which rise in case of war, I would wish for war. So I asked my agent to buy shares which go down in the event of war. This he did. I lost my money and saved my soul.
wisdom.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi, The Crazy Ape

wisdom.quote: My parents taught me how to listen to everybody before I made up my own mind. When you listen, you learn. You absorb like a sponge-and your life becomes so much better than when you are just trying to be listened to all the time.
wisdom.author: Steven Spielberg

wisdom.quote: To have respect for ourselves guides our morals; and to have a deference for others governs our manners.
wisdom.author: Lawrence Sterne

wisdom.quote: I loathe people who keep dogs. They are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
wisdom.author: August Strindberg, A Madman's Diary, 1895

wisdom.quote: Vigorous writing is concise.
wisdom.author: William Strunk Jr., "The Elements of Style", 1919

wisdom.quote: Write something to suit yourself and many people will like it; write something to suit everybody and scarcely anyone will care for it.
wisdom.author: Jesse Stuart

wisdom.quote: Famous remarks are very seldom quoted correctly.
wisdom.author: Simeon Strunsky, No Mean City (1944)

wisdom.quote: People who want to understand democracy should spend less time in the library with Aristotle and more time on the buses and in the subway.
wisdom.author: Simeon Strunsky, No Mean City (1944)

wisdom.quote: To be intelligent is to be open-minded, active, memoried, and persistently experimental.
wisdom.author: Leopold Stein

wisdom.quote: I would not attack the faith of a heathen without being sure I had a better one to put in its place.
wisdom.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

wisdom.quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
wisdom.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

wisdom.quote: The truth is the kindest thing we can give folks in the end.
wisdom.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

wisdom.quote: Is what you hear at church religion? Is that which can bend, turn, and descend and ascend, to fit every crooked phrase of selfish, worldly society religion? Is that religion which is scrupulous, less generous, less just, less considerate for man, than even my own ungodly, worldly, blinded nature? No! When I look for religion, I must look for something above me, and not something beneath.
wisdom.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe, Uncle Tom�s Cabin

wisdom.quote: Grant us a brief delay; impulse in everything is but a worthless servant.
wisdom.author: Caecilius Statius

wisdom.quote: The whole world is a man's birthplace.
wisdom.author: Caecilius Statius

wisdom.quote: Wisdom oft lurks beneath a tattered coat.
wisdom.author: Caecilius Statius

wisdom.quote: He plants trees to benefit another generation.
wisdom.author: Caecilius Statius, Synephebi

wisdom.quote: Men are afraid to rock the boat in which they hope to drift safely through life's currents, when, actually, the boat is stuck on a sandbar. They would be better off to rock the boat and try to shake it loose.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz

wisdom.quote: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, "The Second Sin"

wisdom.quote: A child becomes an adult when he realizes that he has a right not only to be right but also to be wrong.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin (1973) "Childhood"

wisdom.quote: Happiness is an imaginary condition, formerly attributed by the living to the dead, now usually attributed by adults to children, and by children to adults.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin (1973) "Emotions"

wisdom.quote: Formerly, when religion was strong and science weak, men mistook magic for medicine; now, when science is strong and religion weak, men mistake medicine for magic.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin (1973) "Science and Scientism"

wisdom.quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin (1973) "Social Relations"

wisdom.quote: People often say that this person is or that person has not yet found himself. But the self is not something that one finds. It is something one creates.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz, The Second Sin, 1973

wisdom.quote: Talent is nothing but a prolonged period of attention and shortened period of mental assimilation.
wisdom.author: Konstantin Stanislavsky

wisdom.quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
wisdom.author: Sir Richard Steele

wisdom.quote: Whenever you commend, add your reasons for doing so; it is this which distinguishes the approbation of a man of sense from the flattery of sycophants and admiration of fools.
wisdom.author: Sir Richard Steele

wisdom.quote: The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want.
wisdom.author: Ben Stein

wisdom.quote: I came to realize that life lived to help others is the only one that matters and that it is my duty...This is my highest and best use as a human.
wisdom.author: Ben Stein, E! Online, 12-20-03

wisdom.quote: Society, my dear, is like salt water, good to swim in but hard to swallow.
wisdom.author: Arthur Stringer, "The Silver Poppy"

wisdom.quote: She had learned the self-deprecating ways of the woman who does not want to be thought hard and grasping, but her artifices could not always cover the nakedness of her need to excel.
wisdom.author: Faith Sullivan, The Cape Ann, 1988

wisdom.quote: Self-development is a higher duty than self-sacrifice.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

wisdom.quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand on.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

wisdom.quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand upon.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

wisdom.quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton, 1890

wisdom.quote: With age come the inner, the higher life. Who would be forever young, to dwell always in externals?
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton, O Magazine, October 2003

wisdom.quote: Art has never been made while thinking of art.
wisdom.author: Niko Stumpo, The Wooster Collective,  December 2006

wisdom.quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
wisdom.author: Freya Madeline Stark

wisdom.quote: A human being is only interesting if he's in contact with himself. I learned you have to trust yourself, be what you are, and do what you ought to do the way you should do it. You have got to discover you, what you do, and trust it.
wisdom.author: Barbra Streisand

wisdom.quote: Art does not exist only to entertain, but also to challenge one to think, to provoke, even to disturb, in a constant search for truth.
wisdom.author: Barbra Streisand

wisdom.quote: You have got to discover you, what you do, and trust it.
wisdom.author: Barbra Streisand

wisdom.quote: Ninety percent of everything is crap.
wisdom.author: Theodore Sturgeon

wisdom.quote: A dinner lubricates business.
wisdom.author: Lord William Stowell

wisdom.quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
wisdom.author: Joseph Stalin

wisdom.quote: The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.
wisdom.author: Joseph Stalin

wisdom.quote: You do not lament the loss of hair of one who has been beheaded.
wisdom.author: Joseph Stalin

wisdom.quote: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate me away from those who are still undecided.
wisdom.author: Casey Stengel

wisdom.quote: There comes a time in every man's life and I've had many of them.
wisdom.author: Casey Stengel

wisdom.quote: I reached for sleep and drew it round me like a blanket muffling pain and thought together in the merciful dark.
wisdom.author: Mary Stewart

wisdom.quote: Silent gratitude isn't much use to anyone.
wisdom.author: Gladys Bronwyn Stern

wisdom.quote: The emotions that good hunters need to cultivate are love and service more than courage. The sentiments of the hunt then become translated into art.
wisdom.author: James Swan, In Defense of Hunting

wisdom.quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.
wisdom.author: General Joseph W. Stilwell, Motto

wisdom.quote: The summer night is like a perfection of thought.
wisdom.author: Wallace Stevens

wisdom.quote: I catnap now and then, but I think while I nap, so it's not a waste of time.
wisdom.author: Martha Stewart, in McCall's

wisdom.quote: Life is too complicated not to be orderly.
wisdom.author: Martha Stewart, quoted in Harper's Bazaar

wisdom.quote: Passion is the quickest to develop, and the quickest to fade. Intimacy develops more slowly, and commitment more gradually still.
wisdom.author: Robert Sternberg

wisdom.quote: If you are out there, you have fans. You have a champion. Organize these champions. You probably know who your best customers are. Make them a star on your site. Make those people your superheroes.
wisdom.author: Jamison Stafford, Building Buzz for Your Web Project, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: I just never let anything bother me, man. I know myself really well. Nobody's opinion of me can shake my opinion of myself.
wisdom.author: Ruben Studdard, Seventeen Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: People don't have to like or support you, so you always have to say thank you.
wisdom.author: Ruben Studdard, Seventeen Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: You can be confident and secure and know that you do a good job at what you do. But you don't know to be arrogant about it.
wisdom.author: Ruben Studdard, Seventeen Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: You have to learn that if you start making sure you feel good, everything will be okay.
wisdom.author: Ruben Studdard, Seventeen Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: I have always regarded myself as the pillar of my life.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep

wisdom.quote: Being a celebrity has taught me to hide, but being an actor has opened my soul.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: Empathy is at the heart of the actor's art.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: If you have been touched by the success fairy, people think you know why. People think success breeds enlightenment and you are duty-bound to spread around like manure. Fertilize those young minds!
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: My success has depended wholly on putting things over on people, so I'm not sure that I'm that great a role model. I am, however, an expert on pretending to be an expert on pretending to be an expert.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: One is obliged to do a great deal of kissing in my line of work: air kissing, [butt] kissing, kissing up, and of course actual kissing. Much like hookers, actors have to do it with people we may not like or even know.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: Pretending is not just play. Pretending is imagined possibility. Pretending, or acting, is a very valuable life skill and we do it all the time.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: This is your time and it feels normal to you, but really, there is no normal. There's only change and resistance to it and then more change.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: We change who we are to fit the exogenous of our time, and not just strategically or to our own advantage, sometimes sympathetically without our even knowing it for the betterment of the whole group.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: While I am overwhelmingly proud of work that I, believe me, did not do on my own, I can assure you that awards have very little bearing on my own personal happiness, my own sense of well-being and purpose in the world.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: Women are better at acting then men. Why? Because we have to be. If successfully convincing someone bigger than you are of something he doesn't want to know is a survival skill, this is how women have survived through the millennia.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: You don't have to be famous. You just have to make your mother and father proud of you.
wisdom.author: Meryl Streep, Barnard Commencement Speech, 2010

wisdom.quote: If you live long enough, the venerability factor creeps in; first, you get accused of things you never did, and later, credited for virtues you never had.
wisdom.author: I. F. Stone

wisdom.quote: Engineering is the art of organizing and directing men and controlling the forces and materials of nature for the benefit of the human race.
wisdom.author: Henry G. Stott, 1907

wisdom.quote: An expert is a person who avoids small error as he sweeps on to the grand fallacy.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Stolberg

wisdom.quote: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
wisdom.author: Henry Stimson

wisdom.quote: Silent gratitude isn't very much use to anyone.
wisdom.author: Gertrude Stein

wisdom.quote: We are always the same age inside.
wisdom.author: Gertrude Stein

wisdom.quote: It takes a lot of time to be a genius, you have to sit around so much doing nothing, really doing nothing.
wisdom.author: Gertrude Stein, Everybody's Autobiography (1937)

wisdom.quote: Everybody knows if you are too careful you are so occupied in being careful that you are sure to stumble over something.
wisdom.author: Gertrude Stein, Everybody's Autobiography, 1937

wisdom.quote: In the United States there is more space where nobody is than where anybody is. That is what makes America what it is.
wisdom.author: Gertrude Stein, The Geographical History of America (1936)

wisdom.quote: I hate cameras. They are so much more sure than I am about everything.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: Man is the only kind of varmint who sets his own trap, baits it, then steps on it.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: No one wants advice, only collaboration.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: No-one wants advice only corroboration.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, "Once There Was A War"  1943

wisdom.quote: It doesn't matter that Cathy was what I have called a monster. Perhaps we can't understand Cathy, but on the other hand we are capable of many things in all directions, of great virtues and great sins. And who in his mind has not probed the black water?
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, East of Eden

wisdom.quote: It would be absurd if we did not understand both angels and devils, since we invented them.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, East of Eden, Chapter 13, Part II

wisdom.quote: In the hearts and minds of the people, the grapes of wrath were growing heavy for the vintage.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath

wisdom.quote: I know this--a man got to do what he got to do.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath (1939)

wisdom.quote: Man, unlike any other thing organic or inorganic in the universe, grows beyond his work, walks up the stairs of his concepts, emerges ahead of his accomplishments.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath (1939)

wisdom.quote: One of the things about being a grown-up is learning how to act right even when you feel wrong.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: Sometimes a good exit is all you can ask for.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: Sometimes you feel other people's pain worse than your own. We're armored against our own troubles. We can't afford to give in to despair. Then you see someone else struggling, and it breaks your... heart.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: The present is a rope stretched over the past. The secret to walking it is, you never look down.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: There ain't no such thing as wrong food.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: There are so many different ways lives work out, so many stories, and every one of them is precious: full of joy and heartbreak, and a fair amount of situation comedy.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: You never can see into someone else's marriage.
wisdom.author: Sean Stewart, Perfect Circle, 2004

wisdom.quote: Pride is a powerful narcotic, but it doesn't do much for the auto-immune system.
wisdom.author: Stuart Stevens, Northern Exposure, Brains, Know-How, and Native Intelligence, 1990

wisdom.quote: There's a dark side to each and every human soul. We wish we were Obi-Wan Kenobi, and for the most part we are, but there's a little Darth Vader in all of us. Thing is, this ain't no either or proposition. We're talking about dialectics, the good and the bad merging into us. You can run but you can't hide. My experience? Face the darkness, stare it down. Own it. As brother Nietzsche said, being human is a complicated gig. Give that old dark night of the soul a hug! Howl the eternal yes!
wisdom.author: Stuart Stevens, Northern Exposure, Jules et Joel, 1991

wisdom.quote: I agree with everything you say, but I would attack to the death your right to say it.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: I think age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: If an idea's worth having once, it's worth having twice.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: If Beethoven had been killed in a plane crash at the age of 22, it would have changed the history of music... and of aviation.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: It is better to be quotable than to be honest.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: The days of the digital watch are numbered.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: The truth is always a compound of two half- truths, and you never reach it, because there is always something more to say.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard

wisdom.quote: Skill without imagination is craftsmanship and gives us many useful objects such as wickerwork picnic baskets. Imagination without skill gives us modern art.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, "Artist Descending a Staircase"

wisdom.quote: It's not the voting that's democracy, it's the counting.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Jumpers (1972) act 1

wisdom.quote: We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead

wisdom.quote: Eternity's a terrible thought. I mean, where's it all going to end?
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead (1967)

wisdom.quote: We do on stage things that are supposed to happen off. Which is a kind of integrity, if you look on every exit as being an entrance somewhere else.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead (1967)

wisdom.quote: We're actors - we're the opposite of people.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead (1967)

wisdom.quote: The bad end unhappily, the good unluckily. That is what tragedy means.
wisdom.author: Tom Stoppard, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead, 1967

wisdom.quote: This is our purpose: to make as meaningful as possible this life that has been bestowed upon us; to live in such a way that we may be proud of ourselves; to act in such a way that some part of us lives on.
wisdom.author: Oswald Spengler

wisdom.quote: Socialism is nothing but the capitalism of the lower classes.
wisdom.author: Oswald Spengler, The Hour of Decision, 1933

wisdom.quote: By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
wisdom.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

wisdom.quote: It is said that if Noah's ark had had to be built by a company; they would not have laid the keel yet; and it may be so. What is many men's business is nobody's business. The greatest things are accomplished by individual men.
wisdom.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
wisdom.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

wisdom.quote: You cannot slander human nature; it is worse than words can paint it.
wisdom.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

wisdom.quote: An idea isn't worth that much. It's the execution of the idea that has value. If you can't convince one other person that this is something to devote your life to, then it's not worth it.
wisdom.author: Joel Spolsky, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Every day that we spent not improving our products was a wasted day.
wisdom.author: Joel Spolsky, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: Never put yourself in a position that will put yourself at risk if you make the wrong decision. We spent cash on everything. It's fashionable to make 'bet the company' decisions, but don't do it.
wisdom.author: Joel Spolsky, Sink or Swim, SXSW 2006

wisdom.quote: 'Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today.' Under the influence of this pestilent morality, I am forever letting tomorrow's work slop backwards into today's, and doing painfully and nervously today what I could do quickly and easily tomorrow.
wisdom.author: J. A. Spender

wisdom.quote: A free society is one where it is safe to be unpopular.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: I sometimes marvel at the extraordinary docility with which americans submit to speeches.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: If we value the pursuit of knowledge, we must be free to follow wherever that search may lead us. The free mind is no barking dog to be tethered on a ten-foot chain.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: Public confidence in the integrity of the Government is indispensable to faith in democracy; and when we lose faith in the system, we have lost faith in everything we fight and spend for.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: Self-criticism is the secret weapon of democracy, and candor and confession are good for the public soul
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: The hardest thing about any political campaign is how to win without proving that you are unworthy of winning.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: There is a New America every morning when we wake up. It is upon us whether we will it or not.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

wisdom.quote: Man does not live by words alone, despite the fact that sometimes he has to eat them.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., quoted by Human Behavior, May 1978

wisdom.quote: I believe in the forgiveness of sin and the redemption of ignorance.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., retort to a heckler asking him to state his beliefs, Time, November 1, 1963

wisdom.quote: If we value the pursuit of knowledge, we must be free to follow wherever that search may lead us. The free mind is not a barking dog, to be tethered on a ten-foot chain.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., speech at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, October 8, 1952

wisdom.quote: I have been thinking that I would make a proposition to my Republican friends... that if they will stop telling lies about the Democrats, we will stop telling the truth about them.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., Speech during 1952 Presidential Campaign

wisdom.quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., Speech in Detroit, 7 Oct. 1952

wisdom.quote: My definition of a free society is where it's safe to be unpopular.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., Speech in Detroit, Michigan, 1952

wisdom.quote: In America any boy may become President and I suppose it's just one of the risks he takes.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., Speech in Indianapolis, 26 Sept. 1952

wisdom.quote: Words calculated to catch everyone may catch no one.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., speech to Democratic National Convention, Chicago, Illinois, July 21, 1952

wisdom.quote: What counts now is not just what we are against, but what we are for. Who leads us is less important than what leads us-what convictions, what courage, what faith-win or lose. A man doesn't save a century, or a civilization, but a militant party wedded to a principal can.
wisdom.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr., Welcoming address before the Democratic national convention, Chicago, Illinois, July 21, 1952

wisdom.quote: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: If your morals make you dreary, depend on it , they are wrong.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: It is not much for its beauty that makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanates from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: It is perhaps a more fortunate destiny to have a taste for collecting shells than to be born a millionaire.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: Perpetual devotion to what a man calls his business, is only to be sustained by perpetual neglect of many other things.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: Politics is perhaps the only profession for which no preparation is thought necessary.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: The cruelest lies are often told in silence.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: The most beautiful adventures are not those we go to seek.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: To know what you prefer instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you you ought to prefer, is to have kept your soul alive.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: You cannot run away from a weakness; you must sometimes fight it out or perish. And if that be so, why not now, and where you stand?
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

wisdom.quote: Books are good enough in their own way, but they are a mighty bloodless substitute for life.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson, An Apology for Idlers, 1874

wisdom.quote: There is no duty we so much underrate as the as the duty of being happy.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson, An Apology for Idlers, 1874

wisdom.quote: Every one lives by selling something, whatever be his right to it.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson, Beggars, 1903

wisdom.quote: To hold the same views at forty as we did at twenty is to have been stupefied for a score of years, and take rank, not as a prophet, but as an unteachable brat, well birched and none the wiser.
wisdom.author: Robert Louis Stevenson, Crabbed Age and Youth, 1874

wisdom.quote: Be not astonished at new ideas; for it is well known to you that a thing does not therefore cease to be true because it is not accepted by many.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: Blessed are the weak who think that they are good because they have no claws.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: God is a thing that thinks.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: I saw that all things I feared, and which feared me, had nothing good or bad in them save insofar as the mind was affected by them.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza

wisdom.quote: All the objects pursued by the multitude not only bring no remedy that tends to preserve our being, but even act as hinderances, causing the death not seldom of those who possess them, and always of those who are possessed by them.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, On the Improvement of the Understanding

wisdom.quote: Blessedness is not the reward of virtue, but virtue itself; neither do we rejoice therein, because we control our lusts, but contrariwise, because we rejoice therein, we are able to control our lusts.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, The Ethics

wisdom.quote: If men were born free, they would, so long as they remained free, form no conception of good and evil.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, The Ethics

wisdom.quote: The highest endeavor of the mind, and the highest virtue, is to understand things by intuition.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, The Ethics

wisdom.quote: The mind has greater power over the emotions, and is less subject thereto, insofar as it understands all things to be necessary.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, The Ethics

wisdom.quote: For peace is not mere absence of war, but is a virtue that springs from the force of character.
wisdom.author: Baruch Spinoza, Tractatus Politicus

wisdom.quote: A stern discipline pervades all nature, which is a little cruel that it may be very kind.
wisdom.author: Edmund Spenser

wisdom.quote: What more felicity can fall to creature, than to enjoy delight with liberty.
wisdom.author: Edmund Spenser, 'The Fate of the Butterfly,' 1591

wisdom.quote: Sleep after toil, port after stormy seas, ease after war, death after life does greatly please.
wisdom.author: Edmund Spenser, 1590

wisdom.quote: If I had my life to live over... I'd dare to make more mistakes next time.
wisdom.author: Nadine Stair

wisdom.quote: If all the rich people in the world divided up their money among themselves there wouldn't be enough to go around.
wisdom.author: Christina Stead, House of All Nations (1938) "Credo"

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more admirable than the fortitude with which millionaires tolerate the disadvantages of their wealth.
wisdom.author: Rex Stout

wisdom.quote: I'm going to a special place when I die, but I want to make sure my life is special while I'm here.
wisdom.author: Payne Stewart

wisdom.quote: The particular human chain we're part of is central to our individual identity.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Stone

wisdom.quote: 'So you think *I'm* the murderer? What do I have to do to convince you that I'm not, be the next victim?' 'Well, that would be a start.'
wisdom.author: Peter Stone, Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn in "Charade", 1963

wisdom.quote: Common sense is the knack of seeing things as they are, and doing things as they ought to be done.
wisdom.author: C. E. Stowe

wisdom.quote: Ever heard Victoria's REAL secret? Too much support hurts.
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 03-17-08

wisdom.quote: I'm NOT short. I prefer to think there is simply more space above my head for word balloons full of devastatingly pithy witticisms.
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 05-09-2006

wisdom.quote: Why is it OK to love without a reason, but anger requires justification?
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 08-08-2006

wisdom.quote: Wasting sarcasm is a sin.
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 08-16-2005

wisdom.quote: Destiny is for people who are too lazy to create alternate timelines.
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 10-05-11

wisdom.quote: Don't get yourself arrested and make your day worse! If you need to vent, just smash something that's already broken! You can't get in trouble for wrecking the unsalvageable!
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 11-06-06

wisdom.quote: The only good ideas are the ones I can take credit for.
wisdom.author: R. Stevens, Diesel Sweeties, 11-13-06

wisdom.quote: I am open to receive with every breath I breathe.
wisdom.author: Michael Sun

wisdom.quote: It's not about vein' mad at everything. It's about bein' REALLY mad at the right stuff.
wisdom.author: Ice T., Late Night with Jimmy Fallon, 06-13-12

wisdom.quote: The desire for safety stands against every great and noble enterprise.
wisdom.author: Marcus Claudius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: We are all imperfect. We cannot expect perfect government.
wisdom.author: William Howard Taft, Address, Washington, D.C., May 8, 1909

wisdom.quote: I have spent my days stringing and unstringing my instrument, while the song I came to sing remains unsung.
wisdom.author: Rabindranath Tagore

wisdom.quote: It is very simple to be happy, but it is very difficult to be simple.
wisdom.author: Rabindranath Tagore

wisdom.quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
wisdom.author: Rabindranath Tagore

wisdom.quote: What children take from us, they give�We become people who feel more deeply, question more deeply, hurt more deeply, and love more deeply.
wisdom.author: Sonia Taitz, O Magazine, May 2003

wisdom.quote: The men who had hated [the book], and had not particularly loved Helv�tius, flocked round him now. Voltaire forgave him all injuries, intentional or unintentional. 'What a fuss about an omelette!' he had exclaimed when he heard of the burning. How abominably unjust to persecute a man for such an airy trifle as that! 'I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it,' was his attitude now.
wisdom.author: S. G. Tallentyre, referring to Voltaire. Often attributed to Voltaire.

wisdom.quote: Eat a third and drink a third and leave the remaining third of your stomach empty. Then, when you get angry, there will be sufficient room for your rage.
wisdom.author: Babylonian Talmud, tractate Gittin

wisdom.quote: Oil prices have fallen lately. We include this news for the benefit of gas stations, which otherwise wouldn't learn of it for six months.
wisdom.author: Bill Tammeus, in Toronto's National Newspaper, 1991

wisdom.quote: He had a certain frankness and generosity, qualities indeed which turn to a man's ruin, unless tempered with discretion.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: I am my nearest neighbour.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: In stirring up tumult and strife, the worst men can do the most, but peace and quiet cannot be established without virtue.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: It is found by experience that admirable laws and right precedents among the good have their origin in the misdeeds of others.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: Keen at the start, but careless at the end.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: No hatred is so bitter as that of near relations.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: That cannot be safe which is not honourable.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: There can never be a complete confidence in a power which is excessive.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus

wisdom.quote: It is the rare fortuene of these days that one may think what one likes and say what one thinks.
wisdom.author: Cornelius Tacitus, Histories

wisdom.quote: There are two things that will be believed of any man whatsoever, and one of them is that he has taken to drink.
wisdom.author: Booth Tarkington, Penrod (1914)

wisdom.quote: Each person's life is lived as a series of conversations.
wisdom.author: Deborah Tannen

wisdom.quote: The more you chase money, the harder it is to catch it.
wisdom.author: Mike Tatum, Cashing In or Selling Out, SXSW 2006
