wisdom.quote: If you can't change your fate, change your attitude.
wisdom.author: Amy Tan

wisdom.quote: Memory feeds imagination.
wisdom.author: Amy Tan

wisdom.quote: You see what power is - holding someone else's fear in your hand and showing it to them!
wisdom.author: Amy Tan

wisdom.quote: Just as animal research tells us that gluttony and sloth are side effects of a drive to accumulate body fat, it also says that eating in moderation and being physically active (literally, having the energy to exercise) are not evidence of moral rectitude. Rather, they're the metabolic benefits of a body that's programmed to remain lean.
wisdom.author: Gary Taubes, Why We Get Fat: And What to Do About It, 2010

wisdom.quote: The point to keep in mind is that you don't lose fat because you cut calories; you lose fat because you cut out the foods that make you fat-the carbohydrates.
wisdom.author: Gary Taubes, Why We Get Fat: And What to Do About It, 2010

wisdom.quote: We don't get fat because we overeat; we overeat because we're getting fat.
wisdom.author: Gary Taubes, Why We Get Fat: And What to Do About It, 2010

wisdom.quote: The nice thing about standards is that there are so many of them to choose from.
wisdom.author: Andrew S. Tanenbaum

wisdom.quote: Players win games, teams win championships.
wisdom.author: Bill Taylor

wisdom.quote: A bore is a man who, when you ask him how he is, tells you.
wisdom.author: Bert Leston Taylor, The So-Called Human Race (1922)

wisdom.quote: Painting in watercolor is like walking a tight-rope; one must achieve a perfect balance between what the paint wants to do and what the artist wants to do, or all is lost.
wisdom.author: Mary C. Taylor, Watercolor Bold and Free

wisdom.quote: The roots of true achievement lie in the will to become the best that you can become.
wisdom.author: Harold Taylor

wisdom.quote: Any fine morning, a power saw can fell a tree that took a thousand years to grow.
wisdom.author: Edwin Teale

wisdom.quote: For man, autumn is a time of harvest, of gathering together. For nature, it is a time of sowing, of scattering abroad.
wisdom.author: Edwin Teale

wisdom.quote: It is impossible to make people understand their ignorance; for it requires knowledge to perceive it and therefore he that can perceive it hath it not.
wisdom.author: Jeremy Taylor

wisdom.quote: Mistake not. Those pleasures are not pleasures that trouble the quiet and tranquillity of thy life.
wisdom.author: Jeremy Taylor

wisdom.quote: Temptation rarely comes in working hours. It is in their leisure time that men are made or marred.
wisdom.author: W. N. Taylor

wisdom.quote: Gratitude is our most direct line to God and the angels. If we take the time, no matter how crazy and troubled we feel, we can find something to be thankful for.
wisdom.author: Terry Lynn Taylor

wisdom.quote: A fact is a simple statement that everyone believes. It is innocent, unless found guilty. A hypothesis is a novel suggestion that no one wants to believe. It is guilty, until found effective.
wisdom.author: Edward Teller

wisdom.quote: Life improves slowly and goes wrong fast, and only catastrophe is clearly visible.
wisdom.author: Edward Teller

wisdom.quote: Two paradoxes are better than one; they may even suggest a solution.
wisdom.author: Edward Teller

wisdom.quote: Beware of too much laughter, for it deadens the mind and produces oblivion.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Customs are more powerful than laws.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: For the sake of peace one may lie, but peace itself should never be a lie.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: God said: you must teach, as I taught, without a fee.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: He that gives should never remember, he that receives should never forget.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Hold no man responsible for what he says in his grief.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Humor the sons of the poor, for they give science its splendor.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Learning is achieved only in company.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Live well. It is the greatest revenge.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Never expose yourself unnecessarily to danger; a miracle may not save you...and if it does, it will be deducted from your share of luck or merit.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Until a child is one year old it is incapable of sin.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Who can protest and does not, is an accomplice in the act.
wisdom.author: The Talmud

wisdom.quote: Whoever destroys a single life is as guilty as though he had destroyed the entire world; and whoever rescues a single life earns as much merit as though he had rescued the entire world.
wisdom.author: The Talmud, Mishna. Sanhedrin

wisdom.quote: Be eager to fulfill the smallest duty and flee from transgression for one duty includes another and one transgression induces another transgression.
wisdom.author: The Talmud, We Have Met the Enemy: Self-Control in an Age of Excess, 2011

wisdom.quote: Opportunity is rare, and a wise man will never let it go by him.
wisdom.author: Bayard Taylor

wisdom.quote: Coincidences are a true paradox... on the one hand they seem to be the source of our greatest irrationalities--seeing causal connections when science tells us they aren't there. On the other hand, some of our greatest feats of scientific discovery depend on coincidences.
wisdom.author: Josh Tenenbaum, quoted in "The Power of Coincidence," Psychology Today, July 2004

wisdom.quote: Acceptance is not submission; it is acknowledgment of the facts of a situation. Then deciding what you're going to do about it.
wisdom.author: Kathleen Casey Theisen

wisdom.quote: A sailor without a destination cannot hope for a favorable wind.
wisdom.author: Leon Tec, M.D.

wisdom.quote: Never refuse any advance of friendship, for if nine out of ten bring you nothing, one alone may repay you.
wisdom.author: Madame de Tencin

wisdom.quote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
wisdom.author: Nikola Tesla

wisdom.quote: Today's scientists have substituted mathematics for experiments, and they wander off through equation after equation, and eventually build a structure which has no relation to reality.
wisdom.author: Nikola Tesla, Modern Mechanics and Inventions, July, 1934

wisdom.quote: The scientists of today think deeply instead of clearly. One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane.
wisdom.author: Nikola Tesla, Modern Mechanics and Inventions. July, 1934

wisdom.quote: If Edison had a needle to find in a haystack, he would proceed at once with the diligence of the bee to examine straw after straw until he found the object of his search... I was a sorry witness of such doings, knowing that a little theory and calculation would have saved him ninety per cent of his labor.
wisdom.author: Nikola Tesla, New York Times, October 19, 1931

wisdom.quote: The cloning of humans is on most of the lists of things to worry about from Science, along with behaviour control, genetic engineering, transplanted heads, computer poetry and the unrestrained growth of plastic flowers.
wisdom.author: Lewis Thomas

wisdom.quote: The great thing about human language is that it prevents us from sticking to the matter at hand.
wisdom.author: Lewis Thomas

wisdom.quote: Worrying is the most natural and spontaneous of all human functions. It is time to acknowledge this, perhaps even to learn to do it better.
wisdom.author: Lewis Thomas

wisdom.quote: Can I ever know you Or you know me?
wisdom.author: Sara Teasdale

wisdom.quote: I am not yours, not lost in you, Not lost, although I long to be Lost as a candle lit at noon, Lost as a snowflake in the sea. You love me, and I find you still A spirit beautiful and bright, Yet I am I, who long to be Lost as a light is lost in light.
wisdom.author: Sara Teasdale

wisdom.quote: I make the most of all that comes, And the least of all that goes.
wisdom.author: Sara Teasdale

wisdom.quote: Attacking is the only secret. Dare and the world always yields; or if it beats you sometimes, dare it again and it will succumb.
wisdom.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

wisdom.quote: Bravery never goes out of fashion.
wisdom.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

wisdom.quote: To love and win is the best thing. To love and lose, the next best thing.
wisdom.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

wisdom.quote: I would rather not know how to write and have something to say than know how to write and have nothing to say.
wisdom.author: Enrique Tessieri

wisdom.quote: There shall be eternal summer in the grateful heart.
wisdom.author: Celia Thaxter

wisdom.quote: I kill when I hunt and do not apologize for that, although I reserve the right to think about its implications. I also hunt without killing- whether by accident or design-and I do not apologize for that either. There is room in longbow country for a spectrum of tastes and attitudes, and that is as it should be.
wisdom.author: E. Donnall Thomas, Jr.

wisdom.quote: Winning is not everything but wanting to win is.
wisdom.author: Vincent Thomas

wisdom.quote: Hello seeker! Now don't feel alone here in the New Age, because there's a seeker born every minute.
wisdom.author: Firesign Theatre

wisdom.quote: After thirty nine years this is all I've done.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas

wisdom.quote: I just drank eighteen whiskies. That must be a record.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas

wisdom.quote: Do not go gentle into that good night, Old age should burn and rave at close of day; Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas, Collected poems (1952)

wisdom.quote: An alcoholic is someone you don't like who drinks as much as you do.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas, in Constantine Fitzgibbon, Life of Dylan Thomas (1965)

wisdom.quote: Someone's boring me. I think it's me.
wisdom.author: Dylan Thomas, in Rayner Heppenstall, Four Absentees (1960)

wisdom.quote: I choose the likely man in preference to the rich man; I want a man without money rather than money without a man.
wisdom.author: Themistocles, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: I have with me two gods, Persuasion and Compulsion.
wisdom.author: Themistocles, from Plutarch, Lives

wisdom.quote: The past is the only dead thing that smells sweet.
wisdom.author: Edward Thomas, Poems (1917) "Early One Morning"

wisdom.quote: When the messenger arrives and says 'Don't shoot the messenger,' it's a good idea to be prepared to shoot the messenger, just in case.
wisdom.author: Howard Tayler, Schlock Mercenary Webcomic

wisdom.quote: There's only so much you can do, but if somebody doesn't give you a chance there is nothing you can do.
wisdom.author: Charlize Theron, acceptance speech at Golden Globe Awards,  2004

wisdom.quote: Abundance is, in large part, an attitude.
wisdom.author: Sue Patton Thoele

wisdom.quote: The secret of a good life is to have the right loyalties and hold them in the right scale of values.
wisdom.author: Norman Thomas

wisdom.quote: The secret of a good life is to have the right loyalties and to hold them in the right scale of values.
wisdom.author: Norman Thomas

wisdom.quote: A multitude of words is no proof of a prudent mind.
wisdom.author: Thales

wisdom.quote: The past is certain, the future obscure.
wisdom.author: Thales

wisdom.quote: Know thyself.
wisdom.author: Thales, (The Seven Sages) from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Remember, Ginger Rogers did everything Fred Astaire did, but backwards and in high heels.
wisdom.author: Bob Thaves, "Frank and Ernest", 1982

wisdom.quote: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when my mother took me to see him in a department store, and he asked for my autograph.
wisdom.author: Shirley Temple

wisdom.quote: After two years in Washington, I often long for the realism and sincerity of Hollywood.
wisdom.author: Fred Thompson, Speech before the Commonwealth Club of California

wisdom.quote: Get on stage. A lot. Try stuff. Make your best stab and keep stabbing. If it's there in your heart, it will eventually find its way out. Or you will give up and have a prudent, contented life doing something else.
wisdom.author: Raymond Joseph Teller, Fury Letter written to Brian Brushwood, 10-18-93

wisdom.quote: I really feel as if the things we create together are not things we devised, but things we discovered, as if, in some sense, they were always there in us, waiting to be revealed, like the figure of Mercury waiting in a rough lump of marble.
wisdom.author: Raymond Joseph Teller, Fury Letter written to Brian Brushwood, 10-18-93

wisdom.quote: We always felt as if every show was the most important thing in the world, but knew if we bombed, we'd live.
wisdom.author: Raymond Joseph Teller, Fury Letter written to Brian Brushwood, 10-18-93

wisdom.quote: We did not start as friends, but as people who respected and admired each other. Crucial, absolutely crucial for a partnership. As soon as we could afford it, we ceased sharing lodgings. Equally crucial.
wisdom.author: Raymond Joseph Teller, Fury Letter written to Brian Brushwood, 10-18-93

wisdom.quote: We made a solemn vow not to take any job outside of show business. We borrowed money from parents and friends, rather than take that lethal job waiting tables. This forced us to take any job offered to us. Anything. We once did a show in the middle of the Benjamin Franklin Parkway in Philadelphia as part of a fashion show on a hot July night while all around our stage, a race-riot was fully underway. That's how serious we were about our vow.
wisdom.author: Raymond Joseph Teller, Fury Letter written to Brian Brushwood, 10-18-93

wisdom.quote: Conscience is, in most men, an anticipation of the opinion of others.
wisdom.author: Sir Henry Taylor

wisdom.quote: Shy and unready men are great betrayers of secrets; for there are few wants more urgent for the moment than the want of something to say.
wisdom.author: Sir Henry Taylor

wisdom.quote: The art of living easily as to money is to pitch your scale of living one degree below your means.
wisdom.author: Sir Henry Taylor

wisdom.quote: Nobody in the game of football should be called a genius. A genius is somebody like Norman Einstein.
wisdom.author: Joe Theismann, Former quarterback

wisdom.quote: The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Taylor

wisdom.quote: It is very strange that the years teach us patience - that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Taylor, "A Wreath of Roses"

wisdom.quote: Observe Everything.  Communicate Well.  Draw, Draw, Draw.
wisdom.author: Frank Thomas, Disney Animator, When asked to give advice to young animators

wisdom.quote: Now begins a torrent of words and a trickling of sense.
wisdom.author: Theocritus of Chios

wisdom.quote: Extensive traveling induces a feeling of encapsulation, and travel, so broadening at first, contracts the mind.
wisdom.author: Paul Theroux

wisdom.quote: Gain a modest reputation for being unreliable and you will never be asked to do a thing.
wisdom.author: Paul Theroux

wisdom.quote: Travel is only glamorous in retrospect.
wisdom.author: Paul Theroux, in The Washington Post

wisdom.quote: Fame lost its appeal for me when I went into a public restroom and an autograph seeker handed me a pen and paper under the stall door.
wisdom.author: Marlo Thomas

wisdom.quote: I wish someone would have told me that, just because I'm a girl, I don't have to get married.
wisdom.author: Marlo Thomas

wisdom.quote: Never face facts; if you do, you'll never get up in the morning.
wisdom.author: Marlo Thomas

wisdom.quote: One of the things about equality is not just that you be treated equally to a man, but that you treat yourself equally to the way you treat a man.
wisdom.author: Marlo Thomas

wisdom.quote: " i am a man, not a duck, llama, or fish, once a man, always a man"
wisdom.author: Sir Stuart Thomas

wisdom.quote: Good manners will open doors that the best education cannot.
wisdom.author: Clarence Thomas

wisdom.quote: Washington is the only place where sound travels faster than light.
wisdom.author: C. V. R. Thompson

wisdom.quote: Truth persuades by teaching, but does not teach by persuading.
wisdom.author: Quintus Septimius Tertullianus, Adversus Valentinianos

wisdom.quote: Out of the frying pan into the fire.
wisdom.author: Quintus Septimius Tertullianus, De Carne Christi

wisdom.quote: The most powerful factors in the world are clear ideas in the minds of energetic men of good will.
wisdom.author: J. Arthur Thomson

wisdom.quote: To send a letter is a good way to go somewhere without moving anything but your heart.
wisdom.author: Phyllis Theroux, in House Beautiful Magazine

wisdom.quote: The way to write American music is simple. All you have to do is be an American and then write any kind of music you wish.
wisdom.author: Virgil Thomson

wisdom.quote: In attempts to improve your character, know what is in your power and what is beyond it.
wisdom.author: Francis Thompson

wisdom.quote: Isn't it interesting that the same people who laugh at science fiction listen to weather forecasts and economists?
wisdom.author: Kelvin Throop III

wisdom.quote: Household tasks are easier and quicker when they are done by somebody else.
wisdom.author: James Thorpe

wisdom.quote: Man is asked to make of himself what he is supposed to become to fulfill his destiny.
wisdom.author: Paul Tillich

wisdom.quote: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself, in spite of being unacceptable.
wisdom.author: Paul Tillich

wisdom.quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
wisdom.author: Paul Tillich

wisdom.quote: Cynically speaking, one could say that it is true to life to be cynical about it.
wisdom.author: Paul Tillich, The Courage to Be

wisdom.quote: If you aren�t going to say something directly to someone�s face, than don�t use online as an opportunity to say it. It is this sense of bravery that people get when they are anonymous that gives the blogosphere a bad reputation.
wisdom.author: Mena Trott, Times Online, 12-06-06

wisdom.quote: We are none of us infallible--not even the youngest of us.
wisdom.author: W. H. Thompson

wisdom.quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
wisdom.author: Theophrastus, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: Europe was created by history. America was created by philosophy.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher

wisdom.quote: Europe will never be like America. Europe is a product of history. America is a product of philosophy.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher

wisdom.quote: I usually make up my mind about a man in ten seconds; and I very rarely change it.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher

wisdom.quote: If it is once again one against forty-eight, then I am very sorry for the forty-eight.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher

wisdom.quote: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher, in Observer April 4, 1989

wisdom.quote: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher, interview with Barbara Walters on ABC-TV, March 18, 1987

wisdom.quote: I think we've been through a period where too many people have been given to understand that if they have a problem, it's the government's job to cope with it. 'I have a problem, I'll get a grant.' 'I'm homeless, the government must house me.' They're casting their problem on society. And, you know, there is no such thing as society. There are individual men and women, and there are families. And no government can do anything except through people, and people must look to themselves first. It's our duty to look after ourselves and then, also to look after our neighbour. People have got the entitlements too much in mind, without the obligations. There's no such thing as entitlement, unless someone has first met an obligation
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher, talking to Women's Own magazine, October 31 1987

wisdom.quote: Because we don't think about future generations, they will never forget us.
wisdom.author: Henrik Tikkanen

wisdom.quote: Truly great madness cannot be achieved without significant intelligence.
wisdom.author: Henrik Tikkanen

wisdom.quote: Absence, with all its pains, is, by this charming moment, wiped away.
wisdom.author: James Thomson

wisdom.quote: Peace has to be created, in order to be maintained. It is the product of Faith, Strength, Energy, Will, Sympathy, Justice, Imagination, and the triumph of principle. It will never be achieved by passivity and quietism.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Thompson

wisdom.quote: If you're not part of the solution, you're part of the precipitate.
wisdom.author: Henry J. Tillman

wisdom.quote: Life is something that everyone should try at least once.
wisdom.author: Henry J. Tillman

wisdom.quote: Oregano is the spice of life.
wisdom.author: Henry J. Tillman

wisdom.quote: The saying "Getting there is half the fun" became obsolete with the advent of commercial airlines.
wisdom.author: Henry J. Tillman

wisdom.quote: The world is my lobster.
wisdom.author: Henry J. Tillman

wisdom.quote: Not going home is already like death.
wisdom.author: E. Catherine Tobler, Vanishing Act

wisdom.quote: A good book is the best of friends, the same today and forever.
wisdom.author: Martin Fraquhar Tupper

wisdom.quote: Well-timed silence hath more eloquence than speech.
wisdom.author: Martin Fraquhar Tupper

wisdom.quote: I have always noticed in politics how often men are ruined by having too good a memory.
wisdom.author: Alexis De Tocqueville

wisdom.quote: The people reign over the American political world as God rules over the universe. It is the cause and the end of all things; everything rises out of it and is absorbed back into it.
wisdom.author: Alexis De Tocqueville, Democracy in America, 1835

wisdom.quote: The surface of American society is covered with a layer of democratic paint, but from time to time one can see the old aristocratic colors breaking through.
wisdom.author: Alexis De Tocqueville, Democracy in America, 1835

wisdom.quote: There is hardly a political question in the United States which doesn't sooner or later turn into a judicial one.
wisdom.author: Alexis De Tocqueville, Democracy in America, 1835

wisdom.quote: Cast all your cares on God; that anchor holds.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

wisdom.quote: Hope smiles on the threshold of the year to come, whispering that it will be happier.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

wisdom.quote: The greater man the greater courtesy.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

wisdom.quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

wisdom.quote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam, 1850, line 27, stanza 4

wisdom.quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.
wisdom.author: Eckhart Tolle

wisdom.quote: Painting is an attempt to come to terms with life. There are as many solutions as there are human beings.
wisdom.author: George Tooker

wisdom.quote: The principles now planted in thy bosom will grow, and one day reach maturity; and in that maturity thou wilt find thy heaven or thy hell.
wisdom.author: David Thomas

wisdom.quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
wisdom.author: Frank Tibolt

wisdom.quote: In a free state there should be freedom of speech and thought.
wisdom.author: Tiberius

wisdom.quote: Ask not what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive... then go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.
wisdom.author: Howard Thurman

wisdom.quote: Follow the grain in your own wood.
wisdom.author: Howard Thurman

wisdom.quote: Real glory springs from the silent conquest of ourselves.
wisdom.author: Joseph P. Thompson

wisdom.quote: When you want something really bad and you close your eyes and wish for it-- God's the guy who ignores you.
wisdom.author: Caspian Tredwell-Owen,  and Alex Kurtzman, The Island, 2005

wisdom.quote: A good word is an easy obligation; but not to speak ill, requires only our silence, which costs nothing.
wisdom.author: John Tillotson

wisdom.quote: Ignorance and inconsideration are the two great causes of the ruin of mankind.
wisdom.author: John Tillotson

wisdom.quote: Anyone nit-picking enough to write a letter of correction to an editor doubtless deserves the error that provoked it.
wisdom.author: Alvin Toffler

wisdom.quote: Change is the process by which the future invades our lives.
wisdom.author: Alvin Toffler

wisdom.quote: The illiterate of the 21st century will not be those who cannot read and write, but those who cannot learn, unlearn, and relearn.
wisdom.author: Alvin Toffler

wisdom.quote: Never tell a man you can read him through and through; most people prefer to be thought enigmas.
wisdom.author: Marchioness Townsend

wisdom.quote: It would only take one generation of forgetfulness to put us back intellectually several hundred years.
wisdom.author: Dean Tollefson

wisdom.quote: That is what marriage really means: helping one another to reach the full status of being persons, responsible and autonomous beings who do not run away from life.
wisdom.author: Paul Tournier

wisdom.quote: Things do not change; we change.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden (1970)

wisdom.quote: Aim above morality. Be not simply good; be good for something.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden, 1854

wisdom.quote: I say beware of all enterprises that require new clothes, and not rather a new wearer of clothes.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden, 1854

wisdom.quote: It is an interesting question how far men would retain their relative rank if they were divested of their clothes.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden, 1854

wisdom.quote: The finest qualities of our nature, like the bloom on fruits, can be preserved only by the most delicate handling. Yet we do not treat ourselves nor one another thus tenderly.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden, Chapter 1: Economy

wisdom.quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden, Conclusion, 1854

wisdom.quote: Our houses are such unwieldy property that we are often imprisoned rather than housed in them.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden: Economy, 1854

wisdom.quote: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden: Higher Laws, 1854

wisdom.quote: How many a man has dated a new era in his life from the reading of a book.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden: Reading, 1854

wisdom.quote: Education is like a double-edged sword. It may be turned to dangerous uses if it is not properly handled.
wisdom.author: Wu Ting-Fang

wisdom.quote: [Spring is] a true reconstructionist.
wisdom.author: Henry Timrod

wisdom.quote: Going to trial with a lawyer who considers your whole life-style a Crime in Progress is not a happy prospect.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: If I'd written all the truth I knew for the past ten years, about 600 people - including me - would be rotting in prison cells from Rio to Seattle today. Absolute truth is a very rare and dangerous commodity in the context of professional journalism.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: It was the Law of the Sea, they said. Civilization ends at the waterline. Beyond that, we all enter the food chain, and not always right at the top.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: No man is so foolish but he may sometimes give another good counsel, and no man so wise that he may not easily err if he takes no other counsel than his own. He that is taught only by himself has a fool for a master.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: When the going gets weird, the weird turn pro.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.quote: Buy the ticket take the Ride
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

wisdom.quote: The TV business is uglier than most things. It is normally perceived as some kind of cruel and shallow money trench through the heart of the journalism industry, a long plastic hallway where thieves and pimps run free and good men die like dogs, for no good reason.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson, San Francisco Examiner, 1985

wisdom.quote: Traditions are group efforts to keep the unexpected from happening.
wisdom.author: Barbara Tober

wisdom.quote: Getting there isn't half the fun - it's all the fun.
wisdom.author: Robert Townsend

wisdom.quote: Old age is the most unexpected of all the things that happen to a man.
wisdom.author: Leon Trotsky

wisdom.quote: Socialism needs democracy like the human body needs oxygen.
wisdom.author: Leon Trotsky

wisdom.quote: Old age is the most unexpected of things that can happen to a man.
wisdom.author: Leon Trotsky, Diary in Exile (1959)

wisdom.quote: Bureaucracy and social harmony are inversely proportional to each other.
wisdom.author: Leon Trotsky, The Revolution Betrayed p.41

wisdom.quote: In wildness is the preservation of the world.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: It is as hard to see one's self as to look backwards without turning around.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: It is never too late to give up your prejudices.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: It is pleasant to have been to a place the way a river went.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Live each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influences of each.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Many go fishing without knowing it is fish they are after.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Men are born to succeed, not fail.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Men have become the tools of their tools.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Most are engaged in business the greater part of their lives, because the soul abhors a vacuum and they have not discovered any continuous employment for man's nobler faculties.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Most men cry better than they speak. You get more nurture out of them by pinching than addressing them.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: My friend is one... who take me for what I am.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Public opinion is a weak tyrant compared with our own private opinion. What a man thinks of himself, that is which determines, or rather indicates, his fate.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Some circumstantial evidence is very strong, as when you find a trout in the milk.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Thank God men cannot as yet fly and lay waste the sky as well as the earth!
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: That man is the richest whose pleasures are the cheapest.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: The character inherent in the American people has done all that has been accomplished; and it would have done somewhat more, if the government had not sometimes got in its way.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: All human beings should try to learn before they die what they are running from, and to, and why.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: He knows all about art, but he doesn't know what he likes.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: He who hesitates is sometimes saved.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: Human Dignity has gleamed only now and then and here and there, in lonely splendor, throughout the ages, a hope of the better men, never an achievement of the majority.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: I hate women because they always know where things are.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: I loathe the expression "What makes him tick." It is the American mind, looking for simple and singular solution, that uses the foolish expression. A person not only ticks, he also chimes and strikes the hour, falls and breaks and has to be put together again, and sometimes stops like an electric clock in a thunderstorm.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: I used to wake up at 4 A.M. and start sneezing, sometimes for five hours. I tried to find out what sort of allergy I had but finally came to the conclusion that it must be an allergy to consciousness.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: It had only one fault. It was kind of lousy.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: Nowadays men lead lives of noisy desperation.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: The only rules comedy can tolerate are those of taste, and the only limitations those of libel.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: The paths of glory at least lead to the grave, but the paths of duty may not get you any where.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: The wit makes fun of other persons; the satirist makes fun of the world; the humorist makes fun of himself, but in so doing, he identifies himself with people--that is, people everywhere, not for the purpose of taking them apart, but simply revealing their true nature.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: There are two kinds of light--the glow that illuminates, and the glare that obscures.
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: Why do you have to be a nonconformist like everybody else?
wisdom.author: James Thurber

wisdom.quote: I do not have a psychiatrist and I do not want one, for the simple reason that if he listened to me long enough, he might become disturbed.
wisdom.author: James Thurber, "Carpe Noctem, If You Can", in "Credos and Curios" (1962)

wisdom.quote: The wit makes fun of other persons; the satirist makes fun of the world; the humorist makes fun of himself.
wisdom.author: James Thurber, in Edward R. Murrow television interview

wisdom.quote: Her own mother lived the latter years of her life in the horrible suspicion that electricity was dripping invisibly all over the house.
wisdom.author: James Thurber, My Life and Hard Times (1933)

wisdom.quote: Well, if I called the wrong number, why did you answer the phone?
wisdom.author: James Thurber, New Yorker cartoon caption, June 5, 1937

wisdom.quote: You might as well fall flat on your face as lean over too far backward.
wisdom.author: James Thurber, New Yorker, Apr. 29, 1939 "The Bear Who Let It Alone"

wisdom.quote: I am a man, and whatever concerns humanity is of interest to me.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: I am a man: I hold that nothing human is alien to me.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: I bid him look into the lives of men as though into a mirror, and from others to take an example for himself.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: Nothing is said that has not been said before.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: So many men so many questions. (Quot Homines Tot Sententiae)
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: That is true wisdom, to know how to alter one's mind when occasion demands it.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: Their silence is sufficient praise.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: There is a demand in these days for men who can make wrong appear right.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: There is nothing so easy but that it becomes difficult when you do it reluctantly.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: Too much liberty corrupts us all.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: What is done let us leave alone.
wisdom.author: Terence

wisdom.quote: Charity begins at home.
wisdom.author: Terence, Andria

wisdom.quote: Moderation in all things.
wisdom.author: Terence, Andria

wisdom.quote: I have everything, yet have nothing; and although I possess nothing, still of nothing am I in want.
wisdom.author: Terence, Eunuchus

wisdom.quote: In fact, nothing is said that has not been said before.
wisdom.author: Terence, Eunuchus

wisdom.quote: Fortune helps the brave.
wisdom.author: Terence, Phormio

wisdom.quote: A man is like a fraction whose numerator is what he is and whose denominator is what he thinks of himself. The larger the denominator, the smaller the fraction.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Historians are like deaf people who go on answering questions that no one has asked them.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: If one has no vanity in this life of ours, there is no sufficient reason for living.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Pure and complete sorrow is about as impossible as pure and complete joy.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy, Anna Karenina, Chapter 1, first line

wisdom.quote: To regret deeply is to live afresh.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly, the true place for a just man is in prison.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: We cannot but pity the boy who has never fired a gun; he is no more humane, while his education has been sadly neglected.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: We must have infinite faith in each other. If we have not, we must never let it leak out that we have not.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: What is the use of a house if you haven't got a tolerable planet to put it on?
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: What people say you cannot do, you try and find that you can.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: When a dog runs at you, whistle for him.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: When some of my friends have asked me anxiously about their boys, whether they should let them hunt, I have answered yes-- remembering that it was one of the best parts of my education-- make them hunters.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: [Water is] the only drink for a wise man.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, "Walden", 1854

wisdom.quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, "Walden", 1854

wisdom.quote: It is never too late to give up our prejudices.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, 'Economy,' Walden, 1854

wisdom.quote: But government in which the majority rule in all cases can not be based on justice, even as far as men understand it.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Civil Disobedience

wisdom.quote: Under a government which imprisons unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Civil Disobedience, 1849

wisdom.quote: He enjoys true leisure who has time to improve his soul's estate.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Journal, February 11, 1840

wisdom.quote: Man is the artificer of his own happiness.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Journal, January 21, 1838

wisdom.quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Journal, July 25, 1839

wisdom.quote: Beware of all enterprises that require new clothes.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden

wisdom.quote: Our inventions are wont to be pretty toys, which distract our attention from serious things. They are but improved means to an unimproved end.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, Walden

wisdom.quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: I cordially dislike allegory in all its manifestations, and always have done since I grew old and wary enough to detect its presence.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: It's a job that's never started that takes the longest to finish.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: Little by little, one travels far.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: The Hobbits are just rustic English people, made small in size because it reflects the generally small reach of their imagination.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: Nearly all marriages, even happy ones, are mistakes: in the sense that almost certainly (in a more perfect world, or even with a little more care in this very imperfect one) both partners might be found more suitable mates. But the real soul-mate is the one you are actually married to.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, Letter to Michael Tolkien, March 1941

wisdom.quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

wisdom.quote: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

wisdom.quote: It's a dangerous business going out your front door.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

wisdom.quote: All that is gold does not glitter; not all those that wander are lost.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring, 1954

wisdom.quote: One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring, 1954, chapter 2

wisdom.quote: His house was perfect, whether you liked food, or sleep, or work, or story-telling, or singing, or just sitting and thinking, best, or a pleasant mixture of them all.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Hobbit

wisdom.quote: Many that live deserve death. And some die that deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then be not too eager to deal out death in the name of justice, fearing for your own safety. Even the wise cannot see all ends.
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Lord Of the Rings, Book Four, Chapter One

wisdom.quote: 'I wish life was not so short,' he thought. 'Languages take such a time, and so do all the things one wants to know about.'
wisdom.author: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Lost Road

wisdom.quote: Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: Ninety-eight percent of the adults in this country are decent, hard-working, honest Americans. It's the other lousy two percent that get all the publicity. But then--we elected them.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: No matter how cynical you get, it is impossible to keep up.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: Reality is a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: We're all in this alone.
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: Why isn't there a special name for the tops of your feet?
wisdom.author: Lily Tomlin

wisdom.quote: America is a large, friendly dog in a very small room. Every time it wags its tail, it knocks over a chair.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition, a voyage and not a harbor.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: Civilizations die from suicide, not by murder.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: Civilizations in decline are consistently characterised by a tendency towards standardization and uniformity.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: It is a paradoxical but profoundly true and important principle of life that the most likely way to reach a goal is to be aiming not at that goal itself but at some more ambitious goal beyond it.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: To be able to fill leisure intelligently is the last product of civilization.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: We have been God-like in our planned breeding of our domesticated plants and animals, but we have been rabbit-like in our unplanned breeding of ourselves.
wisdom.author: Arnold Toynbee

wisdom.quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
wisdom.author: G. M. Trevelyan

wisdom.quote: Anger is a momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.
wisdom.author: G. M. Trevelyan

wisdom.quote: Education has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
wisdom.author: G. M. Trevelyan

wisdom.quote: Disinterested intellectual curiosity is the life blood of real civilization.
wisdom.author: G. M. Trevelyan, English Social History (1942)

wisdom.quote: Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
wisdom.author: G. M. Trevelyan, English Social History (1942)

wisdom.quote: Never think that you're not good enough yourself. A man should never think that. People will take you very much at your own reckoning.
wisdom.author: Anthony Trollope

wisdom.quote: Success is the necessary misfortune of life, but it is only to the very unfortunate that it comes early.
wisdom.author: Anthony Trollope, Orley Farm, chapter 49, 1950

wisdom.quote: Nothing surely is as potent as a law that may not be disobeyed. It has the force of the water drop that hollows the stone. A small dainty task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules.
wisdom.author: Anthony Trollope, We Have Met the Enemy: Self-Control in an Age of Excess, 2011

wisdom.quote: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Any fool can make a rule, and any fool will mind it.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill. I think that there is nothing, not even crime, more opposed to poetry, to philosophy, ay, to life itself than this incessant business.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Cultivate the habit of early rising.  It is unwise to keep the head long on a level with the feet.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life. Aim above morality. Be not simply good; be good for something.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Every man is the builder of a temple called his body.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined. As you simplify your life, the laws of the universe will be simpler.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: However mean your life is, meet it and live it: do not shun it and call it hard names. Cultivate poverty like a garden herb, like sage. Do not trouble yourself much to get new things, whether clothes or friends. Things do not change, we change. Sell your clothes and keep your thoughts. God will see that you do want society.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestioned ability of a man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: I once had a sparrow alight upon my shoulder for a moment, while I was hoeing in a village garden, and I felt that I was more distinguished by that circumstance that I should have been by any epaulet I could have worn.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: I stand in awe of my body.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: If you would convince a man that he does wrong, do right. But do not care to convince him. Men will believe what they see. Let them see.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: If you would convince a man that he does wrong, do right. Men will believe what they see.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: In what concerns you much, do not think that you have companions: know that you are alone in the world.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: My wish is to ride the tempest, tame the waves, kill the sharks. I will not resign myself...
wisdom.author: Trieu Thi Trinh

wisdom.quote: Canada is a country whose main exports are hockey players and cold fronts. Our main imports are baseball players and acid rain.
wisdom.author: Pierre Trudeau

wisdom.quote: Let us overthrow the totems, break the taboos. Or better, let us consider them cancelled. Coldly, let us be intelligent.
wisdom.author: Pierre Trudeau

wisdom.quote: Some things I never learned to like. I didn't like to kiss babies, though I didn't mind kissing their mothers.
wisdom.author: Pierre Trudeau

wisdom.quote: The Past is to be respected and acknoledged, but not to be worshiped. It is our future in which we will find our greatness.
wisdom.author: Pierre Trudeau

wisdom.quote: The state has no business in the bedrooms of the nation.
wisdom.author: Pierre Trudeau, CBC Archives

wisdom.quote: The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest.
wisdom.author: Kilgore Trout, (Philip Jose Farmer), "Venus on the Half Shell"

wisdom.quote: Nothing�s better than the wind to your back, the sun in front of you, and your friends beside you.
wisdom.author: Aaron Douglas Trimble

wisdom.quote: I can't be a rose in any man's lapel.
wisdom.author: Margaret Trudeau

wisdom.quote: Diplomacy is the art of knowing what not to say.
wisdom.author: Matthew Trump, in Mother Earth News

wisdom.quote: America: the only country in the world where failing to promote yourself is regarded as being arrogant.
wisdom.author: Garry Trudeau

wisdom.quote: I've been trying for some time to develop a lifestyle that doesn't require my presence.
wisdom.author: Garry Trudeau

wisdom.quote: That little man in black over there, he says women can't have as much rights as men, 'cause Christ wasn't a woman! Where did your Christ come from? From God and a woman! Man had nothing to do with Him.
wisdom.author: Sojourner Truth, Ain't I A Woman, a speech delivered in 1851

wisdom.quote: That man over there says that women need to be helped into carriages, and lifted over ditches, and to have the best place everywhere. Nobody ever helps me into carriages, or over mud-puddles, or gives me any best place! And ain't I a woman? Look at me! Look at my arm! I have ploughed and planted, and gathered into barns, and no man could head me! And ain't I a woman? I could work as much and eat as much as a man - when I could get it - and bear the lash as well! And ain't I a woman? I have borne thirteen children, and seen most all sold off to slavery, and when I cried out with my mother's grief, none but Jesus heard me! And ain't I a woman?
wisdom.author: Sojourner Truth, Women's Convention, Akron Ohio, 1851

wisdom.quote: In answer to the question of why it happened, I offer the modest proposal that our Universe is simply one of those things which happen from time to time.
wisdom.author: Edward P. Tryon

wisdom.quote: A rumor without a leg to stand on will get around some other way.
wisdom.author: John Tudor

wisdom.quote: Machines take me by surprise with great frequency.
wisdom.author: Alan Turing

wisdom.quote: No man's life, liberty or property are safe while the legislature is in session.
wisdom.author: Judge Gideon J. Tucker

wisdom.quote: A way to a man's heart is through his stomach, that shit true as gold. You put some love in your food and a fool can taste it.
wisdom.author: Raelle Tucker, True Blood, Cold Ground, 2008

wisdom.quote: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
wisdom.author: Dale E. Turner

wisdom.quote: The real power behind whatever success I have now was something I found within myself - something that's in all of us, I think, a little piece of God just waiting to be discovered.
wisdom.author: Tina Turner, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: At Christmas play and make good cheer, For Christmas comes but once a year.
wisdom.author: Thomas Tusser

wisdom.quote: Make hunger thy sauce, as a medicine for health.
wisdom.author: Thomas Tusser, 1524

wisdom.quote: I've been rich and I�ve been poor -- and believe me, rich is better.
wisdom.author: Sophie Tucker

wisdom.quote: Anybody caught selling macrame in public should be dyed a natural color and hung out to dry.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: Health food makes me sick.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: I don't care where I sit, as long as I get fed.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: In modern America, anyone who attempts to write satirically about the events of the day finds it difficult to concoct a situation so bizarre that it may not actually come to pass while the article is still on the presses.

wisdom.quote: Marriage is not merely sharing the fettucini, but sharing the burden of finding the fettucini restaurant in the first place.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: Marriage is part of a sort of 50's revival package that's back in vogue along with neckties and naked ambition.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: The average trade book has a shelf life of between milk and yogurt, except for books by any member of the Irving Wallace family - they have preservatives.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
wisdom.author: Calvin Trillin

wisdom.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
wisdom.author: Frank Tyger

wisdom.quote: If you cannot lift the load off another's back, do not walk away. Try to lighten it.
wisdom.author: Frank Tyger

wisdom.quote: Listening to both sides of a story will convince you that there is more to a story than both sides.
wisdom.author: Frank Tyger

wisdom.quote: If I only had a little humility, I'd be perfect.
wisdom.author: Ted Turner

wisdom.quote: I've never quite believed that one chance is all I get.
wisdom.author: Anne Tyler

wisdom.quote: People always call it luck when you've acted more sensibly than they have.

wisdom.quote: It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.
wisdom.author: Anne Tyler, Celestial Navigation, 1974

wisdom.quote: A neurosis is a secret that you don't know you are keeping.
wisdom.author: Kenneth Tynan

wisdom.quote: I am not a quitter. I will fight until I drop. It is just a matter of having some faith in the fact that as long as you are able to draw breath in the universe, you have a chance.

wisdom.quote: The reason lightning doesn't strike twice in the same place is that the same place isn't there the second time.

wisdom.quote: A little more moderation would be good. Of course, my life hasn't exactly been one of moderation.

wisdom.quote: Money was never a big motivation for me, except as a way to keep score. The real excitement is playing the game.

wisdom.quote: Show me someone without an ego, and I'll show you a loser.

wisdom.quote: I think we have six people who are really sort of OK. They are all good people. We don't have bad people. I know the bad people. Believe me, do I know bad people.

wisdom.quote: You know what uranium is, right? It's this thing called nuclear weapons. And other things. Like lots of things are done with uranium. Including some bad things.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Press Conference, February 16, 2017

wisdom.quote: We should have a new force called the Space Force. It�s like the Army and the Navy, but for space, because we�re spending a lot of money on space.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Press conference, March 13, 2018

wisdom.quote: China now, put on $250 billion, and they�re paying 25 percent on that. They�re paying billions and billions -- this has never happened to China, and I like China and I like President Xi a lot. I think he�s a friend of mine, he may not be a friend of mine anymore, but I think he probably respects -- from what I hear, if you look at Mr. Pillsbury, the leading authority on China. He was on a good show, I won�t mention the name of the show, recently, and he was saying that China has total respect for Donald Trump and for Donald Trump�s very, very large brain.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Press Conference, September 26, 2018

wisdom.quote: It's got to gestate. The word gestate. It's like when you're cooking a chicken. Turkey for Thanksgiving. My mother made the best turkey.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Rally in West Virginia, August 21, 2018

wisdom.quote: Do you see how nice I'm behaving tonight? Have you ever seen this? We're all behaving very well and hopefully we can keep it that way, right? We're going to keep it that way.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Rally, October 24, 2018

wisdom.quote: Together, our nations remind the world of the boundless potential of societies that chose freedom over tyranny, and who set the free. And we will free, and we will sacrifice, and we will hope, and we will make things beautiful, especially the aspiration of your people.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Speech in South Korea, November 7, 2017

wisdom.quote: Sometimes they say, �He doesn�t act presidential.� And I say, with the exception of the late, great Abraham Lincoln, I can be more presidential than any president that�s held this office. That I can tell you. It�s real easy.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Speech, July 25, 2017

wisdom.quote: 'Billion.' Nobody even knows what it is. What does that mean. It's so much, it's like, 'What does it mean?'
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Speech, October 26, 2018

wisdom.quote: Despite the constant negative press covfefe
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Twitter, May 30, 2017, while President of the United States

wisdom.quote: I think our biggest form of climate change we should worry about is nuclear weapons.
wisdom.author: Donald Trump, Washington Post interview, March 21, 2016

wisdom.quote: Carry the battle to them.  Don't let them bring it to you.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: Carry the battle to them. Don't let them bring it to you. Put them on the defensive. And don't ever apologize for anything.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: I always remember an epitaph which is in the cemetery at Tombstone, Arizona. It says: 'Here lies Jack Williams. He done his damnedest.' I think that is the greatest epitaph a man can have - When he gives everything that is in him to do the job he has before him. That is all you can ask of him and that is what I have tried to do.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: I learned that a great leader is a man who has the ability to get other people to do what they don't want to do and like it.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: Take a two-mile walk every morning before breakfast.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman

wisdom.quote: Once a government is committed to the principle of silencing the voice of opposition, it has only one way to go, and that is down the path of increasingly repressive measures, until it becomes a source of terror to all its citizens and creates a country where everyone lives in fear.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, August 8, 1950

wisdom.quote: I never did give them hell. I just told the truth, and they thought it was hell.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, in Look, Apr. 3, 1956

wisdom.quote: It's a recession when your neighbor loses his job; it's a depression when you lose yours.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, in Observer, April 13, 1958

wisdom.quote: Whenever you have an efficient government you have a dictatorship.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, Lecture at Columbia University, 28 Apr. 1959

wisdom.quote: All the President is, is a glorified public relations man who spends his time flattering, kissing and kicking people to get them to do what they are supposed to do anyway.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, Letter to his sister, Nov. 14, 1947

wisdom.quote: I never did give anybody hell. I just told the truth, and they thought it was hell.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, quoted by Time, June 9, 1975

wisdom.quote: Whenever the press quits abusing me I know I'm in the wrong pew. I don't mind it because when they throw bricks at me-I'm a pretty good shot myself and I usually throw 'em back at 'em.
wisdom.author: Harry S Truman, Speech in a dinner in his honor, Washington, D.C., February 22, 1958

wisdom.quote: Grief can take care of itself; but to get the full value of a joy you must have someone to divide it with.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Habit is habit and not to be flung out of the window by any man, but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Habit is habit, and not to be flung out the window by man, but coaxed downstairs, a step at a time.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Honesty is the best policy - when there is money in it.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Humor is the great thing, the saving thing. The minute it crops up, all our irritations and resentments slip away and a sunny spirit takes their place.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I am opposed to millionaires, but it would be dangerous to offer me the position.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I didn't attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying that I approved of it.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I don't give a damn for a man that can only spell a word one way.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I don't like to commit myself about heaven and hell-you see, I have friends in both places.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I have a higher and grander standard of principle than George Washington. He could not lie; I can, but I won't.

wisdom.quote: I have been through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I have never taken any exercise except sleeping and resting.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I have spent most of my life worrying about things that have never happened
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I thoroughly disapprove of duels. If a man should challenge me, I would take him kindly and forgivingly by the hand and lead him to a quiet place and kill him.

wisdom.quote: I was gratified to be able to answer promptly. I said I don't know.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: I would rather have my ignorance than another man's knowledge, because I have got so much more of it.

wisdom.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous, he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.

wisdom.quote: In his private heart no man respects himself.

wisdom.quote: In Paris they simply stared when I spoke to them in French; I never did succeed in making those idiots understand their language.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: In religion and politics, people's beliefs and convictions are in almost every case gotten at second hand, and without examination.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: In the first place, God made idiots. That was for practice. Then he made school boards.

wisdom.quote: It could probably be shown by facts and figures that there is no distinctly American criminal class except Congress.

wisdom.quote: It is better to deserve honors and not have them than to have them and not to deserve them.

wisdom.quote: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.

wisdom.quote: It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.

wisdom.quote: It is easier to stay out than get out.

wisdom.quote: It usually takes more than three weeks to prepare a good impromptu speech.

wisdom.quote: It was wonderful to find America, but it would have been more wonderful to miss it.

wisdom.quote: Just the omission of Jane Austen's books alone would make a fairly good library out of a library that hadn't a book in it.

wisdom.quote: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.

wisdom.quote: Let us be thankful for the fools.  But for them the rest of us could not succeed.

wisdom.quote: Let us so live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.

wisdom.quote: Life does not consist mainly - or even largely - of facts and happenings. It consists mainly of the storm of thoughts that are forever blowing through one's mind.

wisdom.quote: My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.

wisdom.quote: Never learn to do anything: if you don't learn, you'll always find someone else to do it for you.

wisdom.quote: When in doubt, tell the truth.

wisdom.quote: When people do not respect us we are sharply offended; yet deep down in his private heart no man much respects himself.

wisdom.quote: When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.

wisdom.quote: When you cannot get a compliment any other way pay yourself one.

wisdom.quote: Whenever you find that you are on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.

wisdom.quote: Whenever you find that you are on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.

wisdom.quote: I cannot call to mind a single instance where I have ever been irreverent, except toward the things which were sacred to other people.

wisdom.quote: Of all the animals, man is the only one that is cruel. He is the only one that inflicts pain for the pleasure of doing it.

wisdom.quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.

wisdom.quote: Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising.

wisdom.quote: You cannot depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.

wisdom.quote: We have not the reverent feeling for the rainbow that a savage has, because we know how it is made. We have lost as much as we gained by prying into that matter.

wisdom.quote: The history of our race, and each individual's experience, are sown thick with evidence that a truth is not hard to kill and that a lie told well is immortal.

wisdom.quote: A human being has a natural desire to have more of a good thing than he needs.

wisdom.quote: The universal brotherhood of man is our most precious possession, what there is of it.

wisdom.quote: By trying we can easily learn to endure adversity. Another man's, I mean.

wisdom.quote: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain, Following the Equator (1897)

wisdom.quote: It takes your enemy and your friend, working together, to hurt you: the one to slander you, and the other to get the news to you.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain, Following the Equator (1897)

wisdom.quote: Man is the Only Animal that Blushes. Or needs to.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain, Following the Equator (1897)

wisdom.quote: New Orleans food is as delicious as the less criminal forms of sin.

wisdom.quote: Often it does seem a pity that Noah and his party did not miss the boat.

wisdom.quote: Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.

wisdom.quote: Suppose you were an idiot and suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.

wisdom.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: The coldest winter I ever spent was a summer in San Francisco.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug.

wisdom.quote: The first half of life consists of the capacity to enjoy without the the chance; the last half consists of the chance without the capacity.

wisdom.quote: The human race has one really effective weapon, and that is laughter.

wisdom.quote: The man who doesn't read good books has no advantage over the man who can't read them.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: The right word may be effective, but no word was ever as effective as a rightly timed pause.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: The universal brotherhood of man is our most precious possession.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: There are people who strictly deprive themselves of each and every eatable, drinkable, and smokable which has in any way acquired a shady reputation. They pay this price for health. And health is all they get for it. How strange it is. It is like paying out your whole fortune for a cow that has gone dry.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: There is something fascinating about science. One gets such wholesale returns of conjecture out of such a trifling investment of fact.

wisdom.quote: Time cools, time clarifies; no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.

wisdom.quote: Truth is more of a stranger than fiction.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Under certain circumstances, profanity provides a relief denied even to prayer.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Water, taken in moderation, cannot hurt anybody.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: We have a criminal jury system which is superior to any in the world; and its efficiency is only marred by the difficulty of finding twelve men every day who don't know anything and can't read.

wisdom.quote: A banker is a fellow who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining, but wants it back the minute it begins to rain.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Always acknowledge a fault. This will throw those in authority off their guard and give you an opportunity to commit more.

wisdom.quote: Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest.

wisdom.quote: An Englishman is a person who does things because they have been done before. An American is a person who does things because they haven't been done before.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing you can do is keep your mind young.

wisdom.quote: Barring that natural expression of villainy which we all have, the man looked honest enough.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: By trying we can easily learn to endure adversity -- another man's I mean.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Do something every day that you don't want to do; this is the golden rule for acquiring the habit of doing your duty without pain.

wisdom.quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.

wisdom.quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.

wisdom.quote: Education: that which reveals to the wise, and conceals from the stupid, the vast limits of their knowledge.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Facts are stubborn things, but statistics are more pliable.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: George Washington, as a boy, was ignorant of the commonest accomplishments of youth. He could not even lie.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Grief can take care of itself, but to get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: If you can find something everyone agrees on, it's wrong.
wisdom.author: Mo Udall

wisdom.quote: We have, I fear, confused power with greatness.
wisdom.author: Stewart L. Udall, commencement address, Dartmouth College, June 13, 1965

wisdom.quote: Control's a funny thing. It comes and goes. Some days I had it, some days I didn't. It felt like every time I did something healthy, I had this in satiable need to counterbalance it by doing something unhealthy.
wisdom.author: Edward Ugel, I'm With Fatty: Losing Fifty Pounds in Fifty Miserable Weeks, 2010

wisdom.quote: My ability to tolerate shame, to compartmentalize it, to swallow it, increased right along with my belt size. it came with the territory of being heavy. Obese people have a lifetime of experience with shame.
wisdom.author: Edward Ugel, I'm With Fatty: Losing Fifty Pounds in Fifty Miserable Weeks, 2010

wisdom.quote: The people who can most successfully lose weight and maintain a healthy life style are foodies. When it comes to healthy eating, people who know how to cook and make ingredients taste good have a distinct advantage over those who can't.
wisdom.author: Edward Ugel, I'm With Fatty: Losing Fifty Pounds in Fifty Miserable Weeks, 2010

wisdom.quote: Worrying about gray hair when your weight's soaring out of control is like mowing your lawn while your house is on fire.
wisdom.author: Edward Ugel, I'm With Fatty: Losing Fifty Pounds in Fifty Miserable Weeks, 2010

wisdom.quote: Since you are like no other being ever created since the beginning of time, you are incomparable.
wisdom.author: Brenda Ueland

wisdom.quote: So you see, imagination needs moodling - long, inefficient, happy idling, dawdling and puttering.
wisdom.author: Brenda Ueland

wisdom.quote: Think of yourself as an incandescent power, illuminated and perhaps forever talked to by God and his messengers.
wisdom.author: Brenda Ueland

wisdom.quote: Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due.
wisdom.author: Domitus Ulpian

wisdom.quote: The real division in the world today is not between socialism and capitalism, it's between freedom and totalitarianism.
wisdom.author: Frank H. Underhill

wisdom.quote: Use harms and even destroys beauty. The noblest function of an object is to be contemplated.
