wisdom.quote: I think that God in creating Man somewhat overestimated his ability.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: I was working on the proof of one of my poems all the morning, and took out a comma. In the afternoon I put it back again.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act III

wisdom.quote: Only the shallow know themselves.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Phrases and Philosophies for the Use of the Young, 1882

wisdom.quote: Vile deeds like poison weeds bloom well in prison air, it is only what is good in man, that wastes and withers there.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Ballad of Reading Gaol

wisdom.quote: We have really everything in common with America nowadays except, of course, language.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Canterville Ghost, 1882

wisdom.quote: To give an accurate description of what has never occurred is not merely the proper occupation of the historian, but the inalienable privilege of any man of parts and culture.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist

wisdom.quote: But what is the difference between literature and journalism? ...Journalism is unreadable and literature is not read. That is all.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist, 1891

wisdom.quote: It is only an auctioneer who can equally and impartially admire all schools of art.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist, 1891

wisdom.quote: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist, 1891

wisdom.quote: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist, part 2, 1891

wisdom.quote: One is tempted to define man as a rational animal who always loses his temper when he is called upon to act in accordance with the dictates of reason.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Critic as Artist, part 2, 1891

wisdom.quote: Do not speak ill of society, Algie. Only people who can't get in do that.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest

wisdom.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest, 1895, Act I

wisdom.quote: To lose one parent, Mr Worthing, may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest, 1895, Act I

wisdom.quote: Thirty-five is a very attractive age. London society is full of women of the very highest birth who have, of their own free choice, remained thirty-five for years.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest, Act 3

wisdom.quote: It is better to have a permanent income than to be fascinating.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Model Millionaire, 1912

wisdom.quote: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: I adore simple pleasures. They are the last refuge of the complex.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: I can believe anything, provided that it is quite incredible.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects. A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: Often we don't even realize who we're meant to be because we're so busy trying to live out someone else's ideas. But other people and their opinions hold no power in defining our destiny.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, November 2009

wisdom.quote: Challenges are gifts that force us to search for a new center of gravity. Don't fight them. Just find a different way to stand.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, October 2002

wisdom.quote: Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: I've come to believe that each of us has a personal calling that's as unique as a fingerprint - and that the best way to succeed is to discover what you love and then find a way to offer it to others in the form of service, working hard, and also allowing the energy of the universe to lead you.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: The key to realizing a dream is to focus not on success but significance - and then even the small steps and little victories along your path will take on greater meaning.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, September 2002

wisdom.quote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, September 2003

wisdom.quote: All these years I've been feeling like I was growing into myself. Finally, I feel grown.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, What I Know For Sure, January 2004

wisdom.quote: You can take from every experience what it has to offer you. And you cannot be defeated if you just keep taking one breath followed by another.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, What I Know For Sure, January 2004

wisdom.quote: It is confidence in our bodies, minds and spirits that allows us to keep looking for new adventures, new directions to grow in, and new lessons to learn - which is what life is all about.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Oprah Magazine, May 2004

wisdom.quote: You can have it all. You just can't have it all at once.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, quoted by Susan Litwin in 'TV Guide'

wisdom.quote: Check your ego at the door and check your gut instead. Every right decision I have ever made has come from my gut. Every wrong decision I've made was the result of me not listening to the greater voice of myself
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Difficulties come when you don't pay attention to life's whisper. Life always whispers to you first, but if you ignore the whisper, sooner or later you'll get a scream.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Feelings are really your GPS system for life. When your supposed to do something, or not supposed to do something, your emotional guidance system lets you know.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Forget about the fast lane. If you really want to fly, harness your power to your passion. Honor your calling. Everybody has one. Trust your heart, and success will come to you.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: How do I define success? Let me tell you, money's pretty nice. But having a lot of money does not automatically make you a successful person. What you want is money and meaning. You want your work to be meaningful, because meaning is what brings the real richness to your life.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: If it doesn't feel right, don't do it. That's the lesson. That lesson alone, will save you a lot of grief. Even doubt means don't.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: If you're hurting, you need to help somebody else ease their hurt. If you're in pain, help somebody else's pain.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: In order to be truly happy, you must live along with, and you must stand for something larger than yourself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Inner wisdom is more important than wealth. The more you spend it, the more you gain.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Before you agree to do anything that might add even the smallest amount of stress to your life, ask yourself: What is my truest intention? Give yourself time to let a yes resound within you. When it's right, I guarantee that your entire body will feel it.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

wisdom.quote: My philosophy is that not only are you responsible for your life, but doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

wisdom.quote: I think that when you invite people to your home, you invite them to yourself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, 20th Anniversary DVD

wisdom.quote: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing that nobody's going to know whether you did it or not.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, in Good Housekeeping

wisdom.quote: As you become more clear about who you really are, you'll be better able to decide what is best for you - the first time around.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Every one of us gets through the tough times because somebody is there, standing in the gap to close it for us.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: I define joy as a sustained sense of well-being and internal peace - a connection to what matters.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: I finally realized that being grateful to my body was key to giving more love to myself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: I know for sure that what we dwell on is who we become.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: I trust that everything happens for a reason, even when we're not wise enough to see it.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: If you want your life to be more rewarding, you have to change the way you think.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: In every aspect of our lives, we are always asking ourselves, How am I of value? What is my worth? Yet I believe that worthiness is our birthright.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Living in the moment brings you a sense of reverence for all of life's blessings.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Partake of some of life's sweet pleasures. And yes, get comfortable with yourself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: The big secret in life is that there is no big secret. Whatever your goal, you can get there if you're willing to work.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: The whole point of being alive is to evolve into the complete person you were intended to be.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Though I am grateful for the blessings of wealth, it hasn't changed who I am. My feet are still on the ground. I'm just wearing better shoes.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Understand that the right to choose your own path is a sacred privilege. Use it. Dwell in possiblity.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Football is a mistake. It combines the two worst elements of American life. Violence and committee meetings.
wisdom.author: George F. Will

wisdom.quote: Sports serve society by providing vivid examples of excellence.
wisdom.author: George F. Will

wisdom.quote: The business of America is not business. Neither is it war. The business of America is justice and securing the blessings of liberty.
wisdom.author: George F. Will

wisdom.quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
wisdom.author: George F. Will

wisdom.quote: The problem with intelligent design theory is not that it is false but that it is not falsifiable: Not being susceptible to contradicting evidence, it is not a testable hypothesis. Hence it is not a scientific but a creedal tenet--a matter of faith, unsuited to a public school�s curriculum.
wisdom.author: George F. Will, Newsweek, July 4, 2005

wisdom.quote: Americans are overreachers; overreaching is the most admirable of the many American excesses.
wisdom.author: George F. Will, Statecraft as Soulcraft

wisdom.quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Why was I born with such contemporaries?
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Wisdom comes with winters.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: One should absorb the colour of life, but one should never remember its details. Details are always vulgar.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Picture of Dorian Gray"

wisdom.quote: The only thing that sustains one through life is the consciousness of the immense inferiority of everybody else, and this is a feeling that I have always cultivated.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "The Remarkable Rocket"

wisdom.quote: The secret of life is to appreciate the pleasure of being terribly, terribly deceived.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, A Woman of No Importance, Act 3

wisdom.quote: I don't play accurately-any one can play accurately- but I play with wonderful expression. As far as the piano is concerned, sentiment is my forte. I keep science for Life.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Algernon from The Importance of Being Earnest

wisdom.quote: When the gods wish to punish us, they answer our prayers.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, An Ideal husband, 1893

wisdom.quote: Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, An Ideal Husband, 1893, Act I

wisdom.quote: Suffering is one very long moment. We cannot divide it by seasons.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, De Profundis

wisdom.quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, De Profundis, 1905

wisdom.quote: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, In Life of Oscar Wilde, H. Pearson

wisdom.quote: One's real life is often the life that one does not lead.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, L'Envoi, 1882

wisdom.quote: Crying is the refuge of plain women, but the ruin of pretty ones.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windemere's Fan

wisdom.quote: My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people's.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892

wisdom.quote: I can resist anything but temptation.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act I

wisdom.quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act I

wisdom.quote: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act I

wisdom.quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act III

wisdom.quote: Scandal is gossip made tedious by morality.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan, 1892, Act III

wisdom.quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Extras, 2007

wisdom.quote: Turns out if you never lie, there's always someone mad at you.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Extras, 2007

wisdom.quote: Most men's awareness doesn't extend past their dinner plates.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Leviathan, 2009

wisdom.quote: High school wasn't a trial by fire or some ordeal that had to be survived. It was all a big joke. You just had to provide the laugh track.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Midnighters: Blue Noon, 2005

wisdom.quote: Maybe kissing is sort of like nature's coffee.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Midnighters: Blue Noon, 2005

wisdom.quote: Not everything made you stronger. It was possible to survive, yet still be crippled for your trouble. Sometimes it was okay to run away, to skip the test, to chicken out. Or at least to get some help.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Midnighters: Blue Noon, 2005

wisdom.quote: A little drama wins more friends than boring.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Midnighters: The Secret Hour, 2004

wisdom.quote: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Peeps, 2005

wisdom.quote: People only worry about the uncanny for about a week; that's the end of their attention span. After that, suspicions turn into shtick.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Peeps, 2005

wisdom.quote: The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Peeps, 2005

wisdom.quote: Everyone in the world was programmed by the place they were born, hemmed in by their beliefs, but you had to at least try to grow your own brain
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Pretties, 2005

wisdom.quote: Sometimes the facts in my head get bored and decide to take a walk in my mouth. Frequently this is a bad thing.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, So Yesterday, 2004

wisdom.quote: Freedom has a way of destroying things.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Specials, 2006

wisdom.quote: It doesn't take much convincing to make someone believe they're better than everyone else.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Specials, 2006

wisdom.quote: Here's what I've learned about dogs: They're a lot like pretty girls. Having one or two around makes everything more fun, but when you get a whole bunch together, it turns into one big power struggle.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, The Last Days, 2006

wisdom.quote: I'd watched too many schoolmates graduate into mental institutions, into group homes and jails, and I knew that locking people up was paranormal - against normal, not beside it. Locks didn't cure; they strangled.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, The Last Days, 2006

wisdom.quote: Junkies might be easy to knock down, but they're never fragile. They have souls like old leather shoes studded with steel, and they're about as much good as friends.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, The Last Days, 2006

wisdom.quote: Money's the same, whoever gives it to you. That was the point of money, after all: crisp and clean or wrinkled or disintegrated into quarters - a dollar was always worth a hundred cents.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, The Last Days, 2006

wisdom.quote: We don't always get to choose what we love.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, The Last Days, 2006

wisdom.quote: Hard work's a good distraction.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld, Uglies, 2005

wisdom.quote: ...it is as hard to do your duty when men are sneering at you as when they are shooting at you.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: A conservative is a man who sits and thinks, mostly sits.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: America lives in the heart of every man everywhere who wishes to find a region where he will be free to work out his destiny as he chooses.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: I not only use all the brains that I have, but all that I can borrow.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: Just what is it that America stands for? If she stands for one thing more than another it is for the sovereignty of self-governing people.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: No man can sit down and withhold his hands from the warfare against wrong and get peace from his acquiescence.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: The flag is the embodiment, not of sentiment, but of history.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: The law that will work is merely the summing up in legislative form of the moral judgement that the community has already reached.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, and with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world. You impoverish yourself if you forget this errand.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.quote: The history of liberty is the history of resistance. The history of liberty is a history of the limitation of governmental power, not the increase of it.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Address to the New York Press Club, September 9, 1912

wisdom.quote: Only a peace between equals can last. Only a peace the very principle of which is equality and a common participation in a common benefit.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Address to the United States Senate, January 22, 1917

wisdom.quote: In the last analysis, my fellow country men, as we in America would be the first to claim, a people are responsible for the acts of their government.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Address, Columbus, Ohio, September 4, 1919

wisdom.quote: The world must be made safe for democracy.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, April 2, 1917

wisdom.quote: We live in an age disturbed, confused, bewildered, afraid of its own forces, in search not merely of its road but even of its direction. There are many voices of counsel, but few voices of vision; there is much excitement and feverish activity, but little concert of thoughtful purpose. We are distressed by our own ungoverned, undirected energies and do many things, but nothing long. It is our duty to find ourselves.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Baccalaureate address, Princeton University, Princeton, New Jersey, June 9, 1907

wisdom.quote: Once lead this people into war and they will forget there ever was such a thing as tolerance.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, in John Dos Passos, "Mr Wilson's War"

wisdom.quote: I can imagine no greater disservice to the county than to establish a system of censorship that would deny to the people of a free republic like our own their indisputable right to criticize their own public officials. While exercising the great powers of office I hold, I would regret in a crisis like the one through which we are now passing to lose the benefit of patriotic and intelligent criticism.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Letter to Arthur Brisbane, April 25, 1917

wisdom.quote: Power consists in one's capacity to link his will with the purpose of others, to lead by reason and a gift of cooperation.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, letter to Mary A. Hulbert, September 21, 1913

wisdom.quote: No nation is fit to sit in judgement upon any other nation.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Speech in New York, Apr. 20, 1915

wisdom.quote: There is such a thing as a man being too proud to fight; there is such a thing as a nation being so right that it does not need to convince others by force that it is right.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson, Speech in Philadelphia, May 10, 1915

wisdom.quote: We are each responsible for our own life - no other person is or even can be.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: What I know for sure is that what you give comes back to you.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: What we're all striving for is authenticity, a spirit-to-spirit connection.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: Whatever you fear most has no power - it is your fear that has the power.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine

wisdom.quote: I've learned that you can't have everything and do everything at the same time.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, April 2003

wisdom.quote: If you neglect to recharge a battery, it dies. And if you run full speed ahead without stopping for water, you lose momentum to finish the race.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, April 2003

wisdom.quote: Use what you have to run toward your best - that's how I now live my life.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, August 2003

wisdom.quote: Getting my lifelong weight struggle under control has come from a process of treating myself as well as I treat others in every way.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, August 2004

wisdom.quote: Every time you state what you want or believe, you're the first to hear it. It's a message to both you and others about what you think is possible. Don't put a ceiling on yourself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: I believe the choice to be excellent begins with aligning your thoughts and words with the intention to require more from yourself.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, December 2003

wisdom.quote: Be more splendid, more extraordinary. Use every moment to fill yourself up.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: Every day brings a chance for you to draw in a breath, kick off your shoes, and dance.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: Every time you suppress some part of yourself or allow others to play you small, you are in essence ignoring the owner's manual your creator gave you and destroying your design.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: You are built not to shrink down to less but to blossom into more.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2003

wisdom.quote: The roses, the lovely notes, the dining and dancing are all welcome and splendid. But when the Godiva is gone, the gift of real love is having someone who'll go the distance with you. Someone who, when the wedding day limo breaks down, is willing to share a seat on the bus.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2004

wisdom.quote: There's no easy way out. If there were, I would have bought it. And believe me, it would be one of my favorite things!
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, February 2005

wisdom.quote: Let your light shine. Shine within you so that it can shine on someone else. Let your light shine.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, January 2004

wisdom.quote: Energy is the essence of life. Every day you decide how you're going to use it by knowing what you want and what it takes to reach that goal, and by maintaining focus.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, July 2003

wisdom.quote: I believe that uncertainty is really my spirit's way of whispering, "I'm in flux. I can't decide for you. Something is off-balance here."
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, O Magazine, June 2003

wisdom.quote: What you risk reveals what you value.
wisdom.author: Jeanette Winterson

wisdom.quote: If your ship doesn't come in, swim out to it!
wisdom.author: Jonathan Winters

wisdom.quote: Nothing is impossible. Some things are just less likely than others.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Winters

wisdom.quote: I think on-stage nudity is disgusting, shameful and damaging to all things American. But if I were 22 with a great body, it would be artistic, tasteful, patriotic and a progressive religious experience.
wisdom.author: Shelley Winters

wisdom.quote: Seize the moment of excited curiosity on any subject to solve your doubts; for if you let it pass, the desire may never return, and you may remain in ignorance.
wisdom.author: William Wirt

wisdom.quote: When yu' can't have why you choose, yu' just choose what you have.
wisdom.author: Owen Wister, The Virginian, Chapter 13, 1929

wisdom.quote: A great city is that which has the greatest men and women.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: All faults may be forgiven of him who has perfect candor.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: And your very flesh shall be a great poem.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Behold I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give I give myself.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Give me the splendid silent sun with all his beams full-dazzling.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Have you heard that it was good to gain the day? I also say it is good to fall, battles are lost in the same spirit in which they are won.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Henceforth I ask not good fortune. I myself am good fortune.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: How beggarly appear arguments before a defiant deed!
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: I say to mankind, Be not curious about God. For I, who am curious about each, am not curious about God - I hear and behold God in every object, yet understand God not in the least.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: If any thing is sacred the human body is sacred.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Nothing endures but personal qualities.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: Other lands have their vitality in a few, a class, but we have it in the bulk of our people.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: The genius of the United States is not best or most in its executives or legislatures, nor in its ambassadors or authors or colleges, or churches, or parlors, nor even in its newspapers or inventors, but always most in the common people.
wisdom.author: Walt Whitman

wisdom.quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

wisdom.quote: If people never did silly things, nothing intelligent would ever get done.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

wisdom.quote: Philosophy is a battle against the bewitchment of our intelligence by means of language.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

wisdom.quote: The world of the happy is quite different from that of the unhappy.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein, Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus (1922)

wisdom.quote: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
wisdom.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein, Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus (1922)

wisdom.quote: When I walk into my kitchen today, I am not alone. Whether we know it or not, none of us is. We bring fathers and mothers and kitchen tables, and every meal we have ever eaten. Food is never just food. It's also a way of getting at something else: who we are, who we have been, and who we want to be.
wisdom.author: Molly Wizenberg, A Homemade Life: Stories and Recipes from My Kitchen Table, 2009

wisdom.quote: Idealism is what precedes experience; cynicism is what follows.
wisdom.author: David T. Wolf

wisdom.quote: If you observe a really happy man, you will find... that he is happy in the course of living life twenty-four crowded hours each day.
wisdom.author: W. Beran Wolfe

wisdom.quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
wisdom.author: Tom Wolfe

wisdom.quote: We are made to persist. That's how we find out who we are.
wisdom.author: Tobias Wolff, 'In Pharaoh's Army'

wisdom.quote: My constant prayer for myself is to be used in service for the greater good.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Nobody's journey is seamless or smooth. We all stumble. We all have setbacks. It's just life's way of saying, "Time to change course."
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: The world has so many lessons to teach you. I consider the world, our earth, to be like a school, and our life, the classrooms. Sometimes on our planet life school, the lessons often come dressed up as detours and road blocks and sometimes as full blown crises. And the secret I've learned to getting ahead is being open to the lessons.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: Walk through life eager and open to self-improvement and that which is going to best help you evolve, because that's really why were here: to evolve as human beings.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: When you choose the paradigm of service, it turns everything you do from a job into a gift.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: When you don't know what to do, get still. Get very still until you do know what to do.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: When you're doing the work you're meant to do, it feels right and every day is a bonus, regardless of what you're getting paid.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: You really haven't changed, you've just become more of yourself. That is really what were all trying to do: become more of ourselves.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey, Stanford Commencement Adress, 2008

wisdom.quote: It is what we learn after we think we know it all, that counts.
wisdom.author: John Wooden

wisdom.quote: It's not so important who starts the game but who finishes it.
wisdom.author: John Wooden

wisdom.quote: You cannot live a perfect day without doing something for someone who will never be able to repay you.
wisdom.author: John Wooden

wisdom.quote: I love acting. It is so much more real than life.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: One can always be kind to people about whom one cares nothing.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: Perhaps, after all, America never has been discovered. I myself would say that it had merely been detected.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray, and the advantage of science is that it is not emotional.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. Resist it, and your soul grows sick with longing for the things it has forbidden to itself.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: There are many things that we would throw away if we were not afraid that others might pick them up.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: There is a luxury in self-reproach. When we blame ourselves, we feel that no one else has a right to blame us. It is the confession, not the priest, that gives us absolution.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: To get back my youth I would do anything in the world, except take exercise, get up early, or be respectable.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: When a woman marries again, it is because she detested her first husband. When a man marries again, it is because he adored his first wife. Women try their luck; men risk theirs.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our intellects.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891

wisdom.quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray, 1891, preface

wisdom.quote: To recommend thrift to the poor is both grotesque and insulting. It is like advising a man who is starving to eat less.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of a Man Under Socialism, 1881

wisdom.quote: In America the President reigns for four years, and Journalism governs for ever and ever.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of a Man Under Socialism, the works of Oscar Wilde ed. G., 1954

wisdom.quote: Disobedience, in the eyes of anyone who has read history, is man's original virtue. It is through disobedience and rebellion that progress has been made.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of Man Under Socialism

wisdom.quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of Man under Socialism (1881)

wisdom.quote: I suppose that I shall have to die beyond my means.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, upon being told the cost of an operation

wisdom.quote: Leadership is based on inspiration, not domination; on cooperation, not intimidation.
wisdom.author: William Arthur Wood

wisdom.quote: Stupid is forever, ignorance can be fixed.
wisdom.author: Don Wood

wisdom.quote: Out of the strain of the Doing,  Into the peace of the Done.
wisdom.author: Julia Louise Woodruff, 'Harvest Home,' Sunday at Home, 1910

wisdom.quote: Blame someone else and get on with your life.
wisdom.author: Alan Woods

wisdom.quote: If you can't have faith in what is held up to you for faith, you must find things to believe in yourself, for a life without faith in something is too narrow a space to live.
wisdom.author: George E. Woodberry

wisdom.quote: All the things I really like to do are either illegal, immoral, or fattening.
wisdom.author: Alexander Woollcott, in R. E. Drennan, Wit's End (1973)

wisdom.quote: I have no need of your God-damned sympathy.  I only wish to be entertained by some of your grosser reminiscences.
wisdom.author: Alexander Woollcott, Letter to Rex O'Malley, 1942

wisdom.quote: When a man takes one step toward God, God takes more steps toward that man than there are sands in the worlds of time.
wisdom.author: The Work of the Chariot

wisdom.quote: I have come to realize that all my trouble with living has come from fear and smallness within me.
wisdom.author: Angela L. Wozniak

wisdom.quote: To sway an audience, you must watch them as you speak.
wisdom.author: C. Kent Wright

wisdom.quote: Income tax returns are the most imaginative fiction being written today.
wisdom.author: Herman Wouk

wisdom.quote: No law ever written has stopped any robber, rapist or killer, like cold blue steel in the hands of their last intended victim.
wisdom.author: W. Emerson Wright

wisdom.quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.
wisdom.author: William Wrigley Jr.

wisdom.quote: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
wisdom.author: Jane Wyman

wisdom.quote: I know of only one bird - the parrot - that talks; and it can't fly very high.
wisdom.author: Wilbur Wright, declining to make a speech in 1908

wisdom.quote: Men are taught to apologize for their weaknesses, women for their strengths.
wisdom.author: Lois Wyse

wisdom.quote: If not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse

wisdom.quote: The fascination of shooting as a sport depends almost wholly on whether you are at the right or wrong end of the gun.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse

wisdom.quote: It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies, and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse, The Man Upstairs (1914)

wisdom.quote: A man's subconscious self is not the ideal companion. It lurks for the greater part of his life in some dark den of its own, hidden away, and emerges only to taunt and deride and increase the misery of a miserable hour.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse, Uneasy Money

wisdom.quote: At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse, Uneasy Money

wisdom.quote: Boyhood, like measles, is one of those complaints which a man should catch young and have done with, for when it comes in middle life it is apt to be serious.
wisdom.author: P. G. Wodehouse, Uneasy Money

wisdom.quote: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf

wisdom.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf

wisdom.quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of men who have minded beyond reason the opinions of others.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf, A Room of One's Own (1929)

wisdom.quote: Women have served all these centuries as looking-glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of a man at twice its natural size.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf, A Room of One's Own (1929)

wisdom.quote: I meant to write about death, only life came breaking in as usual.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf, Diary, 17 February 1922

wisdom.quote: I have lost friends, some by death... others through sheer inability to cross the street.
wisdom.author: Virginia Woolf, The Waves (1931)

wisdom.quote: Wisdom and spirit of the Universe! Thou soul is the eternity of thought! That giv'st to forms and images a breath And everlasting motion! Not in vain By day or star-light thus from by first dawn Of childhood didst thou intertwine for me The passions that build up our human soul, Not with the mean and vulgar works of man, But with high objects, with enduring things, With life and nature, purifying thus The elements of feeling and of thought, And sanctifying, by such discipline Both pain and fear, until we recognize A grandeur in the beatings of the heart.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: She was a phantom of delight When first she gleam'd upon my sight; A lovely apparition, sent To be a moment's ornament.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: That best portion of a good man's life,  His little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: That best portion of a good man's life, His little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: The best portions of a good man's life, his little, nameless acts of kindness and love.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: What though the radiance which was once so bright Be not forever taken from my sight, Though nothing can bring back the hour Of splendour in the grass, of glory in the flower;Grief not, rather find, Strength in what remains behind, In the primal sympathy Which having been must ever be, In the soothing thoughts that spring Out of Human suffering, In the faith that looks through death In years that bring philophic mind.
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth

wisdom.quote: The world is too much with us; late and soon, Getting and spending, we lay waste our powers: Little we see in Nature that is ours; We have given our hearts away, a sordid boon!
wisdom.author: William Wordsworth, The World is Too Much With Us

wisdom.quote: A professional is one who does his best work when he feels the least like working.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: An idea is salvation by imagination.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: Noble life demands a noble architecture for noble uses of noble men. Lack of culture means what it has always meant: ignoble civilization and therefore imminent downfall.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: Tip the world over on its side and everything loose will land in Los Angeles.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: Turn the world over on its side and everything loose will land in Los Angeles.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: TV is chewing gum for the eyes.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.quote: Form follows function-that has been misunderstood. Form and function should be one, joined in a spiritual union.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright, 1908

wisdom.quote: The architect should strive continually to simplify; the ensemble of the rooms should then be carefully considered that comfort and utility may go hand in hand with beauty.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright, 1908

wisdom.quote: The physician can bury his mistakes, but the architect can only advise his client to plant vines - so they should go as far as possible from home to build their first buildings.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright, New York Times, October 4, 1953

wisdom.quote: Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright, quoted in his obituary, April 9, 1959

wisdom.quote: Curiosity killed the cat, but for a while I was a suspect.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: Everywhere is walking distance if you have the time.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: I bought some batteries, but they weren't included.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: I have an existential map. It has 'You are here' written all over it.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: I used to work in a fire hydrant factory. You couldn't park anywhere near the place.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: I was walking down the street wearing glasses when the prescription ran out.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: If you shoot at mimes, should you use a silencer?
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: It doesn't make a difference what temperature a room is, it's always room temperature.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: It's a small world, but I wouldn't want to paint it.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: Last night I stayed up late playing poker with Tarot cards. I got a full house and four people died.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: Last night somebody broke into my apartment and replaced everything with exact duplicates... When I pointed it out to my roommate, he said, 'Do I know you?'
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: Last year I went fishing with Salvador Dali. He was using a dotted line. He caught every other fish.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: My theory of evolution is that Darwin was adopted.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: There's a fine line between fishing and just standing on the shore like an idiot.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: What's another word for Thesaurus?
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: When I woke up this morning my girlfriend asked me, 'Did you sleep good?' I said 'No, I made a few mistakes.'
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: Give me the children until they are seven and anyone may have them afterwards.
wisdom.author: St. Francis Xavier

wisdom.quote: It violates right order whenever capital so employees the working or wage-earning classes as to divert business and economic activity entirely to its own arbitrary will and advantage without, the social character of economic life, social justice, and the common good.
wisdom.author: Pope Pius XI

wisdom.quote: Justice requires that to lawfully constituted Authority there be given that respect and obedience which is its due; that the laws which are made shall be in wise conformity with the common good; and that, as a matter of conscience all men shall render obedience to these laws.
wisdom.author: Pope Pius XI

wisdom.quote: If you consider what are called the virtues in mankind, you will find their growth is assisted by education and cultivation.
wisdom.author: Xenophon

wisdom.quote: You don't become great by trying to be great. You become great by wanting to do something, and then doing it so hard that you become great in the process.
wisdom.author: Randall Munroe, xkcd, Marie Curie, 2011

wisdom.quote: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X

wisdom.quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X

wisdom.quote: Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: Power never takes a back step - only in the face of more power.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: Haste is good only in catching fleas.
wisdom.author: Alla Yaroshinskaya

wisdom.quote: As we look deeply within, we understand our perfect balance. There is no fear of the cycle of birth, life and death. For when you stand in the present moment, you are timeless.
wisdom.author: Rodney Yee

wisdom.quote: When I only begin to read, I forget I'm on this world. It lifts me on wings with high thoughts.
wisdom.author: Anzia Yezierska

wisdom.quote: Be wise with speed . A fool at forty is a fool indeed.
wisdom.author: Edward Young

wisdom.quote: Procrastination is the thief of time.
wisdom.author: Edward Young

wisdom.quote: Some for renown, on scraps of learning dote, And think they grow immortal as they quote.
wisdom.author: Edward Young, Love of Fame (satire I, l. 89)

wisdom.quote: A pity beyond all telling is hid in the heart of love.
wisdom.author: William Butler Yeats

wisdom.quote: An aged man is but a paltry thing, a tattered coat upon a stick.
wisdom.author: William Butler Yeats

wisdom.quote: And say my glory was I had such friends.
wisdom.author: William Butler Yeats

wisdom.quote: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
wisdom.author: William Butler Yeats

wisdom.quote: The trouble with weather forecasting is that it's right too often for us to ignore it and wrong too often for us to rely on it.
wisdom.author: Patrick Young

wisdom.quote: Rock and roll is the hamburger that ate the world.
wisdom.author: Peter York

wisdom.quote: The truth is that there is nothing noble in being superior to somebody else. The only real nobility is in being superior to your former self.
wisdom.author: Whitney Young

wisdom.quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.
wisdom.author: Henny Youngman

wisdom.quote: I take my wife everywhere, but she keeps finding her way back.
wisdom.author: Henny Youngman

wisdom.quote: I told the doctor I broke my leg in two places. He told me to quit going to those places.
wisdom.author: Henny Youngman

wisdom.quote: My Grandmother is over eighty and still doesn't need glasses. Drinks right out of the bottle.
wisdom.author: Henny Youngman

wisdom.quote: When I read about the evils of drinking, I gave up reading.
wisdom.author: Henny Youngman

wisdom.quote: Worry is a misuse of imagination.
wisdom.author: Dan Zadra

wisdom.quote: It is better to die on your feet than live on your knees.
wisdom.author: Emiliano Zapata

wisdom.quote: I think about how there are certain people who come into your life and leave a mark. The ones who are as much a part of you as your own soul. Their place in your heart is tender; a bruise of longing, a pulse of unfinished business. Just hearing their names pushes and pulls at you in a hundred ways, and when you try to define those hundred ways, describe them even to yourself, words are useless. If you had a lifetime to talk, there would still be things left unsaid.
wisdom.author: Sara Zarr, Sweehearts, 2008

wisdom.quote: In the end, I decide that the mark we've left on each other is the color and shape of love. That the unfinished business between us. Because love, love is never finished. It circles and circles, the memories out of order and not always complete.
wisdom.author: Sara Zarr, Sweehearts, 2008

wisdom.quote: Life was mostly made up of things you couldn't control, full of surprises, and they weren't always good. Life wasn't what you made it. You were what life made you.
wisdom.author: Sara Zarr, Sweehearts, 2008

wisdom.quote: One day the factory sports coach, who was very strict, pointed at four boys, including me, and ordered us to run in a race. I protested that I was weak and not fit to run, but the coach sent me for a physical examination and the doctor said that I was perfectly well. So I had to run, and when I got started I felt I wanted to win. But I only came in second. That was the way it started.
wisdom.author: Emil Zatopek

wisdom.quote: There are too many people, and too few human beings.
wisdom.author: Robert Zend

wisdom.quote: There's a strange sort of quiet when you're dying. It's as if you're in a glass room, and the walls keep getting thicker and thicker.
wisdom.author: Gabrielle Zevin, Love Is Hell: Fan Fictions, 2008

wisdom.quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: Communism doesn't work because people like to own stuff.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: Everybody believes in something and everybody, by virtue of the fact that they believe in something, use that something to support their own existence.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: I think it is good that books still exist, but they do make me sleepy.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: In the fight between you and the world, back the world.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: The United States is a nation of laws: badly written and randomly enforced.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.quote: Rock journalism is people who can't write interviewing people who can't talk for people who can't read.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa, quoted in Linda Botts, "Loose Talk" (1980)

wisdom.quote: Criticism comes easier than craftsmanship.
wisdom.author: Zeuxis, from Pliny the Elder, Natural History

wisdom.quote: This I do know beyond any reasonable doubt. Regardless of what you are doing, if you pump long enough, hard enough and enthusiastically enough, sooner or later the effort will bring forth the reward.
wisdom.author: Zig Ziglar

wisdom.quote: You can get everything in life you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want.
wisdom.author: Zig Ziglar, "Secrets of Closing the Sale", 1984

wisdom.quote: Diplomacy is a continuation of war by other means.
wisdom.author: Zhou En Lai

wisdom.quote: Be not so bigoted to any custom as to worship it at the expense of truth.
wisdom.author: Johann Georg von Zimmermann

wisdom.quote: Never lose sight of this important truth, that no one can be truly great until he has gained a knowledge of himself, a knowledge which can only be acquired by occasional retirement.
wisdom.author: Johann Georg von Zimmermann

wisdom.quote: Open your mouth and purse cautiously, and your stock of wealth and reputation shall, at least in repute, be great.
wisdom.author: Johann Georg von Zimmermann

wisdom.quote: Duct tape is like the force. It has a light side, a dark side, and it holds the universe together....
wisdom.author: Carl Zwanzig

wisdom.quote: Acceptance without proof is the fundamental characteristic of Western religion, rejection without proof is the fundamental characteristic of Western science.
wisdom.author: Gary Zukav, "The Dancing Wu Li Masters"

wisdom.quote: I don't regard nature as a spectator sport.
wisdom.author: Ed Zern

wisdom.quote: The reason we have two ears and only one mouth, is that we may hear more and speak less.
wisdom.author: Zeno

wisdom.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
wisdom.author: Zeno, from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

wisdom.quote: The older I grow, the less important the comma becomes. Let the reader catch his own breath.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Clarkson Zwart

wisdom.quote: Quit now, you'll never make it. If you disregard this advice, you'll be halfway there.
wisdom.author: David Zucker

wisdom.quote: Traveling there was really boring so I headed for the ditch. It was a rough ride but I met more interesting people there.
wisdom.author: Neil Young

wisdom.quote: An incompetent attorney can delay a trial for months or years. A competent attorney can delay one even longer.
wisdom.author: Evelle J. Younger

wisdom.quote: Besides the noble art of getting things done, there is a nobler art of leaving things undone. The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of nonessentials.
wisdom.author: Lin Yutang

wisdom.quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
wisdom.author: Lin Yutang

wisdom.quote: Sitting at the table doesn't make you a diner, unless you eat some of what's on that plate. Being here in America doesn't make you an American. Being born here in America doesn't make you an American.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: Time is on the side of the oppressed today, it's against the oppressor. Truth is on the side of the oppressed today, it's against the oppressor. You don't need anything else.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: Usually when people are sad, they don't do anything. They just cry over their condition. But when they get angry, they bring about a change.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: You can't separate peace from freedom because no one can be at peace unless he has his freedom.
wisdom.author: Malcolm X, Malcolm X Speaks, 1965

wisdom.quote: You can't have everything. Where would you put it?
wisdom.author: Steven Wright

wisdom.quote: I have a large seashell collection, which I keep scattered on the beaches all over the world. Maybe you've seen it.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright, Stand-up

wisdom.quote: The first time I ever read the dictionary I thought it was a poem about everything.
wisdom.author: Steven Wright, stand-up

wisdom.quote: There are two motives for reading a book: one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: There is much pleasure to be gained from useless knowledge.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: There is no nonsense so arrant that it cannot be made the creed of the vast majority by adequate governmental action.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.quote: The power of hiding ourselves from one another is mercifully given, for men are wild beasts, and would devour one another but for this protection.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher, "Proverbs from Plymouth Pulpit", 1887

wisdom.quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
wisdom.author: Henry Ward Beecher, Proverbs from Plymouth Pulpit, 1887

wisdom.quote: Perfecting patience takes a lifetime.
wisdom.author: Jessica Marie Baumgartner
